Nando Milano is a fantastic example of a small restaurant that has a very specific focus and does all the little things right.  Obviously, you can't have a top-notch Italian restaurant without great food, and Nando definitely meets the mark there.  Scratch-made pastas?  Check.  A nice variety of Italian-American standards and more traditional old country fare?  Check.  Kick-ass desserts?  Oh yes.But Nando also blends into its neighborhood, yet has a small, romantic ambiance to it.  My wife and I had one of those great dinners where hours pass without any thought of the time as we enjoyed the substantial Italian-focused wine list.  Admittedly, the fact that we had our first weekend away from our young (increasingly restaurant-incompatible) son may have played a role in the experience, but the fantastic Italian-focused wine list and extremely personable servers didn't hurt, either.  Nando is definitely a great spot for fans of unpretentious Italian food, as well as for those who, like us, wanted a special date night.

Good weather made it perfect for dining at this restaurant and so we were seated outside. The ambience was great, the service was great. The food was good, and came in good time. Only real comment was that the food was a little small, but it was enough with appetizers. They also gave a complimentary pannacotta because it was my birthday and it was good too. Cozy little restaurant if u wanna get away from the busy bar area of buck town.

If you're in the mood for a night of delicious pasta and flattering lighting, this is your place.  I ordered the Cavatelli alla Norma and devoured the whole thing.  The cheese to pasta ratio was on point: not too generous, not too stingy.  Just right.  I'm talking Goldilocks ratios.With tiny dog statues artfully placed around the room, sultry music in the background, and pasta that just makes me want to curl up in soft blankets and live in a constant state of blissful luxury, I'll be going back soon.
Ordered through grub hub for delivery, portions are kid size... $90 for 3 portions of pasta and dessert... Never again

Family owned restaurant. Delicious food and amazing service. White Truffle Pasta was the best, Calamari and Carpaccio appetizers are a must. Leave place for dessert for sure - so yummy! Ask if they make Semifredimo - out of this world! After he finished his dinner, my 8 y/o son asked if he can meet the chef to thank him :)It can only seat about 40 people, so to ensure you will have a table - make a reservation.Can't wait to go back!

I found this place doing a yelp search for 'romantic restaurants' for an anniversary dinner. Yes. I'm cheesy like that. But it helps me find places like Nando so it works out.What is Nando not? Well if you think romantic is a dimly lit dinner place with good wine, great food, great service and quiet so you can hold a dinner conversation with your partner then this place will hit all your points except one. It's not quiet. In fact I had to use my outdoors voice a few times. (Full disclaimer: I didn't try the wine but the wine racks on the walls looked so quaint and classy that I imagine the wine they held were great :P).The food here is delicious. My gf wasn't very hungry which disappointed me slightly cause I wanted to over order due to the number of interesting options on the menu. :PBut instead we shared 2 appetizers, a main course (pasta) and a dessert.We started with the Polipo E Calamari Alla Siciliana. I've order calamari at italian restaurants before but the presentation on this was so awesome. It's left mostly intact (tentacles separated) laying on a bed of couscous. Couscous isn't very exciting to me. In fact I am highly skeptical of anyone that gets excited by couscous. But the octopus and calamari was so fresh and perfectly cooked!Next up was Tris Di Arancini Di Riso. Ok there's very few times you can order crispy rice balls and be disappointed. So it might not be a culinary feat that these were delicious but I would definitely want these again. The contrast of the crunchy exterior and the warm, moist filling added to the experience.For the main we had the ink squid octopus agnolotti serve with mussels, clams and langoustine in imperial sauce. (Waitress recommendation) For those that don't know (and I didn't) agnolotti is like a ravioli. Apparently these are hand made and they are delicious. The sauce was a bit too acidic for me but (brace yourself this is pretty ingenious) I just knocked a bit of the sauce off before eating them. The shell fish surrounding the agnolotti was very well cooked and fresh.For desert we had the panna cotta. It wasn't too sweet and was very well made. A very good way to finish the meal.As for the service, the waitress was very nice and attentive and very friendly. The manager and even the chef walked around the table talking and making jokes with the patrons which I thought was a great touch of personalization.I definitely recommend this small cute neighborhood restaurant. I want to come back here when the weather's just a bit warmer and sit outside as they have a very charming setup there too.
The place is very nice, but the owner is a racist and classist, you need a White person to treat you right
Superb service. Wonderful food and great cozy atmosphere. We went on a Monday and the place was almost full yet the service and food was excellent. Enjoy

My husband and I had our Valentine's Day dinner here a few days early because of or schedules. It feels like a family owned type of restaurant which was nice. We were seated at what must be the worst table. We were at a two top right in the center of everything. Therefore, anytime a server, busser or diner went by, they would either knock into our arm or chair. It was uncomfortable.The server was nice, she took our drink order in a reasonable amount of time, but we waited about 20 minutes before our food order was taken. We had our menus down on the table as we watched her take the orders of tables that arrived after us, I guess I should have said something when the other manager/owner asked if we were being taken care of, but at the time I thought he meant did we have a server.  I finally caught her and asked if we could order and she said "if you are ready."  Well, yes, we must be. Anyway, the food was delicious and that saved the experience. I could also tell that the other guests were having a nice time and many of them knew the managers/owners. I will request a different table next time.The food:  My husband had the cspeeds salad which was tasty and the ribeye with balsamic. The ribeye was very good, it was cooked perfectly and the balsamic gave it a hint of sweetness (I tried it, of course). For dessert he had the ricotta cheesecake, it was the best cheesecake I have ever had. I had the beet and pear carpaccio with duck prosciutto, it was pretty good but it was not thinly sliced pear and beet, they were huge slices with this one itty bitty strip of dick prosciutto for the whole pile of pear and beet. If it was more balanced, it would have been amazing. My main course was the wild boar with pappardelle, which was absolutely delicious. I want some more right now. For dessert, I had the mixed berry granita which was also very good.Overall, we had a nice time. If we had been at a different table, I may not have noticed how long we waited.

Love the waiter that believes (and makes you believe) you are in Italy. He is kind of pushy at first, but listen to him and you will be in love at first bite. Amazing ambience after you get through the snobby, snooty way-too-thin hostess. The waiter/manager saved the night. Made me love ado vision street.

The most authentic Italian food I've had in a long time. Fresh bread and pasta made in house. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming. Our server was amazing and made the whole experience even better. I will definitely be going back.
Love the salad, it's one of the best I've had in Chicago. And the fungi risotto is great as well.

My husband and I chose this restaurant for a large family gathering. We had eaten here before and chose it for the quality of the food, and they definitely delivered again. Everyone loved the food.The reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the staff were a bit too pushy. We were already 10 people giving them a ton of business, and yet they kept trying to get us to order more antipasti, more wine, more everything. And not just a reasonable amount more, but like 3x what we would realistically ever consume.I'll definitely go back, but I recommend staying firm and not letting the staff take advantage of your good spirits.
Great food. Well-proportioned. Super service with very friendly staff. Who could ask for more?

AMAZING!Everything you would want in a restaurant. Wide variety, fresh ingredients, inside and outside seating, friendly and attentive staff, and the head chef/owner checked in on us to make sure we were enjoying everything.You will not regret going here

I am in love: food, service, atmosphere. Delicious. I have been all over Italy, this place is the closest you will come to the heaven I ate while traveling and eating at best restaurants. I met the owner and the chef- lovely people. My waitress was amazingly informative and attentive. I usually try to pick my own food but she was so knowledgeable - I let her do all the ordering for me. I enjoyed every bite. Even the bread and olive oil were superb. Thanks guys for the experience. You were the cherry on my Chicago trip topping! Will come back there.

DELIZIOSO!This place is now on my top Italian list! Not only was it a perfect night for their outdoor seating, but the food was great! We were brought fresh bread with a bowl of tasty olive oil and olives. As an appetizer, we ordered the white asparagus, that was cooked to perfection. I had the Linguine Portofino. The noodles were homemade and the seafood tasted fresh. The ambiance was great and the food was authentic, not to mention the staff was also very friendly. I highly recommend this place - I can't wait to go back!

The gnochhi at this palce is melt-in-your mouth good. Came here once in person with my family and the service was 5 star. I should mention we were all vegetarian and all 5 of us were able to get something different without issue. We all loved our dishes too! Have gotten delivery from here 2-3 times and the food is just an incredible every time.

Tried this place recently. The host was very friendly. Looking at the menu i was instantly struck at how high the prices were for both wine and food. Ordered my first glass of wine which was poured into small carafe then into my glass. Perhaps this was done for the effect, but to me it was a way to minimize the quantity (a bottle should provide not more than 4 glasses of wine). Tried a couple appetizers, the polenta and beef salad. They were both ok. Problem was the noise level. Music was very loud, which made the customers raise their voices making it impossible to have a conversation. Not a place I would return to quickly.

Excellent! Had dinner here tonight and the food was outstanding. We started with CALAMARI FRITTI, fresh and good. I had GNOCCHI DELLA NONNA, homemade, yes...homemade!!  Hubby had SALOPPINA DI VITELLO AI FUNGHI TRIFOLATI E TARTUFO, outstanding! Save room for their Cannoli and Nutella crapes! Yum!! The Limoncello shots are smooth and refreshing. The Espresso Martini are another must! Can't wait to go back!Grazie Luca, a presto!

Great attentive service, quaint quiet atmosphere and solid Italian food. Skip the bucatini as the sauce was too heavy. Nice little neighborhood place. Went with a friend but would be perfect for a date night.
Delicious, unique, perfect portion pastas! The tagliatelle was light and full of fresh veggies/so yum! The staff and manager were charming and adorably attentive. Would go again!

Best gnocchi I've ever had. It's stuffed with mozzarella and melts in your mouth. Get the gnocchi.Service was excellent. Had to wait a little longer than expected for a table and they comped us a glass of champagne while we waited at the bar.Can't go wrong with anything you order, but get the gnocchi.
Devine authentic Italian dishes! Had their grilled calamari and black truffle pasta that was on special. Everything was incredibly fresh. Can't wait to go back and try more.

Excellent overall--great waitstaff, delicious food, wonderful wine selection. The ONLY thing I would like is for a little more light to read the menu! Best calamari we have ever had, there was a simple pasta dish with oil, cheese and truffle oil that was outrageous and the boar ragu was delicious as well. Will definetly put Nando Milano on our go to Italian list!

My husband and I went here last week for a date night. Overall I really liked this place. We sat  out on the patio at the front and it was a perfect night for it. It's also a really nice set-up.I think if I could, I would probably award it 3.5 stars - The appetizers and entrees were awesome! But the desserts were a real disappointment unfortunately:Buffalo Mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and parma ham (Special), OMG, so very very good. Really high quality ingredients in this one which is a must with such a simple dish.TRIS DI ARANCINI DI RISO (Trio of Arancini) this was also v delicious. If my husband had his way he would have had another portion of this!RIGATONI ALLA BEPPE - (Pasta w/ italian sausage and peas) - a nice solid dish. Big portion too so plenty to take home.Wild Boar Ragu (Special) another winner of a dish for the other half. This was rich and decadent.But the desserts.......hmmmm. I had the tiramisu which was bland and flavorless. I couldn't taste any coffee in it at all and the sponge element was dry. It was basically just a bowl of dry sponge and cream.My husband had the profiteroles which on the menu are described as 'Chocolate cream puff filled with vanilla cream' (obviously) but when they came out were covered in cinnamon and had a cinnamon cream inside. Fine, if you describe it as such, but it really wasn't. I find chocolate and cinnamon to be a kind of strange combo TBHSo in summary, go here and eat the savory stuff but maybe avoid the desserts unless you are REALLY craving something sweet.

It may just have been a beautiful summer evening for outdoor dining, but all four of our party loved their food, the setting and the service.  Everything seems made there, from the pasta to the sausage to the limoncello.The portions are not those humongous chain portions, but fully satisfying with room for desert - something to insist on staying for.  Now my top place for Italian food in Chicago
Fantastic Italian restaurant. Food is authentic and they even have gluten free pasta and are very accommodating. Great wine list and fantastic service.

We came here for a bachelorette dinner of 6 before our night out and I scoured the reviews beforehand...In summary, it is rather expensive, the waiter was definitely pushy and the dishes are not the size you're expecting for that price.All that being said, everything I ate was delicious and I would definitely return again with family. Everything genuinely tasted homemade and reminded me of my time living in Rome. My mother's side is Sicilian, so I can also appreciate that both the head waiter and chef were from Sicily, complete with thick accents and longer hair. It's hard to find an Italian restaurant you can trust is authentic, these days.They were very excited for our celebration and entertained us the entire evening with light banter and drinks. They even comped two rounds of limoncello shots for us!I ordered: Maltagliati San Marco, Arancini di riso, and Calamari.All in all, it was worth it. I would definitely recommend!

I hate giving all or nothing reviews but this place deserves all five stars. Nando is a great date spot that is dark and cosy and romantic.The food is fantastic. The appetizers weren't out of the ordinary tasting, we ordered a caprese and the calamari fritte. Luckily all of the ingredients are very fresh so we weren't disappointed.The main course is where they hit it out of the park. We ordered the Bucatini and the Gnocchi. Oh my sweet lord. This homemade pasta was better than anything I had while studying in Italy. The gnocchi were like small pillows that just melted on your fork. All of the tastes complimented each other well and nothing was overbearing. The portions were just right to feel full but not stuffed.We also got a cannoli and a cappuccino, both perfectly made and the presentation was on point.Service was great. They speak Italian at the table which is fun and they were knowledgeable about everything on the menu. They definitely tried to up sell you but I wasn't perturbed.Prices aren't that high for the city and for some seriously fresh and delicious food.I'm pretty sure this became my favorite restaurant. Can't wait to go back!

What's not to love? Classic Italian cuisine, great service and a wonderful location in the heart of wicker park.We enjoyed everything from the appetizers to the desserts, you should definitely try this place out.

Had a good meal, great service and fun layout at nando.  It is pricey so know that coming in (hate people that complain about price when they knew it coming in) but worth it.  Nice date place for sure in a fun area west on division from damen

The food was excellent and authentically Italian. The owner was super friendly and very involved in making sure the diners were all satisfied. The only caveat was the wine-by-the-glass. What's great about restaurants in Italy is that the house wines are usually about €5 and totally drinkable. While we recognize that Wicker Park is not in Rome, we enjoyed our Prosecco, but the Chianti by the glass left a lot to be desired.We ate entirely off the specials menu. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. The portions were generous so I don't think we could have each managed an appetizer and two courses. Two appetizers, two mains, and dessert, and we were completely stuffed.We'd definitely go back.

Authentic food, great ambiance, knowledgeable servers, and owners/chef who take great pride in their work.  Go to Nando and bring your spouse, date, family, or friends.  They'll be impressed with your hidden gem find, and even more impressed with the food.5 stars!

I cannot say anything bad about Nando Milano. It is my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. The staff (Dario, Alessio, etc) are so kind, charming, sweet, and funny. The food is out of this world and tastes like it's made with love. I absolutely LOVE coming to Nando Milano, especially in the summer and on Thursdays when it's ladies night and drinks are half off! The last time I was there, my friend and I went all out. We ordered oysters for our appetizer and they were delicious. Btw, my friend's name is Linda and she's the one that the Linda cocktail is named after :) We definitely got our drink on that night (hey they were half off!) Lots of bubbles all around. For our main dish, we enjoyed the gnocchi della nonna: house made gnocchi filled with gorgonzola cheese in an aurora sauce. I literally want to pour that sauce on someone and just lick it off. Sorry for that visual. It's just that good. After that, we were pretty stuffed. So we had some more cocktails (their Aperol spritzer is the ONLY way I'll drink Aperol). Then we ordered the bird's nest dessert. It's a delicious chocolate chocolate nest with gelato in the middle.Dario is like my favorite person. If you ever have a bad day and need to feel good about yourself, go to Nando. Dario is one hunk of an Italian man and he will make you feel like the most beautiful woman in the room, I must say. This place is just so charming and the food is delicious. Perfect for a date night, dessert, drinks, whatever! Just go.
Delivery order of cacia e pepe and the sausage and rapini appetizer.  Tiny portions for take out and for the price.  Food was okay, nothing special. Would not recommend (for takeout at least).

Came here with a few girlfriends and was very impressed with both the service and the food.  Everyone, from the hostess to the front of the house manager to our waitress was incredibly charismatic, helpful, and provided service that went above and beyond our expectations.We started with an appetizer of grilled baby octopus and calamari over some israeli couscous - very tasty.  The octopus and calamari were cooked perfectly (so tender) and had a lot of flavor.  It was on the smaller side, so we definitely could have ordered a second appetizer to go with it (next time we know!).  I ordered the cod with soft polenta (so good - I haven't had a good polenta since I was in Florence a couple years ago), my girlfriends had the gnocci, linguine portofino, and one of the specials that was a seafood squid ink ravioli.  Everyone agreed on the high quality of their entrees.  For dinner they brought me a delightful little panna cotta with strawberries.Overall I really enjoyed dinner at Nando Milano Trattoria - will definitely be visiting and trying different items on their menu.

We decided to come here on a whim and was it an experience. Everything from the adorable Frank Sinatra playing throughout the restaurant to our slightly odd waiter with a thick, Italian accent who taught us how to pronounce the dishes we would be having. It was very obvious that everything here was handmade. The bread brought to us as a starter could have easily been made into a meal. Although the calories and my guilt would have destroyed me in an instant.We started with the Tris Di Arancini Di Riso. Each of the rice saffron balls were better than the next although the butter and prosciutto was my favorite. This was followed by the carpaccio di manzo. I've had some capaccio that was not so good, this was not one of those times. The presentation was even better. And fresh raspberries to go along with this salad topped everything off.We decided to split one of pasta dishes and chose the Ghnocchi Di Patate Alla Sorrentina in a tomato pesto sauce. Once again, very obvious that the pasta was handmade. Yum.We we're easily talked into two desserts - the canoli and the panna cotta. While I am a huge fan of canolis and am a harsh judge on the makings of these, this was very good. However, I highly suggest the panna cotta. It is presented with a berry reduction sauce that makes it completely irresistible. We also had limoncello with our dessert that topped the meal off nicely.Will definitely be coming back and indulging in many more calories.

From the atmosphere on the patio, to the friendly Italian host hovering & making sure everyone was happy... Boy oh boy... it was CHEESEBALLZ in the best way possible.Speaking of... Our burrata with prosciutto & grilled asparagus topped with a red sea salt was a perfect start to our dinner. The prosciutto was perfectly warm and you could taste the grill on the asparagus. Our drinks (red wine and italian themed whisky "tony rome" cocktail) were also good.My squid ink ravioli filled with chopped squid and topped with a clam & mussel red sauce was DELICIOUS. I sopped up as much as I could with the provided bread. My wife also loved her noodles with ricotta & pepper. It looked really good.I've spent enough time in Milan to know what's a great Italian meal and this place hits pretty close to the great level on my chart.Our desserts were insanely good and I'm sure if we lived in the neighborhood we'd become regulars. Very good, and very classy while still embracing and allowing a casual vibe.

If you think that you're going to find a better Italian restaurant on the west side of 90 you're 100% wrong.  This place has all the right pieces to make your dining experience a success.  What do I consider a success you might ask?  A place that you'll come back to a second,  third, fourth,  time etc. Very quaint, romantic and also very authentic... everyone that works there seems to have an Italian accent. The octopus appetizer is extremely tasty, the linguine with shellfish and seafood is a can't miss entrée and don't forget the cup of coffee at the end! It's a feather in the cap.Enjoy!

Wow - this is genuine Italian food.  There are lots of good Italian places in Chicago but this is the most authentic Italian I've been to.  House made fresh pasta, seasoned so well.  We had the veal ravioli, spaghetti for the kids, the chicken and the mussels.  Everything but the mussels was outstanding. Mussels not bad just not as good as the others.  And the service.  All heavy Italian accents just adding to the experience.  We went at 6pm and it was pretty packed out.   Finally, the coffee.  Oh my god the coffee.  If the French know their cheese, then the Italians know their coffee.   The cappuccino brought with two small biscotti was pure perfection.   Definitely worth adding this to your list of regular places.

Excellent.The service, the food, the atmosphere( specifically outside). What a cherished neighborhood spot. There are many Italian restaurants in the neighborhood. Everytime I try a new one and have a mediocre experience I kick myself for not going to Nando. The service is entertaining, they are SUPER into their specials and satisfying their customers. Their food is phenomenal. I am a vegetarian so have tried pretty much every pasta dish and all fish dishes. It's a guaranteed great night.

Can't believe I've never heard of this place! We walked in during Do-Division and really enjoyed the food. The pastas were cooked perfectly and very flavorful. Way better than what I had in Italy (maybe this means it's not authentic but I like this version better!)

The only thing amazing I can say about this place is how amazingly mediocre the food was from start to finish. The warm fresh bread served in rustic paper bags that features in many Yelp pictures was no where to be seen. We even asked our waiter and he said they don't serve warm bread. We actually thought maybe we  had confused our Yelp reviews....alas no, it simply seems warm bread no longer makes an appearance here. We were still hopefull of a fantastic meal, but that hope quickly faded with our antipasti orders of crispy polenta with mushrooms and polpo (Octopus) carpaccio served with arugula and fennel. While the restaurant was indeed darkened wth only an atmospheric glow for light it certainly wasn't the lack of lighting that prevented us from barely being able to find the polpo within the underwhelming and tasteless bed of arugula. The polenta with mushrooms certainly offered taste compared to the polpo it tasted so salty that it was nearly inedible.....and for me to say something is "salty" is quite something as I'm typically quite liberal in my use of salt. Our primi piatti of pasta dishes took nearly an hour to arrive and while not disasters, the best I can offer up is that they were just alright. Very mediocre. Nothing special or standout. After the so far mediocre experience we decided to forgo a secondi piatti and instead try out the "tiramisu". I'm writing "tiramisu" because what we had was a poor imitation full of whipped heavy cream and seriously lacking in both masacarpone and alcohol. It had almost a sickly sweet taste to it rather than the balanced sweet mascarpone-espresso-alcohol flavor experience you would expect of a quality tiramisu. Real tiramisu is made with quality mascarpone not cheap air whipped heavy cream. Forno Rosso in the West Loop.....they get it. This place...not so much.

My husband and I are new to Chicago and chose Nando Milano Trattoria for our first night out, which ended up being a great decision! We were promptly greeted at the door and upon learning that we were new the the area, the staff made us feel right at home. The atmosphere is very cozy and intimate and the food was absolutely delicious! We started with the Arancini. Our favorite was the one with the bolognese ragout. My husband had the maltagliati, which he enjoyed, and I had the Gnocchi Della Nonna. I would definitely recommend this dish. I usually get gnocchi when I go to an Italian restaurant and Nando's has some of the best I've eaten! They were so light and the sauce was great. At the end of our meal, the waiter came by with some limoncello to welcome us to the neighborhood. We look forward to coming back and trying the rest of the menu!

I have been to the restaurant twice and will not return. If you are Italian and speak Italian, you are treated like royalty; if not, you are tolerated.  I love Italy and have been there many times.  I have always been treated well at restaurants in Italy, unlike here. The food was fine, but given the lack of complexity, it was over-priced.  The waiter made a production of offering a free desert for  my mother's birthday and then charged us for it. We just took it out of his tip. There are too many similar or better Italian restaurants to bother with this place, which is pretty full of itself. It is next to a dumpy pawn shop on Division.

What a lovely place...with loads of potential!  We dined outside on a cool fall evening.  The food was good...not outstanding, but definitely no grand complaints either.  Our server was engaging and funny, however, I believe the manager was peeved by all of the attention he was giving us and about half way through our meal, he disappeared.  Maybe he was taking tables inside, I'm not sure.  The manager appeared to be a very passionate person, almost barking orders at the servers and bussers.  It was a bit distracting.  My husband's entree left a little to be desired, it kind of fell flat.  I believe it was a Halibut special they were running that night.  I had their version of spaghetti and meat sauce and it was quite tasty, but I think it too fell a little flat.  The appetizers were good and the cannoli was delicious.  I think it's worth checking out if you're in the area, but it wouldn't be my first choice for a romantic Italian dinner while in Chicago.  (A Tavola)

When you leave an Italian restaurant feeling hungry, you know there is something wrong with the food. From the antipasti to the very poor dessert they call tiramisu, this restaurant does not do justice to Italian cuisine.The CARPACCIO DI POLPO was way bland and had no taste to it whatsoever. Barely edible.  The POLENTA GHIOTTA was way too salty and was expecting more when ordering polenta from an Italian restaurant.I ordered the MALTAGLIATI "SAN MARCO" as my main and although it too was very salty, it was mediocre at best... Portion was not that great. They did not even have freshly grated Parmesan to offer!I will spare you the details of the tiramisu as once again was expecting to have a real Italian dessert and not whipped cream on top of some lady fingers. Someone forgot to mention to them that tiramisu should contain mascarpone!The best thing about this restaurant was the bread. Plain and simple a very bad choice to spend a Friday night dinner.

Amazing food and service. Homemade pasta is amazing. The fact that the chef comes out and checks on you and asks you how the food is, is a huge differentiator. You can tell they really care about the quality of the food they are putting out. Highly recommended!

The pasta was fantastic!  You can taste when it's fresh.  The Caesar salad was light, even while heavy on sauce.  The Minestrone soup with a chicken stock base was wonderful.The staff is extremely friendly and attentive.  It certainly helps when the Chef hails from Italy.  It makes a difference!

I wanted to do this review last week but the iPhone upgrade crashed my app... Anyway what a horrible experience.My friend and I met here after work.Many things went wrong that evening. The service got from bad to the owner asking us to leave because we did not spend enough money! What an a..hole!!! I don't drink and my friend was driving so she only had a glass of wine.The waitress asked us at least 10 times if we wanted something else to drink!! She was rude, intrusive and very unprofessional.We ordered the mussels which were horrible and the waitress kept trying to push us to eat them. When we told her we were only going to do appetizers she got upset and told us that we had to place the whole order at one time otherwise we couldn't order more food. How ridiculous!!!! We decided we were not going to order anything else.Horrible service, mediocre appetizers and arrogant owner.
Great place to go if you have a dog and want to enjoy some outdoor seating.Good food, friendly staff.
Best Italian restaurant in the city. Everything we have here is perfect! We keep going back again and again. Do yourself a favor and go here, you'll be glad you did!
Gnocchi is on point. Service is attentive and informed - Great recommendations. Great for dates and catching up with friends and family. My favorite Italian spot in the city.

Adorable place. Friendliest manager and waitstaff. Such tasty food. Great ambiance - great for a date but good for family too. We went with older children - I wouldn't take my baby there. We always have a great time. The food is delicious. They also have some gluten free pasta options, which is nice.

Food is beyond excellent here, the gnocchi were like clouds of pillows, the rissotto was perfectly rice al dente, seasoning was dead on. And the desserts, holy cow, that just topped of the night, the panna cotta and the off menu semi freddo blew our minds. Not only that but the server, Jelena, she was so on top of the service, right when I put the menu down she was already at the table, she made great recommendations, refilled our drinks so quickly I didn't even realize she had done it. And the Italian manager/owner Lucca was so gracious and excited that it was our first time here, his hospitality was amazing. We will definitely be back, good to know that there's a delicious authentic Italian restaurant in our hood.

My husband and I were so impressed with our dinner, we can't wait to return! We walked in on a Monday night without a reservation, and were greeted in Italian and seated right away. The ambiance is dimly lit, relaxed, and romantic. The service was excellent - very attentive, provided great wine recommendations, and did not rush us at all. We ordered the arrancini, caprese salad, rigatoni alla beppe, lasagna, and tiramisu. Seriously, everything was amazing! This restaurant is just perfect, and I can't wait to go back! It felt like a little slice of Italy!

Overall experience was ok. Been here a few times and each time the place seems to get smaller. When we were being seated, we had to squeeze through and bump into almost every table just to sit down.The servers really know their stuff. If you see any of them, they are happy to help, if you're at the bar, they will all greet you, or suggest something great from the specials everytime.The food, is amazing, the chef definitely knows what he is doing, and it's nice to see him at the end of the night, come out of the kitchen with his broken English and ask how was the meal. You can tell he really cares. But sometimes you can tell they are trying to push some expensive wine that we will down in two glasses each and they start so high they make you feel like a cheap ass if you don't order a $100 bottle. (By the way, cheapest bottle is about $40, which is what we ordered, whole meal for two, about $120). Also, you're more likely to have a better experience if you're outside on the patio or sat in the front of the restaurant. If you're unfortunate enough to have to wait for the restroom or sit near the kitchen, it's hectic and you can hear the managers yelling and badgering their employees, awkward...Overall, food is good, if you want a true Italian experience, wine to foccacia, and creative twists on traditional Italian cuisine this place is for you. I'll be back, but only for the food, maybe take out next time.

Food was fantastic. Pasta made daily and variety in the options was wonderful. Great wine list. Service was outstanding. I really mean it: outstanding. Every person we dealt with was on point and kind. They were even kind to the jerk at the table next to us. On a summer evening, we all want to sit outside for dinner, and they have a sizable patio area (maybe bigger than their indoor space?).They probably have the ideal combination going on!

We made a reservation for four a couple of weeks ago to take my dad, who was visiting the city for the weekend, to a nice place in the neighborhood. When we got there there wasn't a table for us. It was really busy that night but we made our reservation. We waited all four outside when it was still cold and no patio available.We thought we would get something complimentary because of the wait but no. We ended up seating at 10:00 pm when we got there at 9:20 pm and waited outside for 40 minutes.I've been to Nando before and hope to go back again soon but certainly this wasn't up to Chicago restaurant standards.

Will never come here again. Went last week on Thursday (July 9th) for my mother's birthday. I made my mother her favorite cake. We were going to cut the cake at her house and wish her a happy birthday, but the server offered to cut the cake for us. We thought cutting the cake at the restaurant would also be nice, so we agreed. However, the server failed to mention a fee, in which he later stated that he didn't know the restaurant charged for cutting a cake brought by a customer. When the bill arrived, they charged my mother $30 for cutting the cake, and they were not being flexible. They demanded that she paid the $30 for the service provided. The manager on duty knew of the situation, but didn't bother to explain or apologize for the hidden fee.I have never heard of this. It's as if my mother bought the homemade cake, i made for her, from Nandos.Many other restaurants, on the contrary, provide a birthday pastry for the person. Never have I heard of a fee to cut a dessert that was brought by a paying customer. Ridiculous.The food was great, but the service was far from what I expected.

Nando Milano is everything you want in a great neighborhood restaurant... a candlelit setting with a fantastic, homemade Italian menu, all within walking distance of home.So why am I giving them 3 stars?  Our waiter (hereafter known as Mr. Upsell) didn't know how to take NO for an answer. It made for an unpleasant experience.We each order a glass of wine. Mr Upsell says "I'm just going to bring a bottle, I know you'll have another round. And this bottle is much better." Forcibly suggests $80 bottle.  We'll take the $40 bottle, but now you've pushed us into a bottle, congrats.We'll start with the Burrata Appetizer ($16 BTW).  Mr. Upsell says "You should also take the other appetizer".  No, we'll just take what we ordered.  There's two of us.Boyfriend orders a pasta dish.  Mr Upsell says "Not this. Get this" [suggests $35 lobster pasta, the most expensive on the menu]. Nope, we'll have what we ordered.Post-dinner, we very politely pass on dessert, promising to come back on a weekend.  Mr. Upsell won't let it go. "You must try the cannoli.  This restaurant was started because of cannoli". Insert cannoli rant.NO, for the second and NO, for the third time, we don't want dessert. Back off dude.  Mr. Upsell insists on shaking our hands at end of meal like we've just bought a used car off his lot...Now I'm annoyed.Let's recap:- Bottle of wine (meh)- Burrata ball with prosciutto and asparagus (really good)- Two Salads (meh)- Two pasta dishes (excellent)$142 including tax/tip later and I realize we could have had more food, without the pushiness, somewhere else.  Sadly, I don't think I'll be back because I just don't have it in me to fight for the food I want (or don't want) to purchase at a restaurant when I'm spending this much money.
Fantastic little find in Ukranian village. Fresh homemade pasta. Homemade bread.Friendly excellent service.Highly recommend it!

Absolutely delicious. I had one of the specials, a pappardelle with porcini mushrooms and shrimp which was to die for. The arancini were also very good.The ambiance was lovely. It's a small restaurant, very cute, and has outdoor seating (we sat inside as it was raining). The staff was friendly - our waitress even gave us a wine-pouring lesson. Will definitely go back.

If you like real-deal homemade pasta, this place is top notch.I've never had anything bad here. My two favorites so far are the ravioli with the walnut sauce (ordered multiple times) and just this Saturday I destroyed the fettucine with clams and other seafood (Portofino - I think it's called).Service is incredibly friendly, as well.

These guys are the best.En Hakkore is SO fresh, so exquisitely crafted, and so amazingly priced--definitely one of the best quick-eat Korean spots in town. This location is strictly Bibimbap and tacos. The sushi burritos are at their 2.0 location. But to me, the original is still the best.The Bibimbap bowls are HUGE--hefty portions with 16 different kinds of vegetables, all fresh and so delicately cut, marinated, and placed. The meats are wondrously marinated. The sashimi-bap is a bowl of fresh fish and vegetables that is priced at only $12!!!! I'm not sure how they are offering such amazing prices for such wonderful, fresh, and high-quality food!This is also a family-run business, and I just love their story. A friend of mine recently asked in Korean what "En Hakkore" means, and we were told that it's a biblical location where Sampson was refreshed by a well-spring from the ground, and they wanted their restaurant to be a source of refreshment and strength for their customers!! LOVE LOVE LOVE these guys.

This place is amazing! Definitely a MUST! The tacos are so delicious, I can't stop thinking about them. Being from LA they put the Kogi tacos to shame!We also had the Bibimbap + Steamed Dumplings, all are so good, but the tacos blew us away.The decor is cute + the service is great!

I can't believe this is the first time I'm reviewing this place. We've been to En Hakkore about 10 times and have recommended it to countless people.The two of us always share a Korean BBQ beef bi bim bop and an order (2) of pratha tacos with spicy pork. It's the perfect amount of food for two hungry people and it's super reasonably priced. (Less than $25 for dinner for two in Chicago? Hell yeah.)The Bi Bim Bop is so flavorful (always go spicy) and fresh. I love the balance of intense flavor and fresh veggies! The tacos are great, but honestly it's all about the bread they are served on. If I could eat one thing forge rest of my life, it would be that bread....Eating it is fun because the Bi Bim is served in a giant bowl and the dining space is (small but) cute. We often take it to go, which is also delightful. It's right across from a park, so we aim to order it to go before a movie in the park and make a picnic of it!!!!

Did not disappoint! Tried one of the bibimbap bowls, the dumplings, and the tacos.  Everything was good! This was my first time trying bibimbap but I thought it was awesome! We tried the pork one. Was spicy but delicious. We got one bowl and shared it between two of us with the tacos and dumplings and we were both full. I saw a lot of people get two bowls but not sure I could finish that much food. Was less rice in it than I expected but it was healthier that way I suppose. Price was VERY reasonable - around $25 for the entree, the tacos, and the dumplings plus 2 sodas. Cute little atmosphere and very friendly staff. Will visit again!

I finally had the opportunity to try this place at the end of the school year. I knew the food would be amazing just by looking at all of the pictures that other people have posted. I can now say that the food lived up to my expectations.My friends and I shared the black rice (!!!) sashimi bibimbap and the tofu paratha taco (a seasonal special). The bibimbap was served in a beautiful black bowl that helped accentuate all of the vivid colors of the vegetables and sashimi, making for a wonderful photo. Adding the black rice cost a bit extra, but I think it is definitely worth it since it was so delicious. Also, black rice is a healthy alternative to the traditional white sushi rice. A normal order of bibimbap would leave me feeling bloated and weighed down, but the sashimi bibimbap was so fresh and it left me feeling fantastic.In addition, the paratha tacos were amazing! The chewy, buttery paratha shells were by far the best part. I thought the tofu filling was actually pretty tasty. I tried some of my friend's pork taco, but it was too oily for my taste. The tofu was just perfect!I'm so glad that I stopped by this place for dinner. I will most definitely be back soon to probably eat the amazing sashimi bibimbap and paratha tacos again. A word of caution: the store is actually pretty small and seating is limited, so keep that in mind so you aren't surprised when you drop in to have an awesome meal.

I ordered the beef bibimbap and my fiancé got the pork tacos. We also shared the dumplings. It was plenty of food and not too expensive if you're sharing. Korean fusion is always a good choice, and En Hakkore does it well. The vibe of the restaurant is cool but definitely not what I'd expect for the type of food served. Overall, a good meal.

My wife and I visited En Hakkore on a Thursday evening to have dinner with a couple and their four year old son. It was our first visit and we each ordered 2 Paratho tacos (kimchi, onion, mushroom, cilantro, lettuce, pickled radish, enhakkore sauce, spicy pork or korean b.b.q beef). For $7.50 you get two generous sized tacos, much larger than Del Seoul (which is another favorite of ours).Between the beef and pork, the pork was our favorite and had a great spice to it even before adding the red pepper paste sauce. Our friends ordered the Bibimbap but this Yelper was fortunate to marry a lovely woman who can create some amazing Korean dishes including Bibimbap ($12) and Japchae noodles ($5 for a tiny, tiny, tiny bowl). Therefore, I can't bring myself to order/pay for traditional Korean dishes anymore. However from all the reviews and the first person witness of the dish, both the Bibimbap and Japcae looked authentic and was very large portions.I don't give 5 stars often but I was really surprised how much I enjoyed the flavors at En Hakkore. I thought the tacos would come in a regular flour tortilla like it does at Del Seoul but instead it arrived in a DELICIOUS naan style bread which was really, really good.  After dinner we walked next door to Miko's Italian Shaved Ice which is becoming my favorite place for shaved ice. The Damen entrance to the 606 trail is seconds away from En Hakkore so if you want to do a nice stroll/run before or after dinner, you can't ask for a better location.I will be back again but not on Sunday's because they are closed.

I really love this place! I had a little me day/spa day and went here for a lunch and it hit the spot! The bibimbap was so fresh with lots of flavors and textures and all the things that make bibimbap great!

En Hakkore is a neighborhood gem. The goofy décor and the small menu add a unique character to the restaurant. I've never had a bad experience and frequent it very often. The family that runs the restaurant is very kind and friendly and remember their regulars. The food is incredible. The bibimbap is not truly traditional, but instead a much lighter- salad type dish. The portions of each ingredient are perfectly balanced and the result is a delicious re-thinking of the traditional bibimbap. It is very filing- but you don't feel bad about yourself when you're done.I am an even bigger fan of their tacos. The tortilla they make is unbelievable. It's thick and buttery and tastes a bit like baked filo dough. Both the pork and beef are perfectly prepared and the spicing is unreal. This food should easily cost between 10 and 15 but I always make it out of there spending a total of under 10. En Hakkore is a special spot.

Two tacos for $7.50 is an absolute deal. I would come back just for the tacos. The beef stole the show but the pork was good as well. I don't think getting two beef tacos would be amazing, I think variety is good even though the beef is way better.Also got the fish and pork bowls. I'd skip the pork and get the beef one instead. The fish bowl was alright but it includes a variety of fish which is neat. They have a spicy sauce and soy sauce on the side as well. Very small place inside but the food is good and it came out fairly quickly!

I LOVED everything about En Hakkore!!!Great service! Great ambiance! And great food!!! My husband and I had been wanting to try En Hakkore for a long time...and the wait was sure worth it! :)I love that the menu has a good amount of options, but isn't overwhelming! My husband and I ordered:- man doo - steamed dumplings. These were really good! You can't really go wrong w/ these!Jap Chae - this is a combination of noodles, veggies, and meat. This was VERY tasty!!!Paratha tacos - WOW...definitely coming back for these!!! You get two in an order and can pick between beef, spicy pork, or tofu. I had a pork and a beef and both were sooooo tasty! The flavors are wonderful and definitely a taste that I would crave and return for!The parathas are large and I couldn't finish my two tacos. I guess it's also because we ordered two appetizers! I think the items are priced well! The ambiance is awesome! Such a cute place with great things on the wall as conversation pieces!Parking is difficult in this area, but be patient because this place is worth it! I can't wait to go back!!!

A cute Korean restaurant in wicker that does a limited selection of dishes really well! The decor is really cute with a selection of pastel plates and antique / wood pieces.I typically order the beef bimbim bap which is loaded with fresh veggies and comes in a huge bowl when you dine in. You can also opt to have the bowl come with purple rice (so special!). Two other favorites are the paratha tacos (2) and the jap chae noodles. The tacos have the best pancake wrap on the outside - reminds me of the Chinese onion pancakes. Best served hot!I've come to this restaurant for dine in and take out several times the past few months and their food is always consistently delicious.Note They are not open on Sunday's - I've walked by a couple times only to be disappointed it was not open!

Really enjoyed our lunch here - the vibe is cool and staff was very polite and helpful! We had the bulgogi Bibimbap - super healthy with lots of fresh veggies! I even put my sauce on all pretty to take a picture but unconciously took a bite - presentation is very pretty! Vibrant colors and big portions!You know it's good when a Korean restaurant is owned by a Korean - try it out!I wish they would give the option of extra sea same oil and a fried egg instead of boiled but other than that - no complaints here :)

If a restaurant is over the moon delicious or below the gutter horrific, the review is totally easy to write. When it falls somewhere in the middle, things get a bit tricky. I procrastinate in writing the review because there isn't anything outstanding to write on either side of the spectrum. Oh hi, hello, En Hakkore.What I like most about En Hakkore is it's the most casual Korean food spot I've ever been to. I wouldn't feel weird if I went alone or just dipped in casually to order some bibimbap or sashimibap. And in those solo situations, I could see myself coming again. All of the ingredients at En Hakkore are fresh, portions are small (compared to other K-spots), prices are competitive (maybe even a buck or two cheaper), great service and very chill atmosphere.Edumacation time - Bi Bim Bap is a traditional dish that is always a conglomerate of ingredients, mostly veggies, over rice. Bi Bim means 'mixed' in Korean and Bap means 'rice'. You can get bi bim bap sans meat so it's a great option for vegetarians, but normally there is meat (usually beef) and egg in it. It's served in a beautiful display of all the ingredients neatly divided into colorful sections...but before eating it you mix it up into a hot mess of food elements and usually mix in a bit of hot sauce.I've had the bulgoki bi bim bap at En Hakkore and liked the dish but sadly it wasn't near the best Bi Bim Bap I've had. And sadly, the bulgoki marinate wasn't mouth watering. Bulgoki is one of my favorite foods...I grew up eating it and am a strange gal that prefers it to kalbi. In my book, this bulgoki didn't knock it out of the park. I did enjoy their interesting take on mandoo (steamed dumplings). These were by no means the traditional version of mandoo but the En Hakkore way is unique and tasty, I'd definitely get them again.En Hakkore is near my 'hood so I can definitely see myself popping in again when I need my Korean fix on the go!

Hipster Korean fusion fast food is how I would describe En Hakkore. The food is not traditional Korean so if you're looking for some authentic stone pot bibimbap go elsewhere. Their menu is small, consisting of mainly their version of bibimbap and tacos. I tried the bibimbap with black rice (there's also choice of white or brown). Their serving bowl is humongous, like a black space saucer. The presentation is beautifully eye catching, with all the colorful vegetables arranged neatly around the rice and protein. Mix everything together and you have something reminiscent of a fresh salad, with lots of crunchy veggies and a hard boiled egg. The spicy pork has quite a kick so I would suggest not prematurely adding more of their spicy sauce. Overall, really cool concept and place delivering delicious food. Check them out!

Paratha tacos. So good they've become my cover photo on Facebook. What more can I say? I'll be stopping here every time I visit Chicago. Got one beef and one pork. Next time I'll make sure to starve all day so I can buy half of the menu items.

very cute store, bright and cleanthe food is fusion but tasted amazing! really liked the paratha taco, it is huge for tacos, and the paratha bread is very chewy and buttery. the bimbibap is filled with veggie and comes in a gigantic bowl that i can just dip my face in there, very healthy and tasty

It's pretty easy to order here. Just channel your inner Hanson.Bibimbap  ba duba dopBa Bibimbop, ba duba dopBa Bibimbop ba duba dopBa du, yeahOk...so those aren't exactly the lyrics to the song, but MMMMMMbop could easily be the soundtrack to those rice bowls since both make people pretty happy. It's a huge, relatively healthy meal for super cheap. They come with rice, veggies, a hard boiled egg, and your choice of KBBQ, pork, or sashimi. All super fresh, filling, and flexible on your checking account.Small place with limited seating, but super nice people working behind the counter. Definitely worth a stop in. And play Hanson on the way out.

This place is an awesome modern Korean fusion stop for a quick lunch or dinner. The menu is small and focuses on bap style bowls over rice and veggies plus some other fun options like paratha tacos, dumplings, etc.I wouldn't call this super authentic Korean but it's definitely a nice blended vibe of Korean cuisine and a modern western influence. I went with the sashimi bap which was every bit as delicious as all the other yelpers have raved. A fresh sashimi medley on top of your choice of rice (I went with black rice) and tons of salad fresh veggies. My friend went with the bulgogi beef bap which was similar and also excellent. Both servings were huge and you will easily leave full or with leftovers (or both). They gave us a delicious kimchi base style spicy sauce to douse our bowls with. Service is quick and friendly. Prices are very good for the quality and quantity you're getting. Location is right in the heart of Bucktown along the Damen strip. I will be back many times until I've tried everything on the menu.My only complaint is that they serve a hard boiled egg with the bibimbap bowls. Half the fun of bibimbap is the runny yolk that you get to break and soak your rice in. I assume the hard boiled egg helps them keep costs down and service quick (you can make them ahead of time and they will keep for a few days) but come on. Give a girl some runny yolk!

This review is only for the "korean tacos" but boy, are they good.I love how the wrap is crispy, flaky, and buttery. My favorite is the bulgogi one. The ambiance inside this little restaurant is adorable. Reminds me of cute cafes in K-Town back home in LA. Definitely want to come back and try the bibimbaps!Love the korean-mexican fusion concept.

En Hakkore is in a quiet spot on Damen right off the 606 Trail, and this may just be what you need after a nice run or bike ride. There's not much to the menu besides bibimbap, tacos, and some appetizers and a special or two, but what is available is done extremely well.Presentation, taste, quantity, quality of ingredients, interior decor, price, etc. all come together in a very simple, straightforward Korean fusion restaurant that crosses Korean fare with Japanese, Mexican, and Indian. I'm not a big fan of fusion, but when it's done right with proper thought and attention is paid to taste, this can be a great crossing of paths.I highly suggest trying the sashimi bibimbap. It's a nice cross between a traditional Korean bibimbap and a Japanese chirashi bowl. It still has rice, but instead of beef, you get freshly cut sashimi (NOT FISHY) as the "meat." The veggies are also finely cut and adds a nice mix of texture across all the ingredients in the bowl. The rice wasn't quite as sticky and cooked to what I eat all the time in my household, but it's not a big deal. Just a little quibble on an otherwise fantastic dish.You must absolutely try the paratha tacos. At first I thought these were like the tacos at Del Seoul, but there's a little twist in using paratha bread (i.e., Indian flatbread) to hold all the toppings. Cool beans! Both the pork and beef options are tasty and do well with the paratha bread. $7 is a tad high for two tacos, but again, just a minor quibble on what was a rather fantastic meal.En Hakkore is a must for anyone that can appreciate Korean fusion, but don't go expecting an endless menu of items to pick from. They do a few things here, but they do it right.
Delicious food with great portion sizes and really affordable! Spicy pork bibimbop is the perfect pre-cocktail meal!

Came here based on a friend's friend's recommendation and was not disappointed!Food:- Korean BBQ Bimbimbap with black rice: This comes in a ginormous bowl with no shortage of meat, boiled egg, carrot, cabbage, bean sprouts, mushrooms, etc. The option for the black rice (the woman said it had antioxidants) was great for one more dollar. It was so yummy and the plethora of food for ~$10 was great.They have tacos that looked really good, but I didn't get to try it. If I'm ever back in the area again, I will definitely try it out.Decor:-The place is really cutely decorated with a chic chandelier and other such decorations.Service:-The woman at the cash register who I think is the owner was so sweet and gives great recommendations as well as brings the food out to you. Be sure to bus your own table!-Lunchtime gets pretty busy actually with take out orders as well as people dining in.

Overview: Have been here twice and both times I had delicious flavorful Korean-with-a-twist food. The menu is small, but given that everything on it amazing it doesn't really matter. The restaurant is small though, so it's best for couples or groups less than 4, and it's seat yourself. Honestly, there's nothing on the menu that I wouldn't recommend, but you definitely have to try the Korean Tacos (get one pork and and one beef!).Service: They are polite and serve you food. As a seat yourself place there isn't much interaction with the staff, but they have always been polite.Atmosphere: Probably seats about 20 people. Expect to be close to others, but it makes for a fun busy atmosphere. Very clean and minimal design.Food: GET THE TACOS! They are the star of the show here. Two tacos is a pretty hefty potion and while it's a good meal for one they could easily be split. I recommend trying both the beef and pork to see which one you like better (I have a slight preference for the spicy pork). That being said, I highly recommend everything on the menu. The noodles and dumpling appetizers they had were delicious too and everything was a good portion.Will be back and would go more often if it was easier to access by public transport.

Fresh ingredients, large portions, awesome interior design. This place does not serve the traditional take on bibimbap but their twist on the Korean traditional dish is phenomenal. I think I can recall there being at least 7 different ingredients in each bibimbap. My girlfriend got the sashimi bibimbap (hue dup bap) and I got the spicy pork bibimbap. I think a lot of people will find the spicy pork bibimbap pretty spicy seeing as how I found it hella spicy and started sweating :(Order:sashimi bibimbap (hue dup bap)spicy pork bibimbap

I love this place!  Such a cute and simple place with great food!  The tacos are a must have!  But the sashimi bop is my favorite!  A light meal that's delicious and refreshing!  Definitely one of my go to places in the neighborhood!

Food: Sashimi rice bowl, pork taco, bulgogi taco. All delicious, very fresh, and well seasoned. Portions are good, and surprisingly filling! I love the pratha that the tacos are served on, and would go back just for those. I look forward to trying their tofu taco! I ask for double spicy sauce for the sashimi rice bowl and mix all of the ingredients together before taking my first bite. Tastes fresh with all the veggies and raw fish.Atmosphere: Small, intimate, cafe-like area with the kitchen in the back behind the register.Service: Good service, few employees, as it is a smaller space. Self-serve water. Great to order to-go, and they package the food nicely.

This place is so far my favorite Korean/Korean Fusion Restaurant! I've tried countless of Korean restaurants because I'm in love with the Korean style but this restaurant in specific is the one I been looking for! lo got the spicy pork bibimbap as well as two tacos and they were delicious! The guy working there helped me understand a lil more how to eat the bibimbap which was a nice touch! The people working there Are very very welcoming and helpful. I hate when restaurants just give you nasty bowl of rice with a tiny portion of "Korean meat" which doesn't even deserve to be call food and try to fool you but bibimbap in hakkore are amazingly proportioned! You get to taste every part of it! The tacos impressedMe because they were great as well. Everything tasted fresh!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to people who are reading this, don't wait to try this place! I already recommend this place to my friends!
This is one of the best Korean food restaurants I've been to. Exceptional value for your money. Highly recommended to the food aficionado on a budget.

As others have noted they have a very small menu but what they do have is done well.Bibimbops are gigantic and come with a colorful display of vegetables.  One slight negative is that they are not served in a stone pot... Which means the rice doesn't get crispy/charred which I personally like a lot.   You can choose from vegetarian or two meat versions.The tacos are also tasty but to be honest... I like the ones you get in Los Angeles (kogi) more because of the slaw which the ones here don't have.All in all a fine little eatery and if I wasn't from SoCal this would be 4* easy.

I am so sad that I live so far away from here. This place is effing incredible. I got a sushi burrito (the spicy tuna variety) and my boyfriend go the bibimbop burrito. We shared the kimchi fries. All of these things were ridiculously deliciuos. Giant portions, reasonably priced, fantastic service. Why don't I live closerrrrrrr??? :(

Super delicious tacos. I got the pork and beef paratha tacos and I can't stop thinking about them. Cheap price at $7.50 for 2 bigger than average size tacos. The paratha taco shell is so so good. There's Instagram worthy decor inside the restaurant. Service was quick but I went at around 4 pm when business was pretty slow. Anyway, just come here. The end.

The menu here is surprisingly tiny, but before even coming to the restaurant, I already knew a few things that I wanted to try. The sashimi bap was clean, fresh tasting. You can taste the sashimi in the bowl pretty well, but I wish there was a little more sashimi in comparison to all the veggies. Felt like I was eating more of a salad than sashimi with veggies over rice. It was good, but not the best that I've had. Great price for it though ($12). I'd say the only thing missing for me here was having a craving for meat after. Sashimi and fresh veggies didn't totally hit the spot by itself. The bibimbap and sashimi bap here don't come in stone bowls, just one part that I felt was missing.The paratha tacos were great and I'd come back to eat this again. A friend described the taco skin to us as a Chinese green onion pancake texture that was a bit buttery. After taking a bite of the tacos (got a spicy pork and a beef one), I think he was spot on. The taco tortilla was very authentic. Never had tacos with this type of tortilla before. Definitely similar to the oily green onion fried pancake texture with a little added buttery taste to it. The tacos weren't tiny, but maybe just two tacos isn't completely filling for those who eat a lot.

sorry to disagree with everyone else, but we found this place to be a "eh". we both ordered the sashimi Bibim-bap. I will say the quality of fish was outstanding, but that's where is stopped. my husband found himself layering the dish with tons of their house made sauce (also good) but you shouldn't have to smother something in a whole container of sauce just to eat it. Perhaps, I'm biased- we came from the bay area where the korean food was a plenty and always so delicious.the thing that annoyed us the most was that we got called out for leaving our plates on the table. as soon as we did, we immediately asked where the trash can is, in utter embarrassment. We are not those kind of people--- we throw our stuff out, but after seeing the only one trash can that deliberately said "do not throw food in trash can", we gave up. If you want people to throw your plates out---make a sign and put it somewhere noticeable. So the food being eh and the rude service, we will not return. while many have said the tacos are excellent- we will take your word on it. I wish this place the best- I like to support local, but please put a sign for trash so others know.

Best tacos in the city. I know there is a great one right down the road, but this place takes the cake. Great prices overall and was impressed with the food. It is not BYOB and doesnt serve alcohol as an FYI.

Writing this review as a vegetarian (we eat eggs and dairy)We loved this place. For $20 total we got the bibimbop, small jap chae (sweet potato noodles) and gingerbeer.I loved the sweet potato noodles personally, but all three were really good. Will definitely be back!

So the options here are few, but what they do have they do incredibly well.  I have tried the bibimbop with spicy pork as well as the paratha taco with bulgogi beef and both came with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor.The bibimbop is served in a huge bowl and is quite a big portion, was enough for 2 meals.  The paratha tacos are also quite big as well, 2 tacos per order and worth every penny.  The flavors really mesh well and it's not your typical Korean food.With only a few tabletops I can imagine it can get busy sometimes, however both times I've been here it has been fairly quiet.  It's fairly self serve, grab your own utensils and water, and the bathroom is in the back but let them know first!Good, quick food at a decent price, a solid update to traditional Korean food.

Came here to get a quick lunch on the 4th of July so there wasn't a crowd and the food came out quick. The food was very fresh and "healthy." I got the paratha spicy pork "tacos" and it had a very spicy kick to it, which I enjoyed a lot. The paratha is awesome and way better than just corn tortillas as it was much thicker and buttery somehow-really enjoyed the combination of meat and the paratha!They also have a variety of bibimbaps which is a mix of rice, meat, and veggies. We got the Sashimi Bibimbap which was $12 (great value). It had a mix of raw fish and a large variety of veggies! It was light and refreshing which was good for our drive back. I would recommend getting both again!

YUM! This place was delicious, I literally finished every last bite. I was hoping I could've tried the sashimi-bap but I hadn't eaten for a couple hours and eating raw fish on an empty stomach is bad news. Nevertheless, this place is an alternative to the bibimbap I'm used to eating or maybe I just haven't had good bibimbap! It was light, filling, and fresh. I usually eat the greasy kind that leaves you feeling kinda heavy. Anyway, the owner was really nice too and was shocked I loved his bibimbap since I was from California. But it wasn't a shocker to me- the ambiance of this restaurant is really cute and the food was bomb!

A couple of friends brought me here for lunch. It's a small place so I wasn't expecting much, but DAMN. I got one of each flavor of the tacos and was very pleased. The portions are generous... I definitely wouldn't come here for a light lunch, it's more of an indulgence. Worth a trip for sure!

SO GOOD WHAT THE BEEP. I got the bibimbap bowl and that stuff was tasty. It was a huge portion size, enough to enjoy some leftover at home with extra rice I'd already cooked. They also had a delicious steamed dumpling side dish that you might want to try. The place is definitely Korean-owned (aka Korean cashier and Korean "decor"), so don't worry about authenticity.

I've gone here a few times now and enjoy the place more and more each time. The spicy pork bibimbap is my favorite here, though the beef bibimbap and sashimi-bap ain't so bad themselves. All of the dishes were extremely flavorful and packed with fresh ingredients. Portion sizes are huge and definitely justify the cost of each dish.For anyone in the area looking for a casual lunch or dinner, this place is a must. Just be careful if you're coming with a big group as the place is on the smaller side. Service is fast and friendly though, so the wait isn't too bad.
Get the paratha tacos and never look back.
Decent beef bibimbop, not as good as Crisp's though.
3.5 stars for the novice Korean diner, for those who have had lots of traditional Korean food, this will be a disappointment.

Everything is amazing here! You'll get blown away with huge bowl of bibimbap and  the tacos are out of this world. Tacos are much bigger and heavier than you'd think.Service and quality of the food is always been top notch.Highly recommend anyone to go here if you're in the wicker/bucktown area.
Everything here is delicious with great prices.  Don't hesitate to try the Bibimbop and Partha tacos...I could eat them every day.  Great food and service, one of my favorite places in Chicago.

It's a sad SHAME to have to bring up an absence of KINDNESS & RESPECT... especially when not MERRITED. Treated like a thing.My first ever best friend since preschool is Korean. I've enjoyed eating with her family since then, therefore upon walking in, I immediately became curious... Not anymore.I came in to pick up an order for someone else. I was so kind and respectful bc I beleive we all should be. At the counter, in attempts at being cooperative and considerate I was thorough. The young Asian guy at the counter is a complete jerk. This opinion is shared. He was extremely short and BLATANTLY UNCONCERNED with his actions causing me to feel unwelcome.As I waited for my order, my initial feeling was VALIDATED. I watched as he tended to SUBSEQUENT CUSTOMERS, and realized he actually treated them with polite words, eye contact and body language that he hadn't me. He also didn't TOSS THE RECEIPT at them.Even when my order was ready, while there were no others waiting, he all too loudly yelled my order out making no eye contact,  KNOWING I was 2 ft. away in the small space that makes up the restautant. Treated like a thing....after having been totally kind and respectful.En Hakorre counter staff,Do yourselves.... and the world a favor by treating people with respect, kindness, and empathy. Their purpose or appearance aren't good indicators. Judging and treating people with disregard won't earn you any new fans and just lost you many.In appreciation of an older lady working there who did acknowledge me kindly.

My grandma and I both got the Korean BBQ beef bibimbop and it was DELICIOUS. The bowl is also pretty large, so I was really full by the end, but didn't want to stop eating because it all tasted so good.If I had to make a critique, I would say the food was warm when it came, but cooled off pretty quickly. However that won't stop me from coming back and trying another protein! The service was also crazy fast, which was awesome

Very cute - it's small, not too many tables, so not that great for large parties over 4.  Come for their paratha tacos (we tried them all), 2 per person + a shared side will be plenty.  Unfortunately the other dishes weren't that impressive. A bit pricey given the portions - but have to give them credit for a creative twist on Asian fusion.Fun to take visitors.
Quite the meal! Counter service was very friendly and thorough in explaining the different sauces and meat options in the Bibimbap and Paratha Tacos. Delicious flavors and unique taco textures!

I loved everything about En Hakkore!*Food taste: I am Korean, and I have to say that everything I tried here tasted authentic and really good. The food is-fresh-good balance of carbs, veggie, meat/ fish (its proportional, as in they give you enough sushi***)-yummy!The portions they give are generous, and the prices are definitely a plus! I feel healthy and not guilty after finished a whole bowl or whole burrito...*service: everyone is super friendly, caring, and happy to help if you have any questionsOVERALL, this place exceeded my exceptions and their take on "hwe-dup-bap" (sushi bibimbap) was probably the best I have yet to taste! wooh!

Sashimi Bap bowl was amazing! It cost $12 for it and it was so worth it. It's like eating a charishi bowl Korean style with lots of veg to go around. It had rice at the bottom and it was delicious. I loved the most were the paratha tacos were outstanding we had the pork and beef and it was yummy! Spicy food all around it was still refreshing and delicious. I would recommend this place it sorta of fast food style dining experience with quality food. I really recommend this place for healthy and delicious dinner or a lunch.

Ambiance: Very clean and homey feel. Casual , quick sit down restaurant. For four people we ordered four orders of Paratha tacos, an order of jap chae and dumplings and from time of being served and getting done eating it took about half an hour.Food: Paratha tacos (you get two with your choice of pork or beef, get one of each!) Are amazing. The pork one was pretty spicy , but nonetheless good. The beef was very tender. For me what really made the tacos is the shell. If you;ve ever had the bread from flat top, that's basically what the tortilla is made of! Dumplings and jap chae were pretty standard, nothing I haven't tasted before, but still yummy.Service: I haven't been there when its busy, but with about 5 others in the restaurant it was pretty fast.

No idea why I was craving something like this on a 90 degree day but OMG am I glad I found this place! Yelped "Korean" food nearby and came here for lunch today. You order at the counter and they serve you. Really cute decor inside, very friendly and adorable Korean lady working behind the cashier. Anyways I had the bibimbap bowel with Korean bbq beef and brown rice. If you like it hot- ask for their hot sauce! As you can see from my picture, the bowel is huge! Can easily be shared by 2 people but only 1 extremely hungry Stefanie. Seemed pretty healthy too, loaded with lots of veggies, protein and hard boiled eggs. 5 hours later and I'm still full. Def will be back!

Absolutely love this place!  Lots of delicious, fresh, healthy food for a very reasonable price.  Wish I could give it more stars.Now you can get it delivered through Caviar (bnc.lt/W9Qc/vOt90Hcf6q)!  Don't even need to drive there anymore.

En Hakkore is a wonderful representative of the growing Korean food scene in Chicago. I have tried their beef bibimbap, sashimi-bap, paratha tacos (both beef and pork), and japchae. All dishes were so delicious and flavorful...and very filling. I personally prefer the sashimi-bap with the black rice.I noticed some customers would just pick at the vegetables...Noooo, girlfriend, MIX IT REALLY WELL!Their customer service has been compromised a bit in the past couple of months -- possibly because of the opening of their sister restaurant? I prefer the kind, older Korean lady to take my orders because you can tell she just cares about the food she is serving...unlike the young man who seems to be irritated by his paying customers and barks orders at you.

This is a more Americanized Korean place, but I don't care - it's the shit.Small menu - basically bibimbap and tacos. I think maybe a sandwich or two as well.+ Really amazing beef, we didn't try other meat options+ Loved the mild sauce, just perfect+ Awesome assortment of veggies - they claim 16, I didn't count.+ Massive serving+ Great assortment of bottled/canned cold bev - Asian and AmericanOnly downsides - isn't served in a blazing hot stone bowl, so the rice isn't crispy and they are closed Sundays. Since this is not super traditional I won't ding them for the former and since I would want a day off, I won't blame them for being closed on a Sunday.One of my new favorite lunch spots.
Pretty goodI got the tofu bibimbopThe presentation was awesome looking n in a huge bowlI also got the dumplingsDumplings were great except it could have been not as sweet but still good.

Adorable little place on Damen. The decor had me as soon as I walked in. You order at a cashier and seat yourself at either a large community table or a few smaller tables for 2-4. No alcohol, but a large assortment of Korean beverages are available. We ordered the Bibim bap and the paratha tacos. Bibim bap was good- like the other reviews say, lots of fresh veggies, but no crispy rice. The paratha tacos were SO GOOD! Definitely recommend those if you're going for the first time.Overall- casual, quick spot for a delicious lunch or dinner. Reasonably priced and good food!!

I absolutely love this place. I can definitely understand why there are so many good reviews. We ordered the paratha with spicy pork and the bibimbap. The bibimbap can be ordered with black rice, which is not something I have seen before. The portion of meat and rice ratio was perfect. I usually do not like too much rice. Also, the vegetables on the side tasted really fresh. As for the paratha/taco, the spicy pork was seasoned perfectly. I am not quite sure if the paratha was made fresh; it reminded me of the frozen paratha's that you can buy from any Indian grocery store. The prices are very reasonable given the size of the portions. I took home the bibimbap for a second meal. I think I found one of my favorite korean place in Chicago and hope to be back soon!

My absolute favorite healthy eating out spot of all time.I usually get the sashimi bibimbap with the mild sauce. The quantity and quality of the food here is up to standard.
