it might be the smallest bar in the city, hardly anywhere to stand, tho i suppose if you can get a seat at the bar its ok, but still you gotta keep scooting up for people to walk by, but i suppose thats the charm, some good beers on tap, reasonably priced, tho i doubt id come back cuz its so small

Went in 8/15.When I walked in I realized just how small this place is.We weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself.As I stood at the bar while the bartenders were figuring out what kind of shot they wanted to take I interrupted to ask.Yes. Seat yourself and he said first come first serve?We sat ourselves on a sticky, unbalanced table.We waited about 5 minutes before we were greeted.Where I had to ask if the table could be wiped down.The menus were really sticky as well.I went with the mule and my friends went with the gimlets.The drinks were really delicious.I really enjoyed sitting outside.Our server seemed un interested in us,  I felt like we had to flag her more than her actually popping in.No small talk nothing.  She's a blonde with a pixie.We ordered guacamole,  calamari,  and bruschett a,All amazing.We asked the server for a salad about 20 minutes after our apps,  and she told us they already had last call.(Which we weren't told)She then said she'd ask if the kitchen could throw a salad together,  and literally never came back,  until they closed the patio.Even when closing the patio I felt like they were really rude.Why would you bring me a full drink ten minutes before you close the patio, then say everyone has to drink up.It was awkward.Food and drinks really good.Service.  Pretty bad.This could have been a 5 star.

We were told to come to the matchbox to experience real bar in Chicago. I think it's the narrowest bar in the planet. It's really cool though. You definitely get to know people around you. We tried a couple drinks there. The woodmans are really good and refreshing. They make the best margarita and old fashion. Totally recommend coming to this place.

If we could, both Rob Thomas and I would give this place 20 stars. Since we can't 5 will have to cover it.Not necessarily applicable in this winter weather, but the patio is pretty dope with way more seating on the sidewalk then inside the bar itself. Until a warmer climate comes you''ll have to fight for one of the maybe 30 spots inside, but if you're lucky enough to get one you'll enjoy awesome drinks cheaper than almost any craft cocktail bar in town.Perfect to post up at alone and enjoy some convo with the bartenders or bring a date to showcase your coolness. Matchbox makes for an awesome spot to start off a night of almost any occasion if you're not rolling with a deep crowd.

This place is pretty amazing, but a star off because cramped quarters are not my thing.  Is it worth a visit though?  As long as you've braced yourself to get VERY cozy with everyone in the bar, yes!We arrived shortly after 5 on a Tuesday and snagged two of the few chairs left (yes, at 5:15 most of the 15ish bar stools were taken!)  Drinks are delicious and reasonably priced.  My friend drank Ladybirds all night (gin, ginger and yellow chartreuse concoction).  I sampled the pisco sour (pretty solid), the gin & jam (sweet but worth a try, it's definitely different - any yes, there's literally jam in it) and the Ladybird.Word to the wise: eat first.  After 4 cocktails each, we were pretty gone.  We snacked on the salt & vinegar chips available, but regretted that decision the next day....  if you're looking to drink in moderation, you're in the wrong bar ;)

It tries so hard to be cool, kitchy, and hip(ster), in one of the cool Chicagoan neighborhoods (it's kinda cool).  But, when have a place that is indeed the size of a matchbox, it's impossible to go during any hours respectable to grab a drink.  Fortunately, I was drinking when it was not indeed respectable, so rather enjoyed myself, but it was still almost impossible to find a seat.It's one of those places you have to try at least once, because of its trendy appeal, but it'd be hard to go regularly if every time you might not actually get to stay.

If you don't like the grit of this place, then this place just isn't for you. This place is small, if you don't get in, or if you are cramped........its always expected, don't base your review on level of service, because.......they don't care. And neither should someone going to 'the smallest bar in chicago'.I believe that only a few places do certain things extremely well, and you should judge those places, based on those few things.Get a margarita. Order the 1/2 ribs. Order the shrimp cocktail.If you do this, you should expect to give a great review - Service is by bikers.....so you shouldn't rate just based on that (because its not bad......its just cold/expected).If you want warm service w/ great bartenders, go to the Silver Palm, which is basically the same place (upstairs). Then, and only then, should you order the fantastic fish tacos and many other their other great food options.
Not my idea of fun being jam packed in the tiniest bar.  It's uncomfortable being in there, but I guess they have their regulars, so good for them.

im visiting from california. on the night on 12/13/15 i came to this bar around 6pm-7pm and the bartender was bluntly rude, giving me the most stalest answers back. visiting from another state and reading all the yelp reviews i expect some kind of customer service but it seemed like right as we walked in (being a group of asians) he had this attitude that could be handled with a ass whooping back home but i kept calm and continued to ask questions on what he did have, politely of course. after answering no to all my questions, i decided to leave. i wasnt greeted as i walked in or out. to the bartender working that night. go fuck yourself, you are a blight in the world. idk why this bar has good reviews. its fucking tiny! the walk-way into the bar is no wider then 2/12 ft wide. fuck this place.

I used to bike past this place every day or two. The Matchbox is small. It is very very small. If you get a seat at the bar keep it. Hold on tight because in five or ten minutes the place will be packed and you will basically hug everyone who walks past. Oh, there is that guy who sits and pretends to read! I get a kick out of that! Man, he can do perhaps 1 page every 10 minutes. Oh, but the atmosphere. This place has it.It has the after workers, the graduate students going on about gentrification (which they cause), and the industry people here having a beer. You may see lots of bartenders and servers from other places. I did. I thought that was funny. Lots of "Haven't you?" or "Don't you?" and that wasn't me. Anyhow, if you can find a seat or a wall to hang against grab a beer or a cocktail and hang for a bit.Classic Chicago joint.

Can't live without this lovely slice of heaven.Best margaritas (according to CNN, second best in the country).Awesome ambiance.No bullshit.Best bartenders.Best food from sister restaurant, the Palm (try: veggie burger, fried, asparagus and ribs)If you don't agree, please don't come back - I'll happily hog your spot!

If we're being honest...and as most know, I usually am.  I was walking home from Binny's in Lincoln Park and my bladder was starting to protest.  I have been curious about this odd little Bar since I moved here last May.  I get off the Blue Line right across the street when I am traveling for business and I always look across at it when waiting for Uber to arrive.  I decided to stop in and have a drink so I didn't feel guilty about using the loo.  What an awesome surprise!  It's shaped like a sliver of aged cheese with pressed tin ceiling and a brick outer wall.  The spirits selection is impressive and they have a few decent craft beer choices.  The wine selections look decent as well.  I am guessing this place holds 30-40 people tops.  The bartenders are super nice and last but not least the cocktails are the most reasonable priced I have found for the quality in Chicago.  You should add this to your list of places to try in Chicago.  Next time I fly home and get off the Blue Line stop at Chicago Ave., I think I will stop here for a wee nip before I summon Uber

The name of this bar, Matchbox, is very apropos to the space. It is simply one long bar. The decor is very casual and relaxing. Seats up to 29?! Depending on the crowd it can fill up very quickly and without a seat can be very tight.The people are friendly as many times I've frequented. They have their popular powdered sugar gimlets but they also have a pretty decent whiskey collection. Their prices are very fair & the bartenders' alcohol pour are generous. No food. Unless you consider a bag of chips fuel for the stomach which it had been for me on several occasions.Definitely a stop on the dive bar crawl. It's easy to become a regular there. Oh and there's a silver train diner parked just behind the place. Never been inside but an excellent visual nonetheless.
Good quality coctails. Also very strog, I could say maybe even too strog, but you can't complain about that. Moreover, the stuff is very friendly.

If I'm in the mood for a cocktail, I go to The Matchbox. In my opinion- it is the best gin gimlet in town. I suggest going on a weekday when it is quieter.. or in the summer when you can utilize the patio space.

Love this place! It's easily the coziest spot in Chicago come wintertime. The staff is down to earth and easily memorable. I've never been to the matchbox and even experienced annoying customers. It's a really great experience all around.Great drinks too. Go for the gin gimlet... They give you the shaker for refills!

I don't get it, or maybe I do. The matchbox is the size of a matchbox. It's a tiny bar that seems like it was built as an afterthought and smells exactly like a college frat house.We came here on a recommendation of a rather lovely gal and was sorely disappointed. The bar is small enough for patrons to sit at and just enough room behind the seat for ppl to walk by and bump you with their sweaty arms. The drinks are alright, they looked imaginative and the tenders make a large portion. They shake up your drinks and give you the shaker to pour out the rest. I wanted to give this place 2 stars, however, the drinks bumped it up. The drinks are cheap, sweet and refreshing. I suppose if the outside area was open my review would be completely different. I just, hate the smell of college frats.

I have never had a drink at the Matchbox. I have been brought there twice. Each time I walked in, I pretty much turned around and walked out. The second time I went, I forgot what bar it was and I had no idea why the heck my friend brought me back there when we pulled up along side of the building to park.When I saw the place the first time, I couldn't wait to get in because I thought that it was attached to the train car that was located behind it, making it look much larger than what it really was. Inside the train, I could see cozy tables with a candle light on top of each of them. I opened the door and immediately started making my way to the back of the building, searching for a way to make it to the train car. I was so excited! I got to the end and realized, to my dismay, that I was trapped in a space much like and old-school matchbox. Perhaps the space recalls the children's nursery rhyme that talks about an old woman who lived in a shoe.The second time I went, I was wearing a big fluffy coat (middle of winter) and carrying a larger purse because I had no idea where I was going. I tried to be nice and tolerate the experience, hoping that the place would be less crowded this time. I was wrong. There was nowhere to put my stuff down. The environment started to close in on me. It was then I noticed the thick moist air mixed with the smell of stale beer, hard liquor, and halitosis. Apparently oral hygiene isn't high on the list of the kinds of patrons who go there. I literally felt like if I stood there long enough, I would have caught the common cold. Had I stayed there and drank, I probably would have left with the flu virus attacking my lowered immune system (drinking does that).Everyone loves this place because the bartender is supposedly epic; and the clientele carry a universal personality of the blue-collar characters showcased in the tv series Cheers. Label me however you want to, but immediately I felt surrounded by old people who don't know how to dance; or don't enjoy dancing. I am a Wicker Park Girl, and I love the small dancefloor venues. I am not the kind of girl you'll find in a cocktail dress at Y-Bar. That's disgusting. I want to throw on blue jeans and dance and let my hair down.Matchbox doesn't even give you room to take your coat off.  I'd be lying if I said that the people did not make you feel welcome. They do; but if I was single, I wouldn't go there to meet a guy at all. The kinds of guys that go, on top of their halitosis, do not hold my interest. Am I too old too handle this place? Am I too much of a cougar for thinking the crowds with rotting mouths are too ancient for me? I don't know. Perhaps a little bit of both. I am an older woman who is young at heart. If I am going to spend my money, I won't be wasting it or my time here. I get the sense that this is the place that twentysomething males and females retire to once they have hit their thirties and no longer care to brave Wrigleyville.Go if you must. If you're a girl, please dress like a man and bring only a wallet and a cell phone with you. Perhaps a protective face mask so you can breathe freely?
I really do love this place.  Relaxed vibe, excellent cocktails.  Dive bar appeal without compromising on quality drinks.  Wish it were closer!!

Love this bar.  I have always had great bartenders who give good recommendations and are very friendly.  The last time I went, I ordered an Old Fashioned - one of the best I've had.  They had jars of home made cherries that they muddled in my glass - amazing.  The bartender recommended a great beer for my friend and another great cocktail for me - a twist on the Negroni.The place is TINY and does not have a lot of seats so try to go at off times or else you will be uncomfortable.88/365

It may be small and cramped during peak hours but the bartenders are great and the silver palm next door tends to be less crowded if you want a more cozy atmosphere. The vegetarian options for food are pretty good and I enjoy the whiskey options! Its a neat place to talk to new people and its even got a great laid back atmosphere in the early evening for a drink with a friend

Nothing but great things to say about the Matchbox.  It has everything you can want in a bar:  friendly, knowledgeable bartenders; a superb drink list featuring classic as well as modern cocktails; a great beer list with a couple of cool Belgium beers; and shockingly good wine should you be in the mood for that.  We've never had a bad time here, and it really is thanks to the bartenders, who couldn't be nicer and make a mean cocktail.Word to the wise:  it is very small, so get here early and snag a seat.  It opens at 4pm, so it's a great early bar should you want to get the day started before the normal 5pm bar opening time.79/365

Question: How many people can you fit inside this bar. Answer: 20 children.  This place is miniature. I guess anyone who likes "small" things would like this place.   I prefer to drink my liquor while not stepping on someone.
Great cocktails hands down. Tony the bartender rocks.nice neighborhood spot.

Best cocktail bar in Chicago. A total dive I unexpectedly encountered and wasted away a perfectly wonderful winter Saturday afternoon chatting to locals and admiring the awesomeness of the place. Oh, and getting drunk. Lets not forget that part of it. The cocktails are GREAT and contain all the wonders of fresh juices, top class bitters, large ice cubes and lots of shaking. No, this isn't a swanky place that caters to the "in" crowd. It's better than this. It's a Harley Davidson-driving, black-bearded man with workmans hands and a belly laugh crafting exquisite cocktails in a tiny dive outfitted in knick knacks and paper money collected from around the world. Pull a seat up at the bar and join in the fun. Be prepared to be the butt of all jokes at some point. If you dish it, you gotta take it.
Love this place! Small and unpretentious. Good food and drinks. Love the outside patio.

I almost had to whiz into the toilet from the bar...because the bathroom is that small.Came here for post-Slurping Turtle drinks and stomach recovery mode for the Thee Little Piggies sandwich next door at Silver Palm.  And technically, I could have ordered it while sitting at the matchbox, I just wanted to be able to sit inside the train car.When we first got to the Matchbox, I'd read and heard about how small the place is.  But words can't describe the actual feeling you get upon walking in.  This place is seriously tight.  Tight like a tiger.  When I wanted to hit the head, I had to play musical chairs with the guy that was leaving the bathroom.Seeing how stretched this place could get, with an empty bar, I shudder to think what it'd be like if the place was hopping mad.  Knowing my wife, I thought it best to grab an outside table  Turned out to be a great choice with the weather being what it was, partly cloudy and 73.Onion rings to share, and a magical Pisco Sour.  Magical Pisco Sour how?  I'll tell you how!My Pisco Sour magically turned into a Margarita!At first, I thought, man these bitters are really screwing with my pallet here, it's making my brandy taste like tequila.  So I drank half the shaker, and then 3/4 of the way through, I let my Margarita expert friend Britt C.  taste it."That's definitely a margarita"Sadness.  Not one to ruffle feathers on a first date(with Matchbox), I left it at that and finished my drink.  So the good thing was it came with a shaker to continue topping off with.  The bad?  The wrong drink.  Our server was also very non-chalant.  It seemed she was genuinely annoyed that we were occupying a table in her section.  After receiving the check, we cheerily thanked her, as she rolled her eyes and said with a touch of scorn,"yeah" while rolling her eyes.I'll come back here, but not for Ms. Rolly-Eyes' terrible attitude.I'll come back for the Pisco Sour that I never received.
Great drinks. The space lives up to the name, you ar certainly a match in the box with no wiggle room. Perfect for the datin' and romancin' folks. Excellent drinks.

smallest bar in Chicago! decent parking around the area.. good vibe! good prices!look for a bartender named Trino ! dude is nice and will make anything you want from fruity girly drinks to i wanna black out drinks.

Bottom Line Up Front: Interesting layout, good selection of booze, fun clientele. It's "smallness" forces you to meet new people.Hanging out at the Matchbox is kind of like drinking with my brother. Like my brother, the Matchbook is dimunitive in size, lives off the blue line, and doesn't really bat an eye if you fart. Even if you've never been there, it has an "everyone knows your name" familiarity that larger, less tattooed, more successful bars (brothers) can match.I like dive bars, primarily because they usually lack the requesite 25 Flat Screen televisions on the Sportscenter loop. It seems to me that the less "entertainment" at the bar, the more human interaction. Well, the Matchbox adds the element that every time that you want to go to the bathroom, order a drink, or turn around, you're literally bumping into another patron. some might rate this as a negative, but it was kind of cool to be absolutely FORCED to meet the people surrounding you at the bar.Matchbox DOES have a small television right above the door. It was playing "Last House on a Dead End Street," a 70s slasher movie. The aforementioned restroom is unisex, and at the far end of the bar from the entrance. It was pretty clean.The Box had an incredibly impressive selection of craft beer and spirits. Only 3 draught beers, but a good selection of local midwest microbrews from Bells, 3 Floyds, Left Hand, and Great Lakes. Behind the rail, the Box has 10, 12, and 15 year old Pappy Van Winkle Bourbon... pretty much the most delicious bourbon in the world. You know it's good because it's featured prominently on the TV show "Justified" - a drama where a Sherrif's Deputy drinks bourbon and/or moonshine, slays all of the goodlooking babes in this town, and shoots with impugnity (because it's justified). Sidenote: if you're looking for a guilty pleasure TV show, give it a watch.Long story short. it's a great place to grab a drink if you're in the neighborhood.

It has been too long since I came here for a cocktail!  Ha ha, looking back at my old review in 2007, my cocktail taste has definitely changed.  If you want a classic non pretentious dive for a classic cocktail, go for it.
Small, narrow watering hole that holds a very eclectic vibe.  Great hidden gem if you're looking for a unique drink in a unique location.

The Matchbox may possibly be my new favorite bar for cocktail drinking.  The bartenders are very knowledgable and are perfectly consistent with their drink creations. I recommend the sidecar which is a classic but strong and delicious.   I couldn't believe how good the service was despite the crowd.  The bartenders are very laid back and the patrons are extremely friendly (mostly regulars).  I was lucky to fall upon this bar while walking through river west and turns out it is the smallest bar in Chicago.  I hope to return soon :)

After 2 years, our extensive research and data collection has lead us to the conclusion that the Matchbox best ginger gimlet that Chicago has to offer...  Especially when Chris is behind the bar and accents the cocktail with his fabulous rim job.... A special nod to Colleen who comes in a close second.  LUV this place and happy to see cheetos return on the menu...

It's good for you. The ginger.Ok, so that wasn't in the description for my drink, but it was a line on the menu about another ginger drink. I ordered a ginger vodka gimlet, and it was amazing. All of the drinks at our table came out in metal shakers. I would say it filled the little martini glasses about 2.5 times. Not bad for $8.50 drinks.I will try to explain this, but when I tried to explain it while I was there with my friends...I pretty much got a "that's what she said". So, the ginger isn't very noticeable when you first sip this drink. It won't be overwhelming. However, there is an after taste that kind of dances over your tongue.I don't know if that makes sense, but hopefully it didn't sound as wrong as my last attempt at explaining it.All of the drinks at our table came out in metal shakers. I would say it filled the little martini glasses about 2.5 times. Not bad for $8.50 drinks.We sat outside on the patio rather than in the teeny tiny bar (my friend is claustrophobic....I just learned that when we got there). The only downside to this place was our waitress. She rarely came around to check on us, and when she did she wasn't very helpful...or nice.Bottom line, I loved that drink! One of the better drinks I've had recently for sure

Yesterday was an awful experience.   This Is no longer my go to place. they stopped giving people the shakers and started giving people a little cup with the extra drink. Last night the bar tender was the guy with the long black beard. He was off and crossed the line.   I asked if each person got a cup with the extra drink.  He said "I should be grateful.  I should go down town if I don't like it.  It's a bargain." Rude! I'm a regular.  Maybe that's why there were only 4 people last night

It's already been established how tiny this place is so I won't bother mentioning it.  I will mention that they have an absolutely amazing selection of liquors, with an equally amazing bartender that was a master of his craft.  I went on a very uncrowded Saturday afternoon.  This was the perfect place to have a perfect martini with an old pal.  There's no other place like it.  This place is a must.

How have I  not written a review of this place until now, I LOVE this place. I've been going here on and off for years. It's got all the booze you need, cheap cans of Schlitz, and the bartender will "start you a napkin".In the summer it spills out onto the street, but the cozy inside part is better.

Solid drinks that are not wimpy, great atmosphere and always interesting people in there.  Great selection of spirits!Patio is nice in the summer.  The service is consistent.  The place is small on the inside.

Awesome.Mixology bar, very very reasonably priced, barman is a genius. The menu is very impressive. Many drinks have vodka's infused in house. Bartenders super friendly. Bonus points for accomodating a diabetic friend and still making great tasting drinks for her. Also invented some amazing drinks on the fly for us. Never had sriracha in a drink before and fell in love with the idea. A hidden gem in Chicago. Off the beaten track and worth the entire experience.Caveat - the place is tiny. I think it's the narrowest bar i've ever been to in my life. The toilets are also super mini with the smallest sink i have ever seen. If you sit by the back, things will get a little too cozy for comfort. There is only bar seating - no tables and no standing room. So you have to come here at the right time. As many ppl have pointed out, the name matchbox is intentional.

Best bar in Chicago. Good beer. Great cocktails. You can order deliciousness from next door. It's small and cozy enough that you can talk with everyone there. The resulting impracticalities (the restroom; sometimes getting hit with a door) weed out the folks who would rather be on Hubbard or in Wrigleyville. The service is always spot on. Love it.
GREAT top notch cocktails at such a good price! It's definitely a "matchbox" though. Be prepared to squeeze close to patrons. Great for Friday night pre-drinks.

I love this place, it's one of my top places to get a drink it the city. Cocktails are amazing and they make the best Gimlets. People complain about rude pretentious bar tenders but they're what makes the place. Nothing makes me happier than to hear them talk to dumb girls who "like OMG want a Cosmo like literally"

Great local spot in the neighborhood! Room for maybe 15-20 people in the entire bar, it makes for an intimate outing where conversations can easily be held. The prices are also spot on as a $10 cocktail comes with a shaker which is basically a 2 for 1 deal. They make the best gin gimlet I've ever had and you can't beat the price. This is a very unique bar in Chicago and a definite must-see.

Who designed the layout of this bar. Long bar which goes and goes and when you make it to the end, hope there isn't a person seated there, otherwise you'll have to pay toll by giving them a hump to get past. You get another free hump of their shoulder as you pass to get back. The room narrows as you walk into the back. Makes for funny situations and conversations with passersby as you sit there inebriated, smiling ear to ear due to the superbly created cocktail made by yours truly, Cheech from Cheech and Chong. Except this Cheech doesn't smile, except at ladies and has longer beard whiskers. Cocktails are pricey, but well worth the cost. They are mixed up in front of you and the bartender will leave behind the shaker with some left over you can pour or they will at some point, pour for you. Great place to impress cocktail connoisseurs or liquor up a date. Feels are free.Ginger vodka gimlet & margaritas on the rocks are a must.

The Matchbox is probably as big as/ just as dive-y looking the apartment I once had on Bowery in Manhattan.  Unlike that terrible living situation, The Matchbox is well-stocked with house infused liquors (pineapple vodka, anyone?) and bartenders who know how to make a mean cocktail.The bartenders are extremely down-to-earth and friendly; this isn't the type of cocktail bar where you are scoffed at if you've never heard of celery bitters.  Your friendly Matchbox bartenders will gladly offer suggestions, describe flavor profiles, and check in on you periodically to make sure you're having a good time.  The bartenders are also particularly nice to the regulars.  It's like a dive bar joined forces with a fancy cocktail bar to provide you with the best of both drinking experiences.Even if you're like me and despise sweet drinks, try the pineapple vodka gimlet.  It is somewhere between "Patio Pounder" (you know, one of those really easy to throw back cocktails) and something a bit more tangy and complex.  The pineapple vodka, infused in-house, is a real treat.  Because The Matchbox boasts a very interesting tequila and mezcal list, I've also had many iterations of a well-balanced margarita.At about $8 a drink (technically for two drinks, as the bartenders are pretty generous when they are mixing and will top you off with the remnants of the drink shaker), this is probably the best value-to-fun ratio to be had along all of Milwaukee.

I went to The Matchbox as the last stop on a holiday bar-hop dinner party bonanza with a shitton of service industry people.I was so drunk when I got there that I think I held on to my PBR with both hands and stared at it for a while.Someone handed me a shot of what was probably Maker's Mark and I think I poured it on the floor because there was no way that she was gonna stay down if I took it.I'll have to come back when I'm slightly less shithoused.

After the Jamaican Me Yelpy event, I wasn't quite ready to call it a night so I met a good friend here for a nightcap.I hadn't been to Matchbox since I lived in the 'hood many moons ago, but I had always remembered that I liked it, so I was anxious to see if it was still a cool place.Indeed it was. I arrived first (as usual; I am terminally punctual) and claimed the last two seats at the bar and ordered a glass of red wine.It probably would have been a better idea to order a martini, but I was craving a robust red and wanted a Cabernet. The bartender was only able to scrounge up a Shiraz, but anyone that knows me is well aware that I do not discriminate when it comes to red - I happily drink it all.My friend arrived and ordered a Scrimshaw pilsner. I am not a beer drinker and had never heard of it before so kudos to MB for stocking a hidden gem.We were engrossed in conversation when I heard the opening riff of "Come Together". Yep, MB was playing "Abbey Road" - the perfect soundtrack.We stayed a while and chatted with the bartender, who was very sweet, and commended her on her musical selection.Matchbox is as good as any place in the area. I'm not sure I'd be brave enough to come on a weekend night as the crowds would probably render me completely claustrophobic, but I'll definitely be back on a weeknight.

It's a dive bar is fantastic cocktails. Reasonably priced. Right next to the Blue Line. Nothing else matters as long as you can find a spot to stand (it's rather small). If you're hungry, there's the Silver Palm right next door.

BEST BAR OR BESTEST BAR? TOUGH QUESTION.I think this bar sums up all that is Chicago. The bartender has a bit of chub and is cheerful while wearing a Smiths tshirt and a Bulls cap.It is a tiny bar that serves excellent cocktails. What more could you ask for? If you haven't been here then you don't know Chicago.
The Matchbox is a great hangout.  Tiny, and quaint - with knowledgeable bartenders.  The Blue line is right across the street, so a very convenient for people visiting from out of town.
$7.50 for a well drink at happy hour? Definitely does not qualify as a dive bar. I suppose they have to maximize profit for their small size. Save your money and elbows and go to a real bar.

This was a great little surprise. The staff is super friendly and helpful, and the drinks were great-- I loved the maple leaf. It's very small, but it's a fun little place that's off the beaten path. Wouldn't plan on spending the whole night here, but if you're in the area and want a couple drinks or are looking for a unique find to add to the list, this is definitely a good spot.

Like the name implies -- this place is as small and tightly packed as, well, a matchbox. It is basically a claustrophobe's nightmare. The restroom was no exception. It was as cramped as an airplane restroom, sans any extras such as - oh, I don't know -- a toilet-paper dispenser! The roll of toilet-paper was 'secured' to the wall via an old nail, off which it promptly slid and rolled away onto the floor in response to my touch. To be fair, however, it made for a funny story and really was consistent with the feel of the place (plus they had soap and warm water, so I can't complain too much).Restroom gripes aside, I did enjoy the Louisville & Nashville Onion Rings. Thick-cut and with a panko breading - they were delicious and quite effective at 'soaking up' the effects of alcohol on an otherwise empty stomach.

I love this place and everything that it is (and its unapologetic demeanor in things its not).They know how to make cocktails, they make them well, and give you leftovers so you get 1 and a half drinks for price of one.Years, ago, before Yelp, when I was such a novice on cocktails and actually enjoyed Vodka (I can't stomach that anymore), the friendly older woman bartender told me, no, she would not make me a vodka martini.  No, instead, martinis should be made with gin and that's what she made me.  I was impressed, and that point forward, I have only grown to appreciate gin and left vodka behind forever.  Where else can you find a place that will tell you that you don't know more than the bartender?I came last night, and while the evening is cool, this place is perfect for the Autumn and Winter.

The Matchbox is not just a clever name. It's a description of this joint, so be prepared to get cozy with your company and the other 3 people that can fit in this bar.2 black gimlits and I was feelin' good. It's a unique place with great drinks.

Warning, this is not like your mother's bar...oh, actually is kinda is. Very funky layout, very small, and very angled!This place has maybe a dozens seats inside and if you sit too far back, you'll be getting up each time people come and go from the bathroom. There is way more seating outside, if the temp is right.That said, great place to meet friends or even someone new. Easy to converse, great bar tender who will mix up a gimlet or margarita with the best. Limited beer but Carlsberg on tap help.Definitely check out this very unique place.

As much as I hate how I feel the next morning after a night at the Matchbox, I can't stop coming back here.Gimlet, for the love of Pete, get a gimlet. Or a Manhattan... Or whatever!!  The cocktails are phenomenal and the bartenders get it right. 6 months ago, I brought my high class, out of town friend (why do I have a high class friend, I have no clue) here and he ordered a rye Manhattan. He STILL raves about it and asks when he's in town again to go there.

My friend and I walked in here by accident last night and couldn't get much further than he door. It was packed to the max and in order to go to the bathroom you have to exit the building and enter through another door farther down the building... then when you get in there, prepare to get VERY friendly with any bar patron sitting between you and the water closets. Calling it "The Matchbox" is no joke.I think this bar is defo 4 star worthy if you get there early enough to get a good seat... but sadly, we did not and were asked by one friendly patron if we were Avon ladies... uhm, what? I had just come from a Yelp Elite event and had a cobra painted on my face... no, we are not Avon ladies.Oh, and I think I was propositioned by an elderly couple for a threesome... you folks seemed nice but no thanks. I'm pretty young but I'm also old enough to know better. 3 stars is where Matchbox sits for now... I take offense to being profiled as an Avon lady.

I love it.  It is always pretty packed in here, it's too small to be anything but.  If you sit close to the bathroom you can't help but meet people because they have to apologize for bumping into you on the way to the "john."Try the lime gimlet, delicious.

We were on an impromptu bar crawl our first night in Chicago. I had scanned yelp to find this bar had great reviews.I loved that it feels like you're drinking in a train. The vibe of this bar was completely different from the other 3 we had just come from. The crowd was a little bit older, less frat-boy like and would be more than happy to leave you alone if you left them alone.We found our bartender very friendly and knowledgeable about suggestions of where else to go for drinks and food.I loved that my Manhattan came with a "friend" (the rest of the shaker). It's like two drinks in one!Then we discovered a very bad thing. Some bars in Chicago have extended last call. And our bartender sent us off to find one of those bars.

Where should I begin. When my friend told me "oh I need to take you a place that serves my favorite drink"...I had high expectations that this would be a nice place. Once we got there....it looked like a hole in a wall southside bar. It was still early to go out so the place was not crowded...but the matchobox is sooo small that it looks like it could get crowded fast.There was an outdoor patio which I was dying to sit at because I felt like an old lady sitting inside this crappy looking bar. Then I looked around and realize that all the people that were there....were 20-30 somethings.So why 4 stars?? Let's talk about their drinks....the pineapple gimlet is AMAZING. They also have other great specialty drinks that they make from scratch.We got our drinks and sat outside and I would have never felt like I was in the tiniest bar ever. Oh and did I mention that the drinks are not northside pricey? Good deal and great drinks....:-)

They say good things come in small packages...well then place is reallll small! The inside of the place is about as big as hallway. Did I bother to go sit inside...no thanks, I am going to pass on the feeling of being a sardine. They have tables outside, which I admit is pretty nice during the warm weather days. The service was good and the waitress suggested certain drinks to try. Gotta admit the drinks were quite tasty...not going to lie powder sugar on the rim isn't really my thing. Overall, its a good place, however if it was a wee bit bigger, well okay a lot bigger, then I would be sold!

Great, cozy neighborhood bar on one of the best street corners in Chicago.  In my book, this is definitely a winter-feeling bar, but even on a late summer Thursday night, it was just perfect.  Great booze selection and creative cocktails.

Clever name? Yes. Realistic description? Pretty much. I guess they are right when they say good things come in small packages, because this place is awesome... but man, is it small. A place this great should be at least 20 times it's current size, and they could call it Matchbox 20....Nothing? Hmm, well, it you didn't close your browser window already, then let me just give you a bit of advice. Try to sit close to the front door. If you grab a seat at the far end of the bar, it gets really, really narrow. This place can get "packed" and you'll be moving forward even 5 minutes for people trying to get to the bathroom in the back. I say "packed", because a couple groups is all it takes to make this place seem full. So, the total number of people won't be that many, but it'll still be wall to wall people. The sign on the wall says max. 29 people, but unless they mean half balancing on the other half's shoulders, I don't see that happening. When the weather permits, the outside seating is very pleasant (and obviously adds some much needed space).The service is really great here, and you'll always get a good drink. This is definitely a good place to come after work or an event (a little early) with a group and just kinda take over the place for a few hours.

Love Matchbox.  Best Gimlets anywhere. I'd 5 stars but they need more tables outside as inside is well, a matchbox.  Always a great place to grab a drink plus Silver Palm is next door and same owners so bonus.

Some places get 5 stars for being odd, unique, particular, interesting and bizarre.  Matchbox is all of these and then some.If you are claustrophobic, have a really large need for personal space, hate being close to strangers or cant stand smelling what someone had for lunch - don't go here.If you like the company of others - right in your face - and good martinis, margaritas, draft beer and cocktails then go here.The bar has to be the smallest in the whole city.  Smaller than Foley's on Irving and also Brendan's on Broadway.  It starts off at the entrance at its largest and just tapers to a smaller and smaller and smaller bar as the stools spread back to the end of the place.  If you are in need of a bathroom break you will most likely end up rubbing your junk on someones back or front - depending on what side they choose to face you with.Its one of the many places that makes Chicago awesome, so if you have never been there try it at least once.Go there - you will remember it forever.

Krystyna B. has raved about the gimlets at Matchbox for some time now.  So, as stop #3 on our mini-barcrawl, we stopped on in.And, yes, she wasn't lying when she said that this place was tiny!  AND narrow.  But...who cares...such a good time.How can I describe these gimlets?  Hmmm.  I'd say 'heavenly' for the most part.  Ginger-infused vodka, sugar on the rim of the glass and a mere $8.  I was intrigued when Krys said that they infuse their own vodka at the bar - ginger, pineapple, lemon?!  Amazing.Crowd is friendly, bartenders are fun and it's just an overall great time.  I recommend NOT wearing heels (or painful shoes) as you're almost guaranteed to be standing.  Unless, of course, you're lucky enugh to score one of the coveted bar stools.  One of my new favs!

Our favorite bar in Chicago by far. Whenever we want to go out and have a drink we always go to matchbox. Cozy place, Amazing staff with great taste in music and tasty drinks. They are very creative with the menu and the drinks they create are all great. Try Woodsman :) you can always order in some food from Silver palm next door too. Whenever we have visitors in town that's one of the places we take them too. It's one of the highlights of Chicago...
Small ugly bar in Chicago on Chicago. Why is it so loved. Can barely get to back to use the bathrooms the place is so narrow.

This bar has the best drinks in the neighborhood. They make a mean Pisco Sour and it's hard to order wrong when all the drinks are made this well. They have a large amount of seating outside and that is much more comfortable than drinking inside. It's the size of a matchbox so if you are drinking at the bar inside every 40 seconds someone will graze your back trying to make it down the narrow walk to the bathroom. That can be annoying. It gets less annoying the more you drink. The bartenders here are awesome. Inside this bar you really feel like you've left the city and are in your own little world.

I have loved this spot for years and I'm so glad that I returned!  I love the premise of the matchbox, as it truly is as small as a matchbox!  and that makes it a perfect spot to meet many new, fun friends!I was very happy with the beer list, the bartenders, and the patrons.  EVERYONE was FUN!  We had a lot of laughs at this spot.  Will return soon.

I really love this place and let me tell ya why.  A story, if you don't mind.My boss farts.  No really, she farts; in my cubicle sometimes, even. They smell.  I can hear them.  If you're reading this and you want a bright, autonomous, creative, writerly type to work for you let me know, because my boss is not only crazy, but she farts.  As you can imagine, this can sometimes be very distressing to me.  Sometimes it is so distressing that I have to stop my commute home half way through and drink martinis alone in probably the smallest bar in Chicago.This happened last Friday after a long week down wind.  I stopped for just 1 dirty martini, and you can imagine what happened.  The gorgeous bartenders at The Matchbox washed me clean of strife and pain, that's what!! I got a dirty martini that was perfectly mixed and chilled and had no problem sucking it down while standing pushed against the wall watching the window outside while it rained.  If I'd been smoking it would have been a fucking art movie it was so perfect.  Then I got a seat and made nice with some folks next to me and had the Pineapple Gimlet recommended.  I ordered it on a whim because their drinks are SO fucking cheap it's a crime not to have at least 2.  The nice man with the shaker and the vodka made a HUGE pour and set a pretty, frothy, icy pineapple drink, with a powdered sugar rim down in front of me."$8" he said, as he set ::THE SHAKER:: on a coaster next to my glass.I looked at him suspiciously, "Is that for me?""Yeah", he nodded.My eyes widened.  I proclaimed it "like a milkshake" (the extras on the side I meant), won the lottery, was voted best looking in the bar unanimously, and then the sun came out after 3 days of rain, a double rainbow formed, and leprechauns danced around me tossing gold doubloons my way.  Of course I gave the doubloons to the elderly and less fortunate, having already won the lottery mere seconds before.That all really happened to me last Friday at 6:30 PM in The Matchbox.  Oh yeah, and then my boss called and told me she'd never fart in my cubicle again because it's a disgusting and disrespectful thing to do to a gem of a person such as myself.All this, on top of getting 3 perfect, delicious martinis, for the price of 2.

It's an itsy bitsy teany weanie little bitty of a place hence the name Matchbox, but it serves AMAZING cocktails such as a ginger gimlet.  The bartenders are awesome and they give you the shaker for your drink with the leftovers.  So glad my friend moved close as it allows me to visit more often.

Let's start with first impression...It's extremely small.  Max. Capacity is 29 people - so it says on their wall.  But don't be turning it down because of that.  At first you might think nothing of it, but once you step inside it transforms.  Once you start talking to the people there and the bartenders (Jackie & Eric) you will start to see the charm of this place.  Definitely a local bar, everyone fits here.  Laid back environment with a friendly crowd.We liked it so much we had to go back before our trip was over.Drinks are amazing and strong.  By recommendation we tried the Margarita, the Cherry Brandy Manhattan, and the Vodka Gimlet.  Could not tell you which one is better, guess it depends on your alcohol preference but they were all good.  They also do your regular drinks like vodka tonics - don't worry for overpaying for the tonic, like I said before, drinks are strong, you really are paying for what you went there for, drinks!Oh, and going back to the fact that everyone fits there - we met the drummer of THE LAST VEGAS.  They opened for Motley Crue on tour earlier this year.Fun place to start your night right.

We stumbled (literally) into this place Friday night. Wow, what a great bar. Sure its about 3 feet wide, but that really lends itself to meeting new people, especially when they have to squeeze past you to get to the can."Excuse me, I really have to go""Hey, be my friend?""Sure, just let me get by so I can take a leak!""Call me"The service was great. The bartenders  friendly. The crowd was very eclectic. Their margaritas were rimmed with powder sugar. L didn't like it, but T couldn't get enough. Great late night ambiance. We loved it.

Honestly, I don't give my five stars lightly but, I have to say this place deserves it, if for no other reason than its attached to a gas station, is super reasonable and cute decor..  oh wait and the beef is AWESOME!  I love a good Italian beef, and this one hit the spot.  Sometimes my husband and I play yelp roulette, we take turns picking a place simply based on our location and number of $$$ we're looking to spend.  This one was his choice but I have to say it was one of his best.   The beef was simple, super flavorful and dipped just the right amount.  Fries are crinkle cut, not typically my fave but these stayed crunchy all the way until we got home, 15 min ride.   Also, the cheese sauce with fries is a must, yes it's just a cheese sauce like any other but for some reason it was great with these extra crispy fries.  We got the 9inch beef and split it and it was a perfect amount for us and split a large fry.  The best part of all was our dinner was $12.55, we will be back and likely sooner than later!!

Popped in here for a late lunch one afternoon with great Chicago May weather. Apparently the place is relatively new as well. Really nice guys who work there, and it's almost like a hole-in-the-wall type of place.Simply had a hotdog and fries, but it was pretty tasty to be honest.If I'm ever in the neighborhood again, I'd totally stop in here again.

I ate here yesterday !  Beef combination !! Was Fye now I'm back again maybe try something different or if it a broke why fix the beef was good wasn't the best I ever had but it was good !! Also very very clean place from the bathroom to the eating area

I found this place when I was hungry and not sure of what I wanted to eat. In times like these I usually go to yelp for some close by ideas.  And this place popped up, and I'm glad I found it. I always enjoy a good beef sandwich, and man oh man was this one tasty. From the first bite I was blown away by the delicious flavor of the beef. They season their beef perfectly,  not too overpowering nor too bland. The juice was definitely a perfect compliment to the flavorful beef. The meat was tender, yum. The giardinera was ok, the pieces lacked the crunch that goes along with the flavor, in my opinion. The fries were crinkle cut, not my favorite cut of fry, but they were delicious, especially with a cup of cheese  for dipping.  I am glad I found this place, it will definitely be added to my list of go to places for delicious Italian beef sandwiches.

Super friendly manager ! Beef was good but Au Jus didn't have much flavor ! I'll go back for a hot dog , but will stay with Portillo's for the beef sandwiches ! Crinkle cut fries are also a nice touch !

I stopped in here for a quick bite to eat and I was so impressed with how incredible everything tasted. I had a Chicago style hotdog and cheese fries that were so delicious I honestly would prefer it to portillos! And at half the price :) yummy!

If you like portillos hot dogs you'll absolutely LOVE this place! Delicious food, great prices, and great customer service. It's clearly family owned and it's very clear by the quality of food and customer service they give their customers. I'll be back soon! 5 stars!
had the beef dipped with fries! it was really good...i hope they do well given their location..attached to the gas station..workers were also really friendly..will definately go back!
So excited that this place finally opened. Beef was exceptional, loved the crinkle cut fries. Senior beef is absolutely massive. Only get it if your very hungry. Can't wait to come back!

Yes Yes yes yes I've been waiting for a new burger restaurant to open up. All in one building.  Carwash, gas station,  dunkin donuts and now restaurant. Italian beef, burgers,  gyros.  I'm getting hungry now.
Just tried their breaded chicken sandwich - topped with lettuce, tomato and raw onion.  Outstanding - high quality sandwich.  Definitely on my 'repeat list'!

Came in a half hour before close and needed a beef before going south on Western. Got a beef with hot and it was very good. Tender beef and even better gravy. The giardinera was ok and the fries were ok. But that beef was definitely good. A must stop if your cruising down western and looking for a quality sandwich. It helps that the staff are good people and very friendly. For trying a spot for the first time at almost close, I did not feel rushed and the products were fresh.

This was a accidental stop. I was driving for LYFT and needed gas and thought why not. And glad I did. I like recognizing the small things like all the employey's giving a "Hello good afternoon". And then the restroom being spotless as was the rest of the restaurant. I went for just the beef, fries and pop combo. Kinda pricey but it was worth it. The problem Al's Beef (which SUCKs) and other Beef place's in Chicago have is they keep the Beef soaking in the crock pot all day which dries the beef out(FACT). And they don't here. And they weren't shy with the amount of beef in the sandwich either. Also quick so I have no complaints. If you live in the neighborhood I'm jealous. And it's not a hole in the wall or it would be dirty stingy and have good beef.
Solid beef sandwiches and fries! Nice portions and great flavor.  Everything was really fresh and tasty. Prices are very reasonable and there is ample parking in the lot.
Best grilled chicken sandwich ever! Wasn't expecting that for a random drop in but, definitely worth going back.

Cozy space, friendly service, great selection of baked goods, food options, and standard coffee beverages!I can totally see myself enjoying my latte, some sort of bakery item or sandwich and just getting a lot of work done. They have free wifi so that's always a plus! Plenty of seating for solo work or group work too.Ordered a latte, cappuccino, Pesto sandwich, tomato quiche, and a glazed apple cider donut. Both of the beverages were good and did their jobs, which was to give us both a nice caffeine kick to start our morning. The Pesto Sandwich was very good! The mozzarella slices were generous as well as the smear of pesto sauce and the salami slices added such a nice bite to the ciabatta panini style sandwich. The Tomato quiche came with a side salad of Arugula and some zesty vinaigrette which was nice. The quiche was flavorful and filling. The apple cider donut was very yummy! It was not overly sweet, but was fluffy and fresh!I bought some other Italian cookies to take home, it was hard to choose given the vast selection but definitely check this place out!

Cheerful, cozy (and by the looks of it) family run bakery in the Little Italy neighborhood. I stopped by here to pick up donuts for Donut Friday at work. I asked for two dozen but when I opened up the box at work there were only 22. I called up the bakery and they said that they would be happy to give me the two remaining donuts the next time I stopped by. It wasn't really a problem for me but if you're getting donuts by the dozen, please count them!The cake topped chocolate donut was amazingly gooey and rich without being overwhelmingly sweet, and the cinnamon donut was crisp and paired really well with the free coffee I got along with my purchase.Surprisingly, Scafuri is where I had one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had in a while. The egg and pepper sandwich had perfectly scrambled eggs and well seasoned peppers that didn't lose their crunch, in a sourdough muffin that held up well and didn't get soggy.The place tends to fill up fast during the morning rush, so get there fast if you want donuts or cookies. Worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood!

Came here early saturday afternoon for some apple cider donuts and coffee but they had already sold out of the prior! I got the in house cappucino, a lemon twist cookie and a fig cookie while my brother got the chocolate chip.  The chocolate chip was big and thick but not as chewey as we wouldve liked but thankfully not too sweet.  The lemon twist was really delicious which a light tart glaze and a cakey cookie.  The fig cookie was also really tasty and was the same cakey type of cookie filled with a mildly sweet fig filling and chopped nuts.  The cappucino was also a prettg good size for the price (around $2.60) and the coffee was not too bitter.  Im just deducting one star for price and low volume of high demand treats (almost ran out of apple cider donuts when i came in the early afternoon of a weekday last year too).  Otherwise, cute place to spend a saturday!

We used Scafuri Bakery for our September 2016 wedding cake and we were not disappointed. The free tasting was delicious and we got to try any combination you could think of before deciding what to order. We went with a vanilla cake with raspberry jam filling and a carrot cake with cream cheese filling and both were amazing. We even get a complimentary 1-year anniversary cake so that we don't need to eat something that was frozen for a year. We definitely recommend Scafuri Bakery for your upcoming wedding!

I've been here a few times, the most recent time to try their paczkis which were all gone by the time I got there [sad face].  If you want some of their more popular baked goods (donuts and such) it seems you have to go in the morning.I was able to get a few cookies on my most recent trip here, which were pretty good, but not the best Italian cookies I've had, not sure they're worth the price.  Their soft baked goods like the donuts are better.  I was able to try the paczkis that a classmate had gotten earlier in the day and those were delicious.The place itself is small, I've seen people studying or meeting here, but there's only a handful of tables, so no guarantees you'll definitely find a place to sit and study.  But the place is cute, and the staff is friendly.  Free wifi (code is at the checkout)!  I'd stop by if I was in the neighborhood, but not a place I'm really going out of my way for.

I tried the Lemon Ricotta with raspberry and cannoli cream after seeing it on Chicagos Best TV. I really loved it and had been hyping it up to my friends and family. I ordered a 6 inch version of the cake this past weekend to bring to a small family gathering and sadly to say it did NOT impress and it was pretttty bad.The cake itself was extremely dry and hard even after leaving it out to come to room temp. The only response I got from the 7 people that ate it was "whipped cream is really good" but, who can't make good whipped cream?? I was so disappointed in the texture, unevenness of filling causing cake to buckle when cut and the overall taste of the cake it definitely was not consistent with what I had tried a couple of months ago. I'm really sorry to write this review but at $40 for a 6inch Cake It should've blown me a way.

After seeing Scafuri featured on an episode of Chicago Best and beginning Italian I thought I would put their baking reputation to the test! And YES they passed with flying Italian colors! Old school Italian Bakery with a case full of all your favorite cookies, loafs and breads. Picked up a loaf of Italian White Bread,Fig, Pignoli and Chocolate Spice Cookies. The bread was still warm fresh out of the oven and the fig cookies are by far the best I have ever had. And you can never go wrong with a moist on the inside and little crunch on the outside Pignoli cookie. Will definitely keep them on my list for the holidays. Free parking on Sunday's right in front of the shop and had to take advantage of the free cup of Lavazza coffee with a Yelp check in
Not bad, An old fashioned Italian bakery on Taylor St has some good lemon pound cake, And some good Italian cookies as well....

O.M.Goodness!!!! I don't know what else to say....I usually order King Cake from Randazzo's in New Orleans when I'm not there, but for some reason Fat Tuesday snuck up on me this year!!! So I turned to my good friends here on Yelp to find a local place so I could take  a King Cake to take to work to celebrate Fat Tuesday. Was NOT disappointed! This was equivalent to Randazzo's! It may have been better since it is local.This King Cake was AWESOME! Moist not too sweet just enough cinnamon... Plus they let you place your order online so you won't have to wait. I got t there and my box was waiting for me and the young lady that rang up my order was soo pleasant!I can't wait to try their other baked goods!The only thing is I wish they had bags with handles big enough for the box that the king cake comes in. Would make life a lot easier for us commuters.
I had the toast of the day, ricotta with almonds, strawberries, and honey, which was delicious! I'll definitely come here again.

Popped into Scafuri during the Little Italy street festival to check out their entire selection, beyond what they were selling at their booth outside. This is a really cute little Italian bakery on Taylor street that looks like it's been passed down a generation or two. My gf and I ended up getting a couple chocolate chip cookies (very soft and delicious) and a couple cannolis dipped in chocolate chips as well. The cannolis were spot on and was the perfect treat to wash down the huge italian sub I had just 15 minutes prior. Everything tasted really fresh!Great place in Little Italy to kick back, relax and have a cappuccino and a sweet treat!
Yummmmmm!!! $5 min for debt/credit! I spent $38 bought 4 donuts, an apple turnover, a loaf of bread, cookies and a loaf of zucchini bread! Stop in and check it out!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I was looking for a cake for a party and came across Scarfuri and was sold when I saw that they had Nutella Ganache (sounds so good!). I got a chocolate cake with Nutella Ganache, assorted pastries and a pan of pizza. It was a moist three layer cake, but I was disappointed that the ganache didn't taste like Nutella at all. They had a good selection of cookies and pastries. The pizza is more Sicilian style with the thick crust and a tad on the dry side.The staff that I dealt with on the phone and when I picked up my order were friendly.Taylor street can be pretty busy, so parking is hit or miss. We found a spot a few buildings down on the Saturday morning that we went.What I had didn't feel like five stars, but good enough that if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop by for a snack and latte.

Scafuri was not very crowded on a Friday morning at 8:30.  The young lady who waited on me was extremely polite.  I had a pistachio donut and got a bunch of the almond and hazelnut biscotti for later.  I used my Yelp online coupon for a coffee.  I'm happy to report that the donut was fantastic, and especially the almond biscotti were just about perfect.

Stopped by here for some take out pastries after breakfast at Sweet Maple.  I got a pumpkin almond bar and a lemon ricotta cake.  Heated them up for a snack and they were some of the best baked goods I have ever had.  I will be back!

So I'm feeling what Scafuri is putting out there.  It's an adorable bakery right on Taylor Street in the heart of Little Italy.Gimmie all the lemon knots.Gimmie all the lemon ricotta cake. (No, I'm not joking.  This is a very real thing.)Gimme all the chocolate spice cookies.Hell, even gimmie all the pizza.  What?  At a bakery? You're lying, Angie M.  Nope.  I'm not lying.  Giardiniera pizza is also a very real thing.One thing you don't have to gimmie again is the cardamon scone.  It was completely overdone.  Hard to tell when just looking at it in the case, too, because it's got a chocolate brown tint, but trust me... no go.Treats are a little pricey, too.I'm OK with it.

Super cute italian bakery on Taylor Street in lil italy. The workers are super friendly and fun to talk to; ask for recommendations and you won't go wrong. I love anything lemon flavored so their $3.20 strawberry-blueberry lemon bar was perfect for me. If you check in on yelp right now they give you a free small coffee! Also, they were giving out samples of their delicious lemon butter cookies. Everything I ended up trying was so colorful & cute. They had these $1.50 pizza breads that looked good for a lunch visit.Also, I've tried their lemon riccotta pound cake at the Italian food festival last summer. It's very dense & sweet; so be warned it's quite the decedent dessert. But again, I love everything lemon flavored.
Reasonable, affordable, authentic italian bakery. Loved the dairy and gluten free pignoli and mocha almond milk coffee. Very nice and pleasant staff was also a plus.
Best cannoli I've had since Modern Bakery in Boston's North End.Super traditional and filled fresh.  Love to take these home with me if I'm in the area.
Four words: lemon ricotta pound cake.Four more words: get in mah belly!

Came here with a friend for a quick dessert one day before class at UIC.I had the blueberry scone and she had the apple cider donuts. The apple cider donuts sell out quick so if they have them don't pass them up!Both were very delicious and although the staff member helping us seemed a little impatient, i would definitely recommend the baked goods here to anyone passing through.
I just had my first ever apple cider donut from here. A bit pricy. I think it was 2.25 for a small glazed donut? But it hit the spot.
VERY good place to get a quick breakfast! The eggs were a little overlooked but for the price it is going to be hard to beat! Stay tuned as I try out Chicago's finest morning eats!

Today, I received an email for 40% off any pie order for Thanksgiving this year due to their poor pie crust last year.I am blown away by their customer service - and just placed my order for another pumpkin pie and cranberry apple pie for this Thanksgiving!
I love their pastries. Everything is super fresh and delicious. Love the latte horchata! The staff is always awesome.
Ordered their daily toast...and you should too! It is Ahhhmazing! +If you check in you get a free cup of freshly brewed strong/hot coffee. Definitely the perfect way to start your morning!!!

I never leave without feeling regret for my future credit card payment but it is fantastic food.  They sell out reasonably early in the day but their "alternatives" are always great too.  They often become my primary reason for going.   Also, usually friendly service.
cute little casual bakery for a quick bite. Ordered lunch food and it was ok

This is an awesome Italian bakery! I was buying a box of cookies as a gift, and I basically got one of each cookie they had plus a couple cannolis. I also got a pignoli cookie for myself. It's an almond cookie with pine nuts that was so delicious. My friends also loved all of the cookies and cannolis. What made this place so great is, though, is that the staff member who helped me was so friendly and knew everything about the cookies and how they were made, and she even let me taste one for free when I was ordering.FYI: if you check in here on Yelp, you get a free coffee or tea with purchase!

Scafuri Bakery provided some sweets for our wedding and they did not disappoint! From jump Kelly was really sweet to work with, super helpful at customizing options (our vision was a table full of random sweets we love), all while working with our small budget (and not making us feel bad about it!) Their sweets are delicious (some of the best donuts I've ever had) and we look forward to having them again soon. If you're looking for delicious alternatives to serve for dessert at your wedding, don't hesitate to give them a ring. They also do wedding cakes, which I can only imagine are delicious as well.

I just recently moved to Chicago and was looking for a bakery for my husband's surprise birthday party. I wanted a 'MAD MEN' themed party so after contacting a couple of bakeries, I picked Scafuri and I am so glad I did.Kelly contacted me right away and we patiently went over my order via email (which was a big help for me). I sent her a picture of the cake I wanted and she was happy /excited to help me with it. Scafuri also helped me with my party favors, which were 4 different kinds of specialized cookies and all I had to do is tell them my ideas. They were PERFECT! The prices were very reasonable and my guests totally loved the cake and cookies.I would recommend this bakery to anyone who wants to stick to a budget and yet have a classy birthday party with absolutely delicious goodies.P.S the staff at the bakery who helped me were super sweet. I loved my whole experience with Scafuri. Thank you guys for making my party successful.Falak.

Scafuri Bakery met all of our requirements... cheap, well-rated, and the perfect location on our drive from Cleveland to Des Moines.My boyfriend and I met up with two friends and we each ordered from the sandwich menu. I started with the sopressata sandwich but after being surprised by the jalapenos I swapped halves with my boyfriend to enjoy the porchetta, which was much more to my liking.There was a little too much bread for each sandwich, and the flour made it quite messy, but the taste won me over.We enjoyed a lemon baby cake and classic donut on our drive to Des Moines, both of which were rich, moist, and sugary.

If you have a sweet tooth, this place is for you. My Wife and I decided to check this place out while attending the Taste of Italy street fair. I'm glad we did. I'll start the description with the decor. The interior is cozy and welcoming. There is a nice seating are where you can sit back and relax.I'm not a huge fan of sweets, but the variety of sweets at Scafuri could change that in a hurry. The Canoli I split with my Wife was delicious. And the Coffee was as good as anything Starbucks has to offer. If I hadn't of eaten so much at the street fair I would have sampled more, but to be honest I was stuffed. I next time I hit up Scafuri, it will be with an empty stomach.

Amazing! Stopped in here for the first time today and felt like I was walking into my grandpa's house (in the sense that he's 100% Italian, traditional, etc). pastries are amazing. Fresh, soft, delicious. Bought a box of pastries to bring to my moms but they didn't make it that far...! Would also be a great place to sit with a cup of coffee and get some work done, but they close at 4.
Nice neighborhood bakery. Had a great coffee and blueberry scone. The bagels also looked delicious. Nice and friendly staff

The short version: family came in 1901, opened up bakery in 1904, it became one of the staples on Little Italy and the family survived the Great Depression, still giving to the community that needed help.In 2007, his daughter (Annette) who held open the business at the age of 90, decided it was time to say good bye to the Bakery.Oh but wait, great grand niece begins construction to open up tradition again in 2010 and, by 2013 (May) once again little Italy has regained it's long lost staple once again!What a pleasant shop, and the donuts, can I say it louder? THE DONUTS! Seriously well worth the few miles walk at lunchtime. I ended up getting a Sopressata Sandwich (an Italian dry salami) provolone, hot giardinera and arugula in this wonderful home made biscuit type of bread. I mean although eating could be tricky, I managed to taste it and savored every last bite!If this is what going back in time is then I need a time machine. Incredible! And the fact that I sat in a vintage living room couch and table, it added to the experience. Including not to mention their 1940's music playing ever so softly as you have conversation with a friend. Oh I know Luigi would be smiling at this, and if you look around the bakery you will notice Luigi and the rest of the family staring back as the family is in vintage photos all over. This in fact takes you to the time that little Italy was in it's  beginning stages. It felt personal and you were part of the era.Use your YELP check in to get great percentages off items! Located next door to Sweet Maple! Can't miss it. And they open at 6 AM!

Scafuri has absolutely amazing donuts! I came in one morning after I had gone to Sweet Maple for Breakfast. I got two apple cider donuts. One glazed and one with cinnamon sugar. They were both absolutely delicious! I also got a pumpkin spice latte which I really was not a fan of at all but Scafuri is a bakery first and foremost, not a coffee shop.I would have definitely given this place 5 stars even for the poor latte but the service here really wasn't very good at all. I asked the lady at the counter about the lattes and she seemed very disinterested and even a bit offended that I was asking for her opinion... She didn't make me feel welcome at all, the opposite in fact.Overall:5 stars for the delicious baked goods!2 stars for the abysmal service and bad latteRounded up half a star since the donuts were so tasty!

So far I've had the pepperoni pizza, eclair, and Horchata latte. All three were excellent. The inside of the eclair was soft and perfectly done. I've never had a better doughnut. I cannot recommend this place enough

We were thrilled with the 3 cakes Scafuri made for my daughter's wedding. Not only were they gorgeous to look at, but absolutely delicious! (They offer a wonderful array of flavor choices. ) Amanda and Kelly were a delight to work with. Thanks for the memories, Scafuri Bakery!!

Wow - now that's service!  Thanks for offering house-made chips.  They are a perfect accompaniment to the delicious sandwiches!Oh, and I think I need to join Lemon Ricotta Pound Cake Anonymous - I am addicted to this pound cake!!!!  :)

We order a cannoli filling cake for birthdays and anniversaries. Super easy over email. Always phenomenal. We also had them do the wedding cake for my sister in law last year. Great prices, great cake! It was the least stressful part of the entire wedding.I'm also a huge fan of the pignoli cookies and buy a 1/4lb whenever I'm in the neighborhood. They also do homemade pizza dough by the pound, whole wheat or white and whatever you decide to put on top of it will become amazing. Great job rebooting this place ladies, you should be very proud.

Am a professional chef and have some skill in cake baking and decorating.  Wanted to make my 60th birthday party a little easier and ordered the vanilla cake with lemon curd filling and whipped cream frosting.  The crumb texture of the cake was excellent in an authentic way (not the super fine texture of grocery store cakes where the flour is denatured beyond recognition), and the flavor was superb.  Price was absolutely fair for a cake of this quality.  Highly recommended.

The cake and cookies that we ordered for our wedding from Scafuri Bakery were beautiful and absolutely delicious. We were able to use some very unique flavor pairings in our cake tiers, including balsamic caramel and salted caramel with fresh fruits. We also had bags filled with lemon knot, pignoli, and butter cookies sandwiched with chocolate. Yum, yum, yum. The Italian buttercream frosting is delicious as it is not sickeningly sweet. I usually hate buttercream frostings but was so happy when we fell in love with the work of this bakery. Long live Scafuri, a wonderful part of our neighborhood.

When the old Scafuri closed, and the reborn Scafuri reopened thanks to the family's appreciation for what their immigrant grandparents created, we were so pleased to see how they remodeled and brought it into the next new century.Beside their great selection from the counter of your not-so-typical Italian cookies and pastries, they make great special occasion cakes.  Trying to make a selection isn't easy because they all sound so good, but we REALLY enjoyed the lemon-vanilla cake with raspberry jam filling. The cake itself is a medium density, and the jam's natural "liquor" soaks into the cake - creating Mmmmms from everyone eating it.  That's the ultimate compliment!  Another tasty one is the chocolate cake with cannoli filling.  I think what we appreciate is that the cakes and frostings are not overly sweet.  You can really taste all of the ingredients when your not overwhelmed with sugar!  Enjoy something different for your next party.

I decided to try Scafuri's after seeing this bakery for some time now. Very cozy with antiquish photos on the wall cool music playing in the background. They have a small selection of pastry items for sale( the waitress said they sold out early) but what was there looked good. The olive oil zucchini cake and lemon ricotta cake caught my eye. After much back n forth I chose the lemon cake. They even sell them in a regular loaf size and the baby cake size.The lemon cake was very dense, had a nice chew with flecks of vanilla beans sprinkled throughout the cake. The lemon icing was very good also. When you check in on FB, you get 3 free Italian cookies too.I will return for coffee and the zuchini cake soon.
Good morningSomething good about Chicago !! They have lots of bakery stores everywhere and the bread is fresh and delicious!!

We worked with them for our wedding and they were a dream! Kelly & Amanda were super responsive and had such great creative ideas to help us work within our budget. Our guests could not stop raving about the cake, which was not only incredibly delicious but beautiful works of art! I can't wait to find another reason to work with them and visit the bakery :)

Wonderful bakery with a variety of sweet treats. You can't go wrong with anything you get here.Right now they're having a free coffee or tea when you check in on yelp. Perfect compliment to any of their pastries!

The family feel to this place is the best. As seen in reviews and suggested by the owner, the pound cake is simply one of the best I have ever had. Plus the free coffee on a yelp checkin is a good incentive.

Their Nutella Lattes are amazing, it is not overly sweet and perfectly made!However, the one thing I can't get over was ordering a pizza once, and it being just incredibly salty, so much so that I couldn't eat it anymore.

I stopped in here on Saturday morning to pick out a hostess gift for an evening at a friend's house, and picked up a 1 lb. box of mixed Italian cookies. My generous hostess shared with us as I was hoping she might,  and the cookies were all fresh and flavorful. My favorites included the lemon knots, the chocolate spice cookies, and the walnut cookies with the powdered sugar. My friend was in love with the chocolate toffee bars. The 1 lb. box of cookies was $15.95, and I also purchased a frozen pizza dough for $1.50 to use later at home. I've also had a delicious fresh-filled cannoli from Scafuri's during the Italian Festival on Taylor St. in summer 2014; the filling is the right amount of sweet and a great  creamy consistency. Free coffee with a Yelp check-in too!

I ordered Thanksgiving pecan pie and an Italian cookie tray using the order form found on their website. Confirmation of the order was received the following day via email, but did not include the total estimated cost of both items, only the pie. I called and received a complete estimate over the phone the next day during working hours. This morning we picked up our order.The pecan pie was very good. The filling was lighter than most and not as sweet as most. The crust was a bit tougher than I prefer but still good.The assortment of Italian cookies was tasty and truly provided a variety of flavors. They were good.We also stayed a bit to leisurely enjoy a cup of Intelligentsia coffee enhanced with a shot of espresso. The coffee was very good!We shared 3 scones while drinking our coffee. The cranberry orange was my favorite. The blueberry was very good. The chocolate chip was the least interesting. All three had excellent texture and were very light! I liked them all and recommend them.Staff were very friendly, and had everything ready for us before 8 am the day before Thanksgiving.The decor is invitingly casual with a large glass display case.We will return.
A gem of a bakery. Amazing lemon ricotta cake and picolli (sp?). Grab a coffee and grab a seat to enjoy. I'm so excited to try the almond croissant that I also just bought.
