Excellent baked goods and coffee. There's a small seating inside if you wanted to grab something to eat and drink with a friend or while doing some work.

I have a large Italian family, so for my wedding this past weekend, I decided to have assorted Italian cookies from Scafuri as my wedding favors. We worked with Kelly, who was incredibly helpful and responsive at every turn. We scheduled a cake and cookie tasting last year and, though we ultimately decided to go with another bakery for the cake, the cookies were delicious and planning was so easy. We ordered 17 POUNDS of cookies in 6 different flavors for pickup the day before the wedding. We bought little favor bags and Kelly was great at making sure to make the biscotti extra short so that they fit. She was crystal clear on pricing and, though we ended up bagging the cookies ourselves, Scafuri offered everything from bagging to delivery for a very reasonable cost!The day of pickup, I had my fiance call first thing in the morning to make sure the cookies were ready. The gentleman that he spoke with was very confused but eventually figured out our order and confirmed it was ready. Then, when my fiance arrived, a different(?) gentleman tried to ring him up for the cookies, though they were already paid for. Luckily, someone in the know stepped in and assured my fiance that he was good to go. The cookies were delicious and fresh! Our guests loved the edible favors and the variety offered was great! Working with Scafuri was so easy, and despite the little miscommunication with the staff on pickup, we had a totally smooth experience.
No seasoning on food, service was horrible, silverware was disgusting. Bad experience over all.

We drove an hour to have cake and coffee at Scafuri.  After driving around for 1/2 hour for parking, we finally arrived and found they had no cake and no milk to have coffee.Very disappointing!  I would call ahead to this bakery and make sure they have what you are coming there for.

They are making our cookies and cake for our wedding and they are always extremely friendly. They gave us a complimentary rating and everything was phenomenal. I highly recommend stopping in just to have some cookies and espresso.

Adorable cafe with wifi, couches, drinks, and great baked goods. The peppermint chocolate doughnut I got was phenomenal, as were several of the traditional Italian cookies I picked up. If you had a childhood bakery with chocolate dipped butter cookies that crumbled into deliciousness, check this place out. They also offer an interesting pizza selection by the slice, which hopefully I'll get to try sometime!

Best cappuccino I've had since Rome, and the lemon ricotta cake is delicious, as are the pignoli! That's all I've tried so far, but everything looks great. The inside is comfortable and quiet - it would be a great place to get work done (especially since the nearby Starbucks is always packed). The prices aren't unreasonable, especially given the quality. I'll definitely be back!

Great cookies, the pine nut cookies are the best! But they have bad coffee lol. The coffee tasted watered down and it was lukewarm, thank God I got it for free with the check in. Prices were great honesty, coming from southern CA where everything is excessively overpriced. The quiche was good not amazing, I make a really good quiche so I'm a harsh critic. The ricotta on my toast was yummy. I would come here again and try the cakes.
Stopped in when Scafuri was supporting Easter Seals Therapeutic Autism School (THANK YOU, Scafuri!!!) and grabbed a lemon knot. To die for.

i wrote to Scafuri about the problem, Kelly went above and beyond to address the problem! I personally do not enjoy the sauce getting brown around the crust. My brother however loves this I find it to be bitter. She told me she let the staff know about my issues, and offered to personally make sure my next pizza is done right. I will take her up on this. Thank you Kelly for the great customer service. I shall return!

Went here while we waited to be seated at sweet maple café because it was pouring.  We only got a lemon bar but it was quite good.  Everything else looked really good and the staff was extremely nice and friendly.  I'll be back to try other stuff in the near future for sure.

Bakery staff is very friendly and accommodating.  They offer samples if you are unsure of something. I got the ricotta lemon cake which was super delightful with my free coffee when you check in as a first guest.  No disappointments over here. I got the green tea coconut cupcake to go for a later treat. I  am so impressed with the matcha flavor they infused into that cupcake. It had this passion fruit tart center which was really unique. I regret not ordering more to share with my family. I highly recommend coming to this cute little bake shop.

I am really confused by all the great reviews. The people working there are not personable at all. There were multiple uncomfortable interactions with customers while I was there. They don't play any music which makes it even more awkward when you're sipping your coffee just witnessing the terse interactions between employees. One woman asked them if they had a mold problem because of the smell of the place. Apparently they have a grease overflow issue in the basement right now. The smell made me nauseous. I ordered a chai (disappointing, but I've yet to find good chai in Chicago), a breakfast sandwich (low quality bacon, eggs, cheddar..just a mess), and a dense little pastry (was okay, but quite heavy). It came out to $17. I did ask for a small chai and he repeated it back correctly, then told the woman working that I wanted a large one. I reiterated that I wanted a small one, but he ignored me. I think maybe if you got pastries to go it *might* be a viable option, but I didn't find anything worthwhile about this place.
Might just be the best espresso in the city. Hidden gem in the Little Italy neighborhood.

I was visiting Chicago from out of state and attended the italian fest on Taylor street. I bought the cookies they had which included multiple types and it was love at first sight. They were so soft and moist and delicious all at the same time. If only I lived in Chicago. I might definitely dream about these cookies

I made a trip to this place just a few weeks after their opening and was very pleased with all of my tasty treats.  I went in with the idea of purchasing about $5 worth of their baked best, but instead I came out with a box full of wondrous baked goods that pleased me for days.  I went in for a simple scone...The prices were more than fair, the atmosphere was great, the service / girls behind the counter were overly chipper and helpful.  Perfect experience....ohh, and I came out with.  2 cinnamon twists, a doughnut, 2 scones, some lemon knots (which were freaking awesome), and a turnover.  It all looked too good to pass up, I was correct.  I will be back, you should go taste it for yourself.

Had a great experience on a Sunday morning at Scafuri Bakery. I heard about a Jazz Brunch that they do on occasion. While I think the term brunch is misleading in the way that Chicagoans typically think, it was really pleasant.The food was great, and that's most important. Ordered the special, the "Daily Toast" which was essentially an opened faced sandwich thought up with some creative thinking. Also had a giant slice of their pizza, and a large cup of coffee. All of it top notch.Service was great...even though it was busy, the staff was buzzing around trying to take care of everything.Finally, the mood was great. Something about being on Taylor street listening to the kind of jazz that put Chicago on the map. Music was provided by the 12th Street Ramblers, who had a big band feel even though they were tucked into a corner.The only issue we ran into was seating, in that there wasn't much...but you can't fault a place for being popular.Highly recommend it if you are in the area, or if you aren't in the area but are looking for something different to do on a Sunday.

Scafuri Bakery? More like Scafuri Bae-kery. This place is amazing. Haven't met a staff member who isn't all smiles, all the time. Coffee is always consistent and they are happy to go out of their way to make my order. The sandwiches are all amazing (it's the bread, really). The donuts are flame. Try the knots. James is such a prince. Jimmy, the kitchen manager, is always happy to come out and say hello. Mileena (hope I spelled that right) is also such a peach. This place rocks my socks, dude. Do it.
I've been coming here since I been a kid and every time it's consistent. Great location!  I love Scafuri!!!

I enjoy coming here on Sunday afternoons after church.  Let me start by saying their donuts, cookies and other baked items are very good.  They are top notch.  I tried coffee this past Saturday, my date made it for me so I can't really comment on it.  I might have fixed it differently. It was his first time making me coffee, he's learning.  I do like their tea and add in choices. I really like the fact that if you have your beverages and treats in the establishment, they give you reusable dinnerware.Other things I haven't tried are the lunch specials and specialty orders.  They serve pizza, sandwiches, quiches and soup.  They make cakes and other baked items for special occasions.

This was a great little find on a Saturday adventure with friends.  We were in the mood for cannolis and WOW did this place hit the spot!!!  We also ordered the red velvet donut and the spiced chocolate cookie.  We all ordered an espresso as well; very well made!The staff was super friendly and attentive (in a non-annoying way).  The atmosphere of the bakery was laid back and informal.  I liked the clustering of seating and the option to make new friends at the nearby tables.Next time I visit, I plan on checking out the board games and maybe exploring their lunch options.

The daily toasts were delicious. We tried both the strawberry and Nutella toast and the ricotta, honey, and walnut toast. Both were excellent although, I wished there was slightly more honey to balance the ricotta flavor. We tried the sfogliatelle and it was similar to Artopolis' galaktoboureko but less sweet and palatable. The peanut butter latte had a very nice flavor to it. I would definitely come here again!

I ordered a cake for my sons baptism. Although I did a taste test way in advance, when the cake was delivered it exceeded my expectations. The cake was so good. I ordered salted caramel with vanilla cake and all of my guests loved it!  I wish I could've eaten the whole thing myself!

Free coffee with purchase. Perhaps a limited time only promotion to entice uninitiated Yelp users to visit? Well it is limited, to drip coffee. And personally I am not enticed by a cafe who's sales pitch is free drip coffee. I imagine most Yelp users are searching for quality and an experience beyond drip coffee also...

Given the other incredible reviews here, I'm guessing that donuts just aren't the thing at Scafuri; in preparations for Donutfest in three weeks, I stopped by to try Scafuri's glazed donut and their old-fashioned cake donut, and thought both were very ordinary.  Slight edge to the glazed if you are in and picking something to go with.  Our server was happy to be working the morning I stopped by and the prices are certainly fair given the price of my other donut haunts.  But even if I lived close to this place, I wouldn't make this my regular donut shop.  But glad to see other Yelpers like the pastry here; I'll come back another time to try all of the other good-looking items in this shop!

This morning was my first time at Scafuri's Bakery; I loved it so much I just HAD to let everyone on Yelp know about my experience.The bakery is fairly small, however it does have that cozy Italian ambiance to it. My friend and I were greeted at the door. I knew for sure I wanted a coffee (they brew Intelligentsia, my favorite!) as well as something sweet. EVERYTHING looked so good, but I ended up getting a biscotti which had almond and hazelnut. At the register they had samples of cookies so I tried one of each. The pignoli was AMAZING! I didn't want to finish it, it was that good. They serve the coffee in cute coffee cups and refills are FREE! My coffee was perfect temperature and my biscotti was absolutely perfect with it. We ended up buying more cookies to take back with us. Service was great, everything tasted amazing, and I will DEFINITELY be back.

Love this place! I'm over the fancy cupcakes and doughnut shops popping up everywhere.  This place is a neighborhood classic. They have the best almond croissants in town and the lemon ricotta mini cakes are heaven.  Both seriously deserve 5 stars. Staff is friendly, and the vintage mid-century decor makes me feel like I'm at home.

Awesome addition to the neighborhood. I'm upset I didn't make it over here sooner. Bread is fantastic. Unbelievably delicious and fresh. Didn't try the bakery (yet) but it looked yummy. I will be back soon and often!!!

Just went here today, I was passing by and had a sweet tooth and a craving for something new. I went in and was slightly overwhelmed, they have coffee, sandwiches, soups, sweets, and a lot more. I was debating between the ricotta pound cake and a pumpkin bar. The worker was extremely kind and helpful and showed excellent customer service.She helped me decide on the pumpkin bar (seasonal item. Ricotta pound cake is year round!) and it was absolutely delicious. You can tell it wasn't just pumpkin flavouring, but there was legit pumpkin in there. It was a hefty size too. I'm already deciding what to get next time.Definitely worth giving a try!

Coffee + sfogliatelle  = you're welcome.Yelp led me here during my final three hours in Chicago. Great find. Cute place, family-owned since 1904, and friendly staff. At first, I ordered a coffee, an almond blueberry cake slice, and a small fig-stuffed cookie. The Intelligentsia Coffee is well-suited for drinking black, my preference. Fun fact: Intelligentsia Coffee originated in San Francisco although they are located in LA, Chicago and NYC now.The cake and cookie were good but not special so my eyes were drawn to the sfogliatelle on the menu. I had decided against it earlier because it looks like a flaky croissant; I've never met a croissant that I loved. When I asked the counter person what it was, she described it as a flaky pastry with a lemon custard filling. The description did not appeal to me either since it sounded like a custard-filled doughnut. I purchased it anyway because my next 7 hours would be in an airport/airplane with only greasy fast food and overpriced nuts for food. Best decision ever. Yes, the outside is flaky but the inside is a dense, moist, orange-zest speckled cake. My internet research shows it's probably a filling of sweetened ricotta and cooked semolina. What is definite is it is delicious. I tried to photograph the inside but my picture was blurry (PEBCAK).  So take my advice and try the sfogliatelle. It's like online dating : it may not look like you'll like it, it may not sound like you'll like it, but you won't know until you actually try it. Enjoy.

I have not had the best impression with the Chicago version of "Little Italy" up until now. This is by far the best Italian bakery in the city. Everything I had the chance to sample was better than the next - the cuccidati (fig cookies), sfogliatelle (sort of like a danish, pastry with cheese filling), cannoli (filled to order) and the lemon ricotta cake. I feel pretty justified in saying whatever you get is going to be a winner.
EAT THESE MACARONS!!!It's such a treasure in LT.  The pumpkin pie is amazing!  Pecan pie is out of this world!  The only drawback is that they close at 4pm.

Everything is way out of this world there. From the pastries to the sandwiches and coffee. Whatever you pick you will not be disappointed. Thank goodness we don't live near or else I would probably ask to move in.

Despite it being my first visit to Scafuri, I felt like I was at home as soon as I walked into the door. The decor is very cozy with photographs depicting the heritage of the bakery, plus the owner was entertaining patron's requests for their old favorite bakery items to return.We stayed for a few hours drinking coffee and trying all of the delicious goodies. The pastry in the turnovers is perfectly flaky, buttery and delicious, and the pignoli is wonderfully flavorful. I even brought bread, cookies, and pastries back for my work friends, and everything held up well overnight. It made for a very happy day at the office!!

Preliminary review as we came by here while waiting for a table at Sweet Maple for brunch on a weekend (that in itself was a miscalculation but it's another review). They've got a wide arrange of cookies (my recommendation is the one that's half dipped in chocolate), and donuts ( didn't get to try one yet). And also a daily toast.The shop is small but quiet and clean. they've free wi-fi as well. I'm interested in the pizza dough that they offer and will definitely try that out. Glad to have this bakery in the neighborhood... will definitely be back to see what else they've got to offer!
I like Scafuri Bakery. Their breads and pastries are pretty good.

We had a great experience working with Scafuri, and they made us a gorgeous, delicious wedding cake. Kelly was very helpful the whole way through, from our tasting to finalizing our order (after having to go up a couple of cake sizes as more guests RSVP'd yes than we had expected!). Our guests loved the cake, and we are looking forward to enjoying this same cake again for our first anniversary. (Scafuri includes a small complimentary cake one year later, so no need to freeze the top layer.) Would definitely recommend them, we tasted cake from several other bakeries and Scafuri's was our favorite. We were really glad we chose them!

Kelly and staff created our wedding cake for us.  The flavors - top layer of lemon cake with raspberry filling and bottom layer of lemon ricotta pound cake with cannoli filling - was really delicious.  Kelly totally delivered on the design of two offset squares with smooth frosting and a cascade of multi-sized silver, white and navy blue beads cascading down the layers was exactly what I had envisioned. The only thing I would have done differently is to have ordered either another layer or larger cake because all our guests wanted to take home a couple pieces of the cake!  We've been long time customers and all their baked goods are wonderful - cakes, cookies and donuts.
Daily toast is soooooo good everyday. Toasted with fresh fruit and ricotta. It is cozy and friendly. Love this place.

Scafuri Bakery is just fantastic. The first thing I had there was the Daily Toast, which was whole wheat toast with fresh ricotta and fresh fruit. The toast had strawberries on top that day, and it was finished with honey and fresh black pepper (om nom). The ricotta pound cake is a lemony, ricotta-y (it's a word, no?) delight. The cannoli are out of this world; they are filled to order and you get to choose whether you want the ends dipped in pistachios or chocolate chips, but no chocolate chips in the filling, which is as things should be!They make beer bread using grains from Revolution Brewing, and it's fantastic. I finally had one of their sandwiches for lunch today, and it was delicious. This place is a real gem with very friendly staff, and you should check it out!

Were I stranded on a desert island, and were only allowed to live on doughnuts for the rest of my life, Scafuri's doughnuts would be my choice (well, after I got over the weirdness of being on a doughnut specific desert island. Dessert island?).Anyway: the doughnuts are rich and flavorful, the apple turnovers a breakfast on their own, the lemon ricotta a gift from a superior race of extraterrestrials trying to elevate our benighted existence.... the lattés are high quality, such that they needn't bother distracting the customer with foam-art (and so they don't try).Best of all, they people behind the counter are personable and happy to see you without is seeming forced - the decor is family rev-room: games in the corner, comfy couches, family pictures on the wall. There's not a lot of seating, but it's a comfortable place to linger.
Can't believe this place isn't busier! It's really cute, has great pastries, excellent service, wifi, couches and isn't expensive.. What more could you want, really?I'm very impressed.
Defaulthangover / don't want to cook /  having guest overFood.We've order at least every other week for the last year and the food is always excellent.

This place is a cool little spot in Fulton Market that has outdoor seating (woot!) and excellent proximity to my office (woot! woot!).We started off with the Chicken Cemita - which is basically like a taco sandwich. We figured we'd try one because it was the restaurant's namesake. It was... fine. Basically tasted like a taco barfed onto bread - though not a particularly flavorful taco. At this point, we weren't impressed.We got the Taco Arabe - unusual with its flour soft shell... immediately I'm skeptical - however, the taco packed a punch. The flavor was nice and I, for one, liked it. A bit different, it reminded me more of a fajita than a taco, but whatever, I can dig it. However, that sucker was spicy, so my friend, at the warning of our server, forwent the sauce - this was mistake #1, as the sauce is what provided almost all of the flavor on the taco. Resulting in her basically eating a bulky flour tortilla with flavorless meat. She was not impressed.The next taco I had was the carne asada taco and it was solid - couldn't find anything to complain about it or necessarily rave about it. Now we are onto my friend's second mistake: she only got the one sauceless taco because she thought she'd be full after that and the Cemita. So while I had an interesting taco and a solid taco to judge. She had a bland taco and nothing else.As such, on the fence about whether we would recommend.** Quick sidenote - A+ service at this location**

Had high hopes for this place. Went with the team on Taco Tuesday and not just any Taco Tuesday the annual Taco Tuesday. We were concerned there would be a huge line, but there was not. Probably a sign that things weren't going to be good.First the good. The ambiance was very nice for a fast casual place. And as mentioned previously no huge lines to contend with. Out door seating was a nice bonus. Note this is a fast casual establishment. The last good thing was the guac.Service, we had a group of 7 and we each ordered a group of various tacos. But they didn't serve them how we ordered them. Instead of serving a plate of Chicken, Vegi, and Chorizo, they served all the Chickens on one place and so on. So we had to go through each lunch size plate and scavenge for our food.And then the food, only one person said they liked the taco's and would return. Everyone else said the food was boring, dry, etc... They have three hot sauces. Two of which have no flavor or heat. I was poring those two on each of my taco's to attempt to add some flavor to mine. The third sauce had flavor but it tasted more like a bad BBQ sauce.

Overall: Good spot for some casual tacos or cemitas (duh!). Definitely worth a try if you need your fix!The good: The cemita's flavor and the sauces were both great. Tons of cheese and the meat was tasty. The prices are reasonable and portion sizes are fair. The service was friendly and fast and effective.The bad: Despite the bulging look of the cemitas, mine didn't actually have as much filling as I thought it would, especially in terms of meat. The atmosphere is kind of bland.Atmosphere: 7/10Service: 8/10Food: 8/10

Nice, casual place to stop by for a quick meal. I've been here a couple times, and the tacos are solid and fairly priced. I've had the pescado, arabe, al pastor, and cecina, of which the arabe is hands down my favorite. The pork is juicy and flavorful and quite unlike any other taco I've had. The pescado I wasn't as much of a fan; the slaw was a bit too creamy for my tastes, and I found the cecina flavorful but a bit on the salty side.Overall, fantastic, friendly service with good food that won't kill your wallet. I also really liked the fact that they offer rotating daily specials. Will definitely be back to try the cemitas some time--they look delicious!

A conversation with a friend reminded me that I've never Yelped this place, despite having been half a dozen times. The sandwiches are really good. They are flavorful, filling, with interesting textures, and miraculously, the cemita rolls hold everything together without being so tough you can't bite through them. This is the sandwich sweet spot.That said, they aren't so mind-blowing that I've ever gone seriously out of my way to eat them. But they are good enough that when I have plans to be over here, I often schedule my trip so it falls around lunchtime and I can grab a cemita.

Wanted to try this place for a while now. the place very clean and the staff were great!well very disappointed on the Cemita I had the Al pastor which lacked flavor, very bland. My BF had the asada Cemita again no flavor, hardly any meat, the bread was cold. we did have a quesadilla which was very tasty and lots of cheese, sorry but I will not recommend this place.

Pleasantly surprised - wasn't expecting anything crazy but the chicken cemita was really good! I love the type of cheese they use on these. We also got the guac which was really fresh tasting. Would love to be back to try some of the other stuff on the menu!

We have been wanting to try this place for a long time but we were really disappointed.  Sad to say, it was one of the worst places we have eaten in a while. We got the steak and pork cemitas. The meat was cold and bland. The bread was not toasted. Too much bread, not enough meat. We were confused and questioned if it was supposed to taste like that.  But after looking at the reviews, I guess it is. The servers were very nice and the place was clean.  Maybe we should have gotten the quesadillas or tacos?

I really like this place! The space is very well kept and the service was beyond friendly. The cashier working today (7/11/16) was so accommodating and went above and beyond to make it an all around great experience for me.My cemita was really great! The chicken was flavorful and I really liked the concept but the bread was just a bit dry. Horchata was the best horchata I've ever had in my life. HUGE fan. It was amazing and so fresh! Keep it up!
I heard great things about it and anticipated it for years, but upon going I was disappointed with the style of stale-ish bread.

Let's discuss what makes a great sandwich. For me, it starts with the bread. Bread is so much more than just the transportation device that seamlessly shovels deliciousness into my mouth hole.  You need both a decent bread to filling ratio as well as something substantial enough to stand up to the filling without overwhelming it.  Next comes what's in between the bread...I subscribe to the school of keep it simple. You've got me with quality ingredients in the right proportion to one another.Cemitas could write a how-to book on sandwich construction.  The sesame rolls are fresh and hold up well even when you over do it with that insane chipotle sauce.  The meat to bread to cheese to avocado to sauce ration is spot on. The Arabe I had today was loaded with porky goodness topped off with lightly melted Oaxacan cheesy perfection. Admittedly, I am heavy handed with my sauce use...but only because it is so good!Long story short, if you're in the West Loop with $7 in your pocket that you don't know what to do with I highly suggest you 1) contact me and give me the $7 or 2) go to Cemitas Puebla and gave you a delicious bite to eat.

This was my first experience at the new location, I'd been to the original once before, where I waited an hour. At 2 pm on a Saturday, I had no issue with a line. I had a milanesa sandwich, which is the breaded pork loin. The highlight for me was the bread. The sesame seed bread is house made and it is one of the best breads I've ever had. And as a big time bread fan, that is saying a lot. If I could buy those rolls by the dozen, I would.The pork cutlet was thin, but well flavored. The sandwich also had chipotle sauce, avocado, and a lot of shredded Oxacan cheese. There was so much cheese though, that it overwhelmed the rest of the sandwich, so I had to take some of that off. I also had an Al pastor taco and a taco arabe, which is their pork and onions cooked over a spit fire. I added some of their medium salsa to both, it was a wonderful salsa and added an extra kick that the tacos needed.With a fountain drink, my sandwich and two tacos ran me about $22. The food isn't exactly cheap, but it's a unique product and it's made well. I would likely return if I was in the mood.

I have been enjoying coming to this restaurant every other day for my lunch I love there salads and specialty drinks  the staff is great ..But Monday it kinda changed for me I've been observing this woman for the past few weeks and I can't believe she still works there this is not the first time she's done this while I ate lunch there but the way she was treating her coworkers I was so appalled especially mistreating them in front of customers she's an Asian short blonde woman be warned if she ever helps you out she's miserable and not a people person it's pretty sad to see this I feel that if your not a people person and not happy you shouldn't be in that kind of business I think I will give this place a shot in the evening ..

After years of wanting to try these sandwiches, we finally made it to the West Loop location. It was the perfect fast casual lunch we were looking for. Even though there were lots of great sounding menu options, but we came for the cemitas.My husband and I ordered the al pastor and carne asada and swapped halfway. Both were really large and really good. The sesame seed rolls these come on are great too, rather than just being a carby afterthought. I wouldn't hesitate to order either of these again. The sauces were a hit as well. The smoky chipotle one is obviously their thing, but I liked them all. We also ordered the large chips and guac. Big mistake in that the portion is so big, we didn't end up finishing it all. Two people will definitely be fine with the smaller size.They sell alcohol at this location, but I opted for the horchata. It was sweeter than I'm used to (not in a bad way) and ended up being a liquid dessert of sorts.Glad we finally made it to Cemitas Puebla, especially since we were able to sit outside at one of their dog friendly sidewalk tables. Pricing was fair, especially with the a la card discount we used, and staff was friendly.

Came here on a Sunday for an early lunch with a friend after church. We strolled in around 11:10 am and were their first customers of the day. It's a bright, cozy little place down in the Fulton Market area. It's not very big so I can imagine it gets pretty busy during other times of day. The people at the counter were very friendly and helped us through the menu and gave some suggestions. I went with the Al Pastor cemita (the cemitas are the giant sandwiches you see in the pictures). For $2.99 you can add chips/salsa and a fountain drink which I thought was a great deal. Everything on the menu is very affordable, which is a nice change from the vast majority of places in that area.The cemita was massive and really delicious. The bun is nice and crisp and they give a generous amount of their house cheese on the cemita (I forget the name for it). They give you three sauces at the table to try and all of them are pretty solid. I didn't find any of them to be particularly spicy if you're concerned about that. Lastly, the pork was well cooked and nicely seasoned on my sandwich. I also really enjoyed the chips and guac! You can definitely tell the chips are homemade. I would totally buy them by the bag if they sold them.Great place! I wish they had a location in Lakeview!

This restaurant has everything I look for in a local spot to grab a bite. The atmosphere is delightful, the service was quick and cheery, and the food/drinks were divine. And I do not use that word lightly.On warm days (even unseasonably warm days like the ones we had in early March), Cemitas opens up the garage doors that constitute the front wall of their restaurant. Has a patio and isn't afraid to use it. Check.When we walked in, the service was friendly and helpful. Daily specials were posted on a chalkboard (Mon-Fri happy hour is half off margaritas), and the menu was both on the wall and in paper.We sat down at a table and were brought three salsas in squirt bottles... I was instantly skeptical. After sampling each salsa, the worst part about them was that it was too hard to choose which salsa to put on each bite of chip! They were AWESOME! As an unofficial guacamole expert, I can say this place does it right- the tang, spice, and saltiness was perfect, and the best part was that it was super reasonably priced!I had the opportunity, no, the blessing to try the elite taco de government precioso (steak and chorizo), the cemita de arabe (roasted pork and onion), and just a plain old quesadilla that nearly blew my socks off. Let's start there. How do they take a tortilla and cheese and make my eyes nearly pop out of my head? I have no idea, but it was amazing. The cemita and tacos were equally awesome.NEW FAVORITE LUNCH PLACE IN WEST TOWN/WEST LOOP/FULTON MARKET AREA!! :)

I tried Cemitas Puebla today for the first time and really enjoyed it!  It was catered into my office for lunch so I had half of the carne asada and half of the pollo.  Both were delicious but the carne asada was truly special.  All of the salsas that came were great but the sandwich didn't really need them, probably better off saving those for some chips!  All in all a solid sandwich and I'm pretty sure we will be ordering from them again!

Cemitas Puebla is a special place. Their tortas are unlike any I've ever tried before. The sesame roll is amazing, the texture is both soft and crispy and holds the delicious meats and toppings very well. So far I've tried to the split pork and the milanesa. Both fantastic! I think the milanesa is hands down my favorite. Their prices are a little on the expensive side compared to other Mexican fast food places but the quality is superb. Worth every penny. The guacamole is actually pretty cheap and it comes with a surprisingly large portion of tortilla chips.The three table sauces are also incredible and I love to just pour it all over my torta. I haven't tried the tacos and I really don't have any interest in ordering any in the future. I've seen other people order them and they just don't look as good as the tortas. Stick with the tortas, you will not regret it.I plan on returning for happy hour. Between 5-7pm they have half price margaritas!! I really want to try those.Staff is friendly and the decor is hip and relaxing. I will be back for sure.

I was really disappointed in this place.  After having such great tacos at places like Del Seoul, Mercadito Kitchen, and passing my various taco joints in Chicago, I expected better.  I ordered 2 chicken and 1 chorizo taco.  The meats were grilled nicely but just nothing came together.  The food experience wasn't very cohesive so the meat tasted great but they just dumped it on a corn tortilla, nothing else was on the taco and you ate it with the condiment that were provided.It tasted nothing like the other places where I had great tacos in Chicago.  Also saw what my co-worker was eating, a ham sandwich, and it didn't really look appetizing. Out of all the places I dined at so far, this was the most disappointing.

Mariachi music, ice cold margarita, and the best al pastor I've had since my grandfather died (rip Gordito).  I'm enjoying all these flavors of salsa they gave me to taste.Ranges from gringo approved to spicy Mexican approved.  The location is nicely set up and I like tablet ordering.  It's modern but the food is classicThese rolls must be fresh made today because they are pretty tasty.Come here for a quick bite.   Ten dollar Semitas but honestly it's worth it.Now let me get back to my margarita and Vicente Fernandez
I love this spot and so glad they expanded. Good tacos and the Cemitas special is a must
This is one of my favorite Mexican spots. The food is high quality yet it's still casual and quick. The arabe and steak quesadilla is my favorite.

We went here because it was featured on DDD, and I am so glad we did. Another highlight of my trip to Chicago that I am glad I did not miss. I don't think there is any going wrong with anything you order at this place. The menu is pretty straightforward and simple so I tried to taste as much as possible by sharing with a friend. Also, don't miss those delicious sauces! The staff was extremely helpful by answering several questions and they were really friendly too. There are so many more restaurants I want to try and Chicago but I wouldn't hesitate to return to this one.
Here's what we had and it was all good!Carne Asada, Carne Enchilada, Pata, house tacos. Small place on super hip Futon Market street.

I used to go to the original location all the time and loved the authenticity of the food.  This place is great as well,  at least when it opened. I feel that they are putting less meat and less ingredients in the cemitas at this new location.  I felt like i was mostly eating bread. At the old location it was pouring out with meat and I loved it.  The most recent cemita barely had any meat.  I will give it some more tries but if quality continues to to be subpar then I may stop going here.  My only hope is my last visit was a fluke and the original quality returns as I used to love the food here.On another note getting an order from grubhub is not nearly as good as getting it fresh.

This place is what it is. Super expensive. 3.95 for tacos that have the small tortillas, barely any meat, cilantro and onion. Taco Arabe is the same prices but has a bigger hand made tortilla with decent amount of meat. Same or less amount of cilantro and onion.Horchata is good but be aware that they don't give you the very last batch (see picture attached) of horchata that has all the cinnamon, grinded rice and vanilla at the bottom.They should also offer a Puebla discount
as always tony's food is phenominal!!
Their tortas or whatever they call them called are deliciousThe quesadillas are good too for a light snackLocation is convenientStaff is nice

Just went here for dinner and really loved it! I got the pollo cemita and a government precioso taco which were both amazing - I really recommend this taco. I love their salsas on the table, especially the green one (there are 3 kinds), and it sounded like you could buy them to take home (which I'm now seriously considering). My boyfriend and I also shared the chips and salsa which were delicious too. Everything seemed really fresh and well made and it was a lot of food for what you pay for. It's also counter service so pretty quick and no wait. They also have outdoor seating. Overall, really cute ambiance and a great inexpensive meal!

Huge Cemitas fan. when I first visited their Humboldt Park location, I immediately wanted to order another sandwich after eating my first. With that being said, I had expectations that their Fulton location would be just as good as the original.The design is sleek, and branding has definitely been focused on. It feels new and hip but still approachable. But looks aside, I was disappointed for a cold, dry sandwich to show up in front of me. Perhaps they are pre shaving meat to save time? I would understand if it was deep into the lunch rush, but it was a lazy Friday night with no wait. The boozey drinks are a welcome addition. Though my spiked horchata was far too cinnamon-y, the price point was fair and I'm sure the other drinks have potential.All in all, I think that if the urge to cut corners is minimized for the sake of food integrity, this location can be just as good as the original.

I met two friends here on a beautiful Sunday, around noon. The plate glass windows at the front of this casual restaurant were opened wide - offering an al Fresco atmosphere and a great view of the neighborhood denizens with their strollers, pooches and hangovers.To start we ordered the guacamole to share - it was exactly what I would expect: fresh with a nice balance of seasonings, served with crisp, lightly salted chips..For the main course we chose the sandwiches that are the house specialty. Caveat: this was the first time I have tried them.I went with the al pastor - spicy pork and onions dressed with the standard toppings that come on each sandwich (avocado, Chipotle sauce & Oaxacan cheese). All in a substantial homemade sesame seed roll.It was a nice combo - but I generally like more kick. So I added a little spice from one of The 3 bottles of sauce on our table (that range from mild to very hot).I also ordered a side of the jicama slaw which was amazing! And thought what the heck - I'll shove some into the sandwich too! It was delicious.My friends got the pollo and carne asada, sandwiches and they were pleased with their selection.It wouldn't be fair to compare Cemitas Puebla to a traditional sit down Mexican restaurant.  It defies categorization:  but if you like quick service similar to Corner Bakery but in a nicer, smaller, stylish room;  and sandwiches and other selections featuring distinctive regional flavors & fresh ingredients - then this is a winner!

Quite shocking that this place has 4 stars. Incredibly expensive for barely any food. Tacos were smallest I've ever seen (for 3.50 and zero flavor). Al pastor cemita had no flavor as well (which I had yet to encounter throughout the entire city). Save your time and money and go to literally any other place in the city.

Quality depends on the type of cemitas gotten.3: I was there a couple weeks ago, and had the beef tongue cemita. It was served cold, almost chewy and raw. Complemented by the green salsa. It was interesting but I would not be ordering it again. I wish it were better seasoned.My friend got the Atomica and loved it.Now they had a half priced promotion on Doordash. I ordered the maximum possible.4: the Al Pastor Cemita was decent. It is a very large portion, the bread is soft and doughy, but most of all, the meat, cheese-string patty, and some avocado are fried to a very nice combination. It's definitely not quite Xoco's level, but then again it's a lot cheaper.2: Milanesa Cemita .. Very meh. The meat was not very fresh, and it did not make my tastebuds happy.3.5:  Veggie Cemita. Zucchinis, onions, green peppers, and button mushrooms. It is overall, done very well and will satisfy many a vegetarian. There's the right level of umami goodness, and with the green and red salsas, it goes down very well.
Hardly authentic.  Papalo was rotten, and on top of that the cashier indiscreetly requested a tip.

I have been to both of their locations and I have to say WOW! they are both equally as delicious!! I dont remember if the other has alcohol but this locations drink selections were on point!The chalupas were a pleasant surprise as I was expecting some drive thru concoction lol but instead I got lightly toasted tortillas with onions and cheese ( I also got meat for an extra charge) and their delicious sauces..it was a great appetizer!I am partial to their taco arabe...my bf always gets the cemita which I was lucky enough to try.point is, eat here! its really delicious...prepare to be stuffed and definitely try the sauces.

Let me preface this review by saying that I did not order the tacos, chalupas, quesadillas, or ceviche. Go for their namesake, and get Cemitas here. Specifically the Cemita Atomica. That sandwich alone is enough to warrant the 5 stars.So how do they make their sandwiches here? First, start with a sesame bun which is large enough to hold all the meat, while still being soft and flavorful. Next, a layer of fresh avocado, which brightens the sandwich and adds a healthy dose of fat and creaminess. Then your meat. Of course, at this point you've already decided to order the Atomica, which has 3 meats(ham, breaded pork loin, and grilled pork loin). And then top with Oaxaca cheese, the perfect texture between melted and stringy, and another bun.You order at the counter, and then they bring the food out to you and clean up after you as well. They also provide you with 3 house hot sauces, which are all delicious. I like to mix the orange and red one, and spread it generously on my cemita as I scarf it down. The portion is also quite sizeable; you will not be hungry after one of these sandwiches.Next time I come by, I think I'll give the Carne Asada Cemita a try. Or maybe just stick to the Atomica again. 3x the meat, 3x the deliciousness.

Disclaimer: we got take out. But, I am not sure what all of the hype is about! The food was good, but definitely didn't seem Eater 38 worthy! The guac was probably the best part, and I think I can make guac that's just as good. :/ The chips, although homemade, were way too greasy. My husband and I both ordered the signature cemitas and were a little disappointed. Again, they were good, but nothing special. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

Great sandwiches, freshly baked bread, home made salsas, chips are THE BEST. I love this place. The staff is great, always friendly and energetic. The green salsa is where it's at. I got here whenever I can. I'll always be a fan!

Stopped by because the weather was nice and they had outdoor seating. It happened to be happy hour so $3.50 margaritas!Service was good, the girl behind the counter did a good job explaining the menu.We got a few tacos and a quesadilla. The food was okay. No real flavors except the meat. They need more toppings in the taco besides just having the sauces on the table bc they just tasted bland. The quesadilla was delicious but you can't really mess up melted cheese.The margaritas were disappointing. Felt like I was drinking straight sugar, then the bottom got really salty eventho I stirred it. Glad I didn't have to pay full price!Overall I would not go back, especially with the other options in Fulton market.

I gave 5 stars for the old location on North Avenue that was unbelievably awesome. I loved it! I've eaten at this location on Fulton Market twice and am very disappointed. The first time at this new location was about 3.5 stars. This time it's down to a 2 star rating. The cemitas at this location taste like they've been reheated and the prices are much higher. The ingredients are different, skimpier on the avocado and the meat was grisly and not freshly prepared. I wouldn't mind the higher prices for the higher rent location, but the quality has taken a steep decline. I miss the old location where the owner and his son were always there.The bathrooms are a hike to get to, you have to walk down a long hallway and down a flight of stairs that for some reason is so heavily scented with a strong disinfectant that it makes you choke.Parking around the restaurant is pretty much nonexistent.

This is  contemporary Mexican takeout. It's very clean and chic inside. You order food from the counter,you seat yourself, and food will be served. Credit card is accepted.Cemitas arabe: popular for cemitas which is homemade sesame bun loaded with your choice of meat. I chose the popular Arabe which is a spit roasted pork, which was very tasteful. The cemitas is like a size of a burger. The combination of oxacan cheese, avocado, special sauce on the tablet, and the warm soft sesame bun was full of flavor.Quesadilla with chicharron: This is a jumbo size quesadilla that can cover your whole face. The cashier rcmd ordering with chicharron (pork rind). Sounds heavenly and ready for a heart attack. It was delicious with the chihuahua cheese and the crispyness of the pork rind.Minus one star because I was only able to eat half the cemitas and half of quesadillqa. This is quite a heavy meal, perhaps would be a good choice for hangover.

Honest review: i saw this restaurant on check please and dinners drive ins and dives so i had to come here and see if it was better then rick bayless's xoco it wasnt.  So this is more of a u order u sit down and they bring u ur food i dont like this type of service cause it always ends up with them forgetting something or like we have to get up and ask for like to go bags and clean plates etc. the service was a little mixed they werent really helpful or gave good recommendations and they forgot something we ordered and we waited a really long time for a to go bag like nobody came by and was like hey u guys are ok? Which i found odd because they were just standing in the kitchen not doing anything if ur gonna be lazy then at least hide so i dont see u or pretend to work. One good thing though was they exchanged something we didnt like for something else with no additional charge which is good because some places dont care. Regarding the atmosphere its cute i like the skull aspect of the restaurant its really cool and modern i would say a total hipster spot for sure.Ceviche: i was really disappointed with this. Im mexican so i had my share of ceviches in my life and this was nothing special like its basically a pico de gullo ( spicy mexican tomato salad) with tilapia. It says it came with octopus and shrimp i didnt see any octopus at all like none and there was like the tiniest amount of shrimp. The actual taste of it was really bland needed salt alot of seasoning heat and lemon or lime. Then there was hardly any seafood in it. The chips were seasoned good but were old dont ever serve me old chips no eww not im not an animal and they were kinda greasy  too wouldnt order this againCemita pata: pata is either chicken feet pork feet or cow feet in this case its cow feet. Ik ur thinking like omg why would u wanna eat that sounds gross like ewww i would never but the weird things always taste the best always try everything dont be afraid to try new things. Ive had pata before and its really good if done properly that means removing the hair yes sometimes it has hair and seasoning it properly. It tastes better on a tostada i was skeptical seeing it on a cemita and i should have just not ordered it but i did. My mom ordered it and took one bite and was like omg its horrible like she was so happy and excited because she likes this And she looked so sad like a child not getting what they want for christmas so then i tried a lil bite and was like eww no i cant. Something about it was just really off putting like there was no seasoning so it just tasted like straight from the jar which is not a good thing so we asked for something else and god was loving me extra hard today and the waiter gave us something else instead woot woot!Cemita atomica: this was amaizing i was really skeptical about trying a cemita because i never had one before so this was a complete new experience for me. Picture torta bread with sesame seeds and just having a better taste to it like its not bland ver delicous. This cemita comes with jamon, carne enchilada, melanesa. Omg it was huge like literly i couldnt finish it was so much meat!!!!! What i also enjoyed was there wasnt any of ur typical mexican fillers lettuce, tomato, rice, or beans just all tasty goodness! They put so much cheese on here like if u try to squish the sandwhich all the cheese would be acting like a spring which will make u not be able to squish it. All the flavor combinations worked beutifully together like it was so good. The melanesa was cooked perfectly not to thin not to thick not greasy seasoned really well. The jamon was tasty not salty or processed tasting. Only complaints were there was way to much jamon like it was mostly that and i didnt see any carne enchilada(grilled pork loin)?? Just put less jamon snd more of other ingredients and boom best thing ever!Cemita melanesa(breaded pork loin): when the pata was a failure we asked for this instead. Ok the problem is that the melanesa was really thin think like paper thin there were two pieces but for a big torta? Just the meat to bread ratio was off either put more melanesa or another meat or make it into a toco instead because it didnt work still tasty though just needs more meat!Taco arabe(spit roasted pork and onions): be warned if u dont like spicy food dont order this! Because u might get a heart attack its not like omg u eat it and ur head explodes but it is spicy. omg this was heavenly. When i opened it up it didnt look appetizing but omg was it good it was seasoned perfectly not bland at all the grilled onions really enhanced the tacoChalupa: This was not a traditional chalupa it was just 4 tacos covered in cheese lol the carne asada tasted amaizing but some of the pieces were completely burnedCookie: i was expecting that typical dry flavorless mexican cookie polvoron but it was really good not the worst not the best the chocolate however wasnt so tasty tasted cheapRicecrispy not goo
There tacos are tiny and a but pricy but there were so good. Had a taco de asada and one de chorizo. ¡¡Delicioso!!

Margarita's and Tacos..  YummmThis is close to my "2nd job"  and I often go during my dinner break so much so my face is  easily recognized.    So far  I am stuck on the steak tacos with cheese.  The food is good and the service is great.  Parking i very tight as the west loop is becoming a bit of a hot spot.   Go and you will be pleased.  Please keep in mind that this is the west loop so the prices will reflect the location.

A friend of mine and I were doing some work in my house (yes! nice friend!) and we needed some decent grub to keep us energized. I had gotten a DoorDash delivery coupon in the mail, and DoorDash also had a special on a couple menu items. I hadn't known anything about this place, but it sounded interesting.We got one of the specials (Pollo Cemita--AKA chicken for you gringos, and only $2 rather than the regular $8--deal!), another cemita (Al Pastor--yummily-prepared pork, gringos) and guacamole & chips (um, avocado... never mind). (The ordering and delivery experience was excellent, but that would be another story:goo.gl/LE02hN.)Wow, we were very pleased. The bread was tasty & sturdy, without having gotten soggy in transit, and the meat and accompanying sauces were savory and, dare I say, succulent? We added grilled onions to the Al Pastor, and they made it that much better. I'm a guacamole snob--I make it as well as anyone (yeah, I said it, bee-atch!)--and theirs was excellent. The homemade chips were excellent, if slightly greasy (though probably made more noticeable by the wrapping).Voy a visitar en persona pronto. ("I plan to visit in person soon," if my gringo Spanish is correct. To channel Anthony Bourdain, "I don't know Spanish. I just know a little Mexican.")

The people that work at the Fulton Market location are so rude, except for Olivia ! She is AMAZING ! She always makes sure your taken care of quickly and that your order is correct, in fact she should be the manager at all the locations.

I went for lunch with a colleague who had been there before and had tacos--mini-tacos on a double-tortilla, that is. The cecina was done surprisingly well (4/5), and it tasted very good with their green salsa. The orange-red salsa tasted like it had tamarind maybe, so I do not recommend it unless you like the modern Mexican mixtures of sweet and salty together. (Perhaps this is also a region-specific salsa recipe, in which case, then I could just not be used to it.) Also, the dark red salsa was pretty if you want a smokey and hotter salsa--perhaps guajillo-pepper based. Anyhow, from there the food honestly got bland (2/5). The al pastor meat was a bit harder than I'm used to and didn't have enough of the distinct al pastor sauce it's supposed to be prepared with. I could also tell that it wasn't prepared on a shawarma-like Mexican spit with pineapples and shaved. Lastly, the carne asada taco was very basic. I recommend just going for cecina, trying other tacos, or just do cemitas. I'll give this place another shot for the cemitas it's known for next time. The service was pretty fast and friendly, and the place is a clean, modern, small-medium location.

Oh my! These cemitas (sandwiches) are absolutely delectable. My husband had Jamon and I had the Veggie...both served on a delicious sesame bread, piled high with chihuahua cheese. The flavor was outstanding.The only con: we split a cured steak taco and it was flavorless. Don't go here for the tacos. Get a sandwich and enjoy their three yummy hot sauces!

I had a Cemita de asada and they put no meat. I was very disappointed. For the amount of money I paid I would have expected more meat. All I could taste was the half a pound of cheese they put in there. The cheese wasn't even melted. Very disappointed.

A frequent visitor to the original location, I was so disappointed to hear that it had closed.Visited their new spot today and while the decor and people have changed, the quality of food has not. They have a nice little patio area for small groups to sit outdoors and the menu is basically the same as the last location just in a different style. The Atomica is as good and HUGE as ever, my only complaint albeit slight, was the amount of queso fresco added to the cemita. I suppose it was supposed to melt a bit more, but I ended up with a giant chunk on top.If you never got a chance to visit the original one, it is definatly worth checking this one out!
Cemitas getting fancyI like real fork & knife no more plastic, smile girls taking your order  nice clean place on Fulton market $$$$

Quality of the Cemitas seems to vary a lot more than it used too.  Sometimes they're great, other times you get grizzle.  Delivery fees have gotten excessive as well after they ditched the big delivery services.

If Xzibit made Mexican sandwiches they'd be like the ones from Cemitas Puebla. They're pimped out tortas that start with seasoned meats and melted cheese. Layered with avocado and chipotle sauce then topped with an awesome sesame seed bun which is what really separates them from other sandos of a same family.The carne asada or atomica are solid bets that will fill your belly without emptying your wallet to the extent that XOCO would. Served with several sauce options on the side it's a pretty spectacular experience for your taste buds if you like awesome bread with your Mexican food.Super nice staff and an owner that's really hands on always shaking hands and kissing babies. Really happy these guys came down to this hood.

Been coming for years when it was on north ave.  Much nicer atmosphere although I liked the pics of luchadors with the owner.  The cemitas is just outstanding.  Been branching out since they moved and really like everything bit get a cemitas first time.  Great service

NEW COOL HIP CEMITASI still remember my first visit to the original  Cemitas location about 3 years ago. It was a long roundtrip drive but worth every minute of it. I found Cemitas because of Guy F from Triple D and thought I need to eat there. After my first visit, I was not let down. Thanks Food Network for introducing me to a Chicago original. I am a lifelong fan of this place.Fast forward to this week, when my buddy wanted to grab lunch in the neighborhood. Our dilemma was where do we eat considering we have probably eaten everywhere in our hood. I suggested Cemitas and he jumped at the opportunity.This location is much different visually then the original location but what hasn't changed is how delicious the food is. It is amazing for me to see Cemitas grow up and become hip and cool. The interior is very modern and clean. I love the large community tables. It always reminds me of eating in Europe. But don't be afraid there are small tables too if you want to eat alone. I love all of the glass which brings in a lot of natural light. The front interior can be opened on nice days. I hear there will be tables outside next summer. This modern design fits perfectly into the Fulton Market area.We ordered our food and grabbed a table. I noticed that they now serve beer which is something the old location never had. I will have to come back another day and try a cemitas with a ice cold cerveza. Hey don't judge me for not drinking at 1pm in the middle of the week.I ordered an Arabe Cemitas which is basically pork and onions but this meat is special because it is roasted on a spit-fire. As a guy, I just love meats that are cooked on a spit fire. I wish I had one of these at home. When is my local Best Buy going to start selling these? This delicious roasted pork and onions is then added to hand shredded oaxaca string cheese and served on their perfectly toasted sesame seed bread.  It is a fantastic sandwich. I also love their fresh made salsas. They offer three different ones to choose from but I love the green avocado/jalapeño salsa. It adds just the right amount of kick without over powering all the flavors. After my first bite I realize I'm in trouble because this place is now within walking distance from my house. All I can say what took you so long to get here? And welcome to the neighborhood because you fit in quite nicely.My buddy got the chicken cemitas and loved it. I had no idea that this was his first one ever. I would have thrown some confetti in the air. From his reaction I know that it won't be his last. We also shared a steak quesadilla with cheese and it was really good. The steak was cooked perfectly and full of flavor.Prior to us leaving we also had a chance to talk to the owner Tony. I love how he made me feel like an old family member.  The food business should be personal where an owner should know their regular customers. It may seem old school but I think that's the best way of building a loyal customer base. It also doesn't hurt that his food is unique and really good.So if you've never had a cemitas then maybe today is the day. It is a perfect step away from the typical sandwiches you are use to. I guarantee you will enjoy the flavor combinations as you take your first bite. I'll even come by and through confetti on you if you want.

Put some more meat-ah on my cemitas. Well, I didn't really need more meat but it just rolls of the tongue. Another great addition to the Fulton Market hood. They fit in well with their surroundings and fill the gap with their Poblano foods. I was on a mission to get a cemitas and I got my fill.At about 8 bucks for this creation and its worth it. No inflated West Loop prices to my surprise. The al pastor with onions, oaxaca cheese, and the fresh baked bread hit the spot. We ordered a couple tacos along with chips and salsa. The tacos weren't anything to write home about but simple and authentic. The chips were fresh and the salsa was prepared fresca style. Three bottles of sauce accompany your meal. Not labeled but the chipotle and verde were my favorite.I will visit again for the atomica, quesadillas, and the horchata. The interior is simple yet unique and they have a few picnic tables on the sidewalk along with a standing bar area. Fulton Market is worth the trip alone and is this is a good place to kick it off.

It's a real shame how far Cemitas Puebla has strayed from its original brand from Humboldt Park to become this incredibly unimpressive version I've experienced today.I visited the new location on Fulton Market for lunch today expecting to get a slice of heaven in the form of a delicious cemita to fill a gap in my soul.  But the experience turned out quite disappointing.We ordered 2 tacos and 2 cemitas, in fairly standard variations like al pastor, carne asada... etc.    To kick things off, our food took an surprisingly long time to prepare considering we were one of the only 3 groups that was in the restaurant at the time.  Luckily, we also ordered some chips and salsa that kept us preoccupied for the 15 mins wait.  The tacos came out first.  With a squeeze of lime and some heavy handed salsa-ing, they were actually fairly decent.  I'm not sure if I was just too hungry to be well calibrated, but the tacos' opening act actually got me excited for the main attraction, the cemitas...Finally, the cemitas arrived looking like a million bucks, but that's about where my good mood came to a screeching halt.  At first bite, it struck me... the sandwiches were not hot, and also the sandwiches don't taste like sandwiches.  They had all the components to a good cemitas, but just without ANY flavor!!!  The meats were a bit dry, flavorless, and worst of all... cold!  That set the tone for the entire sandwich... the cheese never got a chance to get going and just also ended up sitting coldly in between the buns.  In a desperate attempt to fix the situation, I must have unloaded an entire bottle of salsa in my sandwich, but things just weren't the same.  It actually became a punishment to keep eating, so we stopped and left half of the cemitas sadly in the cold tray to wallow in shame.The wait staff was nice though... Sad to say, I will never return again.  I will still keep the good memory I had about the original location in a safe place in my brain so I can maybe tell my kids about it one day... To do so, I need to not let these new locations tarnish it!  So this is how Cemitas Puebla will no longer see one another. Good bye...

I could eat tacos everyday. I'm a sucker for a good taco & this place has them. The steak is top notch and the Guac is to die for. Horchata is on point and the avocado hot sauce is a must. I even bought a bottle for home. We have ordered for work events and the food came hot and delicious. The atmosphere inside is very chill and I love that they have a out door area. Great for a quick work lunch or date night. I only wish they had their music up a little higher to set the mood.
This place is known for their "Cemita" sandwich but I got chicken tacos instead. THEY WERE FANTASTIC. I would come back here if I was in the area.

Great spot to grab a bite on the cheap before going out for upscale drinks nearby. The concept of this place is great... imagine a burger joint done with legit mexican food... rather than ground beef patties, cheddar cheese and day old buns this spot has Cemitas sandwiches stuffed with seasons meats like Al Pastor and arabe (spit roasted pork) and freshly baked sesame seed rolls. I highly recommend!

I know I should have actually tried the cemitas, but I was really craving tacos. I got the steak, chorizo, and al pastor. Of course I also had to get the horchata as well. Everything was really delicious and flavorful. Of course this is a bit pricier than some of the other local Mexican spots. I am pretty sure I will be back to try the cemitas. The staff was nice and service was relatively quick even though there was a short line.
Took a trip to see the Bears play the Niners. Saw this place on triple D years ago..... Always wanted to try it out! It was awesome!

Been from Puebla, where the real cemitas are from, I was a little bit disappointed about this place, they try to keep it real but the reality is that if this restaurant was in Puebla, probably they will be out of business by now, is ok because it reminds me of my city but after I take my first bite, it reminds me how much I miss the food from Puebla...

The space is very clean and well lit. I like that! There were several of us, so we ordered a few different things and shared. The Cemitas Atomica has like a million different types of pork in it, so expect a very meaty torta. This is not your mama's torta, these are HUGE with a lot of meat and cheese. I think I might have been expecting something else, but I think I'd rather go to Xoco to get my torta fix than here. It was still nice to finally try the Cemitas Atomica. Quite a unique experience!
Cold sandwich = no Bueno. I ordered the Al Pastor Cemita and it was cold all the way through.
Food poisoning on the first visit - not what I expected. Compared to similar restaurants, the quality of food is sub-par and seasoning on the tacos was off.

This place used to be really good.  I live nearby, so I have dropped in from time to time, and the last couple of times have been very disappointing.  Maybe they can't handle the busy lunch crowds?  In my last meal, on my Cemita (the Atomica) one of the meats was so fatty I couldn't even bite through it.  I had to take it off of the sandwich.  It also lacked flavor all together.  On to my Horchata.  My Horchata drink didn't have any ice, and the cup was literally half full of the grounds (almond or rice or whatever they make it from).  I couldn't drink it.  My guacamole was runny, and not all that exciting.  For $20, a total disappointment.  Not sure what is going on here, but they need to get it together ASAP!

Really awesome mexican sandwiches.  very trendy space.  i got the veggie cemita and horchata and my husband got the pollo.  it was all really delicious.  make sure to ask for the salsas they are really good too.  only thing i don't like is these new trendy fast food places flipping the ipad over for a tip when i havent even had a chance to see what the service or food is like!  luckily, everything was good so it was worth every penny.
I loved this place! The service was above and beyond. If you enjoy being treated well, go here. The food was so great as well.

Great place for a quick bite with friends. They don't have a lot of seating so not great for large groups. I went with a group of 4 people. We each got a cemita and split a pitcher of margaritas, both of which were very delicious. The chips are also unlimited which is a huge plus for me.

Cemitas Puebla has been on my list for quite some time...and boy did it live up to what I had hoped it would! I had the pleasure of dining here last week with my WL crew (whoop whoop) and its safe to say we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The restaurant it's very casual, where as you order at a counter, sit down, and you will be brought your meal. The decor is quite sterile, but not in an annoying way, in a modern chicy way, all complete with a skull cluster. Mad fun!So on to the food and drank. First, the margs are delicious! You can tell they are homemade and not some mixture crap from a bottle. For eats we ordered chips and guac, a chicharon quesadilla the 3 cemitas: Milanesa, arabe, and the al pastor. The guac was freshy fresh and the dilla was banging - the perfect mix of gooey cheese and crisp pork rinds. The cemitas were all quite tasty as well. I would say the arabe and the al pastor tasted similar, but very delicious. The Milanesa was good, although I felt it was lacking in flavor compared to the others. Have no fear - this was quickly remedied by adding one (or all) of the three sauces on the table. One mild, one hot, one chipotle....all so yummy!The only reason this review isn't getting a perfect rating is because of the price. For one round of drinks+food+tip we were looking at about $75. Make no mistake, the food was amazing but that's just a little steep when ordering at a counter. Regardless of the price, I will absolutely be back to try their tacos. Cemitas is a beautiful gem in the Fulton River district. :)

Boo and I got delivery via Postmates, because the on-demand deal was $4 for a cemita! Delivery took a bit but there is no one to blame, besides mother nature.We get the pollo and the milanesa. Aside from the texture, I couldn't differentiate too much between the two in terms of flavor of the proteins. However, in itself, it was quite tasty. They did not skimp out on the avocado, which was a plus. Bread was surprisingly still toasty when we got it and fit well with the rest of the sandwich. My favorite part was the accompanied salsas. The tomatillo was very nice and tangy. The red one was on fire but had a nice bitter note to it. The orange one was also spicy but not as intense.Enjoyed my first cemitas experience and would like to dine in next time.

Stopped in with a visiting friend after I saw a bunch of posts from local food bloggers. Sometimes, you can trust the Instagram. Cemitas Puebla is terrific. The portions are large, affordable and varied. Service lacked because the order-taker didn't seem too knowledgeable about the various options, but the food came up quickly once we got to our seat.I had the very mild but tasty cemita abela, and it was great to try the various hot sauces available at the table. My friend went for a hotter option, and my quick sample of it was positive. No, that's not cabbage piled on -- it's cheese!This place is casual and definitely off the beaten path, but it's worth a diversion if you are out exploring or are cool enough to live in the growing nearby neighborhood. This is definitely a place I will bring friends to again!

Finally got to try this place out on my last visit to the city and was very pleased.As I've said in past reviews, I am hard on mexican places, but no need to be tough with this place. Good service, enticing menu, great food and amazing salsas!I tried the Cemita Atomica and Steak tacos, I was in love with both. The atomica comes with ham, enchilada carnitas and milanesa. The meat was so flavourful and the bread so flaky and fresh, not to mention the avocado and queso Chihuahua. I ate very slowly so it wouldn't end, but it had to eventually. : (The steak taco was served traditionally with onion, cilantro and lime. Also, perfectly cooked, fresh and delicious.The three salsas they place on the table are Amazing and very close to authentic stuff my family would make, I couldn't tell which one I liked more!Try this place out! I'm excited to go back and try the other location!
I've had the Milenesa Cemita a few times and it's my favorite sandwich anywhere. Great flavors, love the sauce and the bun. The stewed chicken cemita is good too.

I will start off saying that I ordered for my first time from Cemitas Puebla last Friday, it was AMAZING minus a discrepancy with the order- I called and mentioned it to the manager (Lee) and received ABOVE and beyond management experience! It is refreshing, as a customer to be heard, and compensation is a definite plus as well.Today I called to order lunch for the office, and spoke with Lee- he took very good care of us, and the food was definitely above par from the regular Mexican cuisine we're use to ordering. We had the Carne Asada Cemita, Atomica Cemita, Pollo Cemita, rice and guac/chips. Myself and the entire office were extremely satisfied with everything, and can't wait to order from Cemitas Pueblas again!

Love the cemitas, love the three sauces... BUT there was way too much cheese on my sandwich. Not to mention, later after eating my milanesa cemita I had extraordinary food poisoning. I will not be returning.
The Atomica. That's it. The apex of human achievement in sandwich construction.There may be other sandwiches that are *as good* as the Atomica, but there are none *better*.

After a failed attempt to go and play soccer, we settled for this Mexican place.The food, not gonna lie, is delicious. I had 3 chorizo tacos and boy could I have eaten more! But only because the tacos where the size of the circumference of the bottom of a mega gulp at 7 eleven. Thankfully I ate donuts from the place next door (the guy there is dope).Another thing they don't offer discounts if you're from Puebla Mexico, which I am! Actually I don't really care about that it's whatever. Do what you want. But a big issue I have with this place is...THE CHAIRS! While I was trying to scoot in my chair I jammed my ankle against the cold metal steel of this Cemitas sword! And this didn't just happen once but twice: one on my right and two on my left. And I'm a man with sensitive ankles.Anyways, this place prices suck kinda. Just go to a real Mexican restaurant. You get more bang for your buck.

It's actually 3.5 stars. I can't quiet give it 4 stars because this is very similar to XOCO, which I like much better and would choose over any day. Cemitas Puebla is a great spot if you want to avoid lines and crowded areas, especially if you're in the area. My boyfriend and I stopped by here Sunday evening and it was empty. We ordered and shared the Milanese and al pastor sandwiches. Both were good. I chose to eat the sandwiches open faced because it was a bit too much bread for my liking. The milanese is fried breaded pork loin, a bit dry and very flat. Both sandwiches come with avocado spread, definitely not enough avocado to taste. The al pastor sandwich was supposed to be spicy but it was manageable. At the table there are 3 sauces to add to your sandwiches in varying degree of spiciness. Alcohol is available.Bottom line, I will come back for a quick bite but considering this place is seated right next to Publican Quality Meats, only if PQM is packed and I am REALLY craving Mexican food. If you're in the area check it out.
Absolutely fantastic every time. The al pastor cemita is wonderful, as are the tacos. The chicken taco with some of that green salsa? Yum.
Flavorful food, laid back atmosphere. Open to the street, so the fresh air of the spring day was breezing in. We had the jamon cemita, carne asada chalupas, and jamica to drink. Delicioso!!!
Solid food, ate here twice in two days, great cemitas sandwiches and their chips are awesome!

Everything was delicious. Cemitas are a must try. The bread itself was to die for. Had the steak sandwich, chips and guac, salsa, and a half-priced margarita (on a Tuesday). Service was excellent. Atmosphere was very nice. Can't wait to go back!

I didn't wait long to come back on a 2nd visit coz the first was such a hit. This time I was feeling adventurous, so I asked about the Pata (cow foot). The person at the cashier was nice enough to give me a taste, he also gave me the excellent suggestion of ordering it warm, even though typically it's served cold. Cow foot is basically beef tendon. The cold sample I had was well-cooked but still chewy, it also had a nice subtle tang to it. But the warm one...OMG...melt-in-mouth buttery texture. If you're adventurous, definitely give it a try!

Saw the place (actually the other location that I think is now closed) on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. Tried the quesadilla with chicharon and cemitas arabe (spit pork and onions) that were on the show. Both were good, particularly the cemitas. Also had the guacamole and chips and a chicken taco. Liked the  10 choices for cemitas - there is bound to be a meat on the list you are having a craving for (less the veggie and cow foot ones; unless that's your thing). 3 homemade salsas on each table in squeeze bottles; good favors that complemented the food. Overall impressions - good Mexican food (can't comment on the authenticity related to the Puebla region because I have not been to that part of Mexico), really good for lunch, liked the feel of the place, tables were being bussed very attentively, don't care much for the neighborhood (parking is a bitch).  I'd definitely go back.

This is my now my go-to Mexican spot, which I just tried for the first time yesterday during lunch. The place is clean, the tables were solid (I hate rickety tables!), decor pleasant and very inviting, yet modern. Outdoor seating was available, though I opted out due to the weather.The food was great, simple (seemed like only a few ingredients), and delicious. I tried the chicken quesadilla and chicken cemitas. Three different chilled sauces were brought to my table and I had a very enjoyable lunch.
