Great food, incredible service. Portions are pretty big.The owner was nice as heck, made us all laugh and feel special. And coffee was on the house!??! I want to move to Humboldt just so I can eat at grandma j's for breakfast and lunch every dang day.
Arrived here at 1pm, it's now 3 (closing time) and we have yet to be served. I've been here before, and they do have great food; however the wait time after you order is inexcusable.

Grandma J's used to be amazing..... Recently, though, I have never been more disappointed in their quality of food and service. I'd like to think that a small kitchen/wait time disclaimer on a menu is warranted for a busy brunch boutique, but Grandma J's is no longer such a location. The loss of their flagship chef (and indeed the heart of Grandma J's excellence) indicated a lack of management and concern for customer satisfaction.Please get your shit together.. also your outdoor space is full of Yellowjackets during the summer.

What can I say here that hasn't already been said? The work that is being done in this little kitchen is among the best in the city, especially in the ever important byob brunch space.This is the kind of place that could literally charge double, and you would still be happy. But they don't, and that is the other half of the charm here. There's something just so inviting about a local joint, with real people running it, turning out top level food.Owner Layla is always there with a smile of some kind, and along with her warm staff, they make you feel more like neighbors and friends than customers.The Fried Chicken and Waffle Fritters might not only be the best brunch dish in the city, but maybe even the best fried chicken. The breakfast poutine, biscuits and well... everything else is just on point.If you want to go someplace for brunch without a side of pretentiousness, then get your ass to Grandma J's!

Still love this place. While there was a 30-40 minute wait this morning and no room inside to wait, the hostess offered us coffee while we were outside. Not a super cold day, but chilly enough where hot coffee was appreciated.Decided to try something new today. Went with The Works and it was amazing. Poached eggs with kale, cheddar cheese, potato hash, hollandaise sauce, a tomato and bacon. I loved it and it was so filling.They've also acquired an ATM and two tables that replaced a coach and coffee table seating since my last visit.

This place is a mecca for delicious food.We went on my bday brunch.  I have been stalking it on Yelp for awhile now.  It did not disappoint.Fried pickles...a bit soggy, but still goodB&G...might be the best I have ever had.  I am salivating thinking of them right nowFried chick sand...yummy!  Crispy chick with tender and juicy meat.  Some of the best bread I have had.The Works...it just worked.  AmazingnessThe staff are some of the nicest people.  I was shocked by the hospitality here.Super cute homey, place.Go, eat, this place cant be beat.
The grill cheese and the fried chicken and crepes are amazing!! Will definitely come to this location again.

I need to go back here again! I came on a whim and I gotta say, the service was great and the food was awesome!I got the Works which was poached eggs on top of potato hash with Swiss cheese marinated mushrooms , crispy kale, bacon and fried tomato in a bowl comes with toast, and some jam. All delicious! I also paired with some coffee (which they had to keep brewing but always fresh).It's a small place and it gets packed but it's very great! I just sat at the bar.

The first time we went, the food was AMAZING. We went on a lunch date and the food was impeccable! When the chef came out to say hi and ask how the food was, my sister even proposed to him bc the food was so good. The place is very cozy and quaint. It had a very nice homey feeling to it; it was like eating at a friend's house. Since we liked the food so much we decided to go there for brunch on a weekend with some friends.The service was AWFUL. First, we were told there was a 40 minute wait for 5 people, which on a Sunday isn't bad until the waitress sat her friends before sitting us even though they arrived minutes after the people left the big table. Second, she was rude. There was a minor miscommunication in which an extra order of pancakes was made because she thought we ordered two orders of pancakes when I had asked for two pancakes, not two orders. I very politely sent it back telling her I only wanted ONE order of two pancakes. She rolled her eyes, told me I ordered two orders then proceeded to take the food to the table where her friends were sitting. Next, when our chicken and waffles were ready, we didn't get the full order. We left there hungry which didn't happen the first time. We have not been back since because the service was so bad.

Yelped a good breakfast place while on vacation and found this place. Anything with "grandma's" has to be good!The interior here is decorated so cute! It really looks like grandma collected a bunch of things and left it all here.There are old schools games and books on the shelf for you to play while you wait for your food. Also, gum in jars on every table.Time for the food!The boyfriend had The Works that looked good and came with house made pineapple jam that was too sweet for me but my brother liked.I had the Poached Hamboldt. Poached eggs over ~~~ all over delicious potatoes!! Loved! And the portion was perfect if you didn't get extra french toast like I did.The texture of the french toast was good but it was a bit greasy and I did not like the white sauce they put on top.I like when places have non-matching cups and this was how the coffee cups were. The water they give you in the masion jar was warm though so it was kind of gross. So I ordered a Peach-Mango juice that my brother said he saw just came out of a V8 bottle.I would love to come back here next time I'm in town and possible try the biscuits and gravy which they were out of. The waitress told us as soon as we walked in instead of after we looked at the menu.They are also looking for burlesque dancers if anyone is interested!

I was not impressed with this trendy single waitress breakfast and lunch eatery. I've got plenty of details and photos to explain my views.We arrived just after 11am to a few open tables. There are just six small tables that would each hold either two or four people, two tables for up to six people, and a small bar-like counter that holds a total four people. Capacity here is limited but the flow for lunch here never exceeded capacity.The waitress (one chef, one waitress) seated us but wasn't overly friendly. This visit would have likely gone so much better if she had simply asked "Have you been here before?" but we were given no rules or SOP's and remained clueless most of the visit. I would ask questions that I thought of but turned out I had missed a bunch. Being one waitress she had little time for us and was rarely available to help when needed. Even by the end of the meal the waitress still seemed stressed and unfriendly.Both of us started with hot tea. The tea bag selection was nice but my companion likes a weak tea and when she pulled out the bag to save it for a second cup there wasn't a saucer and the only place to put the partially used bag was the sticky table. The table didn't seem dirty but just old and worn.There are a couple menus listed on Yelp. They are clearly outdated and inaccurate. The stuff we wanted (some nice sounding chicken sandwiches) that we picked on Yelp before arriving wasn't on the menu we got. Check the official restaurant website for the current menu!I LOVE anything made with duck so I jumped at the Duck 3 Way (see photo) and for $14 I was expecting a more traditional confit (seasoned and moist from being stored in fat) but I got a small amount of dry duck meat chunks. The poached duck egg was good and larger than I expected. The potato hash fried with duck fat was under seasoned but the duck fat added good flavor. The Hollandaise sauce was good but more lemony than I like. I wouldn't get this dish again even if it were priced under $10.My companion had to put together three sides to make a meal since the full menu was a bit limited. Sides of French Toast, Bacon, and Potato Hash. The four small French baguette slices were the best tasting things we had for lunch today. Bacon was good and hash average.Our check was over $30 for underwhelming food and below par service. We knew that it was CASH ONLY prior to arriving so that wasn't an issue but the cost for what we got was. On a side note for the profit they rake in here could easily cover a credit card system through their bank or even using a Square type credit service with a simple smart phone. Just one way to improve customer service here.

Had potential but it's just a little niche hipster spot. The staff was rude, no air conditioning on a 90 degree day and absolutely deafening levels of punk and ska music from the 90's made it impossible for me to even remotely enjoy the decent meal.

I'm sure you can tell from my previous reviews, that a restaurant's atmosphere makes a big difference to me as a diner.  Grandma J's and its diners are a bit too hipster for my taste, which is why I just can't give a full five-star review.  This place is in the middle of nowhere and it's always packed.  You'll definitely wait more than 30 or 45 minutes on a Saturday or Sunday after 10, especially if you have a party larger than two, so just prepare for that.  And there's NO WHERE ELSE for you to go nearby to wait (i.e. to have a beer or watch football or something), so plan on just standing outside in the cold.Cash only also makes this place incredibly annoying instead of charming, so keep that in mind.  At least there's ample parking available for free.  Only redeeming atmospheric quality of this place.  The servers are pretty curt  and clearly annoyed that their restaurant is constantly full and diners have all kinds of annoying dining preferences like gluten-free vegan nonsense.  The general feeling in the place is "hurry up and order and eat so we can get more people at this table", which doesn't make me feel comfortable.  Sigh.  The people just don't make this place worth it.The food, though, was really good.  I appreciate organic, free-range, local meats and whatnot, and they are clearly prideful of their purchase of these kinds of items.  The breakfast sandwich was excellent and everything comes with potatoes and meat of some kind, so indulge away.  My family really enjoyed everything they ordered (we were a party of six) and the coffee was refilled promptly.Prices are reasonable but, sigh, it's cash only.  I won't come back here on purpose, but would definitely go with a friend if they suggested it.  Maybe my next experience will be better.  At least the food was super delicious.

Clocks aren't the first thing that come to mind when I think of grandmas, but this place somehow got it spot on. From my paternal grandmother's plastic yellow bumble bee clock to my maternal grandmother's loudly ticking wood clock that was always set fifteen minutes fast, there's something about the zillion clocks on the wall at Grandma J's that made me feel at home. That, and the fact that the waiter offered to refill my iced coffee for free!I got the Works, which had two poached eggs, bacon, hollandaise sauce, kale, mushrooms, and a fried (red) tomato over potato hash. It also came with a side of toast, butter, and pineapple jam. Part of me worried that this would be too many ingredients for one dish, but it somehow all worked. Even the ever-nutritious kale didn't detract from the deliciousness of the hollandaise and bacon.My brunch mates got the chicken and waffle fritters and the breakfast sandwich. I tried the fritters and they were kind of dry. I'll be back to try the French toast sticks and enjoy some BYOB mimosas.

What an awesome, quaint, eclectic little restaurant. Located across the National Guard Armory on North Ave and Kedzie this restaurant is a real gem. We popped in for breakfast and had the poached eggs on crispy kale and potato wedges. Delicious! I love the ambiance and the food matched the anticipation. It was a little pricy ($14 for an egg dish), but we didn't realize the size of the dish and could have split it. The owner was charming and we chatted a little about her inspiration for decor. She has a great story worth hearing so make sure to strike up a conversation.

Grandma J's now serves dinner Thursday through Saturday.  The food and staff are amazing.  I have been a fan of the brunch restaurant for a while but I have not taken the time write a review.  Tonight, I was dining with my family including kiddos 4 yrs old and 2.  The dinner menu is great - fried chicken, homemade pasta, trout and a bunch of other tasty dishes.  The waiter also offered a menu for the kids (pasta, hotdogs and a few other items.)  It was not overly busy so when we asked about the possibility of plain yellow mustard for our youngest, the staff left to grab some from a nearby grocery store.  How amazing is that?I have always felt like I was lucky to have found the Humboldt Park neighborhood and make it the home for my family but Grandma J's is definitely the icing on the cake.  The staff makes you feel right at home and the food is just as great!

Delicious chicken and waffles, fried pickles, French toast and gravy. Excellent customer service. The only issue... my biscuit was a little burnt on the bottom, but I didn't bring it to their attention. I just ate the tops with the scrumptious gravy! I'll be back and recommend them to friends!

I can't help but to roll my eyes at the constant rumors that Grandma J's might not make it through the winter, or they'll have to close for some reason or another. I'm not sure if this is a cheap ploy to drum up publicity or what. Every time I come by, that place is packed, and it only has like, six tables. I don't know what they want!Other than the flare for drama or maybe it's self doubt (?) this is my favorite brunch place in the city. The food comes out slowly, but that's because there's a small kitchen. It's delicious. The portions are always heaping, but the food is incredible for the price. The server is always smiling and sweet, the mismatched silverware and decor adds some throwback kitsch, and their Bloody Mary's are on point.

Grandma wants you to be happyyoutube.com/watch?v=9LKe…No, you won't find hot PR girls with pitchers of beer, midgets on stick horses, or Chubbs Peterson playing the piano, but this Grandma will have you hitting the long ball just the same with her little neighborhood breakfast/ lunch spot.It's the cutest little place that really does remind you of your nanna. The food is amazing, affordable and unique and the staff provides you with the type of service that will makes you love supporting a local biz.Try the works, a cup of coffee, and be prepared to feel like family at this hidden gem.

Sorry grandma but grandma j puts your cooking to shame.  Danny W and I made ourselves right at grandma's adorable house.Grandma J is clearly trying to fatten us (and the rest of Chicago up) because there's not many healthy options on the menu. I ordered the breakfast sandwich, which was worth every mile I will have to run to work it off.Grandma J is a cash only type of gal so be sure to stop at an ATM on your way.

I just had my first meal here. Quite delicious. I had "The Works" which is served in a bowl. It has cheesy baked potatoes topped with fried kale, bacon two eggs with hollandaise sauce, and a fried tomato. Excellent with their home made hot sauce. Super high quality ingredients. Although many of the ingredients are fried, the overall dish was not greasy.. Kind of a hangover goers dream.A very LARGE PORTION. I'll ask if I can split it next time. With tax came out to $15 ish... not inexpensive but worth it. The entire menu looks great. Breakfast and lunch only.They have a BYOB bloody mary option.. Just bring your own vodka and the remaining ingredients are 5$.

The best place I've ever been at humbold park and totally one of my favorites through Chicago.They have a tiny space, I think it was around 3 tables and a patio.Service was amazing - everyone was super friendly and still not annoying.They have beautiful old photos on walls.Food was awesome. Loved everything.Totally coming back.
Nice little place, had The Works and was happy with the food, very friendly waiter and cozy environment. Would definitely recommend and will be back!

Service was amazing, small room but atmosphere was fantastic.. I had "The Works" and it was phenomenal, the waffle fritters are great and the coffee was surprisingly delicious.. Over all. 10/10.Thanks again Grandma J!!!

Great hidden gem in Logan Square/Humboldt Park. I can only attest to the brunch menu, but I've tried most of their dishes and have enjoyed everything they offer. My top picks are the chicken and waffles, the Morning Sandwich, and their biscuits and gravy. The staff and owner are wonderful and are extremely friendly and attentive. Definitely a must for those who live in this hood.

Waited 2 hours for food.  Their excuse was everything is freshly made.  From someone who works in the food industry, not a very good excuse. I say, if you want to play in the big leagues, step up your game!!

I would love to give this place a 3.5.  I really liked the small, cozy, funky vibe and the laid back atmosphere. The chicken my bf ordered was wonderful but the waffle fritters came in pancake form today, which wasn't as impressive.  I had the french toast which wasn't very flavorful.  If I ever came back, I would make sure I didn't have anything to do after because the wait for the food was extremely long.
Simply: good food, good service, good people, if u want to have a perfect breakfast just try this guys.

Ate here for the first time today after searching for a good place to eat brunch that had some unique items. Grandma Js did not disappoint at all. The staff is friendly and attentive. The space is quaint and comfortable but not too crowded given its size. And the food was fantastic. I had The Works and it was amazing. The perfect amount of food and everything came so well together. Will definitely be eating here again.

What a nice surprise! Excellent food with a cozy atmosphere. The servers were super friendly and instantly put a smile on my face. This is a great place to start your day. I don't to say too much and spoil the experience. Just go there and see for yourself!

We walked to Grandma J's & were at the right moment in order to get seated immediately. We were immediately welcomed by several staff.  The eclectic decor was fun to look at while we awaited our food.  2 in our party ordered "The works" the other 2 "biscuits & Gravy."  The place was very busy. We placed our order & had a pretty long wait for the food to arrive but it was fine with us. We enjoyed catching up on life plus taking in the decor made time pass.Upon arrival the presentation of the food kicked in the oh I can't wait to devour such a beautiful meal. I ordered "The works" with egg scrambled instead of poached. The various textures in the dish gave pleasing bursts of sweet & salty contrasts. The battered tomato atop the dish was divine. The meal was so superb that I announced to our group that this was the best breakfast ever devoured. I'm actually thinking to go back & order exactly the same dish tomorrow.
This is a very lovely restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff was very kind. I would highly recommend it to any one.

Small place with 2 cooks.. but food is dam GOOD. Went here on a Saturday and it was busy. Reguarless I received my food with-in 20 mins of walking in the door.. I can't stress how good this place is.. I will be back for sure..biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs.. YUMMY.. my experience here was positive. When I was here the owner (I think) was going around talking to people the best she can (remember she cooks and does other things that keeps her busy) I overheard a guy and girl tell her she is rude because she didn't talk to them.. hahaha! are you kidding me?! You go here to eat not talk to the owner, dam weirdo's. Your wife/ gf is with you, talk to her.. I looked at my wife and we laughed at them lol. Can't believe these dam kids got their butts hurt by this lol... She didn't talk to me and my wife and that's fine with us lol. But Honestly if your looking for a GREAT brunch place with decent prices and strong coffee this is your place.. if your looking for a friend or someone to talk to maybe look else where. Lol.. but like I said before, it gets busy.. so depending on times you go, you might have to wait a little bit.. the owner treats everyone like family (the best she can, with smiles and small talk)..

I can handle the limited menu and expect that it will be a long meal. Usually worth it for the food. I don't think I will ever go back. They were waiting on a delivery most items on the menu were only available with lots of substitutes. I was prepared to leave becasue I didn't want to order an item with only half the ingredients. The cook kindly offered to make me something and it was fine, not great, and essentially a snack it was so small. I was charged for a full menu item: $13. The waitress came by once, when I was chewing, so I never had a chance to order more food. My teacup was empty when my food arrived, never offered a refill. My water was empty before my meal was over, never refilled. Check was dropped without a word. Two stars only becasue it tasted good, disappointing experience.

This place is brilliant. Small menu, perfectly crafted, delicious tasting, fantastic service with friendly folks.We ordered chicken and waffles (made from scratch) and The Works. Both dishes were absolutely remarkable and locally sourced. Words truly cannot convey how happy I am that I checked this place out.They have board games, photo albums, books, and toys for children. I will definitely be coming back - often.Did I mention the large coffee cups? Kombucha? BYOB? Yeah. This atmosphere is home.

I went there a while back with the wife for lunch. Great service, a knowledgeable and polite staff, tasty burger and fun ambience, the old furniture is a nice touch. I hope they can get some promo priced items.

Overall decent spot .... Food wasn't the best but I've had worse ...I wanted a omelet I guess that was not on the menu ... I ordered pancakes but since it was day after thanks giving they didn't have it ...  The service (waiter) was nice and on point ... Little pricey or maybe I'm just broke and cost of everything is going up .. Would I come back ??? I guess but only if I'm in the area

If you're like me, you've driven or walked past this place assuming it was a run of the mill diner and thought nothing more. I'm so glad I finally decided to look into Grandma J's because it's nothing of the sort.It's super cozy and full of mix and match furniture and table settings. It's BYOB and they'll bring you and awesome Bloody Mary mix for you to pour your own vodka (they know the way to my heart). The food is definitely stellar. Bomb brunch.It's 4/5 only because I think it's slightly overpriced, but mostly because while the service was attentive, we felt like we were VERY rushed. There didn't happen to be a wait that day and I realize it's a tiny breakfast spot, but we were really looking forward to unwinding and enjoying the experience. I know it stinks when people linger and tables extensively, but by the time we left (it was about 45 minutes) I almost felt like we got kicked out.

Grandma J's is my favorite place in Humboldt Park to brunch (yeah I use that word as a verb). Charming is the perfect word to describe it. It's teeny, so you must time it right on the weekend to get a table (pre-normal brunch times, but it is worth getting up early).The food is made to order just feet from you. I enjoy the Morning Breakfast sammich and The Works. A must try? The waffle fritters!I think brunch without booze is pretty much pointless so do make sure you BYO champers or prosecco (any fizzy wine will do) for the Mimosa Tray! 3 juices = lots of fun mixing and matching!

I love this place. Perfect comfort all around.Simple and cozy atmosphere. I loved the Grandma J inspired decor--ceramic owl lamp, vintage salt and pepper shaker collection. The silverware rolls placed in a variety of different coffee mugs on each table place setting was a nice detail. The food was delicious. The egg I ordered was the best egg I have ever tasted. I prefer thicker and softer French toast, but if you like French toast sticks, these are great, crispy and buttery.My husband ordered the works. All of it was delicious. The kale is a nice addition. The portions were small for my husband but just right for me.We will definitely be returning.

Layla,Five of us went to Grandma J's about 10 am Saturday November 22nd, 2014.  The male host, server was at one of the only two occupied tables talking to patrons and instead of telling us to  sit anywhere, told us to give him a moment, all ok so far, but then when he came over to us and we asked for the unoccupied window table, he told us that on "Saturdays, we have assigned seating", we were given the table directly behind it and he went off to do something.  While we waited for him to come back, we all looked at each other and said, 'Assigned Seating!", really??  As we got up to leave, he arrived with water and told him, "we just want to make sure you have enough assigned seating" !We certainly did not feel welcome...  And will never know if the food is any good. So sad.

This place is absolutely awful. THE WORST. I've actually never experienced such disgraceful service-- or disgusting attitudes-- in ten years of living and eating in Chicago.My husband and I were looking forward to trying Grandma J's-- despite the bad things we had heard about the owner's attitude, we were ready to give it the benefit of the doubt. Unfortunately we had a bad experience from the moment we walked in and sat at the bar. The owner was berating a couple of her kitchen staff-- very loudly, and nastily-- for taking cans of Coke from the fridge while they were working. She then demanded that they dig in their pockets and pay her on the spot! Chastising and humiliating one's staff in front of customers is totally unprofessional--and it made us feel very uncomfortable.Nevertheless, we ordered coffee and two breakfasts. And waited. And waited. And watched as table after table (who had arrived after us) were served. For over 50 MINUTES!!! The guy sitting next to my husband at the bar arrived 25 minutes after us...and was halfway through the *very same* breakfast that my husband had ordered when we finally decided that enough was enough.We put down cash to cover the coffee and told the owner that we were leaving because we couldn't wait any longer-- it had been almost an hour. Instead of apologizing, she turned to us with an insipid sneer and said "You're wrong-- we bring out orders in the exact order they come in." When we pointed out all the many tables who had come in after us had almost finished their meals she flat-out denied it in such a bratty, childish way it made my skin crawl.Clearly lots of other Yelp reviewers have had a similar experience. Until this nasty woman cleans up her act, we'll be telling everyone we know to avoid this place like the plague.

I wasn't sure what to expect when we walked into Grandma J's, but I was pleasantly surprised by the eclectic nature of the place.  We were seated pretty quickly at a community table and were soon joined by another couple.  The menu is awesome, and I had a hard time deciding what to order.  I finally went with the morning sandwich sans bacon.  It was fantastic. My boyfriend got the works, which also looked amazing.  I can't wait to go back and try more of their menu.

Visited from out of town while looking for a fantastic breakfast. I wasn't disappointed at Grandma J's. We enjoyed a game of Yahtzee while enjoying our meal. Service was attentive and warm. A casual experience that rivaled a visit to my Grama's house.

I cannot believe it has taken me this long to review one of my favorite places for brunch in Chicago! Grandmas is a staple for brunch with friends, family and out of town guests.  What truly amazes me that it is consistently great! I have eaten here since it opened three years ago and it is equally amazing every time. Thank you!!!

This place is amazing! John was our waiter and he seriously went above and beyond. We were traveling from Austin to Chicago and had our pup with us and we called to see if they are dog friendly. He had a bowl of water waiting for our dog Rowdy and he even greeted him by name. Haha The food was unbelievable. We were in a party of 5 and 4 of us got "The Works" and I am so happy I did! Our friend got the morning sandwich and he loved it. Perfectly balanced and an amazing way to start your day! The food, ambiance, and service with attention to detail had us amazed. We will be returning back next time we are in town! Thank you for such an awesome meal! I HIGHLY recommend coming here.

Can't wait to come back.  Went to Grandma J's on a Friday morning after picking up my cousins who were in from New Orleans at the airport.  First stop was Grandma J's since you can't bring people accustomed to New Orleans food just anywhere to eat. We decided to try out Grandma J's based on the reviews and location.  So glad we did!  Awesome service and even better food.  We had the fried pickles and deviled eggs to start.  Then I had The Works but prepared gluten free (lowers my head as I admit to being THAT person...) my husband and cousin had the chicken and waffle sliders and I cannot remember what the other dish ordered was but it was just as good.  Everyone was raving about their meal.  Well thought out dishes, strong coffee and great service.  We will be back!
Great food and great service. Organic and locally grown. Conscious restaurant that's in tune with foodies. Definitely a break from the norm!

Fabulous! Really feels like I'm in my grandmas and the food is fabulous. I got the chicken and waffles and my friend got the French toast and the potato hash and everything was delish! And it's byob! Can't wait to come back when I'm in town again. Huge portions and totally worth the price.

A couple friends and I checked out this place for the first time today and just let me tell you the food is great!!!! They were busy and we waited like 20 minutes but it was totally worth the wait! Heads upIt's cash only and they don't separate checks which was no big deal to us.. They kept the coffee coming which made me happy! Check this place out!
The food was ok. I really enjoyed the decor more than anything. The wait was quite long.

I live one block away from this restaurant so I take all of my friends and family here when they come to visit. It never lets me down. I think I have had everything on the menu at this point and you really can't go wrong with any choice, but if I had to pick favorites:-the works-biscuits & gravy (only on weekends)-BYOB mimosa platter or bloody Mary-pancakesDefinitely go if you have the chance. You will not regret it.

What a wonderfully eclectic restaurant with personal service and fantastic food! BYOB'd champagne and got the mimosa (oj) from the restaurant. The deviled eggs were out of this world- funny to say that about a food that is available at most parties I attend. I ordered The Works and it did not disappoint- poached eggs, crispy kale with potatoes.The coffee is good too, try it with their coconut cream, tastes novel! Glad this place opened west of California Ave., very few places in the area that serve such an awesome Brunch! Highly recommended :)

Came here twice in two days. The first time, the coffee was fantastic, the second, it tasted more of filter than of bean. In any case, the coffee is hit or miss, I've heard. The food was fantastic. My girlfriend is veganish (eats eggs and honey but nothing else animal-derived), and has celiac's; she indicated that she didn't want any dairy or gluten in her meal, and when the food arrived, there was bread and cheese included. After trying to eat the bowl she'd ordered with the cheese (she's a trooper), she gave up and sent it back, saying she couldn't eat it and not ordering anything else. A few minutes later, the chef came to our table with a newly prepared dish of marinated tomatoes and peppers, poached eggs, and french fries, and apologized for the misunderstanding (they only charged us for my meal). Made our day - very friendly, very good, very accommodating.

Fantastic southern cooking. Everything we ate was so good. Only downfall was the small dining area- only a few tables so the wait was long and the service was pretty slow too- we waited about 45 minutes for our food. It's worth the wait if you have the time- I recommend the fried chicken! Best I've ever had!!

I love this place.As you step in the door, this place is bound to warm your heart.  The vintage farm girl ambience is a lovely thing to wake up to, especially for brunch.  The community tables are a fun nuance that allows for some light conversation from happy strangers while we can all enjoy and marvel at our delicious eats.  The staff is friendly and attentive, always happy to suggest their daily favorite.The menu is always changing, except, of course, for a some staple dishes-- like the chicken and waffles, for example.  With each new dish I have here, I want only to come back and continue to try what's next.  The portions are perfect and the food is just downright tasty. Comforting, hearty, fresh, and healthful--not to mention, reasonably priced.  There are great vegetarian options, too.Go go go

I can see why people like this place, but you have to love kale, mushrooms, etc to appreciate their cooking. Everything tasted fresh and healthy, and the service was great (we were the only people there, probably because the hours were incorrect on Yelp & Google.) We filled up on pancakes and fritters before our food came. Cash only is a pain, even though there is an ATM on site. As a business owner, I get it.

This is a cute place.  It's got cute decor, it's got cute furniture, it's got cute additions, it's got cute artwork, it's got cute ceiling tiles and it's got a cute washroom as well.  The owner is cute, she's got a cute menu and she's pretty cute to chat with as well.I like the randomness of their serve ware and furniture, it's like having a meal at Granny's.  I've driven through the heartland and found places like this, places that seemed like it was food served in your country Grandmother's kitchen.Except this granny is not serving up the foods attained at the local (GMO) supermarket.  Not all of it.  She tries to offer locally sourced or grown vegetables, organic meats, decent coffee and an alternative for coffee being Almond milk.  I would have liked to see a milk variety like Organic, unpasteurized, grass fed, etc.  This is one condiment often skipped over by restaurants of this caliber.I stopped in with good company to check out their Sunday Brunch.  Parking was readily available and free on the street.  We three dined on the following; Brunch burger, Eggs Benedict and The 1552.  See online menu for details.  The plate was filled and most of us could not finish it.  My eggs Benny was perfect, poached but still runny, the hash was good and complimented with ketchup & hot sauce; how I usually desire it.  (On a side note: celery pieces in the hash were too honking big).  For starters we shared the fried pickles and French toast sticks.  View great photos on Yelp or most any other social media.  Between the two the French toast were my favorite.  Not entirely sweet like most French toast would be, the batter was almost sour but with powdered sugar and a light amount of syrup it was just right.  The brunchin' took time from when we sat to the time we finished.  If in a rush, I wouldn't suggest them as an option.  From first ordering to refills or receiving, the time taken were carefree and that can be a disappointing factor for some.Next visit: Chicken and waffles or their meatloaf sammy.
Love this place with all my heart.Amazing and soulful local food, charming vibes, locally owned and operated. Brunching done oh so well.

I went to Grandma J's Local Kitchen because of the reviews I read, and if those reviews were not favorable I wouldn't have gone to this restaurant.The food was OK, I ordered the Asparagus Benedict it took about 20mins for my husband and I to get our food. But that's not a bad thing if the food is hot when its served but it wasn't, and that doesn't sit well with me. My husband ordered the burger with poached eggs, I don't remember the menu name for the dish. But maybe that's the reason it took awhile before we received our order, and that's fine if whenever I get my food it is hot. I'm a stickler for having my food hot when it is served.The waitress did not top off my coffee until she was serving some other customers who happened to come in well after we did, and did I mention they received their food first!And last but not least, when it was time to pay my husband went to the register and stood there while the waitress was having a conversation with a customer and my husband had to walk a couple of steps back to the table where we were sitting to get her attention and she saw him get up in the first place but she never turned her head to see if he was standing there and she should have because she had just given us the check.Bottom Line I Would Not Recommend Grandma J's Local KitchenP.S. My husband and I are a Bi-racial couple and we are both minority.Hummm......

We've had some good experiences here, which is why I'm not giving it one star. After about a 15 minute wait we were seated, but then were asked to share our table with other customers who hadn't been waiting as long. Our food took almost 50 minutes, when it finally came it was horrible. The biscuits and Gravy wasn't even gravy, just greasy meat on top. The kale in my the works was burnt and chewy, and whatever it was seasoned with was horrible. We couldn't get anyone's attention and no one ever came back to check on us. Then after pushing our plates to the side, it took another 30 minutes to get our check. The coffee is good. But needless to say we won't be going back.

So frustrated by this place!  We were told the wait would be 15 minutes when we arrived.  We waited 40 minutes.  They serve you complimentary fruit when you arrive, but neglected to serve us.  After ordering, we waited an additional 45 minutes for our food, and actually saw tables ahead of ours get their food before us.  There was no recognition of this by the staff.  The waffle fritters were straight up burned.  The french toast and grilled cheese were good and it was clear that the kitchen takes pride in (most of) its food.  Those things get a star.I haven't written a review in ages but really needed an outlet for my frustration.  I hope someone from management reads this review and becomes more cognizant of these service-related foibles.  Once those get ironed out, I think this place would be awesome.  However, life is too short to wait 90 minutes all told for food so I will not be back.Also, although the young lady serving us was abrupt (because she had EVERY SINGLE TABLE to serve all by herself), the young man who was in charge of serving food and refilling coffee was really delightful.  He gets a star.

Big cities always seem to have a profusion of these awesome little gems. Lucky Humboldt Park.Must knows:* cash only* hella friendly staff* solid yummy/ thumbs up on taste* like the limited number of selections* the armory across the street is a stunner to beholdThe iced tea was pretty sucky first time around, but they were so accommodating, they made another pitcher. It still wasn't great tea, but A for effort. I'd go back.

This place has really amazing food!We got there at 11 am on Saturday and there was no wait at all to be seated. It's BYOB so we can prepared with a bottle of vodka for bodies and champagne for mimosas.It looked like There were only 3 people working: kitchen, server, busser - so the service was SO SLOW. We had to wait forever just to get our order taken.  I was actually pretty crabby and hungry when the food arrived, but it was SO good I immediately forgave the bad service. Worth the wait. Delicious. Definitely going back

The chicken and waffles here are amazing! When ever my husband and I decide we want to withdrawal money for the cash only place we eat here. The service is great the food is great and there is hardly any noise. Will actually be there Saturday. My husband has had the fish and chips along with BLT. He is picky about how the fish is cooked so that is always the first item he orders. He loved it. Every once in awhile they do a burlesque show.
SO good. This little gem is in the most unexpected spot but it is divine. Such friendly people serving the most delicious food. Unexpected deliciousness. You must go.

Honestly, I didn't go into Bar Siena with super high expectations. Sure every dish is littered with truffle which makes everything better, but I'm a crazy person. A crazy person in that sense that I thought this was just a restaurant opened by some pseudo-celeb-not-from-Chicago-chef capitalizing on what is the best dining scene in the country. I have watched every season of Top Chef and must admit, if not already evident, I didn't love Fabio when he was on. Since then though, I've only heard good things about the guy and I gotta say - after trying his food, I'm a fan.Bar Siena is an interesting space. In my younger years, I used to come to this location when it was Dragonfly and club the night away. Bar Siena has kept the bones of the building's structure but completely revamped everything to be shiny & new, giving a very vibrant, music thumping, dimly lit yet comfortable atmosphere for your dining. I could have done with the music being turned down a bit though. Our server was just fantastic throughout our meal, attentive but not overly so, well informed and just super friendly sharing some little tidbits of knowledge here & there.They have a respectable drink list including wines, beers and some cool sounding cocktails. Being the beer chick that I am, I opted for the West Coast IPA ($7) and was pleased with the imperial IPA - delicious!Bar Siena heats their pizzas in a beautiful oven on their first-floor, open for viewing kitchen. Every pizza combination on their menu sounded so great - we decided to do a half & half pizza. On one half was wild mushrooms, garlic, white truffle oil, fontina and shaved parmesan. This left a bit to be desired as we didn't get quite as much truffle & bang as we hoped for, however it was a respectable pizza. On our other half, we went with their Prosciutto Fig combo. Aside from the aforementioned ingredients, it included spiced pistachio, taleggio cheese, truffle honey and greens. It was so incredibly delicious and makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Our half & half pizza ran us $19. I'd get this pizza again in a second and honestly can't wait to try more of their ambrosial concoctions.Then the pastas! Holy goodness the pastas. The Sweet Corn Ravioli ($17) was the best pasta I've had in a long time, perhaps ever. It was so incredibly creamy with a rich truffle butter base, well done raviolis surrounded by chiodini mushrooms, all just going together harmoniously for my mouth's complete satisfaction.  We also did their Bar Siena's Short Rib Lasagna ($19) which comes out in an adorable little pan straight from the oven. Again, a very rich pasta with perfection in ingredients married throughout. Just as with the pizzas, I cannot wait to come back and try other carb loaded dishes.Needless to say, we had leftovers between the two of us. But also needless to say after such a great meal, we saved just enough room in our bellies to try some dessert. We both ordered a $5 gelato and their portions were generous! We would have been plenty fine splitting one. I had the Double Chocolate and it was decadent with pieces of chocolate chipped inside the creamy gelato - I just loved it but couldn't even finish my portion. My friend had the carrot cake gelato with chunks of actual cake in it and if that's your thing, you're sure to enjoy it.Bar Siena, you've surprised me! I walked in expecting another ho hum meal that would be good, but forgettable and ended up being blown away by the heavenly food!

Made reservations a month in advance. Did not know that the Cubs would be playing that night, so it made for a great atmosphere, but with or without the Cubs playoff game on TV, the bar area, dj music playing in background still would have had a great buzzy sound.  With that said, it is not a steak restaurant or upscale restaurant, but a perfect combination restaurant for co-workers or date night where conversation is not the main priority.Ana - our server was probably the best in Chicago. Treated us as friends, with the upmost respect, was timely on her check-ins and made good calls regarding what to order (drinks and food) when we asked. When you first read the menu before going in, you think it is just basic Italian food, but everything has a twist. For example: Short Rib Lasagna (fantastic). Place gets crowded after 6pm, but when weather is nice, many people will sit outside.

Great food, drinks, and atmosphere come together nicely at Bar Siena.  As a fan of Siena Tavern, I knew I had to try Bar Siena, and I was not disappointed!  It turned out to be a fantastic spot to grab brunch on the weekend, with some standout items on the menu still on my mind.I went with the Steak and Eggs because you can never go wrong with that classic combo!  I asked for medium rare, and out came one of the most tender cuts of meat I've had in a long time.  The skirt steak could have used a little more flavor, but that juicy cut helped to offset any flavor deficiency.  The waffle hash brown hit the spot - tasty with just the right texture.  The sunny side eggs were cooked well, and everything together made for an outstanding brunch item.I tried a few bites of the other dishes ordered and wished I had room for those as well!  My fiancée ordered the Lobster Benedict, and yes, it tasted just as good as the name suggests!  Perhaps the sleeper dish here is the Short Rib Hash, which my sister ordered.  My goodness, what flavor!  And despite teetering on the edge of feeling utterly stuffed, out came the gelato!  (Do yourself a favor and order the Coffee & Caramel Crisp gelato.)The service was excellent.  Our server was attentive and friendly, which made our experience at Bar Siena that much better.  I also really enjoyed the atmosphere.  You could tell that it was really busy inside, but our rounded booth felt cozy, and we were able to enjoy our conversation because it didn't seem loud despite being pretty close to another table.  The restaurant's signature is the illuminated "tree" in the center which reaches up past the second floor.  It made for a nice visual while you ate.We were really happy with our experience at Bar Siena and look forward to making our way back.

The restaurant ambiance is nice with the lighted tree leading into the second floor. Bar space is nice and ample with plenty of Tv's to catch a game. We had reservations are were told our table would be ready in a few minutes... which turned into 45 minutes and us checking back in... waiter also overlooked us numerous times once seated. I understand that this place is a hot spot but this wait time and poor service resulted in my lower stars.Food was awesome and drink options were great. I highly recommend the skirt steak with the flavorful salsa verde, the spinach and ricotta calzone (large enough to share if you chose) and the burrata (candied pistachios were a fantastic touch) to start off.I'd like to say that I will return but the poor service has left a bad aftertaste.

While waiting for our table in girls and the goat, we came here for couple drinks.  Most places on this street looked like nice places and so was this one.This looks like a pet friendly place. It's nice and cozy inside too. Service was good even tho we were just sitting by the bars.I had glass of Rieslings from the menu, it was not bad. A little dry but was still sweet enough for me.I also tried an appetizer called bread and ricotta. It was mixed with roasted grape and sea salts. The bread were crunch enough while the roasted grape was just so good. It was a great mix with sweet and savory.  This appetizer was amazing good.Overall, this place is really a cool place too.

This is a great place to dine with friends or family.  My daughter and I met for a dinner date after work. It was wonderful.They have a great beer, wine and cocktail list. Love their selection of bourbons.  Not huge, but a great mix of standard top shelf and some craft bourbons. I had the Koval neat, a bourbon made in Chicago. Perfect.We also had their version of an Old Fashion (no. 4) and their version of a Moscow Mule. Really smooth, very refreshing and drinkable.Service was five stars.  Our waitress knew the menu and had great recommendations.   We started with the Burrata which they make and it is fresh and creamy. Wonderful.  We also had the Grilled Octopus which was very good. The flavors were wonderful and the full plate with chili and greens made it perfect. Highly recommend that.We also had their Salumi platter. Their version of a Charcuterie platter. It was good, but I have had a better variety at other locations. If you have a taste, go for it.We split their version of a Lasagna made with braised short ribs.  Although they veered from the traditional, it was amazing flavor. It was also very heavy - and filling. It was really good.And please make sure you leave room for desert. They have these amazing Donuts and a Spiced Cake with RumChata gelato.  LOVED it all.Definitely will be back, even just for a cocktail or desert.

I have only been to Siena Tavern and had a great time at a company event...When my friend and i wandering around the west loop busy catching up saw Bar Siena, my curiosity arose...wondering if it's as good as Siena Tavern....we both sat at the bar, Macro, our bartender, was very attentive and made really good drinks! it was only day time...and i am already buzzed....o..well..after all, it was a friday :DHe also gave us good tips on food....with his rec'd, we got scotch egg ,white tuna crudo, chopped salad sweet corn ravioli. we shared everything...then he brought us a bomboloni ..an italian doughnuts- salted caramel was the best..sweet and a bit of savory on the super soft dough...all in all, thanks to marco., my friend and i enjoyed our visit.

Brunch review: YUM!!!!!!! What a hitI came in with my friend and it was busier then I have ever seen (maybe bc it was west loop art fest) and we waited a good 30 min.We sat outside and it was hot as hell but whatever Id rather it be hot than below 0.We ordered:Lobster BenedictAvocado toastSide order of chicken sausage (skip this not a fan it was super dry and I didn't even eat it)Waffle hashbrownsI had a mimosa- delishMy friend had the Bloody Mary- she said it was amazing.Service was not too bad our waiter gave us some good suggestions and pointed me in the direction of avocado toast when I was in between a few options.

This place is AMAZING! Come super hungry and bring friends because you're going to want to try everything. The cocktail #4 is the best old fashioned I've ever had and #8 is so yummy as well. Get a pizza and do half one kind and half another. The garlic truffle mushroom and fireball pepperoni are to die for. Also the Maine lobster Agnolotti is rich and soooo yummy. A must try!!! I can't wait to come back. Such a cool scene too. The decor is really cool, and our waitress was so incredibly nice and helpful.

*** 1/2 stars overallMy trip to Chicago was filled with great food.  We were supposed to go to Little Goat on a Friday evening but due to a kitchen issue.  They shut down and we were left wondering where to go nearby.  Bar Siena looked like a great choice with it's vast menu and interesting 2 level environment.  There were some misses on the food side but the service seemed really disinterested in being there and we constantly had to flag her to get anything... a clean fork, our order, water refill, dessert order, and the bill... you get the general idea.Food wise .. it was ok.  The salmon really redeemed the entire night meal but it was just the one pt. Chopped salad was unmemorable, the pizza was not as good as Forno Rosso which is just down the street... the prosciutto fig was nearly inedible with the huge amount of honey which made it over the top sweet, the gelato wasnt bad but it a touch too sweet and the bomboloni was good but I think we should have gotten a different flavour.Overall, not a bad choice for Randolph but I much rather go to Forno Rosso or Little Goat for a place that isn't too fancy and more relaxed.
Review just of the No 4 drink, their take on a manhattan. Too sweet, unbalanced.Bar Siena is a cute restaurant but more of a wine bar - will be back to try their pizzas!

Great service, nice menu selection and decent drink  list.  Nice ambiance - very relaxing.  Came with a group of five and we were quickly seated.  Everyone had wonderful meals.  I will definitely come back.

Stumbled into this place on a whim, while waiting for reservations across the street. Between the service from our incredible server Marko and the delicious food and drinks, we ditched our other reservation and stayed the entire day. One of the best spots in Chicago for sure!!!

I was sharing an uber with a semi alcoholic / foodie (aka my type of person) who was giving me awesome places to eat/drink in Chicago.  West loop was apparently the new foodie haven - even the driver agreed!First impression - cute hostess, cute server, classy yet casual atmosphere, check check check.The food is definitely NYC prices - a lot higher than we were seeing in the rest of Chicago but completely worth it.Drinks were on point - very well made by another very cute bartender.This place combined my two favorite things - corn & ravioli.  And the outcome? F#!$ing spectacular.

I really love this place!  Bar Siena is not only great for lunch and dinner but a great Brunch spot.  I even love that I can stop by for my late night s'more Gelato fix.  I haven't had a restaurant in quite some time that I can say is my go-to, until Siena.  I honestly like this location better than sister restaurant, Siena Tavern, location is great (parking is a bummer but that's what Uber/lyft is for).  A couple my order items would be the Bread and Ricotta, this is seriously crave worthy, I get it everytime.  Next, the meatballs, no matter the time of day they are just perfect, just like my little italian gram makes.  For main's the gnocchi is fabulous and short rib lasagna never fail.  For dessert, many go for the bombolini but not me, s'more gelato all the way, unless it's brunch and in that case the breakfast bombo sandwich is tops!!!!!!

Went inside here on a whim because we finished our work early and definitely need a drink! A pretty good selection of alcohol inside the cutest restaurant. There were Christmas lights in the middle of the bar! Food-wise, I think it's a little pricey for what is it, but it doesn't stop the food from being delicious.I had the sweet corn ravioli. It was really good, a pretty balanced sweet and savory entree, but a bit on the smaller serving size. When I got it, my friends asked, "are you sure you don't want to order something else?" Luckily, with the amount of food that we ordered (plus dessert), I did end up being full.I do want to make a remark about the dessert. We had the honeycomb gelato and I still can't believe they make this stuff in house! It was sweet, but not too sweet and the little bits of honey made me smile on the inside! We also had the bombolini (they're popular for this), but I thought it was too sweet after my gelato I do suggest trying this though!

Classy atmosphere, good service, quick and tasty food, everything you could want in a restaurant.  Plus the high top tables and the bar are first come first served, which can significantly cut down on a wait time.The Short Rib lasagna is to die for, delicious, first time I've had a white, roasted garlic bechamel sauce and it definitely worked, albeit a tad salty.  It's a plate size, not the large tray that a lot of pictures made it look like, but it will still fill you up.  The Lobster agnolotti (which means ravioli with lobster meat in it) was generous with the lobster, both inside and as part of the sauce.  The No 5 Cocktail, made with Botanist Gin, has a floral aroma and taste to it, but can appear to be very strong.  The lemon is a weak flavor, with the gin and rose as the primary flavors. There is a special take out window for their bomboloni deserts (donuts filled with a custard), but the vanilla bean edition was nothing special, would not order again.

Business lunch at Bar Siena, and I stick by my original review. The meatballs are very good, as was our flatbread, but chopped salads with chicken, not even up to Portillos standards, or Maggianos.We done here!

I like their Siena Tavern in River North and had been wanting to try the more casual Bar Siena in the west loop.The food was very good! Each small plate we order had an interesting twist. We started with the grilled octopus, which had a great grilled flavor and very tender. The twist was the charred escarole, shishito peppers and Calabrian chili vinaigrette. Nice spicy dish. Next we had the grilled shrimp and artichoke hearts. The twist was the sautéed spinach with blistered tomatoes and chili flake.We then had a pizza with wild mushrooms and garlic, but it was pushed over the top with truffle oil. I wish we had room for dessert because it was very tempting.

I have dined here for both dinner and brunch and the food, service and atmosphere have been great on each visit. For brunch I would recommend the avocado toast served with a poached egg; the order comes with one piece of toast but it is rich and filling. If you have a sweet tooth you should not pass up a bombolini from their Bomobar menu!For cocktails, I have tried No. 3, which is a martini, and No. 9, which is essentially a Moscow mule, and both were fresh without being overly sweet.There are several tasty dinner options, and being vegetarian was not challenging when ordering as the server suggested they could modify several of their dishes to satisfy dietary preference. Overall, I would recommend Bar Siena and I will return for another meal.

Great brunch with unique combos and fresh ingredients. We got the grilled octopus, which came with nice big pieces of octopus and blistered peppers. Then came the scotch egg which was covered in an amazing prosciutto sausage and served over truffle polenta (I love truffle and I love polenta!!). We finished with the breakfast pizza, and the tomatoes on that thing just tasted so darn fresh! Great service and cool atmosphere on the second floor with the tree sticking out!

5 stars for best customer service HANDS DOWN.From the moment we walked in, the hostess was extremely helpful, she let us know about the menu because it was our first time there and assisted us with our luggage since we just got off the bus from Wisconsin!The place is huge and seats a lot of people. There is an upstairs, but I didn't check it out. My friends and I sat outside and we really enjoyed it.The restaurant was beautiful!Our server was amazing, he literally went through every pizza with us, as well as drinks. Oh by the way, Pizza was only available for the time we went. It was pretty  late, around 10ish! For drinks, I ordered the number 12 and LOVED it. It was so tasty, my boyfriend ordered the number 8, his drink was great as well!For the pizza we ordered the Wild Mushroom and Garlic Pizza, THIS is where the amazing customer service showed again. When out pizza came out, it was extremely burnt. The server knew how hungry we were, so he was extremely apologetic and made sure the chef made us a new pizza. After the server apologized, the manager came out and apologized again and explained to us that the chef got hit with about 20 orders, so he got extremely busy.Next thing you know, we got the new pizza, WHICH WAS SO GOOD! Then, the server brought us out new plates, and said we're bringing out deserts, enjoy them on us! We had the three bombolonis (nutella cream and orginal) and a nutella calzone. All the deserts were amazing.Although, our first pizza came out burnt, the service and the taste of all the food made up for it. I highly reccommend this place.

High rating and high vibe at Bar Siena. Nothing disappointed. This is one of the hottest spots in the West Loop. If you wanna be trendy, please check this out.A modern Italian & American restaurant with a very nice ambiance. Nice seating options,  starting at the center with their attractive bar that's surrounding by the lower chair and the bar is surrounding by the bistro tables and high chairs. There are a few good looking booths by the end of the restaurant, against the wall and they always fully booked. The Main dinning is on the second floor with a separate bar up there so you don't have to wait forever for  your drinks, smart! As it is a big space. The patio is opening up in the summer, very soon and I can't wait!There is a very cool and  crazy tree at the middle of the bar with the lights on it. The darker the better so you can see how gorgeous it is at night time. The tree is high up, all the way to the ceiling on the second floor, very creative idea and it looks so cool. There is a giant TV screen with no audio hanging on the tree for some distractions(???)Never heard any complaints about food & drinks here but a long waiting line to get in or sometimes up to 2 hours wait on weekends ( no kidding)I love Bar Siena, great time there, always. I miss the Crudo: Salmon-Spicy cucumber relish, pine nut and sea salt, it's so delicious. One thing that I must do every time when I go there is giving myself an extra  treat with their well known bombolini with chocolate & salted caramel cream, yummy!  I also love the fact that they have so many light beers that I love like, Blance De Bruxelles and more.The service here is spectacular.Wanna be trendy? go to Bar Siena ;)

Cool ambiance. It a fun hangout place no matter what time you come. The decor is edgy, modern, feminine, yet masculine. Kudos to the designer!The service is decent... Minus the fact that, for some reason... I went to the bathroom two times while dining there in a Saturday afternoon... THEY RAN OUT OF TOILET PAPER! The first time I went to the bathroom, all 3 stalls did not have any toilet paper. Weird.The food was decent. It was nothing spectacular. There was nothing that stood out to me. The only one that stood out, was their pistachio gelato. It was, most definitely, the worst gelato I've ever had. I couldn't eat half of it.But I shall be back to try other stuff. Not sure how soon, but one day! Especially for drinks!

I came to Bar Siena to grab a drink prior to A dinner at Girl&Goat. It was a little after 5 on a Wednesday but they must be doing something right because the bar was packed.  Everything seemed reasonably priced for the area and the food menu intrigued me. Although I only had their red sangria, which was a little bit too sweet for my taste, I would definitely want to come back to check out their food menu.

As per my prior experience, the food was exceptional. But in my latest rounds abouts, my experience was unexceptional. Willing to wait the full hour and half estimate at the bar, we were disappointed to find out our name was dropped from the list for no apparent reason. Once the issue surfaced with the help of our party, the host management did little to atone for the error, and placed us back on the waiting list instead of seating us first. Rather disappointing.

I came here hoping to have the best time and it was overall okay. I had made reservations and when we got there and on time we still had to wait a little for our table. We got some drinks ordered which were good and it took a little while for our server to approach us.Once she finally did come again we decided to order a couple of things and I specifically asked for all our food to be spaced out and not to come out right at once. Well, so much for listening. It all came out at once. We ordered the fig and procciuto pizza and it was okay, definitely tasty, but not as hyped up as people make it out to be but maybe that's just me as I'm not obsessed with Figs in general so it was a little sweet for me. What I did love was the corn truffle ravioli, now those deserve a star by itself as they were amazing, rich and the right amount of sweetness. I would definitely recommend those. We were a little put off my the service as we didn't want everything at once, but what can we do. We also felt a little rushed out of there the minute we were done eating but not drinking.So this place is nice and can be a fun place to grab drinks with your friends but I was definitely a little turned off by their service.

BRUNCH REVIEW!After trying to get a spot for 7 at Grange Hall and not wanting to wait at Little Goat on a sunny and chilly Saturday morning we were happy to get into Bar Siena with out reservations at 10:15 (I do recommend making reservations though!) We were seated upstairs on a long rectangular table and it was perfect. The brunch menu consists of 4 sweet options and 9 savory options! Many of my friends got the breakfast sandwich and a few of us ordered the Short Rib Hash.The short rib hash was unbelievable-my favorite from every single brunch spot in Chicago. The portion size was generous- and the fork split the meat so tenderly and the juice flavors were so inviting. Put on top of perfectly cooked seasoned tomatoes and fresh vegetables that were steamed so perfectly- I was in brunch heaven. The presentation is great too. For the egg sandwiches, the potatoes came in a funnel. You'll make a mistake if you don't get the Caramelized Waffle for the table- the nutella is warm and melts right in the mouth.Coffee is strong and hot- and it was nice, quiet chatter, bright open windows environment- making it a family friendly and great restaurant choice for brunch.

Came in on sunday, Stephanie was our server. She was fantastic. We had the pork ribs per her suggestion and they were amazing, as was everything else we ordered. Everything was great, atmosphere was wonderful!!!!!!!!

We came here for brunch on a Saturday. The area is very cute during such a time, with lots of restaurants with outdoor patios. Even the inside of bar Siena though is well decorated.I had the chopped salad and a coffee. The salad was very good and hearty. Lots of tasty ingredients. I also tried the prosciutto omelet, which was delicious and flavorful. The potatoes were also pretty good. The spinach omelet was yummy as well. We also ordered the verde cold pressed juice- a refreshing accompaniment.The service was great and the atmosphere very pleasing for the family outing this Saturday afternoon. A great find!

I was really excited to try Bar Siena for the first time. It's a really fun atmosphere but I really wish the sound had been for the game. That's the main reason I gave it 2 stars.However, the bar staff was great and they really deserve 5 stars.

Amazing decor for date night as the light decorations are breath taking, the staff are very friendly, and the food was filling.The food was filling although not all that satisfying. My boyfriend and I started with some meat and cheeses, the Prosciutto and Salami for the meats, and the Grana and Tremor for our cheeses. We ordered those based on our servers recommendations and we were right to follow them. The Tremor is a softer more creamy cheese as opposed to the dryer more dense Grana. The Prosciutto and Salami were both amazing and the salty and savoriness paired well with the raisin bread slices and the little peppers, figs, and candied walnuts. Amazing starter for sure!For our entrees, we ordered the Langoustine Risotto and the Lobster Agnolotti. The Risotto was underwhelming, presentation wise and flavor wise. For a $21 dish, there should have been whole shrimp pieces and not just bits cut up from one shrimp. The rice was cooked to be fluffy and had a great texture and seasoning was balanced. The Lobster Agnolotti was much better and lived up to the hype in the other reviews. There was a good amount of lobster pieces, the béchamel sauce was lovely, and the agnolotti was cooked to perfection.For dessert, we decided to try their homemade gelato, the toasted coconut and fudge flavor. The Coconut flavor was definitely lacking, only the shreds really proved the existence of coconut in this gelato. The fudge was abundant and took over in flavor.

Went in for a late and quick dinner last night. The staff takes a lot of pride in their restaurant! When we were seated the hostess very excitedly asked us how we heard of them. I think we disappointed her a little when we said we were just walking by and came in.My friend and I shared the gnocchi. It was alright - the sauce tasted like it came from a frozen dinner package. :/ We were super hungry at the time so we didn't really care, but thinking back on it, it wasn't that great.We didn't get any drinks this time, but their cocktails looked pretty good. Might go back for drinks, but probably not food.

We came here for brunch and I don't see what the hype is about. We got the breakfast pizza, spinach omelette, bombo benedict,  and avocado toast. They were all O.K. minus the benedict, which was awful. The only reason they got 3 stars is because the bloody marys were good and the atmosphere was pleasant. To that note, we ordered an extra shot for the bloodies and it doubled the price of them. Outrageous. We could have just gotten a second one.

Around 6:30 on a Friday we were told it would be an hour and a half wait for 2 people. We left to go get a drink at another bar, but surprisingly got a text to come back before we even ordered a drink! That was a pleasant turn of events.We got the Parmesan truffle potato skins to start- yum! Love the garlic aoli it comes with. From there we got the fig pizza, which also very good, but not as mind blowing as other Yelpers would lead you to believe. We also ordered a side of baked shishito peppers because that is my absolute favorite dish at Girl And The Goat... Sadly they did not live up to those. Drinks were solid, a bit pricey. I think I'd like to come back here with a group where you would be able to try a few dishes/pizzas.

Went for brunch. Despite previous reviews I found their selection to be a disappointment. Ordered coffee. Should have walked out when the cream we were served was sour. It fell  chunks into the coffee. Gross. I ordered a pizza and asked if they could put an egg on it. Brunch right? The waiter seemed confused and when my pizza came it had an egg that was hard. The pizza was definately a frozen pizza. I could totally tell. My daughter had the spinach calzone, like I said before, not many brunch items offered. That was stuffed with frozen chopped spinach. We also ordered a side of "waffle potatoes". How something can get greasy from a waffle iron is beyond me! It was swimming in grease. I should have gotten the clue when every restaurant on W Randolph was packed, this place was empty. I know why.Our bill was $50!!!!! That is outrageous for what I was served.  INever again.

Great experience here. I made a reservation a few weeks in advance and the day of, I had to push it back a few times since we were running behind. They were great about it. Once we got there, we got seated right away.I ordered a Wild mushroom and garlic with arugala and it was great! I would love to come back and try more dishes.

I'm still a fan!Had another great brunch at Bar Siena last Sunday -- it has such a cool vibe and the food is delicious. We shared the short rib hash and the bombo breakfast sandwich. Both were very good: the short rib hash is a much more filling meal, but the bombo sandwich (pancetta cured bacon, pork sausage, eggs, cheese) is simply awesome. Bar Siena will continue to be in the brunch rotation.

So good! Awesome place- whether for a date or meet up with friends. The bar is really cool, cute patio, fun and modern decor. We had the fig and goat cheese pizza and I've thought about it ever since! Our waitress was super friendly too. We love this place.

Billed as rustic and more authentic to its Italian inspiration than Siena Tavern, Bar Siena actually does have so much more charm than its River North counterpart.We came for brunch around noon on a Sunday with no reservation. At first we were told it would be a 45 min wait, but then a table for four opened up serendipitously.I got the bombo benedict. The eggs were perfect, and the pork belly, watercress, and hollandaise complemented each other well. No complaints at all.Didn't have much room for dessert because I scarfed down the bombo benedict, but wanted to try the bomboloni, so got the mixed berry because it seemed like the best option for a full stomach at the time. It was good. Just good. Would probably try the maple, chocolate, or vanilla on a less full stomach next time.

This place was sooooooo good! I had my fingers crossed being a Tuesday night in all that maybe we would be okay with seating. No such luck. The first two times I attempted to come here I was quoted a two hour wait. This time we were quoted 50 minutes. Bar seating area though is first come first serve. This really cute couple waived us over at the bar to let us know that they were about to leave and viola I finally got to try this place out. They do take reservations, but what's the fun in that. I'm the type that just likes to roll up in the place :)My friend and I share everything and decided to go with the wild mushroom garlic pizza. Pure Yumminess! The crust is thin and crispy and you can really taste all the ingredients. For dessert we went with the Nutella Calzone. Again another home run! I cannot wait to try the other items on the menu. They have a vast selection and everything looked delicious.I also noticed they have an upstairs. The atmosphere is really pretty and put me in the holiday spirit. It's hard to believe this place used to be Dragonfly. I'm starting to show my age so I'll stop....
Good spot with great cocktails and the food, service was superb, our bartender Marco recommended the food and drinks we got no disappointed! Everything was spot on! Great great service

Lively atmosphere with attentive servers.  The menu is meant to be shared plates so it's great for small groups.  The portions are on the smaller side so I'd recommend sharing rather than each ordering one.  We tried the short rib lasagna and sweet corn ravioli, which were both tasty.  Because they were a bit smaller, we definitely had a lot of room for dessert, which we took full advantage of.  We had a salted caramel bombolini with scoops of straciatella and brown butter pecan gelato.  The bombolini was puffy and airy with a delicious filling.Overall, the food was all tasty and service was fast.  If you want a quieter table, I'd recommend trying to sit upstairs by the lit tree.

To start we had the Burrata. Absolutely amazing, the sweet and salty combination was so perfect. The only complaint was with the polenta bread, I wish it wasn't so hard to bite into, kind of took away from the deliciousness.Second we had the chilled avocado chili soup. ... Extremely salty. So salty my mom ended up sending it back. Shame.Moving on to the meatball sandwich. OUTSTANDING. SO delicious the fries were amazing definitely the best thing we had.We also ordered the sweet corn ravioli. It was extremely rich, but again so so so salty. Again, disappointed.So overall 2/4 on what we got for lunch. Seems like a hit or miss depending on what you order.In terms of the atmosphere I like the decorating, the industrial feel is great but a little loud for my tastes, I couldn't really hear my mom and she was across from me.But it was reasonably priced for what we got and the portion size.The BomboBar is amazing as well the gelato was incredible. Definitely check that out.

I went here last Saturday for brunch after a close friend highly recommended it. I was definitely surprised by the wide variety of items that they had to offer. I loved the summery vibes that I was getting from this place. The wooden furniture and stringed lights really made the atmosphere feel very open and welcoming. Also, there's a sense of warm welcome and coziness that I got from it. It's a very cute place, and I wish I had more time to just sit there and enjoy the environment with a few drinks.As for the food I ordered, I went with a "Puff Pancake," which was essentially lemon whipped ricotta, with blueberries on top, and maple syrup. I also decided to split the "Parmesan Truffle Potato Slices," with a friend. Though I'm not an extreme pancake lover, the description of the puff pancake in the menu definitely sold me. The pancake itself was absolutely amazing. It's served in the actual griddle that it's made in, so it's still very warm when you take your first bite. The potato slices, on the other hand, were slightly disappointing because I seemed to taste more of pure salt, rather than the parmesan, truffle seasoning.Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I will definitely be coming back for perhaps another meal, and definitely for their drinks. I would personally come here with my girl friends to have a girls' brunch/night out, or it would be a perfect location for a date.

This place is a magical fairy forest of food. Or something.Mom and I left super stuffed after our meal of foccacia, burrata salad, short rib lasagna and...French toast (yeah, I know, it's a weird combo, but as our girl Selena Gomez says, "The heart wants what it wants.").The food was totally on point, delicious, not pretentious and left me wanting to return immediately to try more.The clientele this morning was a little douchey, and the waiter/bus boys didn't bring us new plates to dish up French toast after a salad (which was kind of a gross combo on the same plate). Other than that, get yourself here ASAP and bask in the glow of the fairy lights.

I was a big fan of Fabio on Top Chef, and was really excited when I heard about Bar Siena. I came with my fiance and another couple one fall evening when it was still nice enough to sit on the patio, and we enjoyed appetizers and desserts. The meatballs are perfectly fork tender and plump, and the potato skins with parmesan and truffle are so crisp and tasty. We finished up with mixed berry bomboloni and honeycomb gelato, which is to die for! So fresh, so delicious.I returned last Saturday night with a group of about ten of us, and managed to take over a booth despite the quite happening number of people there around 11 p.m. I really love the giant lit tree that stretches from the first floor bar up the second floor; I haven't been up there yet but would love to check it out for dinner one day. This time my fiance and I split the fig prosciutto flatbread, and ohmygosh is that good. Salty meat, savory truffle oil, and the sweet roasted fig - we have been talking about that pizza for days. For dessert I went with the salted caramel bomboloni, which gets two thumbs up, and a shoutout to my friend's dessert, the nutella calzone, I'm coming for you next.
