Does the world need designer soup? no we have enough issues as it is.Its very frustrating waiting 25 minutes for your specialty minestroni with onions or whatever you hope to be getting during lunch. The line is a case of bafflement to me.Its best to come here after 5:30 PM...The sourdough bread is awesome. If you are a soup purist, you can find better soup at the Jewel Osco that you can make at home for less then $2.99. Just a thought.

I absolutely loved this place. It was a nice cute shop but with a great ambiance. There were so many variety of soups to try. It was particularly difficult to pick. In the end, I discovered I could mix two soups together. In addition to their soups, I recommend definitely ordering a grilled cheese sandwich on the side.

An unexpectedly chilly day. A couple in search of warmth and sustenance. A beacon, shining on Chicago Avenue!Our noble heroes were able to warm up from the inside with delicious soups and breads. Creamy chicken soup, lobster bisque, and grilled cheese left our intrepid voyageurs ready to brave the elements and hit the town.Reasonable prices, excellent soups, tasty breads, and free samples as well!

Stopped by for a quick and cheap lunch after being in a soup and fall day mood! While my selection was good (chicken dumpling), it wasn't worth a price tag of $11.00. I'd be willing to pay this for soup and half sandwich... Soup and a drink... Soup and a brownie... But just soup? For $11? That's a little silly people.

I really like the atmosphere and the variety of soup is incredible. I had the butternut squash soup my latest visit. Nick was really nice and offered to let me sample every soup until I found the one I like. I only tried that one and asked about an ingredient in it. He didn't know off hand and asked around. He couldn't get the answer from his immediate coworkers and offered to call and find out. I think that was a really nice gesture. I will definitely be back.

I'm baaaack! Seriously, it's been too long.There's nothing better than a hot, delicious soup with grilled cheese on a cold day. Nothing. I will triple dog dare you to find me something that will top that.I can't remember if they served grilled cheese the last time I was here, but they do now! It's the perfect addition to their many soups. I'm pretty sure I went into cheesy coma after devouring the lobster bisque and grilled cheese on multigrain.You go Soupbox! You are truly a gem in Chicago.P.S. I literally awww'ed when the employee brought me out the grilled cheese in the shape of heart. I can't quit you, Soupbox.P.P.S. I just realized I got the same soup last time!

This place is comfort food personified. There are so many different selections of soup, and you can get a grilled cheese sandwich on the side.Pick your soup, pick your bread and cheese, and decide whether you want to add bacon and/or ham to your sandwich. The perfect lunch for a rainy day!I got the minestrone and a ham and cheese sammy to go. After a short shopping trip and the few-blocks walk back to my hotel, my lunch was the perfect temperature for devouring.If you want soup, go here.
Really good soup! Perfect for any weather! 12 different kinds of soup! Really good bread too.
We have been back several times and the soup is always delicious. The Soupbox is one of my favorite places to eat near Water Tower Place.

Long-time customer and love the soups, but has gotten way too expensive.  Bowl of gumbo used to run about $9, now closer to $12.  There is a Cajun restaurant (on the 7th floor of another building) that doesn't even charge that much.  Other recent changes - you cannot grab packs of crackers, you need to ask the server, and then you'll be lucky to receive a couple of packs.  Also, the bread is about 1/3 of what they used to give you.  I guess the owners are boosting their profit margins, so long Soupbox....

The staff is very lovely and accommodating, but the food left me unsatisfied. I mean if you are going to claim the lobster bisque as your signature dish, there should actually be chunks of lobster in it...it was just a lobster broth with cream. The sourdough bread was okay, at least it added some substance to the soup.
First time at soupbox, they offer samples of the soups and they are all so fresh and tasty! Definitely coming here again. Staff is also very friendly.
I loved my cream of broccoli soup. But the grilled cheese is nothing to rave about.
Wow- over $10 for a cup of soup. Yes s regular not a large cup of soup. I don't care how good the soup is no cup of soup is worth that unless it is made with gold.

Just devoured a turkey/cranberry/cheddar sandwich with soup and potatoes.It was an awesome lunch!  catered by a sales rep for our office staff.All the favors tasted gourmet to me.  Great lunch.  Outstanding food.Jealous that I don't live closer as I would be there quite often.
Wife and I ordered a turkey sandwich, kale salad, lentil soup and grilled cheese from Uber Eats. We were blown away at the deliciousness. Very high quality. Can't wait to get more!

I like food here. But the cashier was not very friendly..Food ingredients, concept, decor are nice. I would probably go back sometimes...Kids menu is pretty good.Any sandwish or salads are good. Bit pricy as order service, meaning no waiter service place.

I'm a big fan of Blue Door. From the shabby chic decor to the farm fresh menu and laid back style, I feel at home here.Also, who doesn't like them some fresh cheesy apps, am I right? I tried both the goat cheese fig crostini and the burrata bruschetta. I love love LOVE that they pile on the fresh cheese--both goat and mozz with that great farm to table freshness and potency, paired with some crisp and savory bread. The goat is wonderfully sharp, accompanied by a nice and subtle fig sweetness. The burrata is wonderfully soft and literally melts in your mouth.My husband and I also shared the Farmhouse Club, which was spot on, exactly what I needed and craved.I'll definitely be back for more of some o' that Blue Door country home pizazz.

Located just east of the Armitage Brown Line stop, BDFS juxtaposes farm fresh eating with big city culture.For those who like their greens, the current menu features kale prepared four ways: baked with parmesan as a chip, combined with artichokes as a dip, as the base of two substantive salads and cold-pressed in green juice. The Brussels & Kale salad is a standout.On the sandwich front, the grilled cheese menu is so much more than its name suggests, and this season's flavors have the restaurant turning to pies for inspiration. The Pumpkin & Sage is BDFS's take on pumpkin pie, while Apple Pie & Bacon draws on its namesake's classic flavor.While BDFS is an ideal lunch spot, it also has a coffee, tea and juice counter that serves up beverages from two other Chicago businesses - Bow Truss Coffee Roasters and Harvest Juicery - making mornings a little better, too.

I love Blue Door's interior and menu! It's a great spot for lunch or even getting some work done. Their menu is quite extensive so coming back here would never be a bore. My favorite item here is their lentil soup. It's one of the best I've had to date with the perfect blend of herbs. I also really loved their turkey sandwich, though the one I had isn't on their menu anymore it seems. It is a bit pricey for the amount of food you get, but quality is top notch so I guess you are paying for that. The front of the shop has some local items for sale if you are interested in that.

This is a really good spot/ really like the rustic interior of the joint!  Basically it's a farm to table cafe with like 10 sandwich/ 5 salads on the menu.  They also have tons of baked goods such as cookies & muffins/ coffee, smoothies, etc.  The farmhouse salad is absolutely amazing, one of the best salads I've ever had with the basil vinaigrette!  On the other hand, the grilled cheese I tried was not so good.. undercooked and not much inside.  It's always busy and def a bit on the pricey side so be prepared! get dat did

You know what grinds my gears?  Walking over to a restaurant that appears open on Yelp, on their website, and has a working phone number, only to find that they are not open for business - on a day when the temperatures hit 90 degrees.  BDFS, you really need to put a note on Yelp or on your website OR add a recording to your phone number advising those who call that you're not open for business right now.

Loved this place the moment I walked in! It's super tucked in between buildings so we almost missed it on our way but when we walked in, the first thing that struck me was the interior design. Wooden floors, simple aesthetic - definitely had a "yuppy" feel.I only got a juice from here (Green Juice #4), which is actually the first time I've ever had a green juice of any kind, and it was delicious! Definitely a little herb-y but sweet enough that it was still very tasty.My friends and I sat at a small table and chatted for a good hour and a half or two hours and there was a constant bustle around the place. The servers brought my friends' meals to our table on cute wooden platters and they said everything was great - light but filling at the same time.I hope to be back very soon for some real food in the near future!

Amazing!!! If I lived in Chicago, I would eat here every single day. I got the kale and Brussel sprout salad which was a 10! Absolutely delicious..Love the decor, farm to table, and staff was so friendly!Only thing I wasn't so in love with was that they were out of most green juices by the time lunch rolled around! Oh well, the food made up for it

I have only been to this place once, but I absolutely loved it! The decor inside is adorable and I love all of the fresh options.BUT...does anyone know when they are opening their new location!? I want to go back!
Love the asian chicken salad and really good french dip.  My kids love the kids' options too. They also deliver through a bunch of apps and always shows up cold and fresh.

Excellent place! The salads and sandwiches are wonderful, so are the yummy crostini appetizers.  You can tell everything here is very fresh and farm to table as their name says.  The interior is shabby farm chic with very pretty light fixtures and country music playing, which is awesome!!Can't wait to come back, wish I lived closer!

Blue Door Farm Stand is such a cute little spot and a great place to grab lunch with a friend. Their salads are my favorite-colorful, beautiful, HUGE and delicious-The Cobb, Brussels & Kale, and Sesame Chicken are my favs. Great spot on Armitage makes it very easy to do a bit of walking and shopping when you're done!

More of a 3.5.Came Saturday for lunch and place was popping. After some confusion, boo and I realized we had to order first and then seat ourselves, in which servers brings us our orders. After ordering, we waited a bit but luckily snagged two seats at the bar top, in front of all the sandwich-making. I like the idea of the communal table they have there, but probably not for me. Space overall was very inviting.I got the tuna sandwich while bf had the gouda and ham. We also split an apple pie and bacon sammie. Sandwiches took a tad long to come. Since we were close to all the action, we saw some confusion amongst the servers, so that was unpleasant. We finally get our orders and they messed up boo's sandwich. However, the lady was nice and offered to box that one up, as she gave us the correct order, so we got a free sandwich.I enjoyed the tuna and everything tasted fresh. I like that it was a little different and had some string beans in there. The ham & gouda was pretty good too, as with the butternut squash soup. The apple pie & bacon one was quite yummy and not overly sweet, but definitely more a dessert imo. I also very much enjoyed the accompanied potato salad.Overall, I really enjoyed the place itself. Sandwiches were pretty good, but think there are betters options here, in which we would like to try. Definitely interested to see their new location on Halsted.

Absolutely love the food here -- wonderful salads and delicious sandwiches. The Brussel and kale salad is one of the best salads I've had.However, on the past three times I've gone here, each time something the staff does makes me a little turned off to the place. I heard two staff members talking about a third, have heard staff complaining about customers and also staff members fighting with each other about duties/yelling at each other to get things done. If the employees can get their act together and present a better front to customers, this place gets 5 stars no question. That's just stuff that needs to be dealt with off the clock. This also doesn't mean there aren't wonderful employees here, but it's just what I've witnessed.

Blue Door Farm Stand has pretty good sandwiches. Their lattes however could use a lot of work.I went in with my mom and my sister. We ordered the following:-Roast Beef French DipPretty tasty to be honest. Very flavorful. The dip on the side provided a lot of extra flavor and moisture-Blue Door Chicken Salad SandwichNot like your typical chicken salad. Still good but not exactly mind blowing.-LatteWe ordered this with a pump of hazelnut. The entire latte was flavorless. I could neither taste the espresso or the hazelnut. Would definitely not order again.Total price: $28All in all, incredibly overpriced. The Roast Beef French Dip sandwich was very tasty but it did not justify the price. It was $12 for a small sandwich with a tiny little tin of potato salad. I could not get over how bland the latte was.Overall this place is decent. It's very overpriced but the ingredients are fresh.

I love the concept of Blue Door -- fresh, seasonal food from local farms. There's even a chalkboard on the wall showing exactly where your food came from. I came in for lunch with a friend and ordered the kale and brussel sprout salad with a cup of the soup of the day. The soup was amazing: fennel, sweet potato and chicken. The salad looked great but was very bitter. It could have used more dressing or seasoning to combat the bitterness of the kale and sprouts.My soup and salad combination cost $10, which I thought was a fair price considering the quality of ingredients. I also considered purchasing one of the cold pressed juices until I saw that they cost the same as my entire meal: $9.50! I get that cold pressed juice is expensive but I'm a broke student and can't spend $10 on a beverage.
So excited to have a "grab and go" option for this delicious and healthy restaurant. I hope they stay open at this location when the new dine-in is open!

The turkey cheddar sandwich is absolutely delicious! I will absolutely order that next time I visit. Clark and I both ordered Cobb Salads with a half sandwich...his the Turkey, mine the Chicken Salad. The Chicken Salad in a wrap was delightful...even with a bit of a kick to it, which I normally do not prefer. This was great! The Cobb Salads came in tiny little boxes, but when I put it onto a separate plate to mix it up, it ended up being almost a whole meal in itself. They certainly do not short you on take out salads! A little too much Bleu Cheese for my liking, but all I had to do was pick the large chunks out.I love this place, but just wish it was slightly less expensive.

Very cool and simple atmosphere.Started with the Burrata Bruschetta.  This was simply better than almost anywhere else I have tried in the city.  Hands down a great small bite.The Farmhouse Club was a great classic sandwich which was done to perfection.  The serving size was huge and thus making it a great value.  Has to be my new favorite spot to get a sandwich.

Wow. Talk about tastey.I ordered the Grill Cheese Fig & Arugula and Brussels and Kale Salad. You can do half of each for $11, but I regret not doing a full one of each because that's how good it was.The grill cheese was very savory, that fig in it was the best, and now I'm going to start putting fig jam in my grill cheese.I don't like Brussel Sprouts, but the Brussels and Kale salad was amazing, w/e dressing they put in it was awesome.The cool thing about this place is they have a map of IL and MI where they where all their food comes from. It's a very rustic feeling inside, wood tables, homely bathrooms,  big bottles of glass water. The only problem with this place is the heat. It was like 15 degrees warmer in here than it was outside and it was 65 degrees out. Their kitchen gives off a lot of heat, and I left smelling like a kitchen, even 1 day later my coat still smells. Oh well. #worth.Also for dessert we got the carrot cake and split it 3 ways. It was amazing, can't go wrong, and it's all MASSIVE, so you definitely need to split it multiple ways.

I love this spot! If I lived/worked closer, I would be here all the time for lunch. I've been a few times for lunch/brunch, and I've been impressed with the quality of food and the overall selection. The atmosphere feels rustic chic (if that's even a thing), and they have some houseware/cookbook items to browse in the entryway area. A good spot to grab a delicious bite, coffee, snack, or host/hostess gift!

This place is legit. Feels like you're eating AT the farm. Highly recommend just about anything they do for breakfast and their Chicen Salad sandwich for lunch is maybe the best I've ever had.If I lived or worked closeby I would be here everyday. I hope it's here for years to come!

I absolutely loved it.  Loved it!  We were out shopping around North and Halsted, and got hungry so my friend recommended we try this, and what a great idea that was!We split the grilled cheese with fig and arugula - holy smokes it was amazing.We also split the brussels sprout and kale salad with the maple tahini dressing - WOW!  It was so so so good, and its like this giant huge mountain of a  salad.  Loved it.It was a very "Lincoln Park" restaurant to me (sorry to sound like a snob). Lots of children, lots of strollers.  It was loud in there, and after we got boxed into our table by 2 giant stroller we decided it was time to go.  However, it wouldn't detour me from going back because it was really that good.

Came by for dinner tonight; here's what I can tell, based on the clientele, the other reviews, and the chalkboard:  if you are a small female, or a male with a small appetite, and no matter what your gender you support the fresh/free-range/organic/natural market, then I think you are gonna love Blue Door.  Lots of great salad options, a few different sandwich/wrap options, cheese board selections and a wide range of desserts that appear to be made in-house.  There's a big space in the back plus the small seating area upfront, so lots of room...there's even a Goddess and the Grocer-style shop to buy items if you are on the run.I tried the Grown-Up grilled cheese sandwich...and that's my main criticism of Blue Door.  For $8, I got a pretty average grilled cheese sandwich, on some pretty tasty bread (Red Hen provides the bread, according to the menu) with something that added a little something special, which I learned later was a rosemary honey on the cheese.  The other ingredients were tasty but not mind-blowing.  But the SIZE of the sandwich was a joke.  I wish I was kidding about this, but after I had my sandwich and a bag of chips, I went to Brothers Beef nearby to pick up an italian beef.  I would say the Grown-Up was basically appetizer-size for a dish in Chicago.Now, again--if you are smaller, or come in not that hungry, OR come in for lunch (probably the best way to experience Blue Door, since they close early for dinner anyway), I think you'll be fine.  Just don't bring your 6'4", 230-pound former linebacker friend to Blue Door, as he will probably leave hungry, or angry, or hangry.

Who doesn't love Blue Door? After hearing about it over and over for months, I finally stopped by with friends for brunch.The location is great (right off the Armitage brown line stop), the place is quaint and adorable, the staff is friendly, and the food is wonderful.I had the Brown Line Wrap: Wheat Tortilla, Scrambled Eggs, Havarti Cheese, Bacon, Oven Roasted Onions, Red Bell Peppers. It didn't seem like anything special on paper but it was so fresh and you could tell that the vegetables were roasted with care. The havarti cheese with the eggs was delicious!My friend had the Sesame Chicken Salad and I caught her eating the dressing with a spoon. So I'm assuming that was great. :)We hung around for another hour or so after we finished, which left us time to try their Almond Milk Lattes. I love that they offer almond milk!I will be back ASAP for the Fig and Arugula Grilled Cheese.

It was my first visit here one Sunday afternoon around 2pm. The wait was about 10-15 minutes to find a table (seat yourself) for 4. One orders at the counter and they give you a number (a very cute wooden block with the number on it) to set down on the table. They bring the food out to you and then take the number away once your order is completed . It took less than 10 minutes for the food to come out. The food tasted fresh and delicious. The only disappointment was that they were out of their cold press juices so I couldn't try it. I would recommend this place. I've tried other farm-to-table type restaurants, and this is my favorite place.

Blue Door Farm Stand was bustling when I went for lunch on a Saturday. But with ample seating and plenty of staff, there was no worries of not having a seat. I decided to try one of the grilled cheese sandwiches, a sandwich I don't often eat. I went with the "Grown Up," which had gruyere, havarti, and swiss, plus basil and tomatoes and a rosemary honey. The sandwich was OK, really only OK, despite the terrific array of cheeses and bread from Red Hen Bread. The only flavors I really could taste were of the herbs, and the single, small piece of tomato was very flat. It's tomato season, and this is a farm-to-table themed place; how did I get a listless tomato??Completing the nostalgic lunch, I got a cup of the tomato bisque. The soup was quite tasty. Lots of flavor, a bit of spice, and a terrific creamy consistency. I wouldn't have minded it being a little thicker, so that it stuck better to the bread of my sandwich. But the flavor profile made up for the light density, and I scraped out every last drop.The cafe itself has a bunch of other fun things to try: pastries, cheeses, meats, juices, coffee, and so on. I did not have any of those things today, though I will note with approval that they had Nordic Creamery butters and cheeses--a terrific brand. I think if I had time to go back before I left the city, I'd try a coffee, a salad, and a different full sandwich. I still trust that the meats and vegetables are fresh and high quality, I just was less than thrilled with my particular sandwich. Maybe I should stick to not getting grilled cheese.

This place is super cute and good but pricey! Everything tasted super fresh and the salad I got was pretty large but not that amazing for the price. I would definitely go back to try something different and mostly because the decor is so quaint. The staff was a little slow and I was very confused about silver wear, I sat there thinking they would bring it to me since no one directed me to it as I left the counter, but for next time I will know!

Great restaurant, and affordable prices for the fully sustainable sourced food options. I went with a group so we tried a number of items.Charcuterie was delicious. So was the fig crostiniFig panini - do it. One of my favorites.Ham and cheese - tasty go-to but nothing super uniqueSalads - Had the beet and arugula salads. Both were tasty and VERY fresh. My one beef is they were very leaf heavy, and light on the accoutrements. PLUS because the portions were SO generous (which was fab) you definitely noticed only having 4 beet slides in there :)Dessert - They were very kind to deliver the banana/nutella later on. Thanks for the great service!Would definitely come back. Loved the ambience and casual counter-style ordering.

Just finished my first visit to Blue Door - very pleased - tried "The Halstead" (BD's version of a "pick two"), with a half of the Turkey & Aged Cheddar sandwich and the "petit" size of the  Brussels & Kale salad.  The turkey was fresh, the cheese, apple and bell pepper preserve were REALLY good and the lightly grilled multigrain bread was AWESOME (OK - it's out there - I'm a bread man....), but the best part of the meal was the Brussels & Kale salad - it had slivered almonds and a whisper of bacon with a maple tahini dressing - the combination of it all together was unforgettable.  It feels like I may be acting a little too over-effusive for what seems to have become a "trendy" menu item but it was REALLY good - try it for yourself!  Looking forward to going back!Oh - by the way - they have bacon brownies - just in case you were feeling too healthy after you finish your lunch - skipped it this time but I'll be ready for it the next time!

I loved it I loved it I loved it.Really though, I loved it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the natural service kinks they have to work out, as well as the acoustics in the place (so noisy!) But aside from that the food was DELICIOUS. I split the kale and brussels sprout salad as well as the turkey sandwich and it was great. The salad may be one of the best in this "healthy" genre.Also, the servings are GENEROUS for the price.. Just $9 for a fresh, big salad.I so look forward to seeing the new menu as the seasons change!

I needed a place to grab a quick, and relatively healthy, lunch on Saturday when I was shopping in Lincoln Park, so I went on my Yelp app and searched for the closest highly rated lunch spot.  Blue Door came up, and sounded perfect to me.I had the half portion brussels sprout and kale salad and half a ham and gouda sandwich.  The salad was delicious, I love shaved brussels sprouts, and there was a good proportion of sprouts, kale, nuts, and cheese.  The sandwich was perfectly fine, I just preferred the salad much more than the sandwich, so I would recommend getting a whole salad instead.  The only thing that was frustrating was that I had to wait for silverware for quite awhile because it is self serve, and Blue Door wasn't keeping up with demand, so as soon as they put a few sets out, diners were grabbing them quickly and I had to wait multiple "rounds" of silverware being set out.  It sounds like this restaurant is fairly new, so I'm sure this will be sorted out soon.The map on the back wall shows where many of the ingredients come from - which I loved.Great lunch place!

Blue Door Farm Stand is a little piece of the country side in the middle of a big city. Brunch is quaint and lovely, and everything is so fresh.I had the greek yogurt bowl with berries and homemade granola drizzled with honey, and I could not have been more pleased. The atmosphere is something special in that it feels a little slower than the city outside. The staff is so accommodating and so so kind.

I've been going here for months, and every time I am less and less impressed. Initially, I thought the food was great and easy to pick up on my lunch breaks. However, some of the managers seem to think it is ok to bark orders at their employees, and treat them with disrespect in front of customers. I find this extremely rude and it puts a bad taste in my mouth. I don't like to see when a manager only delegates tasks that they could obviously do themselves. I hope this changes because I enjoy the grown up grilled cheese and their sesame chicken salad.Definitely avoid this place on weekends as well, because it is a zoo filled with tiny crying children who throw their food on the ground, which employees leave there for hours. I'm pretty sure this is considered unsanitary.I hope in their new Halsted location that the quality will go back to what it was when I discovered this place in June.

Came here for brunch over the weekend--the place is super spacious and looks like it came straight out of a DIY/rustic Pinterest board (in the best way possible). Think flowers in mason jars, water in mason jars, empty mason jars....and tons of quirky gadgets in all the right places. So while the food was alright, I have some reservations:1. The breakfast menu is rather limited, and ends by noon! Pretty sure the brunch gods mandate that nobody be at a restaurant before 12 pm.2. The sandwiches are pretty good, but I ordered one with a coffee and ended up paying $18--whaaaaa?Although these two things rather irked my brunching experience, the staff was super friendly and we spent quite some time there without being bothered. This place seems to be more suitable for lunch, for which I likely would have been more satisfied...thus, 4 stars.However, if you're looking for some traditional brunch without paying for a pretty penny, I'd look elsewhere.

Thank Jebus for this place.I live down the street and am tormented everyday by overpriced, unhealthy food (I'm looking at you, Summer House). The neighborhood really needed something that was affordable, healthy, and quick. The answer? Blue Door. I've tried everything from their salads, soups, sandwiches, and yes the occasional "slice" of carrot cake. If you've never had the carrot cake, try it just once, I double dare you. My only complaint is that this place is forever and always crowded (typically with strollers and blonde moms, as they can smell kale from 10 miles away). Overall a great experience and good value for the quality of food! Will continue to be a regular!

WOW! The salads here are amazing. They are so filling and look very appetizing. Im not really a salad type of girl, but if you are looking into eating something healthy, this is the place. The sandwiches are very creative and well put together, the ingredients go well. The cashiers are always friendly. Love it!

Blue Door is definitely going to catch and become more popular, I would stop in now while there's no wait! Came in on a Sunday morning with Sunny H. for some grub. I do wish Blue Door had some more breakfast options, but we ended up going with lunch. The restaurant is located in a very convenient spot on Armitage in an old house. The interior is decorated so well, like straight from Pinterest. They even have a map in the back outlining where all of their food comes from which is so cool! Sunny and I ordered at the counter and sat down to wait for our food.I have one complaint and reason for my deduction of a star. We waiting a reeeeeeally long time for two sandwiches. I think they might still be working out the kinks and not have enough runners, but we were both feeling very impatient by the time our food finally arrived. Blue Door's menu has a plethora of very appealing sounding items. While we waited, we saw large, colorful salads going by, and hearty-smelling soups. Sunny and I decided to share the turkey/cheddar sandwich on multigrain and the chicken salad. The turkey was fresh and the sandwich was melty and so tasty! The cheddar was tangy as well as the preserves on top. The chicken salad sandwich was even better. The chicken salad itself was smokey and phenomenal! I can't wait go to back and have this again. Both of our sandwiches came with huge kale chips that had some parmesan sprinkled on top, such a nice touch!Overall, I can't wait to come back to Blue Door. The interior is really pleasant and their menu is full of locally sourced items that sound fantastic. Definitely recommend as a lunch option in the area!

Things I love:1. cute interior2. brussels and kale salad3. roast beef french dip4. option for a beer or cocktail with my meal5. the deceptively delicious mini side of pasta salad that comes with the sandwichesThings I don't love:1. speed and level of service2. attitude of some staff3. $9.50 for fresh pressed juice... for realsHonestly, the food is so so so good and is easily worthy of 5 stars.  I've tried a million times and a million ways to replicate the brussels and kale salad, but Blue Door has the market cornered.

I could have gone to this place daily!Almond Milk Lattes? Fresh Chocolate Chip Cookies? Gourmet Tomato Soup and Fantastic Grilled Cheese Sandwiches??I admittedly over ordered and still managed to eat it all.You can't go wrong!

I love this place!A lot of people raved about the cobb salad but I actually did not like it at all. However, the kale and brussels salad is awesome! The french tuna sandwich is really good too (if you like tuna).My favorite thing on the menu is the goat cheese and fig jam crostini.Great place for healthy eating!

This might be one of my happiest finds in Chicago and I'm thrilled I live so close to it! I had come across this place on a google search a while back, but it faded in memory for a while until my friend came to visit.We got here on a Sunday at 12:05 and I was so disappointed when I was shut-down for breakfast (which ended at 12). I don't blame them and it was silly of me to be disappointed by that. Fortunately, they rebounded so fast. I got the chicken salad sandwich and slice of pumpkin bread and I was in heaven! The whole cafe is adorable and such a cozy place to be. They have so many good bakery treats and a diverse menu that I'm sure you'd find something wonderful to eat. They also sell a lot of products from local artisans and the cafe is worth visiting for aesthetic comfort alone.We loved our experience so much that we came back the next day and finally got the breakfast I wanted.Enjoy!

I ate here once and it was the only thing I ate all day-- I ended up with violent food poisoning that night. I called the next day and the manager was nice to me and offered me a free item for if I wanted to come by again. I ended up stopping by and getting a cold pressed juice (usually $6-7) but found out after reading the fine print on the back that I couldn't drink it because there's risk for people with weakened immune systems. All of that being said, the french dip sandwich that I had really wasn't that great. The restaurant's got a very "hipster" feel. You drink out of mason jars and eat on cutting boards. But I don't know, there's something about puking your guts out that makes you not trust/like a place. Definitely cute, but don't get the french dip.

This place is SWIFTLY going down hill due to the customer service and management and it makes me sad so I'm writing a review to hopefully change the situation. I live around the corner and eat here all the time. Recently, there have been a couple of situations that literally, don't make sense to me.First of all, do not order soup as your entree at this place. Especially not to go. I ordered soup to go, which was 8 dollars, and received my small container of soup without bread. I asked if it came with bread and the manager said that it did not, that that is just something they have never done. I asked if it was possible to get some bread with my soup. He asked me if I wanted multigrain toast or a crostini. I said crostini, and he then asked me for $2.21. I literally thought he was joking. What kind of place charges 8 dollars for a bowl of soup and doesn't give you bread, crackers OR a spoon??? Offensive. I told him not to worry about it but that they should consider serving bread with their soup, LIKE EVERY OTHER RESTAURANT IN AMERICA, and he says, "Ok, thanks, have a good day!"Another time I ordered their most recent sandwich special, the avocado grilled cheese with tomatillo jam. It arrived, sans tomatillo jam. I asked one of the employees if I could have it on the side since it was missing on my sandwich. The same manager as the first incident came over and says, "Oh, we ran out of tomatillo jam 45 minutes ago!" I said, "Ok, but it kind of makes the sandwich. What you gave me is just a few slices of avocado and 2 pieces of mild cheese? I'm pretty sure the reason the sandwich is interesting is because of the jam." and he said "Yes, it's too bad." Clearly sensing I found this offensive, I HAD TO ASK if I could get something else instead. He asked me what I wanted and then replaced it. He apologized only when he brought the other sandwich, and very quickly. Another patron at a different table leaned over and goes "That guy is an asshole."You can eat here, because the food is great, but GOD FORBID you have a problem or ask for anything additional or you will be made to feel like you are SO demanding. For a place with such high prices, you expect a little customer service. Not sure what's going on here but I hope this changes because this place was a great neighborhood addition.
Really amazing food.  Sometimes it's pretty packed and hard to get a seat, but this is a great place in Lincoln park.

Yes yes yes!!I went here on a whim with a friend about a week ago and I am impressed. Local ingredients, local ciders and beers, ams HUGE salads. Great homemade salad dressings as well.The place is super cute, great for groups, and they serve your food on wooden cutting boards, how cute!!I ordered the Sesame Chicken Salad with a side of the blue dressing. Mmmm. My friend and I also split a gingersnap cookie and wished we had ordered two.I think that their juice is way over priced (9 to 11$) but what can you do.I would come here to eat again, or to just chill and drink coffee.

BDFS was shockingly crowded which is probably why my friends and I stopped inside to grab a bite to eat on a recent Saturday. BDFS has a rustic feel. Its the kind of place where drinks are served in Mason Jars. Additionally, BDFS is the kind of place that serves amazing food. Try any grilled cheese because they are amazing. The sandwiches were huge and delicious. Also, BDFS has an unusual, homemade Bloody Mary I suggest people check out. If you are okay with waiting in line, then wait in line at Blue Door Farm Stand.

Neat farm-to-table café/restaurant, great for lunch. I had the kale and shaved Brussels sprouts salad; my wife opted for the farro and arugula salad. Both were delicious. They only minor quibble is that I was expecting some kind of interesting bread to be served with salads, but only "side of toast" was available (and had to be ordered separately).

I really like this place.Good, nutritious breakfasts & lunches.I, like countless others, am a fan of the kale/Brussels sprouts salad with tahini dressing.All the sandwiches I've tried here are very tasty, and on the best bread, which makes all the difference.My one complaint is the exhaust system/open kitchen.  As much as I like eating bacon on my salad, I would prefer that my coat did not smell like bacon for days and days.

Wish they had one in California. This place is amazing. So fortunate my friends live around the corner.Was too late for breakfast so got the fig and arugula grilled cheese. So so so good. Simple, a little rich with the fig, and perfect.Iced vanilla latte was also ridiculously good. Apparently they make their own syrups. Not too sweet at all, just right.Girl working at the counter was also very nice. Can't go wrong with good food, coffee and customer service.So happy to have chosen this place, and will be back tomorrow for breakfast!

This place!!! Who knew I'd find myself ever saying "I had the best salad of my lifetime!!" ??? Not this girl, but guess what? I had the best salad of my lifetime at Blue Door!! Not once but twiice!Brussel Sprouts and Kale. Omg. They got this said so right. It doesn't even sound appealing in the name but honestly, it is. They figured out the perfect mix of deessing, greens and other goodies. I liked it so much at lunch I actually ordered 2 to go. One for me and one for a friend who I knew would love it. Who craves salads?? I do now. Call me crazy but I actually crave that salad...so fresh and so delicious.I love that you can do a half salad with had soup or hard sandwich combo. The grilled cheese sandwich is super awesome and the perfect 1/2 with a salad.I brought my kids one day for lunch and they cleaned their plates. I have to mention the giant piece of carrot cake we saw being delivered to a table. Omg. It was as bug as my head and was ONE serving. There are so many things I need to go back and try at Blue Door!!!

Easily my favorite, rustic place in the entire city. Reminds a homesick country girl of home!The decor is rustic, typically with folk music playing. You grab your own silverware, cups, and water there, not much unlike Native Foods.I ordered the Grown-up Grilled Cheese and a side Citrus and Kale salad. The kale salad was crafted with love, the dressing perfectly complimenting the fresh fruits and vegetables. Produce is key at Blue Door - they take pride in many of their locally produced and delivered fruits and vegetables. In the salad alone, you can taste the quality.My sandwich blew my mind. Who would have though brushing the bread with rosemary honey would be so delicious? It was a sweet and salty combination to die for, a sandwich I'd honestly kill to replicate.So if you're a homesick country girl like me looking to get some local grub, come to this hidden little restaurant with a little blue door. Bask in the farm pictures. Listen to the folk music. Order the grilled cheese and bask in that country glory.

Blue Door serves great food but their service lacks a little and is very pricy. I usually go with the Blue Door Cobb salad which is delicious. The last time I went I ordered an Americano and got just a black coffee which was disappointing since it was like $3. A normal salad will run you $12-14. Good food but confusing service.

I have been to this place a few times, so I am pretty well versed in their menu. Overall I like coming here because its convientint and you know you will get a good lunch meal. I would recommend that if youre looking for quanity to go with a salad. They are delicious and give you a lot of bang for your buck. I preffer their turkey sandwich with melted cheddar and straberry jam. My only gripe is that it was a little pricy for the amount of money. Overall will be back soon.

This place is awesome! They use local farms for their ingredients, so everything is very fresh. They believe that the seasons should decide what they cook.I had their Caprese Grilled Cheese - it was really good! It comes with a side of potato salad, which is great, but the portion is pathetic. It basically comes in a one oz. shot glass. It's so good, so serve it in a bigger bowl or something!I also got the sweet potato hummus, which comes with carrots and sweet crackers. I will definitely get it again - cheap ($7) and quality!They also sell various kitchen accessories, like cheese and cutting boards, utensils, books, etc. Another perk to this cute place is the staff. They're very friendly, and will offer advice if you're torn between options, or are just confused entirely.Looking forward to going back here!

Went for lunch and the interior design is quite nice. Everyone is very friendly and it has a "help yourself" kind of attitude. The food was very good. It is smaller portions by regular standards, but that's good! It's a perfectly sized lunch. I had a combo sandwich and soup fare, and the corn poblano pepper chowder was delicious. The salads look amazing and very big! So yes the food is really good!Downfall is price. It's very expensive. Word of advice: don't order drinks. I got a little juicebox of chocolate milk (yes the same one you get at the store) for $2.25! And a tiny tiny bottle of Coke was $2. Get water.
The Brussels and Kale salad is INCREDIBLE. They have great sandwiches, salads, and soups and you can do 1/2 1/2 combo orders with anything on the menu. Reasonable prices for quality too!

Great brunch/lunch spot. I got the grown up grilled cheese and lentil soup which was really good!The restaurant it's self is very cool. It is farm to table and everything is extremely fresh. The room is a little small and it is open seating so you might have to be patient.This is definitely a place I would frequent for a nice fresh and healthy lunch!

Found this place on Yelp and decided to go there for a weekday lunch with a friend and I. I expect any restaurant to do a crowd at lunch, and this was no exception. However, we stood in line for upwards of 20 minutes before ordering. Be prepared to wait. They move at a snail's pace in everything they do. We also waited what seemed an unusually long time for the food to come. Do realize that some of this place (not all) is a communal seating concept, so if they are busy, you will very possibly end up sitting with strangers. We had some personal stuff to discuss over lunch, and had we known this, would have certainly opted for a different spot this time.That being said, they have some really healthy offerings and the food was pretty good. I'd give the food 4 stars overall, so without all of the waiting, the review would get the same. I get the impression they are just a slow moving place in general, so as long as you aren't in a hurry, this is a good stop in Lincoln Park to check out.

I very rarely give 5 stars but this time, I truly believe Blue Door deserves it.  I just moved much closer to this gem and I must say I can't WAIT for many more dinners to come.I popped in about 20 minutes until closing time on a Sunday and the staff was extremely pleasant...last minute customers are the worst but I really wanted to try them out.  I knew in advance I wouldn't be able to decide easily so I went with "The Armitage" (half salad and half sandwich).  After suggestions from the employee taking my order, I opted for Brussels & Kale salad and the Fig & Arugula grilled cheese.  What I loved MOST of all was that after eating this I felt great...the grilled cheese isn't coated in grease.  It's solid, amazingly fresh flavors.There's quite a few things I want to go back and try on the menu...I do wish they were open later than 8pm however, that is one distinct flaw.  Perhaps they will consider expanding their hours to 9 at some point...

Really cute and organic place that you would miss if you just walked by.  Their food is very fresh and they focus on farm to table ingridients. I had the smoked ham and brie with potatoe salad.  You could really taste the smokey flavor.  Only downside is that it is a little pricey. I paid $30 for 2 sandwhiches and 1 beer.

Great spot for a local farm to table style lunch.I think they still have some kinks to work out on operations of busing the tables and getting food out. I think they should probably make it more clear that you should try to have someone in your party hunt a table down if it's busy and you are waiting in line.Go for the kale & brussel salad, even my boyfriend who avoids overly healthy things at all costs loved it. We split this and the turkey sandwich and it was the perfect amount without being too full.We also tried a cranberry scone while we waited and that was delicious as well.Excited to come back and try breakfast items.

All of the grilled cheeses are worth trying! the kale and brussell sprout salad is very popular as well. They have awesome Bloody Mary's on the weekends. Great atmosphere and decor. The only downside to this place is that when you leave the heavy smell of food lingers on you for awhile.

This place has extremely charming decor, which drew me in. But that's the best thing about it, in my opinion. It's supposedly very fresh, seasonal food, but it's still way over priced. $9 is too much for an all-veggie sandwich, which I didn't think was very good. BF wasn't impressed with his food either and I felt bad for choosing this place for a lunch date.Also, I ordered their housemade juice and was given an expired one. I returned it for another one and was given a 2nd expired juice. I returned it again and was given one with the expiration sticker peeled off. Shadey and annoying. We ordered two different juices and didn't care for either.

Love it here! First off, the decor is adorable. They also have a retail section where you can take special jams, sauces, and other treats like that to go.I've had lunch here a few times and have really loved everything. The kale and brussel sprout salad is amazing, as is the veggie wrap. The adult grilled cheese is also fantastic if you feel like treating yourself. Speaking of treating yourself, try the carrot cake! You won't be disappointed.Anyways, the staff is always super friendly and the food is delicious. Prices might be a little high, but you are getting local, fresh items and great service, so I think its okay to pay a dollar or two more. Its a great addition to the neighborhood and I suggest you check it out!

This place is absolutely amazing. I found this place on yelp and just expected it to be a good ole sandwhich shop but this is like no other. There's a real home-y vibe, everything is painted white and blue, and there's even mason jars to drink water with.I'm not sure of her name, but the girl who worked there explained to me how Blue Door operates, and it's all locally imported stuff, along with a changing menu that corresponds to the season! How often do you get that???I got the fig and arugula sandwhich (amazeballs) along with a salad (forgot the name) but it had shaved brussel sprouts and a maple tahini dressing. It was thebomb.com.This isn't your typical panera. It's an infinite amount of times better. Everything is extremely fresh and tasty. It's quite healthy also. I didn't feel morbidly obese or bad about myself.It is a little pricey, but all and completely worth it!Definitely and absolutely will return!!!

I loved my first visit to Blue Door. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The food is great and fairly priced--large portions, fresh and great presentation. I had soup and petit salad, my friend had a sandwich. It was the best sandwich he'd had.There are 2 issues I can point out.A minor one--the menu boards are on three walls. The food board is behind the counter, the drink board is closer to the entrance on the opposite wall, the soup board is at the end of the counter on a different wall.The more annoying issue is you leave smelling like smoked bacon and the grill. They need a better exhaust system. I've experienced this at other cafes in Chicago. I certainly would take the food to go  if I needed to return to work or be somewhere important after the meal. I still smelled it in my jacket and hair late that night.

Adorable! Such a gem. It looks tiny from the outside but opens into this airy light filled back room with beautiful wood tables, cute plants and pretty lanterns.  All food looks and sounds amazing.  Playing good oldies too!
Brussels sprouts and kale salad! Amazing! And I don't eat kale unless it's in a smoothie. This dish changed that! Perfect lunch spot!

My friend and I decided to check out this newly opened sandwich shop that was featured on PureWow!  We visited the shop on a Tuesday afternoon after hoping the brown line from the loop.  Walking down Armitage, I realized that this place fits right in, however there is little curb appeal as we walked past this shop two times!Upon entering the secret door, two other pedestrians were curious what we were walking into and joined us for a look.  We were greeted by a quaint store in front that offered various farm fresh spreads, and treats for purchase.  We browsed for a bit, but quickly made our way to the counter - we were greeted by a display of delicious treats that; cookies, croissants, and of course carrot cake.We decided on two sandwiches, each splitting the half's so we could optimize our tasting.  The French Tuna Salad sandwich was great.  The tuna was like what you would find on most gourmet tuna sandwiches, however it was the fresh red peppers and artichoke hearts along with the green beans that really sealed the deal.  We also ordered the Smoked Turkey, which again, Blue Door was able to offer fresh twist on an simple sandwich, each ingredient adding an awesome touch - especially the blue cheese.  The turkey was sweet, and was amazing all on its own and the arugla and grilled onion added an amazing balance.  As a nice compliment, each sandwich came with homemade baked kale and Parmesan cheese chips --- worth the trip alone!For desert, we opted for the Carrot Cake, which accordingly the Chef, was 6 years in the making.  The cake itself was amazing, the frosting was on the buttery side; I prefer a little sweater, but this would not stop me from ordering it again!

Really somewhere between 3 and 4 stars.Came here on an early Saturday afternoon with the boyfriend after reading awesome reviews, hoping to get a sorta quick, delicious lunch. Things were pretty busy, but we don't mind waiting in line to order, and know eventually we'll make it to the food. . . except when we finally get to order, the cashier tells us it will be about 30 - 40 minutes to get out food out.  But, we really wanted to try this place, so we get some banana bread (so good) to snack on while we wait.After awhile, we start to notice that although food is coming out of the kitchen, no one around us is getting their orders; things in the kitchen must have been seriously backed up.  Then, oddly, one of the bussers tries to take our silverware and napkins, even though we are clearly still waiting for food (we have the little cafe number right in front of us).  After I tried to stop him, he gave me back my knife and fork, but since he had grabbed them by the tops instead of the handles I would really rather he had just taken them - I'm not going to eat with that fork now.Anyway, eventually (I think the wait actually ended up being more like 45 minutes) we got our sandwiches, and they were pretty good.  And I have to say I really enjoyed the Red Bell Pepper juice.  But, not quite enough to make me wait that long again.  Maybe I'll come back at a less busy time of day.

Short version: best grilled cheese and cauliflower soup I've ever had and super friendly staff.Long version: We stopped by on a Saturday at 6pm and it was fairly empty so we thought we were at the wrong place but people began showing up after we ordered and sat down (you order at the cashier and they give you these cute little blocks with your number on it). The place was so cute with this rustic farm vintage feel.My fiancé and I ordered the grown up grilled cheese, cauliflower soup, the Brussels and kale salad, and the kale and artichoke dip. The grown up grilled cheese was the best grilled cheese I've ever had. It wasn't too heavy on the cheese and it was sweet which I thought would be weird but was amazing!! The cauliflower soup wasn't overly salty like some soups can be and it had a ton of flavor. The salad was good but didn't blow my mind- the dressing was what made it really good. Places like these can be hit or miss i.e. the atmosphere is great but the food is bad or vice versa, but this place really had good food.We spoke to the manager Chauncey (sp?) on the way out and learned that they had opened Feb of 2014 and that they always change their menus with the season and the food. We will definitely be back!Tip: for the mothers and fathers out there, they have a koala kare changing station in the bathroom and have high chairs as well!

I like the decor especially the lightings. Staff were friendly and food was good but felt like few items on the menu were little pricey. I like that they serve intelligentsia coffee which is one of my favorite coffee. I really enjoyed the kale chip! I would eat that everyday if I can!
Nice food, but it felt like I should have been wearing suspenders and blasting The Decembrists while snapping a pic of my sandwich with a Polaroid.

The decor is adorable - the fresh herbs on the table definitely set the atmosphere. They also have a cute retail section where you can buy special jams, sauces, cute plates, etc. I stopped in for lunch, so I had the turkey and cheddar sandwich and it was sadly pretty underwhelming. The highlight of the sandwich was the apple and bell pepper preserves (which was fantastic). Outside of the preserve, it was a standard, run of the mill turkey sandwich. Also, the kitchen also lost my order so I had to wait at least 5 minutes for my food after my friend got hers. However, my friend ordered the chicken salad sandwich and hers was fantastic! Full of flavor and a surprise of dried cherries. I had a bite of hers and I'll go back just to order my own!  I think they are still working out some of the service kinks, but I look forward to stopping in again.

This place is super freaking cute! Has a great rustic feel on the inside and they serve drinks out of mason jars - which I am always a fan of :)I did the half sandwhich and cup of soup for $8 option. I had the cauliflower and cheddar soup - YUMMY! I just wish there had been more of it! For my sandwich I had their AB&J (almond butter and jelly). It was delicious, but I felt a bit foolish paying what I did for it, when I could have made it at home - but oh well!I work less than a block away on the weekends - so I am sure I will frequent this location for a fresh option :)

Love blue door, I've already been a few times and have been very happy with everything except one thing. I think they cut the onions out in the open kitchen and my eyes have been irritated every time I'm there as well as whoever I am with.The salads are huge and awesome, the staff is very nice, and the cookies are uber good!

5 for decor/ambience. The rest was just mediocre. The prices are pretty high for the quality. Grilled sandwiches are way too crunchy for my liking and juices were not as tasty and refreshing as I thought they would be (and crazy expensive!) Was a little disappointed they charged me for a full salad and full sandwich when I specifically asked for half sandwich and small salad. Since I didn't realize the mistake until the food came out, I decided not to make waves (I was with other people including two children) and just kept it.  Wasn't offered an apology and was instead handed a to-go box for the extra food I was bound to have after my meal... Really??

Such a cute place! Decorated like something from down south with a bit of class. I had a number 3 green juice, really good and oh so fresh. I also had the gouda and shaved ham sandwich, in place of the original Brie and ham, to be honest I wasn't too fond of it, mainly because of the Dijon mustard that I was told was actually a fruit jam, but I guess she just confused it with the old sandwich. My friends were highly satisfied with their meals. I'm going back to try something else, somebody that likes Dijon would have probably really liked the sandwich. Definitely give this place a shot. You'll be happy you did!

My husband and I stopped at Blue Door on Memorial Day for lunch. Granted it was a holiday, so we knew it would be crowded, however, the service was so poor that it affected my rating. We arrived around 12:30, and the line was all the way back to the door. Why? 1 person at the register. We then waited for a seat, not because there weren't seats open, but all the seats that were open had dirty plates and cups on it because no one was cleaning them up. Eventually we just took a spot and after 15 minutes they cleared the space. Gross. Finally, after 25 minutes of waiting for a tuna sandwich and turkey sandwich, my husband's was delivered. 10 minutes later, after he had finished his, my meal showed up. No apologies, just thrown on the table. The food was good, but nothing to get excited about after waiting so long. I won't be returning, unless maybe its like 3pm on a week day when even the worst service should be able to handle the off-hour.
The purple line wrap is OKAY and a bit overpriced for what you get. Overall decent experience
Absolutely delicious!!! Very fresh and healthy. Recommend the carrot cake as a treat!
Loved the kale brussel sprout salad. It's not a huge menu but each dish is interesting (and sound delish). I'll be back for that Gouda ham sandwich and carrot cake!

I visited for the first time on Saturday afternoon. The food was great but the environment wasn't that great.Food- I ordered the strawberry salad and fig and arugula sandwich.  Both were excellent.Environment - the seating is open, with several community tables.  Unfortunately, the line was long and my friend and I ended having to sit with two moms with little children.  It wasn't what we expected and we were constantly interrupted.  Yes....we could have waited for a table but that would have taken another 20 minutes.Post lunch - our clothes stunk!  P-U!  My friend emailed me later and had the same experience too.  ick!
I really like this place, they are just open back in Feb and they are really doing very good.Price is normal, and foods are really delicious.

This is in my hood and I visit weekly. I love the decor, good is above average, lattes could be better but want really needs work is service. It takes forever to get food!!!! I only go when I have plenty time to wait. Overall it's a good place but won't last imo if service doesn't improve. Also, would love some prepared foods for takeaway.
Food is great here. Fresh and creative. I was not fond of how a situation was handled after they got my order wrong... But in the end, the great food distracted me from feeling totally devalued.
Been here two more times since and it hasn't failed to disappoint just wish it was open later.
When will you reopen?

great addition to the 'hood.  i've been working around here for 6 years.  there are about 5 burger places and 12 mediterranean places, so it's refreshing to see something with tasty sandwiches and salads that's not whole foods.it is very lincoln parky.  lots of chicks who just got done working out or are stay at home moms.  lululemon threw up everywhere.  but i ain't mad at it - i just wanna eat.i ordered the armitage, which is a 1/2 salad, 1/2 sammy.  i chose the kale + sprouts salad which had bacon [important].  also, almonds.  and a tasty tahihi dressing.  it was TDF [to die for].  that's gonna be my go-to fo sho.  the fig + goat cheese grilled cheese was deece and as much as i like figs and sweet stuff, it was a bit too much.  easy on the spread, bro.serve yo'self - order at the counter, grab free water and a rolled up napkin with your utensils.  water in etsy type water jugs.  cutesy.

We ordered take out from here and it was delicious. Fresh ingredients, delicious mix of tastes, generous portions. We ordered the Kale and Artichoke Dip appetizer, the Farm Stand Cobb Salad and the Citrus Kale Salad - they were delicious and we could not have enjoyed our meal more than we did. Kudos Blue Door Farm Stand! We will definitely be back here again!
Their Kale Salad and Grilled Cheese are life changing!!! Will always come back, when will they be open on Halsted??? I'm waiting patiently!

I like this place.  I live in the neighborhood so it's convenient for grabbing a cup of coffee or a bite to eat.  I've also brought my laptop in to study/do work a couple of mornings.  Their breakfast wraps are good, I love that they're packed with veggies!  Their pumpkin grilled cheese is also amazing (it's off the menu now but hopefully it comes back in Fall 2015!).  The space itself is cute -- something you would find on Pinterest.  It gets super busy during lunch hour, and the strollers/huge groups of girls definitely crowds up the place, but it's a great spot.

Great neighborhood brunch place and extremely nice staff! We had a huge group of 8 adults and 4 kids show up with little heads up and they had the tables and high chairs all ready.Food was solid and a good price.

This cafe is by far my favorite breakfast/brunch spot in all of Chicago! They have the best coffee, the best omelettes, the nicest staff, and the menu size is perfect. Not to mention, this place is the best cure for a hangover.Now I won't downgrade my five-star rating, but I must alert you that you may have to stand at the doorway, awkwardly, waiting for someone to seat you... they dont have a host stand. And you may have to wait a bit (awkwardly still, hovering over people as they eat) for a table to open up... they are usually busy. So if you like good food, and you're not too insecure, definitely consider overlooking this minor inconvenience. Enjoy!

Simple breakfast/brunch spot in the Ukrainian Village.  I think the draw here is just that: simplicity.   You can get a nice breakfast for 8-9 dollars.From a quality standpoint, it's pretty good.  My only knock is the portion size is a little on the small side.  But if you aren't looking to spend a bunch of money on breakfast, it'll work.  It's not BYOB but they serve alcohol for those looking for bloody marys or a little spike in their coffee.

Janik's has done a bit of a re-concept recently, and it's better than ever! They have upgraded their toasted sandwiches, and my husband enjoyed the most delectably toasted Cuban yesterday. They also added empanadas to the menu which are SO GOOD! The breading is probably a little thicker than other empanadas I've had. But they were the perfect compliment to the soup of the day, which I get every time I go to Janik's.

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time. We got there and before I could say anything, the guy was like seat yourself. I understand they are busy but why the attitudeTook awhile for our server to come. Once he came around he dropped off waters and walked away. I said hi when he approached us and he didn't respond.So I thought maybe he didn't hear me?We got our food. The food was mediocre. My latte was delicious.The food took forever but it was busy so that's fine.Our waiter never came to check on us. Once we finished, he came over to pour more water.I said can I get my check? He didn't respond. He came back later with the check and dropped it off and left.He barely even spoke to us but I saw him speak to other tables. Was it cause we are minorities? I'm not sure but it sure felt like we weren't welcomed

Came for LUNCH!-LOVE the casual patio outside, comfy and neat inside-BEWARE of slow service, yet friendly-CHOOSE quickly, and enjoy reading the large menu-SURPRISED by portion sizes, and quality, delicious caesar salad with grilled chicken-HAPPY about the cheap prices-PERFECT location in Wicker Park-ENJOY taking your time

I dare you to find a more reliable breakfast establishment in the neighborhood. There's a reason they've been around for so long and routinely feature long wait times. If your party can't find something they like here, they are snobs; one of the largest menus I've seen in Chicago. Regardless of whether you're in the mood for a sandwich, an omelette, a sweet breakfast, or something a little exotic (they feature delicious Tex-Mex cuisine in addition to their traditional breakfast and lunch food), there's bound to be something for everyone.My personal favorite is the hangover beater; chicken-lime soup! You can order a cup on the side, or a bowl for an entree. The caesar salad is great. Sandwiches are awesome, especially now that Jerry's is closing (RIP).They also have a great patio with friendly, efficient service. Pro tip: call ahead for a table!
Pretty good, they give you the right amount of cream cheese for your bagel. Not the best breakfast around but really good.

Food is delicious and setting is really nice. In terms of food, the price is reasonable and the potatoes is full of spices which is really appetizing if you like big flavor. This place has breakfast, lunch and dinner served at anytime. Food comes out fast and freshly made. Wide varieties of options to choose from.Only downside is there's no free parking and you have to pay for the parking meter but it's not their fault.

"One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas.....how he got in my pajamas, I'll never know."  --Captain J. SpauldingWhere else can you find commissioned pieces of art**, delicious breakfast potatoes, and the world's best banana smoothie?  If it's somewhere other than Janik's Cafe then I'd really like to know.On the heels of a couple very unpleasant breakfast experiences, I was more than a wee bit hesitant to try this Ukrainian Village hangout.  But Anna T made a handful of claims that this spot was the bombdiggity, and after eating here on 3/19/16 I'm inclined to agree with her.Once we got seated at the only unoccupied table, a waiter came by and I immediately decided on the banana yogurt smoothie.  HOLY LORD was it good.  Fresh, fruity, and fantastically filling.  Sitting there and gradually sipping away at it (I didn't want the goodness to end!), I felt that it was the tastiest smoothie I've ever had.  Sitting here and typing this all out, that still holds true.  Best.  Smoothie.  Ever.  #nobullIn no time at all the food arrived and I feverishly ate my order.  The ham & cheese omelette wasn't much different than one I'd make at home, but it had plenty of meat, so that's something.  It came with toast and breakfast potatoes that were masterfully seasoned and almost didn't need hot sauce.  Almost.  But with so many choices of stuff in the condiment caddy--2 types of salsa picante (green & red), 2 types of ketchup (regular & spicy), along with butter, sugar, and an assortment of jelly--it seemed rude *not* to use them.  Major kudos for the variety.If I'm eating before 11am, it's going to include bacon.  So I was a little taken aback when my side order of bacon came out all meager-looking.  But then I realized I'd asked for 'extra crispy' (contents may shrink by 80% during cooking), and they delivered just that.  Anna T's Belgian waffle was superb, I wouldn't hesitate to order that on a future excursion.Bread = 4.5Circuses = 5**You're probably wondering why I leadoff this review with a Marx-ist quote (Groucho, not Karl).  I was inspired by a piece of art hanging on Janik's wall of the 2nd-most well known Marx brother, Harpo (the mute one with the top hat and curly hair, always doing sightgags).There were landscapes, surreal paintings of eyeballs, other random stuff, but a portrait of Harpo Marx instantly caught my attention.  I said to myself...."I absolutely have to have this.  This is going in my apartment."  Our waiter gave me the guy's business card, and a few hours later the artist and I negotiated a price (his name is Brett Whitacre, for those that are interested).  As of this writing, I now have a 1-of-a-kind piece of painted glass pop art proudly displayed in my entryway!   :)BIG thanks to Janik's Cafe for a wonderful breakfast (especially the smoothie and potatoes), Anna T for the outstanding suggestion, and Brett W for being a gifted artist in his own right.  Don't worry my man, your work went to a good, appreciative home.  I figure since I started this one off with a Marx brothers quote, I might as well end it with one:"I could dance with you 'til the cows come home. On second thought, I'd rather dance with the cows 'til you came home!"  --Rufus T. Firefly

They're Always consistent with the customer service and quality of the food. But the space is not functional and or comfortable. Customers picking up orders are awkwardly standing over dine-in patrons and wait staff are always bumping into each other and avoiding accidents.But because I am sleezy Chicago foodie that has a weakness for restaurants that allow you to have sausage and eggs with your waffles....I keep going back. Like 3 times a month actually. The Cheese grits are undefeated.What's an hour of bumping elbows with strangers when the food is good right?

In the modern day society, brunch isn't quite right unless foisted with crabcakes, lox, duck eggs, etc. You're not getting with the trend until you start downing those bottomless mimosas and discussing what's the next best brunch place. That would be the least of your concerns at Janik's, your typical community cafe with the unpretentious breakfast and lunch entrees. Grab any available table, seat yourselves, and order.With five famished adults and a ridiculously inexpensive menu, we recklessly pointed our fingers across the menu like children, "I want that...and that...and this...and that!"1) My corned beef sandwich was served on rye with lettuce, tomatoes, pickle, mustard, and Swiss. For less than $6, my sandwich was packed with generous slices of corned beef. To complete the meal, I also had a small side of standard potato salad.2) For $2, you can have a plump piece of french toast served with powdered sugar and condensed milk. This can easily be shared between two people, especially if you want to have enough capacity for other items.3) A good portion of the menu is composed of Mexican-inspired items. Our chicken tostada had two sunny side up eggs with a pile of shredded meat, lettuce, tomatoes, rice, and sour cream. It was served slightly warm but the flavors were standard.4) I like how a lot of breakfast items can be easily turned into a dessert. The pancakes with nutella and bananas are a perfect example. This platter had three thick pieces of pancakes that were crispy on the edges and fluffy in the center. In between each pancake was a generous spread of nutella and the whole stack was decorated with banana slices.Overall, I think Janik's was well worth the visit. We ordered over 10 items in total and it didn't even damage our wallets. If you want to keep it simple, Janik's is the place to go.

First time at Janik's. We went on a Wednesday morning. They had both outdoor and indoor seating available. The staff was extremely nice and the place was clean. The food was amazing. My hubby had the chilaquiles w/ chorizo. I had the breakfast bowl w/ turkey sausage and a side of French toast. The food was amazing. The portion size was more than enough. My only recommendation: I wish they had half orders of their speciality pancakes. Other than that, I would definitely come back.

I order delivery all the time (probably a little too often) because I LOVE Janik's! Favorites: any yogurt smoothie, creamy chicken and rice soup, southwest salad, quesadillas. I'm kind of a picky eater and the flavors in the Janik's potatoes and the chicken like soup were a bit too strong for me, but my roommate loves them both. Great food!

I live right around the corner from this place and it's by far my favorite breakfast place in the area. The food is delicious, the staff is incredibly nice, and it's decently priced. I'm a huge fan of the Denver omelette so if you get an opportunity to try it, you should!

Janiks is great! I usually place a takeout order, but the interior is cute. They have a small outdoor area too. Their takeout orders are always ready on time and I've never had a missing item or mistake. I absolutely love their Greek chicken sandwich on a wheat tortilla, it's amazingly delicious. Their breakfast is always great too. Highly suggest this place to anyone looking for a quick bite to eat. Definitely diner food with great quality!

I love this place. It is SO CHEAP and has great food. This is our go to spot after a night of drinking. The outdoor patio is relaxing and great for people watching. I do like their drink specials.. in case you don't wanna stop partying from Saturday night, their bloody mary's are really good on only 5$. What a deal. They have plenty of items on their menu. I really prefer their soups!// chicken lime tortilla soup - $5 - very filling and limey! Great for a morning after drinking. I couldn't really find it on the menu so make sure you ask the waiter/waitress for the daily soups.

Janiks is the mom and pop spot of popular wicker park. Love the homey feel and affordable prices for drinks! The breakfast is always amazing and the staff rocks, Enriquo rules, biscuits and gravy forever!!

Absolutely love this family restaurant. I took my dad here (who has specific foods that he eats), and he and I both loved it. We ordered salmon bowls, and the salmon was cooked perfectly. Also, one of the family owners came over to chat with us, and she was super friendly and sweet. We finished off the dinner with a coconut flan, which was delicious. I will definitely be returning.

This was our first and last time placing an order for pickup from this place. The manager/owner by the name of Felipa is one of the rudest person we have dealt with. She did not let us speak and explain the issue. She said she was not going to sit there and go through what happened. Excuse me? How would you not want to go through an issue with a paying customer. Just plain ignorant. Now let me me explain what happened to yelpers because I am sure they would like to know...I placed an order through yelp for pickup. My order stated it was going to be ready at 11:51am. My husband gets to the restaurant on time and asked for the order. They said hold on and some time passed and no one brought up the order. There was a line of people (one paying with multiple credit cards) and they told him to wait until they finished ringing up other people's order (my order was prepaid via yelp). He finally gets my food and places it inside a hot bag. He gets home and I have a  missing item and the food is cool. Obviously it was sitting there for a while. And since they were to busy charging other people they let my food get cold. I contact yelp and they refund my missing item. They call the resturant and spoke to Felipa. She told them the food was cold because we picked it up late. What a total lie!. My husband calls her and she gets an attitude and says "I am not going through what happen" do you want a credit or refund" RUDE!  Now why would I want a credit? I will never buy from here again. Over a million places to choose from in Chicago..Keep your credit..give me my refund!FYI...Food sucked!

When we lived in the Ukrainian Village, my friends and I went here almost every weekend, often twice. For starters, they make an *excellent* Bloody Mary- it also appears that your server is the one who makes the drinks (sometimes it can lead to a wait because they have tables to take care of, but this is totally excuse-able), so you don't get the exact same one every time but I found the variety fun, and have not had a bad one yet. The food is extremely good. I've worked my way through most of the menu, and you can't order anything sub par.Just be aware, they are very good and very popular, if you get there at peak brunch time it will be crowded. The wait is never terrible, though. The only reason I took a star off is that it can be frustrating to get your check sometimes if you're sitting outside. Not really that big a deal, you can always go find your server if you're in a hurry. Also, they have El Yucateco as their standard hot sauce, which makes any omelette extra delicious. Have brunch here, trust me.

Very cheap. Two people with various drinks was under 50. Our server wasn't around until we were done eating which was annoying but he was nice, and actually, punctual when we did order more drinks. So I guess order more drinks? Bloodies and drivers were tasty and cheap, food was great.

This place is amazing! It was a bit crowded when we got there, which was a good sign for us. The staff was really sweet and got us a table as soon as they could. I ordered the steak eggs benedict with bacon and it was absolutely phenomenal. The meat was cooked well and the bacon was thick! Also, the potatoes were great! They have their own flavor. Lastly, the nutella croissant is a MUST! We are here today for the second time and I couldn't help but to order the exact same thing! Thanks for unforgettable food and service!!

I really have to go back to writing more reviews. I'm a Chef and don't eat out much but when I do I am VERY critical. So this review is well deserved. I had the day off and while cleaning and doing laundry I got hungry. I was craving Lox and Bagels. I am originally from NY but had my first Lox and Bagel about a month ago in Chicago. I know it's not the best option to order from a cafe, especially take out but I was prepared to not be overly wowed.
