I ordered delivery on one of the coldest days in Chicago and my order arrived more than 30 minutes before the estimated delivery time.First off, everything was packed Really REALLY well. Everything was separated, hot separated from cold, etc. My bagel was wrapped separately, I got a container of cream cheese and then a platter that was packed and air wrapped really well with Lox, capers, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, mixed greens, and feta. The spread was fresh, veggies were crisp and I loved the addition of feta crumbles. I really enjoyed Janik's Lox and Bagel platter...really good. The only thing is..I wish the Lox was sliced thinner...but it might just be my preference.I also ordered a side of breakfast potatoes and a slice of french toast with mixed berries to make my minimum. Now I got the potatoes because I read good reviews and they did not disappoint, great flavor. I am NOT a pancake or french toast fan at all but I thought I'd get something savory so I got a slice. First off, the mixed berry compote didn't come from a can which I thought it would be. It was perfectly balanced with sweet and tart and was not overwhelmingly sweet at all. I french toast was delicious! I literally ate the whole piece right away.. usually that's not be at all.I am so satisfied that I think an omelet or Benedict is in order for next week from Janik's. They're whole menu looks amazing and it's totally affordable. Great job Janik's!

You really couldn't ask for a better place to eat. The food is so good! The prices are reasonable. There is a big menu to chose from.  The staff is friendly and on top of their game. Finally, the owner is so sweet and friendly. This keeps me coming back!

We decided to come to Janik's Cafe on a Sunday morning to celebrate gaining an extra hour from daylight savings. This is a decision I absolutely do not regret (even if we did try milk & honey first, which had a 40-minute wait). We walked into the cafe and were immediately greeted and seated. The place was happily bustling with people, but they still found a place for us. I abhor waiting, so Janik's immediately left a good impression on me.The menu is filled with a lot of really delicious options, so it was hard to choose. I knew I could not ignore the banana Nutella pancakes, so I gave into fate and ordered them! The wait was pretty short, so again, I was a happy camper. My banana Nutella crepes were really delicious. There were three substantially-sized pancakes with a healthy topping of bananas and Nutella with powdered sugar on too. The part that impressed me the most is that there was a spread of Nutella and banana slices between each later. I had leftovers (yay for big portions!).The only thing keeping me back from five stars is that service wasn't particularly attentive and my water was empty for the majority of the meal. I'm forgiving, of course, because I know it was busy. Perhaps they were able to bring the food out so quickly because servers weren't filling waters and making small talk.We noted that they also have milkshakes and fresh-squeezed juices. These definitely will be on our to-try list for the next time we're here! What a wonderful local cafe to have so close to the boyfriend's apartment and prices are very reasonable for what you get. I look forward to returning, especially with the knowledge we won't be left waiting!

I love Janiks cafe!!!! I have had almost everything on their menu! I love the wicker park area, the friendly staff and manager, and the awesome food.Everytime I go in there the manager (I am guessing) is always so nice giving helpful options. I love that they serve homers ice cream, moose tracks and mint choc is the best. I also love their quesadillas, salads, and steak sandwiches.I will continue to come here!

Hands down THE BEST breakfast/lunch place in the area, even farther than 'the area".  Unpretentious, great specials, FABULOUS food, party of 8, and everyone was extremely happy with their meal.  They have a million selection menu, which is a rarity these days, and a welcome one.  Excellent fish tacos, appetizers, my Greek wrap was HUGE, and lasted back to Minneapolis and the next work day, when it was tasty as new.  That's value folks.  The service was good, and we did drop 8 people 1/2 hr b4 closing on them.  Bloody's are excellent, PBR's are ice cold, the pitcher of margaritas only down spot, (little light on the teq, and kinda bland), and the teens were remarking and sharing their: iced mocha cucumber peanut butter sooper pooper latte schmattes (with skim milk), OMG. Anyway... for excellent sidewalk seating, fabulous food, complete satisfaction of all parties with widely disparate tastes, good service, a visit from the owner or maybe the chef herself, doggie bags for everyone, a measly $120!!!!!!...8 people, 5 adults, 2 teens, a toddler who had 2 kids breakfasts..and.. alcohol! Unreal.  Our sincere compliments...don't ever change, Janik's!!!

I am not a breakfast food fan so Janiks is the perfect brunch location to meet friends. The food and portions are great, service is top notch everyone works together. My friend got crab cake benedict for under $10. Everything I have eaten there, especially the buffalo chicken wrap, has been delciouso!My one tip is to get the pasta salad over macaroni salad.

This is probably my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. Everything I have ordered has been great!! Delivery is always speedy and food arrives warm. I will forever be a loyal customer and continue ordering from here :)

I live around the corner from this place and it's my absolute favorite spot in the neighborhood. The employees are attentive and sweet! The food is simply amazing! Their eggs benedict is the best I've ever had and their nutella and custard croissant is a must! ADORE everything about this place.
I LOVE going here for breakfast. Their French Toast is to dieee for. But their whole menu overall is phenomenal. Sincere service, great vibes. Dog Friendly patio outside too!!

This is my favorite lunch spot without a doubt. We would drive from the West Loop to Janik's for lunch.  Now we are lucky enough to live about 50 feet away.  The owner is so sweet.  My daughter and I went in and ordered a pick up and she asked if my daughter would like ice cream while we waited. I haven't tried something I didn't like from there. The chicken and rice soup is the best.
The coffee is amazing, the food is fresh and the variety on the menu is sure to please anyone.

Breakfast is on point. Homemade and you can tell. Got the buttermilk pancake combo with crispy bacon and the man got Biscuits and gravy with eggs and potatoes. My god was it yummy and great portions. The staff was super nice and attentive and you must try the spicy ketchup. I had to take a bottle home its that good :)

Great food and great customer service! It was a relaxed type of customer service. I met the owner, Felipa (I believe), and she stepped in to help with service. She gave us great service and great recommendations. I would go back!

Delicious Greek Omelette. The feta is amazing. I didn't enjoy the center of the omelette being under cooked. There was a good amount of egg white that was clear and uncooked, but I just ate around it since it still tasted bomb. Perhaps some prefer their eggs like this, so I'm not hating, it's just not for me.The fried potatoes that come with the eggs are amazing. A great cajon type flavor.The toasted croissant was bomb as well.The lattes here are a joke. Just get regular coffee, and don't expect much.Overall, this place is about their food. The rest is soso.

2.5 StarsI met a friend here for brunch yesterday around 12:30 and of course since they have outdoor seating it was a little pack. Luckily we only had to wait about 5 minutes and we were able to score an outdoor table. Side note: this area is perfect for people watching :)Service and price point are great, but food is pretty mediocre. I ordered the French Toast. Tasted like I could have made it from one of those frozen food packages. The eggs were also really bland. Although I wasn't impressed you did get eggs, French toast, sausage and bacon...all for $8.95. Not too shabby on the wallet. However it left me craving good French toast I'm use at other places. This is where quality over quantity comes into play. I probably won't be coming back here. I would rather pay a little bit more and enjoy a really good savory brunch.

We came here because we were really craving brunch on a Sunday morning before I had to drop my girlfriend off at work. We were seated right away because someone was just leaving as we arrived. This seems like the kind of place where you don't linger too much with conversation. You order quickly, they being the food out pretty quickly, and they bring you the check quickly. This had it's positives and negatives. I enjoy sitting and savoring my food, maybe enjoying some conversation after I've finished eating. Here, I felt a little bit rushed to get or of there and free up a table. That's really the only thing keeping this from five stars. It wasn't fast food quality, though. Not at all!My girlfriend went with the Nutella pancakes, which I enjoyed sampling. I was  perfectly pleased with my substantially portioned skillet, though. The hash browns were perfectly browned and there was a good amount of cheese without being overwhelming. I didn't notice there were fresh juices on the menu until right before we left. I would definitely try that the next time I come here.Janik's has great prices for what you get, especially for the city. It's a solid brunch option in Wicker Park especially. Come here instead of milk & honey, which isn't as good and often has a wait on the weekends.

I was here for brunch with some friends on a Sunday afternoon and ordered the pancake combo (two pancakes, eggs scrambled dry, sausage and bacon).The food was all okay - I think I could have made comparable food. The pancakes were fluffy enough, but I tend to like mine a little sweeter (so I don't have to smother it in maple syrup), and the bacon and sausages were both very small portions, and basically what I could have gotten from a grocery store. Same with the eggs.It's not that I didn't enjoy it, but it's definitely not a food I would crave.

I ordered the Florentine Eggs Benedict and a Bloody Mary. The Florentine came with a generous portion of potatoes, and was fairly good for the price point, although the spinach was on the soggy side. I was definitely pleased with the $5 Bloody Mary.The staff was very attentive. My only qualm would be that I was given the check shortly after my meal arrived, which I felt signaled unnecessary urgency to finish since the place wasn't full.Overall decent quality for good prices.

I went for brunch on a Saturday - there were two of us. We called at like 10:30 to see what the wait might be - they said they had open tables but was first come first serve. We finally got there around 11:30 and got a table no problem. It was full but the tables turn over quickly. I'm a neighabor but relatively new to the hood and had not yet tried Janik's cafe. This place has a huge menu - so it's great to accommodate a lot of different eaters. It can be your local diner with a layer of hangover grease if you so wish or it can be perfect for the vegetarian in your life with all the fresh breakfast & lunch items listed.I had the breakfast quesadilla - I don't usually order this at places but I was of the "diet starts monday" mindset. It was fantastic! Huge portion that I couldn't finish. We shared two chocolate chip pancakes. perfectly fluffy and amazing. My boyfriend had the huevos rancheos which he loved and devoured.It took everything in my power to not insist we go back the next morning!! But I will be back... probably next weekend!

This is an AWESOME BRUNCH place that is QUICK & YUMMY! I've come here multiple times with a few friends to a big group. It usually doesn't have too long of a line (maybe 10-15min on weekends). I really like their Nutella banana pancakes, and they have great savory dishes as well! It's my 2nd favorite brunch place in Wicker Park after the bongo room.

My review is late...but better late than never! I went in a couple of weeks ago for breakfast and was very happy! I had the breakfast bowl..Super yummy! Friendly staff and quick service considering how busy they were that morning. I will definitely be back a second time!
I can only recommend this spot! Great omelets and potatoes! Fast and great service. Really good prices. All you want for a weekend breakfast.

Absolutely, hands down, my all time favorite breakfast place! Nothing on the menu disappoints. My bf and I have been coming here forever. We have moved out of the neighborhood and have started to try other breakfast places but they just never satisfy as much as Janik's. We always come back for some awesome pancakes, which are my favorite. My bf loves the eggs Benedict. Breakfast bowls are great. Serving sizes are either just right or you will have plenty of leftovers to take home.Sometimes crowded, but you can usually get a table pretty quickly. Artwork on the walls is for sale. Prices are very inexpensive. Owner is super nice and always walking around to make sure everyone is doing ok.Love this place!

it's great! Great hot chocolate, great french toast, great waffles! I didn't care for the syrup but the banana french dip they face with the French toast were good enough! eggs Benedict was delish pus also and u got a strong morning cocktail! great food, slow service. Still we be back though.

I love this place.  Had lunch with a friend there on Tuesday before my dentist appointment and fell in love with this place.   The crab cake sandwich was amazingly delicious and my friend had the BLT and you just can't go wrong with a BLT.  I ordered ice tea and it came in a giant glass so no refills necessary.  And, the whole bill was less than $25.00.  Fantastic.  Oh, forgot about the potato salad that came with the crab cake sandwich-also great.  Really, there's no reason to eat lunch anywhere else in that neighborhood.  Enjoy!!!
The Nutella custard croissant !!! And cappuccino yum!!!!Plus you get to support a local business..They have everything from sandwiches, ice cream, tacos and more
Nothing to rave about. Food is just OK. Wouldn't come here unless my options were limited.The service is slow and when we asked them for straws and a fork they seem irritated.

I'm a weekend brunch regular here with my fiance.  Why?-Very affordable-So many sweet and/or savory [read: EGGS] brunch options-All day breakfast!-Freshly squeezed orange juice - WHAT-Quick, friendly service - always offer me extra coffee TO GO-Bottomless good and cheap coffee-Even though it's usually packed on weekends for brunch, magically we always arrive when someone else is leaving-Dogs are allowed in the outdoor area-More racially/ethnically diverse and age diverse than many other brunch spots in Wicker Park/Uk. VillageYUMMY
Wonderfully fantastic breakfast spot! Great service, fair prices and super tasty food. Big thumbs up!

I came here for lunch based off the great Yelp reviews. Let me just go ahead and say that I had a great meal here. I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap, and it came with a pasta salad.The pasta salad was fantastic. I've never been a fan of pasta salads before, but this really was delicious. It wasn't overly creamy, and the perfect amount of light.The buffalo chicken wrap was equally great. The tomato wrap that it came in was great. I wasn't skimped on the chicken and the buffalo sauce was good.We sat on the outdoor patio. It was a gorgeous day so we had that going for us. It's always nice to be able to watch the traffic on Division as you eat. I always appreciate a place that has outdoor seating.Service was prompt and polite. We never had empty water glasses.This place is great if you want a good sandwich around lunchtime. Definitely coming back if I'm ever in the neighborhood.
Awesome neighborhood spot.Super versatile - great for breakfast and lunch.Laid back, kind, professional staff.Inexpensive.Great for kids too.
This small establishment is amazing! Quick service, ridiculously delicious food!!! Top notch flavors definitely going again!!!
Stopped by with my wife, had Nova Lox with smoked salmon, Katie had spinach&shrooms, both to die for. Thank You for nice start of a day
This is a great restaurant. It's so simple and clean. I personally love the soup... I love the rewards program. Amazing!

I eat here nearly every morning.  Wish the coffee were a little better, but everything on the "south of the border" section of the menu is so good that I can't keep away.  Get the Huevos Racheros or the Breakfast Bowl (add avocado)
This was an unexpected find.  Delish food.  Great ambiance.  Nice decor.  Great value for your money.  Decent staff.  The owner was very friendly despite an issue with server.  I will be back again.
The best biscuits and gravy ever! Just enough zest in the sausage, too.
DELICIOUS!!! Nutella waffles are amazing- huge salads great service. It's a new favorite!!

Very nice Cafe!I came for Mother's day with my mother-in-law and sister-in-law. Janik's Cafe is very cute, clean, great atmosphere, staff was friendly. I had Chilaquiles and my family had the steak & eggs. Food was great I'll definitely be back for another occasion. Brian was our server he was a total sweetheart :) The overall staff seemed friendly and organized. Very cute place and good breakfast food I highly recommend!

It wasn't a very busy Sat when I got there, but it was mostly full. I very politely went to the front and told the waitress I would be happy to sit in the least desirable seat by the door, since I was by myself and it was cold out and I could see people shuffling away from that section. I like to make it easy on servers - especially breakfast servers. I'm pretty sure they forgot about me, and proceeded to waited on the other tables as more people came in after me.  I watched as the staff stood around as if they were lost and clueless. After about 10 mins I waved a staff member down. I asked if they had forgotten about me since I hadn't placed and order yet. He looked blankly at me, said nothing, walked away and got a server. When the server came over he just said, "you ready to order?"  I'm pretty easy to please, but he really didn't acknowledge me.  Ordered the sausage bowl and was surprised how fast it came out. Bowl was good, what I expected. I never question tipping, but here, this time, I see no reason why I should.

Great food, unbelievable prices, and I've had nothing bad here. It's breakfast and lunch with a Latin twist to it. If I'm in the area I call in advance to pick up my breakfast bowl but I always manage to order a baileys shake to enjoy before I leave the doors.
I love it because I can get a table right away! I've only ever tried try breakfast chicken tostadas and they're pretty good

TERRIBLE SERVICE!My fiancée and I were very excited to check this place out. We were greeted immediately and menus brought out.  We sat outside on the patio and there were some tables filled but they definitely weren't slammed. Reviews from Yelp enticed us to stop in and try the suggested items: French toast, tortilla soup, & shakes. The issue is just that...they looked good on paper. A server walked passed us 4 times, not once acknowledging us; no water, drinks, nothing! We just sat there waiting for 10 minutes, feeling ignored. We looked inside and saw 5 staff members sitting down eating/drinking. I worked in the service industry for years; yes, everyone needs to eat and take a break on shift. However, you shouldn't have most of your staff on break at the same time while customers are waiting to be served. This poor service will unfortunately delay us from trying Janik's for a while longer. We've lived in the neighborhood for 3 years now and we're always looking for new places to check out. We were hoping to find a new breakfast place today. It was clearly a flop and we left!

It pains me to recommend this place bc it's one of my favorite places in Chicago, and I don't want to share ;)My bf and I are long distance and whenever he visits, our first stop is always janiks. We love the food, environment and service.Recommended: the crab cake Benedict. I've tried these in many restaurants, and none compare to theirs. Awesome spot!

First off, my girlfriend are neighbors, and thus regulars of Janik's. Like, every darn weekend, and it's because this adorable cafe has some of the best bang for your buck brunch in Chicago, let alone Chicago.If you don't get the French Toast - or have a bite of some else's French Toast - you are doing it wrong. This is some of the best French Toast I've ever had, period.Still, it should be mentioned that is not a "fancy" brunch style restaurant, rather quite the opposite. And that's okay.5 stars for Janik's and their wonderful French Toast!

Nice outdoor seating, and a fairly simple and straightforward menu.I really enjoyed my espresso, and the cheese grits were on point! The hollandaise on my crab cake benedict was good, and the eggs were properly cook... but sadly the crab cakes were bland and bready, and the english muffin was dry and low quality. Bummer, because otherwise it was perfect!Certainly a great deal in a hopping neighborhood. I'll be back!

Walked in. Sat down was greeted, handed menus. Told the server would be right with us. Waited about 10 minutes and the server came to the table next to us, cleaned up and left. Another 5 minutes pass and the server went the table across from us and left. Finally I say I'm dying of thrist kinda loud to my friends and the two servers look at each other and debate on who should go over to our table. Finally we were able to place our order. I ordered a omelet and it was good. But those servers though

Went for Sunday brunch and sat outside. We were seated and had our order taken quickly but after that, service was pretty much nonexistent. The food took a very long time which is understandable on a crowded day, but no one came to refill our coffee or water the whole time. The food was absolutely delicious though, so I would go back again.

Strong performance by Janik's, particularly the biscuits and gravy...that, on its own, was enough to say that hitting this spot for Restaurant Week was worth it.  I also tried a mixed berry smoothie, the chorizo breakfast bowl and the brownie a la mode (with very tasty Oreo ice cream).  Now I see why this place is always crushed on the weekends, especially when it gets warmer...fast service and the normal menu prices looked pretty good to me!

I have been to Janik's a handful of times, and have had food delivered from here even more and thought they deserved a shout out.Dining in? They are right on Damen and Division so the location is great. No frills food - just straightforward and delicious. We go for breakfast all the time (haven't made it in for lunch because the breakfast is THAT GOOD!). They have outdoor seating for when the weather is nice.Ordering out? Hands down one of the fastest delivery I have ever gotten.I love this place and so should you.

Okay, you do know that these little spots are the best, right?On a busy Saturday in the early afternoon the place was busy, BUT, the best part ~ we did not have to wait for a table.  That's right, when people finished their meal, they paid, AND LEFT.  Whole new concept for a few of the places in the city that I have visited and waited for up to an hour for a table, while watching people sit.  Just sit.Everything is fresh, very good, and extremely reasonably priced.  The perfect trifecta in the food industry.  Yes, the service, itself, was quick, anything to accommodate special requests, and with a smile ~ Merry Christmas to you, too.A bonus, the people watching is 5-star.  Perfect spot for a quick breakfast, brunch, or lunch.
I really like the breakfast burrito - I can't help but get it almost every time. Food in general is good, never a long wait and it's reasonably priced. A great little spot.

First order to them through grub hub had simple special order and the messed it up. So that immediately loses stars. It was pretty fast though, about half the estimated time. Prices aren't too bad.In terms of actual quality.The bread was basically like Aunt Millie's  so it was nothing special, and the same with the deli meats and cheese. I don't like a ton of meat on my sandwich but this was really like subway standards.Cookies were pretty hard. I wouldn't say stale, just hard.Sunkist Orange Soda was cold which is good and chips were regular Jay's which are pretty good.

Went here for lunch today and not great selection of you are gluten free other than salads. The brunch food looks delicious, only hope they can find a way to offer more alternatives such as gf pancakes or waffles.I purchased the apple salad with chicken and the chicken was over salted and a bit overcooked. The chicken taste competed with the sweetness of the salad.Overall looks like a fun place but beware if you have allergies!

I always use Yelp to order lunch for my boyfriend and I and decided to try Janik's. First off, the menu is HUGE which I love. I'm all about soup now that it's gotten cold out and I just couldn't decide which to get because they all sound amazing! I got chili and the bowl was actually huge for $4something - I could barely finish it!My boyfriend ordered a meatball sub and a turkey bacon (he's a hungry guy) and although the delivery was speedy, they delivered a turkey avocado sandwich instead. He absolutely hates avocado and even though he hesitated I told him to just call and tell them they mixed it up. When he did call they were super friendly and apologetic and insisted on having a driver bring him a new one free of charge with 2 extra bags of chips!! Great customer service, really nice people and at such a great value!Thanks Janik's!!

This place is awesome! It was my first time being there, everything was perfect. The service, the food, the design... Yes! I pay attention to the design of my plate as much as the taste of my food and this place rocked it! :DI was so excited about my food that I forgot to take a picture. But definitely will do next time. The restaurant is far from my neighborhood, but I will definitely go more often because it's worth it.I highly recommend you go and try it out. One of a kind! And TASTY! :D

My friends and I originally were planning to go to Bite Cafe for brunch but it was an hour to hr half wait so we came on over to Janik's since there weren't much of a wait. We were seated within 15 minutes for a Saturday brunch at 1130, awesome! The staff were hospitable and got us seated. The culture there is pretty much if you see an open table take it! There's no one that needs to bring you to a table.The food on the entire menu is cheap, so my husband and I ordered more than one entree. I had the crab cake benedict which was okay. The Janik potatoes were good! I also ordered their cobb salad which was also okay. Decent food. I have no complaints. My husband ordered their french toasts and two eggs with meat. He said it was pretty good. I like their french toasts, though. It was good. My other friends ate there before and ordered their norm. I believe they enjoyed their food.Overall, food is cheap and decent. Easy to get seated. Parking is a little difficult.
Good basic food. Fast service decent prices in a neighborhood where this is getting harder to find.  Atmosphere had a Hipster vibe, crowded but we were luckily able to get a table.

Today was definitely a day of despair. With all the bad weather in Chicago and the holidays, I ran out of all my staple groceries to make breakfast. We finally broke down and decided to order breakfast delivery. I used Yelp to find Janik's and was excited to see the high ratings. We used the online ordering system offered by Yelp. I will have to give kudos to the system as it is very easy to use.My husband ordered a bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich and I ordered a steak and cheese omelet with mushrooms. Since we were under the 15 dollar limit, I also ordered the cheesy hash browns.Aaaaaand here's where the low ratings come in. When we got ready to eat our food, there was no bacon in my husband's BACON, egg, and cheese sandwich. Then, my pet peeve. The hash browns were NOT hash browns but rather breakfast potatoes (which I personally am not fond). To top it off, there was NO cheese... sigh. Oh I also forgot to mention that they had a strange after taste which led me to believe that the oil they used was quite old. I also would not have ordered the potatoes if the description of the omelet stated the inclusion of potatoes.The positives were the delivery service and the omelet. The delivery was on time and the guy was very nice. The omelet was standard.Moral of the story: do groceries proactively.
Best food ever!They have great service and their chicken lime soup is amazing!  I crave it all the time. Yummy!
Love this place! Friendly staff, great food,super bargain prices.  What more could you want? These guys really care about what they do and I adore them for it.
Love this place! I had the avocado BLT and it was fantastic and the service was great!
Breakfast. Steak and eggs..do it. Just do yourself a favor and do it.Fast service and friendly servers.

Janik's not only has great food, but also some of the best service anywhere!  We order from here often for group lunches and the service has always been really good, but yesterday they went above and beyond.   When our order didn't make it to them from Grub Hub I called them directly and they had our food to us in 20 minutes from when I placed the order - and everything was perfect.
Always good. Been coming for a long time. Chicken Lime soup every time!  Banana walnut pancakes are good too! Always crowded but always worth the wait!

My boyfriend ordered the belgian waffle with a side of berries and a side of hash browns. I ordered the French toast with custard.I liked what I ordered, but the bacon was too burnt/crispy for me. The white sauce that came with it was a bit too sweet, but still nice. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal, but they forgot his side of berries and his side of hash browns. The waitress brought the hash browns, but forgot the berries.The customer service here is lacking. I wanted to get hot sauce for my food, but I couldn't find the waitress, so I got up and grabbed it myself. Another customer saw me and he did the exact same thing, so I'm not the only one!Food not extraordinary and the service needs some help.

The food here is pretty good and the service is very friendly.  I think the menu is really broad for the type of place it is, it might be better to just focus on what they are good at to keep it more manageable.  Overall fairly uneventful; I wouldn't go out of the way to come here but it's definitely a good option for this part of town if you're here already.

I have literally walked by this place over 200 times since living in the Wicker Park area and been to every establishment that surrounds it.Yet Ive always strayed away from Janik's Cafe.Was it the faded and tattered awning or the assumption this was an Eastern European coffee house? Maybe it was both....But as the old saying goes - never judge a book (in this case, fucking amazing brunch place) by its cover!!!!!!Err mah gerd!! It was a chilly Sunday morning and their patio was packed, we opted to sit inside. Big space, cool art and hipstery Chicago feel. Also packed.Get the menu... Options for days!! I can not even effectively sum up the menu.In short, I went with the breakfast quesadilla and cheese grits. I ate every last bite. So damn good.Oh, did I mention they also serve liquor?Nothing like a $2.50 budlight with my breakfast.I am forever furious with myself for not trying this place long ago.
I LOVED Janik's. But boyfriend and I stopped by on a sunny Friday for some brunch. Food was good, service was on point, and mimosas were only $5! I'll be back

DONT EAT HERE!*Disclaimer: I manage a restaurant five days a week and have hired/employed numerous workers in the past 5-7 years.*First off, I had a great first experience a few months back. The food was great and the service was average.This final visit:FIRST, I had ordered a salad. Upon arrival, the salad had 20-30 rotten prices of lettuce on the plate. I could deal with a bad piece or two, but the kitchen staff knew this and continued to serve it to me. That is unacceptable.NEXT, after removing the rotten food, I noticed there was A HAIR in my salad. Attention to detail at this restaurant is spectacular.AFTER THAT, we had zero follow up from our server or acting manager. It became clear later that there isn't an actually manager on duty.I was not looking to get any of the bill comped in any way. None was even offered.This sort of action would never take place while I was running a shift at my restaurant.While I was finishing my meal, our very own waiter began closing our outdoor seating section. The section was well covered until that point. I then ate the rest of the meal in the blazing sun.CUSTOMER SERVICE:I then asked to speak with a manager about why our experience was so poor. This was the first time I saw the "manager" the entire time. She did the absolute minimum to resolve the issue. All I received was a blank stare and a meager "sorry".It seemed like, for now $10/hr., that was the acceptable level of customer service for them.Shocking.With over 30 other well-established restaurants on division st, we will have no problem not returning to Janik's Cafe.Janik's Cafe has just lost my business.(Those are the last words a business needs to hear in this economy)BUYER BEWARE!

This place was fine; we sat on the patio, but neither the patio nor the inside have much in the way of ambiance or character. Our server didn't bring our coffees until after we were midway through our breakfast. Food was good (pancakes and eggs; chilaquiles), but nothing to rave about.
I love it here!! Cannot go wrong with the Chicken lime soup and buff chick wrap! Obsessed. And as a bonus they deliver :))

Came here for our anniversary and had an amazing time! We got a great big booth on the back wall facing the entire restaurant and bar - great for people watching! (My guy almost lost his cool when Denzel Valentine walked in, lol)Everything we ordered, from the oysters and carpaccio for starters, to the filet and lobster tail for dinner, to the mushrooms and broccolini to accompany, it was all just to die for. The lobster tail specifically was some of the best lobster I have ever had. Even compared to that of places I've been in the Northeast. Drizzled in this miso butter sauce, I could've eaten literally like 3 more tails - if they weren't like $40 a pop that is. But oh my god was it worth it. SO delicious.After dinner they come out with a huge plate of pink cotton candy which we loved. We also got a dessert which was so-so, I'd recommend just sticking with the cotton candy. Unless you're really craving chocolate, it's perfect to help curb that sweet tooth I always get at the end of a meal.Service, as expected, was perfect. The minute your plate is empty, someone is there to pick it up for you. Silverware is changed frequently, and your drinks are never empty. Staff is very knowledgeable and does a great job assisting you in ordering.The place has kind of a speakeasy vibe, lots of rich woods, leather, great lighting. The Windows on to the street are completely covered in beautiful curtains which really transports you into the moment.Overall I would highly recommend RPM Steak for anyone looking to celebrate, or even just looking to treat yourself. It's a nice change of pace from other Chicago steak houses like Morton's or Gibson's.

First time thereHad the fried calamari, Tuna tartar, king crab claws & roasted beat salad. All delicious.For dinner we all had the filet 8oz  & lamb chops with mac and cheese side and the garlic Yukon potatos Meat was all cooked to perfection.Wine was Pinot Noir  JL BONACCORSI bin 1627 and a great choice.Dessert was cheesecake with lemon whipped cream and blueberries, donuts with a dipping sauce and a peanut butter filled chocolate cup with caramel popcorn and a chocolate drizzle.The cappuccino was hot and creamy. Best I've ever had.Front desk was very nice however wouldn't seat our party of 6 until at least 5 were present. Immediately upon arrival of all guests we were seated and greeted.Service was great.Very expensive but worth itI'll definitely go back and want to try RPM Italian.

Go big or go home right? I decided to throw a party for my boyfriend's birthday at RPM Steak after drooling over these photos. We had a room on the 2nd floor looking over the main dining room. It was a great set up because we still had the ambiance of a restaurant. Nothing has really wow'd me about the food... But to be honest, you can't appreciate food when you're distracted; therefore, we would love to go back and try it between just the two of us.Our servers were attentive and super sweet. They helped me with our spontaneous change to an after party too.Big shoutout to the coordinators who helped me plan this dinner. I was all over the place... unsure what I was really planning. All worked out well though!

After a fairly negative experience last year, RPM's management reached out to me and offered us a not insubstantial (roughly one entree) gift card to return. I was still skeptical, but the boy and I finally had a big celebration planned and I caved. I couldn't be more pleased we went back. Unfortunately, I didn't order any of the same things, so I can't tell if the food has gotten substantially better or if I just ordered well this time. But here's how to do it right, apparently:We started off with the beef carpaccio. I was nervous. The last time I had carpaccio (at another establishment), it made me sick almost immediately and the texture was awful. Not so this time. This had a great almost salami-like flavor (with more beef undertones, obviously) with a delicious salad inside and great aioli on top. It was fantastic.For dinner, I went with the steak frites, upgrading the frites to a millionaire's potato and a shared side of Brussel sprouts. I don't even like sprouts and I loved the curry Brussel sprouts. They were like the world's healthiest curry potato chip. Delicious! The béarnaise sauce on the steak was fantastic, and the steak itself was fine. The millionaire's potato was a bit of a letdown - I didn't think the truffles on top added as much flavor as if they had been worked in, and I wanted a bit more flavor (garlic? Scallions? Basically anything).On the beverage side, I went with an autumn sour and it was delightful. Sweet and a little tangy, I could have kept drinking those all night. Our server (a Mr. Dritan according to me receipt) was a delight - very attentive and funny. It's definitely a special occasion sort of place, but I'll happily put this one back in my rotation. The menu definitely isn't bulletproof, but we had a decidedly good experience.

The food is amazing! The service is incredible. We love the atmosphere. The energy is always likely and I love the set up they have. It's great for business dinners and the bar area is quite nice.We always enjoy their desserts and the hand crafted cocktails are the best we know around town.

Enjoyed my husband's birthday dinner, and yes we ate the golden chocolate cake. Cool things about this place: (1) best steak ever (2) very hip (3) sexy music and mood lighting (4) cool people e'rywhere (5) even bussers wear tuxes (6) strong tasty classic cocktails (7) a Lamborghini parked outside (8) event the bathrooms are nice (9) they let me eat there.Negative things about this place: (1) the specials felt like more of a sales pitch. But that's it! Only one negative! Go, flee before me and feast upon the buttery steaks of locally sourced, grassfed bovine and please dress to the nines! Wear false lashes!

On a trip to Chicago with the better half for our annual nuptial trip, we had many options for dinner.  Many of my Yelp friends gave great suggestions on places to eat, thanks to all them for their suggestions!  I decided to hit up RPM Steak since it was highly recommended from my fellow Yelpers and within walking distance to our hotel.The vibe when you walk in is a low-key, romantic, yet modern vibe.  Confused already?  So was I.  The lighting is dim, giving great ambience, the decor is more modern and the music playing overhead was definitely not your typical steakhouse music, it was 'hip'.  Not that I am hip, because those days are long gone.  Needless to say, we were ready!The hostess made us feel very welcome immediately.  Very friendly, smiling and polite.  She guided us to our table and we began our adventure.  I immediately took to the wine list.  The wine is is fairly robust, offering many Old World and New World options.  There is not a main focus of the wine menu as it offers many styles, varietals and countries for you to choose from.  But if you asked me, I could tell they took pride in their French Bordeaux and Burgundy wines.  A decent amount of Cru Classe Bordeaux wines and a wide assortment of Burgundy wines.  The prices are fairly reasonable for most of the wines as well.  Since I like to scout around lesser known regions for red wine values, I found myself looking through Chile and Spain.  Found a great Tempranillo and we were off, time to look at food.The menu is very robust.  Plenty of appetizers, entrees, cocktails, wines, caviar and desserts.  For an appetizer, we started with the Cheddar Popovers and Thick-Cut Bacon (recommended from friends from the night before).  Both app's were delicious!  For the main course, you have options my friends, lots of options.  Steaks and seafood dominate the menu, but let's be real, that is why you come to a steakhouse, right?  I had the "Sno Cap" special.  A 5 ounce Wagyu beef dish.  Yes, I only ate 5 ounces of steak.  The better half had "The Duke" which is a 10 ounce ribeye.  I had my steak done to the chef's recommendation and it was spot on.  I love a juicy, red steak without all the 'red' on the plate.  Perfectly cooked and perfect presentation.  The better half lover her ribeye (so did I, since I snuck a piece or two or three).  In addition, we ordered the Millionaire Potato (fantastic!!) and the spicy brocollini (also fantastic!)  For dessert, I opted for Peanut Butter/Chocolate Ice Cream and the BH had the Vanilla Sugar Doughnuts.  Though we were both full prior to dessert, we happily finished both off.Brian, our server, was spot on, one of the best servers I have had in my recent dining experiences.  Super friendly, extremely knowledgable about the menu and the wines.  Cannot say enough about him.This place is pricey as all heck, but you know that going in.  One of the better meals I have ever had.  I would happily go back again!

SO GOOD. I think this is the best steakhouse I've ever been to.We ordered the parker house rolls which are a must- especially because I don't think this restaurant has a complimentary bread basket so it is a good starter to get! The bread is extremely fresh and the rosemary butter it comes with is the perfect compliment to the sweet,buttery rolls.We got filets as our entree and the steak was extremely tender and perfectly cooked!For sides, we ordered the millionaire's potato is a must (it looked funny in pictures so we were a bit hesitant at first but it is absolutely the best potato dish I've ever had - basically smooth mashed potatoes in a crispy potato skin topped with cheese and truffle shaving. We also got the trumpet mushrooms which were extremely good as well.To end our night we got the chocolate cake which was super chocolatey and definitely satisfied our sweet tooth!All the portions here were big (even the chocolate cake) and the service was excellent! our waitress was extremely attentive and friendly!

While in Chicago, you must eat steak. Yes, copious amounts of corn fed cattle farmed and raised in the mid west. RPM was one of three steakhouses I attended while visiting the windy city. Also, I'd like to add that I rarely eat red meat so at the end of this trip I wanted to die. Ha.Anyway...RPM is a swanky steakhouse that differs from many others in a "traditional" sense. Not that it's a bad thing, just expect a different experience when dining here. I was impressed with the level of service and management definitely knows what they are doing.We started with the popovers and the burrata/heirloom tomato salad. Both were pleasant, light and great options before the main course. I opted for the 12oz. filet (bone out) because, it's just an easy cut of meat. I went with the "Allen Brothers" prime, which is a local beef and boy was it great! Cooked to perfection and one of the better pieces of beef I've ever had. Seriously, really good. To accompany this hefty helping of beef, we had the shaved black truffle twice baked potato. Holy mackerel was it rich :)All in all, a successful dining experience and I'd go back in a heartbeat. Stay tuned for the next Chicago steakhouse review.

What started as a frustrating experience, turned in to one of the most memorable nights I've ever had.The evening started by my boyfriend and I arriving 10 min early for our 7:30 reservation. (Side note, we have had this reservation for 6+ months and were really excited) We were told as we entered that we would be seated closer to our reservation time, which we understood and had no issue with. 20 min later, we were still not seated and had yet to receive an update. My boyfriend and I truly felt we were being judged by our younger appearance to be honest. We received no sorry or even update. We began to count the couples / parties that were seated ahead of our party of two. In the end 9 parties (two being parties of 2) were seated ahead of us. Some being 7:45 reservations. Although we were excited to celebrate our big anniversary there, we began to browse to see if any other places around us had open reservation times because we were so frustrated. Sure enough, at 22 min past our reservation time (and 3 potential other restaurants chosen) we were told it was time for us to sit. This did not sit well over with my boyfriend who sits here next to me, still frustrated and pouting to my right, over the situation.Moving on, we walk to our table and see Giuliana & Bill sitting in the corner table. I won't spend much time on this cause everyone knows how perfect and amazing they are.Anyways, let's start with the decor. The dim lighting and the half oval cushion booths along every wall are the most elegant design that created the perfect romantic setting. As the booths align each wall, more tables fill the center. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to get one of the large booths that allowed us to have a gorgeous view of the entire restaurant.The staff: Although we had a very sour start, our waiter David was one of a kind. SO attention detailed, intelligent, attentive and kind, he turned our night around instantly. Constantly getting to know us and make sure we had a great anniversary, this detail was very much appreciated and noted. Thank you David for making our night so special!Now the food- the best part .The appetizers: We started with the Parker dinner rolls, the hamachi and the wedge salad. The Parker dinner rolls were soft and delicious, but in all honestly weren't any different than the dinner rolls you can buy frozen at Costco. They are a great thing that's easy to start with to nosh on, but not bursting with flavor. The hamachi however was elegantly presented and loaded with both spicy and clean/fresh flavors. The dish was very small but incredible. Finally the wedge. What comes across as a very simple and boring salad can easily be a disaster, but this one was incredible! The wedge was dressed with square chunks of blue cheese that were delicious, large tomatoes, and thick square cuts of bacon. Yum! With our appetizers, I ordered one of the best dirty martinis with blue cheese olives I've ever encountered in Chicago, and my boyfriend had an old fashioned. What rpm steak constantly presented was the attention to detail in every item. The ice cube in the old fashion was even branded with RPM on it and the drink itself was flavorful and smooth.The entree: I originally was going to play it safe and order the 8 oz filet, but David (our amazing waiter) suggested the lamb chops and WOW was he right. They were so delicious. Crispy yet tender at the same time. I had separation anxiety letting my bones being taken after licking them clean. I needed more of that amazing flavor!! My boyfriend got The Duke and loved his as well. It was like cutting soft butter! With our steaks, we ordered the Hen of the Woods mushrooms. Like the Parker House Rolls, they were not the best thing honestly, but a nice side to add to my dinner. Personally I don't know if I would get those again. They just didn't have that much flavor or pizzazz like everything else I encountered before in the meal.Finally: the dessert. After watching countless tables get the baked Alaska, we figured we should join in on the fun too. The presentation did not fall short. It was gorgeous and even came with some homemade cotton candy!Overall, our anniversary dinner was extremely special and was saved by both the delicious food, the attention to detail, and the wonderful waiter David. I am still a bit salty about how our meal began, but happy the night overall ended to well.

I think I've found my new favorite steakhouse! From the food to the service to the ambience, my dining experience at RPM Steak was excellent and therefore I can't wait go back! My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our 5 year anniversary and we loved our experience from start to finish.Parking: there's valet parking available but there's also paid street parking a block away if you don't mind the walk.Location: RPM Steak is by Epic Burger, there's a ton of restaurants and bars in the area.Decor and Ambience: loved the decor, it was dimly lit inside and I loved the booths and the white loungy chairs in the dining room area. I loved that it felt romantic due to the dim lights. The ambience was great, it felt chill and loungy. I honestly thought it was gonna be uptight and too posh since this place is in downtown but it was the opposite! I saw couples, families with kids, and coworkers eating there and it felt more relaxed and chill than I had expected.Service: Service was excellent from the beginning since we walked through the doors until the end of our meal. We were greeted by smiles by the hostess and she wished us a happy anniversary. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered our food based on his recommendations and we were so happy that he recommended the best items on the menu. He was very attentive, refilling our waters, asking us if we wanted more beer or drinks, and cleaning our table once we finished our food.Food and Drink: I ordered the Good Night and Good Luck, which had tequila, strawberry, and lemon. This was strong and it tasted yummy. We ordered the Wagyu Beef Carpaccio as an appetizer, Parker House Rolls, Roasted Summer Corn, the Millionaire's Potato, the Duke, and the Cowboy for our main dishes.The Wagyu Beef Carpaccio is raw beef wrapped with arugula and parmesan. I loved the flavors and it had a little kick with the peppercorn. We wanted more, it was so good. The Parker House Rolls were nice and warm and buttery and we loved the rosemary butter that it came with. The Roasted Summer Corn was a little spicy to me because of the peppercorn but it was great. I especially loved the Millionaire's Potato, one of the highlights of my meal. I loved the cheese and the truffle potatoes, I couldn't stop eating it!As for the steak, I got the Duke, a 10 oz ribeye filet. My boyfriend ordered the Cowboy, a 24 oz steak. The server was awesome for recommending these 2 dishes and even better for asking us if we wanted our steak to be sliced! Our steaks were perfectly cooked medium done. I wish I liked my Duke better but it was a little too salty on the edges. I do appreciate that it was perfectly cooked because my boyfriend and I ate all of it. I enjoyed my boyfriend's Cowboy Steak better and it was so juicy and cooked perfectly. We ate all of our steaks because we enjoyed it so much!As for dessert, we got complimentary cotton candy since it was our anniversary. We ordered the Baked Alaska, which was prepared at the table. This was yummy, it was like ice cream cake with a smores taste on top.Verdict: I loved the food, the service, and the ambience. I can't wait to take my family here because I enjoyed the experience so much. Next time, my boyfriend and I want to try the Wagyu Tomahawk!

Before work, I had decided to stop in for a late lunch.  The hostess gave me the option to sit in the dinning area or in the bar area.  Opted to sit in the bar area.Dion, bartender, had greeted me shortly after I sat with a smile.  Dion even remembered me from the last time I was in.   He is a great asset to RPM and to the Lettuce Entertain You organization.I had opted to start with a soda.  By the time, he had returned with my drink, I was ready to order.  This time, I decided to try the Executive Toasted Cheese comes with a small side salad.  I also ordered an order of fries.Within 8 minutes or so,  the items were dropped off to me.  The toasted cheese sandwich was cut into four slices.  The cheeses were rich and filling.  The fries were flavored just right.  Dion would check in periodically without being overbearing.Excellent food and service.  I would highly recommend this restaurant and looking forward to my next visit.

Holy stuffed to the brim, batman!We were starving: that was our first (and only) problem. We saw a menu with food and just said yes. To everything.Parker House Rolls with rosemary Nordic butter? Yes.Thick-cut bacon with this donut-y (bourbon-vanilla) glaze? Hell yes.Alaskan king crab? Oh, yes.Miso-broiled black cod with sesame? Is it OK if I lick the plate?Bone-in KC cut? Seriously making my mouth water right now just thinking about it.Millionaire's potato? Fluffy, buttery, truffle-y goodness. Yes!Crispy hasselback? Actually, the only "just OK" thing we had.Donuts with whipped Nutella: sugar-y donuts were fresh and delightful, the whipped Nutella... meh.Watermelon cotton candy: the perfect ending to a meal (of this size) for two.Fantastic wine selection with tasty cocktails (the rye-based ones are delicious[ly strong])!Three bills later, we waddled outta there slightly tipsy though entirely satiated.

I was really not sure what to expect when invited for dinner here. This was mostly due it being owned by reality tv stars. However, I will say that it exceeded my expectations. The cherry on the top was the service - extremely attentive, helpful and didn't rush our dining experience. I would say the wait staff was the best I've experienced in the city.The decor was nice. It's a mix of old school and modern. Not my taste personally but tastefully appointed.We started with cocktails at the bar. The grapefruit mule and old fashioned were good but the standout was the good night and good luck. So good and so dangerous :)Now the important part: Dinner! The lobster in miso sauce and the steaks were really where it's at. I will say that we had to return our Kansas cut twice because it wasn't cooked properly. When they finally brought it back, it was overcooked (but I thought it was still good). We also had the rib eye prepared tournedos rossini (basically the richest thing ever). It's a divine chunk of foie gras served on your steak with a truffle demi-glace sauce. Definitely have your steak prepared this way! In addition, we also ordered the Cobb salad and tuna tar tar- definitely something to skip. Don't miss out on the calamari (best I've ever had), the spicy broccolini and the thick bacon (O-M-G)! We paired dinner with a Chianti and a Malbec which were both fantastic recommendations.And then... The dessert! This alone gets all my stars and votes. We ordered the cotton candy (hello childhood), the cheesecake (which was quite delicate), the donuts (nothing special) and then the baked Alaskan (best I have ever had).Would I go back? Yes! If you have a special occasion or just want a great meal and kind service - make yourself a reservation!

Had a wonderful experience. First, the atmosphere is very different from a traditional steakhouse. It has a contemporary design with modern music and a sort of hipster vibe coming from the waiters. They are super nice, accommodating, and knowledgeable about the food and cooking process. The portions are large enough to share so we got to try a lot of items without stuffing ourselves silly. Love it and will be back!

Had to work late tonight and decided to order in. This review is for carryout only, as I have yet to dine at the restaurant. I ordered the 8oz filet and roasted sweet potatoes. The filet had no fat, was cooked medium as requested, and was soft to cut through, all a plus. For whatever reason, they decided to douse the top of the filet with salt. I've never actually seen that before, but needless to say it definitely affected the taste, not in a pleasant way. The roasted sweet potatoes also would have been tasty, but for the container being drenched in some kind of oil or liquid. The roasted sweet potatoes themselves had a nice tangy taste to them. Won't be ordering in from here but would definitely try dining in next time. Prices were relatively market rate for the area.

Made reservations for Friday evening at 5:30PM to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. It is a very classy ambiance and service was amazing.Between the two of us, we got:-Parker house rolls - They don't give free bread like many other restaurants do. The parker house rolls were buttery with a nice crust.-Thick cut bacon - Good, but overplayed. The outside was sweet and crispy. Inside was tender. It tasted like there were some Asian-inspired flavors such as soy sauce, brown sugar at play.-8 oz Filet Mignon - Above average. This filet had flavor and was melt-in-your-mouth. Also cooked perfectly - medium rare like I requested.-10 oz "The Duke" Above average. Had all the flavor of a ribeye cut without the bone. Also cooked perfectly medium rare.-Roasted Sweet Potatoes (side) - Average. There was a bit of a kick to the roasted sweet potatos and a sprinkling of cheese on top. Would have preferred the potatoes without the cheese.-Curry Brussels Sprouts (side) - Above average. Crispy, perfectly seasoned with a spicy kick to it.We opted out of dessert, but to celebrate the birthday, they gave us free cotton candy, which was a nice touch.Definitely a good place to try out for special occasions, but it can be pricey.

It was a Wednesday night, and they were very busy, so we had to wait a little longer than our reservation time to be seated. However, the manager approached us to apologize for the wait and our server treated us to an appetizer and dessert! That really blew us away.For dinner we had the bone in ribeye and 14 oz strip steak- both were amazing. The Ribeye was the best I've ever had. We also got a few sides (spinach and sweet potatoes) that were delicious. ANOTHER thing that blew me away was that, when going over the menu before ordering, our server Drew mentioned a seasonal side of squash that we should try. I forgot about it when it came time to order, but when our food came out, he brought one for us on the house anyway because "you guys seemed so enthusiastic about it but then didn't order it, and I wanted you to try it." What!? Ha! That was awesome. We ended with the s'mores dessert, and it is amazing also.Shoutout to Drew for being an amazing server. I really wish I caught the manager's name who was so kind to us in our wait as well- I really liked him. This was a great experience for us overall!

Service: We had to wait quite a while for our table, even on a Tuesday night, but the manager took great care of us and gave us free appetizers for our trouble.  The service after that was great.  Our server took great care of us and explained all the cuts of meat and the sides expertly.  The one hiccup was that he offered to help us make wine recommendations and when we asked his thoughts on a Napa cab on the menu, he said he had never tasted it before and didn't know anything about it.  Other than that though, very attentive and didn't rush us at the end of our meal when we were one of the only tables left in the restaurant.Main courses: The steak was definitely worth the wait.  We had a group of five and each of us tried a different cut and they were all cooked perfectly to temperature with a great flavor on each steak.  I'm not a huge steak person so I tried the steak frites for a smaller cut.  It came with plenty of crispy frites with a great dipping sauce.  The steaks paired perfectly with the sides we got on our waiter's recommendation-- the crispy flavorful brussel sprouts and the blue cheese whipped potatoes.Dessert: I dare you to find another restaurant that has a chocolate cake with gold flakes, Boston creme donuts, and cotton candy all on the dessert menu.  The chocolate cake was moist and rich. The donuts were light and fluffy with delicious Boston creme sauce to drizzle on top.  And the cotton candy-- well, it was randomly awesome and brought me immediately back to my childhood.

For our first anniversary, my husband and I made an 8:15pm reservation on a Friday night. We got there an hour early and checked in and tried to find a seat at the bar. This place was packed with people! We ordered drinks to wait for bar stools. My husband had some fancy beer and I tried the imperial spritz. My Spritz was a little bitter, but the vodka made me happy while waiting for our table.There were a lot of people waiting to be seated, in fact. At some point we moved toward the hostess table to wait for our table (about 25 minutes after our reservation). There were so many people coming up to complain to the hostess regarding their wait time, but those people irritated me more than the wait did, and when we were seated (45 min after reservation), I figured out WHY we waited so long for a table! The restaurant itself isn't very large, and there are only so many tables. With an extensive wine, beer, and liquor list, it's not surprising that you just want to sit and enjoy your meal with some drinks!Before we were seated, all the ladies at the hostess area were just incredible and polite. They were great at diffusing difficult situations with people who were irate that they weren't seated. One of the managers did have to comp a round of drinks for the very vocal complainers. There was even a round of champagne coming around to everyone waiting! Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to grab a flute, but one of the hostesses (I unfortunately didn't get any of their names) went out of her way to grab us two!Our waiter, Scott G, was warm, inviting, and very knowledgable! He let us know the prices of the specials upfront. He didn't have to try very hard to sell us on the white truffle risotto (the managers come out to slice the truffle onto the risotto at the table!). Omg it was the most rich delicious risotto of my life!Our appetizers (comped for our long wait!) were the cheddar popovers (themselves dry, but the prosciutto butter was delicious!) and the thick bacon. Now listen, bacon lovers, this is unlike any bacon you have ever had. It had this delicious maple tasting sauce on it, and it was so tender and melted in our mouths. I only wish there were more of it!For our entrees, hubby had the Duke (10 oz ribeye) and deemed it very delicious. I had the 8 oz filet mignon with bearnaise sauce and it was also delicious - though not anything extraordinary. We split the risotto and the Parmesan spinach (also amaze balls).All in all, this is a great restaurant with long wait times (which isn't surprising, since I wish we were able to sit longer with drinks and food. But I needed to relieve the sitter...). We were too full for dessert, but everyone around us who had dessert looked like it was delicious and smelled amazing!

My boyfriend had one request for his birthday - steak. After hearing many positive reviews of RPM, I decided to try the "new school" Chicago steakhouse. Trying to make reservations one month in advance means a 5:30pm dining time on a Saturday night. No matter, we gladly skipped lunch to save room in anticipation of our early meal. Valet is offered, but we parked in the garage next door ($21) so we could walk around the neighborhood after dinner.I won't dwell on decor or ambiance, and instead say this is a definite date or business dinner spot. While at the early hour of our visit there were some diners in khaki shorts, I recommend more refined attire to match the white linens. Ladies, please be careful in your heels! I was slipping and sliding in my stilettos and another female patron fell right beside our table in her wedges. The painted wood floor in the dining room is especially smooth. I have to give kudos to the staff for trying to immediately clean up an invisible puddle though. In fact, service was top notch at every level.Food was equally impeccable. For the first time ever, my boyfriend said he could see why people like oysters. We both enjoyed the jalapeño and sherry with the half dozen we started with. The Caesar salad was also exceptional, and I appreciated it's lack of croutons. The real winner of the meal was my man's Allen Brother's filet. It was seasoned and cooked perfectly. My halibut was similarly done well.It couldn't be a birthday without ice cream cake, right? The baked Alaska is finished tableside and drizzled with rich fudge. In case you're wondering, it's probably meant for four, but the birthday boy ate 3/4 of it himself. You only live once you know.If you're on the edge of visiting RPM Steak, I say what are you waiting for??
Great service. Very good food. Fantastic sides. Great atmosphere. Recommended but not perfect.

Good food good friends good times. Friend had his birthday here  and we got a private room. The place was packed with fancy people. Wasn't expecting a prefixed meal with 10 courses. Thought I was going to just order something simple off the menu. Felt kinda guilty eating 1/3 of the snow crab appetizers it was pretty tasty. There was only 3 pieces but don't think anyone noticed or cared. The bill end up being $2500 without tips. There was 15 of us and 9 bottles of wine and shots going around.

Came here Friday night for my daughters birthday, She has been looking forward to this for months. When we checked in we were told that our table was not ready. We waited patiently at the bar. While we waited a manager stopped over to introduce himself (Admire ) and ensure us that our table would be ready shortly and he apologized for the delay. After discovering that our daughter was hungry, he brought chips over for her to snack on which was very thoughtful. Once we finally got seated our server Steven was fantastic, already knowing we were starving he brought over bread right away. He made great suggestions for steaks . Later the manager Admire stopped over again to make sure we were taken care of which was a nice touch. My daughter said it was the best meal she ever had which was worth all the wait. Will be back again.PS. we asked for business cards for Steven and Admire and the host stand had neither.

Ambience of the place was real slick wit and upstairs that over looked the entire restaurant real playa like ... Service was really good waiter was on point steak was decent but could've been a little more tender and I ordered medium for a160$ steak I expected it to damn near melt n my mouth . But besides al that we turnt up like bosses that night

Shalamar's lyrics were spot on for visit number  two. The "second time around is much better".After receiving a very generous offer to have another steak here, I ventured over (with a reservation) on a Sunday evening. This time the temperature of the steak was PERFECT.As for service, it was just as great as it was the first time. Sam, our server was very witty and genuinely a nice guy. He ensured our glasses of wine matched the other (even though our drinking patterns are different) which was no small task.Our ChoicesGuiliana Chopped Salad - 5/5 (amazing)Cheddar Popovers with prosciutto butter -3/528 day dry aged Kansas City Cut -4/5Bone in Ribeye  -4/5Oyster and Wild Garlic Mushrooms - 4/5Charred Cauliflower - 4/5Champagne Grapefruit Sorbet - 3/5Recommendations-If you are dining with someone else and you enjoy similar type wine, it is best to share a half bottle or bottle. It is economically better than ordering by the glass. If ordering red, it also ensures you have a newly opened bottled.- As for valet parking ($15), it seriously takes a while (more than 15 minutes) for them to bring vehicles around. I would suggest parking at a meter close by or car service.-If celebrating a special occasion, let them know. Your server will bring out flavor of the day cotton candy for the table to share.- If you are visiting on a date or romantic evening, you should request a booth or table along the wall.

My husband and I had an excellent date night here during our weekend getaway to Chicago! We enjoyed the fresh taste of the burrata caprese, followed by a perfectly cooked and seasoned filet mignon paired with lobster risotto. Meanwhile I had a couple glasses of Malbec and my husband enjoyed a crafted vodka drink. We finished up our meal with some delicious and rich nutella bread pudding and a glass of Tawny Port. This is definitely a great restaurant for a romantic and private evening with your significant other. The service was excellent, we will definitely be back next time we are in town!

What a great experience from start to finish! We went to RPM on a Saturday night to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. Our original reservation was at 5:30pm, but based on traffic we weren't able to get there until 6pm. We called around 5:30pm to let them know, and even though they said they could only hold the table for us for 15min, we were still able to be seated immediately once we arrived and the hostesses were very friendly. So that was a great start.The dining experience was as equally wonderful. Our server was very friendly and helpful, making suggestions on drinks and food when we asked, and even taking a GREAT group picture of our table. He served the birthday boy an AMAZING Old Fashioned (pictured), and pouring it at the table was very nice touch!Lets get down to business: THE FOOD WAS AMAZING!Started out with appetizers: the Thick Cut Bacon and Tuna Tartare (both pictured)-the bacon is SO thick its crazy. My boyfriend LOVES tartare so we will order it as an appetizer anywhere we go. It was average in comparison (we've had better).For our main entrees, we all ordered different cuts of steak. My favorite by far was the RPM Signature Steak Frites (which keep in mind is literally $20 less than the NY Strip which was what my mom and I ordered). So tender, so juicy, so melt in your mouth-everything you want in a steak! It also came with its own special fries-I would DEFINITELY recommend ordering it.For side dishes, I would recommend all the ones we tried: Hand Cut Fries (nothing too special but good for fries), Curried Brussels Sprouts (very crunchy and flaky in a good way), Roasted Sweet Potatoes (BEWARE of the red peppers in them, they are HOT!), but the table favorite was the Millionaire's Potato!!!! (pictured) It is literally truffled potatoes served inside a potato skin as the dish with nothing other to be described as amazing-ness on top! It is FANTASTIC!!!!Lastly, my favorite part of any good meal, DESSERT! (all pictured) We ordered the Baked Alaska, a medium-sized cake to be shared, prepared table side and lit on FIRE! Who's excited!! But our amazing server also brought us the Vanilla Sugar Donuts (my new favorite) and Happy Birthday Cotton Candy on the house! What an amazing way to end an already spectacular dining experience!

You walk in, state your reservation name and then are directed to your table as you walk through an atmosphere of dimmed lighting and rustic decor. The hostess asks if you are celebrating anything and you make small talk until you settle into your seats. You open the menu to reveal options upon options of sides and steaks, desserts and drinks. Where do you start!? Well how about the smoked pork belly bacon with a nice salad? Sounds promising. Your drinks arrive and shortly after your appetizers come, the delicious combo of the bacon and salad get you ready for your meal, then it arrives...you dig into the beautifully presented plate of high quality cut meat and enjoy every last morsel of food until your belly is full and satisfied.It's simple to guess that I love this restaurant and the food is great. Steaks can be a tricky thing to master, however, RPM steak gets it right!

Some of the food here is absolutely spectacular. They serve some of the finest risotto I've ever tasted and the 'Baked Alaska' for dessert is a must try. My friends were raving about the 14K cake - i can't fault it.The look of the restaurant is beautiful and I would give their service 6 stars out of 5 if I could.We were a group of 9 on Friday night with a 9:30 reservation. We arrived on time and the restaurant was packed. We were seated as soon as the first larger table was freed up. Some people are irritated by stuff like this. I don't think it is a big deal.I ordered the '72oz Tomahawk Wagyu' which is basically a Kobe Beef on-the bone Rib Steak - with the entire rib bone left. This was a $195 item which tasted about a 97/100. I was a little surprised by the portion (it was on the smaller side) but after dropping $$$$ on food one tends to be hyper critical.My heart tells me to give RPM steak 4 stars but my mind can't think of a good enough reason to. Let's just say that if the food was a 4/5 overall, the atmosphere and staff was a 6/5 - and therefore RPM steak gets a 5 star review.

Service: Right from the start, our waiter was knowledgable and funny. He gave personal suggestions, offered honest feedback about how many people a portion serves (i.e. The hassleback potato easily serves 2-3), and seemed genuinely interested in making our dining experience pleasant.Drinks: We had a glass of Rosé and the "Good Night and Good Luck." When we ordered, the waiter specifically told my boyfriend "the cocktail is going to look like something you're not going to believe you ordered because it's so pink, but you MUST because it's one of the best on the menu and you're manly enough to handle it." Was it pink? Yes, you totally spotted it a mile away. Was it superb just like he promised? Absolutely!!!Food: The short version... PHENOMENAL. Seriously though. The Parker House Rolls (deliciously buttery and crunchy on the outside), Filet Mignon and "The Duke" (cooked EXACTLY how you ordered and melted in your mouth in the most delicate manner), Hassleback Potato and Jumbo Asparagus (PERFECT accents to the steak), and let's not forget the most amazing piece of 14K Chocolate Cake in the world (fudgy, rich and surprisingly huge!). Honestly, we walked out of there feeling like we probably shouldn't eat for the next week. So worth every penny.Ambiance: It's not too loud or too quiet. Plenty of couples, families and groups of friends, so you won't feel out of place no matter who you're dining with. Best of all, it's not overly dark where you feel like it's a struggle to see your food; every table has a light directly overhead that lights up your space beautifully.Definitely a great steak house experience! There wasn't a thing we would change! Can't wait to come back again.

I visited RPM Steak about two months ago and held off on writing a review because I wanted to calm down and avoid exaggerating my experience. After taking some time to reflect, I conclude that RPM Steak is in elite company among "new wave" steakhouses in Chicago. Everything aspect of my dinner here was out of this world and I look forward to returning.

Arrived and was seated pretty much right away. Would have preferred the main dining but got the upper level. Waiter was knowledgable and friendly. The food was all a la carte so pretty pricey. No appetizer, one steak, one fish, each one alcoholic drink, one size and dessert set you back 200.00 with tip.The steak was done medium to my liking oscar style was exquisite . The steak was smaller but very juicy. Side of jumbo asparagus were charred just right - not dry and very crispy. My husband loved his bourbon. The name escapes me but its their own.Bathrooms were tidy. Music soft techno. Service was oddly mostly men in great uniforms. Overall experience was great. Be prepared to spend but I feel it was worth it

RPM Steak is the best steakhouse I've been to in Chicago! It's definitely a more modern steakhouse with more modern dishes...but geezzzzzzzzzz everything is stellar from the service to the food to the awesome atmosphere.My friend and I started with the parmesan popover bread special for $10. Excellent option to start the meal with a warm and filling delicious cheesy carb explosion. Plus it came with prosciutto butter. Uh....yes, puhleese.The tuna tartare ($15) was good but the least memorable course of our meal. I think this is something that can be skipped but if you are looking for a protein filled app, this will get the job done.We shared a Cowboy Steak for $72 cooked medium rare and wow was it tender yet hearty. We did something blasphemous and had them pre-cut it for us but that made eating it much easier for me, plus made it easier to share. I highly appreciated that! We added the side of bernaise sauce for $3 and that was a great compliment to the beef. Oyster mushrooms ($12) were a side we went with and although tasty, I'd go with another of their mushroom sides next time. They had three different options and the oysters came with a lot of greens & such. I want all mushrooms, all the time.Based on everyone's recommendations, we ordered the Millionaire's Baked Potato for $18. Topped with fontina cheese and black truffle, it sure is a classy gal. I'm normally not a potatoes girl but this little doozey changed my mind on that. Indulgent, rich and still great the next day.I was insistent on ordering the Macaroni & Cheese ($17) even though my buddy kept questioning if I was sure. Am I sure?! Psh. I never pass up a good mac & cheese on the menu. This creamy dish had bacon & mushrooms thrown in - two of my favorite things! There's no way it could go wrong. Loved it and it's another leftover I loved eating the next day.Although full, we pulled through it and had the 14k Chocolate Cake ($12) for dessert. It was so rich & decadent, made me feel like I was splurging on any every bite. It's a must get dessert! #TreatYoselfI can't think of a time I saw a beer list that included such rare and amazing beers. They had 6 years of BCBS as well as many other higher priced bottles that are hard to come by. I ended up having a bottle of 2010 Bourbon County Stout for $18 which was big enough & strong enough to last the entirety of my dinner. I'm very impressed by their current on draft list, as well as rare 'special' beers as they call them.Just had a magnificent time at RPM Steak in every way possible. I left full beyond belief and so satisfied. Even after we left and started driving away, our server chased after the car with our leftovers! I'm so forgetful and so thankful for such an awesome lady!Pro-Tip: Download the Lettuce Entertain You app so you can earn reward points.
