The hype is real... Or maybe I'm just too big a fan of RPM Italian. I have visited on several different occasions. I've have tried the Boot Steak, the 22oz Bone-In Kansas City Cut, and most recently the 16oz New York Strip. Out of these three definitely the Kansas City was my favorite. I am a pretty big fan of Dry Aged steaks. I had to look this one up but from what I've read the Kansas City Cut is just a New York Strip with the bone. But I found it to be much more flavorful. The bone makes a difference!For sides and what not, I recommend the Giuliana's Chopped salad and their Calamari are two of my favorites. Aside from the food being absolutely delicious, the service at any RPM is always top notch.My goal is to splurge one day for the Lone Bone Ribeye ($125) or the Mishima Tomahawk ($195) just to see how it compares to a Tomahawk I've had at Mastros back in the day. One day, one day... Make sure to book a reservation in advance! 'Til next time, cheers!

I was here for a special event in their semi private room (party of about 30) on a week day.Our meal was served family style.2 salads (caesar salad and Giuliana's green salad) and both were delishRosemary Bread ~~~ YUM!!!Steak, chicken and salmon and all were amazing.Sides included blue cheese mashed potato, rapini and trumpet mushrooms.Oh let me tell you about the desserts!!!! TO DIE FOR!!!We had small individual portions of RPM cheesecake, 14k chocolate cake and grape cotton candy.The service was good but the space was quite cold in temperature.Check it out and enjoy!!!

I took my bf here for his birthday and we had a really great dinner. The bf started off with an old fashioned, which was poured table side. He mentioned it was quite strong, just how he likes it. I had the pamplemule and it was light and refreshing, as expected.We had the popovers as an appetizer and they were light and airy, so don't worry about it being too filling. I ordered the boot steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. And the bf had dry-aged new york strip. I didn't hear any complaints from him. I was very impressed by their side dishes. We had the hasselback potato and the top was amazingly crispy, I loved it. We also had the oyster mushrooms & wild garlic, which was also very good. They gave us a huge complimentary bowl of cotton candy with a happy birthday sign in it. I was so excited (I love cotton candy). We still ordered the baked alaska just to try it. It would have been nice if they had smaller portions so we wouldn't have had to waste half of it. The baked alaska was fun to order for the presentation, but I wasn't crazy about the flavors.In conclusion, this place is now my favorite steakhouse. I highly recommend it!

Service is excellent, food is excellent.Tuna tartar- bright and fresh, lots of fresh parsley. Very good flavor, nice portion size for 4 ppl.Burrata- fresh and creamy burrata paired with roasted tomatoes that are a little smoky. The pesto tasted mostly like spinach. Flavor could be a bit upgraded here but the toast it came with was so good. Salted and buttered with a fluffy inside and crunchy outside.Bacon - basically pork belly. So good! Nice portion for 4 ppl to get a big bite. Very rich and fabulous flavor.Popovers with prosciutto butter - light and buttery and the butter has great flavor.Short ribs - huge portion! Huge flavor! Meat is buttery and delicious. So smokey!8oz fillet- cooked perfectly. Tons of flavor. I don't think it could get any better. Perfection.Donuts - very light and fluffy and not too sweet. The cream sauce is so yummy it tastes like melted vanilla ice creamCotton candy - so fun! The perfect way to end a fabulous dinner :) not on the menu but just ask!Old fashioned - made with rye whist so a little spicy in flavor but very delicious

Maybe my expectations were too high because of previous reviews or the price tag of this place.  As we left I just couldn't help but wonder if that was all there was.   And for $200+ I think maybe there should have been.  We had two kids with us and didn't even get the complimentary cotton candy.  They continuously refill your water glasses and at first we had fresh chilled water, but by the end of the night they were just bringing room temperature water, with no ice.  At one point we had to ask for my daughter's drink to be refilled even though it was clearly empty for a bit.  The steaks were okay. The mashed potatoes were amazing.  The chocolate cake with gold flakes was so rich I couldn't eat it, but my husband loved it.   The cheesecake was oh so yummy!*We parked in the garage right next to it.*Get reservations!!!

RPM Steak is very good and high class. Though not as good as the original RPM, I would still return here.The service, ambiance, and food was delicious. If you enjoy steak, it's a very good restaurant. We found the servers to be polite, gentlemen and ladies. It's a great place for special occasions, birthdays, homecoming, or any other such celebration. It is a bit pricy though, so I don't think I would come here regularly, as there are other equally fantastic (some even better) steakhouses in the immediate Chicago area.That said, we had a great time! It was a fun experience, and I look forward to enjoying another meal here!

AMAZING dinner.  Two different steaks, both cooked to perfection.  Sides that could have been meals on their own.  The million dollar potato IS worth it.The only thing we didn't try was desserts as we had other plans but will definitely make room for it next time.  However, the chef did send out a bowl of complimentary cotton candy which was flavored like orange creamsicle.  Delicious!  They even let us take it home.Ambiance is very modern/chic.  Service was outstanding.

We celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary here the Friday before Memorial Day.  I have been looking forward to eating here because I love Gulianna Rancic and believe we are kindred spirits (after reading her memoir)...and of course we heard the food was good...and Hubby had a $200 gift card :)The space felt bigger than RPM Italian, nice modern decor, and two levels.  The bar itself was pretty extensive.  Thankfully we were seated upstairs with a nice overhead view of the first floor.  It felt more private and intimate compared to the bustle downstairs.  We were seated immediately for our early reservation.  Also props that everyone who spoke to us greeted us happy anniversary.We started with a round of cocktails.  I tried the Good Night & Good Luck, which was refreshing, but overtly sweet.  Hubby had Everyone's A Winner, which was far superior.  In lieu of a bottle, we each had a glass of red to go with our meals, and our server did a great job making pairing recommendations based on our orders.For food we went big to take home!  We started with the Mediterranean Octopus, which was cooked perfectly and delicious.  I wanted to try the Cheddar and Black Pepper Popovers, but opted for the house bread basket to save room for everything else.  The regular bread was fine.  For dinner, Hubby had the 28-day prime dry-aged 16 oz New York Strip.  He's pretty snobby about steaks, and he marveled that it was the best New York Strip he's had in Chicago.  I had the 28-day prime dry-aged 24 oz Cowboy Steak.  It was fabulous.  One of the specials for the night were Spot Prawns.  We ordered 4 to go with the steaks and they were sweet and tasty.  We also ordered the Millionaire's Potato because we couldn't pass up truffles despite the fact it was an $18 potato, singular.  It was worth it, for the special occasion.  So rich, creamy, and decadent, fit for an celebration!  The Hen of the Woods mushroom side dish was great.  The texture was a mix of crispy and soft, but it's a shame it was over salted.  We forgot to order the Shredded Kale salad, but I'm glad we didn't because we were stuffed and had leftovers to take home afterwards.For dessert, we ordered the 14K Chocolate Cake and the Coffee Custard.  While we were waiting for it, they brought out the cotton candy, which was a fun playful surprise.  The chocolate cake was the best of the two - so moist, super-chocolately, with the gold flakes.  We took the rest of the cake home with us and it was even better the next day.Thanks RPM Steak for a memorable anniversary dinner!

My boyfriend and I had such an amazing experience here- they were so accommodating. We had our hotel book reservations and somehow they had booked them for the wrong night- we only had to wait an extra 30 mins and we were seated in a very comfortable booth in the bar.The food, the wine and liquor options are all delectable, and we were even served a small pork belly appetizer (compliments of the chefs) that were absolutely to die for! Surf and turf for dinner with a fresh white flakey fish that we couldn't help but devour every bite.Katie was extremely helpful and so welcoming. We will definitely be back! Keep doing what you do!

Another great meal.Brother was in town & is a big steak lover, so the boyfriend & I took him to RPM Steak.We had three starters, which were the kale salad, carpaccio, and the pork belly. Salad had a light, tangy dressing and I couldn't believe we enjoyed the kale as much as we did. My guys are meat & potato men, so them enjoying a kale salad was a surprise. The only appetizer I wasn't in love with was the carpaccio.Now entrees.We had the special 60 day, dry age bone-in ribeye ($175). It was 40 oz and was prepared medium rare. They sliced it in the kitchen & presented it on a platter. The flavor was all there. We couldn't be happier with our choice, well the brother wouldn't mind a larger portion, but that's not the point.We also had the mashed potatoes & a side of mushrooms.Wonderful.

Had dinner here Monday night for a friend's birthday. I was excited to check it out, after so many good experiences at RPM Italian. I'd perused the menu prior to arriving and was already preparing for a bit of a splurge, money-wise, but I was very impressed with the quality of the food.I had steak frites and the meat was cooked well and to my liking (medium). The frites were different than what I'm used to--almost as if they were julienned--which I really enjoyed.My friends got salmon, cod, and the 8 oz filet, and everyone really enjoyed their meals. We shared a few sides--the Parker House rolls (a must, they're divine, and come with a yummy duo of butters), the bleu cheesed whipped potatoes (very tasty), the roasted sweet potatoes (not a fan of this, as they're topped with a salty cheese, but everyone else loved them), and the mac and cheese (okay, but I didn't get seconds, though I'm not a huge mac and cheese fan anyway). As it was my friend's birthday, we had to get dessert, and this is where things get seriously delicious: the 14K Chocolate Cake, which I'd been dying to try, paired with the Baked Alaska. There are no words for how good these were, so save room!My one critique: the prices of wines by the glass are too high. I Googled a few of the reds before dinner and they sold for $9/bottle at Binny's or online. So, I couldn't validate paying $13/glass. I tried the Tuxedo cocktail, which was okay, but not exactly what I was looking for.Overall, would definitely go back--perhaps split a nice cut of meat and a side or two, splurge on dessert and a drink, and enjoy the environment.

The service was impeccable from the moment we walked in the door. We had reservations (highly recommended), and we were seated at a spacious booth in the bar area.The service was impeccable. Our waiter was friendly, helpful, and very attentive. He explained that the menu was designed for family style dining. Thus, the side dishes are large and sharing is encouraged.They also have a great cocktail menu. I went with the "Good Night and Good Luck," which was very refreshing.Given the waiter's suggestions, for dinner, we ordered a large filet mignon, macaroni and cheese (which had mushrooms and bacon), a variety of mushrooms, and garlic potatoes. Everything was phenomenal, but the macaroni and cheese was the best I've ever eaten anywhere! It's different and somehow surprisingly light! If you order one thing on the menu, order the Mac and Cheese. You won't regret it!For dessert, we ordered the 14K Chocolate Cake. We were underwhelmed. It was very heavy and really nothing to write home about, but the rest of the meal and the service made up for it!

I have to give kudos to RPM. Given their celebrity connections, I thought their restaurants would be overhyped and so so on quality. But boy was I wrong. RPM Steak definitely delivered.Our server was great. He was very attentive, but without being annoying. He was also great at helping us pick out the best things on the menu to try. I ended up trying the wagyu A5 Miyazaki, which was fabulous.  The steak basically melted in my mouth.  My dining companion had the ribeye, which was also really good.  I also highly recommend the macaroni and cheese.  It could be an entree on its own (and costs just about as much as one) and is filled with bacon and mushroom goodness.  Our waiter also totally hooked us up with dessert.  We couldn't decide between two desserts - the cheesecake and the baked Alaska - so our waiter brought them both out and gave us one on the house!  Neither dessert was particularly memorable, but the presentation for the baked Alaska is awesome.  Another Lettuce restaurant for the win.

I came her for a business lunch. Apparently it's packed in the evenings just like its Sister Restaurant, RPM Italian - which is my favorite restaurant in the city.This place is expensive and the menu is a little limited, as we were in a hurry we skipped the appetizers and went straight into entrees. I had the steak frites and the steak was to die for - really tender and juicy and perfectly cooked with a great sear on the outside. The bearnaise sauce was a great compliment also.The reason I am dropping a star is because their "frites" or "fries" are awful. They are basically strips of chips that would be a nice appetizer perhaps but have no place on an entree plate. You couldn't stab them with your fork as they'd break and you couldn't really scoop them up either as they just fall off so you really have to use your fingers - not something you really want to do in a high-end steak house.For the prices I'd also expect some nice bread and dipping sauce or an amuse bouche but instead there was just a bowl of what could have been Lay's potato chips which didn't taste all that fresh on the table when we sat down.Ultimately they're a steak house and they nailed the steak so I am giving them a 4*, but if it wasn't for that it would probably be a 3.

Perfect food, perfect service! Had dinner with good friends on a Saturday night. Every aspect of the meal and service was top notch , our server Matt and our sommelier were very knowledgeable and attentive. Will rave about RPM for some time!

Took the lady here last night for some juicy steak and ended up ordering the beef carpaccio, seared foie gras, "The Duke", 20-oz bone in ribeye, and the "Millionaire's Potato".First off, the service is great. The waitress was very knowledgeable on the food and water glasses were never left empty. I also should note that I make steaks at home quite often in many different methods and it's rare that I find a steakhouse have mind blowing steak, so don't take it as a bad point if I thought that the steak was good but not out of this world.On the other hand, the potato? *Insert thumbs up emoji here.* Pretty much half of a potato roasted and prepared in a mashed potato like texture with melted cheese and truffle on top. Definitely my favorite thing here. Actually, the sides in general were pretty good. Carpaccio was very simple but good as it was wrapped in arugula and topped with shredded cheese. Seared foie gras was interesting as well but I felt that the balsamic reduction was so sharp that it took away a bit of the "essence" of the liver.All in all, great date joint. Bottom line below.For the boys: Ambiance is great, dimly lit=romantic, boogie, ladies will love it.For the ladies: Bring your man here and it is more than likely that he will be pleased.For everyone: Wallet buster. I spent $220+ for two people.

I was treated to dinner at RPM steak. We had reservations on a weeknight because apparently this place is always packed. We were seated in a booth and our waiter came over. I ordered a pre dinner cocktail, "Aviation". I was surprised, very pleasantly, that it is in fact a Last Word. It happens to be one of my favorite cocktails.We had brought our own wine and they charge a corking fee and decanted it for us. For an appetizer, I got the yellowtail ceviche. It was refreshing and seasoned well. A little bit salty, a little bit of heat, and the crunch of the cucumbers. For dinner I got the 8 oz filet medium with the Yukon potatoes and asparagus. The steak was cooked perfectly, the potatoes were outrageously good, and the asparagus was tender and had a slight lemon flavor. I was very satisfied with my meal choice.For dessert, I got the bread pudding. I normally do not care for bread pudding but it had Nutella and banana ice cream. It was not the best dessert, there was far less Nutella than I had hoped for but it was still tasty.

A reservation made a month in advance was not honored this past Friday.My boyfriend proposed on Friday (10/14) and made reservations back in September for us to celebrate with dinner at RPM Steak. We arrived 15 mins early when the hostess told us the restaurant was running 15-30 mins behind on reservations but we could grab drinks at the bar while we wait. We were able to order drinks but after waiting 15 mins beyond our reservation time, my fiance notified the hostess that it was our engagement dinner and asked when we could anticipate being seated for our reservation. She said we would be "next." After waiting another 30 mins with no further communication from the hostess, we left disappointed and hungry. At no point did any of the staff offer to provide us the drinks my friend called in and paid for in advance.I know the night was not special to the staff but what is the point of having a reservation system if you have no intention of honoring the reservations.  Aside from just being decent to your customers, there are way too many amazing restaurants in Chicago for this to be smart business practice.

I've heard of people raving about this place for such a long time, so I figured I'd go ahead and try it out. My wife and I went for a date night Friday night to see what the buzz was all about. I'm not going to lie... best restaurant in the city! Hands down.First, I would like to say how amazing our server was. Rob Potter made our experience great. He was so generous and kind, and was so knowledgeable on all of the meats. Also, I talked to Joshua Waddell who was awesome and got me set up with a reservation so easy, and got me a table upstairs which was awesome. Rob gave us the whole background scoop as to where the different types of meat come from (the steak, the Bison, etc).My wife and I decided to get the calamari and bacon thick cut for appetizers. Oh my gosh was it good! Everything on the menu looked delicious, so we asked Rob for suggestions. Since I never had Bison before, I was feeling adventurous to try it out. We went with the Bison and boot steak. I couldn't believe how great it was. I literally eat chicken and steak everyday, but as soon as a tried the bison, I asked my wife where can we go to buy Bison. Also, since we don't drink, Rob recommended the cucumber water which was out of this world. The way they prepare it beats me, but it's a really cool design.We couldn't stop there, and decided to get the 14k gold chocolate cake and cheese cake and watermelon cotton candy (yes were fatties) Haha just kidding, but it was delcious. It was by far the best date night I've ever went on, and the staff here at RPM made it great! Definitely recommend to everyone to come try this place out at least once to get the same experience I did!

I dined here with a small group of women as we wanted to check out this restaurant. Their Restaurant Week menu is a great deal- $44 for three courses and all were generously sized. We started with the grilled squid and then the short rib steak. For dessert, I chose the warm donuts with Boston and was so surprised that it came with FIVE donuts!! To say I came home stuffed is an understatement.RPM Steak's decor is much like RPM Italian which is modern and sleek. Service was great and the food was really good. I definitely plan to return and try items from their regular menu.

I can say That this restaurant has Great food as well it's a fun experience  the baked Alaska was sooo!!!! Cool to watch them make it the steak was good the sea food was freshThe atmosphere of the restaurant is fun Friday night was my first time at RPM STEAK but it won't be my last

I'll admit the first time I came here about a year ago (near opening time) I was far from blown away with the food. The customer service? top notch.But I had heard good things and as a Lettuce member, was willing to give this place another try.Our amazing waitress Kristen started off the evening asking if we had been there before. My date and I looked at each other and smiled, "Yes, but the last time we came here there was a mixup in our order and the replacement steak was far from good." She frowned and said, "Oh no! And you guys came back?" Timidly we responded, "Well, we've heard good things and we're Lettuce Entertain You members..so..." She smiled and said, "Well, we promise everything will be perfect this time to make up for it."We had: the roasted beets salad, the coal-roasted king crab leg, the 24 oz kansas city 28 day dry aged steak (medium), the 22 oz cowboy cut 28 day dry aged steak (medium-rare), the brussel sprouts, the hen of the woods mushrooms, and the peanut butter popcorn chocolate dessert..oh yeah and a bottle of wine.The roasted beets salad was perfectly composed - some arugula to balance out the beet taste...but it was outshone by the king crab leg! oh dear goodness that crab was good. get it get it get it! I will warn you though, it is not the biggest bang for your buck (3 precut portions).As for the steaks, this time they were cooked perfectly!I love mushrooms and the hen of the woods mushrooms were delicious.I wasn't a huge fan of the brussel sprouts but they were decent. They aren't traditional cut (in half) but rather kind of fanned out. There is a good portion, but it was just too well seasoned for me. As a side to steaks, it was overwhelming. I think i had one bite.The peanut butter dessert though? Man oh man that was yummy! I'm not a huge sweets person but sure do love my ice cream! While obviously sweet, this dessert was not overwhelmingly kick you in the mouth sweet. A perfect ending!

Great experience.Perfect for those looking for a great steak-centric meal without the normal Steakhouse experience.All the steakhouse staples are available, some with a twist.  Service was friendly and attentive.Nice atmosphere and diverse clientele.Would definitely go back.

I definitely am not going to influence the Yelp average with my review.So . . . I'll take the micro-view to give some sense of a very good four star in the city restaurant--the French Onion soup was the best I've had, ever.  Just think.  How many French Onion soups have you had?  I'm not kidding, the best.

For a work dinner we came here, and was probably the first guests of the evening. It's not often that I get to a restaurant for a 5pm reservation. We started out with the delicious bacon and the popovers as appetizers. I then had the Duke ribeye steak and the Yukon potato sides, the brussels, summer squash, broccolini were great compliments. My meat was cooked perfectly. The Baked Alaska table side was very cool and it was a nice treat to get the cotton candy. I would love to be back and try some of the seafood options as well. Service was good, but a little slower for my taste. I think we were ready to order a few times and my boss had to leave early and didn't get to have dinner and only just appetizers.

Tasty, trendy steakhouse! Came here for a family bday dinner with a group of 7. Service was impeccable the whole way through. Our water glasses and drinks were constantly refilled and plates and silverware cleared. Timing of the courses was also great. Our sever was knowledge  and a pleasure to deal with.For appetizers we ordered the bacon which was literally a large slab of sizzling bacon. Yum! We also had the popovers with the most amazing herb butter ever. Omg! Delish. The butter made the order worth it. Otherwise they were well seasoned and crispy and tasty. We also had the fondue which was crispy sourdough with cheese fondue. Yummy but not wow. For my entree I had the 8oz. Filet. It was cooked to perfection and was tasty but not the best I've ever had to be honest. The burger my man's brother ordered looked amazing and he said was very very delicious. And was literally more than half the price and came with tasty pomme frites so I was jealous and wish I got that instead. Next time!My steak was large but came with 2 pickled peppers and a sprig of parsley. All other sides are ala carte and say are sharable but I would say are still rather small. We ordered the millionaire potato which is a double baked potato w/fontina cheese and truffles. It was heavenly! Highly recommended. We also had the Mac and cheese which was the lightest and tastiest Mac I've had in a while. Amazing! Again. And it came with the most amazing tasty crispy maybe hen of the woods mushrooms on top and mixed in. For a cheese and mushroom lover this is ideal.For dessert we had the Nutella bread pudding with ice cream which was great and watermelon margarita flavored (yes it tasted just like it) cotton candy which was graciously on the house as a bday treat. Over all tasty tasty place. Would def come back.

Great service but our beautiful steak (the Duke) was ruined because it came out sliced. We didn't request that.  We should have said something earlier but we couldn't believe it came out sliced. If sliced, it gets cold quickly and all the juice runs out.Please ask patrons if they want their steak sliced.Thank you!

What an amazing all around experience.  The ambiance was amazing, if not a bit European.  They have an amazing specialty beer selection and carry some of the most exclusive and rare beers of anywhere I've been.We started with a seafood tower - everything was perfect.  Many of my party went with the Bison - a favorite of regulars there.  I had a dry aged strip that was perfectly prepared.   Sides were excellent and deserts - while not required - you could pass up cotton candy and homemade donuts.Highly recommend for a special occasion or a client you really want to impress.

I helped plan my department's lunch summer outing here on 9/16 and have to say that we had a great experience.  95% of my coworker had never dined here before and they walked away with nothing but compliments.The menu we picked consisted of and the reviews I heard from the overall group were:- homemade chips - really good, could keep eating them- bacon mac and cheese - great- calamari - good- thick cut bacon - amazing!! melted in your mouth good.- truffle burger - great- lobster roll - ok - the brioche roll was really good but the lobster was perhaps overcooked- wood grilled rib eye cap steak with truffle butter - amazing- 14k chocolate cake - AMAZING - creamy chocolate goodness- baked Alaska - AMAZING (we didn't get the fire show, but it tasted great)Needless to say, there weren't any leftovers on any of the 6 tables. I wouldn't change a thing!

Bar Food Review OnlyStarted with a drink called the Cobbler. Good, fruity drink. As for the food, we got the Fondue that came with garlic bread. I thought the bread was average but the fondue cheese was a great complement with the garlic.The star though was the coal-roasted king crab (2 orders in my picture). Already cut for easy eating, the king crab was smooth, soft, not overcooked. It was really delicious. Tasted fresh and great for sharing between two people per leg.

One of the best steakhouses in the city. Very modern space. We had the Parker house rolls, which were very good--the butter is the star of the show and the octopus, absolutely delicious, the crema amps it up for sure. My only complaint with that is that the portion is small. The bacon is also great.I had the Japanese Waygu which was fantastic. Melt in your mouth tender and flavorful! The guy I was with had the rib eye, which was good but we had to get sent back because it was way under cooked. I had the millionaire's potato and he had the hassleback. Personally I preferred his to mine as I found the millionaires to be too rich.For dessert we had the donuts and the staff was kind enough to bring us cotton candy also.Overall dining here was a nice experience. I like RPM better than Chicago Cut but not as much as Bavette's.

My wife took me out here for my birthday, and I'm going to have to give it the full 5 stars!  The service was great, very comfortable, and all the courses were cooked to perfection!  We had the Shredded Kale Salad, Mediterranean Octopus, 20 oz. Bone-In Ribeye, Broiled Black Cod,  Millionaire's Potato, Broccolini, 14K Chocolate Cake, Blueberry Cheesecake, and the Birthday Cottoncandy!The Kale Salad was great, generous portion, dressed nicely and had little cubes of delicious bacon. Octopus was well seasoned and cooked, crispy exterior and tender in the middle.The ribeye has always been my favorite cut.  It was very well seasoned, and had a good amount of char with the perfect medium pink in the center.  They also brought out extra seasoning if needed.  The cod was fresh and cooked well, but I was not a fan of their sweet glaze.  I guess I don't usually eat fish with any sweetness.  I prefer it to be savory. Wouldn't order the cod again.For sides, the broccolini was good and I would order it again.  The millionaire's potato.... it's an $18 potato... should we order it?  YOLO! We're ordering it!  It's like a twice baked potato, with a crispy skin, and topped with black truffle.  I hate to say it's soooo good, because truffles with carbs is like cheating, at the same time I would have eaten 3 of these (if I could afford it) and passed out in the booth, and would have been the dreaming about the pigs searching for the truffles. We ended up ordering one and made it back home on the 8:35 metra train.For dessert, the cheesecake was very light and blueberries were fresh.  The cream with lime zest was also a very nice touch.  The chocolate cake arrived with a little happy birthday topper, dressed in gold leaves.  I'm so fancy, so baller, so chocolaty.  It was so good, I had to save half for a pre-workout meal the next day. FYI, I killed it at the gym the next day.  Musta been all that gold!  Now I know why this places gets such good ratings.

Fan-freaking-tastic. Wow, what s great dining experience. RPM Italian never disappoints, and RPM Steak is just as good.The ambiance of this place is great: dark, elegant, and trendy. It can get pretty loud inside, which is why I'm glad my friends and I scored one of the coveted patio booths outside. Yes, I said BOOTHS. This is patio dining at its finest, people! Service was excellent and we had a fabulous time.The drinks were great: I stuck to the Cobbler all night and had a few of them because they were so tasty. But the FOOD!!! Every single dish was outstanding. We ordered the cheese fondue bread, thick-cut bacon, and octopus to start with. I had "The Duke" entree signature steak, along with the brussels sprouts and papas bravas sides. Everything was heavenly. Somehow we made room for dessert and opted to share the chocolate cake, which was divine. It was also covered in flakes of 14K gold. HOLY. CRAP. So fancy, so excessive, so fabulous.Our bill was pricy but reasonable considering the high quality of everything and the generous portion sizes. The RPM restaurant group is awesome and I cannot wait to go back here.

So after going to RPM Italian which I loved, I was curious to try RPM Steak.  One word sums it up ... Wow!  After first walking in we hung out at the bar for our first cocktail since arriving early.  Atmosphere was cool and elegant and not as crowded and chaotic as RPM Italian where we got seats at the bar no problem. My extra dirty martini was made perfectly which really set the stage for our upcoming dining experience.  We were seated at a nice booth that was still part of the bar area elevated above the actual dining room.  I would have preferred sitting in the dining room as it was a really cool modern space but where we were was still ideal as it included a number of nice comfortable booths and couples dining together.  Our waitress suggested we start with the coal roasted crab leg appetizer that was crazy good.  I am not a fan of crab but this dish was absolutely out of this world.  We then split the bone-in Kansas City cut done medium rare.  I thought the steak was perfect.  My boyfriend also enjoyed it but made just a small comment to the waitress about it being a little chewy due to a strip of tendon within the cut.  Due to that feedback, a manager came out to apologize and asked if we wanted another steak done for us.  Because it was really no big deal and we thoroughly enjoyed the meal, we mentioned that wasn't necessary.  So instead, our waitress brought out her 3 favorite desserts that were on the house (incredible cotton candy, blueberry cheese cake that was luscious and light and beignet like donuts with vanilla and chocolate anglaise).  Now that was above and beyond superb service!  With the bottle of red wine we ordered our dining experience was so enjoyable.  Top notch service, excellent food and atmosphere perfect for both a business dinner or romantic date, RPM Steak is a fabulous choice that shouldn't be missed.

Excellent service.  The right price for the level of quality.This is a great place to entertain business clients.  Chicago steakhouse with a refreshing trendy twist.  Great seafood as well.Highly recommended.

We had dinner here for Chicago Chef Week, and we thought the food was okay for a very pricey upscale restaurant. Appetizers were okay, we weren't really excited about it. The steak was delicious, but not memorable. But we enjoyed the desserts a lot. I might have to come back on a regular day and give them a second chance.

Great experience, great ambiance, great server, great food. Had the scallops and side of broccolini, both were delicious and surprisingly filling. Everything was cooked to perfection. They also gave us complimentary cake and cotton candy for the birthday boy, which I thought was very nice.

Dined here Saturday night. We were early so sat at the bar. A lady, and what looked like her daughter sat down next to us right after. They ordered two waters and right away we could tell the older woman was highly intoxicated. She fell asleep at the bar a few times while we waited. I was shocked they didn't escort her out. Didn't bother us, but just a bit surprising. We got sat exactly at our reservation time in a nice booth. Waiter came out and was great with recommendations. Appetizer crab leg was the best part of the meal! After we ordered dinner, our waiter seemed to be less attentive to us. Steak was a bit overcooked, which really took away from the flavor. It was our anniversary, and I was a bit surprised they didn't acknowledge that. Overall, for the price and quality, I don't think I would go back. Disappointed for sure.

Came to RPM for restaurant week, but I ended up not ordering from the restaurant week menu because the filet mignon was just too enticing for my cravings to resist. So I ordered the 8oz filet mignon and brussels sprouts as a side. The brussels were not what I was expecting. I thought they would be made the more traditional way (oven roasted), but these were flaked and curried. Still fantastic and extremely flavorful, but just not what I expected when I ordered them! The filet was cooked a perfect medium rare consistency the whole way through, and I was very pleased with the quality of both the meat and the way it was prepared.What really made me give RPM steak 5 stars was the fantastic desserts! We had cotton candy, champagne sorbet (very palette cleansing), a chocolate cake with gold flakes (a little too rich for me but then again I'm not a big chocolate cake person) and these AMAZING doughnuts that in my honest opinion could beat many of the doughnuts made in various doughnut shops around the city. To be fair to these specialty doughnut shops, I am a big fan of yeast-risen doughnuts and not so much the cake ones, which seem to be a more popular variety. So sadly I don't get my fill of yeast risen doughnuts very often. When our waitress brought out these warm, airy, sugar-coated, square shaped doughnuts with the consistency of a beignet but the size of a doughnut WITH a marbled Boston creme on the side, I was in HEAVEN. Every bite is like putting your teeth into a delicious sugary pillow of dough, and I really could not get enough.Originally came here for the steak, but will definitely come AGAIN for the desserts. And probably also to try out the risotto! Thanks RPM for a great experience and let me know if you ever plan on opening RPM doughnuts because I will be your first (and most loyal) customer.

**More like a 4.5 star experience, but will round down to 4**First off, the restaurant is beautiful - very modern and chic, refreshing from the other old school steakhouses you see in NYC.  It was a packed for a Monday night, perhaps from Restaurant week, so there was a slight delay.  The staff seemed a bit frazzled which made way for a half-friendly welcome.We get seated and the one thing I noticed is that all the tables were so close to each other.  Not sure if it was because it was extra busy, but felt like the sardine.  Now to the food.Bacon - very savory and sweet.  Not your typical large and salty bacon slab that you get, however it was melt in your mouth delicious.  Not a large serving, so keep that in mind.Tuna tartare - nothing special here, but was delicious.8oz Filet - perfect medium rare, delicious.  Nice crust on the steak.The Duke - equally delicious.Millionaire's Potato - delicious, but seemed like it was a bit light on the truffle flakes.Brussels sprouts - probably the weakest dish.  They peel off each flake and then fry it with some oil or something.  It was okay, just tasted greasy.  I would not recommend.Overall, great experience, just fell a little short from the crowded-ness, hostess, and parts of the food.  I would highly recommend for a special occasion, date, or work event.  It will be a sure please-er.  Our waiter was great, however, I did realized that the busboys or secondary servers, served our food which takeaway from the personable experience.  Again, not sure if it was because they were extra busy that night or if it's standard.I would like to go back next time I'm in town.

I absolutely LOVE this restaurant.  Not a single item on the menu that isn't worth every delicious bite.  I highly recommend the donuts for desert, they are incredible!Though it is sometimes tough to get a seat, definitely make a reservation and wait, there is a reason dining here is highly sought after.  The service is incredible...we last had Lucy as our server and asked her to chose our food for us...she didn't disappoint.Each experience we have had at RPM has been great.  We will continue to return!

We loved so much of RPM Steak...the seating, the service, the atmosphere and most of our food.  It was a wonderful dining experience.We dined early on Christmas Eve, because well, you know Santa was due at our place later...and since it was a special occassion (and we were hungry) we ordered quite a bit for the three of us.Opened with drinks cocktails for me and my son, a beer for my husband--My pamplemule was tasty.  My son's kiddie cocktail came out in the cutest RPM plastic cup.Appetizers--Vanilla bourbon glazed bacon and the octopus and the Parker House Rolls. All three were stellar.  I loved the sweet and salty of the bacon--and it's not just strips of bacon, these are hearty portions of the bacon belly. The Ocotopus was perfectly char-grilled, set with some crispy potatoes with a very nice spicy Jalepeno Crema. The bread was freshly baked, soft, warm and served with a tasty herbed butter.For the mains, we each got steak--grass fed for the mister and dry aged for me.  RPM also had a carving station with prime rib and lamb chops and we opted for a couple of lamb chops to share at the table too. I found my steak to be overdone a bit.  I ordered medium and I found areas where it wasn't pink like our server said it would be. The flavor was good and the bernaise sauce I ordered amped up the flavor a bit.  But it was also a bit tough, my steak knife worked hard.  But when I ate my leftovers at home, our steak knives worked just fine.  Weird. The lamp chops were tiny, but did have a very good flavor and cooked to a perfect medium rare.  They were served with a delicious mint creme sauce and it complemented it well.Sides for sharing: Cauliflower--divine! it's char grilled so it's not over cooked or mushy and it's served with a delicious citrus aoili on the side. This was my favorite.Hen of the Woods Mushrooms--loved this too. Fresh, earthy, a bit of a crunchy texture.Millionaire's Potato--excellent!  The truffle was not overpowering, the texture of the potato super creamy and the Fontina just made it extra rich.Spinach--very good.  Creamed spinach.  It was good, nothing better than what i can do at home, but we always have creamed spinach with our steaks so this was a must.Dessert.  You bet my son was eyeing the complementary cotton candy that was brought to other tables and he loved that we got a bowl for too.  Such a fun whimical touch. We also ordered the Baked Alaska, Because who wouldn't love having something flambeed tableside?  The presentation was really pretty and the ice cream and meringue were mighty tasty.Service was impeccable.  We had our server and his two assistants and they worked really well as a team.  Our server was spot on with his suggestions and really good about describing and suggesting wines for our tastes.The space is sleek and upscale with just the right volume of clubby music playing in the background.  Conversation friendly.This place is not kid friendly, but if your little one can behave during a nice dinner and doesn't need chicken nuggets on the menu then they might enjoy this place.  They treated my son like a little adult and he loved it.

Chicago is one of the greatest steak towns in the country, so our party of 2 was really looking forward to what looked like a fantastic steak dinner on paper.The Good: The service was impeccable, the crab appetizer was the best shellfish I've ever tasted, and the Caesar Salad was delicious, if not a bit salty. Cocktails were enjoyable, and the  sommalier made a perfect recommendation for an obscure wine I was looking for.The Bad: The $125, 60-day dry-aged tomahawk ribeye was both undercooked and under-seasoned. We ordered it Medium-Rare Plus, and it came out Rare to Blue. While they gladly took it back to warm up, there was no apology or concession of any kind. I've had several dry-aged steaks before and like them very much. That said, this particular steak had the consistency and flavor of a New York, not the melt-in-your-mouth ribeye you might expect. To his credit, our server said this would be the leanest of the ribeyes on the menu, but I didn't expect it so dry. Sorry, but if you're charging $125 for a steak, it needs to be 100% perfect or you make up for it somehow.The Ugly: our party of two shared 2 cocktails, 1 salad, 1 app, 1 steak, 1 dessert, and 1 modest bottle of wine and the total was $320+ without tip. I'd have no problem with this if the steak was amazing, but considering the steak was average at best, I'd say this place was overpriced substantially.

Went back to RPM on a gift certificate provided by the manager. It was top notch. Home run.Two of the dishes I would put on my "Best dish in Chicago"list - the coal roasted crab appetizer and the steak frites. The crab will blow your mind. Just get it. The steak frites which is actually a ribeye cap cut, is cooked perfectly, has just the right amount of fat and it's so tender you can cut it with your fork. And the donuts for dessert are a winner. How could they not be, they're donuts. Service was excellent throughout the meal.RPM isn't cheap. You'll spend some hard earned cash for sure. But it's worth every penny.

I definitely like RPM Steak more than RPM Italian. The coal roasted Alaskan king crabs were definitely a showstopper. The oysters were fresh and steak frites were delicious. I loved how thin the frites were, and the steak wasn't too fatty and cooked exactly how I asked.When it was time for desserts, I didn't need to hear anything else as soon as I heard Baked Alaska.Even for lunch, this place fills up quickly, so reservations are recommended. The ambiance of this place is great, so it's good for a date or for groups.

First time at RPM Steak and it's really a great option for food in Chicago.So I like steak and pretty much any other kind of food out there. We made early reservations on a Sunday. The restaurant is very open and modern inside. Not a dark cave like Maestros where you need night vision goggles to maneuver the place. We had a booth by the bar which was very comfortable.A few things we had... Started with the octopus app with was great, cooked perfectly, and all the flavors worked well together. Next I made a mistake... I ordered the special king crab tempura... Now I love king crab and I love tempura. But I know that 90% of places that serve "tempura" have no clue how to make it properly, this includes Japanese restaurants!! Was it bad, no. It was just a fried crab nugget in a thin batter served with avocado and a spicy dipping sauce. I would skip this especially for $24. After feeling foolish for falling into the tempura "made by a white man" trap, I had another martini and felt a little better...On to the rest of the meal... So of course you cannot visit an RPM without paying for some bread, right? So we got our own loaf of mini buns. I have to say it was very good and the cheapest thing on the menu!!Next a lobster tail flown half way round the world for mom to enjoy! Sometimes she's just in that lobster mood... I will say the meat was sweet, cooked perfectly, & excellent to eat. It didn't need any butter at all, perfect as is.Dry aged bone in strip. Very good. I am normally a rib eye fan but went with something different. A great char with a light salt flavor which is perfect to me. I hate anything over salted when I am paying for a quality product to start with. They do give you a tiny bowl with a salt herb blend to add if needed. I did use it on a few bites and liked it very much.The side I had were the Hen of the Woods mushrooms. I have to say this is one of many things that make RPM the better steakhouse. Most places will have the mushroom caps, Giant asparagus, and some baked or mashed potato. There were 4 different kinds of mushrooms I could choose from, plus 4 other vegetables, plus potatoes. It really makes a meal when you can have additions past the generic...Our server was great. If there was something she didn't already know she would find out for us. Even on a Sunday it was a full house but the time we left at 7:30. So having been to a few steakhouses over the years RPM is something to look forward to compared to the rest. If you just want a steak and potato then it probably doesn't matter but for that little extra that makes a dinner better it's here.The one odd thing was my coffee was weak like diner coffee. It felt out of place, more fitting with some bacon & eggs... Maybe just made wrong...?

Love love love!!!! I wish I lived in Chicago so I can go to RPM all the time. While visiting Chicago, my mate and I were looking for a tasty steak place to take his mom to enjoy a great time with great food!!! Due to all the touring, we lost track of time and RPM was open till 1 AM!! We were greeted by a friendly staff and great energy! The staff were in white blazers and just looked extremely classy! Our waiter Joshua was knowledgable of all of the dishes and recommended so many! Such a complete sweetheart and such bubbly personality. The ambience is so sassy and chic! Fun to go with a bunch of friends or a sexy date. The rib eye was to die for. You have options with or without its fat! The rib eye was flavorful and just delicious and tender in every bite! The potato was so uniquely made and veggies were just right! The alcohol was definitely made with love and the wine was 2 thumbs up!!! My taste buds were having a party in my mouth with the chocolate cake sprinkled with 24k gold. The banana pudding was almost the best I've ever had!! The whole experience considering getting there very late was a 10 star rating!!! Please bring RPM to LOS ANGELES!!!  Thank you RPM for a great taste and experience in Chicago!!! LA steak houses has nothing on you!!!
A few friends and I came here on a whim, with no reservation on a Saturday night. We did have to wait a bit, but the food was great and worth every penny. The staff was very attentive.

We had the best experience at RPM Steak. The food was outstanding from the bison steak to the delicious Hen of the Woods mushrooms and curry brussel sprouts. Most of all, however, the service was impeccable. Brian Neely (not sure on spelling) was our server and his recommendations were spot on, as well as he consistently made sure we were taken care of.  We sat outside in one of the crescent-shaped booths, which was the perfect spot to enjoy time with my boyfriend while people watching. The sommelier identified our tastes and also make the perfect recommendations. Highly recommend this place and Brian!

We came here on a Friday night, prepared that we would be spending some money. We were celebrating our third anniversary amongst other things and this seemed like the place to do it.The space is very modern. Reminded me of NYC or LA. Large, minimal, black and white, full of fancy people.We showed up a bit early so grabbed a drink at the bar and then got our table almost right away.The service here is on point. From the moment you check in to leaving, they are on their game. It's wonderful.We treated ourselves to a few things: bottle of wine, oysters (incredible vinaigrette), the $18 potato (amazing), foie gras tower - they should serve this with some bread - pointer: 2/3 is fruit, brussel sprouts, Duke steaks, the donut-Y dessert. You'll get a massive ball of cotton candy at the end so be ready for that sugar high.So why 4/5? I was surprised to see that given we were celebrating a few things, nothing was gifted. Even at the nicest places around the country, they tend to do something (a drink, a dessert) to really class up the experience but they didn't here.Guess Giuliana and Bill are pinching pennies!

Fantastic food, service, music/sound level and ambiance.Special night, had great meal. No sign of Bill or G. But did see Mayor Rahm & Common.  Reservations are very difficult to get even a month in advance.Awesome night last Saturday.

Came in on a random Tuesday night bc we were actually able to get a reservation. Had the oysters, octopus and the woodgrilled cap. The octopus and oysters were a solid 3 stars, nothing that would blow you away in terms of flavor but still good and the cap was a 4 (altho it comes out sliced for some reason which led to my steak getting cold pretty fast).I'm glad I got to check it out but was expecting to be blown away. Overall its another solid steakhouse in Chicago, but for the price I'd probably go with another spot.

I was in Chicago on a short trip before going to Europe and I wanted steak, not just ordinary steak but top notch steak, ones that Chicago is known for and RPM does not disappoint.I was in the area and after a few drinks nearby I really wanted steak, under dressed because I was on vacation I wonder in and they were really cool to let me in despite it being dinner time and I was wearing shorts.  The bar was organized well, the drinks were carefully crafted and a decent whisky selection to boot as well.I had the Tiger Prawn to start, and it is just one prawn, it looked like it ate 3 other prawns before ending up on ice in front of me, the flavor was strong and vibrant, too bad it was only one prawn.  I went with the "The Duke" Ribeye, medium-rare (why have good steak if you have it any other way), and it was cooked perfectly, steak was flavorful, juicy, everything you want a $50+ steak to taste.  The Millionaire Potate was totally worth the $18, the truffles totally made the side, the earthy-ness of the truffles took the steak and potatoes combo to new heights.  I made the mistake of ordering the cheesecake because it was massive, and tasty so you can't just a few bites, you have to have it all.  The cheese filling was light, fluffy, aerated and yummy.  My bill wasn't light but eating this good and rich only comes once in a long while
Excellent. Service was excellent, steaks were excellent, sides were delicious but didn't steal the show. All around great experience if you are looking for a high end steak house.

Bobby is the shit!What an awesome experience. I came in with my lady on the late night and I got who I think was the last server in the joint. The food was awesome, the drinks and wine list were off the chart, but he took it to the next level and seriously made the night a memorable occasion.Right when we sat down and was greeted I knew we were going to have a great time, I am not gay, but was charmed. The menu was not huge but big enough to feel a little overwhelmed and needed to choose what to have because I wasnt  trying to blow my load all over Chicago and had already pre drank at pop's (nuf said).Bobby explained the menu with confidence that not only showed knowledge but also an appreciation for what he was serving. It was clear to me he was truly proud of this menu. Bobby led us in the right directions after I subtly explained I didnt want want spend a ton of money but wanted to taste the best. He picked up on my Incognito 'im not trying to brake the bank but still want eat right.. and get some of course'.I started out with a spot on manhattan at the bar and my date and I each had two glasses of wine that were delicious. For dinner I tried the Rib eye, which is my favorite cut, and was perfectly cooked mid rare and seasoned perfectly. The potato sides were on a new level! Everything was worth the money, be careful though its easy to rack up the bill.In the end it was well worth it and a great experience. I dont know if I will be back anytime soon, personally, but if you can throw down some decent cash I would recommend this place every night of the week. Great food, atmosphere and especially service.Thank you for reading ;)

Absolutley amazing. Started with roasted bone marrow & Thick cut bacon, which is great for 2 or 3.  Moved on yo the main courses of Lamb Chops, which could have been a little thicker, but cooked to perfection, non the less.  The Duke was also on the table, & probably one of the best steaks I've ever had.  Sides, we went with spicy broccolini & crispy Hasselbeck, which is a baked potato, sliced, the fried...you will not be disappointed with it.

RPM steak was a little bit of a disappointment compared to its swankier sister RPM Italian. Ambiance was not as elegant. Waiter seemed rushed. Bacon appetizer was delicious! Moscow mule was a bit watered down. Lobster was excellent. Millionaire potatoes were tasty. I want to say they were overpriced at 18 dollars, but they were really really good. Friends got the filet and it was good, but they weren't blown away. Donuts lived up to the hype. With so many steakhouses in the city, will not be back unfortunately, but would visit RPM Italian again.

Had an amazing dinner at RPM Steak last night. The hype here is real and this place exceeded my expectations.The restaurant is large, modern, and has great ambiance. There are a lot of tables and every table was full at dinner. However it never felt too crowded or like you were sitting on top of the table next to you.We ordered the octopus appetizer and it was probably the best cooked octopus I've ever had. It was so tender and cooked to perfection. We also ordered the Parker House Rolls. They are freshly baked in house and they were light, soft, and had great flavor.For dinner our table of six ordered 2 filets, bison filet, black cod, wild king salmon. We also order the following sides hasselback potatoes, whipped bleu cheese potatoes, bacon, hen of the woods, and brussel sprouts.  The steak ordered rare was outstanding. I was very pleased with the quality of both the meat and the way it was prepared. The fishes were also very flavorful and moist. Very impressive for a steakhouse. The thick cut bacon appetizer was awesome. It was savory/sweet and it was melt in your mouth delicious.We ended up with the house made donuts, 14k chocolate cake, and Baked Alaska for dessert. The house made donuts were light and airy. The chocolate cake was very rich cake but really good. It was served very cold which is my favorite way to have cake. The Baked Alaska was fun to order for the presentation, but I wasn't crazy about the flavors.Our waiter Bobby was friendly and personable. He checked on us several times through the night and made sure everything was to our liking. Service was exceptional. There's a fleet or servers, food runners, and bussers working. All of our entrees and sides arrived at the same time so no one was kept waiting. Bobby was attentive throughout the night. I just wish he waited for everyone to finish eating before he sent his crew to clear the table.Everything about RPM Italian is excellent and I highly recommend dining here when in the Chicago area.

Just popped in for a drink, but was it worth it, yes! Their old fashioned was superb. The giant ice cube barely melted, but just enough to balance out the flavors and didn't water the tasty bev down as I'm a slow sipper.The vibe of the place is really cool too. Like a 1920s experience, but upscale. So consider dressing to impress unlike us. Note to self for next time. The bar area overlooks the whole restaurant and is set slightly above the dining room so you get a great view for people watching. In the bar, the walls are lined with leather-lined booths in a semi-circle shape -- very intimate, very chic.I could have spent hours here and wish I could afford to spend $15 per cocktail on the reg. But alas, it was time to hit the hay.I will admit it is my dream to run into Giuliana and Bill at one of their Chicago restaurants. Perhaps one day.
The food was phenomenal! I've been to many restaurants around the county and this restaurant is A1! The steak was incredible. The seafood platter was the best my wife has ever had. Good stuff!
Best restaurant I have ever been to at this point in my life.  Went for lunch. Service was impeccable.  Food quality was superb. Amazing experience and I am critical.

My boyfriend and I came here for brunch and the food was great.Excellent service! Great menu choices! Food came out minutes after ordering! I can see it featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. IT'S THAT GOOD!!!It's one of those places you go to once a month to dine in, but, you get carry out every Saturday and Sunday.We will be back for sure.

One of the best omelettes of my life was had at Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club!I had their caprese omelette but made modifications of no tomatoes and no onions. It was absolutely delicious filled with pancetta, basil, mozarella cheese and a walnut pesto on top. It came out quite quickly and I ended up scarfing the whole thing down!Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club has an eclectic decor in their cramped dining room but it's a good place to get a fine meal in North Park!

They used to serve great basted eggs, that's why I drive from Lincoln Park. No more. Either tell your customers you do not serve basted eggs anymore or hire a cook that can baste an egg. Sending out over medium eggs with the explanation "this is how we baste eggs here" is just awful and let's me know the person in the kitchen never went to cooking school.  They should look up the word "baste" in a dictionary.The really toasted rye toast I asked for came out as warm bread. Eggs overdone and toast underdone. Not a pleasant experience. No need to drive back across town for it again.

This is one of my favorite brunch spots in Chicago! It's cozy, local (North Park) and servers treat you like they've known you forever. You'll get great service and delicious, hearty food.To all the breakfast-lovers like myself: GO. Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club provides you with purpose. You will see hungry folks lined up outside but hakuna matata, there is a nice bench on Kimball to sit on. Staff do their best to keep everyone happy.I've been here twice. Once with my friend Meliss and another with my Aunt from the East Coast who was visiting for the weekend. I'm sure I will keep coming here with friends and family.I'll get a steaming mug of coffee and add a few creams. When the food arrives, I will slowly, purposely devour whatever is front of me. Usually I'll get a taste of whatever my dining parter is having, but we are unable to eat everything because the portions are huge and definitely shareable (2:1 person/dish).I always get something savory and with chorizo or avocado. Meet you at BMBC where you order something sweet and we will be a perfect pair?Things I have ordered and/or stole from someone else's plate:-Mayan Benedict: bean cakes, chorizo, poached eggs, cheese, salsa, avocado-Cubano Guava Hotcakes: guava sauce, sweet marscarpone, graham crackers, pecans-Chorizo Skillet: chorizo, onion, tomatoes, black beans, avocado, cheddar, sour cream, chipotle sauce-Caribbean Omelette: jerked shrimp, cream cheese, avocado, cilantro, mango chutneyYou can get half orders of some of the sweet items (French toast). From my experience, your server can make an excellent recommendation if your stomach allows!  Many orders come with a side of toast.It's cozy (crowded) in the restaurant, but it's so lovely; the hustle-bustle of servers/greeters, the chatter of people, the clanging of silverware. The ducking under trays of food and zig-zagging your way to the table. The fresh flowers in a mason jar by your mug. It's a euphoric breakfast at BMBC every single time.

Bread Pudding French Toast is by far my favorite.   It's hard not to get it.  I've tried other things there too, no complaints, good quality, flavorful.Finally a good restaurant in that corner.  It's a great meet up place for that impromptu breakfast with your friends on a weekday.  Sometimes setting for 2 is quick, but most likely you'll wait 30-40 min.  It's worth it.

I was meeting a coworker for breakfast and was trying to find a breakfast place in the Edgebrook area.  I wanted a place where they keep pouring the coffee and I can be waited on while I try to wake up.  So I found this place on Yelp and the meals looked incredible.  We got there just as it opened.  It's a medium sized breakfast place, kinda like Egg Harbor Cafes.  There is only street parking but when you get their at 7am, finding parking is not a problem.  We were one of the first people there, but by the time we left at 8, there were few open tables left. And our server said on weekends they are jammed.One of the reasons I came here was because they had some kind of pancake with bananas and I think carmel.  It looked really good!  I'm not an adventurous eater (chocolate chip pancakes is about as adventerous as I get).  But those banana pancakes fit within my boring tastes.  Well it ended up they were a daily special and they were not on the specials for this day.  There was another pancake that sounded good with cherries and peaches.  I was going to tell them to just put the cherries on it, but I was willing to step out of my comfort zone so I just ordered them as they came.They ended up being one of those meals that you wish would never end.  The mixture of the cherries with the peaches blended perfectly.  And the pancakes were different (read 'much better') than most places I've been. They were light and slightly sweet. Once I finished the meal I had to compliment the cook (truly more like a chef) for creating such an amazing dish.  I want to come back soon!

Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club is located on the SW corner of Kimball and Bryn Mawr.  My friend went here a few months ago and the food in the pictures looked amazing.  Couple this with a 4 1/2 star review and I book marked it for the future.I finally got a chance to go here for a late breakfast.  The restaurant is very nice, the wait staff was good.  All of the food is beautifully presented, however looks can be deceiving.  I ordered the skirt steak skillet.  The potatoes were very good, cooked crispy the way I like them with the eggs over easy on top.  All good?  Until the skirt steak.  The meat was seasoned ok, but the quality wasn't the best.  The meat was very chewy.  Maybe I should have ordered one of their French toast or pancake dishes that came with a variety of fresh fruit instead as they looked incredible.  Ehhhh Cie la vie.

This place was amazing!  Everything.... and I mean Everything on the menu sounded delicious.  Which is great, but such a torment for someone who has issues deciding whether to have lemon in my water :PAnd of course I couldn't decide so I got a 1/2 order of french toast with lemon and blueberry which was so damn good I literally licked the place and felt no shame...  then came my eggs, which was a special that day with chorizo and was also delicious!!We arrived at the right time because we got seated right away but soon after there were people waiting out the door, which I understand is the norm, and I can see why.Even the coffee was amaze-balls!!Staff was attentive, atmosphere is cool.  Will definitely return!

Great service and a really cute spot. My friend and I came in for brunch on a Wednesday and fortunately didn't have to wait for a table.  I had the Pajun pancake and she had the chilaquiles, we were both very satisfied. If it weren't so far from where I live, I'd come back weekly but 90 minutes on the CTA is a trek for sure

Great place for breakfast!I went here with a friend around 10 am on a Saturday and the wait was only 5-10 minutes. I was a bit worried about the wait since they don't take reservations, so I pleasantly surprised when I found out the wait was so short. We were seated all the way in the back next to the doorway. The table was located too close to the doorway. People working there were moving high chairs and couldn't fit. At one point, my friend had to get up and move so they could get through.I ordered the Mayan Benedict (black bean cakes, chorizo, avocado, sour cream, cojita cheese, mayan salsa) and coffee. I thought the benedict was delicious! I liked the black bean cakes instead of the traditional english muffins. The dish had a nice spicy kick to it without being too overpowering. The potatoes were perfectly cooked and seasoned well. The coffee was good too - I liked their cute coffee mugs.The service was excellent - we continually were asked for water, tea or coffee refills. It's a great option for breakfast - delicious food, good service, charming decor, easy to find parking and reasonable prices. I'll be back!

So delicious! Wanted a unique and innovative meal and I was not disappointed. I had the acorn squash and tomato soup with the bread pudding French toast for something sweet. Everything was great, the food came out quickly and the service was fantastic! The kept my water/coffee full constantly and although the place was busy they were attentive. I would definitely recommend and I hope to be back sometime

Woah, yum. Our server greeted us with 'we've been here two years, where have you been?' And rightfully so.This spot was great, but be prepared to wait if you're there during prime brunch times. The wait was relatively quick but I did see some people lingering, so I suspect as the morning gets later, the waits go up.The menu looked great and I had a hard time deciding. So, I obviously had to try more than one thing. I had pancakes and a breakfast torta. They both were delicious. The torta was light even though it had chorizo in it (which sometimes skews heavy and greasy).  The pancake was huge! Also delicious with fruit.Nothing was overly done. The ingredients were fresh and made well and also somewhat simple.Worth a visit for the wonderful food. Also, great staff and they take credit cards now.

Really enjoyed this place hit the spot in the morning time, but don't go too late because they might have a line and they close around 3pm. When I came here to have breakfast with my girlfriend we weren't sure what to expect. We came here because she said they have huge portions and she was correct on that their portions are pretty well sized for there price. We got what other people have reviewed over and said was delicious, which was the crab cake benedict and another benedict that include salmon in it(forgot its name). MM the flavor was alright really enjoyed the salmon benedict, but only complaint about it was the eggs in both benedict. I guess in my past experience for me benedict is suppose to have a runny egg, but our were more well done you could say. that was the only bad part. The service was great they had plenty of servers and those servers were on it never had a empty cup for my coffee.

Amazing bread pudding French toast and black coffee, but long waiting and uncomfortable high steel chair.I and my husband got here for Sunday brunch around 11am. We had to wait 20-30mins. While waiting, the staff asked us anything to drink, so we got a cup of coffee. It was very good! I was happy that they serve uncommon coffee which i just read about their news online.Bread pudding French toast was just amazing!!! Sour of fresh strawberry and sweetness of marmalade were perfectly matched!! My husband got omelette which I think it was good, but I wish the egg was more half cooked to give more smooth and silky texture. I felt it was a little bit overcooked.We got a high table seating spot and very uncomfortable with the high steel chair. You could adjust the height, but it was still uncomfortable. So, if you wanna enjoy your meal without worrying about chair, I recommend you to ask having a regular table!

This is a great spot for weekend brunch. Friendly staff, interesting food with options to go classical, contemporary, Mexican, or the basics. I had the french omelette which was just big enough to satisfy without putting me in a food coma. Good fresh flavors and just the right portion size. We had to wait but it was faster than predicted. Come early to avoid the rush! Will be back!

This is my second time eating here and it was great! This place and m.henry are probably my 2 favorite spots for breakfast/brunch.I got the pancakes with berries and cream and my husband got the acorn squash and tofu plate. The kids got pancakes and we added berries and cram for them as well. Everything was delicious! Literally my son wanted to kick his plate because it was that great. The last time I came we ordered the bread pudding French toast, French omelet, and Oreo pancakes for the kids. Again it was amazing! I have no complaints about this place! The service is awesome and street parking is fairly easy! In terms of coffee they brew uncommon coffee roasters which is based in mi. It's good coffee but not my favorite. If I had to give them a con it would be on the orange juice. The fresh squeezed orange juice doesn't really taste fresh squeezed but maybe I read the menu wrong and assumed it was fresh.This place is super kid friendly because we have 3 little ones and it was no problem with them. They have high chairs.Also the restaurant is not too big so there is a wait but it usually isn't a long wait. We went at the busiest time and waited about half an hour which isn't bad.All and all this place is a family favorite and will definitely be back many more times!

Amazing comfort breakfast food! I always go for the biscuits and gravy. Pancakes are fluffy and delicious. The price is definitely worth the amount of food you're getting.Service is great as well :) Even when the place is crowded which happens during rush hour every day, they instantly greet you at the door and assist you a few moments after sitting you down.A++++++ !! 100/100

I met a friend/old co-worker for lunch about a month ago here.  She suggested it... the menu looked great when she first mentioned it so I was looking forward to going.  We met for brunch on a Sunday in the afternoon...I believe shortly before they closed, but we had plenty of time to dine and talk.  It was so hard to choose on the menu, but I was very happy with my selection and being very warm out, I had iced coffee too.  We had a minimal 15 minute wait and the waiting area was outside...I'm not sure where people go on cold days or days it's raining, but it worked out well.  Also, I parked right there on the street with no problem and didn't have to pay the meter!  The service was good and it was an all around great experience here.  I would definitely return.

Wowza!  I got the BLT club which came with a side of hash and I can't believe I devoured the entire thing in one sitting....along with a side of French toast. Yikes!  It was THAT good. Coming back tomorrow lol.

First time here and we loved it! Got there early and didn't have to wait. Staff was very friendly and the food came out fast!  Coffee was good. I had the French Omelette, my hubby had the Bread Pudding French Toast and my mom had the Caprese Omelette...everyone loved their meal! We will definitely be back. Such a cute little dive spot for a great meal.
Excellent brunch, ample menu, great service and ambience. We went late on Sunday afternoon and only waited 10 min for a table. We both had skillets and they were tasty and plentiful.
been there a couple times now. It's a great little brunch/lunch place.  Food is good. Service is quick. Coffee is strong. All you can ask for in a Brunch/lunch place

Never disappoints...bar none one of the best breakfast places in chicago. I've tried nearly everything on the menu each better than the next. The only thing better than the food is the service.  Here are just a few recommendations:Pajun breakfastSteak and eggsIncredible pancakes (so light and fluffy)Fench toastChorizo skillet (a serious favorite of my boyfriend he literally gets this every time we go)ChilaquilesBLT with egg (OMG, i had this today and it was amazing)Steak skillet

My 2nd visit, and just like the first time around the food was very good. Very nice selection for breakfast or lunch. I've opted for breakfast food both times. Portions are on the large side, so beware. Staff was friendly and accommodating. What stands between 4 and 5 stars for me is about 10 degrees...........as in AC. Almost uncomfortable to eat it was so warm. I don't think it was coincidence since my visits were over a year apart. I really like/need coffee with my breakfast, but won't be able to do it during any return visits if the temp is the same.

I have been wanting to go to this place for a while, especially after reading all the reviews and I am so glad I finally went. Such a cute place to have breakfast/brunch. The veggie skillet I ordered was delicious. My friends loved there brunch menu too. To top it off, they had the best customer service. Everyone was super friendly.  We were greeted  as soon as we stepped in. Definitely recommend it to peopleP.S. I actually ordered the chorizo skillet but w/o the chorizo.
For a local spot, came here because the menu looked interesting.  I'm not a huge pancake fan but the pancakes here were the best I've ever had!

You can smell the food as you walk down the street and into the doors. And the smell was delicious and I was excited. It was just me and a friend and they seated us within the minute. It was Saturday brunch and the place was packed. I got the strawberry rhubarb French toast and I didn't like my dish, it was too sour for my taste. My friend got coffee and the chorizo skilled and she liked her dish and so did I. For both out dishes it coated a total of 28 dollars. The service was very good and they were friendly and refilled the waters and coffee very promptly. I might have just got the wrong food but other than everything else was good.

Great breakfast spot.  Was in Chicago for a couple days and found this place had pretty good reviews.  Everything we got was cooked perfectly and no one left hungry.  I would strongly recommend their eggs benedict.

Now that's what I call "going clubbing"! Rolled by this neighborhood joint early on a Saturday after a 0630 flight from B-More and it really hit the spot. Great, fresh coffee from uncommon grounds, super attentive service and amazing food. Got the skirt steak skillet which came with nicely done (but a little tough) skirt steak under an egg, over avocado and home fries. The dish was seasoned perfectly and flavors really complemented each other. Blueberry hotcakes, bread pudding french toast and peach granola waffles got high marks from my crew. Even by 8 AM some items were crossed off the board and by 9 place was packed. The early bird gets the blackberry Kiwi French Toast.

This was a fun and surprising find (via Yelp)! This is a cute, quiet little place early on a Sunday morning! The food and service were great (see my photos)! Happy to have found a solid place, not too far from home!

It's aight.The wait was a little long, food was decent, iced tea was tasty, staff was attentive.My group had 5 members which caused us to wait a little while, which is cool. The inside is wayyyyy tight, not sure that I would seat groups larger than that on a Sunday brunch service because of how tight it is in there.The food was OK. I had the strawberry-rhubarb french toast, it was sufficient. I did like how they represented Cubano culture with lots of guava usage. They also use a TON of fresh fruit which is AMAZING. Kind of silly though that they have trickier ethnic staples such as scallion pancakes which can in no way be properly represented in a short-order brunch service spot. The menu seems a little too vast for such a small spot. My iced tea was fresh and delicious, the staff was always present to refill when needed.Cost was about normal for a neighborhood brunch spot in Chicago.
If you get here early, you won't have to wait in line.  This is the second time we've eaten here. The service is excellent, the food is amazing, and the decor is charming.

This was a pretty good experience, but a little disappointing after reading all the great reviews. The wait wasn't too bad, and the ambiance of the restaurant was modern and welcoming.The food varied, however. I ordered the multi grain blueberry pancakes which were disappointingly dry. More blueberry sauce would have made it better, but as it was, I had to add butter and maple syrup.My husband's savory stuffed French toast was much better, with excellent home fries. I recommend trying the dish with maple syrup.Our server was competent, but surly at best. I actually empathize with him, however, as I'm sure I would be the same if I had to serve in a restaurant that was so warm. This place is in DIRE need of air conditioning. It was so hot and humid that I couldn't really enjoy the meal and was eager to leave.
