I went with the meatball sandwich and a side of mac and cheese, while my buddy tried the fried chicken sandwich and fries. Generous portions, tons of flavor, and everything arrived to the table nice and hot. To me, that's a very underrated aspect of any meal. Get it to me hot, please.Fun atmosphere, rivers of beer, and excellent food. Job well done, First Draft.
Fun place to hang out. Great appetizers and pretty good service. The burgers were solid and the fries were addictive. Overall, it's a place that I would go back to.

Came in here for a Sunday Morning BLoody mary and was treated to a good one. The place itself was clean and the large windows allowed for some great street watching. Why did i give this place 5 stars? Because the bartenders. 2 females behind the bar offered great conversation while we were there. i wish i could write more but like i said only stopped in for a Bloody Mary. Would recommend Sundays there if these ladies are behind the bar

First Draft was a better experience than it's First Impression.Walking up to this bar from the north side you would never spot it walking down Clark Street. Perhaps other locations are like this in the south loop but I haven't ventured in this area so I can't really say. All they have is a small flip folding sign on the ground in the front. The front of the building is unassuming and does not stand out amongst the buildings. I would suggest a larger sign with some moving lights or something. This will help draw more attention.Once I found this sign I was quite nervous. Looking from the outside it did not look like this would be the place where I would want to watch the Triple Crown attempt and game 2 of the WCF.I will admit I was wrong.Once inside, I realized that this was a legit sports bar. They had a modern open interior with plenty of televisions for viewing. Bar space and "booths"/tall boy tables are inviting for groups. I didn't have anything off of the menu but others in my group seemed to be happy with the selection as well as the drink options. Bud light and a round of fireball shots was good for me.A couple notes for improvement:The audio for the live sporting events was slightly off and this is something that didn't ruin the experience but was noticeable. Audio for the horse race started late and the audio to and from commercial breaks during the Hawks game was not smooth. These are things that  a sports bar should be good at. But maybe they are not a sports bar on the regular and I have this place completely confused. If they were a regular bar acting as a sports bar then I could understand and I would say the did a decent job.Service was good but I felt like it could be a little friendlier. It was above average but it took a while for the staff to get involved with us through friendly banter. A shot loosened them up but it only benefits the bar if you get people having a good time and wanting to come back to see familiar faces.

Came for dinner and drinks and sat at the bar. Great service, super friendly and helpful staff. It was Tuesday so half price wings.  In town for work, but would definitely come here again. Honey Siracha wings are awesome!

Great spot and great food. Been wanting to go here for a while and just got around to it tonight. Atmosphere was good and the beer list was more than anyone could ask for.There was a slight accident with our pizza (not the restaurants fault) and they made us a brand new one even though most of the other one was fine.They also have a really good special for when the Blackhawks and bills are playing!

Stopped in here recently mainly because I was curious what happened to the "old Villains" space. The new owners stuck a sports bar in it and kept all the draft lines, adding some windows and removing the cheesy rock n' roll decor. Minor improvements, and they also put in a nice custom back bar.Service at the bar was a bit of a hassle. It took almost 20 minutes to get a drink when the bar was half empty. They were out of the first 2 beers I ordered, then weren't sure if I could order a beer smaller than a pint just to try it. After seeing a flight of beers on the bar, they remembered they do flights, so i'd have to order 4 beers at a time. I asked for 3 and a dealer's choice, which turned out to be Founders Project Pam, which was not good. Maybe they were new, i'll give the frazzled bartender the benefit of the doubt.Didn't try the food, but it looks like your average fried pub grub. The beer selection was good, and i'd return another time but my experience didn't make the greatest first impression. 3.5 stars.

I like first draft a lot!  It's a good location and a nice atmosphere.  There's always sports on TV and the people in the bar are usually pretty invested in them, which makes it SO fun to go to.I've gone here and gotten the wings twice, and each time I found them to be disappointing.  The flavor wasn't that exciting and they weren't great/ crispy enough.Additionally, the Old Bay fries don't taste like Old Bay at all. They are seriously underseasoned and soggy and bland AF. Very disappointing  for someone who misses that delicious East Coast flavor!!The poutine is super delicious and really enjoyable.  Classic poutine with a twist.  So yummy.The best part is definitely the amazing beer selection.  The servers and bartenders are well informed on the beer, so you can ask questions about it if you can't decide form the MANY, frequently rotating options on draft.  It's a lot of fun to pick and try new beers!The service is good, the servers are friendly, but it's always busy which means it can be hard to get the attention of your server when you need it.

Great vibe, super friendly service, a ton of TV screens, and a huge selection of beer!Food: Tried the chicken wings (Chicago and buffalo sauce, half and half). Decently priced at $10 for 10 wings and they were awesome sauce!Fried Brussels sprouts (only $5 for a whole bowl) were decent but I didn't really understand the hype?! It was just regular Brussel sprouts (which I like so it was still tasty) with some Parmesan cheese sprinkled on them. I would try something else next time.I would definitely be back!!

When you eat out in the city you're gonna spend some money so price doesn't really factor into this review. The food is delicious and the beer menu is extensive. What else could you need? Plenty of TVs to watch sports and a jukebox in the corner for your favorite tunes. Service is attentive and friendly. Nice crowd, tends to attract business people during lunch and happy hour.

This nice little cozy bar we found off Yelp!! It was our first time to downtown CHI and wanted something walkable (in the snow) from our hotel. Thanks to Yelp we found this perfect place. Everyone was friendly! OMG their poutine fries r to die for!!!! Totally would come back here if I'm ever in town. Btw they have 64+ beers on tap!!!

I made this place the Last Draft of the night after touring some other beer locations and having earlier dinner with friends.  This place in the South Loop has it going on.  The draft beer list is quite good.  They had some great Bell's limited edition and some seasonal Oktoberfest beers that were unique.  The location is pretty large with lots of seating and tables.  The staff are super friendly and efficient.  I will be back.

This place is great.  I was in town visiting and got to my hotel a couple blocks away around 8pm.  I really just wanted some food and a beer, so I looked on Yelp and it had good reviews and was close.  I ended up staying later drinking beers because the staff was friend and the place has great atmosphere.  I had a burger which was really good and the fries were awesome! Highly recommend it! I ended up going back there for a beer 3 of my 4 nights in town.
If we lived in Chicago this would be our local bar. Great service and a wide beer selection make this place a spot worth visiting. Plenty of seating inside also doesn't hurt.
Great atmosphere, great staff and great beer/food!I loved the Brussels Sprouts and the Burgers are great.

In Chicago for a convention. Stopped in to first draft due to the beer list. With that said. Food was good. Wife ordered brussel sprouts and they were excellent. I ordered Buffalo wings and they were also excellent. Wife felt same about her Cobb salad. Only bad pick were the onion rings. Skip em. Beer selection was exceptional. Had a flight of Illinois finest brewers. Really enjoyed the Three Floyd's dreadnaught. (Indiana).

First Draft has become a go-to of mine in the South Loop (after the gym, after anything at Soldier Field). I've been here a bunch of the past couple of months and I can now confirm that the food is pretty good (specifically the Turkey Burger).  Also, the service is always good here. I dig it here.

Love this place. Its our after work hang out spot.  My friends love to come here because of the large variety of drinks that they have here.  I'm more of a foodie and I thought their food here was pretty delicious. So far I've tried the first draft burger, the chicken wings, fried pickles and the cheese curds. All delicious!  Service was good and they even allowed us to do separate checks for our group of 8.  They have specials on Tuesdays for half off chicken wings. Lots of TVs and good comfortable seating. I'm sure we will be back soon.

Gem's #1 Draft Pick!First Draft is a local bar in the Printer's Row/South Loop neighborhood of Chicago, IL. It has a gemload o'unique & craft beers on draft, many from local Chicago breweries. If ya can't decide which draft to try first, ya can't go wrong with my local fave brewski, Cross of Gold brewed by Chicago's own Revolution Brewing Company. It's a golden ale, "RB's Bud Lite" with a nice lil hop, skip & a jump & is $6 an ice cold draft at First Draft. If beer isn't your preferred poison, don't fret ya can still have a gem time & get tipsy cuz FD offers a wide selection of spirits & other liquor too.First impressions count & I heart the window display at FD which is a lil shrine o'memorabilia in honor of the late, great former Chicago Cubs player, Ernie Banks aka Mr. Cub (see my pic). RIP Mr. Cub & brownie points to First Draft for making a gemriffic 1st impression!The interior of FD is pretty spacious & has a very charming modern, art deco kinda decor with a wooden bar & wooden high tops, tin ceiling & my fave: exposed, Chicago brick walls. FD is a nice, pretty laid back/chillax kinda bar & is super clean, including the bathrooms! There are also lotsa TVs throughout the place, gemtastic for viewin' your fave Chi-sporting event!I've only had drinks at FD but the menu seems pretty gemmy with your standard bar fare of burgers, pizza, wings, various sammies & assorted apps. Looks like yummy grub as a late-night snack, HH app, or game-day meal!Service at FD is pretty first-rate based on my drinking experience here. Our server was friendly, quick & capable of making beer recs off the beer list! Only gripe I have was the group at the bar that was shouting loudly! They were playing some kinda game?! This friggin' obnox-ass screamin' shoulda been ix-nayed! This isn't a dive bar where I would tolerate or expect such annoying BS nor was I in the mood to listen to it!Sans the gamers' shouting, I overall enjoy First Draft. It's gotta great cozy, neighborhood feel to it with lotsa gemmy booze & character without bein' a dump! So if you're in Printer's Row o'Chicago or you're headin' back to da burbs & ya need a cold one but don't know where to go, I recommend stoppin' by First Draft for your 1st, 2nd or last draft!
Service was mediocre. No happy hour specials :-/ Great beer selection though.....

Sub par service 8.00 a beer not thrilled about this place just easy for my travels. Eat the fried cheese otherwise I don't have to much more to quote it's a sports bar with alcohol want to go get trashed and watch the game with the boys stop right on in there. Looking for amazing food and awesome atmosphere well go to devil dogs eat there than go drink there.

Hands down the best bar in the South Loop Area. More beers than you could begin to count, great food, and really chill atmosphere. Plenty of TVs, and they come around regularly to ask what you want on the TV closest to you. They also always have great specials on craft beers. Would recommend this bar to anyone looking to grab drinks

This is slowly becoming my go to spot in the Printers Row. The beer selection is amazing, and somewhat intimidating. I take the strategy of just slowly working my way through it from tip to tail. Just take your time, realize that you're never going to fully grasp the complexity of everything, and have fun. From a food standpoint, the menu is extensive. On Tuesday they have half price wings, which come in three flavors (all excellent). The service is great, and if you're sports fan, fear not because they have tons of tv's that are viewable from just about every seat. It gets a bit crowded in evenings, so if you want to get a table with a lot of people, get there early.If you're there and the weekends, and chicken and waffles is on the menu, go for it. It's the best I've had in Chicago.

We came here for a coworker's birthday lunch, and it was quite empty. It looks like mostly all high top table seating here. The tables have a storage area underneath that holds the menu which is really neat. We were probably the first table here, and there were a few other people that came after. I felt like service was a little slow still given that there was 1 server/bartender. She did refill our water once, but I could have used another glass. It also took a little bit to get our bill. We were only a group of 6 so I'm not sure how they would have handle this as sometimes our group gets to be around 12 people or so. The food here though is really good. I really liked the fried chicken sandwich and fried brussel sprouts that I had. The other food items looked pretty delicious too. I might not really dine in again, but definitely would come for a pick up order.

I'm not typically a fan of the sports bar atmosphere, but it wasn't overwhelming. Lots of tvs, but they didn't distract from the architectural appeal of the space. The food was delicious; I got the Southern Fried Chicken sandwich and it was enjoyable, although in my opinion it could have been spicier. The mac&cheese was heavenly. The tap and scotch lists were extensive! Can't wait to come back.

The wife and I stopped in for a quick drink before our dinner reservations. I can't comment on the food at all since we didn't even look at the food menu. It was pretty packed at the restaurant and the bar area on a Friday late afternoon. We were lucky to score at least one chair at the end of the bar for the wife while I stood to enjoy my beers. She opted for a bourbon, knob creek, if I remember correctly. The bourbon selection was fairly standard with no real great finds for two bourbon snobs. I was there to try some local beers hopefully and they were up to the challenge.Overall, they had a good beer selection and at decent prices. The first local beer that I had was described as a hoppy Belgian style saison. It fell flat on all those descriptions. My next beer more than made up for it. It was call Morning Wood from Local Option and had this great coffee flavor to an Amber/Red ale. Overall service was a little chaotic, but I will say that the atmosphere was lively. If we find ourselves in the area again, I would consider returning, but there are a lot of places to see in Chicago....

Ugh it kills me to update my review.. But after last night I just have too!Everything about this place is cool! Great beer list, great ambiance, and just an overall great place to hang out with friends! What made me sad was the menu! It turned into the basic bar food! Where did my mussels and shrimp go? I had the bison burger last night and it was just average! I suggest adding In a few different items that's what I loved most about this place!I  will always come back for drinks but I will know not to be too excited about the menu!

Visiting from Cali and was looking for a local sports bar to watch some games and have some beers,  and I found it thanks to Yelp. Cool place with friendly people. Lots of good beers and allot of tv's. Good music play lists and good vibes !  I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Chi-Town !
I come to first draft for the fried Brussels Sprouts and stay for the beer menu that is in a leather bound book. They always have unique beers that I have never had before.
Great Bar! Tons of great beers on tap! Menu is unique and they have tons of great dynamic deals having to do with local games and what not.

We went here in the late afternoon on a weekday. They had about six sandwiches as $10.00 lunch specials. We got a turkey club and a buffalo chicken sandwich, both of which were simple, but very well executed. Their selection of draft beer is excellent and reasonably priced, and their online beer list is up-to-date. Service was friendly and attentive. The space is pleasantly pubby, with a pretty green ceiling. I would definitely go again for a casual lunch or a tasty beer. They also do beer flights, which is always nice at a place with a lot of great beer choices.

One of my favorite places to eat in South Loop.  Don't be scared by the sports theme, the kitchen is better than anywhere in a 1 mile radius!  I cannot remember life before porksicles, you have changed me forever. Also, the fried chicken sandwich is nothing less than a work of art.  Not a beer drinker, but their selection is A+ and will satisfy the most selective of connoisseurs.Probably the best sports bar in the South Loop, and one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood, too.

Good god, the beer selection here is amazing.I've had very little in the way of food from First Draft (though, both times I have gotten food, it was fantastic. Especially the squeakers, oh my god.) What primarily brings me out is the beer selection, which is one of the best that I've seen in the city. Was it worth waiting for them to open for a year? Yeah, definitely. (Though I just wish they had opened before I moved out of the dorm across the street, but alas. I'm sure my wallet's thankful that they didn't.)They have a truly mind boggling amount of draft beer on their menu in a wide variety of styles and will even mix beers for you (which I definitely recommend in some cases. They don't have Lagunitas's cappucino stout right now, but when they did, mixing it with a vanilla porter was my go-to if I didn't want to try something new). And really, it's nice to look at a beer menu and feel compelled to get something new every time, especially when there's such a variety.
They served me cold pizza. The cheese was cold as well as the rest of the toppings. This is an extreme food safety risk if they continue to undercook their food.

64 beers on tap, good food and fair prices! I stumbled across this place on the beer menus app when I was looking out for a particular beer. I'm a beer geek and always looking for new places to go, especially on Blackhawks game nights since I go to most of the games and like to have a few beers and eat dinner before getting to the UC. I was able to park right in front (metered parking) at around 4pm on a Thursday. They had good specials for Blackhawks or Bulls game days and a lot of great craft beer at good prices. My wife and I shared the buffalo chicken sandwich which was very good. We substituted the mac & cheese for fries which was tasty. I'm not sure how long this place has been around but it's a great-looking bar and restaurant. Service at the bar was friendly and helpful. First Draft is a great alternative to Madison Street bars before games at the UC. We will definitely be back.

Nice atmosphere to watch a game.Very good craft beer selection.Horrible service. There was 1 Waitress for the entire restaurant, so I understand being busy, but she would walk past us when we obviously would need something. She had no urgency whatsoever.Food was nothing special. Prices weren't too bad though.

First of all, the service is abysmal. We waited 20 minutes after we ordered our drinks to order our food---meanwhile, our waitress went to another table at least 5 times while we sat and waitedThe food is also very sub par. The fried pickles are pickle spears which is the worst. The pretzel bun I received was completely ripped in half so I had to eat my burger with a fork and knife!Everyone raves about the draft selection---two beers that I ordered were no longer served!It was just one thing after another here. Do not recommend.(Bus boy was lovely)

So my boyfriend and I sort of found this place by accident. We were looking for lunch at a bar near a conference we were at, and we sort of went mostly based off of location. But wow did we get lucky!The bar looks really clean, it has a great vibe and they played good music. The waitress/bartender was super friendly and attentive! They had an amazing beer list and the bartender was knowledgeable about them to boot.Now on to the food... Which was delicious. I had the first draft burger, and let me tell you, that beer cheese is amazing! My boyfriend had the 34 Hanger steak sandwich, which he practically inhaled it was so good. I think the best part about the food was how well the burger and steak were cooked. We like our meat on the medium-rare to rare side and it's hard to find places that actually cook it like that, and First Draft certainly did!I would definitely recommend this place! It was the first place we went to eat at in Chicago and it definitely started the trip off right!

Found this place by Yelp and I'm glad I did.  Had a great time here.  Service was super friendly.  Tap choices were vast and had some delicious beers.  I only ordered the Fried Pickles because I had eaten previously but they were delicious!  the menu did look good and sure enough the food I was watching them bring out to other tables looked excellent.  If you have not given this place a shot, I recommend you do. I'm glad I did.
Great fried chicken sandwhich. The owner is great, as well as the staff. Adjacent parking lot. Great place to watch the game.  Fabulous beer selection.  Need I say more?

Another great night at First Draft. The Blackhawks were playing in the Stanley Cup finals, the U.S. women were playing in the first game of the World Cup. The place was packed with locals in Hawks jerseys,  and as expected the beers were awesome.
great spot - actually busy /full even on weeknights, which is awesome if you want to go out and don't want to hit up an empty bar! good service, awesome beer selection

Epic beer list, great servers, small but tasty food menu, lots of TVs, and weird/eclectic but usually enjoyable music. Highly recommend on game nights or otherwise!The only negative, in my experience, is their total inability to guess how long the wait will be for a table. I've been told 20 minutes and waited over an hour for a bigger table, been told 10 and waited 40 just for 2 of us. Often no wait for a table at all, though, and there is a long bar for seating as well.

The bar has a good atmosphere. Had some onion rings which were good. Fried chicken sandwich was very dry and not tasty so I would stay away from that. Good beer selection on tap. Our waitress seemed annoyed at times. I'm not sure I'll be back with other good options in south loop like scout.

My wife and I had an incredible time here. All of the food was delicious, including the lamb and hummus (which my wife normally doesn't enjoy). The drinks were great, and our server was very friendly and helpful.The space itself was elegant and polished but calm. The roof seating area wasn't open when we went (Sunday dinner), but atmosphere was just right anyway.Very well done, Bernie's!

Quality food in a relaxed environment with a beautiful rooftop.The lunch menu is simple: six starters, four salads, and five sandwiches to choose from. That's it. Yet despite its short menu, this restaurant is quite popular and enjoys a steady clientele.Every item in the menu is carefully chosen, each and every one I tried was great! But great in a simple, non-sophisticated way: a rare gift nowadays.All starts are fabulous and would confidently suggest any, but if I had to choose I'd go for the lamb hashwi. The steak salad had a great spicy kick, totally unexpected but well appreciated. The burger was great too!In a restaurant with so little options to choose from, the kitchen takes a big risk. Bernie's has followed a simple approach to mitigate this risk: do things right with quality ingredients.This was my first time at Bernies and certainly won't be my last.

I took my fiancé here last night for dinner. It was our first time and, while we enjoyed ourselves, there were a few opportunities for improvement.To begin, the hostess never really greeted us properly because she was on the phone. Granted, she was on with a potential reservation but I think people who are actually there in person always take precedence over someone on the phone especially when we had reservations also.A server spotted the situation and walked over to help so the restaurant deserves some kudos for him. Once we were seated, we were introduced to Martez, our server, and he was great. He knew the menu and made some good recommendations.We had a hummus spread, steelhead trout appetizer and split a burger. The burger was amazing for me but undercooked for my lady although she enjoyed the hummus and trout quite a bit.We were in a bit of a rush (dinner and movie night) and Shane, the manager, came over to check on us a few times, which is always appreciated!Prices were reasonable and the atmosphere is nice so we will definitely give Bernie's another shot.

Lamb hashwi on a daily basis - please and thank you. I was confused about what to expect at Bernie's - seems like a "basic"-attracting brunch spot but the Mediterranean inspiration is not misguided.Fantastic flavors, interesting options, balanced drinks, and beautiful decor with equally juicy colors and contrasting styles.

I came here Friday night with 2 other people.  I had made a reservation on Open Table for 7pm and called ahead to see if we could sit outside, they said we should arrive early to be seated upstairs as they couldn't guarantee rooftop seating.  We arrived at 6 and had drinks at the bar until the table was ready.  The drinks were good, very nice inside bar area however they need to fix the acoustics because it was so LOUD.  I was screaming my order at the bar tender to the point where we were joking about how we were basically yelling at each other.  The host table kept needing to go outside when the phone rang and just seemed stressed (understandably so given that they couldn't hear anything).The dinner menu was interesting- definitely a $$$ and not a $$ like Yelp indicates.  The least expensive thing on the menu is the burger and it's $15 ($2 to add an egg and $3 to add bacon) plus you have to order fries separately ($8) which climbs to $28 rather quickly.  The service was very friendly but I certainly would not make a point of coming back for a $20 burger when there are so many other more affordable and equally tasty options in the city.

Brunch + Rooftop sounds like a total win to me!I had the pleasure to have brunch here recently with a group of 10 friends. We were lucky enough to get a group table on the rooftop for our early Sunday afternoon meal. Their brunch menu is pretty lite on option but the options look pretty good. I went with the Fried Egg Sandwich which was decent and a pretty nice portion. The sandwich included avocado, bacon, cheddar & hot sauce on farm bread. I washed everything down with some grapefruit mimosas...nice!View is nice...not too high up but still nice and good for pics! Music playlist was nice as they had some hits rocking. Servers were more than awesome and took great care of us. I would like to come here at night and check out the scene here then.

I love the concept of Bernie's. I also love their rooftop dining. I also really adore their happy hour menu. Beyond those features, though, Bernie's was just ok in my book.A few of my girlfriends and I made a reservation at Bernie's for a nice catch up dinner a few weeks back. We enjoyed a $5 happy hour drink (I went with the Moscow Mule - a tastier choice that the bubbles or the white) and then headed upstairs where we shared a long table with another group of ladies. We were asked beforehand if this was ok and we said sure, we're friendly.Our server was enthusiastic and helpful and we ordered a variety of eats to share among the three of us. Here's where things went a little south - throughout the night we were constantly getting the wrong dishes put in front of us or moved between our group and the other group at our table. I'm more than fine sharing space but the number of times things were incorrectly set down and moved back and forth was comical. The food itself was hit or miss. The burger was fantastic - flavorful and substantial. The hamachi was Barbie sized at best. The falafel desperately needed more sauce. The patatas bravas were delightful. The avocado salad was mediocre and could have used more pizzazz. The rooftop is on the loud side, but it's rooftop dining - I expected that.If you're headed to Bernie's - grab a seat on their beautiful rooftop and order the burger. That would be a delightful combo!

AMAZING HAPPY HOUR! so many food and drink options under $5 from 5-7. You cant find that kind of deal in Chicago. I went yesterday with a group of 10, and they were so accommodating. Our waiter Justice was the perfect waiter. He was both sweet and attentive and that went a long way with our group. We ordered many rounds of their famous white sangria. I am very picky with sangria and it was honestly the best i have ever had. I want to take jugs home with me regularly.Food wise, my group order 6 (seriously) rounds of french fries (So great and comes with a mayo dip), the eggplant dip, and the tomato toast.All were amazing. The fries though are an absolute must get. You wont regret it.I am happy to say i have found my new regular happy hour spot. Cant wait until next time!

The rooftop here is beautiful. The brunch options are few but everything on the menu looked delicious. We had the seasonal fruit, oatmeal, avocado toast, and cheese omelette with crispy potatoes.The fruit was layered over a bed of honey ricotta which was delicious, and was a nice variety. Sometimes fruit platters tend to be bland, but this one had plenty of berries, watermelon, etc. Everything was delicious, although the omelette was pretty bland, but it was paired with yummy fried potatoes. Would reorder everything but the omelette!

PERFECT for a group brunch date. Still heard dinner is better. But brunch was awesome. We had a group of 10 on a Sunday morning with reservations- which I do recommend making ahead of time! We saw groups with kids, groups celebrating a baby shower, so many families and friends gathered! Nestled in River North- I was happy to enter the ambiance of natural lights, beautiful brass displays, and teal furniture. With a hipster 50's feel with vintage decor, the restaurant was so inviting. Our waiter began talking about the chef, the restaurant group, Detroit and it's Mediterranean influences brought to Chicago, and his history of working as a server and you can see his delight for serving us and repeating the menu on both sides of the table in the loud and chatty restaurant.Don't let the 'small plates' and 'large plates' fool you on size- all the plates are graciously perfect in size the large is like extra large and the small is like a good medium size entree. We got lamb hashwi which seems to be popular in other yelp reviews for the table. The small minced pieces of lamb were paired perfectly with rich and velvety hummus and soft and thick pita bread. The potatoes bravas added a homey comfort as we also shared that at the table. I got the ciabatta toast with guacamole and it was nice, heavy in a good way, and a healthy way to start my morning. Service was excellent! I thought it would be slow reading the other Yelp reviews but as they are a new restaurant and working on their perks- they may be getting better! A great visit.

wow...I havent had a dining experience this bad in a long time...it was awful.  I felt like I was being punked!Walked in and stood at the front and watched at least 5 servers walk by me without acknowledgement.  Finally got the attention of the host and got seated.Its LOUD in here, which is fine.  The other thing is...its FREEZING in here because they dont have a revolving door and they dont have one of those little tents to block the door...so every time anyone walked in or out, a cold gust of wind rushed in.  We were all the way in the back of the restaurant and I could still feel the wind every time.I know, I am being picky, but this place was so bad, I just have to say everything.The service...although our server was really nice, he was not good.  Extremely slow.We went for brunch.  This is a Mediterranean cuisine right???  Nothing on the brunch menu remotely resembled any medi place I have ever been too.  They had american, spanish, just about everything else...nothing said Mediterranean.  Complete disconnect.They only had decaf lattes...this is brunch correct??We ordered a ton of food.Fries to start.  Massive plate.  Nothing wrong here.  Just took 20 mins to get the app plate.No one came and offered more coffee, more drinks, nothing.After an hour...we finally received our food...Burger that we had requested a side salad.  No salad.  10 more mins to get the salad.Omelette no cheese.  There was cheese on it and it had literally been under the warming lamps for at least 15 mins because I saw it sitting up there as I was getting hangry.  The crispy potatoes were the same as the fries.  There was no lettuces like the menu described.  Sent it back to remake and it literally took them 22 mins to get scrambled eggs back to me.  I got to eat alone because everyone had finished their food by the time my sad plate came out.Pan con tomate.  Good but it was missing the jamon...after about 10mins, they brought a few slices to place on top.Seasonal fruit with ricotta and honey.  The seasonal fruit..was not seasonal.  The ricotta tasted very sour.  Grapefruit was juicy.  Very ok.Bacon.  Sad, shishy, soggy pieces that looked like they should have been cooked at least 5 mins longer.  Sent back immediately and didnt want a replacement.French Toast.  Just forgotten.  When we mentioned it...they said it would be right up.  15 mins later we got it and it was very mediocre.This place is a complete disaster.  The crazy thing was that it wasnt even that busy in there!  I saw at least 2-3 open tables the entire time we were there.The GM did come over and profusely apologize.They did end up comping a bunch...but still so awful.  After they dropped the check, we then had to flag someone down to actually take our credit cards to pay.2hours and 15 mins had passed.When I got home, I ordered delivery because brunch was so bad and I was still starving!

Came here for drinks around 5 on Saturday. The waitress was very attentive and helpful, but the cocktails were very mediocre. They were also out of one of the cocktails we wanted to try. You can only get certain beers upstairs as well. We did enjoy the lamb/hummus/fresh pita plate though. Those pitas were so fresh and delicious. The drinks left a lot to be desired though.

Had a girls' brunch at Bernie's this past weekend, and it was probably the most disappointing meal I've had in quite some time.BL&S has been on our lists for a long time. So, we all decided to give it a go this past Sunday. We met for brunch, had reservations, and were excited about the prospects.The excitement quickly turned to frustration, as the meal was truly just a comedy of errors.I'll start with some good: the restaurant has a great atmosphere. I loved the open kitchen in the back, the hip industrial-ish interior, the bar. That's where the good ends, unfortunately.Our waiter was kind, albeit a little slow. The four of us ordered a smattering of everything on the menu, which I thought was kind of limited, and the folly began.Drinks came out fast, but they were not--for the duration of the two hours we sat there--replenished. 90 minutes in, we had to stop someone and ask for more coffee/refills on our cocktails.My wife ordered a latte, but she was told that only decaf lattes were available that day.We ordered fries, which were plentiful and came out relatively quickly.Then, we waited nearly an hour for the rest of our food, growing hungry and impatient. There were lots of staff in the wings, but there didn't seem to be much attention being paid to the tables.We saw tables seated after us get their food. And we waited.Finally, food started coming. First, we got my friend's omelet, which she ordered without cheese. It had cheese. She sent it back and it wouldn't reappear for 25 minutes, despite our asking about it numerous times.I should mention that the omelet had sat under the plate warmer for a good 10+ minutes, which the runner admitted, flippantly.We got the bacon. It was limp, room temperature, and super fatty. Sent it back.We got the fruit and whipped ricotta, based on the waiter's recommendation, and the fruit was far from prime. Unripe pineapple. Citrus.We got the burger, which my friend asked to be served on a salad. The waiter even repeated and confirmed her request. It wasn't served on--or with--a salad. They corrected that pretty quickly.We got the tomato bread with cheese and ham. It came out without ham. "Doesn't this have serrano ham on it?" I asked the manager who'd begun trying to troubleshoot our order. "Oh yeah, let me get you some!" She replied. Minutes later, she brought ham on a plate.We got the French toast, which they forgot to bring and which arrived 10 minutes after all of the other food. It was room temperature, too.The general manager finally arrived at the end of our meal, and he was very apologetic. At that point, though, so many things had gone wrong--and without much graciousness or acknowledgement from the other staff--that our brunch was spoiled, and we were all convinced we wouldn't be back.I have to say, the most disappointing factor was that, even once all of the food arrived--and was corrected--it was underwhelming. At the end of the folly and waiting, I wish we would have at least been rewarded with a delicious meal.In all fairness, they did end up comping a good portion of our meal, but we still paid around $60 for what was essentially a wasted 2 hours, and we left hungry.I hate to write such a bad review of a new-ish place, but our experience was truly packed-full of just about every single thing that could have possibly gone wrong.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but the interior is beautiful and this place has a roof deckFood:Oysters - delicious and best dish on the menuShrimp and grits - very goodOmelette with cheese and potatoes on the side - goodPan tomate - okTorrija - delicious

You know what'd be better than happy hour at Bernie's? An entire weekend at Bernie's!! This place, though. Insert heart emoji here.We walked in @ 5:15 on a beautiful, sunny, 65 degree Thursday evening. It was empty inside and I mean EMPTY. I asked for a table for two in the patio and they said all the tables upstairs were reserved but they had space @ the upstairs bar. I decided to give it a go. The hostess took me up there. There were like 10 open tables and no seats at the bar. I then asked the server, "umm, ALL of these tables are for reservations?" She said yes. Dumbfounded, I was like, wtf? and agreed to go back downstairs to sit and eat in a completely empty restaurant. But the relentless Cuban b*tch in me wasn't going to give up that easily!I opened up my OpenTable app and saw that there was a 5:30 reso available. I booked that ish with the quickness and walked back up to the server. I told her that I now had a reservation and that I'm requesting to sit at one of the tables on the patio. She laughed at my slick move. Lol. I get what I want! This pissed me off because I know damn well they could have seated before I made the OpenTable reso. But the reviews are so good here that I was determined.Okay, now to the important stuff:DRINKS - white sangria: MUST. best I've ever had, hands down. And for $5 (during HH) I sipped on quite a few that night! Great deal.FOOD - lamb hummus: DO IT. that bread alone is superb.Pan con tomate: PASS. Not bad just nothing extraordinary.Chicken: WOW. rarely and I mean RARELY do I order poultry @ a pricey restaurant. I feel like poultry is for pu**ies in these instances. But their chicken, man, oh man!  WOW. just wow. MUST ORDER. So juicy and flavorful - the only way this girl eats her meat bruhaha (insert dirty joke here).Service was slow as we had a server-in training. Pain in the butt but I felt bad for her so I gave her the benefit of the doubt.Crowd was awesome! I would say mostly everyone here (during HH at least) were in their 30s or 40s, looking to relieve work-related stress, in business attire. I loved that it was a sophisticated, older crowd. No 21 year olds welcome. Ha.In short, just go! Get that damn chicken thigh in your mouth STAT.

Loved the space. Rooftop accommodations are hard to beat as the seating was very comfortable and large decorous bar is a piece of art in itself. I made my own salad, it was fresh and tasty. Great place for a date or large groups of people.

We came here for their brunch menu and everything was phenomenal.Loving the rooftop space but I'm not a fan of the sun so that was kinda bad.We got two special cocktails and both of them were really good, frozen Pisco something as I remembered correctly.The food: Really good food, and shareable. We got the French Toast, Croque Madame and Lamb Hashwi.Definitely a good spot for all occasions. Kids friendly too!

It's funny.  I drive down Orleans all the time and never really noticed this building.  What did it used to be?  Was it even there?  It would have to have been . . .it's old.  Oh yeah.  I know.  At one time it was a strip club and most recently it was a photography studio painted all black like it wanted to just disappear.Well those days are gone cuz Bernie's Lunch and Supper is there now, painted white and shouting "Look at me . . .look at me"!! And with the cute interior and fabulous roof top, you should do more than look, you need to stop in and enjoy some friendly service, very good food and people from the neighborhood who are clearly thrilled that Bernies is in town.I brought a gang of 10 for brunch so we had the opportunity to try most of the brunch menu as well as some of their fabulous crafted cocktails.  I sat at the bar to wait for the group and had a spicy Bloody Mary which was rich in horseradish and packed a wallop.The brunch menu has a good mixture of breakfast and lunch options.  If you order nothing else, order the maple sticky bun.  I am still drooling for that thing which we cut up into tiny pieces to share with my inner voice screaming the whole time, "It's mine . . .It's mine"!The winners at our table seemed to be the fried egg sandwich with avocado and parmesan, the croque madame (although there was a little too much sauce on mine), the burger, the eggs benedict and the torrija (a take on fresh toast but better!).  Each is served with a salad  and each is a very good sized portion.The specialty cocktails all come with cute names (so cute I can't remember any of them or was it because I had too many of them?  Hmmmm ), and we sat at the bar after brunch to catch up while the guys watched the game on the TV that was there.The ambiance is light with huge factory style windows letting in plenty of natural light.  And the open kitchen in the back as well as all the little touches (like the belt buckles on the bar shelving) let me know that there was a ton of thought that went into building Bernie's.Parking on this side of Orleans is always easy so if you drive you should be able to find street parking.  And I'm hopeful that they have a vestibule on order as we were seated by the door on a perfect Indian Summer day, but I would hate to be in that same seat in January!  And the prices are reasonable, brunch with drinks ran about $30 a person.Now if I could only get my car to stop trying to turn into Bernies to get another one of those maple sticky buns . . . . . . .hmmm . . . .I see a parking spot.  Perhaps I'll just stop in just this once.
Excellent brunch. Great atmosphere, the lamb hashwi was a great starter and the shrimp and grits were phenomenal

After reading all the rave reviews posted by a few of my favorite bloggers, I suggested Bernie's for brunch a few weeks ago. I made a noon reservation for Sunday brunch for two friends and I. I arrived late, but my friends were seated, and had already chatted with our waiter. When I arrived, he came back to the table and took our drink orders--we all ordered coffee. Our waiter was friendly and excited that it was our first time visiting the restaurant. He told us a lot about the sister restaurant, Gus's Chicken, which I thought was funny since we weren't dining there, but alas, back to Bernie's.I ordered the Croque Madame, and though I'd never had one (at least not one that was memorable), I figured I couldn't go wrong, as I like all the ingredients. My friends had the egg sandwich and the wedge salad. When my dish arrived, I was a bit overwhelmed by the amount of gruyere that was melted on top of the sandwich. It was drowning in a cheese sauce and though it didn't make the sourdough bread soggy, it was just too much.My friend enjoyed her salad, but my friend who ordered the egg sandwich was also a bit overwhelmed in how to eat it, as it was so large. He ended up taking it apart and eating it with a fork, but he seemed to enjoy it.What was perhaps the most concerning was the amount of time that we had to wait after we'd received our orders. Our water glasses were empty and our coffees were cold before our waiter ever returned to our table. I understand that we weren't the only table he was taking care of, but it was a bit unnecessary to have to wait as long as we did.Overall, I would go back to Bernie's and get something entirely different at brunch, and I'd even try dinner there, as many items on the menu sounded good. I'd just suggest easy on the sauce for the Croque, cheaper coffee, and more attentive service.

Bernie's is awesome! They have, what I consider the best Happy Hours (from 4 to 7) in River North. I uploaded a photo of the menu. The food is different and outstanding. Order the Lamb Hashwi. It's like Hummus on steroids....or steroids (in the form of delicious lamb) on Hummus! Their rooftop patio is big and offers outstanding views of the city. The patio is partially covered so it can also be enjoyed even if the weather is less than great. Bernie's location is in the heart of River North, so it is definitely a popular spot. The patio fills up fast, so get there early if you want a seat.

Had dinner there last week and really LOVED the flavorfully innovative deliciousness our meal was!We had a reservation, called before arriving to confirm whether they have a wait and they said no come on over.  We like 5 min walk away and when we got there we did have to wait for 30 minutes which was quite off putting.  If it was not for this, I would give them 5 stars.  The food was 5 stars though and once we were seated, service was incredible!Some items we found very tasty & memorable....Pickled Mussels - small but creative and very flavourful!Beet Salad was not the generic trendy beets and burrata we all have everywhere we go...they have a nice spin on it and it was very tasty!Pea Falafel - so fun and tasty and large....everything about it was delish!The skate was like a schnitzel...too dry and fried.  They did say they are testing out that item as it was just added to the menu that week.Patatas Bravas - yummy potato goodness....good item to get!Gnudi - rich and tastyLooking forward to returning here as we are very happy to have such a tasty spot in our hood! They are a Michigan based brand that is a fab addition to our 'hood!

Great rooftop bar and during happy hour, lots of drink and good specials. Had a few $5 Moscow mules and enjoyed the atmosphere. We didn't order food because we had dinner reservations later that evening but I could definitely see myself going back there for some Pan con tomate and a few mules.

This is not Girl and the Goat. Bernie's Lunch and Supper does not play around with a dozen fancy ingredients to make some new and innovative combination of flavors. Instead, chef Zack Sklar's relatively compact menu offers simple, delicious food - executed perfectly.Example: the roasted chicken with patatas bravas was perfection. Chicken was ridiculous tender and juicy, the potatoes were crispy on the outside with a very tasty tomato sauce.I don't want to talk about the ambience (which is lively), nor the staff (which was friendly and helpful), nor the the cocktail list (which was excellent). I just want to implore you to come here to get perfectly executed, deliciously simple food.

Came on a weekday with a group of gals and definitely enjoyed the food and environment at Bernie's. They have great happy hour food & drink specials with everything under $5. The lamb hashwi, which was essentially hummus and lamb schwarma with toasted pita, was a really great app to start with.Other highlights of the menu were:- The sweet potato gnocchi: gahhhhhhh, I am not usually a gnocchi person (low on my list of favorite pastas) but this gnocchi was like eating clouds (and combined with the mushrooms and truffle sauce, DAMN).  Favorite dish of the night.- Veal meatballs: I am always on the quest for the perfect meatball and this one was pretty fantastic. The meat was tender and flavorful and paired with a great red sauce.Our server was pretty cool too and contributed to the overall laid-back vibe of the restaurant. The space is versatile and would be great for friends/parents/bringing your boo out.Would definitely come back to try more of the menu at Bernie's! Oh and they are based out of Detroit too.

I came here on a gorgeous Sunday morning for Brunch with some girlfriends and we had a nice time.To start- the roof deck is killllleeerrrrr! It is so gorgeous upstairs, we could have sat there all day. We were seated at a large 4 top, 3 people to start and then a couple more joined later.We started with mimosas, and we did not receive menus. Our waitress came over and asked us very nicely if we wouldn't mind moving to a smaller table, they had a larger party coming in that would fit better at our table, no problem, we were happy to move. She told us as she helped us move that she would send us a complimentary round of drinks for the trouble, awesome. And the new table was in a better spot, so that was great.Once we moved, it was like we didn't exist. Our drinks never came and our water was empty, we were chatting and didn't notice at first until I looked at my phone and realized it had been 25 minutes since we moved tables and we still didn't have drinks or menus.I went up to the nearest waiter and asked for the manager, they immediately came over and apologized for the error, the waitress told our new server that we were his table, but the new sever forgot we were in his section. Even after this it still took a bit for menus and drinks to arrive. We were a table of girls, we would have already downed about 4 mimosas each at this point, so they delay was a bit costly to them.Our new server was a bit off, not a bad attitude, but just socially awkward. He had a difficult time taking our orders, didn't have any suggestions for us, and he wasn't very fun. Not to be too picky, but come on, it was a sunny day and a table full of girls that want a boozy brunch, have fun with it.Now for the food, it was good, I ordered the fried egg sandwich, the bread was way too greasy, and it was wayyyyyy too hard for an egg sandwich. I couldn't actually take a bite of the sandwich, I had to cut it up because it was so greasy and too hard to bite with out egg splattering all over. Also it was super messy. But the flavors were nice.Overall it was a nice time, we'll def be back for the roof deck, but the experience wasn't great. I think they may be relatively new, so maybe just a few more tries to get it right.

When I was informed that we were meeting at Bernie's for dinner, I hoped to God that we weren't meeting at the sports bar across from Wrigley. Thankfully, we were not.I used to ride the bus by here all the time, last I recall it had been a recording studio for awhile  before it was vacant. They're really transformed the space putting in windows and brightening it up. This place is billed as Mediterranean, but it's not what one typically thinks of as Mediterranean food.We started out with a round of drinks. I enjoyed a tequila cocktail, the Fernweh and later a sangria with my dinner. I didn't like the sangria as much as my cocktail, but it was decent. I will say the cocktail menu is priced on the high side with at least one $18 drink. For our meal, we decided to do a variety of small plates; with one pescatarian and one vegetarian in the group, we made some modifications so that we could all try as much as possible.We ordered the hummus with the lamb on the side, falafel, avocado toast, beets and burrata salad, crudo, cauliflower, and veal meatballs. The best dishes we ate were the hummus,  falafel, meatballs (so I'm told), and cauliflower. The "bread" served with hummus and falafel was delicious; I think we all would've devoured a basket full of the stuff. The crudo was average with the salad and avocado toast being C dishes at best. The avocado toast was bland; a dish I make myself when I've got some avocado I need to use up, I think I do a better job. The common refrains heard while we ate the salad were "where are the beets?" "did we get any burrata?!" For a salad called beets and burrata, both ingredients were noticeably scant. If you're considering this dish, I recommend you pass on it.To finish up our meal, we got two desserts - the bananas foster sundae and the warm cookies with sea salt caramel gelato. Neither dish was perfect, but the cookies/gelato was the stronger of the two. We were warned the sundae was small, but for $8 it was a joke of a portion. I had a small taste and it was good, but again the price was mismatched to the portion. The cookies were an assortment of chocolate chip and peanut butter; we got 6 cookies and our table devoured them with gusto. The peanut butter ones went so fast, I didn't get to taste them. The gelato wasn't great. One of my favorite flavors of gelato and ice cream is a sea salt based one; this lacked the pop of saltiness I've come to expect.Overall, Bernie's is a solid dining experience. It's not a place I'd rave about and say is a must go, but the service was great and they're putting out some solid food and drinks. 3.5 stars

Delicious!!! I went here on a Friday night and I would suggest making a reservation cause it was rather packed. We did make a reservation and were seated right away. I didn't realize that they have happy hour here Monday - Friday from 4:00pm to 7:00pm. We chose to stick to the $5.00 happy hour menu and we left rather full. I would definitely recommend getting the Lamb Hashwi. The pita bread it comes with is AMAZING. We also had the Pan Con Tomate, which was pretty good. I stuck with the $5.00 cocktail libation and the special that night was Sangria. It was delicious although it did have a cinnamon taste to it, but I'm not complaining.

I went to Bernie's for the first time last night and oh my goodness it was wonderful!  When you first walk in the hostesses are nice and the chic decor are impressive to start. It is kind of an upscale industrial chic style.My 2 girlfriends and I were quickly whisked to the elevator and up to the rooftop where we once again were not disappointed.  The view was great and the stringed lights over the tables were beautiful.  We were not there when it was dark, but even at dusk it was an impressive view.Now for the food - yes!  We all ordered the white sangria which was absolutely beautiful.  It was unusual and seemed to have a hint of cinnamon.  Next we decided to order an assortment of items and share. We instructed the helpful waitress to have them sent to the table as they were ready. We started with the avocado & goat cheese toast. The presentation was beautiful and the flavor was spot on.  These were quickly devoured.  Next came the french fries - these thin cut fries didn't look like they'd pack much punch, but the first bite proved us wrong.  They were the perfect texture and full of flavor. Accompanied by ketchup and some kind of aoli - they were good.  Next came the Fattoush salad - this was probably my least favorite item we ordered but not bad by any means just less flavor than the rest.  For our main course we ordered the paella.  It came with full shrimps and delicious muscles. The seafood was cooked to perfection and the rice with the pickled onions and peppers - oh mah goodness - I swear we didn't leave one piece of rice on that pan.  We finished off the meal with warm peanut butter, chocolate cookies and salted caramel gelato.We took a couple pictures of the view and of the 3 of us under the cute Bernie's sign and were on our way.  A wonderful evening over all!  I will be back for sure!

Fantastic space, airy with high ceilings and a big square bar with comfy stools.  Excellent service.But the food!  Fully rounded seasoning, with perfect peaks of flavor, high quality ingredients, and generous portions to sate two hungry guys on a Saturday night.We started with the beef tartare which was exceptional.  Quite possibly the best I've had.  Fresh and highly seasoned served with an impossibly thin but very substantive lavash cracker, the perfect vehicle to convey the tender meaty goodness to my gaping maw.We then had the avocado toast, again generously sized bites and lots of flavor.The roast chicken I can definitely say is the best I've had.  Flavored all the way to the bone (must've been brined) and just cooked through, with no pink to be seen, which resulted in the most tender and juicy meat.  And the patatas bravas were the perfect accompaniment.My friend had the falafel and peas, while solid, surprisingly the least stellar dish of the evening, but tasty nonetheless.Passed on dessert, too stuffed.  But I'll be back for sure!

This was a pleasant surprise for our group. There were a number of great choices. I really recommend the roasted chicken as it was prepared perfectly. The group also tried the Bernie's cheeseburger and it was perfect for the group and it was great to share. The sweet corn was a group favorite as well as the Pan con Tomate, Lamb Hashwi and Falafel & Peas.  The service was awesome and we actually took everyone of the waitress recommendations and were not disappointed. The food was enough for 5 of us to share and I assure you no one left hungry. The drinks were a group favorite with a number of options.  This is a place that I would keep going for the atmosphere and the food and of course the service .  Need a couple of better dessert options! Job well done!!!

Found this place while looking for brunch options in River North and I can't believe I haven't "bumped" into this place before. The food was simply amazing, it's a mix of mediterranean, spanish and french food, their warm pita with hummus and lamb was delicious, decent portion sizes and prices.The restaurant inside is gorgeous, nice decor and ambience and service was superb considering it was a busy Sunday brunch. They had a full bar and the usual brunch coktails (mimosa and bloody mary's). They also have a rooftop which was closed (it was cold outside), will definitely like to check it out some time.

Went here for Happy Hour on Friday. They take reservations so that was great! Unfortunately, their rooftop wasn't open yet... even though it was 70 in Chicago all weekend. Seriously disappointing.We were seated right away. We had to ask for the Happy Hour Menu, which seemed odd. The Draft Cocktail is a sangria. Super flavorful and delicious! I switched over to the Cocktail of the Day which was a Smirnoff Moscow Mule and it tasted like water. Disappointing. The beer choices are really cheap for Happy Hour.We also tried the Lamb Hashwi, which tasted like hummus with ground meat. The pita/bread that it came with was the highlight. Also really enjoyed the Pan Con Tomate. Fries were pretty average.Overall, great Happy Hour specials. Great vibes! Decent service. Just wish they'd open up their rooftop already!

It's got a few rough spots, but the food is great.During happy hour, the bar and kitchen can really get backed up, even on a "slow" weekday. Come with an expectation that it'll take a bit longer than you want. That is also because the happy hour deals are killer. You should basically order one of each food item and be quite happy.The food really kills it. Roasted oysters, the much-touted lamb hummus, and a minimally reviewed tomato bread are all perfect foils to the modern cocktail. On the other hand, the drinks vary. The draft sangria was delightful and punchy. The cocktails off the regular menu just lacked the strength of flavor I'd hoped for.Service is also reasonable. When said backed up bartender realized he'd messed up an order, he had the courtesy to comp a drink. They're clearly trying.Overall, I'd give it a shot again.

Been here twice for brunch now and I just love the food!!The lox & warm pita are not to be missed. And also you think yogurt & warm quinoa is boring? Wrong. For $8 you can't go wrong here.Toasts are awesome - really enjoyed the pan y tomate. More so than the avocado toast but that's because the avocado toast at The Winchester is my high bar and this did not beat that.Ive tried the egg sandwich and the corque madame - both winners.Service the second time I went kind of sucked. The guy was new and seemingly nervous. Lost our credit cards at one point but oh well, he found them again.

Ended up here on a total fluke waiting for another spot to open for the night.They were only serving drinks cuz we caught them at that nap time between lunch and dinner service, but that was perfect. I had a drink with beet, gin and rosemary and it was absolutely killer. I loved it.They had a daily special on for drinks too and I had one of those, also really good.I wanna say their happy hour menu started at like 4 or something and we ended up getting a couple of things which were all good as well. I think this is definitely a sleeper spot and I'd love to check it out again.

I am so sad to be writing this review. I visited Bernie's twice in one week- the first with family and the second with friends.The first time, the service was sub par. I went with a group, made a reservation on the roof, and arrived on time. We were promptly escorted up (which was great!) but we were disappointed when our waitress knew absolutely nothing about the menu. They were out of the wine we chose and the beer one of us chose, and it took 45 minutes (we timed it) to get our final wine selection.For some reason, I came back.This time, we made a reservation with friends. It took ONE HOUR AND TWENTY MINUTES to be seated. We were naturally upset, but also understood - they were busy, right? Upon asking for the manager, and sharing our story in hopes of something (anything!), he shared no resolutions or sincere apologies. So much so, that one point, I said, "so pretty much were shit out of luck?" And he said "yes."I am so disappointed because I love the food and drinks, but this was ridiculous. I will not be back.

I really like this place, and I really hope they're still working the kinks out because it would be a shame to not go back because of the issues we've had everything we've gone.I've been to happy hour twice since it opened. The happy hour menu is fantastic: $5 for tons of drink options and food, and lasts til 7, AND on a gorgeous rooftop. What more could you want? BUT both times, getting up to the roof has been a nightmare! They claim to be at capacity and will only let one person in at a time, even when there are empty tables, and the rooftop is about 50% full.Yesterday we had a friend arrive at 3:30, before happy hour started, to make sure she got us a table for 4. When I showed up at 4:15, it took a lot of explaining and convincing for the hostess to let me upstairs because of "capacity", regardless of my friend literally having 3 empty chairs for us at the table. The rooftop has at least 6 empty tables (I have a picture for proof) and the bar area was barely crowded. When the next of our party showed up, te hostess refused to let her up to our table, and my friend had to go downstairs to talk to them about letting her in. Our final friend showed up around 5, and same thing. When I went downstairs to get her, I got into an argument with the hostess becaus Mage absolutely refused to let her in. WE HAD A TABLE FOR 4! I tried to explain that wthe literally had her empty seat tray and she said something like if they let her up, the Fire Marshall would come. Again, I took a picture to show the empty tables and how not full it was. It took 15 minutes for the nasty, rude, hostess to roll her eyes and finally just let my friend in. I get not letting people in because of the fire code, but don't be rude, especially when you're nowhere near capacity and we've had a table for this exact purpose.Don't even get me started on how long it took to get drinks, and the fact that my friend ordered to well vodka drinks and they used top shelf and charged her for that.Bernies, you're adorable and have great happy hour... Don't ruin it with this ridiculousness.

Had such a fabulous experience at Bernie's! Came here on a whim with two girlfriends on one of the first nice, warm days in the city and was able to score a rooftop table- much due to the help of the lovely staff here- they were so accommodating and seated us as soon as a table was available. The downstairs dining room is lovely, but the roof is where it's at. As far as food goes- it's great! We ate a variety of things, but would definitely recommend the avocado toast and strozzapeti pasta! Both were so delicious. We washed it all down with a bottle (okay, two) of albarino and soaked in the sunshine and people watched! Overall, a great place to add to a list of terrific rooftops and food. Will definitely be returning!

What I liked most about this place is the venue itself. Really such a beautiful space, and especially the bar is such a modern-looking focal point that catches your eye when you first enter. Loved the chairs and seating options for dining tables as well.Service is super friendly and attentive! Very accommodating to special requests and questions.The Brussels sprouts side dish is delicious, and the olives starter is nice to munch on while waiting for your main. The meatballs are amazing, with whipped ricotta on top and a tomato sauce on the bottom , the three meatballs are perfect to share.I had the roast chicken main dish and it was great. Very tender and juicy meat with the skin full of flavor especially za'atar. Yum! And the potatoes that come with the dish are the star of the show. Small whole potatoes that are soft on the inside and crispy on the outside covered with a drizzle of a garlic sauce. Soo good.I would come back here.

Super nice restaurant with good and smile service, delicious food and great atmosphere.The food is Spanish inspired - and therefore super tasty!The drinks are well chosen; and the menu has a nice variety.The restaurant is well located in Chicago city.During summer time, the restaurant offers an amazing terrace on the second floor with a full bar and tables for dinner.I can definitely recommend this place, both for quality and price.

Poor service. Our waitress was Michele, 30 minutes to ask us what we wanted and 30 minutes for a beer. Then she forgot about us and I gave her the benefit of the doubt she was busy but then I saw her and she was just standing around, and then she actually said "oh I forgot about you". That sucks because the rooftop is pretty cool but for that I can just go down the street to Citizen bar. Same thing but more attentive staff and friendly atmosphere.

Overpriced and the food is nothing to write home about. Have been there on several occasions hoping we'd had a one-off experience, but I'm afraid this spot just isn't that hot. Service and decor are great however.

ATMOSPHERE: Fancy diner w/chic booths, unique light fixtures and open kitchenSERVICE: All their servers are donned in old fashioned name-tags with old fashion names which is a cute idea. Our server was friendly and explained the Bernie's concept with excitement.FOOD: I love their Build-Your-Own salad. Our server explained that this is their most popular feature. Their burger rivals Au Cheval's according to my husband.PRICE: $$ is accurate. A bit more expensive than a quick, fast-food joint for lunch but great quality so prices are fair.

Come for happy hour!!!! It lasts until 7pm and the $5 drinks and apps are such an amazing deal. The hummus was so delicious we ordered another serving. The burger is pretty damn good as well. The dessert... Heavenly (brownie that we subbed sea salt gelato for the banana) Can't wait to come back and sit outside.

Ever since it first opened (about two months after moving to Chicago, just down the street), I've been totally hooked on Bernie's. The food, while not having a huge selection, is unbelievably good. Once I found out they started doing happy hour though, it was game over for every other place I had previously had happy hour. Their happy hour prices are beyond reasonable, and they have lamb hashwi (my absolute favorite thing on the menu) for only $5! The staff are some of the friendliest, knowledgeable and most helpful I've ever had in Chicago. In particular, my friends and I LOVE Jordan the bartender. Shes always attentive and super fun to talk to when it's not too busy. 5/5 for Bernie's. Oh also, the rooftop is lit.

I work across the street and unfortunately there are limited sit-down restaurants nearby. I'm pretty sure in order to be employed here you have to be completely miserable with your life. The hostesses are so rude it is baffling- be prepared to feel judged ESPECIALLY when asking to be seated upstairs on the rooftop. The food is good. My go to is usually the "build your own" salad, which consistently comes out lacking a couple of the ingredients I marked off on the checklist. Kind of defeats the purpose of "build your own"....My co-workers and everyone I know in the area agree while this place has good food and a beautiful atmosphere, it is not an enjoyable experience whatsoever.

I have given this place two tries with guests and both times confirmed what the other reviews say - bad service.  The first time we had a nice waitress but the food took a long time to come out and we were served at different times.  The restaurant apologized without us complaining by giving free dessert which was a nice gesture but we ended up being there for longer than what we wanted.  The second visit was my last visit which is a shame because they have a great rooftop.  We had ordered the paella and it was awful.  Very fishy and mushy.  It was bad enough that we couldn't eat it and I sent it back.  I rarely send stuff back but this just couldn't be eaten.  The manager came out and was very passive aggressive and said "it is paella.  Of course it's fishy".  And he walked away with attitude which is good because I was ready to tell him off.  Having studied in Spain in college - no paella is not "fishy" like the paella we had here.  Fresh seafood is not fishy.  So, believe the other reviewers.  Skip this place would be my recommendation.

I live in the neighborhood and I've been meaning to try Bernie's  out for months! Well, I'm here...right now...sitting at the bar and just finished my dinner share with my friend (we were hoping to sit on the roof, but it's not open yet).For starters, the drinks and the rather limited food menu are overpriced. We shared the pasta main coarse ($21) and the scallops ($30). Both portions very small; the scallops had four pieces to the order with a total of (no joke) a full tablespoon of broccoli florets decorated in total on the plate, arranged in super tiny pieces next to each scallop.The ambiance was very loud and difficult to have a conversation...the adult contemporary / 80's music seemed inappropriate and made me feel like I was in a club or bar than a fine(er) dining establishment.I'll consider coming back for brunch and give that a whirl...but, I won't be back for dinner.One good point, the service was great!

This place was outstanding...Went there with a group just after 10 pm. Little late but wanted to check out their patio.The hostess was great, checking in on us and letting us know that the kitchen does close at 11 but we will be able to order and we have nothing to worry about.  Forgot the name of the server but he was awesome also.Ordered the Beef Tartar, Pickled Mussels, Baked oysters,  avocado goat cheese (which worked really well together),  sea bass and burger.  Everything was excellent!!! The short rib PorkBelly burger was unbelievable.Great portion size, great prices.Sold out of Paella,  but defiantly going to have to make a run back there for it.Great Experience!

I'm impressed! In all fairness the only thing that stopped me from a 4 star review was that service was on the slower side, and they weren't busy, and the heirloom tomato salad was not good. I think that had more to do with the flavor combination for me.I liked the meatballs along with the bass, sans the creamed corn. Both dishes were a hit, very well spiced and full of flavor. The drinks were very well made and wow they were easy on the purse! I haven't seen drink prices this low in awhile! Maybe I've been going to the wrong places?The one drink I had was southern decadence, and it came with the option of "on fire," I declined. But there's always next time!

Yeah...this place is awesome.I drove by Bernie's frequently as it was being constructed, and I was extremely intrigued after I saw the amazing looking rooftop. Husband and I tried it this past weekend for brunch and it did not disappoint. I have to say...I feel as if many new restaurants in Chicago seem to go through "growing pains" their first few months of opening....things seem to be a little haywire and unorganized etc...but Bernie's does not seem to have these pains.We had an 11:00 am reservation and as soon as we walked in (first people in the restaurant) everything seemed to be running smoothly. The atmosphere is wonderful...a nice combination of old diner and a trendy brunch spot.  The servers are friendly and the food is yummy. All cocktails are priced at $13. Hmmm...feels a little pricey but I won't hold it against them.I had the Fine Herbs Omelette and my husband+2 in laws had the fried egg sandwich. They pretty much didn't talk to me or anyone else as they finished their sandwiches in a few minutes (it seemed amazing). My omelette was very good but definitely on the simpler side. Not sure I would run there to order the omelette again before trying something else. Thankfully, there are many things on the menu I want to/need to try!The atmosphere is definitely the thing that stands our most about this place...it's so cool on the inside. Makes me want to redecorate my house Bernie-style. I can't wait to try it again for dinner or cocktails.

What a gem. I've walked by this place numerous times and finally got to try it out. We ordered items from the HH and regular menu. We had to ask for the HH menu which made it seem like they tried hiding it. I learned about it b/c i browsed through their website the night before. The HH menu was outstanding. There were 5 dish choices; we got the roasted oysters, olives, and pan con tomate (bread with cheese). Cocktail of the day was a vodka mix, so we opted for cocktails from their reg menu since we were feeling fancy. My friend got the Komorebi - a Japanese whiskey drink. It was blended very well and so refreshing. I got the Vorfreude - a gin based drink with a number of ingredients; it was delicious and also refreshing. Every Yelp review praised the Lamb Hashwi, so we went with that even though we were wary of the lamb. We don't like the gamey taste that normally comes with it. Now that i think of it, the dish was also on the HH menu so we must've had a brain fart for not realizing it, but i'm not sure why our server didn't point that out and charge the HH price instead. Note: everything was $5 on the HH menu. The portions are smaller, but still enough. For instance, there's 3 pieces of oysters vs. 6 on the reg menu. The amount of food was just right for two. Flavors were robust and food was finger smacking good!Warning: i really wanted to give this place 5 stars for the food and cocktails. But, not being forthcoming about the HH menu was a turnoff and not pointing out the dish we ordered was also on the HH menu is poor service. Keep in mind you may need to ask for the HH menu or they'll let it slide. I think that's just bad business/service ethics.

I have mixed feelings about this place. I went with a big group and tried a handful of dishes and they were hit or miss. Some were really good but others were just weird.The good:- SWEET POTATO GNOCCHI: This dish was the highlight of the meal. The mushrooms were really well cooked and went great with the truffle and sweet potato. Very truffly. Mmm mmm.- LAMB HASHWI: This dish comes with pita bread that you dip in hummus and a lamb mash. Super good. But also didn't go well with the other dishes we ordered. This place is supposed to be Mediterranean inspired but this was the only dish I had that tasted at all Mediterranean.The not so good:- ROASTED OYSTERS: Topping roasted oysters with a mushy chorizo sauce kind of defeats the purpose of roasting them at all. Texture was very bizarre.- BRUSSEL SPROUTS: These had so much potential to be great but were just WAY to sweet.The way that our waiter paced our meal sort of bothered me. We ordered a handful of small plates, medium plates, and sides to share and nearly all of the dishes came out at once. It was overwhelming and made it hard to enjoy each dish individually.From an ambiance perspective, this place nails it. Gorgeous interior. High vaulted ceilings with retro lighting fixtures. Very cute.Would maybe come back. And only order the dishes that i know are good. But am in no rush to do so.

Everything about Bernie's is absolutely perfect. The food is thoughtful, the bartenders care (My bias leans towards Jordan as best bartender of all time but even that title may not be enough), the venue looks nice without being pretentious, the rooftop has an amazing view without being too far from the loop. Hell, if that rooftop were open in the winter I'd be at that place 24/7.

We came here for dinner on a Tuesday night. Clancy our waiter was very friendly and provided us with great service. We ordered the veal meatballs and the falafel plate. The food was delicious however the reason I'm giving this place a 3.5/5 stars is because of the prices. We paid $18 for a normal falafel plate. Again the food was good just a bit overpriced.
