Parking can be difficult in this neighborhood with all the other businesses and restaurants in the area.  I had heard good things about Toast and this location so I had an opportunity to check this place out before going on the Vienna Beef hot dog tour.We went on a weekday morning so it wasn't that busy inside except for a few single visitors and a couple of moms with their kids in strollers.  The decor is pretty simple and plenty of vintage toasters.  The Julius Meinl coffee is decent except for the presentation that you get from the original cafes.  We ordered the pancake orgy, an order of huevos chorizo and cheddar, along with a standard breakfast of eggs bacon potatoes and toast.  The breakfast items were pretty standard and none of them really stood out.  I expected more from the pancakes and they sort of blended into each other with the individual components not sticking out on its own.  The portions were good and service was good since it wasn't that busy.  But the key for me was that I never felt like this place would be worth it to stand in line for or drive around to find a parking space when there are so many similar places around the city.  If you're here on a weekday, then stop on in.  But it's not a stand out for any particular items or the environment.

When I passed by Blackwood and saw a sign indicating they have a new chopped salad option, I immediately began investigating. I don't do BBQ sandwiches for lunch, because I would definitely nap the afternoon away at my desk...When I went at 12:30 on a Friday, the line was to the door, but it moved very quickly. Like Chipotle, Blackwood's got it down. I ordered the pulled chicken chopped salad, and boy was it good. You can choose your toppings (I got all of them), and those croutons! Amazing. Everything was fresh, and the chicken was tender.I will be back again, and it's great to have another salad option to work into my rotation.

Chipotle rears it's head again. This time it's with barbecue.Pulled chicken with Kansas City style barbecue sauce. Elotes. Salted caramel root beer.As I mentioned, there is the Chipotle style method of ordering. Barbecue is something that should never be rushed. However, I think that formula is to cater to the downtown lunch crowd. Move 'em in, move 'em out.The pulled chicken was tender and moist. The sauce did nothing to enhance the chicken. The sauce was more of a drizzle. The elotes was the equivalent of cold corn salad. The salted caramel root beer scored points.I would have to return and try the brisket and baked beans. I've seen a few positive statements about the brisket. For the Near West Loop district, Blackwood BBQ isn't a bad option for something quick.

Feeling adventurous and tried something new today. Came at about 12:15 and the line wasn't too long. There was plenty of seats insides and outside.Should have got the pulled pork, but opted for the pulled chicken platter with Chicago sauce as a last minute decision. Eh. Not my best meal. The chicken was tender but the sauce didn't do it enough justice for me. The sauce could have been just a little thicker for me as it seemed kind of watery. The flavors I did get from the sauce were pretty decent though. I was hoping to find sauce along the tables somewhere but they are only behind the counter from what I could tell. Didn't feel like having to wait in line for some more sauce so I just ate it as it came.Had the Mac and cheese as a side and it was pretty good. There was a crunchy outer crust and the inside was really gooey  and cheesy. No complaints there!The portion sizes were pretty good. I even had some as leftover.Overall, a decent place. Would came back but not for the pulled chicken.

I'm a Rhode Islander, so I might not be a world authority on BBQ (We don't have much). I do know one thing though: Blackwood BBQ was super tasty. Service is done assembly-line style: pick your base (platter, sandwich, salad), pick your meat, and pick your side(s), drinks, and pay. Fast, friendly, and fresh.I had the brisket platter with some mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is served in it's own little foil dish with ample amounts of crispy cheese to seal in the gooey cheesy macaroni within. As for the brisket, it was the best I've had so far. You get your choice of fatty cuts or lean cuts of brisket and there's plenty of it. The chicago style sauce was tasty too; well balanced with sweet and heat.I liked the choice of craft sodas too, always a plus! I'll be thinking about coming back here until I get to finally make it back.

Wanted to try something new for lunch nearby work and decided on here. And I would definitely order from here again! I don't usually eat BBQ (shame!) so this was a treat. Pulled pork platter was my choice and couldn't decide on just 1 side so I ordered three. 3 Cheese Mac, Apple Slaw & Beans were all so delicious and right portions (for me, after all the pork). I'm lucky to have this place near work, although that could be bad for the good ol' waistline. Totally worth it! Ordered online, fast service. Thanks!!!

My favorite BBQ is a tie between what my mom makes or what I make. I have yet to find my BBQ holy grail but I'm trying! The reviews here were so good that I wanted to give it a shot.I will admit I'm in love with the mac and cheese and the corn muffin. The mac was perfectly crispy on top and oooey gooey, cheesy on the bottom. The muffin was damn good. No explanation necessary. If my reviews were based off these two items alone it'd be a five, but it's not.I've never had brisket before today and I was feeling adventurous. I told the guy I was a first timer and he gave me a nice explanation of everything. He recommended the brisket "half and half." He slices through the middle of the brisket cuts a chunk out then places it on top of an end piece. This way I get to try some dry meat and some fattier pieces, which he says have different flavors. Whatever the flavors, I wasn't feeling them.The Chicago sauce also didn't help. It just tasted like some high fructose, processed sauce. I usually make my sauce from scratch so I know the difference.The reviewer who compared this to a BBQ Chipotle is spot on. I was surprised by how "chain restaurant" it felt. Not to hate on that but it makes a difference.I seriously might come back for that Mac & cheese though.
Place is on point ! I've eaten BBQ from all over the world and it's great as well as the sides. Staff was warm and friendly as well. Even got some to take home for later.

I live in the area and have yet to really get used to the fact that restaurants on Clinton Street operate on a 9-5(ish) schedule. So while there is a plethora of places to eat, it's rare I actually get the opportunity to try them.I decided to head into Blackwood BBQ for lunch one day I was home, and was blown away by how delicious it was! I was not expecting the quality of ingredients to be as they were - very fresh veggies, home cooked baked beans and macaroni, and boastful about their antibiotic and horomone-free meats! Love, love, love!The menu is very limited, but that's okay - 'cause you're there for just what they have - some meats, and some to be expected sides of pickles, mac 'n cheese, corn bread... You get the idea.I opted for my favorite of the BBQ meats family - pulled pork - which is slow roasted dry, so you have the opportunity to pick your sauce. They have probably close to a dozen different sauces for you to try, all categorized by region and briefly described on the menu - I loved this! I'm a vinegar lover, so the fact that I could actually choose a Carolina sauce full of tang, over the sweet style that Memphis has to offer was awesome! (They even have a Chicago sauce, which according to my boyfriend is slightly sweet and spicy). Your sandwich will come with house made pickles (YUM), all other sides are additional. My eyes were larger than my stomach on this particular day, not to mention I'm a sucker for baked beans, so I decided to get a side of them - they were good, but honestly I was so full just from my sandwich and pickles, I could only have a taste of them or I would've blown up.Price fits the quality and portions of the food, and despite coming for lunch and given its location, service was super fast, efficient and friendly!

If you have read my other reviews, you know I am a jerk. But for lunch I am more of a barbecue person. This place is perfect for BBQ.  Beans, pickles and sandwiches!! makes me less of a jerk. salad are forget it. go next store.

Decent bbq place to downtown sums this place up.  I would lean towards giving it 3.5 stars if i hadn't followed it up with dinner at Green St Smoked Meats.The brisket here was so smooth it falls apart in your hands. Pretty good flavor and smoke.The baked beans were also pretty good with some brisket and maybe pork mixed in.Great overall service and experience.  The interior is a bit tiny, but gets the job done.

We just tried the Clinton store for the first time.  Absolutely no parking but good if you live or work in the area.  Clean with an ok staff.  Friendly enough but a little scary looking.  The employees that is.Portions were a little small. Taste was excellent.  I got a combo brisket and pulled pork platter with extra Chicago sauce.  The mac and cheese is some of the best I've ever had and so is the cornbread muffin.My friend basically said the same thing about the pulled chicken with North Carolina sauce.Will definitely return.

Delicious!!!!! I ordered the beef brisket platter throughgrubhub.com. the food was delicious, I thought the brisket was very tender and they give you a very large portion that will fill you up. It comes with a side of your choice and pickles, I decided to go with the three cheese macaroni. I would recommend this place each platter is about $8.50. The staff and atmosphere was very friendly when I went to pick up my dinner. The only downfall about the place is there is absolutely no parking.

This place is awesome. The Beef Brisket is so juicy and no signs of being dry. I would recommend that if you go during lunch time, try to get there early or the line is super long. I have no complaints about this place whatsoever!Make sure you try the different sauces too! Yummy!!!!!
My company catered from here, and OMG....Im HOOKED on their chicken salad. Everything is fresh!

This location is nice and new and has lots of seating, even a little bit of outdoor seating. I had the pulled pork platter with a side of coleslaw and I chose the North Carolina sauce because I love sour/tangy stuff. The meat was awesome. The coleslaw was okay. It seemed healthy at least and wasn't too creamy. Next time I will try the Chicago sauce since the North Carolina sauce didn't really blow me away. The meat, however, was great for bbq near the loop. I would come back to try the brisket.

Never heard of this place was in the area for a training walked by and went it. It's a different type of bbq restaurant that I'm used too. I had the beef brisket sandwich with the Chicago sauce. Delicious plan on going back today for lunch .Very limited seating which was a disappointment because it was a beautiful day too nice to be inside an office.Great place to grab a bite.

Got the beef brisket platter with Chicago sauce, 3 cheese Mac side, and additional  creamy apple coleslaw side. They have us complimentary honey cheddar cornbread because it was our first time. Everything was delicious! My favorites were the BBQ, coleslaw, and corn bread.

I am not a huge barbecue person, but I really enjoy Blackwood BBQ here in the West Loop! You get to choose among three meats (chicken, pork and beef) prepared three different ways (sandwich, salad, platter), as well as regional sauces to top it off.My go-to is the beef brisket sandwich with the North Carolina sauce (tangy and not too heavy/overwhelming). My friend really enjoyed her pulled pork sandwich with the Chicago sauce. We split mac and cheese and corn bread. The mac and cheese was great; love the crispy top. The corn bread was so-so, but I'm not a corn bread fan to begin with.It gets a little crowed inside, so be prepared to either take your food back to the office or become "that person" who stands over a table until the occupants are done.
The Brisket was smoked perfectly and had amazing flavor.  Definitely a go-to BBQ spot in Chicago.

Great BBQ! It's assembly style, which is a good way to get a quick lunch. I ordered the brisket salad with everything on it and it was delicious. The staff were very helpful and gave me four different containers of sauce when I wasn't sure which to try. The brisket was a little bit fatty, but otherwise good. And the corn muffins were incredible. I'd definitely go back.

We stopped into Blackwood BBQ for lunch and enjoyed our meal.Décor: It's a BBQ place so there isn't much going on, it's all business. There's enough room for a decent line to for and they prepare your food right in front of you as you move toward the register. There are a handful of tables and even a few "bar" seats at the front window. Everything has a BBQ feel to it, with wood tables and metal hardware, and it's a very relaxing atmoshphere.Bathroom: unknownStaff: Everyone was very friendly and they prepared our food very quickly, they keep the line moving!Food: We each had the Brisket Platter (with mac 'n cheese) and a different sauce: Chicago (tasty) and Kansas City (more of a hot sauce consistency but definitely more heat), and a bowl of the Brisket Chili (very tasty!). Additionally I had a bottled lemonade, which was enjoyable. The serving size is quite good and I left feeling full (but not stuffed).Value: The prices are great, given the serving sizes!This is a great lunch spot and one I will certainly remember for the future for lunch (although, Green Street Meats is still king of BBQ).

The food is decent but the portion sizes are tiny and the prices are high. It also gets crowded during lunch hour.I don't like that they don't have extra sauce for you to dispense. They only sauce you get is what the person behind the counter puts on your food. My guy gave me half a squirt and called it good.Overall my experience was just 'Meh'

So first off....you have never been here!?!?Omgosh, you don't know what you have been missing.The staff is very friendly. If you have never been there before, they make sure to announce it but also help you make a decision if you aren't sure of what to get. They have different sauces for the person that likes spicy or sweet. You can also mix them if you are feeling adventurous. I usually get the sandwich and I never forget the mac and cheese with a cornbread. It's BBQ so of course it will be messy but they give you wipes too.They have a ton of seating as well. So, if you haven't gone....what are you waiting for?!?!?!?

I tried the brisket and the pulled pork plate. I really enjoyed the food, however the portions were small and they did not put much bbq sauce.  I also did not like that I did not have complete control over the sauces.  You have to order the sauces when they prepare your plate. I wish they had the sauces available for you to dispense as much as you wanted.  The Mac and cheese and slaw were really good as well.

Just had the best BBQ I've had (so far) in Chicago. It's (un)surprisingly difficult to find good BBQ in this city (and the suburbs). We stopped by after a day at Shedd (on the way back to the train). It was about 4:30 pm and not busy at all. We ordered the brisket and scored some burnt ends with it as well, also ordered mac n' cheese, and a honey cheddar muffin. We tried the Chicago and KC style sauces.Brisket (5 out of 5)- $9.99 - This brisket was delicious. The sliced brisket had the nicest smoke ring I've seen on brisket in a long time. The meat was well seasoned and didn't even need the sauce (so we minimized our use of it since it was our least favorite thing we tasted here).Mac n' cheese (5 out of 5) - under $2 - This stuff was very rich, but also very delicious. It even has gruyere cheese in it! Impressed that the sides were as good as the bbq since often sides are an afterthought (or taste so).Honey Cheddar Corn Muffin (5 out 5) - under $2 - This muffin had nice flavor, was moist, and actually had corn in it! It was a nice compliment to the rest of the meal.They serve an interesting pickle, bean, and onion "salad" with the meal. This was interesting too, good, but I was too stuffed to eat much of it.The staff were very friendly too. Great experience, we will be back!

My coworkers and I frequently order from this location.  We usually get the pulled pork platter, and have tried several of the different sauces.The North Carolina vinegar style and the Memphis sweet sauce are my favorites. The vinegar sauce is just strong enough for a delightful refreshing taste, while the sweet sauce is also quite a treat.Their Mac n cheese is great also, definitely my favorite side.This place always delivers on time as well, usually well ahead of the promised timeframe. We will continue to order on a weekly basis.I can't wait to visit their other locations, including the one on Belmont in Lakeview, close to my home.

They were running out of brisket, but the pork was fantastic. I had a sandwich with Kansas City BBQ. Definitely some spice to it, but it was even and not overwhelming. I also had a side of beans, which are tasty as well.  I am happy with the choice in coming here.

Surprisingly good BBQ in downtown Chicago!I got the brisket platter with Kansas City sauce, and a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is sooo good, and comes served in a little cup with cheese and breadcrumbs baked on top. Would seriously consider coming back here and ordering 5 of these Mac and cheese cups as a meal.I wasn't the biggest fan of the Kansas City sauce, and if I were to come back, I'd probably try it with the Chicago sauce. However, the brisket itself was very well cooked, with nice marbling of fat and lean. I also really appreciate that they ask you if you prefer a leaner/fatter/medium cut of brisket. The fatty parts melt in your mouth, and the lean pieces are still extremely tender!Definitely try it out for lunch if you work in the area! You can't beat half a pound of brisket and delicious mac and cheese for $10.

I'm from STL, a city that prides itself on BBQ and I am here to tell you that Blackwood's brisket puts our BBQ joints to shame. It was the most flavorful and tender brisket I have ever experienced. It was so tender, I was able to cut it into bite size pieces with a plastic fork.One thing that I also liked about Blackwood is that they only offer; brisket, pulled pork and pulled chicken. They do three things and do them well. My co-diners, both gave thumbs up to the pulled meats.I am more of a dry rub and natural seasonings man, but I did try the Chicago Sauce. I figured, it was only appropriate since I was in Chicago. Their description was spot on, it is just the right balance of sweet and heat. We all ordered Cole Slaw, which had a sweet tangy taste, making it a good accompaniment to our meat selections. Wish I could have persuaded them to each order either the baked beans or mac-n-cheese. I would have loved to see how they were prepared. Oh well, I'll just have to order them myself on the next visit.Sorry for no pictures of the great food, it was a short lunch break during a training class and I wanted to EAT.

Blackwood, you have redeemed yourself. The secret's out, and EVERYONE comes here for lunch now. Your staff is friendly and quick, the lines get long (but they move fast, so I'm not complaining), your place is clean, and your prices are still very fair. Not to mention the little outdoor oasis you've created with tables and umbrellas to sit under. Five stars for that! I still get my usual pulled pork with Memphis sauce and the mac and cheese. It's still phenomenal. And your brisket is just amazing. I can tell it's been smoked for hours when I eat it. Hats off to Blackwood, king of Barbecue in the West Loop!

Very good. I love me some BBQ. I was skeptical. But, I was wrong. Great BBQ, said sides and the line moves quickly. The above applies to all their locations. I'm a fan. Why 3 stars? Simple, you can't order by the pound. Everything is either a sandwich a platter or whatever. What if I just want meat? No dice, I'm afraid. A key element of legit BBQ is your ability to purchase by the pound. Get on it Blackwood! As soon as you do, this is a 4 star review.

Finger-licking good!! Had the brisket sandwich. Meat was tender and juicy. I asked them to add onions to the sandwich and had the Chicago and Kansas City style sauces added. The combination of the sauces, onions, and delicious brisket were good enough to have me back. Cost me around $9.60 just for the sandwich, but was worth every penny. I will be back!!!

Underwhelming and over-priced.  This is a "BBQ"-version of Chipotle/Roti, but unlike these other establishments, Blackwood's quantity is way-lacking, and the food's flavor profile is nothing special.  But my biggest gripe here is the staff - they were not engaging at all, incredibly curt, and unfriendly.  I understand the job is not glamorous, but to have an entire line of food servers (roughly five or six people) staring back at you with frowns on their faces is off-putting.I'm pretty sure I won't be returning.

Had the brisket and pulled chicken and both were amazing. I like their take on coleslaw since I dont like heavy mayonnaise-y versions.  Have been here several times and will probably return when I'm walking that way. No parking ANYWHERE so it's a pain to get to unless you walk there.  Note: The portions are small for the price but definitely worth trying.

I'm a big fan of BBQ & wanted brisket, so I came here to give it a try.Arrived at 2:45pm, after the lunch rush & was told they were out of brisket.  Settled for pulled pork, very good, but not what I had my heart set on.  Tried their Memphis Sauce, very good as well!  Ordered a side of beans, was told they were out of them also....very disappointed.

My dad and I ate here the other day while staying in Chicago. We went around 5 pm and there were only like 3 other people in there. We got the pulled pork and the brisket with Chicago style sauce. Both with Mac and cheese and a free cornbread since it was our first time eating there. You can choose how much fat you want on the brisket. Both the brisket and pulled pork was delicious! The brisket melts in your mouth and has great char/smoke ring. The Mac and cheese is really tasty also. I wish we had this in Madison.

Stopped in here with a buddy who knows one of the cooks. Dillon was really awesome, talked to me about the different styles of BBQ, methods of cooking, and even showed me one of their cook machines. Really awesome. The brisket was the best brisket I think I have ever had. Absolutely amazing. A new favorite.

Was craving some BBQ over the lunch hour. When I walked in, I balked at the sight of the long line, but never fear! The Blackwood team was incredibly efficient and the line moved very quickly and orderly. Consider me impressed!I had the pulled pork sandwich with Kansas City-style sauce and the mac and cheese. Having spent a fair amount of time in Kansas City, I was initially skeptical of their offerings, but Blackwood pulled through on flavor! I was glad to hear I'll have a KC-style sandwich just around the corner if I ever get hit with the craving again.Ample seating, efficient staff, and a good tasting sandwich. Definitely would recommend.

It's very good for properly cooked (smoked) meats. Just like any proper bbq restaurant down south, the meat is the main attraction. The SC and NC sauces were solid. The meat was moist so very little sauce was needed...or wanted. The cole slaw tried too hard and had too unfamiliar of a taste to be enjoyed. The corn elote was delicious. This place is perfect for a lower key, delicious meal in the downtown area.

Plenty to like, but some stingy practices prevent it from being 5 stars.Positives:Delicious brisket and the ability to choose lean, normal or fatty is great. Delicious pepper and smoke flavor, tender meat and a good pairing with the KC sauce (spicy). The cornbread was a good texture, not overly moist but enough that it wasn't breaking apart.Negatives:Weighing the meat. Good for the accountant, and while I didn't think I was underserved by any means, it doesn't give you a good impression as mentioned in other reviews. I don't like that the sauce is only on the line and not available at the table or at least by the fountain. I like drenching my sides in sauce or trying different ones with each bite.I'd definitely come back, but will probably continue trying new places before making a second trip.

The brisket was great and literally fell to pieces as we ate.We also had the beans and corn bread. We had not had food so sinfully delicious in a long time. My only regret is that i am from Detroit and we don't have this restaurant in our town.The staff was super helpful in selecting cuts of meat. They also let is taste all of theor sauces when we were trying to make up our minds. They never rushed us or became impatient.I would so make another trip to Chicago just for this food.

My first visit and I will be back.  The brocket sandwich with home made coleslaw was amazing! There was a little wait when you walked in but well worth it.Keep up the great work, stay consistent and we will continue to come back.If you love Mac and cheese and corn bread please try theirs. You won't regret it!

Beef brisket platter with mac n cheese and cole slaw.  EXCELLENT.  I did not care for the Chicago BBQ sauce but need to return to try the other ones.  My coworker went and picked it up so I didn't get opportunity to use other than Chicago, which i ordered.  Excellent food.  I wish BBQ places would be a LITTLE less expensive and a little more liberal with their sides.  Pretty small for the price.  But overall a great place.

I stopped in with a buddy for lunch, and we both enjoyed our meals.  We both got the beef brisket; I got the sandwich and he got the platter.  The brisket is really tender, and on that soft bun, it's even better.  I just wish I had more.  They could pile a little more meat on the sandwich, and it doesn't come with any sides.  Needless to say, it didn't take me that long to scarf it down.  They don't skimp on the salad though so that's definitely worth a try.The service was fast and friendly, and of course, the food was fantastic.  I'm definitely coming back.

Hidden gem in the loop. Went here for lunch based up yelp reviews and craving good bbq. Mentioned 1st time customer and received free corn bread. I ordered brisket and pulled pork. Meats had good flavor to them, though I was disappointed on the portion of them. The seller for me was chicago style BBQ sauce. It was very good and flavorful with the taste of old style in it. I sampled all the sauces and I would also recommend the south Carolina mustard (esp with the brisket) and Memphis style. Mac and cheese was decent and my second favorite item was the homemade sweet tea....I'd go back for that alone. Overall very nice atmosphere, food is good;wish the portions were a little bigger, and staff was very friendly I would recommend Blackwood to my friends and family as I would visit again. I also purchased thier chicago style BBQ sauce for home.

First time here and already my favorite!!!!So get this: they are a BBQ spot and they offer beef brisket or pulled chicken!!!!I'm on a crazy diet so I asked about the brisket and she told me they have a lean version!! Yes please!!!You can have it as a platter with a side or over salad which is what I chose.When I asked how they prepare it--- they SLOW SMOKE it for 11 HOURS!!!!!! And then finish it off omggggg the flavor is amazing.Know how I know? Because I didn't add any BBQ sauce. Due to my crazy diet, I can't have any sugars so I just had it as is, smoked, plain and it's amazing.I am super excited to come back here daily.Great friendly patient service, good quality, filling.  And price?? Only $6.99!!Love.

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the brisket on the salad I had at Blackwood. It was extremely tender, flavorful and not the least bit dry. The price won't break the bank and the portion size was ideal.As much as I wanted to, I didn't try the sides my co-diners raved about the Mac and cheese and cornbread.If you're tired of the usual offerings give Blackwood BBQ a try.
Awesome BBQ, I love this place. Great everytime! The service is awesome and I love the beef brisket. Must have!

Let me tell you, this place is the TRUTH!! Every time I go, I get a pulled pork sandwich with a mixture of Chicago and Kansas City sauces. I literally could eat this just about every day! And that Mac & Cheese they make?! To DIE for!! The service is friendly for the most part. Have not had any major issue at this restaurant that I could think of. Definitely a meat eaters paradise. They are pretty pricey though for the portions you get, no lie.

OMG Delicious!! Great food, great price and wonderful friendly staff.  Super clean environment, simple, homemade foods and sauces, make for "clean eating" in the heart of Chicago.I had the beef brisket platter with Chicago style sauce, beans, corn bread, pickles and coleslaw. Every bite was to die for!!  And they have excellent, sturdy take out containers.  It traveled by foot two miles to Millennium Park without spilling a drop!The price of the meal is minimal for both quality and portion.

I use to work here and continue to come to eat the food! Everything is made from scratch and tastes amazing! It is very hard to get good BBQ in the loop that is not fake or processed, but this place is perfect when you have a taste for some.

As the BBQ scene starts to heat up in Chicago thia is exactly what a lunch BBQ spot should be. Pulled pork and brisket sandwiches are great. Good array of sauces to accompany great meats. Mac and cheese is the best I've had in this city. Was skeptical at first but each time I visit I feel it gets better. Overall this is a great BBQ lunch spot with a line that's always out the door. Be patient. Trust me..

Seriously my favorite place for lunch!  I'd seen this place for a while, walked by numerous times, checked out the menu online on several occasions, but just thought, meh and always went somewhere else for my cheat lunch every week.  One day I went to Epic, which is just down the street because who doesn't love a burger, right?  I walked in and the place was packed...not a seat in sight.  I looked over the menu, hemmed and hawed and walked out the door.  Ok, so now what?  Where do I go for my fat-girl cheat lunch?  I was like, okay fine, I guess I'll finally go try Blackwood.  All I can say is...HOLY CRAP!  I've been to Blackwood for my cheat lunch every week for the last four weeks.  I can't stop!  I've had the pulled pork with Memphis sauce three times and I gave the chicken with Memphis sauce a whirl once as well.  I can't even express how much I love this place.  As for the sides, I've tried the mac and cheese (of course), the cornbread and the baked beans.  I've done the baked beans twice.  All were really good!  The mac and cheese was a little dry for me, but it did have good flavor.  Everyone raves about the brisket.  I have yet to try it, but I will.  It's just hard for me to pass up the pork!  I would eat here every day if my waistline could handle it (it can't so I don't).  I also plan to try a couple of the other different BBQ sauces they have, but again, I like the Memphis so I have a hard time deviating.  Hey, I like what I like!I've been told the line can get pretty long around lunch time.  I usually go around 1 pm so I avoid anything too crazy, but they say the line moves very quickly so don't be deterred by a long line.  You won't regret the wait!I'm so glad I finally tried this place!  It's so damn good.  Go here...today!  I think I probably will.

In a mad dash to find something quick to eat so I could get back to work I stumbled upon Blackwood  bbq... I was a little disappointed when I walked inside and I saw they really only have sandwiches.  I was in the mood for some ribs!  But I was on a time frame so I decided to go ahead and order.The 3 meat choices Blackwood  bbq offers are brisket, pulled pork, and pulled chicken. I went for the brisket. You can either order a salad with your meat choice inside, a platter which is basically the meat in a pile without the bun #Fail, or just get the damn sandwich. I'm all about my carbs so I got the sandwich #IAintNoSkinnyB*tchThe side choices were coleslaw (I HATE coleslaw. I would rather eat a sh*t sandwich!! Nothing against backwood! I hate coleslaw!) baked beans, or Mac -N- Cheese. I went for the Mac. I told the workers it was my first time at Blackwood bbq so they gave me a free corn muffin.When you pick out your meat you also pick out a sauce- they have a North Carolina, South Carolina, Kansas, a couple others, and then a mustard sauce. I went for the mustard. Not sure what made me do that, but it was pretty good! The Mac -N- cheese was really good. I was actually quite shocked by that because I usually don't like anyone's Mac -N- cheese.  It was really good. Like my whole group of coworkers loved the Mac -N- cheese!  I didn't really care for the corn muffin. I didn't like the bits of corn inside. I think it was a texture thing for me.Later Gators!!

I was so happy when I found this place. I was first introduced to their food at my office since they catered here. I loved everything. The cole slaw is amazing, the mac and cheese so creamy and rich, the meat cooked just right. I decided to get lunch from there and whoa. First of all, the meals are relatively cheap and the portions are decent. I was surprised to learn their lunch platter also comes with a pickle salad- its now my favorite part of the meal, except a little too much onion. It also comes with one more side of your choice and anything beyond that is only about a dollar or so more.

Love Blackwood BBQ! I live in the south and can easily say this is some of my favorite BBQ in the country. I always get some when I'm in Chicago. Always get the brisket with a side of mac and cheese. The cornbread is good too just avoid getting the slaw as a side.
Damn good brisket! Get it with the slaw. Add the extra 1/4lbs. South Carolina mustard sauce. Add cornbread. Less than $20! And the staff were the best!

Absolutely wonderful. Had the beef brisket sandwich with Memphis sauce, pickles, side of Mac and cheese and sweet tea. Good lord, I wanted to lick that container but I was good and will save my licking for a more intimate setting.
If your in the loop, this place has great bbq.  The brisket is tender and lean and the price is good.

Went at 11:30 and walked right up to the counter. I got the pulled pork salad with Memphis bbq sauce and everything on it. So good!! Also got the brisket chili. It was really good but made my meal expensive so I'll skip that next time. The salad is filling enough!

The best comfort food I have found in the city! First of all, the meat is always done perfectly and is fresh from the grill, you can even see them chopping/pulling new pieces as you go through the line. They have a choice of sauce for everyone - my favorite is the Memphis because it's not very spicy, but a little sweet with a BBQ kick. The beans are housemade and super yummy, and the mac and cheese is good, but is taken to the next level with a crispy crust baked on top. Last, but definitely not least, THE CORNBREAD. It's soo good - real corn and just the right amount of cheese baked in. YUM!If all the food isn't enough reason to love it, I can get a platter (meat, sauce, side) for $8 in about 5 minutes max. (Since the line moves in a Chipotle-esque style, there is almost no wait, even during the lunch rush.)HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

This place being only 5 minutes from Union Station, I stopped in and grabbed some BBQ to eat on the train. Service was quick and friendly. Very reasonably priced! I got the combo platter to sample all the meats and a couple sides.All the meats were juicy and flavorful. The real bonus here is the variety of authentic sauces, including both Carolina styles (vinegar and mustard based).The coleslaw was spicy and original (a good thing), and the beans were a hybrid of Texas style with a hint of sweetness. I normally don't like Texas style beans, but these wee exceptional with chunks of meat.The ambience is a bit too polished for me; it feels like Chipotle. BBQ needs a more "down home" environment. What this place loses in style points are made up for in the good food.Would visit again whenever I'm taking the train!

The hubs convinced me to do BBQ for breakfast. Odd? Perhaps. Amazing? Yes.Blackwood has a few locations and is set up like a Chipotle, but for being a "chain-like" restaurant, they have a reasonably priced and tasty b-fast bowl with eggs, taters and your choice of meat. Of course, I always have to try the pulled pork. Happy to report it was delish at 8am! They have 5 or so sauces and after testing them, I ended up mixing Memphis with North Carolina and it was perfect!

This is an outstanding place to eat if you are hungry for Barbeque.  They have Chicken, Pulled Pork, and Beef Brisket, in a choice of salad, sandwich or platter.  And the sides are very tasty.  The food is prepared in the style of Chipotle where the ingredients are added to your meal the way you want them - very nice.The one distration I will comment on is that they have a phone order and on-line order business, too, where they will insert the on-line orders into the sequence and it may confuse you, the customer, and you have to be patient with them.  At Chipotle, I believe they do this in the back in a completely separate operation.  Blackwood ought to consider doing this, too, since they have a great business in the front with their in-person customers.  As long as you don't let this get to you, the food is great, the people serving are great, and the prices are reasonable.I really recommend this place and I know you will be happy if you like Barbeque.  Eat well and prosper.

I rated this 4 stars and it could easily move to 5 stars.  I will definitely be eating here more often and trying the different meats and sauces.Simple menu with a choice of three meats, five sauces and four sides.Three types of meats:  Brisket (regular or lean), pulled pork and pulled chicken.Five types of sauces: Chicago (Sweet and Heat), Memphis (Sweet and Thick), Kansas (Rich and Spicy), North Carolina (Vinegar Based) and South Carolina (Mustard Style).Four sides:  Baked Beans, Cole Slaw, Cornbread and Mac n' Cheese.We got there early and luckily missed a long line.  As we were eating we saw the line move very quickly though.  Even though the line still moved, there were not open tables which had people standing around or taking the food to go.This is the type of place you order at the counter, get your food and pay.  The folks at the counter were informative, patient and quick.Price wasn't too bad but I probably would have paid a little more for a bigger helping of the meat.We all ended up getting brisket, some regular and some lean.  Everyone's dishes were delicious and moist.  The regular versions had nice bark and plenty of it.  The lean portions were nicely sliced and again, delicious.  The baked beans had pulled pork in them and got thumbs up from those eating them.  Creamy style coleslaw was also good.  Cornbread was good but could have used some butter.  Most people felt the side dishes, for what they were costing them should be bigger.Biggest disappointment was that they put the sauce on the food for you when you were ordering.  It would have been much better to allow the people to self serve on the sauces.  This allows them to put exactly the amount they want on the food.  It also gives them the ability to taste the different variety of sauces. They need to rethink this and put some sauces over by the drink area.

My boss told me that a buddy of his was an investor in this restaurant, so naturally he recommended this place as a good place to go for lunch one day. Took a few co workers and set off to eat here during our lunch hour. Ended up getting a pulled pork platter with Mac & Cheese with Kansas City style sauce on the side.The pork was nice and juicy; the spiciness of the sauce added flavor to the platter. It helped that the server laid it on really thick. The side dish was basic Mac & cheese but with breadcrumbs on top; dish was still pretty awesome. The only complaint I had about it was that it was too small of a portion for what I paid for it.The place wasn't a formal restaurant; still it was a good use of space for it's location. Wait staff was excellent & prep time was quick. Wouldn't mind stopping by to try other dishes on the menu.

Great BBQ, 4.5 stars.   I shaved 1/2 of a star because they are always cheapskates with the BBQ sauce.   It's such a cheap add on and it completes the meal...why always be light???   You guys have a great product, just give customers what they want; more sauce.

I've been a few more times since my original review.  My opinion hasn't waivered much, but I my original rating may have been a little harsh.  The salad is the best & most fulfilling option in my opinion.  Reasonable side servings would greatly improve this place.

If you visit Blackwood BBQ consider the following tips:1. Order the brisket. While the chicken and pork are decent the brisket has been cooked to perfection every time I have been here. You can see the juices run out of it as they slice that delicious smoked hunk of meat. So the other meats will simply be a waste of valuable stomach real estate.2. If you get a sandwich have them slice the brisket, not shred it.3. Do not fear the line!  It moves surprisingly quickly.4. If you cannot conquer your fear of the line either order online (1 hour lead time requested) or come before/after the lunch rush.I am clearly a fan of this establishment but I am only giving it 4/5 stars for the following reasons:1. Hours - they close at 3PM which means I can't stop here on my way to Union to grab dinner for my wife and I.2. Their take on BBQ from around the country is misleading.  The difference in BBQ  is more than what type of sauce you put on your meat, it is in the rub and use of other ingredients.  You could also argue that some of the sauces are not representative of the region, particularly the Kansas City.3. They can be stingy with how much sauce they give you.

Coming from the south, I like to think that I know a thing or two about BBQ. This place was recommended by a friend and it didn't disappoint. It's set up like a fast order style restaurant. You order at the counter and they put it together in front of you. Although their menu isn't huge, the food was very good. I had a pulled port sandwich with some Chicago and menu style sauces, baked mac n cheese, and corn bread. Everything was very good. Highly recommend it. The service was great too. Fast and friendly! They also have freshly brewed sweet tea which reminded me of the south. Definitely give this a try!

Delicious, very reasonably priced food in the west loop (and they have another location in the loop). Don't be intimidated by the long line out the door... It goes very fast! I got the pulled pork salad with beans, tomatoes, carrots and corn with the Kansas City Style sauce (had a nice kick to it). Hands down better than any Chipotle salad I've ever had.
Great bbq place.  Very flavorful and tender.  I recommend.  Today i went for the first time and will go in future.

I believe this place is just about as good as it can get for a chain.  I work down the street, and find myself drawn in once a week.  The staff is always friendly, the line moves quick, and the food is good.  There is nothing here to blow anyone's mind, but for a quick lunch option, it is about as good as it gets for me.
Backwoods  breakfast is amazing!!!!! I wish that i could  have breakfast there every morning.

This was the best pulled pork & beef brisket I've had, hands down!!!!! Macaroni & corn bread is awesome too. Great staff, clean restaurant. Too bad it has limited hours, I crave this in the evening! I definitely take the trip downtown for this flavorful meal!

One of my go to spots for lunch in the west loop. Line moves fast and efficent and works are always friendly. Brisket is my favorite and the pulled pork is solid as well. Have tried all the sauces the north Carolina is good and the chicago i love as well. South Carolina had too much mustard for me its the only one i dont really care for. Corn muffins and mac and cheese are both good and a deal for a buck extra

Fast food bbq I did not believe it. But everyday there's a line out the door so I decided to try it. As much as I hate lines this one moved quickly. In no time at all I was at the front and then back out the door with my food. And real food not processed junk like McDonald's. Food is great!!! You get either beef pork or chicken and choose your sauce and side. All for 7.99 that can't be beat. I got the spicy sauce but I think it could of been spicier.  Other than that everything g was great. So great I'm there about 2-3 a week

Ordered for a small group at the office (five people). Not only was the food delicious, but the service was excellent. We asked for "assorted sauce" on the side and they included a WHOLE BOX with a big bottle of each of their sauces. Really went above and beyond - will definitely be going back

My brisket was tender, and mac was tasty. Chicago sauce had a decent flavor but too salty. One may suggest I get less sauce, but that would make my meat too dry for me. The prices must have gone up recently as I didn't get the pricing that other reviewers raved about. Brisket, pickle, small portion of mac for $9.99...okay but not great. Overall I would give about 3.5 stars.

Do you ever want something so badly you know you won't sleep unless you have it? That was my roommate and I at approximately 7:40pm tonight- 20 minutes before Blackwood closes. We called as fast as we could find the number and spoke to Annette - a living saint on this earth - and after a few moments of deliberation with her manager (Norman?) she gave me the best news I would receive today. That beautiful woman told me that they were locking the door at 8, but if I ran real fast she would put an order in for me. I live 15 minutes from Blackwood and I had roughly 12 minutes to get there, but it was a task we were willing to accept. We walked so fast our legs burned, but at exactly 8pm they opened their doors and their hearts to us two hungry girls. Not only did they let us in late and make food later than they needed to for us, but they were incredibly, unbelievably sweet to us about it. They turned the pop machine on, cracked jokes with us (about how much we were sweating (or was that just me?)) and sent us on our way letting us know that they're always happy to get us food- next time when I call she'll remember my name and she won't waste time asking the manager, she'll just start going. It doesn't even stop there. When I got home we realized they gave us an extra side, because they clearly wanted my life to peak tonight.Honestly, I may be obsessed with them. Thank you so much for everything you did for us tonight.Oh, and Blackwood is pretty damn amazing for all you trying to read about food right now. Trust me, I dated a Texan.

Location is perfect since it's downtown. Makes it easy to grab a bite for lunch then be comatose the rest of the afternoon. The mac 'n cheese will change your life. I wish it came in a much bigger serving. I had beef brisket which was good but next time I'm going for pulled pork all the way! Also you can try multiple sauces. The menu is simple and the food is good. I hope they are in business a long time. Judging from the lunch lines out the door, it will be here to stay.

I've walked by this place for a couple of months and finally stopped in for Breakfast.   They only offer one type of breakfast, a breakfast bowl with either pulled pork or beef brisket.  At first I was bummed, but I have to say, after tasting the bowl, it was AMAZING.  Definitely a 5 in flavor.  They have 5 flavors of BBQ sauce and I mixed the Chicago with the Kansas (Spicy).  So good & great pricing.So after having my first visit, I decided to go back the next day for more.  I experienced the same great food with amazing flavor, but this time i noticed something I hadn't the day before.  As they put your food in the to go box, they have a scale and weigh the eggs, the potatoes, the beef as its going in.... It felt a little to me like they were measuring similar to that of weight watchers so I didn't go over my "points".  I understand it may be smart business, but it definitely gave me a bad taste.
Awesome place for lunch! I would have asked for extra sauce on the side if possible. Mac and cheese was great, cornbread was great, pulled pork was awesome!

Blackwood opens their 2nd location and the lines were out the door and half way down the block. Yes they are good but the true reasoning for the long wait was the free lunch they were giving away.This places gives a decent bbq. It is similar to Chipotle or any other build their meal establishment. You pick a meat (pork, beef or chicken), next decide the presentation: platter, salad or sandwich, sauce is next and finally an optional side.This is a great addition to the area. I must add that their brisket is very tender but does however lack a smokey flavor hence the 1 star deduction.Side note: they are open for breakfast and lunch only so go now!
This place is awesome. The bbq chicken salad in my opinion is the best item in the west loop to get for lunch. The staff is awesome and the prices are reasonable.

Awesome place!  Great portions and very fast service.  When you get the brisket, make sure to get the regular, amd not the lean or fatty versions (they ask). 5 sauces to choose from (all are great). Ill definitely be back
Amazing BBQ! Lunch and breakfast are awesome. I can't wait to go back and try all the sauces!

The food is fantastic and the prices are cheap for downtown! My favorite lunch spot. The line can get long, but it moves fast. Would definitely recommend the brisket salad. It is a lot of food and it's delicious!They also have a punch rewards card which will definitely fill up fast for me.
Had the breakfast. It was amazing. I ordered the brisket, eggs, and potatoes with some Chicago sauce. For 3.99 it was very well worth it.

Best tacos in Chicago.From the carne asada to the fish tacos (all are $2.75!!!), you can taste quality in every bite. Really fresh ingredients and oh my god the fish tacos are insane. Get some of that lime and salsa verde on, and I'm set.Not quite the Southern California tacos I was hoping for, but by far, the best tacos I've had since moving to Chicago.Seat yourself (they'll come to you and take your order) and be amazed by how clean the place is - this is no hole in the wall, although it might feel like it since it's on a less crowded street across from McDonald's.I was tempted not to leave this review to keep this a secret, but it's too good not to share!

i give this place a 3.5 stars.. workers here are nice and food comes out quick.. i usually order the atotonilco and al pastor tacos..the atotonilco taco  is steak with like gyro sauce, onions and tomatoes.. its pretty interesting but I like it lol.. the al pastor taco is pretty good too.. nicely flavored...I just wish they serve more then just tacos and tortas..

Damn you Atotonilco! Damn you for being so tasty!Though not the original on 26th Street, this one is closest to me and usually hits the spot after a night of drinking.Service is friendly, but most importantly FAST. Sometimes I wonder how the servers catch someone new come in. But when they do, they put in your order in their tablet, and literally less than 5 minutes later, your food comes out fresh and hot.Their tacos and tortas are FIYAH. And I'm a fan of their horchata and licuados (shakes).My only gripe is that they're cash only.

Nearly every Monday night, my friend and I will take a trip down to Atotonilco for some amazingly cheap and delicious Mexican food in the heart of Pilsen.Driving over from UIC with some necessary cash in our hands, we come and grab tacos, tortas, and horchatas on the go. The design and layout is simple. You walk in, order your meal at a counter, and dine in or out. Tacos here are $2.75 while tortas are $5.My favorite order so far has been their Milanesa torta. Now I love my street tortas from LA and Mexico, so how does Atotonilco compare to those spots? Pretty damn high! My torta had a crispy slab of milanesa with plenty of avocado, shredded lettuce, onions, and salsa. I loved every bite of this and can't wait to come back for more!The service here is very friendly and understanding too. One time, they accidentally skipped over my friend's order, but were kind enough to add in an extra taco as an apology. They're the real deal here.To top it off, there is a dedicated parking structure right next door just for you.

Yummy tacos, nice atmosphere... Not much else to say. I wish they had more on the menu. They only serve tacos, tortas, and fruit smoothies. It was pretty cool that the waiter took our orders with an iPad, but this place only takes cash... Weird! Which is why it took me 2 tries to go to this place because the first time I didn't have cash. It's a great place for a quick bite to eat, the service is very fast; but they don't serve chips and salsa!!!!

Rosa J. has had enough with the "north-side" Chicago inflations on tacos, tortas, and menudo.  Therefore, she and hubby voyaged down to the south side.  Taqueria Atotonilco was bookmarked based on a Pilsen co-worker's recommendation.This place is very ideal for a quick lunch, snack, or dinner.  Cash is the only acceptable form of payment.  However, an ATM, with a sub-charge of $2.50, is available if your cash has been unjustifiably taken by the CTA Ventra machine.I would like to introduce you "Taqueria Atotonilco" in a PowerPoint format:Slide #1: menuIt's simple.  Tacos and tortas are the main staples, with menudo (fines de semana).  Grande-sized menudo costs $6.50 (as of 09/20/2015).  Most tacos cost around $2.50; most tortas cost approximately $5.00.  Horchata, Jamaica, and jugos are also available.Slide #2: speed of serviceIt's fast for both dine-in and take-out orders.  My bowl of grande menudo was delivered to our table within three (3) minutes, so was hubby's torta de aguacate.Slide #3: pros- delicious complimentary pickled veggies- affordable ($15 and some change for both of us)- clean facility and comfortable atmosphere- free parking for customers in their lot adjacent to the taqueria- accessible via CTA bus #60 (Blue Island/ 26th. St.)Slide #4: cons- cash only (doesn't bother us)I know there are other locations of Taqueria Atotonilco in the city and suburbs.  My experience with this Pilsen location was very positive.
Great Carne Asada Tacos..I've been to a couple places in the area but this will hands down be my favorite! I will def come back!
Best pilsen taco spot. They have delicious flavor combinations in their tacos and fresh ingredients. I recommend their fish taco and the atotonilco taco. Make sure to bring cash.

Great tacos: Steak, ground beef, chicken, and goat. I like that you can watch everything being prepared in the kitchen which sits in the front of the restaurant. A plus: They serve carrot juice, something I've never seen in a taco restaurant before. Convenient place to eat if you're working late at BLUE1647. Worth a visit.

BEST TACOS OUTSIDE OF UR MAMAS KITCHEN. My favs are the barbacoa & carne asada. As good as Little Village (26th St) location...dare I say better! Be warned, CASH ONLY - NO CARDS, They have an ATM; limited menu, tacos & tortas best.Great small, no frills taco spot with razor sharp eats that always leave you yearning for mas.  YOU WILL GET ADDICTED TO THESE TACOS & TORTAS.

Really terrific tacos, nice & fresh prepared very well and served hot but may be lacking some salsa kick?They don't do chips and salsa here which I'm cool with, but I think I'll still keep searching for Chicago's best taco. It was hard to tell the difference between Carne Asada and my Al Pastor which should be a no brainer.Excellent juice and the place was super clean. I'll go back and give it another try.

My family lived in Chicago Lawn neighborhood on the South Side of Chicago for some years, so we would visit the other Atotonilco on Kedzie & 57th growing up.  Now that I live closer to downtown and haven't had Atotonilco in a while, we decided to come to this come to this location for a family meal while we were all reunited in Chicago.  There were 8 of us but this location is spacious and was able to easily accommodate us.  It's CA$H ONLY, but there is an ATM.We were given two tubs of the Mexican-style Hot Pickled Carrots, Onions, and Peppers before we ordered. I wish more Taquerias would offer this w/o asking.  Our extremely nice server took our order on a tablet (I didn't know they were this high-tech yet no do not accept Credit Cards) and you basically had two options: tacos or tortas; or both.I have such fond memories of the tortas at Atotonilco since that's what they do well.  Growing up, my dad would bring us to Atotonilco at least 3 times a week and he would always order the Lengua Torta with a Papaya Milkshake so this place was bringing back some memories. The smell and atmosphere was exactly like the original Atotonilco we grew up going to.We ordered a bunch of tacos, a bunch of tortas, a bunch of milkshakes and everything looked and tasted exactly as I remembered.  The bread is unique to Atotonilco and even their avocado still has the distinct flavor and creaminess that you only get here.  Atotonilco on 57th was where I actually tried avocado for the first time 20+ years ago.  Their milkshakes are also what they're known for and are made to order.The one standout was the Atotonilco Taco (special steak).  I've never had it before and it was almost like a taco/gyro mashup.  It included a creamy queso fresco/sour cream/tzatziki sauce with onion and tomato.  These are the exact same components of gyro except they use steak for the meat and a tortilla instead of the pita.  It was delicious and unique.Not only was the food extremely fresh and delicious, it came out within a minute.  I mean, it was blazing fast.  The tablet ordering process helps expedite the orders so if you're in rush, this is your place.  Even if you're not in a rush, this is your place for some perfectly prepared tacos, tortas and milkshakes.  I am thankful for this Pilsen location closer to me now - it's like I'm permanently reunited with another family member.

oh-m-blank-gee. this place is a total gem.their horchata is killer, almost tastes like a milkshake. its distinctive to any other horchata i've ever had ever.everything is made right in front of you and it comes out quick. i have gotten all types of tacos from atotonilco lengua, cabeza, carne asada, and my absolute freaking favorite, al pastor. the al pastor taco and torta take the cake. i mean it takes the cake. so good. they mix carne asada and al pastor (pork) and throw on some sort of chile salsa. it is o-m-blank-g good! anytime someone wants to go her it is an instant yes from me.my sister in law came in town and it was the first place we ate. and also the second place we ate. so bomb.--borland out--

first off I'm gonna start by saying these are the best tacos you'll ever have. seriously. I mean it. the price for tortas is unbeatable plus they're freaking huge. I have dreams about the chocolate liquados. pricey, yes. worth it? absolutely. it's unlike anything I've ever had.. the only downside I have to say about this place is they don't have chips and salsa complimentary like most taquerias do. but don't let that steer you away from this Mexican goodness

I ordered a taco al pastor but it seemed more like a carnitas taco. It was simple and dry, there was no sauciness, tanginess, cilantro, hints of pineapple or onions. Perhaps this is a version I've never had or my order got mixed up.$3 for such a small portion was also disappointing.I felt gypped.

Goodness knows I'm one of those white folks that can't properly pronounce the name of this place, but that didn't stop me from my taco quest. I had a late lunch here on Saturday afternoon. First off, CASH ONLY, but there is an ATM inside. You can seat yourself anywhere available. The menu is posted in several places along the walls. Your choices are tacos or tortas. No burritos, no quesadillas, no enchiladas, no rice and beans, no entrees. Tacos, or tortas. Easy enough then to decide what you want.I tried the al pastor, the goat, and the atotonilco special. The special comes with steak, onion, and tomato, and was tender and flavorful. Both the goat and the al pastor are served in a slightly spicy red sauce, and tender meat chunks. Honestly I could not tell which was the goat and which was the pastor, which I guess was ok flavor wise, but I like to be able to distinguish what I'm eating typically, especially with a goat taco that is less common among the neighborhood taquerias.They also have milkshakes, which I did not try on this visit, but come in several fruit flavors like melon, banana, canteloupe, etc.Service was quick and efficient, place was clean, prices were decent. Nothing outstanding or terrible either way.
This is my go to spot for Tortas  $5.00 can't beat it!! Al pastor great here and they have awesome smoothies

So-so tacos here. I like my al pastor spicy, tangy, and tender, and this was none of those. Don't get me wrong, I still ate it, but I've had better.The juice is delicious!I can't believe they don't have chips here, though. WHY?!The worst part is, our server was just so rude. He was hostile and very short with us the entire time. It's ok to smile at your customers!
This place is in a sea of Mexican restaurants. There's a lo to choose from over here.Taco's are tasty...but CASH ONLY.

Best. Tacos. Period.....I have am a huge taco fan, and I have to say these were the best tacos I have ever had in my life.  I had steak tacos with no grizzle and full of flavor.Not only was the food excellent, but the place was very clean and they have great customer service. I live in Schaumburg  so it's unfortunate I won't be able to be a frequent customer but I will definitely come back when I am in the area and I will tell my friends.

I grew up eating tacos from Atotonilco. I would usually go to the one on 57th and Kedzie on the south side of Chicago. I love their tacos de lengua, al pastor, and carne asada. After 15 to 20 years of eating their tacos I learned how Atotonilco is one of the real Mexican Restaurants (Taquerías) The way they make their tacos is by simply dipping two corn tortillas in oil and cook them while cooking the meat. I recommend this place for real tacos, tortas, etc.
I love this place. Next time we visit Chicago we won't leave without stopping here for Tacos. Service was excellent, food was ready quick and delicious.

This city boasts hundreds of taquerias representing the best of Mexican cuisine. Yet when it comes to the best tacos in the city, I have to say this place is second to none.A friend from Los Angeles suggested to give it a try. Now, normally I wouldn't take notice of recommendations for tacos. But here's the catch: Californians are infamous for bragging about the unique and special taste of Mexican food in LA. So I knew I had to come give it a try.I am afraid he was right. Their taco al pastor is outright amazing. Their soft, tender meat  melts in your mouth in a delightful sauce that leaves wonders. And their sauce and shells are made to perfection.I have nothing bad to say about this spot. It's simple, small and humble. But it reminds of you of everything that you love about food.A+

AL PASTOR! AL PASTOR! AL PASTOR! Make sure you get the Al Pastor with anything you order. It's the best in Pilsen that I've tried.I ordered one al pastor quesadilla and one carne asada quesadilla, and the Al Pastor was out of this world. As I was waiting for my food, I saw the tortas come out and they looked delicious, I will be getting that next time I come.A lot of the time when I go to Mexican restaurants, workers are normally short with me because I don't speak Spanish and they aren't fluent in English, so I won't ask many questions and will just order. But the lady at the register spoke GREAT English, was VERY nice, and answered all my questions! Thanks nice Lady!

I hate when I order greasy food and then GET greasy food!  THE HORROR!I was kind of jealous when Atotonilco opened up in a nearby suburb.  Then I found out a new one was opening 2 blocks from home.  Jealousy gone!  It came back again briefly when I went in to order a burrito and found out that option wasn't available here.  It's like they knew someone like me would want to add rice to it, so they just veto'd that idea altogether.  That's alright though, they make some pretty solid tacos.I don't remember what I ordered.  I was like a kid in a candy store.  Give me one of those, two of those, one of those, make that three.  You order with the cooks, but the young man behind the counter saw the look of sadness and confusion on my face when he said they have no burritos, so he clearly took my order to save my sanity.  That, and he probably knew I wasn't going to speak spanish.  I only do that when drunk without someone around to do it for me.  Everyone in there was really friendly, and the wait was quick.  No complaints there.When I got home, I took a bite of everything and then promptly put the leftovers in the fridge.  They were just as good later as they were fresh.P.S. - What's a "jelopeno"?
I am Mexican and I love Tacos! This is the place! The tacos de asada with onion and cilantro with the meat well chopped are to die for! And the milkshakes are awesome too! Banana chocolate! Yum

Atotonilco has been doing two things very well for over 40 years: making bomb-ass tacos and frustrating white people that try pronounce their name. "Ah-tone...uh-TONE-tow...wait...toto...whatever bro!"I've been buying their corn tortillas in grocery stores for years, and just recently had food from their taquerias. I've heard they're renown for their al pastor. Not to be confused with my pastor, Al, whom I visit at my Christian congregation regularly. I'm talking about their marinated pork. It's unlike any I've had before. It's spicy, hella flavorful, and as good as advertised. They're also some of the greasiest tacos I've had. So brace yourself.I'm glad this location seemed to open just as I moved to Pilsen. Talk about good timing. If tacos are your thing, think about stoping here. Then, actually do it.

Decided to try this place after the great reviews on yelp! The four stars are seriously too hyped for what this place offers in flavor. I ordered 2 carne asada and 1 alpastor. The carne asada was very bland, lots of fat was left on it and it just didn't taste good. The tortillas were so greasy and hard that all I tasted was the oil. I also got a tamarindo water and it was sour and also tasteless and room temp. The alpastor was not alpastor and it was drenched in sauce but the sauce was good. Would rather much go else where next time .
Sadly disappointed. I was anticipating really good mouth watering tacos, and instead picked at them in hopes that the next bite might magically get better.Glad I tried it, but I won't go back.
Seriously, awesome food. Very fast and courteous service. Clean place. Cash Only.
Great tortas de milanesa.  Ask for the Atotonilco taco special.  Claudia de owner is on hand.  Free Parking is a big plus.  I highly recommend.The best taqueria in Pilsen.

Eek! They don't wear gloves when they prepare food, and I did not see the  employee wash his hands immediately before preparing mine. I realized this AFTER I had already paid. The food is decent, but I won't be returning until they become more sanitary. Also, just FYI, they are "cash only."
I been to different Atotonilcos but so far this is my favorite one, los tacos de asada and las tortas are really good. and the owner is really nice with the customers

I have been curious about this Atotonilco since it opened and finally was able to go there in person (usually my husband carries out) this Saturday.  The place was very clean.  It wasn't crowded at all.  The servers and the waitresses were very friendly and helpful.  We have two young children that we take everywhere we go so I'm always looking for a family friendly place to eat.  We dragged in our red wagon and I thought we would at least get the "look" but they understood and were very welcoming. I love that.  The tacos were delicious.  I tend to stay away from most places because I just cannot eat any grizzle in my taco.  I Can't do it!!!   These tacos de carna asada had absolutely no grizzle, rest assured.  The rice was delicious.  My husband ordered an al pastor torts and could not stop raving about it.  I'm glad they are so close to us! CASH ONLY....I keep forgetting this.

I have to say, with the surplus of Mexican restaurants in the Pilsen neighborhood, it can be difficult to make up your mind on which to choose.  Luckily, I had a friend recommend this place to me after a night out drinking.They have their own parking garage which is nice.  And only a few steps away from the restaurant.  Price for food is reasonable.  Service is solid.  Location is much bigger than what it appears and food... Some of the best tortillas that you will have to compliment the well flavored meat.  Really brings back memories of eating tacos from Mexico as a kid.Only downfall, if there is any, is that it is cash only!
Been going here for years, since I was in high school ( the one on 26th street) and they never fail. The tacos are "thick" with meat and super delicious. Make sure you get a fresa liquado.

Im obviously NOT a fan. Ill go over my entire perspective since I live extremely close and saw it as it went up. It seemed all of Pilsen was buzzed about them opening here. I thought at first it would be nice to try them but after the hype... I was a little eager, Ill admit. When they first opened they had people in taco and jelopeno costumes passing out flyers. Pretty basic, one side said it was a Mexican Restaurant in english and the flip side said it was hiring but in espanol. I got a kick out of that. Why are you giving me that? Plus I saw these costumed people putting flyers in peoples cars behind the windshield wiper WHILE WAITING FOR A RED LIGHT! Yup! Saw it with my own eyes. I couldnt believe how rude that was.So the Tacos... My friend was in from Colorado and I had been bragging about Pilsen and how AMAZING the food was. I first brought him to El Milagro who was closing up so I thought this was the perfect time to try the new joint... enter ATOTONILCO. They are pretty friendly but dont ask what is good there because they obviously have been trained to tell you EVERYTHING is AMAZING! Ya.. okays thanks for the tip. We got steak and goat tacos. I love that the dude at the register made sure we knew that the goat tacos were especially great.So we brought them back to my place and low and behold the goat tacos were all fat. I bought some for my wife and she couldnt find any meat, just fat. It was disgusting. We would of brought them back but it was cold, it was late, and I was entertaining an out of state friend.This place made me feel not only ripped off and lied to but also a bit ashamed of my Pilsen bragging.Ill never go again and I tell everyone my story.

OMG my absolute favorite taco joint in Chicago! Food is always fresh and delicious. Service is amazing. What more can you ask for! Me and my husband live in the west side so it's a drag to have to come out here but it's so worth it. They need to open up another location in the north/west side.

It is the legend!  Brand spankin' new.  Quality control in effect.  The young gentleman who served me most warmly said I ordered the three best tacos: al pastor (natch), birria (here daily), and Atotonilco (house specialty).  Pastor less toothsome than La Villita; the other two we first-time tryouts and failed to disappoint.  It is already clear, despite the profundity of taquerias in the immediate vicinity, that this place is going to honor a fine tradition within the chain and succeed beyond what one could reasonably expect in this neighborhood overflowing with exceptional cuisine.  As I told the young gentleman, I am so happy this joint is here.  ¡Saludate!

Great I love it!I'm used to going to the 26th at location but it's great and convenient that there's actually a closer location.Place is very clean and updated.It kind of sucks that they accept cash only but that's not a deal-breaker and I knew that going into the restaurant.Nonetheless tacos and service are really good which is why I went

The best taco place in the Pilsen area. Pilsen is known for carnitas but they finally get a good taco establishment! The Steak has a good flavor and they make the best licuados aka milkshakes! They are really known for the alpastor tacos. Just meat and tortilla with the flavorful hot sauce. Do you're self a favor the next time you are in the Pilsen area with cash & craving a good taco or torta stop in at Atotonilco you won't be disappointed!

Came here for some late night tacos. I'm new here in Chicago but in NYC, people who prepare food wear gloves. It was disgusting to see this man put meat veggies etc on my tacos with his bare hands. Who knows the last time they were washed? I was really excited to try the tacos but I lost my appetite so there is no rating for the food.

Great food and authentic! Clean space and friendly service. I been here twice and my husband and i are hooked. We have tried  tortas and last night we had tacos, asada, al pastor and lengua. My husband said best tacos he has tried hands down. Cant wait to go back :)

I Normally try different things everytime I go to a restaurant  but I was so pleased with the Pastor Torta, I cannot bring myself to order anything else. I just don't see how it would be possible to like anything more. It does have a kick but the flavor is spot on! I recommend a cantaloupe juice while there also. A yummy sweet end to a solid meal. Best part of all, the price is really cheap for tortas!

Very sad to say I was completely disappointed. Been going to the one on 47th for 25 years. I grew up around the corner. When in the Pilsen area I usually go to el Milagro but noticed this spot just opened. Much pricier than anything in the area and even then the other atotonilco. I ordered a torta and the bread was soggy. The tomato was so thin it wasn't even a slice. It was opaque. Raw Onions, No beans, no sour cream, no nothing . The rice was completely bland no flavor at all. Everyone else said their barbacoa and tacos de asada were not very good and half the meat as other atotonilcos. Guess well stick to the one on 47th.

So excited to see Atotonilco in Pilsen. They just opened. So far great and friendly service. No-nonsense menu. Mainly tacos or tortas. The tacos de "carne asada"have become my new favorite in town. The "al pastor" are fantastic too.

Not a fan of this location, and it's so convenient because I am a local. But I rather take that trip to the one on 26th. Blue islands locations meat is always dry. I asked for salsa verde and salsa Roja... And what i thought they gave me was only Roja... Turned out to be both verde and Roja. The employee said "they both look red but one is green, it's just the way they made it today". Sigh!

I loved this place!  I have gone to almost all of their locations, but this one is cozy, close to us, clean, and open late for those last minute taco cravings.  I am very happy that they also have a parking area just north of their location, where the big sign stands.  Now a days, if you blink, you get a ticket!  The food is fresh, made at the moment.  Their staff is prompt, friendly and the food is delicious.  They are a keeper in Pilsen!

Going to make this simple, really good tacos, Freshly made and fast.  On your first visit I'd suggest you get a couple of regular steak tacos and if you eat pork a couple of  Al Pastor tacos (some of the best in Chicago), these are my go tacos when visiting here.  Everything else is good and authentic as it gets, but most are acquired tastes, that's why I can see why some people on here don't really know what they are getting when they order it and are probably comparing it to what they've gotten before at Chipotle or some other Tex-Mex place and not liking it.  At the end of the day this is a real authentic Mexican taco joint, nice oiled up tortillas with fresh made Quality meat, just like in Mex.
The service is great and the place is clean, but I wouldn't feed those tacos to my dog. Licuados and jugos are amazing though.

A quick stop taco joint. I finally checked out the new location in Pilsen earlier today for lunch and I was very satisfied.  The tacos were very good, meat was seasoned to perfection. The staff was very nice and friendly. I will definitely come back here soon.  The barbacoa was good, picadillo was really good, the asada was my favorite! I wasn't too impressed with the birria but not bad.  I can't wait to go back and try the al pastor and a licuado.
pilsen was in dire need of a good taco joint. Order tacos Al pastor, soooo good. Friendly and speedy staff, soo happy they put an atotonilco in Pilsen.

I'm writing this review based on my experience from back in May, 2014. I placed a large order that included an assortment of tacos. As we were taking the tacos out of the bag, we couldn't tell which ones were the chorizo tacos. Now, chorizo is pretty distinctive. There's no mistaking chorizo for anything but chorizo. Well, not here. We finally figured out that the mystery meat was the chorizo. Oh boy. The other tacos de carne asada were tough and chewy. The tacos de al pastor tasted like the meat was stewed and than fried. I am a lifelong Pilsen resident and I'm just disappointed. The food should be consistently good. I have not returned since then.
Service was fast and the Al Pastor taco was amazing. Will be back to try the Chorizo and Atotonilco.

My friend is a ramen fanatic so I follow her around to all the ramen places in Chicago.The ramen itself is okay, alittle salty and the noodles were very stringy in my opinion, but there are some great and unique options on the menu and definitely more customization for your ramen than most places.I had the crab appetizer - absolutely amazing! Doesn't fill you up and makes you crave more food.The dessert donuts were way too sugary and that's all you tasted, and felt... Sugar. Wouldn't try again.Great atmosphere and a perfect place to go with your friends whenever you're in the area.

Ramen has always been my first choice when it comes to Japanese cuisine. Honestly the ramen dishes that I've had in Chicago are disappointing. Just because "ramen" is Japanese for noodle doesn't mean that it's acceptable to use a random kind of noodle to make ramen. Just like linguine, the Cantonese wonton noodle (oddly the apparent choice for all three Japanese restaurants that I've been to in Chicago) is definitely the wrong choice for ramen. Also the broth should be savory, not just salty.Comments for this particular restaurant: the food looks good, is overpriced, and is really really salty. The decor is way off for a ramen restaurant.
