I'm not a purist and have had many traditional and modern lobster rolls in Maine and elsewhere. There are certainly many in Chicago that put this version to shame. You are better off ordering the Connecticut style if you absolutely have to get a lobster roll here, but it's only going to manage to be acceptable.The reason why I can't give Smack Shack one star is they actually have some decent menu items that are prepared well. The grits are great as many have noted. There is the chance I will even end up at Smack Shack again for their brunch one of these weekends. But if I'm wanting a lobster prepared well, I will spend my time and money elsewhere every time and so should you.

I wasn't too impressed with this place. I like the decor and the bar is beautiful but overall it was just okay.The sandwiches are a small portion based on the cost. I like that the menu is short so it's easy to choose but I probably won't go back. It seems like they can charge more being in the Google building.I was also disappointed by their beer selection. They had a lot of options but none of them stood out as must try's.The upstairs has a cool atmosphere and they are starting to serve brunch but for $35 all you can eat without drink seems high.

Yummy! I went here for brunch and for $35.00 you can get ALL you can eat and add an extra $15.00 and you can get unlimited Mimosa's. I enjoyed ALL 7 food stations lol. You can make you own omelet, chicken & waffles, sea food, comfort food (mac and cheese was good). They even have DO -RITE donuts! Hello Red Velvet :). All in all decent brunch spot. I wasn't really feeling the dessert station, but I didn't really make room for it either. LOL. Oh also, I love you can make reservations so you're not waiting in line for hours. I would definitely come back again and bring my appetite as well!

It does not get much better than this! Great new addition to the West Loop. Once a month all you can eat crab boil! $29,95 plus $5.88 service fee so for $40 total with taxes. Salad, Crab, Snow Crab, Potatoes, Kielbasa, Corn, Cookies and Beignets for dessert. I left stuffed, I couldn't eat another thing. WOW! The crab was cooked perfectly, the place was jam packed. The service, servers and hostesses we all amazing. They kept bringing more and more crab non stop. The place is huge inside two levels. Plus at the bar they had all draft beer on sale for $3.50 a glass. I hear the Sunday Brunch is not to be missed, so I'll be back..

Five stars all the way.  Another awesome brunch buffet from the Four Corners Group.  After hearing they launched the AYCE Seafood Brunch here on October 1st I scooped up a reservation for October 2nd.  $35 for brunch with an upcharge for bottomless booze options.This brunch featured a carving station with brisket, sausage, and salmon right next to the sides (dirty rice, mac and cheese, the most wonderful grits ever, and breakfast potatoes).  Towards the back there was and omelet bar and Eggs Benedict bar.  I wanted to love this...but Eggs Benedict may not be the right made to order item in a buffet setting.  Lost my favorite part of the dish, that creamy runny yolk of the perfectly poached egg, because it cooked through in the process of reheating.  The hollandaise sauce was a little loose as well.  There was an awesome waffle bar with friend chicken and fixings and the raw bar, with shrimp, snow crab legs, and oysters was absolute heaven.  Glazed and Infused doughnuts were also part of this party...and who are you kidding those will always be a welcome addition.On top of decadent donut action, there was a sweets table with mini cupcakes, parfaits, and other sweet treats too delicious to try in one sitting.  Oh and some salads and fruit and healthy stuff too.As would be expected with any self respecting brunch buffet for an $15 upcharge you could add the bottomless bloody mary bar or bottomless mimosa action.Overall, great variety and great dishes.  Food was constantly rotated throughout the time we were there. Compliments to the chef and the team for a really great brunch in the West Loop.

My fiance and I stopped in Tuesday around 3 p.m. and sat at the bar. Happy Hour is Tuesday-Friday from 3-6 with some great specials, including $1 oysters (no minimum order) 1/2 off the rotating beer special, and $10 for the signature draft Hurricane. Tables line the open wall of windows for nice days - there is a lounge-y area by the bar with some couches, and the dining room is elevated up a small flight of stairs. Restroom had multiple stalls and very clean. On-street parking as you find it or valet option at the restaurant.I'm not a personal fan of oysters, but my fiance says they were very good, and they looked big! That day they were featuring some east coast ones, served with lemon slices, horseradish, and an onion/balsamic(?) dressing as well. We also shared the lobster poutine, which wasn't skimpy on the lobster or cheese curds. The Hurricane doesn't play. There was plenty of booze and plenty of that sucker in a tall glass; be prepared.I didn't give 5 stars because we haven't tried the lobster rolls or much other food yet, but based on this visit and peeking at the other menu, we will absolutely be back again!

Grabbed a quick lunch on a Saturday afternoon and loved this place! It was pretty quiet (surprisingly, considering the mob that rushes this place on weekday evenings!) and the food was amazing.The andouille sausage sandwich was maxing- the creole aioli was amazing and the sausage was the perfect amount of spice. The lobster roll was also delicious and refreshing. The FRIES were to die for- the seasoning was amazing! The menu had great options for seafood-lovers and those who are hesitant. It's a great place for lunch, brunch, dinner, or just drinks and a bite!I love how open this place is on a beautiful day! The entire front (the lower level by the bar) opens up and it's open seating. The decor is nautically fantastic!! I even learned a thing or two.. On the upper deck (sorry, level) there is a tank with the live catch and chefs working in the open preparing them.The staff was friendly and knowledgable about the menu, the restaurant, and drink specials.Overall, it was awesome experience and I will be back! :)

On gorgeous Sunday morning, I decided to come to Smack Shack to get their lobster roll and oysters. The selection of the oysters were very limited but it represented good options for the west and east coast oysters. I tried a few of the oysters and were very impressed with the quality and the freshness of the oyster. The lobster roll was very heavenly. Generous amount of lobster was poured into the bread and Da Lobsta is peanut compared to Smack Shack.However, for an expensive joint (aka not red lobster), I had some expectation on the service component of the restaurants. The waitress today didn't seem to be very focused and was not knowledgable about the menu. When asked about the oysters, she was giving some attitude to me. I would prefer if she went to her manager and obtained clarifying answer. Later on, when I tried to get her attention for water or clean utensils, she ignored me and was acting busy helping other table. Ironically the restaurant was only 10% filled at 11.40am today. I ended up taking utensils from the other vacant table. I hate to talk smack about smack shack.....In a nutshell, I love the oysters and the lobster roll here. However, with service that approached red lobster quality (or worse?), I am not sure that I want to re-visit this venue again with friends or clients.

The Connecticut style lobster roll is a can't-miss option. It's one of the best I've ever had. There must have been 5 claws amongst other lobster meat in that thing. It was delicious. Their lobster boil looks interesting but I really only come here for the lobster roll.I've had the crab dip appetizer before, too. It's pretty good but not a must have. If you're in the area and in the mood for a good lobster roll, you can't beat Smack Shack.

First visit (dinner) was a 4-ish star ; second visit (brunch) was a 3-star. Overall I'm giving a 3 stars rating on Yelp for the below reasons:Lack of consistency in overall experience:--During the 1st visit (dinner), service was prompt, server was friendly, personable, made the effort to have a convo with us. The carafe of water was always on the table so our water glasses never went empty since we could refill them ourselves. The server was visible at all times but not intrusive.--During the 2nd visit (brunch), I'm assuming that because the crowd is much less at this time, they staff less people on the floor. I can understand that but not if it impacts service. Our server took awhile to greet us and filled our water glasses. Took awhile for him to return to take our order. All this while, our water glasses set empty for a noticeable amount of time. This time there was no water carafe left on our table either so I'm not sure what's standard practice in this place. There appeared to be no bussers. The server didn't have the support to carry out his job efficiently. We did end up getting our water glasses refilled after awhile, but it was sometime again before they got filled again. We were almost finished with our meal when the server decided to leave the water carafe on our table. The server wasn't very much visible at most times either.Food was good, not mind blowing:--Food here was good. Just not outstanding. I'm a firm believer that what you pay is what you get and fair enough, the menu pricing reflects that.--I'm a huge fan of mussels. I tried the mussels here and the flesh was small and not juicy (the broth that came with it had great depth and flavor though). Compared to other places where I always get the mussels, the flesh is plump and juicy. Well, this is also because I paid $13 for the mussels at Smack Shack vs ~$20 at other places. We got the lobster boil and while the price was fair, the quality was not excellent and just fine.Smack Shack felt very much like a place that was a level above Red Lobster. In the West Loop/Fulton Market where above-average and outstanding restaurants define the neighborhood, I appreciate Smack Shack offering an affordable price range for people to have seafood. However in order for them to sustain and compete in the neighborhood, they really need to be on their game with providing a great experience for customers every time. When I go out to eat, I look for the entire experience. I did not really get that here.Also, not sure why in their restrooms, they use Cowshed hand cream BUT not Cowshed hand wash? Weirdly, they seem to have taken a used Cowshed bottle, washed it clean and filled it with a generic hand soap?!

I loved Smack Shack! Came here for brunch on a Sunday with my boyfriend. We had oysters, lobster rolls and some bacon. The service was awesome and the manager was so kind and accommodating. We will certainly be back!

I was really rooting for this new spot because a great lobster roll is all I truly crave sometimes.I'm not sure if it's all the recent seafood I have had in Seattle, Miami and Key West or it's just a known fact that seafood in the midwest cannot be great but the food was mediocore at best.  For the prices we paid just plain outrageous to come back again and again.We had the  LORRAINE'S LUMP CRAB CAKES - with Maque Choux, CONNECTICUT-STYLE- Warm Lobster Tossed in Butter, Lemon & Chive on a Warm Split Top Bun and LOBSTER CIOPPINO - Clams, Mussels, Shrimp, Whitefish in a Tomato-Herb Broth.I liked the little bit of heat in the crab cakes but would have liked a little more citrus.  The lobster roll was good.  Definitely plenty of lobster in a warm buttery roll that didn't feel like just a slab of bread.  The cioppino wasn't necessarily the best seafood but the broth was done very well.Overall, great location with plenty of open seating.  I can see this as a great summer go to for a large happy hour but the food is priced way to high.  The service for a slow empty sunday was moving like molassase so I wonder how good they are during the rush of the week and prime weekend time.

My boyfriend and I wanted some lobster and oysters.So we got some Oysters and Lobster!We ordered all the oysters East\West bc we wanted to taste everything.They were delish! They have two sauces that  DID taste pretty damn good. However, I am more of a lemon,salt with hot sauce type of oyster eater.The Lobster Boil was great! Out waiter was really great! I want to say his name was Zee? But I can't remember :( Either way, he was really great with guiding us through the menu.We will be back :D** CORNBREAD WAS AMAZING**

I have been probably 5 times because I am dying for them to do well.  The lobster rolls are delish, but $2 upcharge for fries..ick. And the amount of lobster filling is verrry inconsistent. Sometimes I am thrilled and sometimes I am like what is this.Lobster mac and cheese-the first two times I got this I was loving it. Last few times it was a game of 'find the lobster'.Service has been hit or miss. In the bar for brunch is very inattentive. Dinner is better but not on point.Very first time I came our entire meal was a massive disaster. I emailed management instead of posting a review hoping they would right their own wrong. They made some promises and didn't keep their word which was extremely disappointing.Not sure where this leaves them for me...

I love this place! I live two blocks away and it's the first restaurant I think of if I'm craving sea food! Their shrimp and grits is my favorite dish here! Of course their crab dip and lobster rolls are amazing!!! Try their brunch! It did not disappoint!!! Their service is great too! Will keep going back :D

Came here for a late lunch on Sunday with the PIC.  It was kind of quiet, and we were sat right away from the bartender Andy.  Great guy.  He is a transplant from Fremont.  Pretty decent sized menu that noted we were still on brunch items.  The atmosphere is great.  Very open, second floor seating up top, and elongated bar.  Hightop seating, very bar feeling.  So many options, but I knew exactly what I wanted.  PIC and I both got the Connecticut style lobster roll.  $21 a pop.  You are, however, getting what you pay for!  Serious large chunks of meat here, no skimping.  The roll is buttered and toasted and the lobster is warm with lemon and chives.  I opted to switch things up a bit and sub the chips for the grits, which I enjoyed.  Cooked perfectly for me.  All in all, it was a great lunch.  A bit pricey for a lunch sandwich, but the meat was serious and succulent.  Way to go Four Corners, always doing something right! ;)  Next time I'll have to try dessert.

I attended an event at Swift & Sons and when I was leaving I came across Smack Shack. From the street the restaurant looked pretty interesting, nice bar area and windows were all opened.I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately everything fell short.Food: Lobster Guacamole - I was really excited to try this. I love lobster and guacamole and never had them together. There was a nice amount of lobster in the appetizer, but the guacamole was not seasoned well and the chips were greasy. Crab cakes - nice portion, but nothing special. I came here for the Lobster Roll. I decided to go with the Connecticut style lobster roll. It had a ridiculous amount of lobster!!!! Unfortunately, the sandwich was so dry. I asked for more butter and sauce after two bites and I still was unable to make it work! We also had the Fried Chicken and Lobster Mac n Cheese. The Fried Chicken was the best item we had. This is a seafood restaurant, so that was not what I was expecting. At least all was not lost. In fact, we order the Fried Chicken because the waiter said it was one of his two favorite items on the menu. This should've been a red flag. The Lobster Mac n Cheese was horrible. There's very little lobster, which was not a deal breaker, considering how much lobster the roll and guacamole had. It was the mac n cheese that was the issue. It was runny and not flavorful, very bland in general.Atmosphere - the bar area is nice, especially for enjoying a drink on a nice summer day or night. The rest of the restaurant doesn't really feel like it would meet the expectations of people who frequent the West Loop. It feels like a family establishment, chain and suburban.Still looking for great seafood, especially lobster rolls, with great drinks and lively atmosphere in Chicago....

Loved it! The customer service to the food was amazing! We had the lobster boil and enjoyed every bite. My husband grew up on the ocean and said this might be the best lobster he's ever eaten. The meat was very moist and the butter sauce was amazing. It came with corn, potatoes and a little slaw. All yummy!We thought the clam chowder was fantastic. It was the perfect consistency -not too brothy or creamy. And very tasty!The banana cream pie was good but a little frozen in the middle. Otherwise this was awesome!

Place was pretty empty on a Sunday around 6pm. Server was very nice and attentive. Crab dip was good. I didn't understand the lobster roll hype. Tasted a bit fishy to me. Also waaay too much seasoning on the fries. Couldn't really eat more than a few of them. Really liked the key lime pie, you can tell it had real limes in it.

I came here for brunch on the weekend and it was pretty empty inside. We shared the crab benedict and conneticut-style lobster roll. I really enjoyed the crab cakes. They were very meaty with not much filler. The crab cakes were so plump, they didn't even serve it on english muffins (didn't need it!). The small red potatoes that came as a side were slightly smashed and crispy and very delicious. The warm lobster roll was full of fresh lobster chunks, can't complain. Definitely check this place out.

So my boyfriend has decided to stop eating steak and now i am stuck with a man that only wants seafood and veggies. Checked this place out on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty slow. We were seated right away and the server took our order. The reason we came here was because of the seafood but i wasn't too impressed with it. I ordered the king crab boil for $50.00 bucks and yes it was good and the seasoning was great but the amount of food you get, i don't think it was worth it.This restaurant is in a great location! I would probably come back to check out their brunch menu since it looked really YUMM!

I was excited to check this place out since my brother moved to Minneapolis and told me about this place. Looking at their lunch menu (the Minneapolis version), the food sounded delicious, so I wanted to try this place out with my dad. I admittedly did not look at the Chicago menu and I should have because I was disappointed with the lack of selection.Location- This place is next to the Google HQ and some neighboring restaurants are Swift & Sons and Bar Takito. The space has a nice bar with TVs and a nice boiler area in the main dining room which you can see right when you walk in. Parking is stressful and difficult. We had to circle around multiple times until we found paid street parking on Halsted.Food- Like I had mentioned before, I only saw the Minneapolis (original location) menu, not the Chicago menu. I was expecting to see the large extensive Minneapolis menu with the lobster mac and cheese, fish & chips, salmon, shack towers (towers of jumbo shrimp, mussels, lobster, and king crab legs, 6 different types of po boys, and even the lobster boil (served with red potatoes, Polish sausage, corn on the cob, and butter).When the waitress gave us the menu, I was dumbfounded. Seriously? I go to a lobster restaurant and there's only 2 lobster rolls, 2 appetizers (chicken wings and lobster guacamole), one type of soup (clam chowder), 3 types of salads (BLT, Caesar, Lobster Cobb), 1 of which has lobster in it, and 2 po boys (Shrimp or Andouille Sausage) and a burger, neither of which have lobster in it. Of the 11 items I just named in the whole menu, only 4 items have lobster... I'm not going out of my way to go to a lobster restaurant to eat guacamole or salad topped with lobster. So that leaves me with the lobster rolls as my only choice for lunch. Where's the lobster boil that I saw on Instagram posted on the very same day?! This was very misleading considering it wasn't on the menu for lunch yet the Instagram told people to come for lunch to try it. My dad and I got the Smack Sauce Wings (9 wings) with hot sauce and bacon blue cheese dressing. I liked the sauce but it didn't taste hot, more on the sweeter side. The chicken was crispy and juicy. Our lobster rolls were yummy with large pieces of lobster cooked perfectly wrapped in warm buttery Texas Toast bread. The chips had the right amount of salt and crunch. The food made up for the lack of selection in lobster...Service- It was good, we were seated right away and the waitress was attentive, refilled our drinks and took away our plates when we were done. I thought it was weird that she refilled my dad's Coke with a can of Coke lol I haven't seen that before.Verdict- I really want to recommend this place because the lobster rolls and chicken wings were delicious. However, why is the lunch menu so small? This is supposed to be a lobster restaurant and only 2 options out of 11 have lobster as the main course. Where's the lobster mac & cheese and lobster boil that were advertised as available for lunch on Instagram? I would've given this place 4 stars due to the lobster rolls but due to misleading advertising, 3 stars. The menu needs to be expanded otherwise it's not worth a trip to lunch here.
AMAZING food, INCREDIBLE staff...DEFINITELY coming back! Andy, Jillian and Madalyn were AWESOME!!!!!! Thank u for everything!!!!

The food and Ambience was magnetic. This appears to be a new Restaurant we actually went here to celebrate a Birthday on a Saturday morning. We thought there like a Seafood buffet. Our server stated that there was o e and now they want to bring it back. Anyway I ordered the Eggs Benedict  with Crab cakes and it was delicious. The crab cakes reminded me on when I lived in Maine and Maryland, thry tasted that FRESH.  We arrived like tbe first customer. Nice experience...

I really wanted to like this place. I love seafood, and I do really like the layout and the atmosphere of the restaurant. The food was not bad, it wasn't phenomenal, I feel that there are at least a dozen of seafood restaurants in the city that do as good of a job or better.What I am appalled at is their BYOB practice. My friend was excited to try a couple of bottles of wine he just got and so he called to asked if they were BYOB and they said that they were, but there was a corkage fee. We really didn't think much of it, until we got our bill.The corkage fee was $25 dollars per bottle. I feel like if you are going to charge such an exorbitant fee, either make sure to tell your customers this, or just ban BYOB altogether.Mediocre service combined with mediocre food and a surprising high corkage fee will make me think twice about coming back to Smackdown shack.

Bomb, Bomb, Bomb service.The lobster guac is ON POINT.Oysters are fresh and great to shoot.The lobster roll is not bad either.They get seafood right here, and I felt like this was a pleasant dining experience.

The concept is very unique; we definitely needed a "real" lobster bar in Chicago. They brought East Coast cuisine to the West Loop, and all in the Chicago way. Hand painted lobsters on the walls, two huge tubs filled with live lobsters, a VIP area for industry peeps... love it. Food is out of this world with such an addictive flavor. Staff are very friendly and know their menu well. I'm very impressed with this concept.When you go, ask for Josh Thoma (the owner) and tell him Autumn sent you. He'll take great care of you. He always takes great care of me and my guests. :)

This place is cute & huge, like seriously huge not sure how they will keep it full.  But anyway service was good (even for being new), and food was great.My lobster roll was very good and would go back for that alone.Nice new place in a newish area of the city.
Bad service, over priced food and minimal lobster options.  Waiter didn't serve us for 30 minutes.

Went in on a whim and wasn't disappointed. Great and friendly atmosphere. Our server gave suggestions on the cocktail menu, we had a front Porch Buck (sweet) and Slo & Cho (more pungent).We got a little of everything to try... The deviled eggs were so good and the tarragon really brought it together. I'm not a crab person but my friend ordered them and I have to say it was really yummy. Not at all what I've had before, usually it taste so fishy to me but not there. We also split the fried green tomatoes.She got the shrimp and grits and I got the original lobster roll with grits (suggested by our server) and the cornbread. Now I'm not a grits person but these have changed my life forever!!We ended the meal with the Banana Cream Pie and Peanut Butter Torte. Both were great ways to finish.

This review will include two experiences:1) Stopped by about a month ago to check out this because I am a lobstah lovah. This is a beautiful restaurant with an open kitchen, lots of light, open windows, and seafaring theme. We started with drinks at the bar. The bartender was very knowledgeable about the restaurant history from it's original location in Minnesota. We started with a drink and weren't really hungry so just browsed the menu. What I did find really annoying was that they were playing Top 40/hip-hop or what I call Millennial music. It just didn't fit the theme or the price point and no one in the place was under 38. I was buzzed so I tweeted them and interestingly they responded quickly and politely said they will play whatever we wanted. I suggested some music like classic rock, 80's/90's, alternative rock, and seafaring music.2) Came back here for lunch and it did not disappoint. First, the music was upgraded to Foster the People and Foo Fighters from what I can remember. I got the Connecticut style lobster roll which had a very generous portion of lobster that overflowed the butter-grilled New England style roll. Best lobster roll I've had in Chicago. Fries were good but a little too thick and overcooked for my taste. Waitress was nice but curt and indifferent.

After a day at the beach,  Smack Shack was the perfect spot to keep the beachy vacation vibe going! We were happy to learn that we arrived during happy hour...the peach Moscow Mules were to die for! And for $5 they really couldn't be beat! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and the lobsters are the freshest ever...kept in a tank on site and cooked in a huge old bay spiced vat along with potatos, corn and sausage. We got an appetizer and split the lobster boil and were glad we did; it was very filling. Overall,  a very enjoyable meal- I didn't even want to take off my bib. I'm looking forward to coming back!

One of my friend told me about this place and we went with three people including myself. This restaurant is fairly new and been opened for two months. The restaurant decor is really nice and had great ambiance. Our waitress was really nice and was attentive to our needs. My friends and I started out with the wings and lobster guacamole and they were both great. Both my friends had the lobster rolls which was great to except the  roll needed more sauce. I had the burger called Lobster Lucy and the only complaint I have about it is you don't get enough lobster meat. My friends and I agreed we will definitely go back to this place and tried the seafood boil and other items on the menu. Overall we enjoy our experience here and would recommend others to try this place.

Imagine Red Lobster but worse and twice the price.The food is so uneventful that I would be annoyed wasting a meal here even if it were free.There is a competing restaurant just blocks away with similar style food but many times better and for half the price.The food was bland and I left hungry and annoyed after spending $188 for my girlfriend and I.  The best things there was the free caramel I had when leaving.

Well I can officially call Smack Shack my fav restaurant in Chicago for all of my seafood needs. Um, amaze balls. I love the space itself in the ever growing Fulton Market area. Can you say hot, hot, hot. Like so timely.Plenty of seating in the bar area, which features an open window concept perfect for warm nights. Upstairs there is ample seating for a dining room experience. We sat upstairs for our table for 4, and upon being seated we were able to cruise by the tank where the lobsters come to die. Very cool (morbid, but cool). Our waiter was fantastic on suggesting dishes as this was everyone's first time. Do yourself a favor and order the Alaskan King Crab dip. You just must. It's warm and crabby in all the right ways;) our dining partners dined on oysters and said those were very yummy. The menu is huge...oozing with many innovative seafood dishes, as well as the classics. I got a lobster roll which was BY FAR the most substantial roll I've gotten to date. The comps in the area do not even compare. I'm looking at you GT and Dusek's... So much lobster, so much roll, yet not so much left on my plate after I devoured it. My boo had the shrimp and grits which he adored. And my friend had the 5 lb...yes you read that right 5 lb king crab. Let me tell you shells were flying everywhere in a blaze of glory!No room for dessert because the portions are hearty. Everyone loved their  meals. The only downside was trying to decide what we wanted to order. Can't wait to come back and sink my chompers in dat shrimp po' boy! Ohhhhh yeahhhh!!!
Good food, great service.   The price point is very high for the quality of food.  The four start rating is based on price and limited menu.   Otherwise good food and very friendmy staff.

We discovered the Smack Shack while waiting for another well-known chef's restaurant, and made a point to come back at our first chance.  Wow!  We walked through the Chase Corp. Challenge 5K, and then headed over here directly afterwards (~9pm).They welcomed us with open claws, and we were not disappointed.  We ordered the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese, Smack Shack Original (Lobster Roll), King Crab Dip, and the Jumbo Shrimp Boil.  Yes, lots of food, but hey we were hungry.  Yes, it was amazing.  I think the most important part was the service.  Our server was amazing, as I expect all of them.  I always grade on ambiance, food, and most important the service.  This place had it all.Stop in, and see for yourself.  I hear they have brunch too, and then stop for some Glazed Infused donuts on the way back to the couch!

It also takes me a lot to write a bad review... I'll eat anything... But I could barely eat the food here. Started with the lobster guacamole. It was very clear that this was not fresh, but instead processed and likely preserved pre-made....for $17. The lobster Mac and cheese was so extreme creamy that it could barely be swallowed...how can you mess up Mac and cheese?!? Lastly tried the clam chowder. Gross. It was also so thick and within 1 minute at our table it was starting to congeal at the top. The cornbread was decent. The butter was probably my favorite part of the meal.Lastly, the atmosphere - with how cheap the food tasted, I felt like I was in a TGI Fridays....except that restaurant can serve good food. I saw staff members exiting through the front kitchen in street clothes...really? Use the back door!For $70 with tip, I left feeling hungry and completely disappointed.

Great service, excellent vibe and atmosphere, and the food was delicious!  I went here on my birthday and our server, Ian, was so accomodating!  We got the crab dip for the table - it was very tasty! Highly recommend.  I got the po boy which was good.  But the grits were were so flavorful! Awesome place to get seafood with a really nice bar area!

We came here for Father's Day and we loved it! The food is absolutely delicious. They just recently opened so the service was a bit lacking. We ordered two drinks and it took them 30 minutes to get it to us. I'm sure they are just trying to get up to speed. The place is really cute too. We will definitely be back!

Smack shack is a little off the popular path but def worth the trip! Visiting Chicago+missing a classic east coast style lobster roll it was on the list and we came here. Wonderful staff w trendy Industrial look we were invited right in. Our server "Z" took great care of us and highly recommend him! The lobster roll was on a buttery warm toasted bread lots of Lobster meat will def be by next time I'm in town!

This place is so cute! I was looking for a new brunch spot and Smack Shack did not disappoint. Love the location and the restaurant itself is big and airy with lots of open windows. Great place to check out when the weather is nice. Our server was so friendly and nice. I love when people actually like their jobs. I had one of their specialty drinks. It was okay. Pretty weak on the liquor. Beignets were awful. They were more like a biscuit maybe? They were just no good. The table next to us actually sent theirs back. The crab crabcake benedict was AMAZING. I can't say enough about it. 5 stars just for that. My friend had the lobster roll and she liked it. She added some hot sauce and said it was perfect. Overall, the service, ambiance, location and food were solid. I can't wait to go back!
The best sea food in town! It's fresh & delicious. Impressed by the customer service, decor & design, great atmosphere and cocktails !!!

Having been to the location in Minneapolis, I had really high expectations. This place doesnt quite have the vibe of the other but It is much more modern and seems larger. Service was very friendly although kitchen struggled to keep up it seems. Started with the cornbread which was great the butter with it was delcious. I had the classic lobster roll which was ine of the best Ive ever had. The cucumber and tarragon really make it different. Fries were great as well with a little old bay. Mac n Cheese and Lobster Burger were both just average although the amount of lobster for the price was solid. Maybe give them a little more time to work out the kinks and this place could be really great.

love the ambience. the feel of seaport district of Boston was so close. I'm bias to warm and hot food, so I prefer the Connecticut style lobster roll and loving the bread too. the crab cakes were different and I like the spicy taste in it. definitely would come back for a lobster dinner soon.

Brand new and worth every penny. Service was great! Ian was our server and very helpful. Cocktails were delicious!! East coast oysters were great, the lobster bisque had huge chunks of lobster and they do not short change you on lobster on the rolls! The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because I wasn't able to try the desserts. Looks like I'll have to come back!

It was a rough day, and so I thought I would treat my boyfriend and I to dinner here. I think it was meant to be as we were looking around for a place to eat and it happened that this spot was located on the street that we were on. It was a pretty spacious place, casual and fun, but still a nice spot. I wasn't sure what to think considering my boyfriend doesn't eat seafood, and we didn't look at the menu prior to see if they offered any other land meat. It worked out really well as there was a steak, burger, and chicken options. I got the Connecticut style lobster roll and it was delicious! I can see why they are known for it. Definitely one of the top ones I have had in the city - the warm butter made it rich and flavorful and they did not skimp out on the lobster meat. My only complaint was that I did substitute the chips for the collard greens and it was too salty for me. The service was excellent. The staff was so friendly, and our server Greg B was very cool. Prices were reasonable, and would love to come back and try a boil!

Everything was well prepared and you can definitely taste the seafood in every dish. Lobster bisque was good and had multiple prices of lobster in it. The lobster Mac and cheese was also very well prepared with pieces of mushroom in it.  service was also very good.
Great happy hour deals!  Clean. The bartender, BJ, was a wonderful host!  Can't wait to go back and try brunch.

We had an excellent experience this evening at Smack Shack!  It was our 2nd time here and this time we brought our son. They have a kids menu and our waiter, Justin, put his food in right away which is always appreciated!  We had the lobster boil which was really good!  Would definitely recommend especially for families.

We live in the west loop and decided to try Smack Shack out...Bad decision. The food is WAY overpriced. $17 guacamole anyone? And it would be fine if the atmosphere fit...but they have paper table clothes! Make up your mind...either go fine dining and charge these prices, or casual and charge normal prices. Paying over $100 for lunch for two people is redic.On the plus side the food was good. Not great, just good.

Lobster. 80s music and plastic bibs...Well Done.We haven't had our seafood fix in a while and love a good boil. This new spot is sleek and attractive. Service was excellent. Food came quickly. One of us had the lobster boil. The other had the shrimp boil. They were both extraordinary. We left full. Great value. Reasonably priced wine list and good selection.

Stopped in for a bite after some drinks in the area. Food was, for the most part, great. Oysters were fresh and delicious, well cleaned and shucked. Fried green tomatoes were ok. Wings were delicious. Lucy was out of this world. Shrimp po boy was delicious. And the fries were good as well. Will go back for the boil!

Original one in Minneapolis is way better.+ good atmosphere+ lobster roll was good. Filled with chunks if lobster.+ one of few places in chicago you can get a whole steamed lobster.- oysters had tons of shells in it. Need to get a guy better at shucking- their juicy Lucy isn't nearly as good as the one in Minneapolis. They put way too much onion and not enough lobster.- their bread is different on the lobster roll here. They copied da Lobsta and have a toasted buttered roll instead. Not great.- less lobster in their Mac and cheese than in Msp.

Amazing food, friendly service and wonderfully unique atmosphere. You will love it as much as we did. The lobster here is the best I've ever had! Street parking is very easy (for now).  It's right in the Google building so it was very easy to find.  If you're driving there, there is valet available at the corner with Swift and Sons.  Smack-Shack really hit it out of the park with this concept.

Came here for a special occasion and made reservations because I thought it would be packed - it wasn't too crowded but not empty.  Was seated right away.  Hosts were very accommodating to make sure we got seats where we could see the Cubs game on the tv :)  They have a decent kids menu, and affordable.  We ordered the lobster bisque soup, which was the best I've tasted anywhere with the largest chunks of lobster I've ever seen anyone put in their bisque.  We also had the chicken wings which were okay, and the lobster mac and cheese, which was also delicious and packed with chunks of lobster.  The bill for two adults and one teen was under $90, so definitely a special occasion place, but well worth it. Will definitely be back!

I went there for dinner. I was excited, because I live nearby and looked to be another nice addition to all of the other great restaurants on Fulton. I had the lobster roll. It was very bland and thought their price point was way too high. One month later I stopped in for a cocktail. I ordered their version of an Old Fashioned. When the drink came I could immediately tell it was all wrong. I could see water in it. The color should be dark, but instead it was light brown. Very disappointing.

The portion size on the signature lobster roll is bananas. Normally, I buy a lobster roll knowing it will probably not be worth the money, but this was humongous, and tasty. Next time I'm getting the $12 deal for a half roll with a bowl of chowder. Our server, Justin, was mad cool, and really took care of us. Can't wait to go back.

Delicious Lunch! We started with chicken wings, very good, practically  no breading with green goddess and blue cheese dipping sauce, both good. The clam chowder was amazing. As was the lobster on a brioche roll. Very satisfied. Service was very good too and the space is very welcoming.

We had brunch yesterday and the Lobster rolls were terrific, as was the service.  We both had the Connecticut style  -- super buttery and warm.The only negative would be the beignets - kinda the consistency of a day old bagel with  powered sugar.  They did not charge us,  even the hostess said they were working on it.

They are on to something here. I will check out this place again but maybe I will sit in the lounge area near the bar.. The couch seating in that area looks kinda cool. The food wasn't terrible just a bit too salty on the deviled eggs, and lobster guacamole. The grits with the shrimp and sausage had a good consistency.

Came upon this place thanks to a long wait down the street and was pleasantly impressed. We had great service! Ordered the lobster boil, oysters, hamburger and a shrimp po boy...loved them all! Pricy if you're taking a large family but I suppose it's to be expected with lobster on the menu (hehe)

My experience was very good at the Smack Shack. Went there with a couple of friends for dinner. Had the burger, which was excellent and king crab dip for an appetizer. Overall my experience was great. Service, food, atmosphere were all top notch.
Had drinks and a few appetizers, everything was very good. Cool view into the kitchen and the tub of lobsters

Welcome to Chicago, Smack Shack! Tonight is their opening night and my husband and I stopped by for an early dinner. It is a HUGE space. If word gets out about how great it is, I think they should be able to fill the place up regularly. It is little off the beaten path (next to Google, around the corner from Swift & Sons), so I hope it gets the traffic it deserves.We expected some kinks, being that it was their first night, but for the most part, everything went smooth! They did not have our reservation (we called earlier to make one), but it was no big deal since the restaurant was empty. It opened at 5, we got there at 5, so that is to be expected. It was fun to be the first person seated on their opening night.We were seated in the main dining room, near the kitchen. I actually really liked the seat because it was clear they were doing a lot of training in the kitchen and it was interesting to watch. The bar area would also be a fun place to sit. They were opening up the glass window/doors to take advantage of the nice weather tonight. Would be a great place to have drinks and dinner on a summer night.Our server, Confessor, came over right away. He was attentive and friendly the entire meal. We started with some drinks - I had a rum punch, my husband had an old fashioned. Both were great - mine was very strong. Next we had appetizers. We ordered the lobster guacamole and the lobster bisque. Delicious. Both had big chucks of lobster. Two large claws in the soup and enough in the guacamole that I had a little with every bite. For our main course, my husband had the Connecticut lobster roll and I had the lobster mac & cheese. My husband has wanted a Connecticut lobster roll ever since I declined to wait 2 hours for one when we were in Boston. It did not disappoint. the bread was great and the warm, buttery lobster was perfect.  The lobster mac & cheese was equally delightful. This stuff was SO rich and cheesy. I have no idea what cheese they used, but it was perfect. Again, LOTS of lobster in there. They do not skimp on the lobster at this place. The meal was spaced out perfectly and we left feeling full and happy.I think this is a unique addition to the Chicago food scene - nothing else like it. We will definitely be back!

The food was good. Pricing on the lobster boil is misleading. They show you the price per pound.  Apparently there is a seafood law saying that you can't get just 1 pd.. Yes.. That is what I was told.  Ha..We got the bill and it was for 1 and 1/2 pds not just 1. I suggest they put the price on the menu for what you have to order.

I had dinner, actually, a birthday party, at Smack Shack in early June with seven friends.  The food was generally good and the service was courteous but there were exceptions.We were a table of eight and for the most part were served by one waitperson.   That's not enough for eight people, either taking orders, delivering food, busing dishes or the like.  Also, the waitperson and the table were not supervised in any way at any  time.  There were too many times that the table was not served for periods of at least ten minutes.Most people enjoyed their food, however two people had lobster bisque and one person had shrimp and grits and these dishes were overwhelmingly salty.  We told the waiter about them and he apologized.Two people had the lobster boil without sides.  The lobster was fine but they believed the price was $29.95 and were surprised the cost was over $46.  A second, literal reading of the menu showed the minimum size and the price per pound but I would suggest that is not clear enough for people selecting that item.I had called a few days in advance and told someone that it was a birthday party and I would like an appropriate dessert for the entire table.  When we entered the restaurant I told the people at the front the same thing.  Finally, I told the waiter.  After finishing entrees and waiting a good while, the waitperson came out with one microscopic cupcake and a candle he had trouble lighting.  I told him I thought we were going to have a cake or other dessert for the table and had him bring out enough for the table.  He brought out several more cupcakes.  When I reviewed the bill, these tiny desserts were $9 each.  That price is out of line for those items.These items were negatives and shouldn't happen at an impressive new restaurant with an attractive, delightful menu.  Pricing at this restaurant is fair but the total cost that night was too much because of these lapses.M. Winter

The lobster boil is the main attraction here, but the other dishes we tried were also excellent. He crab cakes were phenomenal--not too much filler and served over a corn salad. It's soft shell crab season so tempura crab over orzo is a must. Don't skip dessert. The key lime pie was probably the best I've ever had outside of Key West.

The Lobster Roll was awesome---maybe could have been $17-$18 instead of $20, but I must say I cannot think of a better lobster roll I've ever head. Huge chunks of lobster claw, perfectly buttered roll. The cocktail I had was just ok. I will definitely be back.

You should definitely go to Smack Shack. We were there for dinner on Saturday and had a fantastic experience. Everything we ordered was great. We started with the mussels, shared a shrimp boil and a lobster roll (Connecticut Style with fries). We also added an order of collard greens and cornbread. I would recommend everything we had. Can't wait to go back and try more things. Wine and beer list were very impressive. Don't let the casual vibe deter you.

Great food. Great service. Usually lobster rolls are hit or miss depending on try quality of the lobster and the type of bread they use... Both were on point here! We also had the king crab dip... So delicious! The Alaskan crab boil was perfect--generous portions! I can't wait to go back for dinner.
Really disappointing. The food just wasn't that good. The oysters were sub par. The lobster bisk had shells in the soup. The shrimp boil wasn't worth it.We won't be back.

Went here last night and really loved this place! Went with a bigger group so we got to try quite a few things. The crab dip appetizer was really good. The clam chowder was also really good, better than any of the stuff I had in New England! The place is big and the decor is great. Can't wait to go back soon!

This is a great place to get boiled seafood in Chicago. I should know--I'm from Louisiana, where boiled seafood is a way of life. (I was disappointed to see no Gulf oysters on the menu, however.) We went for a birthday dinner with a large group and the service was great. I look forward to going again.

Great to have a place like this in Chicago. Food good. Not too pricey. Hostess friendly. Service, based on personal experience and tables around me, not great.Wish they have "cold" items on menu....at least for summer months.

Great atmosphere: you can choose between bar with TVs for sports, lounge booth area, or just main seating. Awesome selection of food: for both seafood lovers and someone like me who is allergic to shellfish (highly recommend the leg of lamb sandwhich). Cool drinks: starting from the beer selection to signature cocktails.

Took some out of town foodie friends here last night - we tried just about everything on the menu - lobster guacamole had huge pieces of lobster, tasted great! Oysters were fresh and they offer a really  nice variety. Lobster rolls were packed full of lobster and I'm not talking little pieces! We also had the lobster boil which is very difficult to find in Chicago. Dessert was excellent (we tried 3) One of our fav wine was on the wine list at almost half the cost we paid at other restaurants! You can dress up or go casual - huge bar area with plenty of room. Nice to have something "different" - thumbs up

We had reservations from 6:15 on Friday and it was all good with a single exception (last paragraph.) Parking was surprisingly easy as we located on-street parking just two blocks away. When we walked to the restaurant we discovered that they have valet parking which is a good option to have since parking would almost certainly be a challenge as the evening wears on.The restaurant has a very nice vibe when you enter and the decor is understated but very nice. The red/white checkered tablecloths were covered with heavy white paper as you'd find in many fish restaurants, cloth napkins and nice decor on the walls. The music...they might want to work on that. We saw one large-screen television but it was off. We were greeted warmly by the hostess and by servers as they passed us at the host station. Our server, Gregory B, was prompt and provided recommendations when we asked. The wine list was good and our water glasses were filled whenever they were running low. The menu, while not pages long, had several dishes that we considered ordering. Ultimately we went with crab cakes and shrimp and grits. De. Light. Ful. Both meals were great--as was our wine. The key lime pie came in a large portion and was one of the best I've had lately. So, the food and service were all good.The only thing that was disappointing was that during the time we were there, no manager came to check on us. I would have expected this since the restaurant is fairly new and was fairly empty while we were there. It definitely started to fill as we lingered and I have no doubt that there would be a wait sooner than later...which is exactly why someone could/should have stopped by before the rush. At this price point, which I classify as "pricey but totally worth it", send someone over to say "hey" just like your competition does. I'll be back 'cause it was that good.

Stopped in here for apps and drinks before heading to dinner. Had the king crab dip (the bread it comes with is absolutely amazing) and the deviled eggs which I liked because there wasn't too much mayo.Our bartender was great and the manager gave us a tour of behind the bar to see the fresh lobsters and how they boil them!Drinks were very good-- the hurricane looks like it is expensive but it's a really big drink so worth it if you are looking for something fruity!

Came here for a grand opening event and got to taste test a lot of their menu items and cocktails. Left with a full belly and a desire to come back again soon. Plus, you've got to love the space. It's HUGE and would be awesome for an event or happy hour after work.

Well I'm was very disappointed with my first (and most likely only) experience at Smack Shack. We decided to try out this new neighborhood spot on a Sunday evening. We were very eager to try several things on the menu. We started with the Sea Bass Ceviche- decent flavor if you like red peppers, a lot of them. It was served on a leaf and while that is aesthetically pleasing, it makes it hard to scoop up with the chips they serve. Needs to be served in a bowl. Next, we split the lobster roll. Very good flavor but Gilt Bar's is night and day better. We ordered a half order of the lobster mac and cheese. This was the clear winner. Our last dish was the Juicy Lucy. Now when I splurge on a burger I want it to be worth it. Chicago has some ah-mazing burger places and a burger stuffed with lobster sounded like it'd fit right in. Unfortunately, this is not one of them. It was served to us not just well done, but CRSIPY. We each took one bite of the burger and did not eat anymore. The problem came when we let the server know it was over done. He shrugged his shoulders- no apology, nothing. We didn't push the issue. But if you are going to charge $20 for a burger, your chef had better know how to cook it! In general the service was pretty bad. He took over 15 minutes to bring a glass of wine, did not serve any of the food to us, nor checked on what we thought. He could have cared less and the restaurant was not even 1/4 full. This place charges River North prices with McDonald's service. Go back to Minneapolis, Smack Shack. Chicago has higher expectations.

Wonderful staff. Plenty of seating. Fresh seafood served in a casual atmosphere. Prices are fair but from 3-6 or lunch time the prices are better value. We tried the lobster and crab boils and found the crap to be sweeter and more tender. The lobster was flavorful but we enjoyed the crab better. Good with friends and share. It's a lot of food.

I have been to the original location in Minneapolis and wanted to try their second location here in the West Loop.  I was not disappointed!  Service was fantastic.  We had the lobster guacamole as an appetizer and loved it -- serious chunks of lobster, and even the chips were fresh and good.  My husband had the organic salmon entree, which he said was amazing.  I had the best crab cakes I have had either ever or in years.  Our server, Zsolt, is worth a trip back even if everything else had not been so terrific.  Zsolt is personable, efficient, knowledgeable and a true delight.  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that I am not a fan of "energetic" noise level designs -- even though I know this is a big thing now.

The food was good - don't miss getting a lobster roll. I had a lobster Cobb salad that was delish. Our server was attentive and did a great job. I thought it was kind of weird that it was virtually empty on a Tuesday night - with the exception of few bar tables - but the weekends are probably busy.

Underwhelmed, service average and patronizing. Oysters very good, nice mix of east V. West. I had pound of Alaskan king crab - way over Cooked, meat turned to rubber, not succulent, decadent crab meat we all crave. Shaw's prices, not even close to Shaw's quality. Obviously they ar trying to capitalize on location, but quality of food and service is definitely lacking. I saw recent review of seafood restaurants that rates this place at or near top, clearly inside resting, this place is not special and way overpriced for food and atmosphere.

I first tried Smack Shack when visiting Minnesota.  So I was super excited to learn that one was coming to Chicago.  I have now been there twice and they don't disappoint.  The food and drinks were great.  We all had the lobster rolls.   If you're in the West Loop, go visit Smack Shack - it won't disappoint!
Great lobster.  Love the atmosphere, the designers did a great job.  Bar offers a nice place to chill and hang with friends. The staff was really polite and very punctual.

Tried to get into Swift and Sons around the corner and the wait was too long so came into smack shack.. Never been to a seafood boil in chicago. Very fun and open interactive cooking atmosphere where we could see our lobster being boiled... $60 for almost 2lb lobster With all the sides. Pretty solid deal and we probably saved money versus Swift that night. Flavor was good and portions were generous. We'll be back.

Original lobster roll was amazing!  Huge chunks of lobster meat!  Boozy-Q cocktail was perfect!  The Lay's potato chips threw me off, sort of cheapened the roll.  Sea Bass ceviche was okay, a tad salty.  We'll definitely be back for the roll!

Omg Smack Shack is truly amazing. The food is awesome. The customer service is one of the best I've   encountered in a long time. I've been telling everyone i know to go get the Smack Shack experience.  The lobster mac is my favorite, but of course everything is great. Most importantly go see for yourself and you will understand what I'm talking about. Everyone i have taken there was pleased I'm happy to say. Chef Josh and Chef Brian make your taste buds come alive with their unique touch to the menu. Enjoy

Best hurricane I have ever had and I lived in New Orleans for a few years. All the food and cocktails are amazing. Omar is an amazing bartender. Service and food would get over 5 stars if I could. We had brunch, one person got the lobster boil, chicken and waffles, lobster roll and Lucy burger everything was amazing. We will definitely be back!

I was so excited to read about this place opening up in the West Loop. However, my experience won't be bringing me back. Very expensive and not worth it. The food is just okay, albeit over-salted. Every fish dish we had was salty. Portions are small and the way they portion things out make no sense. I ordered a pot of mussels swimming in sauce for a starter and got two tiny crostinis the size of my pinky to dip into the sauce. Yet our wedge salad had a whole piece of Texas toast. What? The drinks we ordered were all ice for $12-$15 each! Horrible value. Also $5 for bottled soda. Why? For food, we ordered one of every entree and honestly you're better off going to Bonefish Grill for taste and value. The only items that were good was the Juicy Lucy burger and lobster Mac and Cheese. I went with my family of 7 on Mother's Day, spent over $300 and it was not worth it. There are so many other places to drop $300+ on. They also put items I didn't order on the bill (extra $17 appetizer). As always, check your final bill. They're going through opening pains so service might improve but it won't make the prices any cheaper. I would not come back. Sad that my mom did not enjoy her dinner.
Amazing service.  Fun, relaxed, casual but hip atmosphere.  Lobster rolls are super yummy.  I can't wait to go back!

Go before they get too crowded and order the crab cakes. So many crab cakes seem to be more cake than crab, but these have recognizable chunks of crab and great seasoning. Share a lobster as an appetizer and then dive into one of the po' boys. Service was very friendly and the space is wide open, so you don't feel like the next table is on top of you.

We went here 2 days in a row. One time was with the guys. Good times and food was so good we came back the next day when we were in neighborhood with other friends.We were a little early but the owner was nice enough to welcome us in. Tacos (esp T&B) and burgers were both good. We also tried mac and cheese (ok), guac (fresh), and all the fries (good and plentiful). Service was great! I recommend!
I really like this place. The tacos are yummy with homemade tortilla. The burgers are good too.My kids like it, I like it my super fussy mother-in-law likes it.YEAH!!!!

Still 5 stars. My new favorite thing to order: $12 for 4 tacos (which we split) and 1 mini burger. All my cravings are satisfied in one seating. Love T & B.So GOOD! You need to try this place. We've eaten here 4 times and hey have been consistent with the quality of food and service.
I loved their veggie burger! It is freshly made and instead of cheese they put fresh guacamole. Service is also great and welcoming.

This place has been showing up on my "Best of Yelp: Chicago" restaurant list and I thought I should finally check it out. We came here for an early dinner on a Saturday and there was only one other table taken. We took advantage of some specials they were having and, between the two of us, we had the T & B mini burger, the spice mini burger, fries, T & B taco, fish taco, chipotle steak taco, and pork belly taco. The ingredients were definitely fresh and everything tasted good, but nothing really stood out to me. I couldn't taste the difference between the bison burger and the beef burger and the homemade tortillas didn't make that much of difference to me either. This was a good amount of food for two people and the prices were decent. Service was friendly and that's always a plus. Again, the food was good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

T & B's menu is like West Side Story...only with salsa verde. It's the tacos versus the burgers in an epic battle for the love of your taste buds.While I dug the food, price point, and the fact that they're BYOB, I don't feel like I was given their best performance. The tortillas on my tacos were overcooked and had a slight crunch around the edges. That being said, I still ate all four with little to no haste. Guessing it was just a fluke.Had no gripes with the burger on the other hand, and the mac and cheese was melt in your mouth delicious.Just make sure you bring your hearing aids to T & B Grill. It's loud. I'm talking some of the most terrible acoustics you could ever imagine for eating with friends. Oh well, it's a good thing I love to eat alone.

T&B Grill is an amazing Mexican & American fusion restaurant that serves delicious and quality food!The interior is very clean ans decorated nicely with beautiful and colorful fresh flowers on every table. Lots of seating- bring your family and friends!The appetizers were the true stars of our meal. We got:Mac and cheese with crab ($8.50). You can add smoked bacon for an additional dolla, but I would recommend it without so you can really enjoy the flavor of the crab. There isn't actually that much crab in it, but that made it more special when you actually got a mouthful of crab. This dish is beyond amaIng. It is just the right amount of cheesy, and even has veggies like zuchinni cooked in. I think this is the best mac and cheese I've ever had, anywhere. I would strongly recommend this dish.Brussel sprouts ($6.50) with smoked bacon and truffle balsamic glaze. This was also delicious and I will definitely get it again. The portion is very generous, especially the bacon! The glaze is so tasty and the sprouts are cooked perfectly. Yum!We also got a side of Truffle french fries ($6). These have a strong cajun taste to them too, but the truffle flavor is prominent. These were not my favorite, but I am pretty picky about my fries.We also tried some Tacos:T&B Taco ($3.50)- spicy shrimp, habanero aioli, garlic cilantro lime slawDuck Taco ($3.25)- duck leg confit with ancho pepper,  guajillo aioli, pickle cabbage and carrotsFish Taco ($3.25)- pico de gallo, jalapeno lime aioli, black seaame seeds, pickle cabbage, ancho chile peppers seasonedThese were all good, but nothing compared to the appetizers. Not sure I would get tacos again when the appetizers are so much better. Tacos range from $2.50-$3.50. Burgers range from $8.50-$14 and come with fries. You can also get mini versions of each burger for $5! I want tovtry these next time- they look interesting with things like biaon burgers,  grilled shrimp on top, and fried eggs.Check in on yelp for a free order of beignets, which we enjoyed more than ones from New Orleans! They are cute little beignet munchkins settled on top of a delicious chocolate sauce, with a rasberry sauce that was so good I wanted to drink it, and fresh raapberries. The perfect way to end our meal!Another plus- this restaurant is BYOB! There is a liquor store right next door, which is very convenient.Truly excellent service. Our waitress, Monica, was so sweet, personable and friendly and really made our dinner a wonderful experience.5 stars for sure!
This place was awesome! The tacos were really great, and the shrimp mac and cheese was really good too. The waitress was really nice and helpful, and the BYOB is awesome. I wi definitely be back!

This place is the only reason I wish I lived in Albany Park. Their tacos are incredible! Flavors were on point and I absolutely love that they're BYOB.  Perfect restaurant to bring some booze to and have a great meal for a great price. They also have specials too which is awesome!

Love this little place!Parking is very easy. Tons of street parking on Lawrence. Came at 3pm on Friday for late lunch and since they just opened no one else was here.Wasn't in the food for a burger, I'm typically not. Though they all sound different and can all be made into mini burgers which is pretty cool.I ordered a half order of the crab Mac and Cheese. Also has chopped up veggies mixed in. It was pretty good. Slight crab flavor that wasn't over powering. The crunch of the veggies was a good texture too.I then ordered the T&B shrimp, Fish (tilapia), and Chorizo taco. The fish and the chorizo were my favorite. Tacos come on a slate plate that I loved with a wedge of lime and salsa verde. The tortillas are green which I'm assuming have spinach in them.I also got a side of truffle fries and have to say they were probably the best truffle fries I've ever had. And I've had a lot of truffle fries. There is a reason the side of fries is $6.00 but it's also a large portion and delish! Don't miss out.Server was Monica and was she super nice and let me know about the fact that I could order a half order of the Mac even though it's not on the menu and it can be ordered with or without crab and veggies.Nice place in the middle of a mess of stores.

Remarkable place.  I went back again last night with my wife and another couple.  They were pretty busy as it was Saturday night.  The tacos were delicious & just as good as the first time.  You can see that the chef owner and his staff have a labor of love in the food that comes out of the kitchen.  Each taco is beautifully presented and absolutely delicious.  They serve burgers & mini burgers too that are incredible, but I had 3 mini burgers at the seminar I went to earlier in the day.  The waiter suggested ordering an appetizer because of the backlog in the kitchen for the other orders.  We got a quesadilla with cheese and steak that was delicious.  They also serve burgers and mini burgers that I want to try.  The creations coming out of the kitchen looked delicious and were also beautifully presented.  Oh well there's always a next time

We are always on the hunt to try new restaurants.T&B Grill did NOT disappoint.Started with the duck and chorizo tacos....fantastic! Fresh, flavorful and delicious.The burgers were also delicious! We tried the T&B and the classic. Again, fresh and nice balance of flavors.The truffle fries also hit the spot.  Perfection!I highly recommend for burger fix at reasonable price.

This was my favorite place to go for tacos, but the 4 tacos for $12 is gone.  I actually walked out when the hostess told me that the tacos were priced individually now.  They lost me as a customer and will potentially lose many more.  The tacos are wonderful but I will not come back until this offer returns.
A cozy neighborhood place with delicious burgers and tacos.  Service was friendly and attentive.   I enjoyed the visit and highly recommend.

Good place all around. Great service, great inventive menu serving gourmet tacos and burgers and service is on point. Really good offering of tacos and they come with great fresh ingredients that most will love. Burgers are the same. And, you can try full versions of burgers or mini slider versions of them. Very delicious. My favorite taco was the duck taco which comes with very tender meat in a gorgeous soft tortilla.  My favorite burger was the T&B burger with grilled onions, guac, and shrimp. The rest were definitely tasty but nothing blew me away.Plus BYOB which is always good in my book. Very affordable esp if you get the taco plate you can get them down to three dollars each and def lower priced then the typical Chicago gourmet taco or burger joints.Only thing was that it does get a little noisy and stuffy in there. They must try to get better vents. Otherwise, I would come here again and pair some good tacos and burgers with my own brew.

This place is so amazing!! I went there Saturday night with friends and we all loved it! It was not busy at all (which is crazy based on how delicious it is) and we were able to hang out and have good conversation. The server was very attentive and the menu has so many good choices that I had to try 3 things! All were equally delicious. I highly recommend this place and I will definitely be coming back!

The menu options at this place are great!I love how they offered all the burgers on their menu in mini sizes which were $4.50 each and comes with delicious fries! The burgers were delicious and so worth the price. I would come back for the burgers alone. The presentation was also very cute! See all the pictures!I did however think the tacos were a little overrated. Although the T&B and shrimp taco were good and the presentation was nice, I wasn't blown away by the taste.I also did not like the crab Mac and cheese. It tasted bland and the consistency was very watery :(The service here is really great. The waitress was so smile-y I couldn't stop smiling at her either :) :) :) What a lovely lady!The chefs and owners of this place seem to take very good care of the restaurant. The place was a lot bigger than I expected and very clean. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to those in the area.

When:  We had reservations for 7:00pm on a Saturday night.  It was mostly empty when we arrived and were seated immediately.Drinks:  It's BYOB so we brought along our own supplies.Food:  We ordered the T&B, Steak, and Pork Belly tacos.  We also ordered the mini burgers as it was a special that night.  We went with truffle fries and an order of chips and guacamole.  Everything was excellent, but it was way too much food for two.  The chips are homemade and flavorful, all the tacos were fantastic, and the burgers were perfectly cooked.

I'm a proud Albany Park resident.  I personally have witnessed many establishments, at this very same address, failed to make it through.  However, I felt that T & B Grill is here to stay!  Their menu is simple, yet it's done with a creative twist.Yes, the "T" stands for "tacos," and the "B" stands for "burgers."  I tried their T&B burger.  The burger patty is made out of bison, along with shrimps, avocado, and chorizo bits.  It was delicious and satisfying.  I haven't seen crispy chorizos on a burger before, but it really added some texture to the burger.Hubby had the veggie burger.  I told him about this place that serves vegetarian entrees.  He said he would definitely go back for their veggie burger, or their tacos.I saw the adjacent table order the Mac & Cheese, along with a mini burger.  Everything I saw coming from the kitchen was a work of art!  I really should have visited this place when they first opened.  What took me so long to realize that this BYOB corner joint was this awesome?Fortunately, I live one (1) block away from T & B.  Often times a paid parking spot on Lawrence Ave. is difficult to find.  If you choose to drive, Argyle, two (2) blocks north, has free parking.
The steak, Duck and Pork Belly Tacos were on point!

Lovely place. Great tasting tacos. We tried one of each tacos except for the veggie one. Our favorites were the shrimp and pork belly, followed by the fish. The duck, steak and chorizo were all good, but over salted. The tacos contained very fresh ingredients and bright flavors. We ended up ordering seconds on the shrimp and pork belly.We also tried the sweet potato fries and free check-in beignets. Both were very fresh. We will be back!

Lawrence Ave Restaurant Crawl! I continue the journey down Lawrence ave from Cicero to lake michigan. Next up is T & B Grill. Not much to look at the decor?...well there isn't any. The service is excellent. The guacamole was one of the best savory. The chips were thick and different and I liked it. Ordered three taco's a bit on the expensive side but they were huge so not so bad. Fish, Steak and Shrimp all excellent so much protein, i could have ordered two and been satisfied.

Found our favorite taco place in the city! The drive was totally worth it just for the home made cilantro tortillas on their own. Tried the duck, steak, shrimp, fish, and pork belly tacos and all were great. Guac and chips were very flavorful too. We'll definitely be back!!!

I promised myself that after the 2nd time I was going to write a review, I live in the area and decided to try this place a few months back and my taste buds were so happy after the first time I had to find a reason to go back. Service is always amazing, food presentation is outstanding and the duck taco is quickly becoming my absolute favorite. The chorizo and pork belly tacos are also very very good, lowest rated item would be the fish taco, although good, does not even compare to the rest of the menu. The classic burger and the spice burger are also heavenly when you bite into them. This is a little hidden gem in my neighborhood that's started to get noticed. As others have mentioned, it's byob, so it also has that going for it. $ is an absolute bonus, 4 for $12 tacos special is always good.One of these days I'm going to leave room in my tummy for dessert, cause they all sound amazing as well.

Good food with good price, I would like to introduce you the amazing Mexican place.We were near by and found it 5star on Yelp then tried the special of the day.I've never taste the sprouts like this, taste excellent with the special sauce~ it was amazing!Will come back to try more dishes^.*

T and B grill may just prepare the very best tacos I have ever eaten. The atmosphere is cozy and casual. The service is friendly and efficient. Most importantly, the food is so fresh and well prepared. The green tortillas are beautiful and delicate serving as a base for tasty fish and chicken tacos. Prices are a bargain for extremely high quality tacos. This place is a must for any taco lover or for anyone desiring a really good meal at reasonable prices,

So my lovely bride provided an excellent review of T&B Grill but they deserve a second 5-star rating.Friendly staff with big smiles on a crappy day (mostly due to being Hangry!) good simple food, flexibility in wanting half orders of fries so we could sample more.A great stop if you are nearby

Color me impressed. This place appeared to me as a savior after the food fail I experienced yesterday. Everything about this place was as good as it looked in the photos and honestly, it restored my faith in humanity (a little).T&B Grill sits cozily on the corner of Lawrence and Lawndale. Parking is pretty easy to find with a lot of parking meters on Lawrence. Walking in, it had a nice atmosphere with a cool mural of the Bean to the right wall and another mural of colorful corn on the back wall. Immediately my gf and I were greeted and seated by one of the nicest servers I've ever had.I ordered the T&B burger with a duck taco (had to try it), while my gf ordered a mini T&B Burger and a fish taco, both orders coming with a side of truffle fries. Although we didn't order the tacos as appetizers, they came out first as if they were and it was a pleasant change up seeing as how we were famished. I'm so glad I tried the duck taco, the meat was tender and succulent while the pickled cabbage and sauce complimented the meat for a refreshing, vibrant flavor. By the time the burgers came out, my gf and I were ready for more flavor bombs.The burgers themselves were delicious. On it were a bison patty, shrimp, guac, chorizo, pepper jack cheese, all on a brioche bun. After the first bite only one word came to mind, DELICIOUS. The truffle fries were super on point too, and it came with so many. After we finished we were so satisfied and stuffed yet how we felt in our stomachs did not reflect on the bill (which was a good thing). For 2 burgers, 2 tacos, 2 sets of (what seemed like bottomless) truffle fries, and exceptional service, it came out to about $30. Well worth it.This places gets 5 stars, an A+, 10/10, etc. Highly recommend this place as it serves good food, gives great service, and really gives you a bang for your buck!

What a hidden gem! The waitress was very hospitable and nice with the kids. She even gave them crayons to color with. They had a mini burger and crab Mac to share and my friend enjoyed her taco platter with hand cut fries. Can't wait to go back and try the desserts! Best part, it's BYOB!

So glad I finally got to try this place. The Crab Mac n Cheese is a must try! Also tried the t&b (shrimp) and fish taco which were also very tasty.Friendly staff and good service, I will definitely come back. I want to try the rest of the taco selections as well as the mini burgers.

The name doesn't say much.That's ok, because their food and service speak volumes.I could eat tacos here every day if I could.T&B isn't an old, greasy-spoon taqueira. It's upbeat and clean inside. The servers are really superb.The food is traditional yet modernized, with new flavors and dressings, but not minimalist junk you get in trendy neighborhoods, either.

This is one of the neighborhood gems of Albany Park! I have lost count of how many times I've eaten there, but each time is fantastic!  Everyone I've ever brought with me has asked to go back. The food is delicious, bursting with fresh flavor combinations that explode on your tastebuds. Tacos and Burgers Grill as a name for the restaurant belies the menu inside! Don't skip this one!
Bomb Tacos and amazing mini burgers. I didnt have too many expectations considering the neighborhood and how spare the crowd was. But the food was legit good. Going back again.

Wow, LOVE THIS PLACE. We got there 8 Mintues to close and they served us.  I thought for sure we had half an hour, which is still cutting it close, however my party sat  before me because I was parking and they were nice enough to let us stay. I wanted to stay forever and continue eating .This place is amazing. When I saw the  five star review with over 200  + I was skeptical but I'll tell you what this place deserves it and then some. Fish taco blackend ,crispy ,cooked to perfection. Bison mini burger  with shrimp and guacamole so succulent with a side of sweet potato dusted with the perfect amount of cinnamon and sugar. Pork belly habanero,pineapple tacos. Wow this cook is amazing. I had a steak with fried eggs the white was runny so the manager /waiter came back and  brought them back thinking upon the return it would be over cooked yoke, nope perfect and runny just the way I love it. Nice order of Brussels sprouts cooked to perfection. With bacon that was cooked the way I like it crispy meat and golden fat . Might as well die happy. As my dad said, "who wants to live forever"
The duck tacos......
