Fantastic food, reasonably priced, BYOB, neat and clean. What more can you ask for? Friendly service? Check. On street parking? Check. Recommend you try them out.
This place is on point with both their burgers and tacos.  They have some of the best specialty tacos I've had!  We are new to the area and have all intentions of making this place our 'go to' spot!

Forgot those frou frou taco joints in Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Albany Park is legit! Just go the extra mile and eat here instead.Freshly made taco wrappers definitely gives it the soft texture that makes a good taco. Add some protein, sauce and slaw and you got yourself a gourmet taco. It is definitely up on the list of best not-so Mexican taco places in the city! Yes, I said it, in the CITY.I ordered a bunch of tacos from Duck Confit, T&B and fish. They were beautifully presented and good portion size. I ate the fish taco and there's a lot going on, it's a grilled piece of meat so it's healthier than the deep fried ones (though I like those too).Also ordered a round of mini T&B sliders. Each mini-burger comes with it's own side of fries. I tried all three and my favorite were the sweet potato - crunchy on the outside, creamy and sweet inside. Ask for aioli and you have 4 options to choose from at no additional cost. Burger cooked at medium was perfectly medium. Inside sits a piece of shrimp and guac, this tiny burger is incredibly quite filling.Tiramisu with blackberry sauce served on a chilled marble cutting board is excellent as well. At $4, can't go wrong.I forgot to mention we were here on a Sunday and they serve brunch too - a meat and veggie option, chilaquiles, chips and guac. It's not on the menu, but I think they're starting a brunch too.Space is great, high ceilings, cool giant mural of the "Bean" and large windows. Good staff and plenty of seating. If this place opened in Wicker, I am certain there would be a line out the door. The only unfortunate thing is the name, T&B Grill. Had I just saw the name alone, I think of those little shops that sell frozen patties, chicken nuggets and fries, quickly fried or griddled in a seedy neighborhood. Nothing wrong with that except T&B uses all fresh ingredients. Definitely coming back here to get my fill of tacos and sweet potato fries.What you wanna go now?!?!?! Let's go!!

Honestly, there was not one bad part to our dining experience here!1.) make a reservation on yelp, it's convenient, and the restaurant was very accommodating even though we arrived 15 minutes early2.) There is plenty of pay to park street parking across from the restaurant3.) go to the liquor store next door, and pick up some liquor. This place is BYOB, and they don't charge you a fee!4.) order the TACOS! These were some of the best tacos I have ever had. They are very unique and flavorful. The chorizo and shrimp taco were sooo good.5.) you should definitely order a burger as well. The best part is they have 2 sizes for their burgers, so we didn't have to commit to only getting a burger and were able to order lots of different things. We also had the truffle fries, and the sweet potato fries which of course did not let us down either.

I recently ordered a takeout meal from T & B Grill, a fairly new joint on Lawrence that serves "Mexican and American fusion."  The service was pleasant and relatively quick, and the dining area is decorated by a colorful mural of the "Bean" - the landmark Cloud Gate sculpture of Millennium Park.I ordered a "T" (duck taco) and a "B" (turkey burger) to go.  The duck taco was tasty but not your average taco coming out of one of the many taquerias that line Lawrence Avenue.  This taco comes with duck leg confit and a cup of green salsa, though the meat was flavorful enough without the salsa.  The turkey burger was good, with a very thick patty of turkey meat.  The toppings included a blob of cooked spinach, which to me did not seem to mesh well with the burger as it seemed to just sit there.  The tomato slice and the swiss cheese worked out better (what happened to the onion rings??), and the pretzel bun was satisfying and for the most part withstood the soppiness of the spinach pile.  The burger is accompanied by fries, which I upgraded to sweet potato fries for a slight upcharge.  The spicy ketchup is good, but the fries were very good and did not need much enhancement.  They also offer mini versions of their gourmet burgers, so you might want to mix and match if you want to try several kinds of burgers in one shot.

Are there lastnite with family for mom's birthday.... Good was really good! I had the tb taco, steak taco and fish taco... All three were really good! Including MacBook cheese shrimp crab with bacon for appetizer with family... All was worth whileTo go and eat! There... Only issue we had since we had big group of 12 they need work on how to handle party of 12... Other than that the food was so worth it!

Love this place. Incredibly friendly service, and the tacos are fantastic. I've heard good things about the burgers as well, though in my three visits I haven't been able to tear myself away from the taco side of the menu.The aguas frescas are all fantastic and refreshing.

This place was absolutely delicious!! The have a variety of tacos and burgers seasoned to perfection.  The great thing is they have regular sized burgers and mini versions of al burgers for $5.  We ordered two mini burgers, three tacos(shrimp, duck, pork belly), shrimp mac n cheese, and the guac.  Everything was so delicious! The tortillas were jalapeno tortillas and the chips for the guac were chipolte and jalapeno chips. They were thicker and tasted really good. Everyone raved about the truffle fries, but I honestly thought the sweet potato fries were so much better.  The server was also awesome and very attentive.  Also, byob is always a plus.
Really awesome place for vegan stuff... They have tons of vegan options, especially if you have a bigger group and let them know a couple days prior..Loved the tacos..

Surprise. Don't expect a normal grill menu.Specializes in tacos and burgers. But not traditional ones. Unique fresh taste And presentation. Menu is limited but everything our group tried was great!Our waiter was helpful and friendly. Dinner took  a little while to get but the wait was worth it.I recommend t&g

My other half and I loved the food! They lost a star for the long wait. In the end it was totally worth it though. Our waitress was efficient and friendly. I jumped right in on the tacos - steak, chorizo, and veggie. All delicious. The homemade tortillas and the salsas really put it over the top. My fiancé had the duck quesadilla and was just as impressed. I would highly recommend you give this place a try. We will be back!

A solid place for burgers, but I was a little underwhelmed. I got the T&B burger with a beef rather than bison patty and substituted sweet potato fries for the side. I wasn't a huge fan of how the burger came with chili, which overwhelmed the shrimp and avocado flavors; however, the patty itself was generously thick and juicy. The sweet potato fries, while also solidly executed, weren't anything out of the world.Friendly service and good food--I liked the variety of unique options the menu offered, but I wasn't as amazed by the food as the reviews seemed to suggest I would be.

Okay...so we leave the Emerald City Coffee spot and I'm like..."let's take the train to this place I read about on Yelp that got great reviews"."Uh, where is it?""I don't know...ya'll live here...it's down on Lawrence...unless ya'll wanna get off the train and go see what all the Trump folks are up do?""PG, that's down in Albany Park...""Aaaand?  Do they not allow coloreds there?...LOL""No..we've never been there before.""Oh...so this will be fun...and just this ONE time I'll protect ya'll if something jumps off.  I have renounced the cap'n-sav-a-ho, white knight mentality, but I'll make an exception for you for this trip. LOL"."PG, not funny".What a long ass train ride!   We took the brown line from Chicago Grand, all the way to the end to the Kimball station.  I feel like it was light when we left and dark when we got there.  Damn.Then this long ass walk from Kimball station to the spot was like "ugh..."   Most of the places we saw on the way were pretty marginal to outright run down.  "PG, really...where are you taking us..?"Then there it was...T&B..like an Oasis in the desert...and boy it was WORTH IT!!!(Read JackeeM's review from February 26, when you get a chance),The restaurant was spacious, very cozy, nicely decorated, and playing old school hip hop in the background.  I was like "what?"Our hostess was a dreamy Latino lady..and YES she was checking me out!  LOL.  "PG, you're just gonna Mack like we're not sitting here."."Uh yeah, I'm "here" with ya'll, but I'm not here WITH ya'll... see?"  :)Anyhow...I had...ummm.. a Fish taco, a Duck taco,  some ginger beer (w/lemon-strawberry mix), and truffle fries.  Yes sir!!  Sooo freaking good!Little Mamma had the T&B taco and ate some of my truffle fries. (EXCUSE ME!!!)Little Mamma's homie had a mini turkey burger thingy and some sweet potato fries.Desert was these little round donuts sprinkled with cinnamon sugar and strawberry sauce, and I had a piece of chocolate tiramisu with a scoop of Ice Cream.OMG!I tell you that if you don't go to T&B Grill when you visit Chicago you done missed out, bros!

Great tasty place close to home. Have only been once but certainly plan on going back.Kids had burgers and absolutely inhaled them. Wife and I had a selection of the tacos on the menu and every one was fantastic. Plus- Saturday night was 3 tacos for $9, such a deal!Brought our own beer and there was no charge to open them, which was unexpected and appreciated. And our server practically had wings on her back she was so pleasant and smiley. We will return again and again.

Food was better then expected. I was thinking just regular burgers and tacos but they have a different selection. They have fish tacos, duck taco, etc. Their burgers seem to have a splash of excitement. Food was made with a twist that made it just better! Having something different rather then the same old regular stuff makes it boring. This place was a breathe of fresh air with the different style tacos.

This is a very nice little restaurant with very good food properly good and great service.  Food arrived in a reasonable time.  The only reason I do not give them five stars was due to an additional charge of $1.50 per person "cork fee."  The restaurant is BYOB so we brought some beers along and the waitress did offer to bring a small bucket of ice to keep it cold.  A nice gesture, but it should have been made clear they would charge for this service.

This place is a true gem for the neighborhood. The service was amazing, very attentive & patient with us and our 4 year old son. The guacamole and chips are very fresh, I particularly liked that the chips were homemade. Tacos and burgers are all delicious and the price is reasonable. I think my favorite were the fish tacos, its hard to say cuz they were all so good. Too bad we're moving out of the neighborhood but this place will make me travel back!

First off -- the service is amazing and our waitress is so sweet and friendly! super plus!For the food:T&B Taco and Fish Taco -- they look amazing but the flavor might be lacking just a little. However, each taco does have a good amount of shrimp/ fish -- so it's okay overallT&B burger (mini) with truffle fries -- the bison patty is juicy and very flavorful. I enjoyed this a lot more than the tacos. This has shrimp, chorizo and guac on top of the patty which were good additions. Yummy burger!  &not dry!The mini burger was good but it was $5 + $1 for the truffle fries -- it's good to try but I wouldn't come again if I was hungry and not looking to spend a lot of money on tacos and small burgers

An unexpected gem in the neighborhood. Yes, you can get truffle fries in Albany Park!This spot has quickly become a family favorite. My oldest son gets the cheeseburger with sweet potato fries, my youngest son gets a veggie quesadilla while my wife and I work our way through the burger options. The classic is my favorite, it's one of the best bacon cheeseburgers in the city. And yes, I've been to all the usual suspects. This place holds their own quite well.
Just moved to the neighborhood and have already been here twice! Had a burger the first time, tacos the second. Both were exquisite! This place is gonna be huge!

So delish!!  Best fish tacos.  Wonderful light crispy crunchy coating on them. Very affordable. Sliders scrumptious. Quac with homemade chips soooo good!! Husband thought chips a little greasy but I liked them. More for me!!;)
Love this place!!! I used to live walking distance from T&B and it was the sad to move away. But I make it a point to return at least once a month. Who am joking, almost every week!

I can't believe I never tried this fantastic gem on Lawrence Ave.Went here for dinner with a couple of new friends and my fiance the other night.There are GF options, meatless options, and so much more. I tried a duck taco, a fish taco, and a shrimp taco (the t&b taco). Every one was fantastic. The duck was surprisingly my favorite, followed by the shrimp taco which is delightfully spicy, and the fish taco was great as well and very generous on the fish portion.Everything tasted fresh and bright and well thought-out. The tortillas were so cute and clearly handmade!!The service was a little slow because they were surprisingly packed for a Tuesday, but it was noooooo problem. The environment was simple, clean, and cool. The bathrooms were super clean as well which was an awesome surprise. All this and BYOB means that I will definitely be back again and again.

Best tacos in the city and great service. The T and B taco may be the best shrimp taco I've had. The veggie burger and fries are also great. The Brussel sprouts and mac and cheese don't quite live up to the rest of their stellar menu.
Great place for tacos! The pork belly with pineapple was particularly good. My boyfriend loved the T and B taco. The sweet potato fries were great too.

Went here for lunch, I live around this area so my BF and I tried it. The service was great, they were very friendly. I really enjoyed eating their tacos, I tried 4 of them and it's pretty good! Will come back to try other food :)

Wow! Taco's and burgers,  AKA...T&B..We ordered guacamole to start, served with homemade slightly spicy green and brown chips. Excellent!  My son had the classic mini burgers and fries..demolished.I had the quesodillas with veggies, great. Hubby had chorizo tacos. Two bites and gone. It's a BYOB  (liquor store next door).Service was great.Can"t wait to come back!

Stumbled in after a rough beating from the snow, too many brunch offerings at previous restaurants, & way over hungry... Soon truffle fries graced our table & slowly my inner hulk faded as each bite solved life's problems. After a quick jaunt next door to the Liquor store (BYOB!) to further eradicate my lack of personally (if you've ever been hangry you'll understand) for a bottle of wine & why not?!? Shortly after my glass was full & numerous tacos graced our table. Thank you T&B for saving our family Valentine Day! Added bonus, the donuts drizzled in both chocolate & raspberry sauce didn't hurt either.

This is something beyond chic or "Hot" as described in yelp.The maccaroni and cheese with lobster, its something you only enjoyed in fine dining!The Guacamole and chips elevates to the next level.We were a group of 7,.they didn't automatically include the gratuity( an act i believe should be the gold standard )-guess what they got 25% from me.The manager, incredible. He was the one who serves our water-bottom less!He even include the coffee FREE with the desert.All the tacos they served is within the price range of any taco place you go but the preparation, presentation and taste that's when you imagine Armstrong ( the cyclist ) separates himself from the pack!I cant think of anything that i didn't enjoy my experience in this place.

Ordered delivery from here today. I tried the mole enchiladas with rice and beans, guacamole & horchata. I have to say delivery came quick! I only waited about 30 mins which is pretty darn good. Nice amount of chicken stuffed in to fresh what taste like homemade tortillas.I loved the mole it is definitely worth the try! Guacamole was delicious but I have to say the horchata was my favorite. They put like a chocolate syrup to top it off and it really does the trick. I would like to maybe dine here one day now that I've tried it out. I did spend quite a bit but that's usual with good quality food.

What a cute little Mexican fushion spot in Albany Park! It's clean, the servers were so attentive and nice, small creative menu, and it's BYOB! There's a liquor store just east of T&B if you're like me and realize, while you're parking the car, that your booze is sitting in a bag on the counter at home. The restaurant wasn't crowded at all for 7p on Friday, but good for us because we were hungry. From what it sounds like, everything is fresh. Nothing frozen and thawed. Another plus!I ordered, and would repeat order, the shrimp taco and a fish taco. The fish ranks a little higher only because the aioli on the shrimp taco was a tad too spicy for me. I tasted more spice than the shrimp, but the shrimp was well cooked. Overall, everyone at the table felt the spices were worked into the meats quite well. My toddler gave his plain mini burger a thumbs up. The truffle fries is crack! Soooooo good!! I could have that, a taco, my BYOB, and sleep very happy.3 adults & 1 toddler ordered 7 tacos, truffle parm fries, a mini burger (comes with plain fries), crab mac n cheese (it was "ok"), pistachio ice cream, and (free with Yelp check-in) tiramisu. The bill, with tax, was $45. You'll have to check it out.

Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!Such friendly staff - they made me wanna return even before we got the food - and the food wad amazing!  Best veggie tacos ever, best fish tacos ever! (Not exaggerating). Also had some truffle fries to start with --- mmmmm, what a treat.  Best casual eats I've had in a while, we will definitely be back -- can't wait to try the weekend brunch items.  Oh - and BYOB with a smile!   My only suggestion/hope as they settle in would be to expand the menu a bit, especially to add an appetizer section, like some guacamole/chips or nachos or similar.All in all, a great find, tasty, clean, comfortable, friendly -- welcome to the neighborhood!

Not bad duck, fish, and carne asada tacos. Awesome that they serve duck. Tasty, yes but really nothing special. Slightly overrated. Presented as a "higher-end" taco but many street taco counterparts are better. Seems as if care went into the preparation. Fat was trimmed off of the meat nicely (or meat was nicely chosen). Too much sauce. Barely any cabbage. Very, very, skimpy on the meat. Concept not very unique. Simple (although simple isn't bad). Would be worth it if portions were fair and sauce was not heavy. All protiens were cooked nicely. Food was seasoned well. Price compared to portion is shameful (especially in that neighborhood & in Illinois). Tortillas nice and fresh but small. Guacamole was good but overpriced. Fresh (like all other good taco spots). Creative but mimics an overdone food truck concept.Overall, should have more of a humble approach to what is offered.When it comes to tacos it just comes to freshness, great meat, and flavor... This being said, you can find great and "fairly" priced tacos in Chicago and T&b Grill is not that spot. There are many other places that offer tacos that are not skimpy, of quality meat, complimented by great salsas, and made with fresh ingredients.This place is not bad but definitely doesn't impress when it comes down to fulfilling hunger with some great tacos... This place will leave some realizing that they were better off going to a well worth it taco spot instead.Taco's were almost there but they missed the mark and the place seems more like a business concept.If changes are made than this pace would be worth another try, if not than search on if your looking for great tacos...

I love this place! The tacos are sooo good! I love their chips and guac. So homemade and delicious. The burgers are good too and I like that you can try a big burger in a mini size if you're not that hungry!
Amazing duck and fish tacos. Steak and shrimp were ok. Have to go thre again to try out their mini burgers.

My family just tried out T&B Grill in Albany Park. We live nearby and we're always excited to try new places in the neighborhood.Everything was great! My wife, a vegetarian really loved their veggie burger with sweet potato fries. My daughter had the turkey burger and enjoyed it. I had the T&B burger and it was excellent!The service was top notch.I highly recommend T&B!

Amazing. When I walked into T & B Grill following a recommendation I was blown away by the quality of the food. I had the Spice Burger with sweet potato fries and shared a Chipotle Hanger Steak Taco with someone. First off, the taco was amazing, a mix of a traditional taco infused with a more modern fusion flavor that Chicago is used to (think Antique Taco in Wicker Park, but better.)The Spice Burger was wonderful, habanero aioli, a fried egg, thick burger patty and pretzel bun. I would recommend this for anyone who comes in.The service was lovely as well, Monica was our waitress and she was enthusiastic and very kind with us as we paced through the menu.This restaurant represents what I hope is coming to Albany Park (more specifically Lawrence between Pulaski and Kedzie) great food and lovely service. Keep up the great work guys!

Stopped in here for a quick dinner after a Cubs game. So glad we stopped. The chips and guacamole were the best we've ever had. I had three different tacos, all flavored perfectly. My husband tried one of the burgers which he says was also amazing. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town. Points also on very friendly service and a very reasonable price.

tacos are phenomenal. having 4 right now. Shrimp, Fish, Chorizo, and Duck. can't wait to come back and try the burgers and fries! lovely service as well. music is good and at a nice level for dining / talking.

What an awesome neighborhood spot! The food was delish (easily at the tastiness level of B-town/WP/LSq), the staff was super friendly, and it's BYOB!I had the uber tasty veggie burger and "regular" fries. (Ain't nothin' regular about them. They're coated with what I can only imagine to be crack, because I couldn't stop scarfing them.)Hubs had a T&B mini burger (which he loved), a duck and a fish taco (also loved), and the sweet potato fries (also crack).All of this, I might add, was under $20. Mind blown.Can't wait to go back for dinner and brunch!

Pretty sure the T & B in T & B Grill stands for terrific and brilliant! I came here because of the high reviews on Yelp and the restaurant did not disappoint. Me and my girl split a T&B Burger, two T&B Tacos, and two Chipotle Steak Tacos. The avocados that came inside the entrees were fresh and the meats were cooked to juicy perfection. Highly recommend the T&B tacos, never had a taco taste quite as  flavor packed as those. The sweet potato fries were a perfect compliment to the burger and it also came in a generous portion so that's a plus. It wasn't just a meal, it was an experience. Will definitely be coming back here again.

T&B Grill has my admiration, they are trying creative things and doing them well. The service was friendly and fast, the hostess was super nice and personable.Tacos were delicious, we tried the duck and steak/chorizo mix, salsa verde was very tasty as well. Presentation was nice, the tacos came out on a wooden cutting board. House made green tortillas with cilantro and jalapeño were unique. I'd definitely return to try the daily specials and a burger. The menu seemed very ambitious with a good variety. Interesting concept, I'd encourage anyone to try them out. Glad they're in the neighborhood.

I was presently surprised by this restaurant. The food was absolutely AMAZING. Everything was excellent. Try the shrimp tacos, they were my favorite. The fish taco and steak taco were also fantastic. The classic burger was also really good.The service was excellent and very attentive. We will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the near future!!!
Great atmosphere, BYOB, original and tasty tacos, good service.. Less than par chips and limited menu.. Best Latin place in Chicago so far for me :)

This place was delicious! I had the jalepeno cheddar burger with a turkey patty with sweet potato fries. Ugh it was so good! I also ordered quesadillas for my kids to share. It was a very large portion and I tried some and they were so good! The portion sizes are big and the presentation is fancy!The only thing I would say that kinda stinks is the restaurant didn't have air conditioning and it was really hot in there. I'm not lowering my stars for this because I'm not sure if they actually had AC but didn't have it on or maybe it wasn't working? They are a 7mo old restaurant, so maybe that's something that will change in the future. Regardless, I will be back and I will be spreading the word of this great neighborhood restaurant!

Heads up people....T &B is still BYOB but now they charge you a corkage fee.  We just had dinner and brought 2 beer bottles and were charged $1.50 each. That is just CRAZY TALK!   Next time we might just drink water while we're there or go some place else.  That said,  their food and desserts are amazing!

The shrimp taco is a must!!! All their aioli sauces that come with burgers and tacos are full of flavor. Their burgers are super delicious and you can get them in mini size with a side of fries. Their delicious  guacamole is made from scratch. The OJ is freshly squeezed at $3.50 a 16oz glass is a steal. Our tab for 3 tacos, guacamole, steak and eggs and mini burgers with fries $40.00!!! Come try! Your belly will be happy!!

Basically drooling as I write this...  First time trying T&B was earlier this week.  Will be moving closer to the area soon and wanted to try some new places nearby.  After reading through some others' reviews, I was super stoked to stop in and give this place a go.We were promptly greeted, seated, and brought a carafe of water as soon as we walked in.  Very friendly & polite host.  He energetically explained some things on the menu after learning this was our first time here.I ordered three tacos - one chorizo, one duck, one pork belly.  My girlfriend ordered a mini jalepeno burger w/ fries and a shrimp taco.  Took a bit longer than expected for the food to come out, seeing as we were one of 3 tables seated at the time.  But, the food was undeniably well worth the wait.The duck was moist and incredibly flavorful, the chorizo was nice and crispy with just the right amount of chipotle aioli, and the pork belly (my favorite) was pure perfection - a thick seared cut complimented with a juicy slice of pineapple and habenaro aioli.  Tried a bite of the jalepeno burger - loved the kick, and was cooked to a precise medium-rare.  Also loved that they offer "mini" burgers as well, prepared exactly the same as the regular 1/2lb version!  You can get the best of both taco / burger worlds without having to roll yourself out the door when you're through.And all for under $20 w/ tax!Also, a BYOB place with a liquor store right next door? Awesome.Seriously, this place sets the bar pretty high for other Latin fusion taco spots.  Can't wait to stop in again try some other offerings on the menu!

Checked out this place for a quick brunch while in the area. The service was exceptional and the food was great. We ordered steak tacos (had a sauce on it which I was not a fan of but that's just me), french fries which were absolutely delicious with seasonings on them, and the french toast with raspberry sauce was my favorite. The food was served soon after we ordered, not sure if it was because the restaurant was not too busy.There was ton of parking available on the street, will definitely visit again.
Presentation, taste, quality and price was just right. Exceptional food. T & B is definitely a must try.

Update! Still awesome, they now have chorizo on the menu as well as quesadillas. Every time our parents come to visit we take them to T&B. They have also started to develop their dessert menu and it has some pretty tasty offerings. I've also tried 3 of the burgers now and they are phenomenal. I was very impressed with their mini burgers/sliders, most places they are just an after thought but T&B is the first place that actually asked me how I wanted me mini burger cooked! Plus you get a full order of fries.

Found them on Yelp. Super happy We tried them out since they had 5 stars. We are from California and brought our friends that are local. We all loved the food. Great flavors & the service was awesome. We shared both the tacos & burgers.. My favorite was the chipotle steak taco & chorizo taco..

This place is fabulous!I had the shrimp taco and a couple of the mini burgers. EVERYTHING was very tasty. My friend had the turkey burger and I thought that was the best of the bunch. Sweet potato and their regular house fries are excellent as well.Friendly service as well.I'll be going back!

I've been here twice and really enjoyed both times. The atmosphere is casual and the service is friendly, and  the food is seriously tasty. Tacos and burgers--but innovative flavors and interesting pairings. Think duck or pork  belly tacos, bison burgers with rock shrimp, pickled red onions, various aioli dressings...fresh cut sweet potato or truffle oil fries....this is not your ordinary taco place!!!! Even the tortilla chips are a cut above: they are homemade and have a subtle bite of jalapeño that perfectly complement the freshly made chunky guacamole. Even the creme brûlée is a cut above with a subtle almond tint. Great food and BYOB...ill be back.

This place has been on my "to-try" list for awhile, but you can't throw a rock without hitting a taco place in my neighborhood, so I didn't really expect to be impressed.  This place was a pleasant surprise.I had the brussel sprouts, every taco on the menu, the cucumber mint ginger beer and tiramisu.  My favorites were the pork belly and duck taco.  Too yummy!  They were running a special of 3 tacos for $9 which made it really affordable to sample the menu.Our waitress was also very sweet and pleasant.  Maybe next time I'll try the burgers.

This restaurant was recommended by a friend and I am so glad she did. We started with the guacamole and chips which were delicious.We ordered a variety of tacos and could not decide which we liked the best because they were all wonderful. We finished our meal with chocolate beignets dipped strawberry puree that were mouth watering! The service was attentive and friendly.I have recommended this restaurant to friends who loved it as much as we did.

Was recommended by a patient of ours while taking his blood at 4am and just started talking about Yelp so saw reviews and pictures and wellDELICIOUS, I love it. I'm not a big burger fan but the minis are perfect! Steak, shrimp, duck taco are all good the truffle fries, lawwrdd I mean I loved them! My guy goes for the sweet potatoe ones , delish as well! Service is great too. Just wish there's was more then Coke/pop products maybe some sweet tea! Otherwise fav new spot!
I never write Yelp reviews, but this place is SO GOOD. Hands down, the best tacos I've ever had. And burgers/fries are fantastic.

Food was good, didn't serve alcoholic beverages but there's a liquor store next door and it's BYOB (didn't take advantage of that) but we know for next time. Burgers are juicy! And tacos were good but it was a little pricey, would go back again.
Hidden gem of Albany Park. The chips and guac are fire.

I had the distinct pleasure of trying the Urbanbelly Ramen and the Pork and Pineapple. The ramen was well balanced, the broth spicy but not overbearing. It was creamy without being heavy, and the noodles held up well in the broth.The pineapple and pork combo was simply a delight - sweet and savory! The garnishes used in the dish were well received, the pork belly cubes tender and flavorful, with the sweet pineapple rounding out the dish nicely. the crispy onions added a welcome texture contrast to the rest of the dish.Overall, both dishes were amazing. I also had the passion fruit lemonade. Loving the refills!

We ordered delivery to our hotel. The food showed up pretty late. They provided no utensils for us to eat with.Got the Urban Belly Ramen and the Asian Bolognese. Asian Bolognese was too sweet for my taste. Urban belly Ramen was ok, but nothing too exciting. Maybe my experience would be different if I ate in the restaurant.... especially if we had silverware or chopsticks. I can't tell you how hard it is to eat noodles with your fingers.

Urbanbelly was good, but pretty underwhelming for its hype.Decent service, decent food, decent price for a restaurant in West Loop. We got the Urbanbelly Ramen, which included curry-like-based broth, ramen noodles, pork belly, and a soft boiled egg. The bowl may look large, but most of it was just soup. The flavor of the broth was pretty strong/tasty, and slightly spicy, but I'm finding it hard to describe what the flavor actually was. The pork belly and egg were both prepared nicely.

Loved the phat rice. Pork belly, more pork, and fried rice. Had some duck dumplings too. But I would come back for that phat rice. It's easy to share the fried rice because of the big portion, but if you truly believe, you can make it your personal fried rice.I would skip the Urbanbelly Ramen. Just because there is pork belly in it, doesn't make it fabulous. I think they went overboard on the broth. Of the dozens and dozens of the other ramen joints, I've never seen this dark cloudy pink broth concoction until eating here. And it didnt taste that good either. Also there was just way to much broth for the amount of noodles given, or maybe they just didn't put enough ramen noodles in the bowl.I'm also not a fan of the whole paying first, and tipping first experience. I mean, I had to pour my own water and if I wanted some more beer, I had to go to the front and order it there, so it took out the whole service experience.

Urbanbelly never disappoints! Everytime I come here I try something new and it's always super delicious, and refreshing. What I like most about this place is their quality consistency. I have never left unsatisfied! The flavor combos are always on point.

Yum yum yum! After a day of dancing I needed something hearty. Thank goodness this place was nearby! Got the urban belly phat noodles. Damn! It had all types of meat. Beef, chicken and pork lol. Just what I needed. It was delicious! The flavors went well and then to top it off, they had a good array of sauces. The noodles were nice and thick. I really enjoyed my meal (my plate was empty lol... Ate that Thang like whoa).  Then I got the donuts! That was okay! It was a nice little dessert but I definitely was full. It's a relaxed environment and you can eat indoors or outdoors. Great food. :)
Great Asian fusion spot. Very quick service, pretty good local beer (can) selection. Had the Phat noodles and sweet potatoe dumpling. Both were excellent! Great outdoor seating, very hip place!

Yelp reviews are about honesty, right? Well, I was honestly disappointed with Urbanbelly. Other Yelp reviews let me down.When I think of West Town Asian fusion BYOB places, I think of cheap food, decent quality, decent service, with kind of a hipster feel. Well, the only thing UrbanBelly has going for it is the hipster feel.I get it, your building rent is high. But, I hate when places don't give you enough food and I leave hungry. Not only was the food high priced, the beers were really high priced. Even though it may show up in your BYOB search, it is only BYOB for a small window of hours. The cork fee is like $20 otherwise!I got the duck dumplings which other yelpers recommended. I was not impressed. The flavor was actually kind of bland, and I liked the pork dumplings better.Service was also to be desired. You have to go all the way around to the front counter where you ordered it you want anything. And then the guys up there act really annoyed that you are asking them for help! Like hello, water is a basic need. I NEED WATER.I wont be coming back, and would say it's not worth your time either.

My first time here and eating Ramen.1) Outside patio is a 5. Its nicely decorated and secluded even though it is located by two busy streets (Ogden/Randolph). Self serve water and utensils are also a nice touch.2) Service was also good. Prompt service and clean up. No rush to leave and ordering went quickly (they give you a number and bring food to table).3) Food is OK. I ordered the Pork Belly Ramen and Edamame as appetizer.  The portion of Ramen was very generous and the egg therein was perfect. The Pork Belly was pretty good as well. The overall liquid portion was just ok. I would have preferred it be a little spicier (the chilly sauce did not help).  The Edamame was just ok as well. The portion was pretty small (but ok for the price). The spices were not quite working out. My GF has eaten here before and said that the Edamame was a little off as well, maybe it was just a bad day to have it.I'll likely come back to try some other choices on the menu.They have beer and its BYOB on Sundays I believe if you would like to do it.

Ramen was decent, phat rice was decent. Service was pretty good too. Belly lost stars because when I went to sit out on the patio, it was empty of people but almost every table was some type of dirty. We found one table that wasn't sticky or full of napkins and garbage to sit at. I thought it was odd too that a sever kept circling past the tables and not thinking to wipe them down. I would probably come back again and hopefully it would be a little more clean.
Went here for lunch and it was really good. I got the ramen and I'd have to say it's neck and neck with strings and high five ramen.

I came here for the second time, and am still a fan of the Urbanbelly Ramen! The broth is thick, creamy and rich without being too salty. You can easily split the huge bowl and also try out another dish--which I did, with the Phat rice. The Phat rice reminded me of Southeasian (Thai) street food, so I definitely found it to be overpriced at around $12-14 (my memory fails me) but it was still tasty. What made it even better was scooping some Urbanbelly Ramen broth into the rice with every bite--I suggest you try that!My friend also opted for the frozen beer. Only the "foam" part at the top was somewhat icey. It was essentially just regular beer.I've always loved the dining environment at Urbanbelly. The interior is clean, spacious, dimly lit and cool. Since it was a sunny day outside, however, my group opted to sit outside. It was nice, but really hot especially since I was sitting out in the sun.

This place has great ramen. I got the Ramen Jr. which was more than enough for one person, so I have to imagine the regular size is enormous. Their cocktails are actually pretty good too. It's casual dining - you order at a counter and it's communal seating, and this location also has a nice patio to enjoy during the warmer months. I'll definitely be back.
Friendly staff, awesome food. Definitely want to come back again! We went out of our way to come here (we live near the loop) and I'm glad we decided to do so!

New favorite lunch spot! The menu is simple and delicious, with options for dumplings, fried rice, ramen, and more! Craft beer & specialty items are also available for sale.When you walk in, you order at a counter and take a number to a table in the seating area. When you turn the corner, there are large tables equipped with silverware, Asian style condiments, and carafes of water, but even more amazing is the vertical garden! It adds life to the room and made the dining experience complete.Our food was brought out from the open kitchen as it became ready, which was quick!The duck dumplings were incredible, especially with a mixture of the two house condiments on the table.I ordered the half house ramen, thinking I'd just have something light... WRONG! I couldn't even finish it, but God knows I tried! It was creamy and flavorful, with a large piece of tender pork marinating in the broth.My boyfriend ordered a special with a curry zing! Again, tender meat, fresh veggies, and large noodles. Completely different flavor than the ramen, but equally delicious!The place was clean, our water was kept full, the staff was friendly. Can't wait to go back once the snow has melted so that I can sit on their patio.  :)

Inside the same building as BellyQ, but a different restaurant.  Tables long and would allow for big groups.  Food was delivered quick, but all other areas of service were sparse.  We tried the Phat Rice, Ramen, and a Pineapple-guava macaroon.  The rice was the best dish, 8/10, tad salty (it is fried rice after all), lemongrass chicken the best of the meats, pork belly very fatty (like 80%), and braised beef was tough and fatty.  The ramen smelled good and had a unique broth flavor, had 2 large pieces of unflavored pork belly (almost devoid of fat, contrary to that in the phat rice), but lacked noodles (extra were $2.50),  Lastly the pineapple-guava macaroon was 90% coconut shavings, and there wasn't enough of the pineapple-guava mixture in the middle to taste any.  Perhaps it was an off-day, but overall not reason enough to return.

Urbanbelly has won me over.+They have a good sized menu with many delicious sounding options. However it's not so expansive that it overwhelms you.+After ordering, you can grab a seat at any of their modern yet casual communal tables. Loved the chill atmosphere and also the design of the Urbanbelly dining area....so much so that I weirded out and took photos in front of this grassy, leafy wall. Then they bring your food out to you.+Love the open kitchen where you can stalk Chef Kim doing his thing.+Food came out really quickly which was great because I was starvvvvvvvin'.+Huge, huge portion. At first I scoffed at paying $17 (incl tip) for my $13 Urbanbelly Ramen---but I take all my cheapass mutterings back! This ramen is making 3 meals for me easily...probably 4.+The Wagyu Beef wontons ($7 for 4) were just alright. They were plated beautifully but they didn't blow me away. However they have some other dumplings I'd love to try in the future....Sweet potato potstickers, I'm looking at you!+Urbanbelly Ramen!!!! Must. Get. I've already raved over the giant size of this dish but now let me rave about the dish itself. Their signature ramen dish has a great balance of spices and flavor that made my urban belly so happy. It was filled with ramen noodles, two huge slabs of pork belly, an egg, and mushrooms all in a semi-creamy and semi-spicy broth. For me, this was total perfection in a ramen. I absolutely loved it.+Once you're done, if you have leftovers, they will take it in the back and wrap it up for you. We had buku leftovers.I've been to BellyQ and loved it so I'm really happy to see the more casual version didn't disappoint.

Loved this casual place adjacent to BellyQ last night!I was prompted to come in after watching "The best thing I ever ate" on the Food Network channel. They were doing their spicy episode and their kimchi stew was listed. So first, it is an off the menu item. Second, it's actually not that spicy. BUT.... it is very good! They use their spicy pork ramen broth which is very yummy, and then they add their kimchi to it which adds a little bit of a kick! I recommend it although I am excited to try their ramen next time!Also tried their phat rice which is a fried rice with pineapple, pork, and other yummy things in it!My husband thoroughly enjoyed our meal, and we cannot wait to come back!
First time having Asian fusion. It was so yummy. So close to my job, I'll def be a regular!!!!

I am still dreaming about this meal I had over the weekend....it was definitely one for the books! We originally tried going to Belly-Q, but since it was only 4:30 and they weren't opened yet, the hostess suggested that we try their sister restaurant Urban Belly. I am so glad we did!My boyfriend and I ordered way more food than we should have for just the two of us, but we got so excited reading the menu, there were things we just had to try! We both love a good Asian fusion menu, we couldn't resist! We went with the Korean Chicken wings, the Waygu and Cheddar dumplings, the Urbanbelly Ramen with chicken instead of pork, and the Asian Bolognese. The chicken wings were the weakest, but they were still yummy! There was a creamy horseradish sauce to dip them in that was very flavorful.  The dumplings also had a similar horseradish sauce on top of them, which gave them the perfect amount of spice. They were light, crispy, and delicious. Next, the ramen. The broth had a great flavor to it, and they even made it with chicken per our request. I was surprised because usually a chicken based broth falls weak on the flavor, but theirs certainly did not. The noodles had the perfect amount of bite to them also. Lastly, the Bolognese. This menu item was a thing of my dreams. It was truly amazing!!! They took their perfectly cooked, silky udon noodles, and topped them off with a delicious pork ragu. The sauce wasn't your traditional Bolognese though, it had an Asian kick to it that was unworldly. I will definitely be coming back for this dish!The only reason this isn't getting the full 5 stars is because of the service. We asked someone working for a ramen spoon when they dropped off the food, and were told he'd be right back with it. Instead, he proceeded to walk back and forth past us plenty of times without any spoon.

Very delicious and unique options. All hot food so a little difficult for summer. They share the space with bellyq. Only complaint were the gnats and giant fly that were all over. The gnats were giant and a concern for an indoor seating location.

Urban Belly is not authentic Asian food. Nor does it try to be in all fairness. But keep that in mind before you try this place out. To me, it is another hipstered out, Starbucked price restaurant that drains your wallet as you stare into the cool interior designs and fast paced environment. A culinary delight?Not in this case. So, I tried their Kim Chee Soup. I've had my fair share of this Korean staple. I remember when my friends and I would venture out to Ktown's local spots. So the  taste here is new, different. A strange, oily Frankenstein invention. Did I like it? It's hard to beat the original. It's like Taco Bell trying to pass off as Mexican food. Only difference here is the quality of meat was good but the taste just wasn't.I guess hipster mania is here to stay like that unwanted skin tag you need to rip out of society but if keeps growing. Or maybe people just are craving for something new. But we have to remember what quacks like a duck most of the time in hipster nirvana is just quacking LIKE a duck. That's all and you'll be fine.

I love everything about this place. The only thing I don't like is the fact that they don't have one in Virginia.I stumbled upon this place on Yelp and came here for dinner with a coworker during our business trip. Like everyone else said, there's free 2 hr parking right across the street making it super convenient to eat here. We walked in and immediately liked it. The atmosphere was trendy, chill, and relaxed. The decor is modern and adds to the ambiance.We ordered at the counter and decided to sit outside. I ordered the duck and pho spice dumplings, the urbanbelly ramen, and the peanut butter and jelly soft serve for dessert. My coworker got the pork and cilantro dumplings, the phat rice, and a side of kim chi. The ramen and dumplings came out super quick. The dumplings are a little pricey, 4 for $7.  But they were delicious. The duck was juicy, and the dumplings were fried perfectly. They're garnished with cucumbers and some grapefruit. The ramen was interesting. Good flavors, nice kick to it, and they give you 2 huge pieces of pork belly. Yum. I tried some of my coworkers phat rice as well, and I liked it a lot too. It was a fancy version of fried rice.The soft serve was a perfect ending to a perfect meal. The berry compote was delish, and the crunchy peanut butter worked so well with the ice cream. I'm still dreaming about that pb and j soft serve. The ramen portion was fairly large, I made my coworker finished some of it because I wanted to save room for dessert. We both walked out of there, extremely stuffed.There was a little confusion with the numbers they give you when you order. The waiter who brought out our food took our numbers away when we hadn't gotten all our food. Easy fix, the waitress who took our order walked by and we just let her know. She remembered everything we ordered and took care of the rest of it. Not a big deal to me, especially since the food and ambiance makes up for it. They also have a little station outside where you can get your own water (I actually don't mind getting my own water, that let's me get as much as I want. score.) And sauces. Belly Q, the restaurant it's connected to looked really cool as well. We almost came here again for dinner the next night. That's how good it was.Please, please, please come to Virginia! Until then, whenever I'm in Chicago, you will most definitely find me here for a dinner or lunch.

My experience with Urbanbelly was pretty out of the ordinary. While in Chicago for work, my colleagues/friends and I came to Urbanbelly for dinner. Because it was Superbowl Sunday, one of my associates asked if the restaurant had a TV (I couldn't care less about sports bowl). The manager was within earshot. And I guess because there were so few patrons in the restaurant, he offered up their tasting lounge for us to watch the game. To which I asked if it meant we would be ordering from their sister restaurant, BellyQ. He responded by handing me one of each menu and said, "feel free to order from either menu." Talk about accommodating! And really, I don't like to be catered to. The manager really went out of his way though, and I'm sure it was because it was such a slow night. Regardless, he didn't have to. He chose to. And we were very, very appreciative.Immediately, this was a really good experience. But then the food started to arrive, and a really good experience became a FANTASTIC experience. So much so, that I'll have to write a separate review for the BellyQ menu items I had.Let's start with the dumplings: I don't know which I enjoyed more, the duck & pho dumpling or the pork and cilantro. Both were very unique. I expected the duck dumplings to be heavy, but they're really not. And mind you, I'm one of those people for whom cilantro can be a little overwhelming. But the pork dumplings were delicious too.What really blew me away though was the "asian bolognese". This was a heavier, more dense dish, naturally. But it still wasn't as heavy as the traditional bolognese I find in most restaurants. It was a very interesting spin. I think it's because of the udon noodles. But the combination of pork, black bean sauce, and tomatoes really makes this dish stand out. Long after I was full, I couldn't bare to let the bolognese go to waste.When I set foot on, or even near, Chicago soil again, I'll be making a b-line for Urbanbelly.

Two of us visited this place on a rainy Saturday afternoon. Because of it's location, we managed a parking spot a little far away. They do not take reservations hence we decided to go at noon. To our luck there were only a couple of tables occupied. So we could take our time and browse the menu boards that are up front, as well as go over the fancy, imported beer selection - That was steeply priced. They have a communal seating concept and this "live wall" which is a pretty neat addition. We ordered for a Kirin Pitcher with the frozen foam and beef & cheddar wontons. The wontons were tasty and crisp. For our mains we got the mushroom pho and the ramen jr. Both the dishes were unique in their broths and even for a "jr" serving it was quite a large portion. On the whole a pleasant experience at a very hipster joint. I look forward to seeing what their other joints have in store.

We discovered this gem thanks to the Michelin guide. We went here so often that the wife of the owner will recognize us and greet us warmly.This is the best Asian fusion noodle soups place worldwide: creative, surprising, extremely flavorful, ...and extremely affordable for the quality of the ingredients and the creativity you get.It was awesome they had specials to keep things fresh. Some new combination of flavors to experience....I learned to appreciate spicier foods based on their incredible offerings.We also enjoyed their lamb dumplings and the complementary ginger candies that come with the bill.The restrooms are clean.The place is conveniently located on the way to the Chicago O'Hare airport.The parking was free.A must try if you were to be in the area.

I've been to both Urbanbelly and Belly Q now, and the casual side is a-okay, but not amazing. Urbanbelly is the more "order and grab a seat" style annex to Belly Q. It's a great, casual space with communal seating and order tags adjacent to the fancier Belly Q restaurant and bar.I was pretty excited for their Phat Rice and Rice Cake dishes--Phat Rice with 3 types of pork and Rice Cake Soup with chicken katsu in a spicy tomato-based broth. Although these were unique, strongly flavored, and very filling, I felt that the combinations were a little over-ambitious and consequently sloppy.The Phat Rice had 3 different kinds of meat, all uniquely flavored and strong. When added together, it just became distracting and a little overwhelming. The Rice Cake Soup was promising at first, but a little too salty for my taste and the mix of fish balls and chicken katsu was odd to me.Overall, average experience. But I'd go back.

This one is way better and better priced than BellyQ. Had the phat rice which was really good, the phat noodle I liked way more, and had the urbanbelly ramen which was so tasty. I'm not a pork person so I skipped out on eating too much of it in the ramen, but it tastes just fine without meat. The set up of the restaurant is really nice. You order as soon as you walk in. Then you can sit wherever, on the table they have bowls, utensils, napkins, cups and water ready for you. The food came out quickly. Definitely will be back!

This was my first time trying Ramen! Urban belly did not disappoint. Although I may question the authenticity of the dish,  it was really good. Besides the ramen, I tried the sweet potato dumplings and the Phat Rice. The phat Rice was amazeballs, the rice was cooked to perfection.I would most certainly recommend this place

Now for people who have never gone to urban belly, it's a causal dinning place where you order at a counter, they give you a number and bring out your food. Next door is belly U where it's a fancy sit down full service restaurant which shares the same kitchen as urban belly. Both have different menus, urban belly is slightly cheaper.We went to urban belly for the ramen, and dumplings. They allowed us to sit in the far back room of Belly U for the TV. The guys wanted to watch the Sunday night food ball game. Also there's no other TV in there but that one.Urban belly ramen was by far the best I've ever had, large portions too. We also had the pork and cilantro dumplings, wow, those were great! Also try their gummy bears up front. Thank you to the staff for allowed us to seat on the couches in the very back just for the guys to watch their football game.

I really like the ambiance of this place. It is a really nice casual place to get a quick bite. It is right next to belly-Q. I usually get their ramen. I really like their broth. Though, last time it might have been a tad bit salty for my taste. I really like this place a lot and would definitely come back here.

Another date night, another excuse to try something new in the city! We LOVE trying the restaurants on W. Randolph (it's the new up and coming restaurant row!), and we do love our Asian fusion. It gives me ideas on what I can try at home with whatever Korean cuisine background I have (being Korean and all).We were initially confused because we both had no idea that there were two separate restaurants. Urbanbelly is the more "casual" one and BellyQ is the "sit-down menu" one. After looking over both menus, we decided we were in a more casual mood and ordered our food at the counter. They give you a number to take to your table and bring out the food to you when it's ready. It was a GORGEOUS evening, so we sat outside in the patio area. LOVE the urban mural on the wall with the stringed lights for added decor. Really gives me that Chicago summer patio vibe and it's wonderful. The inside is beautiful too. They have a wall with lush green plants and industrial-type lighting with glass that makes it look like huge light bulbs. I am probably not describing it well, so just take a look at the photos of the interior decor to get a better idea. :)Btw, make sure to order their Kirin Ichiban on draft; it is on. point. They top it off with this beer slushie that is just icy enough to keep the beer beneath nice and cold. Are you listening? It's a BEER. SLUSHIE. on top of my already awesome refreshing beer. You guys are taking this to whole other level, yo. And I love it.We've been on a mission to try ramen places in Chicago to compare and find our top favorite. So, of course we ordered the Urbanbelly Ramen ($13) which are the ramen noodles with braised pork belly, mushrooms & an egg. Let me start with the broth: If Tom Yum and Ramen had a broth baby, it would be this dish. There was a slight sweetness to it (like Tom Yum) and there was also lemongrass, cilantro and mushrooms, all of which can be found in Tom Yum soup. Yet, it was thick like ramen broth, and slightly spicy. Talk about Asian fusion, right? The best of Japanese ramen and Thai soup! The noodles were not the absolute best that I've had, but they were still fairly good. I just couldn't wrap my head around eating a bowl of ramen that had lemongrass and cilantro in it. The egg is added whole (NOT cut in half like most places) because the yolk is runny. When you cut open that thing, get ready for some beautiful egg porn with the ooey-gooey yolk oozing out into your broth. The absolute best part of this dish was the PORK: I mean. WOW. Thick cut (and I mean THICKY THICK, like Beyonce's jelly) pork belly meat, braised to perfection. The outside was perfectly crispy, and it was so tender and juicy, melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness on the inside. I would order the ramen bowl JUST for the pork. Out of all the pork that I've had in my ramen, this one certainly stole the show. I shall crown thee as our Royal Ramen Pork Belly, behold thy Oink King!We also ordered the Phat Rice because of the reviews that we read here on Yelp (thanks, fellow Yelpers). The Phat Rice bowl is a combination fried Jasmine rice with pineapples, ground chicken, pork belly and braised beef short ribs. This was a little on the sweet side for me, I think I just like my fried rice a little more salty/savory...even the ones that have pineapple in it. But, again, this reminded me of a marriage between Chinese and Thai fried rice. They have a bottle of hot sauce (that looks homemade) at the self-serve utensil/drink cart that you can bring to your table, so we tried the rice with it. I actually wish there was more "heat" to the hot sauce, along the lines of what Sriracha offers as far as heat and flavors go. Overall, I want to say that I've had better combo fried rice (fusion or not) and maybe they can try not to make it so sweet? But that's just my humble opinion.

For our final meal in Chicago, we just wanted a little comfort food before heading the the airport. Urbanbelly was convenient and that's where we headed. We ordered our food first and sat down in the restaurant. The seating was community style and just grabbed a table for us and all our luggage. When our food came, it was pipping hot and ready to warm our stomaches. The ramen broth was deliciously savory. The only thing I disliked was the pork bellly, but that's just because I'm not a fan of eating fatty meat. This was great way to end our trip to Chicago.

We ordered three popular menu items, phat rice, urbanbelly ramen and Wagyu beef dumpling.Phat Rice is a mix of many things. This is similar to Korean Bibimbap. It's similar because there are many things and you mix them together. The similarity ended there. The problem with this dish is I was hoping to have more Asian spice in them, and it is too sweet for my taste.Next, we had urbanbelly ramen. I like this dish because of the kimchi flavor in the broth and it's a little spicy, but I don't like that it's again too sweet. The egg and the pork belly are good.Finally, we had Wagyu beef dumpling. This is the most disappointing dish. I don't taste anything but the sauce that they put on top. The sauce is way too overpowering.Overall I feel like they tried to be fusion, but failed miserably. I'd categorize then as Americanized Korean food instead. I rated them 2 stars because of that.

Can't get enough of this place. I come here often with my boyfriend after the gym because we are always hungry and they have a section you can sit in where you food comes out within minutes. Have only had the vegetarian food, but the pea shoot and sweet potato dumplings are something that I consistently crave. Great price considering the location and quality of food. The foam on the beer is so much fun, and cocktails are great too.

Located close to Union park and only a couple blocks from the Ashland pink/green line is the brainchild of Chicago chef Bill Kim.  His first restaurant in the city, Urbanbelly is now one of 3 restaurant with his trademark "belly" in the name.  Look no further than right next door where you will find BellyQ, Chef Kim's take on korean bbq.  While BellyQ and Urbanbelly share the same kitchen and a familiar cuisine, the similarities end there.  Urbanbelly provides a casual, price conscious, friendly environment with a focus on starches.  Here you will find the menu split by starch: dumplings, grains, and noodles.  Dumplings are $7 for 4. Rice dishes and noodle dishes range from $9-$13.  A pitcher of Kirin beer was $10 or $3 for a pint.  If you happen to partake in "a la card chicago" you will find that both Urbanbelly and BellyQ are in the deck of cards.I came here for two reasons: I happened to be visiting the Randolph Street Market just a block down the road (awesome btw), and the $10 card to Urbanbelly.  I had heard good things about it, and nothing gets my stomach growling like Asian food.  Everything on the menu looks good.  My girlfriend and I ordered a pitcher of beer, the Duck and Pho spice dumplings to start, and then I ordered the Phat noodle and she ordered the Rice cake noodle as our entrees.  Ordering is done at the counter, and the ambiance is modern and inviting.  Service is fantastic as we got our food in about 5-10 minutes.  As food goes, we liked the Duck dumplings the best by far.  The dumplings were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, and were perfectly paired with the cucumber and a little house made hot sauce.  The Phat noodle was disappointing.  The flavor felt like something was missing, and the chicken was dry and tasteless.  The pork belly was my favorite part of the dish.  I wouldn't order it again.  The Rice cake noodle was quite good.  The broth was flavorful and spicy.  The chicken katsu was well cooked.  The mango in the broth was a great idea.  It's a bit on the spicy side so be careful if spice isn't your thing.  My only complaint was the rice cake seemed a bit too much.Location: 4 starsEnvironment: 4 starsService: 5 stars.  The food came out in about 5-10 minutesTaste: 3 stars. see abovePrice: 4 starsMenu selection: 4 stars. Plenty of meat vs veggie dishes.  Lots of different starch options.Overall: 3.5 starsWill I return: Yes

This place gets my vote all the way. WOW this is exactly the place I had been looking for.We had the phat rice and the urbanbelly ramen - highly recommend both. I can't wait to go back and try more things from the menu.The dumpling we had were perfection- I think they were pork but I do not foresee them doing any wrong any kind of meat you may choose.Dessert needs to step up a bit but the peanut butter and jelly ice cream was definitely original.Super friendly service and awesome beer selection- helped me choose exactly what I wanted (Belgian)

3 and a half stars!We were here for dinner on rainy weeknight. The place is really cool and casual with a very urban ambiance. The tables are set up for communal dining. But since it was a week night there wasn't too much of a crowd and we had the whole table to ourselves. We ordered the wheat berry bowl and the pea shoot fried rice and the spiced edamame. I really liked the wheat berry bowl - it was perfectly tangy, sweet, spicy. It tasted great - though was a bit too greasy for my taste. The pea shoot fried rice looked really good but it was too salty. I don't know why a lot of places these days have too much of salt in their food. Too much salt does not mean tasty. The spiced edamame was pretty good as well. The service was good and friendly.

I came here with a friend today because I was craving some noodles and was in the west loop area. It was my first time here, and the first thing I noticed was how huge the place was. Most lunchtime patrons were seated in the back near the kitchen, but there were at least 20 empty dining tables that I passed on the way to the bathroom. I thought about how cool it would be to come here for dinner or after work for a drink.What I really like about urban belly is their sizable but focused menu. I chose the pork belly ramen, and my friend chose the kimchee stew along with a bottle of kirin. We were ready to chow. Grabbing our number, we sat at these long brown wooden tables with block stools--i thought it was modern and cool. Then, 2 minutes passed and somehow our two bowls of noodles, steam rising from the server's hands, were being whisked to our table. I remembered that my friend had struck up a conversation with the guy who took our order, but altogether it took less than 10 minutes for the food to come. FREAKY FAST which is a great thing.I liked my ramen noodles and the dish hit the spot. However, the 2 pieces of pork belly were so fatty. I was dissecting it to find bits of protein amid globs of white, but my friend really enjoyed it, so much so that he wanted to replicate it at home. I thought he was crazy. The soup broth was also a tad too sweet for my taste--I think the dish would do well with some added heat. My friend's kimchi noodles came in a bowl that was considerably smaller than the ramen. I wondered why since it was the same price as the ramen and was accompanied with the same amount of meat. For better or worse the kimchi flavor wasn't powerful, but again, I was missing some spiciness. Overall it was a solid experience, but I figure that the flavor of some of the dishes could use some tinkering. After reading some reviews, I must have forgotten to ask for the belly fire sauce. doh.

Yelp came to the rescue again!  It is such a useful tool when trying to find things - specifically food - when traveling!We got there about 10 minutes after them opening for lunch, so we were the only ones there for about 15 minutes, but that definitely didn't last long.We ordered sweet potato and maple dumplings, spiced edamame, phat rice, and wheat berry bibimbap.  There's not a single thing to complain about.They have family style seating with forks, chopsticks, bottled water, napkins, and sauces on the table... you only need to get up for the restrooms.The sweet potato and maple dumplings were amazing.  I am not usually a fan of maple, but they were not overly sweet.. perfect compliment to the sweet potato.The spiced edamame was a fantastic surprise... I always enjoy edamame, but the Szechuan peppercorns, coriander, and fennel make this dish a symphony in your mouth.The phat rice!  Oh my geez!  This was fantastic and very filling!  It was so overwhelmingly flavorful while not being overpowering.  I would definitely order this again!Lastly, the bibimbop.. my husband was thoroughly pleased... I wasn't able to try too much as I was stuffed from all my food, but it was very flavorful.  This was the talk of the day while we were going out and about.I take it back, I do have one complaint... why is this place NOT in Ohio?!

Wagyu beef dumplings: 3Meh. They were alright, a little too chewy, and the flavor of the meat passable. Nothing good nor bad about them.Pork and cilantro: 3.5.A touch above the beef dumplings; we ordered these to hit $25.Phat rice: 4This was umami-good. I was gobbling up every last grain of it, the pork-belly and beef short ribs. The amount of meat was more generous that I would have expected.Service: 5I came here with a friend, based on the Alacard recommendation. The service was outstanding. They kindly let us use both Urbanbelly and BellyQ vouchers on the same bill, and we ordered from both menus.Would recommend going back. It was 60% full on a Monday night, so I imagine it is packed on weekends. The bar aesthetic is modcon.
The environment looks so cool and beautiful. Food are great. Like everything we ordered. Love this place and will comeback next time for sure.

It was a solid four (4) place to have a quick lunch.  The service was speedy and friendly.As soon as we walked, we decided what we wanted and placed the order at the counter.  Then we sat down and food was brought to the table within five (5) minutes.I came with an impatient friend of mine; she personally dislikes to wait for food, but she didn't need go through that hassle because everything came in within eight (8) minutes.We both had the Urbanbelly ramen ($13 as of 02/09/2015).  We both liked the chewiness of the noodle and the ingredients in the bowl (radishes, a runny egg, and two (2) large pieces of pork belly).  Nevertheless, the broth needed some re-thinking; it needed more intense spices so that it could be enriched with a bolder flavor.On the other hand, the pork & cilantro dumplings were just ok; it had an unknown sweet-undertone, which I didn't like it as much.  For $9, I probably will try another item on the appetizer menu next time.The parking situation was convenient; there's two (2)-hour free street-parking on the island available.  You don't need to pay for at a pay station to obtain a ticket like some parts of the city.The ambiance and service were excellent.  That's why a four (4)-rating was warranted.  If you're on public transportation, the CTA Ashland Green/Pink line station is within walking distance.

I've been to BellyQ and belly shack already so I figured I'd complete the belly experience with a trip to urban belly.  It's a smaller quick service window in the same building as BellyQ and it's just a little more casual.My wife and I tried the ramen and the phat rice. First off you could feed two people with the ramen.  You get a huge bowl and thankfully it's really good.  You get some pork belly and a full soft boiled egg in the broth as well.  Sometimes I'm not a huge fan of how pork belly is prepared but here I loved it.  The broth had great flavor, you could really taste all the herby and spicy goodness in there.  The phat rice was pretty good too. Not a show stopper but the short rib was really tender and the pineapples were a nice touch.  I added a little of that orange garlic sauce to it and it went together perfectly.  Not to mention I got a Kirin Ichiban draft for $3?! Where else are you going to get a draft at a restaurant for $3 in the city?By the way I've been looking for that orange sauce in bottles at the Marianos for a while now.  I saw it a few months ago and I'm kicking myself I didn't grab one.  Now they've disappeared.  The only thing I can do now is wait with bated breath for it's return to grocery store shelves.  Anyway, this place is good. Check it out!

This place is delicious. Finally an Asian fusion place that does it right. It's not quite like home but it tastes just as good. I ordered the phat rice and I'm a huge fan of how the fat just seeps into the rice. The pork was fatty, and the savory flavor blended well with the pineapples. Also, I'm a huge fan of sticky rice, so that really made me happy as well.I wouldn't get the edamame. It's really lacking in flavor -- I wished it was saltier. I still plan to eat through the menu though... :)

WAY too over priced (like everything in that area). The food is ok, but no where near the price.$7 for 4 very small dumplings is nuts. They tasted good, but not $1.75 a bite good.The half ramen was only $8, which seems about right, no complaint there.  Certainly large enough for lunch.  It came with a nice big chunk of pork belly, which was very tasty, a hard boiled egg, some sliced radishes and of course ramen noodles. A little spicy but nothing ridiculous.The seating arrangement is kinda of unusual. When you first walk in, you will see the counter to order and one row of counter seats. I didn't realise at first that the is a dinning room in the rear with a few large communal tables. After you order the counter someone will bring you your food.

I thought that Urban Belly was amazing! Walk up, order your delight (get the beef and pineapple) and sit down to a cozy atmosphere.Grab a CHANG beer, it's what we drank when I was in Thailand in November!! Gotta do it!!Prices are average, maybe a little high but very worth it!!Would totally come back!
The interior is well done.The ramen was very flavorful. Not filling, but then again I eat a lot.

I wrote this review before we even have our food just because how amazing they accommodated us. It was raining in morning so they closed their patio. However, when we showed up with our dog, they had no problem with opening up their patio right away to sit us. Such a way to keep their customer.

We finally got to try out the restaurant I wanted to try in the first place (see Belly Q review). Due to our previous experience, the owner of Urban Belly/Belly Q promptly contacted me and invited me back to check out Urban Belly and was gracious enough to send a gift card.When we walked into Urban Belly, we made sure to ask questions on how ordering worked (we learned this time). The woman at the counter at this visit was very nice and friendly and answered all of our questions. We ordered the duck dumplings, the urban belly ramen, the pork and pineapple fried rice, and hubby got the Asian bolognese and beer. Cool thing about the beer-they use a tap that freezes some of the beer so that it stays cold throughout your meal. I don't know how it works, but it's pretty cool.We grabbed a table and honestly it took only a few minutes for all of our food to come out. The dumplings were adequately filled and had a good flavor. The rice was absolutely delicious! The ramen was very good-I still have my favorite ramen at another establishment, but this was still quite tasty. The Asian bolognese had a lot of meat and sauce on it-very hearty. Our experience this evening was very nice-the workers were attentive and made sure we had water, extra utensils, etc. I would visit again if I was in the area.

Having now tried all of the Belly restaurants, I have to say that Urbanbelly is my favorite (and that's saying a lot because the others are great too!). My husband and I had lunch on their outdoor patio and were very happy with the experience.Vietnamese iced coffee--it was my first time trying it and though I am not really a coffee drinker, I really enjoyed itWagyu beef dumplings--amazing appetizer, you could definitely make a tapas style meal by just ordering the different dumplingsPhat rice--holy crap, I loved it. I added some spicy sauce because that's how I like my food, but it was very good and definitely something I'll be ordering againBacon and kimchi--also very good, my husband really liked it. Had enough to bring home leftovers for another lunchLiked their patio area, which is dog-friendly. Staff was nice, brought out water for our dog. You order at the counter, get a number, and they bring your food to the table. Not sure about the indoor tables but the outside ones had one of my favorite things: hooks for your purse! They kind of share the space with Belly Q, which means you walk through the entire place to get to the bathroom.The only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is the pricing. Our lunch ended up costing $37. Not high enough to keep me from coming back, but probably won't come back as often as we'd like because of the prices.

What's not to love about Urban Belly. I've been a fan since they were in Avondale but this was the first time that I've been able to make it to the new location...cool digs! Love that Belly q is right next door so I can visit next time.I got the urban belly ramen and side of eggplant and it was so delicious! I think I must be on a ramen kick bc I just had some at Santouka in Mitsuwa this past week. Urban belly was so much delicious! Briny broth with two big pieces of pork belly...which were so delectable! A perfectly cooked egg with a runny yolk that dribbled into the broth...and I tossed a bunch of the eggplant into my soup as well. I have no idea how they cook the eggplant but I think it's sautéed and then soaked in some kind of vinegar ...totally addicting and if anyone knows the recipe..please let me know! they used to have a spicy eggplant ramen which I loved...it's no longer on the menu, thus my improvisation. Happy to have had my lunch there today!

hidden gem. spacious. ordered the phat noodle - curry udon, pork belly, brisket, lemongrass chicken, and napa cabbage. dishes were comforting and flavorful. definitely give this place a try!will come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.

I had a late lunch here yesterday with a friend.So here's the dilemma - the food is astounding. And the portions are large. And they serve you within seconds (literally) of you sitting down. So why is this anything less than 5 stars?The service is awkward. Drinks are handled by the counter, which is at the front of the house. My date and I had our meal before we had water. And there was a half-full container of water at the table that no one bothered to refill or clear from an earlier group. I get that water shouldn't be wasted but leaving that half-full container of water with us and not offering a new one, or any glasses even, just made me feel like they needed some help.The food was awesome, though. And the waitress was cool. They just need to figure out the counter situation for when they get busy in spurts. Guests should never have to wonder about how to get a drink.

Loved the food and the Kirin!  Had the Pork Belly Ramen, Duck dumplings & a side of Kimchi.  Fast-fast service!!!!!We didn't realize when we walked in that it was 2 concepts in 1.  Urban Belly is "quick service" whereas BellyQ is "full service."  We were told of the 2nd concept after ordering & paying.Staff was friendly, prompt & the restaurant was clean.  Will definitely return to try BellyQ.
