I came by on a whim for lunch and it was exactly what I expected after seeing their menu - an Asian fusion place that doesn't do Asian quite right but hey, at least they tried (seems like the general theme around West Loop)Appetizers: Duck and pho spices dumplings - best item that we got. It's not absolutely to-die-for amazing and it's certainly not something I would come back just to order but it tasted pretty good. They are fried more like pot-stickers instead of dumplings.I got the Urbanbelly Ramen which was mediocre at best. The menu says it comes with mushrooms but there were none in my bowl. The pork belly was average and the broth was decent but lacked the fattiness needed for ramen soup. Of one thing to note is that this is one of the few ramen places out here that adds a soft-boiled egg in their soup. Toppings wise - the bowel was definitely lacking in decorations.My friend got the rice cakes which again, we both thought was fair for Korean-American fusion. Medium spice but he definitely worked up a sweat. I wouldn't recommend eating this for one person as it's a pretty one-dimensional dish and let's face it, that's a lot of carbs.Awesome decorations inside and a decent-sized patio outside for your dining pleasure. Order before you sit!
I get the Ramen the one that has pork in it. Savory and spicy. It is a bowl of awesomeness.

The sweet potato and maple dumplings are amazing!! Their mushrooms pho is also awesome. I love the broth they make it in, super flavorful!Super fast service and its BYOB on Sundays!I've heard people don't like the order at the counter part but it's really not too bad as they still serve you. Will try the wicker park location next! :)

Phat rice.That is all.Well, not really. My friend has the mushroom pho and it was really rich and savory. Didn't even taste meatless! Service was great. Everyone was really welcoming and attentive. Love the living wall too!

Came here with a friend during a lull and ordered the Phat Rice. Wasn't sure how I felt about pineapple in my dish, but count me as a fan now. It was pretty damn good! I'm a picky eater and this helped me push my food boundaries- always a plus in my book.

Ordered from Urbanbelly via Grubhub today - the Urbanbelly Pork Belly ramen is quite good! The soup was not at hot as you would get in the store, but it was no problem as I heated it up in the microwave. The broth was pretty good, and the pork belly was delicious. The edamame was pretty good as well. A little bit oily so I had to rinse it off a little, but the flavors were great.
Love this place. We have 2 under 2 and there is not too many place where you can actually relax and eat. Great food and great vegan options!
We are vegetarians and ordered in through grub hub. The food came in super quick and was soooo yummy.  We had the edamame, sweet potato dumplings and the mushroom pho noodles.Highly recommend it.
Big fan of Urban Belly.  Dine in and delivery are both great. Perfect go-to restaurant quick eats.

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend, thought it was delicious and will definitely be coming back.It's a nice casual place for a quick bite to eat. The staff is helpful and nice. I ordered the Kimchi Stew and my friend ordered the Mushroom Pho. We both thoroughly enjoyed both meals. It was a hard decision to choose what to order, as well, because everything sounded so delicious. I definitely will be back to try some other things out. It's great and affordable and I will definitely take advantage of the take-out at some point!

Urbanbelly was an amazing experience, especially if you love ramen the way I do. I ordered the Urbanbelly Ramen (Ramen Noodles with Braised Pork Belly, Mushrooms & Egg) and Chilled Vietnamese Coffee. I made the ramen a bit spicy by adding hot sauce out of habit, but it was so flavorful it really did not need a thing. The broth was perfect just the right amount of everything, especially flavor. The pork belly in the ramen was fatty and tender. And if you are one of the reviews that said the pork belly was too fatty shut it because that is what makes pork belly, pork belly. In my opinion and my experience with ramen this definitely earns a top spot!The Chilled Vietnamese Coffee was spectacular and that is probably because the use Cafe Du Monde Coffee! In fact it was so yummy I went and got myself another!Though I might live very very far (San Diego, CA) from UrbanBelly it is one of my favorite ramen restaurants!

I really enjoyed eating here! Their rice bowls are all really good, from what my group was saying) I had the Ramen, which was good, but I don't think I would order it again. The broth/noodle ration was pretty off, and it was the most expensive thing on the menu... so... I feel like their other stuff is better and cheaper. I liked the outdoor dining! Very casual, and nice.
Words cannot explain how much I love their lemongrass chicken rice. Delivery is always super quick also!Absolutely love this place, and I highly recommend the lemongrass chicken rice or phat rice.

Came here for the first time after living in Chicago for 3 years and I'm sad that I won't be back for awhile since I've recently moved out of Chicago.If you haven't been here, you order first, pay and then get a number and sit where ever you like. Ordered the phat rice, beef and horseradish dumplings and a junior ramen bowl. Everything was deeeelicious!!! So much flavor in each dish. My bf talks about the phat rice and how he craves it. We can't wait to visit Chicago just to eat here again! I definitely recommend this restaurant. The atmosphere is super casual and the decor is simple yet cute. Plus it's in the west loop and you can't beat an area full of different restaurants and bars.

Different type of ramen served here. The chef has cleverly combined a chow mein styled noodle, pork broth, and rich gochujang paste. It was a good chance of pace, and I would consider this to be a mid-tiered shop.Pros are the convenient free parking and the do-it-yourself seating.

I have somewhat turned into a ramen snob. I love my ramen and I like them flavourful and big. While this ramen was big, the flavour simply failed to impress. We also tried the fried rice which too was okay at best. Been here twice and both times left unimpressed.My friends have reviewed BellyQ favourably so next time I'm hopping next door to BellyQ.

I have done take out from here a few times.  Brilliant location putting it next to west loop athletic club.The phat rice is loaded and full of flavor.  Diced pinapple / beef / pork/egg/spice combo mix really well,The pad thai is really unique in a good way.  Its covered in sauce so you don't have to worry about it being dry.  Both of these dishes are definately worth trying. It is not your traditional pad thai!As for the dumplings, they aren't that great or worth it. Pass on them

Solid prices for solid food. I got the phat rice (fried rice with pork belly and short ribs), which I enjoyed for the most part, but I thought the flavors were a little on the heavier side--the spiciness, while not extreme, tended to overpower everything else--and the food a little too oily for my tastes (though not overly so). I really liked the setup of the restaurant--very casual but very unique decor and thought the service was fantastic, especially for a more cafe-style restaurant.
Fantastic flavor, quality, and representation. I am so happy to have enjoyed two dishes and two appetizers from UrbanBelly and will quickly do so again. This is the best Pad Thai I have ever had!
I had the phat rice. I wasn't very impressed. The dish had a mushy moisture to it that didn't seem right. I wouldn't return.

Very helpful staff, delicious food and attractive decor. The Chinese Rice Cakes in the Pad Thai were interesting in the best way! The Sweet Potato Dumplings were also really tasty. Imani was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions with patience. Check this place out!
I love asian tapas style. This place has very good food and they do not pretend. The flavors have some korean insights but definitely they make adjustments to the food that are really special!
One of the best Asian food places I have ever been.  I have been here about 10 times and always more than happy.  Was stuck on the pho until i tried the fat rice...

Urban belly is incredible, the staff is super friendly, the dumplings are delicious ( go duck or wagyu beef fo sho) they have some really inventive noodle dishes that look as wonderful as they taste.The seating on the patio is awesome in the summer, but fear not, the inside is gorgeous with some really cool hanging light fixtures, communal tables and some wall vegetation.Bottom line...eat food here and you will be happy and full like I am.
Nice job MJ & BK great robust flavors in all dishes we had. Would have gotten a 5 if the kimchi was more authentic. Love the frozen beer. We will return.

Urban belly is a great fast casual dining area attached to Belly Q. The menu in my opinion had many options for noodle or rice dishes and dumplings. There was a small selection of beer but more than enough choices. I like that the tables have small stacks of bowls and chopsticks so you can share your dishes with friends. (Asian food is always better when you can eat family style!)As for the food and service... It was so-so. The girl at the front who took our orders was nice and explained dishes when we had questions and was very patient. She also was able to substitute shrimp for pork in the ramen for one of the diners in our group who doesn't eat pork. However when our food came out, the substituted ramen arrived much later than the other entrees. We were all practically done with our food by the time the ramen came out. We ordered two of the duck pho and spice dumplings which were tasty. Nothing mind-blowing but still delicious. I had the phat rice which again was tasty but I didn't feel excited about it. I also didn't have short ribs on mine which I didn't notice until half way into my meal. Again, it wasn't horrible food but it didn't exactly leave me impressed either. If I was in the area I would probably come back but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine there. I'd prob also try something different like the Asian bolognese which sounded delicious. The phat rice was sort of a disappointment.

We came to check out their ramen and must have misunderstood Urbanbelly's concept. It is not a Japanese restaurant or a Korean restaurant, but rather some sort of fusion. The ramen did not have any sort of identity and was really lacking in variety of ingredients. It did however have a very juicy and nicely seared pork belly. Otherwise the ingredients were small and not full of variety. The decor was cool tho lol.

Ordered to go tonight from urban belly and was not impressed. Got the pork and cilantro dumplings which were good. Phat rice was just ok and the pad Thai was weird - pad Thai is supposed to have rice noodles this one had weird shaped rice cake noodles.The ramen was ok, nothing awesome. Also, very small portions. Probably won't order from here again.

Food was pretty good, but think it's a bit pricey.  Went for lunch for two and ordered appetizer and two dishes and bill came out to 40 dollars.  I guess it's comparable for the area, but when thinking of getting a ramen and a rice dish, maybe a bit much?  Regardless good food.  Recommend other to try and they can decide for themself

They serve Asian fusion style food. I had their version of Pad Thai and Duck Dumplings. It is similar to a lot of the Asian fusion places here in California so it was not that special to me but I do appreciate the flavors and the reasonable pricing for what you get.

Great spot for lunch or fast dinnerFood: unique very good food presented beautifully. Decent portions. Do not lack in flavor whatsoever. Pad Thai is different so buyer beware. Ramen is super good with rich deep favors.Decor: super trendy and very Randolph street hip.People: everyone is super nice and willing to help. Do not get annoyed by questions like some super trendy places often do.All in all a must go and a great spot for lunch.

Kid friendly - thank you!!!  Phat rice and Ramen were tasty, great portions.  Kiddies crushed two servings of the edamame and chicken rice.  PB&J ice cream and donuts - elegant.Service was amazing and attentive to our needs, we'd go back again.

We walked into Urban Belly/Belly Q after we discovered the place across the street was closed for a private party. Urban Belly had been on our list of places to try for a while so this was a good opportunity to check it out.We actually sat at the bar on the Belly Q side but ordered from the Urban Belly menu and had a couple great Belly Q cocktails. The Stove Pipe is a bourbon based drink and was perfect. The Red Lotus is a sake and yuzu drink that was even better. Drinks ($11) were 5 star quality.We weren't totally famished so we split an order of Duck and Pho Spices dumplings ($7 for 4) and the Pad Thai ($14). I thought the dumplings could have come with a more interesting dipping sauce, but they were good. The Pad Thai was an interesting and tasty presentation with rice noodles and some interesting slices of rice cake. Only 4 shrimp in the dish, maybe 2 more would be nice. They had a house hoisin sauce that was good, but the other one they had wasn't great. Overall, the food was 4 star.Service was really good, food and drinks came up quickly. Lots of free parking on this end of Randolph Street.

Don't eat here...or anywhere near here.  I was basically robbed while eating at Urbanbelly.I thought I would meet a friend in a new part of the city for lunch.Parking is a bit of a challenge in the area but I found street parking right behind the restaurant.  I confirmed with the Urbanbelly hostess about my parking location and she told me I should be fine.It turns out that a neighboring business has 100-200 cars a month towed from that street, and I returned to find my car towed.  The owner bragged about it to me.  He also watched me park there and made no effort to explain that I shouldn't park there.  There was a banner 50 yards away but the signage was completely inadequate and confusing....nothing like I have seen anywhere else.This was complete entrapment and any reasonable person would park exactly as I did.I split an Uber with another Urbanbelly customer and we paid $218.50 each to get our cars back.  As we reviewed what happened to both of us, it was pretty clear that this was a scam.Not worth it. Go somewhere else.

The decor was nice but honestly the food was mediocre at best. There were barely any noodles in their so called special food item (urbanbelly ramen) and the broth was way too salty. It was also overpriced. Tried their other dish phat noodles as well and thought that was salty as well. Substituted the udon noodles with rice noodles but it felt like they cooked it with oil for too long causing it to taste mushy, almost like we were eating mush.

I ordered from Urbanbelly on a Wednesday night using Grubhub. The order came in about 45 minutes, which was okay, although I thought it would be a bit faster. I ordered the Phat Rice and the Pad Thai.The Pad Thai was, well, not what I was expecting. Although it did say rice cakes on Grubhub, I assumed that the rice cakes were an addition to the typical noodles in a Pad Thai. I assumed wrong! I received just the rice cakes with sauce, toppings, and grilled (maybe?) shrimp tossed inside. Nevertheless, the food was great. The rice cakes were surprisingly delicious, the shrimps were large and plump, and all the additional toppings like peanuts and garlic complemented the dish well. For $13, the portion was tiny but it was delicious, and I guess I can justify the price...a bit.The Phat Rice was larger compared to the Pad Thai. The rice was cooked just right (al dente, for those wondering), the other little things didn't get in the way of eating, and again, the portion was good (but not great!) for $13. The meats (ground chicken, pork belly, and braised beef short ribs) were definitely on point. I didn't notice the chicken too much because it was ground up and mixed with the rice, but the pork belly, which was a bit dry, was soft and tasty and the short rib was chewy but had a melt-in-your-mouth texture. All three meats had a great taste, although the Chicken was just a tad bit bland. There were ample amounts of meat compared to the rice, and by the end, I found myself debating whether or not I should order again the next day. Overall, a very delicious dish.Solid 5 stars for food, but knocking one star off for rather small portions and big prices. So far the best food I had in Chicago without stepping outside the hotel!

I just ate the best ramen of my life! And it was takeout! I definitely need to dine in!The soft-boiled egg was cooked (and kept) perfectly considering the time it took for delivery. Pork belly was oh-so tender and dat broth tho! Ahmazing.We also had lemongrass chicken and wagyu beef dumplings which were delicious.

Awesome casual spot for something exotic --think duck dumplings, lemongrass and kimchi...-- but inexpensive and delicious.  I've had the rice and salad bowl with ground chicken twice - outstanding! You get steamed jasmine rice with arugula, pickled vegetables & the most perfectly cooked soft boiled egg on top. The flavors are sooooo gooood.  Cool warehousey space.  Great for a group.  Good beer too.

This rating is based on ramen cravings via takeout. The Urbanbelly Ramen never disappoints. We've also tried the Mushroom Pho, pork dumplings and kimchi. Their broths are so rich and flavorful and even better as leftovers the next day!

Delicious mushroom pho! It's hard to find good veggie pho and this place did not disappoint. Good price for the quality and size as well.It's a great place for a causal meal. You order at the counter and can sit wherever you want. Would love to come back next time I'm in Chicago.

One of my favorite spots in Lakeview with the best burger in town! The burger is the perfect size with a good balance of flavor and meatiness where you don't feel disgusting after. Trust me, I used to get a burger every week here over the summer. Really good bloody Mary's as well with made with homemade Bloody Mary mix.One time I opted for the Shrimp Soba Noodle Salad as my meal and it was also delicious and refreshing. For those who don't eat meat or want to stay on the light side, I highly recommend.Service is always prompt and friendly. They don't take reservations, but I've never had to wait more than 15-20 minutes for a table. Perfect for dinner anytime or brunch on the weekends! I try to come by every few weeks or so to check out their many rotating beers.

Two things I love: Good whiskey, and great burgers.  This is one of the few places where I ask for my burger medium and I get it medium every time.  This is also one of the few places where I ask if they have Blanton's, and they have it.  It's the best of both worlds for me.  Even when this place is busy, they do a fantastic job.  The meat also is not compacted.  It's an actual beefy patty with flavor.The restaurant itself it very trendy, and comfortable.  The staff is polite and courteous as well.  Can't wait to go back!

Literally have nothing bad to say about this place. It was incredibly busy at 4pm on a Saturday, but we got seated relatively quickly (10 mins) and got a patio seat to boot!Split a flight ($15) and all the beers were delicious and unique. Definitely pick that option if you have a couple of people with you.Food came out quick and was amazing: moist, flavorful burger and crisp fries with homemade ketchup and some sort of aioli. Lovely experience, great service, good food and beer. Will definitely be coming back.

Never thought I would ever say this...but if all veggie sandwich tasted like the Reuben I had here today, I'd totally go vegetarian! None of the fake meat BS, just a portabello mushroom with red cabbage, onion, horseradish sauce was the perfect combination! So flavorful, so palatable. The side of frites came with this sweet & sour ketchup that was just divine. Beer wise, I opted for the sharkler, which is a grapefruit beer on tap, you know, just trying to hold on to summer time in Chitown! I'm a huge fan of Radler because it's refreshing & not as heavily alcoholic, and I instantly fell in love with the Dryhop version. I can't imagine how good the burgers taste, so there's only one way to find out! Also, the waitresses here are great at their jobs, I gotta give them a shoutout. Ones that seated and served us were very chill & funny people!
Meh. This place is perfect for hipsters who brag about their choice of IPAs.Food isnt great. Beer was pretty good.

Visited this place for brunch on a short Chi town trip with some friends and was pretty pleasantly surprised. For a Saturday, I was thrilled that we were seated immediately.I'm not a fan of hoppy beers, but my buddy and I opted for the flights. Considering the name, I found most of the beers to be quite good. My friend was not so forgiving.The food was tasty, but not quite tasty or unique enough to deserve a perfect score.Food: 4/5 (Good, but not great)Service: 5/5 (No complaints, friendly staff)Price: 4/5 (Not cheap, but you're not overpaying)Atmosphere: 5/5 (Cool place, especially the garage door style doors on a nice day)

Small brewery with unique beer and food.  What is not to love?  I split the chicken sandwich and the club sandwich with my friend and enjoyed both of them!  My husband and I split a beer sampler and their beers are all very solid.  I would definitely come here again.

I had the blackened catfish over collard greens and grits. It was amazing!! The seasoning was right and wasn't overwhelming. The portion was just enough to feel full. Great place, great location. They're also dog friendly for their patio and were nice enough to bring our pup a bowl of water. Highly recommended

The bottomline:  Skip the apps, they are small and pricy.  The poutine isn't really poutine.  It was fries with cheese and scallions - no gravy.The food - good, it was devoured and the price point wasn't horrible.The beer - the names are more interesting than the taste.  The beer was solid but it is pricy at $9 a pint.

Delicious food, great beer, nice environment. I would definitely come again.I ordered the vegetable Reuben which was hearty, delicious and very colorful. I appreciate when restaurants don't skimp out on the veg options. The side salad also was beautiful.My friend ordered The Burger (+ egg), which he said was phenomenal, and my other friends ordered the breakfast sandwich was great. They wished the side of potatoes came with some sort of side sauce (but in retrospect probably should have asked for Frank's).Beers were delicious and summery. I absolutely love grapefruit beers and the Sharkler met my expectations. Our table also ordered the King Ghidorah, Sister Carolina and Weiss Wedding, all of which were great. The Weiss Wedding was really nice (especially the banana undertones).I would definitely come again! Maybe if there was another veg sandwich that would be great!

Ate here with some friends for dinner on a Wednesday evening. Initially, the wait time was supposed to be a 30 minute wait for our party of 6. That unfortunately ended up being a 60 minute wait, but I will say the wait was worth it. Intelligentsia is just down the street so we killed an hour there and got coffee while we waited.Waitstaff was super cool. Actually, this whole place is super cool. Really trendy vibe from the chalkboard walls to the house brewed beers to the modern twist on bar food and the dishes they serve it on. I ordered the veggie reuben and omg it was great! Red cabbage and mushrooms instead of the typical corned beef and sad looking kraut. I would definitely eat this again! The fries here are really thin and crispy and served with a lemon pepper mayo and a spicy ketchup/bbq type thing; both were really good!Half the reason my friends wanted to eat here was for the beer. I can say that didn't disappoint either. I got the Shark Meets Hipster. Really nice light beer, super fruity, reminded me a lot of Wailua Wheat from Kona Brewing!Overall, dinner was good. Good, friendly service. Portions were a little small, but the prices reflected that and were well within reason. If you plan on drinking more than 1 or 2 drinks, I could see it adding up pretty quickly. Still, if you're going to eat here you should try at least one beer! They also offer flights and you can take their beers to go in either cans or growlers. From what I remember the growlers were actually a pretty decent price.The free wifi here was also a nice added bonus!With all the other trendy restaurants in the area, I'm not sure when I'll be back to this one any time soon, but it was definitely some place worth trying!
Wow! Beer is solid and food is awesome. Buttermilk chicken sandwich and Mac and cheese with an egg on top was so tasty.

I've been here twice. Once for dinner, and once to just grab some beers to go.The food is awesome. I had the pork chops, and it was one of the best meals I've ever had in Chicago. Also tried the beer sampler, and every beer I tried was great.The carryout beer option is also really nice. You can get 32oz cans or 64oz growlers. I've only done the cans, but they fill them up directly from the tap, and the beer is super fresh when you want it.

Stopped by with some friends late Sunday night since they were the only place serving food. FYI..they are open til 2am on Sunday. I ordered the Buttermilk fried chicken sandwich which comes with two chicken breasts topped with white cheddar pimento cheese, sweet pickles and slaw. I upgraded ($2) to the poutine - frites with chopped Applewood smoked bacon, aged cheddar, scallions, and sausage gravy.The chicken sandwich was fantastic! I especially enjoyed the sweet pickles and slaw. I would definitely order this sandwich again. Equally tasty was the poutine!! The fries were topped with just enough cheese and gravy - not too dry, and not drenched. Service was friendly and fast.

BLUF;  Good beers and great food.I got a stout and it was great.  I'd love more time to try more.  Looked like a lot of interesting beers to try.I also had a chicken noodle soup burrito.  It was very interesting and very good.  Picture a burrito with a brothless noodle soup inside the tortilla.  It was awesome, I'd love to go back and get more beers and try another burrito.

This is the only brew house we went to I'm Chicago, so we don't have anything to compare it to in the city. However, my husband and I love going to local brew houses and they had some great beer! We both enjoyed the Fission Ignition-  an IPA, it was creamy, not the usual way to describe a beer but it was so good! I also tried the Sea Salt, but it was too sweet for me. The tilapia tacos were very good too!Bartenders were great, informative and friendly. The crowd as well! We befriended the guy next to us and had a great conversation. I would suggest this place as a great hangout place or a date night!

Came here on the recommendation of the bartender at Beermiscious (great place I highly recommend) and it did not disappoint.We were greeted warmly and welcome to put out seat (it was 4ish) so we got a great window spot. Our server was super nice and let us go at our own pace. We planned to only have a beer or two but their menu looked too good.Beer: They offer a six beer flight of their house beers in 5 oz samples. Perfect to try a variety and learn what you like. They also offer samples if you want to try before committing to a full beer. Also, they have a few guest beers so ask about those.Food: Green curry mussels! Delicious! Actually wished the bread wasn't buttered so there was no competition with the broth! That's good broth!The space is awesome and jade a great vibe. Perfect for a date night or outing with friends!

Fantastic brewery and gastro pub. Beer is always fresh and rotating. They offer guest taps as well, but Dryhop beers change so often you always want to try their newest offering.The food is amazing! Burger and chicken sandwich some of the best in the city. The kitchen is alway timely even on busy weekends.The place is packed every day after 5 so plan accordingly. But the staff and service is top notch, so you never feel like you are waiting for something.

Ah dryhop you NEVER disappoint. Great beer, despite me drinking the lightest lager-like brew on the menu, I've heard great things about everything on tap! The best part about dryhop is that you go there equally for the beer and the food! The fried chicken sandwich is a popular choice and perfectly fried and seasoned. As for the sides, the fries are #1 and definitely give the Mac n cheese a shot. Be prepared for a much needed nap, between the comfort food and beer, you'll be snoozin'

Cool spot....to start with the good:Beer was solid and service was friendlyI got the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich.  It was really lacking in flavor.  My fiancé got the Skillet Mac & Cheese and it was the same story.  Just felt like something was missing for both dishes.For apps we got the Poutine and Pretzel.  The Poutine was great.  Fries were nice and crispy.  The pretzel was so small.Overall, not terrible but probably wouldn't come back

This place has now been moved to my "upon request" bars. When someone suggest meeting at DryHop , I shrug in disappointed consent.Over time the beer has begun to all taste the same. The lack of ingenuity and quality in the beer only highlights the so/so food offerings. Though you could certainly do worse, convenience is the only draw of a place that manages to consistently brew boring beer.

Was in the neighborhood and thought we'd give it a try. They make all beers in house and have a small rotation of about 6 beers. Since it was Fall, most of the beers were darker and hoppier. We were looking for lighter beers, but the Saison I tried was quite good. I had the burger and it was very well constructed. The bun was soft, but held up well to the juicy burger. They have a homemade spicy ketchup that really took it over the top. I am removing one star because of the small variety of beers on tap and the service was a bit slow. In all, we really enjoyed both the food and beer and will be back.

This brewery makes high-quality, southern-esque food that is tasty enough to attract non-beer drinkers. The environment is pretty cool (no TVs, whaaat!), and the beer, oh the beer. Because I frequent this place so often (along with countless others) they have to brew entirely new and completely different beer every couple weeks, which means I have to go more often to sample them, which means they have to brew more often, which means I have to go more often...some may see a problem with this vicious cycle, others may toss around the label "drinking problem". I call it sweet, sweet capitalism.I knocked off a star because the place is a bit tight and at times their beers get a little too eccentric even for an eccentric like me, but when you catch them putting a stout, porter or any darker beer on the draft list, drop whatever you are doing whether it be weekend chores, a project at work or holding your friend's baby, and sprint over before the locals gulp it all down.I mean the coconut milk stout, dubbed the "Angry Samoan," still haunts my dreams in a very real and satisfying way.

DryHop ended up being a decent burger and beer joint in the middle of East Lakeview. They have a large selection of beers they brew and brands they carry but maybe brewed by others.It was also a really good hamburger which ended up being a nice surprise.  They have a new and trendy dining space located just south of Belmont on Broadway. And while it might be located in the heart of Chicago's own Boystown, I would definitely say there was a very wide mix of patrons. Maybe the only qualifier to dine is that you come hungry.I'm not going to go into a long explanation of what their burgers were. I think if you're in the are and want one you need to come try it for yourself. A good burger bar in the east end was sorely needed and DryHop filled that need quite nicely.

Came here from NYC. Had a great time at DryHop. The beers on last night weren't particularly mindblowing. No sours too :( But everything was executed well for what it was. We each got a flight, which was nice, but everything felt similar somehow. Hoppy wheat, hoppy lager, english ipa, ipa. Would have loved to see something really high abv, higher IBU and lower IBU, and stout option that wasn't spiced. They were all delicious, but safe. And I'm aware I'm just spoiled going to craft beer bars in NYC with often 20-70 taps to choose from. Can't wait to come back at another time of year and see what they have.Food was delicious! Fried chicken is everywhere and they did it nicely. Same with the shell pasta mac. Service was good, a little slow, but we were busy with out 6 beers anyway- a great deal for a flight!

Whoa there DryHop Brewers. I came in for some beer and all of your beers had very similar tastes. Im not sure if it was the glasses or the water or hops you use but something tasted off about the beers. Kind of a dirty taste that ranged across all the flight beers and pints I got.On top of that the selection of beers was limited. Nothing really exceptionally exciting about the brews. No super malty drafts, no sours, no punchy dark beers. All of the beer was pretty normal. I might be spoiled living in Boulder but damn, I just cant say I was blown away.  However, nothing here is bad per se, I just am not a fan. Revolution and Goose Island are pretty damned good though.The staff was kind of excited to go home on a friday night, understandable, but they pressured me, aka shower up with the check, to close out 25 minutes before closing, lights came up 20 minutes before closing and it was suggested to me that they were closing countless times. Yes so I left 15 minutes before closing.

So worth the wait! We came here on a busy Saturday night with friends to celebrate their engagement.  We knew there would be a wait so we put our name and number in with the host and went over to Intelligentsia to grab a cup of tea/coffee.  I think we waited about an hour, but since we had planned for it, it went by quickly.Once we were seated we had the problem of choosing what to actually order. Everything sounded delicious! We ended up with the pork buns, soft pretzel, and charcuterie and cheese board to start. I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with pickled jalapenos and fried onions - so good! My husband had the burger and was extremely happy.  Of course, we also a few of their tasty brews to wash everything down.Don't come here if you're looking for a quick bite or if you're already hangry, you won't be happy with the result. But if you have the time and plan on the wait, DryHop is definitely worth it.

Dryhop was amazing!! The burger was one of the best I've had. The Monday special of $15 for a beer and burger (with fries) is pretty unbeatable in Chicago especially when the burger is so great. We also tried the beer flight and it was great since it was our first time trying their beers so we were initially unsure of what to order. I definitely suggest the flight for first timers.
Best burger in Chicago! I live downtown and can't find anything comparable. Highly recommend for your burger craving :)
Cool spot! Good beers and good vegetarian options for food. Wish the patio stayed open later but the inside is really cool so it works out. You can fill up growlers here too!

Awesome brewpub in East Lakeview with some of the best burgers in town!This is my first review after three visits to DryHop. It's a pretty small place with only maybe a dozen or so tables and another dozen seats at the bar. You get a great view of some of their brewing equipment across from the bar. I definitely recommend trying a few of their house brewed beers. There's always something for everyone and they have pretty decent flight prices if you want to try them all!So after three visits you would think I've had a pretty good taste of the whole menu. Nope. I've only ever gotten the burger because it's delicious, absolutely one of the best in the city. It only comes one way, but you can add bacon or egg. Bonus points for the spicy ketchup and garlic aioli you get for the fries. If I can ever manage to not get the burger the chicken sandwich and skillet mac n cheese both sound delicious as well.Love this place! 5 stars all the way

DryHop has opened my mind to IPAs again, with the higher IBU beers showing complexity of flavor despite their hoppiness. I recommend the sampler!Staff was fun and their burger was delightful - whatever they do for their patties is impressively succulent for something that manages to maintain its puck shape. Fries were McDonald's style and tasty.Good crowd on a Wednesday night but not too loud for conversation.

My boyfriend and I stopped in just to try the beer, but we decided to get some food too. The beer, first off, is great. We love trying microbrewery beer and always enjoy something different. This place has a nice selection and definitely offer something for every beer drinker.The food is eclectic and different, and not too pricey! We got to fried green tomatoes and fries as an appetizer. Their Monday night special is a burger, 16 oz beer, and a whiskey shot for $15. How can you go wrong???Love the interior- it's hipstery but also casual and modern. And a little patio for the good weather too. Will definitely be back!

Stopped in to try their craft beers on a busy Saturday evening. We found a spot at the bar and tried a few beers. Bartender was friendly. We had a great time!The best part of the evening? Every Saturday they pick one beer to offer at a special price ($5) in their 32oz cans, which they fill when you order (they also have a growler special), and the special beer happened to be the one we liked the most--Mondo Generator Doppelbock.  We bought two cans to take home.The dining area is small, but we plan on returning to try their food...and more beer.Note: My husband is a big fan of craft beers, so we've made a point of visiting local brew pubs in Chicago. He spends plenty of his spare time learning about craft beers and tasting them. He and a friend have taken trips to Michigan and Wisconsin for the purpose of visiting craft brew pubs. This 4-star rating is his, too.Enjoy!

After walking past this place numerous times, first visit was yesterday, Saturday, early afternoon. The outside seating area was filled but my friend and I happily took to inside seating next to the window in the much needed air conditioning.Inside was kinda crowded, but I dug the decor. Our server was nice, sat us down right away, and told us right away that they were out of their "Steal Your Face" beer but would be replaced with a light belgian beer. With that said, we decided to go with a flight of their beer selection.We weren't that impressed with any of the beers. Our favorite out of the bunch was "Mr. Banana Grabber". The most interesting tasting was "Wolves Loose in Koln." I kid you not, it tasted like pizza. PIZZA! It wasn't meant to at all. My friend agreed, he said it tasted like tomato sauce. Not my cup of tea, but he liked it.Regarding the food, we shared "The Burger" and that was top notch! It was juicy and very flavorful. It came with a side of crunch fries with a side of homemade ketchup and dijon sauce.  The sauces were just ok. I would definitely like to explore more of the menu at some point.So overall I'd definitely go back AND major brownie points because the entire time we were there, they were playing Grizzly Bear songs, and they're my FAVE!
I don't get the hype. I paid $25 with tip for 1 overly sweet pint of grapefruit beer and 1 burger with fries. What?

We went here on a rainy day and it was nearly empty...one of our favorite stops on this trip to Chicago.  Beer flight was awesome and allowed us to try a little of everything and I found myself liking things I never would have ordered.  Very unique beers...you could tell a lot of thought went into their brew...complex.  Onto the food...quite possibly the best fish tacos I have ever had and I get them everywhere I go.  Frites were amazing and instantly gone.  Cheese board really wowed us with all the extras pairing so well with the cheese.  Service was excellent!  We will be back even if it takes us 17 hours to get there!

A very belated review, but even after several months, I thought this worth reviewing about.Went here with my girlfriend for a light lunch with a local friend after recently having relocated to the midwest from Oakland.We ordered their charcuterie plate, ordered a sampler of beer, and enjoyed pleasant seating near the front of the establishment. The atmosphere was comfortable; it wasn't cliquey.Service was very friendly and prompt.Price was more than acceptable.I will come again and order the crew a pitcher of beer.

Tried to eat here - twice. The first time, the wait was 90 min. Ok good sign that it is a popular place. Try again next time.Well, tonight was next time. We arrived at 10:35 pm. The website lists dinner available until midnight, open till 2 am and a late night menu is available. What they DON'T say is that even though they are open, they stop seating on the patio at 10 pm and do last call on the patio at 10:20 pm. We came here for the patio!Wtf?! When we asked the hostess (I think? She had no uniform or name tag on) to repeat herself, thinking clearly we must have misheard, she actually spoke louder and slower like on a bad tv show.

Six Words: Overpriced, strange beer combinations, boring burgersI came here with a friend on a Wednesday night to catch up. We wanted a casual vibe and thought we had hit the jackpot. I left feeling a bit underwhelmed.They had a variety of beers on tap that night but they all had something weird added to them. Like odd flavorings. I ended up with a Milkstacio, which was/is a South Loop collaboration. It was a pistachio milk stouth with cocoa nibs and pistachios. It was described as having a velvety mouth feel with a chocolate finish but I just got tons of pistachios. Now don't get me wrong, I like pistachios. But not in my beer. Didn't know that until I started drinking it but yeah, not a fan. But it was the darkest thing they had on the menu.For dinner I went with the burger with bacon. I've never seen a sadder "gourmet" burger. It was a thin patty with two thin strips of grocery store bacon. None of that thick, juicy bacon you come to expect with a $2 extra charge. Nope, grocery store thin. And again, the patty was a thin patty. Not hearty, not flavorful. It was greasy dive burger for double the price.I probably won't be back. Reviews said it was like Hopleaf, but it's definitely not at all like Hopleaf. Well I guess they're similar in that they have the word "hops" in their name.

You guys, let's be honest. I love this place. I'm here all the time, since I live a few blocks away. When I want a craft cocktail, I come here. If I want some good pub food, I come here. And I thought "hey, let's come here for brunch on the 4th of July". So I called them up at 10am just to confirm that their hours were the same, as google indicated times might differ due to the holiday.I figured since I called to come in at 10am, that they would have disclosed the fact that "oh yeah, we aren't serving brunch today." Why tell me that after I get there? Obviously I'm not coming at 10am to eat a cheeseburger...............So sadly, we just got a few beers and then left. It was a disappointing start to the 4th of July, but I will live. I would just suggest that if patrons call, and there is important information that you can disclose, then just tell them!

I wish there was a way to rate with halves - DryHop is somewhere between 3 and 4 stars.Came here with three friends on a gorgeous Monday night, just looking for good food and a good beer. We had spent almost an hour wandering around Lakeview and Boystown looking for a place to go and finally made our way here, so we were hungry. Three out of the four of us were newcomers, so deciphering the lingo on the beer list was a team effort but with help from our great waitress, we all chose the right brew for our tastes - I loved the Shark Meets Hipster. Our waitress also sold 3/4 of us on the Carbonera dish, complete with a raw egg yolk mixed in, which was so delicious and perfectly portioned to fit each our hunger levels.I also wish I could give this place 5 stars because everything was wonderful, but our food took almost an hour to come out. This was offset, however, by our waitress offering us a free round of drinks so that made it less frustrating. I would come here again - just maybe not on as much of an empty stomach.
Fortunate enough that Dry Hop is close by.  They have great beer, delicious food (obsessed with the pork buns). And since the day they opened, I've always had super friendly kind service.

The place: Staff is friendly. In the summer, and warmer days, this place is hopping. Went for an early dinner the most recent time, and by the end...7:30, it had filled up quite a bit. I'm sure there's a huge draw for the drinks, but I don't always need a drink. Service was solid...The taste: I cannot get enough of the veggie reuben. I got it with the horseradish sauce on the side, and they even brought me a little taste of the "jam" that's really fancy ketchup that's normally served with the burger. I think it's ancho-chili tomato jam, and it was pretty great. But the sandwich......damn. My companion got the burger, and inhaled it, so I also assume it was tasty.My face: The $3 upcharge for the salad instead of fries seems a little steep, but it's actually a really decent portion, so it's all good by me. I think the total was maybe $15 a person. We both left happy and full. Just how it should be. Sober smile up in here.
Great homemade beer! Food is awesome too. There are always good surprise in their beer list which they change quite often.

went here for a lil happy hour actionreally liked their beer. it was a name that i can't pronounce and can't remember but an X was involved. So if you see that on the menu, order it bc it was velvety and golden and delicious.this place also has a cool sidewalk patio area. unfortunately, the sun and i aren't on good terms bc it incinerates my skin and thus i couldn't sit out there. from what i saw tho, the other patrons really seemed to enjoy itin terms of food, GET THAT PORK CARNITAS TACO. (i say everything is the best so take this with a grain of salt) it was the best pork carnitas i have had in a whilealso that deviled egg was a little cute dollop of lush savorinesswell donebravowinky facego here

I've been here twice now, once for brunch to watch the Pride parade and once for dinner on a Thursday night. Both times, the food, drinks, service and ambiance were great. The food did not disappoint once (love the poutine) but my personal favorite were their beers. The in house brews were all amazing, I'd highly recommend trying out the sampler beer flight and go from there. It can be a bit pricey but the quality is well worth it. Also this place can get very crowded, very quickly. Go early if you want a patio spot, even the inside wait can be an hour depending on the time/day. All in all, perfect spot for a night of food and drinks when budget and time aren't your top priorities.

I would say this is more of a 3.5 star.The atmosphere is awesome. There are no windows - it's completely open which is perfect for a warm day like today. It's always nice trying a new brewery. They had tanks set up in the back and it was very interesting.I had a beer recommended by the server called "Fat Sacks" which was both hilarious and delicious.The Entree I ordered was AMAZING! I had French Toast made out of Challah Bread crusted with Captain Crunch. It was covered with cream and blueberries. My girlfriend got the "Angry Toddler" omelet which I believe had eggs, apple-wood bacon, and cheese.My only gripe with this place was the service.  It was fairly busy in the restaurant so this is reasonably understandable. However, I was a little concerned at the lack of attention we received and furthermore, I was disheartened by how long the meals took to prepare and serve. It wasn't so bad that I won't ever come again. However, I can't in good faith give this place a five-star due to the nature of the service.In Short - the food was outstanding, the service was subpar but not so bad that we wouldn't go again. This place is an easy five-star if the service and speed got a little bit better

Full disclosure: I really can't understand all the hype of craft beer movement in US. Being a lifetime lover of good old German and Belgium beers (Hefeweizen and Trappist) I have always suspected that those craft beer brewers tend to brew IPA's to hide their failures with more and more hops. Maybe that's just me, but during the years in US, I have become almost allergic to hops. Unfortunately DryHop IPA's are not an exception. With that being said; they have always some non IPA, worth to drink. And the burgers... If it were just a burger joint, I would give 6 stars.
Loved it.  Had a few great beers with dinner.  I had the Mac and cheese,  wife had the portobello reuben.  Everything was really good.  The pepper appetizer was a little small but very good.

QUICK HIT (Must Go vs. Consider Checking It Out vs. Pass/Don't Bother): Consider Checking It Out - 3.5 Stars...5 Stars for The Burger.All you truly need to know is that you come to DryHop for three things: BEER, BRUNCH, and most importantly, the BURGER. Incredible beer selection and the burger with fries is top notch.Atmosphere:What a great place to be. Social without being too loud. Able to accommodate a lot of people without being overcrowded.Food:As mentioned above, if you go here, just order the burger. You would be ridiculous not to.  It is a burger blended from brisket and short rib with chile-tomato jam, aged cheddar, arugula, and pickled onions. How does that not sound amazing? Oh, and order it with the smoked applewood bacon. Compliment it with an order of their crispy fries served with a nice aioli or homemade ketchup and you have absolute perfection. Order it.Pictured Below: Country fried steak (crispy, well cooked, very flavorful) and Cap N Crunch french toast (bland, disappointing)

DryHop Brewers has won me over! You know I'm all about that beer, but DryHop has a lot to offer not only in terms of beer but their food is bananas and service is completely on point.I went to DryHop on Friday night about 10pm and was met with a thirty minute wait. We ended up snagging seats at the bar and not having to wait at all. I loved the guys working at the bar - they were both friendly and attentive but not overly so.I tried every beer on their menu that night, thanks to the beer flights they offer. They price the flight at $14.61 so it comes out to an even $16 when you pay - love that convenience. I also tried their two beers not included with the flight and everything I tried was solid.Highlight of the beers - the Daytona 500! Holy spice explosion! This beer has ginger, galangal root and ghost pepper! It was so spicy yet so unique and I loved it. It left my lips tingling for thirty minutes after finishing my brew. Tart Down For What!? was another good beer that not only had an amazing name but made me lips pucker it was so sour ~ loved it.I had the Skillet Mac & Cheese for $11 for dinner. The highlight of this mac & cheese was the sunnyside egg on top! It was cooked perfectly and complimented the dish well. The macaroni and cheese itself was insanely creamy with shell noodles, covered with breadcrumbs. It came out piping hot in a skillet! I've always said Kuma's has been my favorite mac & cheese in the city but I have to say this now takes that honor. Next time I'm going to try it with peas & bacon - some additional add ons available!I loved everything about DryHop - great food, great beer, great service! I'm itching to go back and fill a growler with that Daytona 500!

Been here twice and have not been disappointed. They have a great beer selection. The food menu is very limited, not many selections. I think they are more focus on quality over quantity when it comes to their menu. The food is delicious!  The Cubano sandwich and flan steak were very good.I also had the beer flight, which I really enjoyed.The place is small so there can be a wait at peek hours. Go check it out!

They may be small, but they're big on good food and great brews.  The beer flight is a great place to start if you're not sure of what they offer.Take home a can - poured and sealed as you watch - or a growler of your favorite brew.  Lots of great brew pubs in the Chicago area.  Dry Hop should be on your bucket list.

Love their beer and the patio!  Shark Meets Hipster is prob my favorite beer.When I came here,  I ordered a flight and got the shrimp and grits, the tacos, and my boyfriend had the burger.  While all the food was stellar, I wasn't super pleased how much it cost for the size.I'll be back, but I may stick to just ordering drinks.

By far the best cheeseburger in Chicago. Forget Au Cheval and check this place out.The burger is incredibly juicy and flavorful and the beef has an almost buttery quality. On a brioche bun, which is perfectly soft and toasted, and great toppings to boot.Don't miss out on Monday nights when you can get this amazing burger, a shot of whiskey, and a beer all for $15!!!

Very cool, hip place! The beer is pretty good, but nothing spectacular I'm sorry to say. I've tried many of their beers, and my mind is never blown.I've tried both their brunch menu and dinner menu. I enjoy both! The first time I had the captain crunch french toast, and the other night I ordered the burger. The french toast was great, very tasty! The burger was pretty good! A bit smaller than I expected especially for the price. I loved the chipotle ketchup, and if I heard our waitress correctly: horseradish mayo? --Awesome. My bf ordered the buttermilk chicken sandwich, and I thought that was better than my burger. I have my eye on your macaroni and cheese next time.There is something about DryHop that is missing. It just needs that extra umph for me. The food menu could use a boost. I'll be back sometime I'm sure!
A brew pub that brews some very nice and innovative beers. Very friendly bartenders. Great food. Draws a big crowd, consistently. The place to be. What more can you ask?
Disappointed. Usually much better, growler only 3/4 filled and flat by the 2nd pour. Bring back the old fillers please.

Went here tonight with a few friends of mine. We walked in and put our names down because they said it would be about an hour wait and then they'd text us. Only took about 30 min and we were at a table! They don't take reservations either or we would have done that instead.The place was very busy. They don't serve food at the bar but we wanted a table anyway. Our waitress was nice and very patient and efficient as we tried to make our best decision on the great sounding beer and food they had.The table all together got a couple burgers, the Mac and cheese and the Poutine. Everything was incredible. We all talked about the burger on the walk back to the car, such great flavors I could eat another one now!We loved it here and definitely plan on coming back. Might even make it a regular place to eat and drink.

I live down the street and come here regularly. I have never had anything bad here. Mussels are amazing, bacon is to die for and the chicken sandwich and burger are spectacular. I forgot to mention the great beers they change up and make weekly.

The food is alright. It's a step above your typical bar food. The beer is a little better. Service is good, and there is indoor parking next door, which makes hanging out in the area less of a logistical nightmare.The crowd is young professionals. It isn' too rowdy, but it definitely isn't quiet. This is a good place to meet up with friends for a beer and pregaming.

Great food and absolutely love coming here. But  recommend the hostess work on her people skills. She refused to seat me until the second person in my party (who was 10 minutes away) joined. When I asked what if I had said I was here by myself, she said I would have been seated immediately. I understand the need to wait for larger parties to arrive, but kind of silly and leaves a bad aftertaste that even a great beer won't wash away.

Great brewery with delicious eats in Lakeview area. They're open for lunch! The burger looked really good. I had the pork chop, which was absolutely delicious, quite unexpected. It came with some delicious potatoes and haricot verts. Highly recommend!

DryHop is such a great addition to Lakeview East, and one of my favorite brunch spots. The outdoor seating is great in the summer, and when the weather is nice they open the whole front of the restaurant so more tables can soak in the sun as well. The interior is casual, but well designed, overall just a really cool neighborhood spot. Best of all, there's rarely a long wait!As far as the brunch menu goes, two words... Hank's Plate. It may sound like a safe choice compared to some of the other options, but it's truly amazing! The applewood smoked bacon with brown sugar black pepper glaze is absolutely the best bacon I've ever had. The potatoes are phenomenal, and the biscuit and sausage gravy is equally delicious!If you're coming for dinner, the burger is awesome. And of course, you can't forget about the beer!

My friends were super excited to eat here because of the good reviews but I didn't find anything too spectacular. Since this place is so popular, we ended up waiting for about an hour before we finally got a table for 6. Our waitress was very nice and made great food and beer suggestions. I ordered a serving of fries with garlic aeoli and it was very good. I don't know what they put in the ketchup but it was some of the best ketchup I have had. I wasn't a big fan of the garlic aeoli dipping sauce because it was a bit too rich for me. My friends ordered burgers and from what I could tell, they enjoyed their meals. They also enjoyed the draft beers that they ordered. All in all, this place is your typical American-fare restaurant.

Dryhop is literally right down the street from my apartment.  I guess you could call them my local brewer.  I can drag myself home from here.  That's a good thing.  Here's why:First, you need to divide the food experience from the beer experience.  At least I do.  Not that one is bad and the other good, but they are just different.The food is upscale bar food meets gastropub.  Definitely on the high end, both in terms of fanciness and cost.  I've eaten here a few times now and everything was really good.  The mac and cheese simply rocks!  But be prepared to drop some cash.  This really isn't much of a 'grab some snacks while drinking beer' place.  It's a 'sit down and dine' kind of vibe.The beer is the opposite.  Very casual.  Drop in and have a pint at your neighborhood pub, kind of thing.  Sure, you get the trendy douchbag folks in here too, dressed to impress, or calculated casual to make you THINK they're not trying to impress.  Either way, it's tiring.  But the beer is not.  They have a nice, diverse selection - something for everyone to enjoy.  And the taps change fairly often, so all the better to lure you back in regularly.  But if that's not enough, they have several guest taps too.  Nice locals and collaboration beers to try.  I like that.  The best beer I've every had?  No.  But respectable, with a few shining stars in the lineup.  Plus, if you're here with a non-beer drinker - first of all, what's wrong with that person?!? - they have a full bar and a respectable scotch collection.  Beer prices are in line with other places in Chicago - still too high, but a guy's gotta drink, right?Service has always been spot on, even when they're packed.  No complaints there.  My only issue in the 'experience' regard is turn down the music a touch, guys.  Makes it hard to even hear the bartenders, much less fellow customers.See you next time, guys!
One of my favorite places to visit in Lakeview! Amazing food and delicious beer! Highly recommended trying this place.

Never eaten a full dinner here, but have stopped in for drinks + apps. Really fun vibe, great service, and good food. They don't rush you out at all which I enjoy as well. They don't take reservations and it gets really packed REALLY quick so go early and put your name down! Awesome neighborhood spot.

I like it here. I like the beer, and most importantly I like the people. They aren't beer snobs, what a treat! Seriously some of the nicest bar staff I've been around. The layout is really nice, the bar is great (we liked the bar at Dryhop better than the bar at Corridor), and for a rather cold December night it wasn't remotely drafty. We old folks catch a chill real quick. The music wasn't good, but it wasn't my taste. Loud screaming death metal ain't my thang, especially not on a Sunday evening.The beer is fantastic. My favorites were the Moustache & A Supernova, Light Up Gold, and, Funcrusher. The Moustache was by far my favorite and I'll gladly return for more of that. Food wise I wasn't blown away, but it wasn't bad. The best thing we ordered was the pork buns: perfect balance of sweet and spice but not too much of either. There are two per order and I would gladly have eaten both. The deviled eggs were, you know, they were deviled eggs. The only thing I didn't love was the shrimp & grits. I normally love this dish, but, I didn't realize the "gravy" would be tomato-based..no. That's not okay with me. The shrimp was delicious, but I didn't like the gravy, and had I known it was tomato-y I would have asked for the poutine gravy instead. We want to go back for brunch, more beer, and more great bar staff.
Love the beer here! Cool patio and ambience.  The burger was really good too.

Feel a bit silly writing a review for here seeing as I'm in a no-drinking year of my life but this place is definitely owed a good review. When I lived in Chicago, definitely a spot that became awesome to grab a beer with friends. I think the best thing I ever had there was The Shark Meets Hipster. Also, the fries there are awesome. Finally, if people-watching are your thing, also a a great spot because every other couple there is a Tinder date.

I didn't have much food. Only the frites. Which were perfect in every way possible. Hot and crisp. And the garlic lemon peppered aioli that accompanies them, MY GOODNESS! I had to get extra. Best EVER! The ambiance is super dope. I can't wait to go back for brunch.

Nice little gastropub we'd been wanting to visit for a while, and we finally got a chance when an old pal from Texas came to visit.  It's a lot like other brewpubs in the city -- very nice selection of brews, a bit overcrowded, a surprisingly good selection of foods.  The service is okay, but it's usually packed as hell, so it's hard to fault the staff.  The hook here is that they make a lot of their own stuff, and while it veers between excellent and merely okay, they've always got something interesting on the menu, which makes it worth return visits.

What a nice local brewery! I had the Gamera, which was quite tasty and drinkable, not at all hoppy or fussy, but nonetheless pleasant and interesting.One 13oz beer + a growler + filling the growler only set me back $22! And the food all sounded great--will be back to try more beer and food.
WOW!! their "the burger" was amazingly juicy & made to perfection!! 2 words: totally delish!! would definitely go again!!

This is my second time here and this place doesn't disappoint. The beer is spectacular and the burgers are epic. Epic. They change the burger style every few months just to keep it fresh. And the frites are thinner (sort of Belgian style) and absolutely delicious!One of the things I love about Dry Hop is that the entire street front is glass and when the weather is nice, they move the panels back and open the restaurant to the street. That is Dry Hop at its best. It can be a little loud otherwise. But when you're sitting in a place and looking out into this great north side neighborhood, you just can't do better!

Hm.  I may need to reassess DryHop in the future.I visited on a Sunday around noon and ordered the burger (blended from brisket and short rib with chile-tomato jam, raw milk cheddar, arugula, pickled sweet onions, and optional - nay, mandatory - bacon.)While the burger itself was pretty juicy and phenomenal, I thought the "raw milk cheddar" was disgustingly rich.  When I bite down into a burger, I don't want something with the consistency of a Cadbury creme egg oozing through my teeth.  A little of that cheese would be okay.  Instead, I felt like it totally drowned the natural flavor of everything else on my plate.Fries were exceedingly bland.  I didn't care for the chipotle ketchup or the dijon aioli they supplied.I suspect I may like DryHop more on future visits, but on this go 'round, the burger was far too rich for my tastes.

Had a late lunch at Dry Hop with one of my favorite out of towners about a month ago. We stayed there for a few hours and ended up eating a LOT so I'll go through a rundown of what we sampled:Poutine: The poutine was good but was not at all what I expected, very different than poutine I've had at other places.Buttermilk Biscuits & Sausage Gravy: This may've been the best thing we tried. The biscuits were enormous, heavenly, and very warm and came with excellent gravy. Definitely a must order if you're here for brunch.Bacon: I didn't try any but my dining companion tried the bacon and it was all gone, enough said.Make Your Own Omelette: Again, my dining companion had this and I didn't try it but he said it was good.Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich: I was so full by the time my sandwich came I struggled to eat much of it but what I had was pretty darn good.All in all I wanted to love Dry Hop but I just couldn't get there. The price point is high and the food is good, but not great. Since I live down the block I'll probably be back again, next time maybe just for beers.

I've seen a lot of positive reviews about DryHop Brewers so when my friend and I were looking for a place to eat before doing some day drinking I recommended we go here. The service and food was good, but my socks weren't knocked off. I will say the there were some other items that sounded good so I wouldn't be opposed to giving DryHop Brewers another chance.What I had:* Poutine - was good, but wasn't the best I've had.* The Burger - good flavor and juicy, but that's what I expect from a burger. I will say that the addition of the bacon definitely was a good decision on my part.

This place is so good. I have come here on my own and with coworkers and friends on many occasions.I usually end up getting their burger with fried egg, as this is definitely one of the better burgers you will find in the city. I order it cooked medium, and they nail it every time. Their fries, skillet cookie and soft pretzel are also quite desirable.Dryhop has a great revolving beer selection. The Shark Meets Hipster APA is their year-round offering, while they frequently change their other draft beers that are available. They always seem to have something for everyone's taste.Their service is impeccable as well. Every time I've been there, the servers and bartenders are always very helpful, attentive and knowledgable.Can't wait to bring more coworkers there in the months and years ahead.

Came here on a date and had a great time. We loved the atmosphere and open air seating. It's a cute place to sit back and relax after a long day!We ordered the mussels along with some beer as a starter. The mussels were delicious and had a great sauce! Later, I had the ham and pulled pork sandwich and fries and my date had the burger with an egg on top along with mac and cheese. I thought my pulled pork was good, but it could have used some stone ground mustard since it was a bit dry (they do provide dipping sauce such as ketchup and aioli sauce, which didn't do the trick for me). Fries were delicious. My date liked his burger but the mac and cheese had no flavor (and don't get me wrong, we love mac and cheese!).We are looking forward to coming back and ordering the beer samplers along with some more appetizers. The meat and cheese plate looked delicious!

This place has everything. Amazing food and fantastic drinks. The burger is one of the best I've had in Chicago. In addition to this the staff is always attentive and very polite. I can't ask for anything else when grabbing a bite to eat.If you are in lake view you have to stop here.

The atmosphere is romantic enough for a date but  casual enough to feel fancy by yourself. The menu is small but fierce. The staff is sweet but helpful.The bar is made of a giant oak tree that was struck by lightening! It's beautiful!! Also the bartender named Kevin is a sweetie and will headband secretly to the metal playing inside. It's dope, come here.

Unique beers brewed on site. My husband is the beer guy and he's enjoyed all the beers he's tried. I am a cocktail girl and they make one of the most delicious gimlets I have ever had, they add peach bitters. I can't comment on much of the menu except for the burgers which are good and the fries, which are amazing. Monday special is a burger, a beer and a shot of whiskey for $15. Awesome.

First off, every beer I tried was awesome.  I don't know what yeasts they're using here, but holy shit is it flavorful without off flavors.  Their saisons are outstanding.Here's what I didn't expect: the BEST mussels in Chicago.  Incredible green curry broth, beautifully buttered toast, and wonderful steamed mussels.Kudos to the fish tacos, skillet cookie with bourbon ice cream, and the mezcal/grapefruit cocktail.  All were also great.Service, again, outstanding, though service is a lot easier when the product is already top notch.I've heard people talk about this place like it was the best thing ever, but they were Cubs fans so I figured they were exaggerating and drinking the kool aid.Nope.Highly recommend.  Best brewpub in Chicago.

Went on a Friday evening at 6:30. Only had to wait 30 minutes & they text you when the table is ready. We got seated faster than expected and were able to sit outside. The food was great. Recommend the tacos (which are an appetizer) for an entree. I normally don't like my fish fried (grilled wasn't an option), but the breading wasn't over bearing.

The food is very good but very overpriced for the portions.  I ordered a flight and most of the beers were above average quality, shark meets hipster probably being the best out of the bunch.  Although being a beer snob, I was slightly disappointed in the lack of higher gravity beers.  The service was average and the atmosphere was decent, they open the front of the restaurant on nice days.  Will probably not come back due to the price.

Tried this place out a few months ago, I really enjoyed the ambience of the place and the fact they are a local brewery. I tried theirSummer arugula salad. I didn't hate it but it defiantly didn't catch my attention. When I told my friends I only tried the salad when I dined at dry hop, their jaws dropped and demanded I go again and try a hamburger. Today we went out for brunch and I tried the hamburger and I am a sucker for a good burger and their burger hit the spot. The French fries were also a nice addition, crispy and the sauces that accompanied the fries were so good, I almost asked for a to-go container for the Dijon aioli! Defiantly a great go-to spot in the area.

They have an IPA called "Shark Meets Hipster."  Of course I had to try this, and it's pretty dang good.  My dad is too cool to care about craft beer, so he let me pick something for him.  He had the Vampire Somethingorother, which I thought was equally as good as the Shark.  I like breweries with beers that all have very distinct flavors and varieties.We came here on a Saturday in the early evening, and we were informed of a one-hour wait for a table for 4.  We only wanted beer, so we headed to the bar, which was just as busy.  Every stool was filled, and there were crowds of people in every square inch of the place.  We ended up standing along a wall, which put us in the way of servers busing food back & forth.  Sorry guys.Despite the crowd, the bartender was friendly & prompt.  DryHop also has a small cocktail menu, but most are complex cocktails made with whiskey or bourbon.Paid street parking is (usually) available on Broadway, but we exhausted our options and parked in the garage next door.  An hour is a whopping $7, which may not be much if you're on the Gold Coast, but since we were only coming in for a beer, this one bit a little.I would definitely come back to DryHop, although not during their peak hours.

DryHop had been on my list of places to try for awhile, and my parents coming to visit for a long weekend seemed like just the right time to go.  We arrived around 2 on a Saturday afternoon.  The place was busy, but we were seated right away.  The tables are a little close together, but once people around us started to leave I didn't notice it as much when new parties were seated.  We started out ordering beers.  We tried Light Up Gold, Power Cosmic, 3Peat, and Shark Meets Hipster.  My favorite was 3Peat.  Some of the beers have different size options.  There's also a beer flight option, growlers and more to-go options.  We were all starving, so we decided to order some food.  They were still serving brunch at the time.  I think my only complaint of this place is serving brunch until 3pm, without having many options if you don't want something with eggs.  Adding a few more "lunch" style options would be great since not everyone wants eggs/breakfast foods at 2:30 in the afternoon.  Two at the table had Hank's Plate, one had the burger and I had the country fried steak and eggs.  Hank's Plate was enjoyed, the burger was decent, but my steak lacked flavor.  Thankfully, the gravy and egg helped render that.  Initially we were going to leave after eating, but we decided to stick around for another round of beers.  We really enjoyed our experience

Didn't even get a chance to eat here. Walked in with my parents and was talked down to by a hostess on a power trip.  Claimed there was a 3 hour wait for a table when no one else was waiting. When my Mother inquired about the communal table (that seated 6 but only had 2 sitting at it) the hostess cut her off saying "that's my job as the hostess to figure out seating". All we wanted to do was grab a bite to eat and this hostess, who is a serious need for an attitude check, had already ruined our appetites.Recommendation to management: ditch the server from Monday night. She's making you lose business and is tarnishing your name.*UPDATE* - one of the members in our party found the manager to express disappointment in how we were treated by the hostess. He seemed very sincere in his apology and offered to seat us within 10 minutes (the "hostess" told us 3 hours). Half of our group had already left in search of another restaurant so we did not take him up on his offer, but his urgency to ensure a nice dining experience was appreciated. For that, I'll up it a few stars.
Awesome burger and add the egg. I highly recommend a shark meets hipster beer. It was outstanding.

I'm certainly no beer snob, but do love a nice brewery. Tonight I visited Dryhop with a friend for the first time and would absolutely come back again.I tried the flight as I'm completely indecisive and enjoyed every beer in the line up. I tend to enjoy beers with fruity notes, so my favorite was the Violet Beauregarde, a lavender & blueberry saison.For my grub, Since I'm a picky vegetarian freak, I got the Mac n cheese with an egg on top. It was pretty hearty and the perfect portion size.If you find yourself in Lakeview, Dryhop is certainly worth checking out.

This was the first brewery that Boyfriend and I hit on our Chicago trip, and we came here because of its proximity to Wrigley Field (where we were going to watch a baseball game that evening).I really enjoyed their beer sampler, as well as the food that we ordered. I was super full after ordering the mac and cheese and adding bacon. I could barely finish it, but I could see why people can say that it's so-so. I personally love mac and cheese, so I'm never going to complain when it comes out better than what I can make it. Boyfriend's burger was pretty juicy and flavorful and definitely more than filling as well. He ordered it cooked medium, and it came out perfect. I also LOVED that their french fries were super crispy as well!The staff was very friendly and informative when we asked them some general questions about their beers (styles/flavors, etc.). The only downfall was that, for some reason, there was a lot of condensation on the pipes above our heads (the place has an industrial chic kind of decor), and the water kept dripping on us throughout our meal. Otherwise, I thought that this was a pretty cozy little place to eat!

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)1/1 Star: I walked here and there was no wait to get seated._____Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)1/1 Star: great service. Smooth classy ambiance. Clean._____Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)3/3 Stars: the Traditional Steak Frites is a must try! Very tender and juicy. Delicious! The carrot Cake is ok, needs more cream cheese icing_____Overall Experience5/5 Stars_____Last WordsAmazing service excellent food great ambiance

I went here for lunch with the boss and clients.  For a restaurant as expensive as this is, there were major problems.  Service was good, which is the only reason I am giving 2 stars.I ordered what turned out to be 3 little seared tuna tacos for $18.  They were ice cold as if they had been taken directly out of the refrigerator.  Worse than that, the tuna was so fatty that parts of it were inedible.  When you are taking clients, or anyone, to lunch, having to surreptitiously spit out globs of fat is not fun.It was clear that all of the entrees were cold. The boss sent his back.  I'm pretty sure that chicken pot pie is supposed to be at least warm.  The rest of us dealt with it, but don't plan to come back here for lunch until whoever runs the kitchen gets a microwave or learns how to cook to order.

One a lovely walk around the city one day, the bf and I were ravenous and decided to check this place out. Thinking that maybe it wouldn't be top quality because it's basically in touristville but it looked nice and we wanted to sit outdoors so we went for it.Since it was nice out and the freaken weekend, we opted for an alcoholic beverage. Nothin like a nice glass of champagne for a late brunch. When it arrived, his was bubbling like crazy, while mine was almost flat. We asked the server if she could check to see if mine was poured out of an old bottle. She came back with a new glass, claiming they came out of the very same, newly opened bottle. [insert eye roll]I ordered a salad. He order the lobster roll. We got calamari to start.The calamari tasted like typically greasy calamari that you'd get at a pub or cheap restaurant, but hey, it wasn't the worse. My salad was decent. I've had fresher from a salad bar, but it did the trick.My bf's lobster roll was laughable, to say the least. It looked like a tiniest bit of seafood salad on a lame looking hot dog bun. All that "lobster" for $20+.We asked the server about it.
