I had the "Aloha" and my husband had the "Crunch" - both were very good. I will definitely be back to try building my own bowl. Great addition to Lakeview.

For the third time in the last month, I stopped by to get lunch and they were out of tuna. I could understand this happening for a store that was going through growing pains in the first few weeks of business, but they make a habit of not properly stocking the one ingredient that is key to the one item they are known for. When I went by today, they were out of tuna at 11:50 am. They should post a sign or something letting people know of their supply chain issues prior to having the stand in line for 7 minutes.

This place is amazing! The food was great and reminded me of being in Hawaii and the staff was THE BEST! The owner helped me get connected to wifi when he could have just totally ignored my request. This allowed me to sit in their cute cafe and work for a few hours while I enjoyed my bowl.The ingredients were delicious and fresh and being that I work in food safety, I noticed that the place was clean and looked great! Highly recommend :)

The only thing better than Aloha Poke in the French Market is Aloha Poke in Lakeview.I love this place. The poke bowls are to die for - and I am a little embarrassed about how often I go here. The ahi tuna (I get the marinated) is as good as it gets. Aloha has quickly become my favorite lunch spot in the city.The medium size is a great deal - with tons of protein, rice & as many toppings as your heart desires.One hack - Get the Kahuna for lunch, and save half of it for dinner!!! Dreams do come true!

I love poke, but Aloha Poke Co far exceeded my expectations!  Tender Ahi, perfectly spiced, and beautiful presentation too.  Crazy good value too,  with the small size coming in under $9 for a very satisfying early lunch.  I will be back!

I reallllllly wanted to like this place because Poke bowls are one of my favorite things. Unfortunately, this was very disappointing.The ahi just didn't taste right - maybe because I got the marinated kind and that's not as fresh as the naked - but it just wasn't good fish. That said, the rest of the bowl tasted very good (minus the unripe avocado), but I just couldn't get past the fish to finish it.I'm hopeful this may be a result of this being a new location, but I won't be back for a while unless the quality improves.

Good food, friendly staff who didn't mind explaining what the different sauces were. I ordered the big white rice bowl with marinated ahi tuna and all veggies + samurai and volcano sauce. It was great and the crunchy bits gave it a nice texture. It IS basically a sushi without the wrapping. Will go here again.

Awesome Poke bowls. Salmon bowl was good. Big bowl was plenty to feed a good appetite. Staff was really good at explaining the process and he different sauces.Only down side was the annoying music playing. Kind of ruined eating in this location. Shazammed the music, The Gun Club, sounded like untalented teenaged kids who should never have a music deal. It was really that annoying that it altered our experience. Again food was great.

I took a few friends from work here for lunch.  Poke is the perfect lunch - you feel light and full of energy for the rest of the day.  My favorite part about this location is that they are open until 10PM so I can come for dinner now!My bowl:BigWhite ricesalmon and tuna marinatedMaui OnionJalapeñoSamurai sauceTobikoGingerCucumber

The manager contacted me so I wanted to clarify -What I meant by food poisoning was that something was so foul I couldn't stomach it and threw up. Since I had eaten there and the exact same order multiple times I knew something was off, it wasn't an issue of pallet. Apparently that is not what you call food poisoning and I apologize for any confusing terminology.I did tell some of my friends later about what happened and they shared the were very sick later that night and into the next day (taking the 12 hours to develop as real food poisoning does)The business owner has personally messaged me and I felt honestly hurt and attacked by his response.
Really cute place with fast service. Ingredients are fast and reasonably priced. Got this to eat before my drive home and the large bowl was plenty of food.

Poke bowls over PokeballsHonestly though, this was the best possible first bowl of Poke that I could've hoped for. And I barely payed 10 dollars for a medium sized bowl. Definitely go for the ahi tuna bowl with crunchy toppings when you do go here.

I stumbled upon this place randomly and love the concept of build your own Poké bowl. It really allows each customer to choose what fits their palette and/ or diet. The tuna and salmon fish is fresh and the topping selection is diverse. The portions are generous for the price. A sushi roll with a fraction of the fish can cost you the price of a small bowl. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a quick refreshing snack or meal with lean proteins and toppings. Definitely a great addition to the area.

I am Poke Obsessed and so glad the Lakeview location is now open with 10-10p business hours!!  Super Fresh Ahi Tuna just like I like it.  Can't wait to see how this holds up with the Poke in Hawaii.  Right now, I rate it 5 Stars. Yum...

Really fresh, flavorful and interesting options to choose from at Aloha. Crunch option was really good. Marinated tuna was great. Nice addition to the area. A bit more expensive, but well worth the cost. Serving sizes are good, but the bowels are a bit tricky to eat out of in the beginning.Great lunch spot.

I really liked my first two experiences at Aloha Poke Co, but this time the fish in my bowl was half frozen. Really disappointing and since I got take out there wasn't anything I could do. I hope they just need to check the fridge temp to ensure it's not too cold. If they're using frozen fish, that's a real bummer.

My first experience at Aloha Poke Co was a very positive one!  I met a friend here for lunch this past Thursday and was greeted by their friendly and helpful cashier.  I ordered a little bowl with a mix of brown rice and greens with marinated salmon and the Aloha add-ins (pineapple, cucumber, scallion, jalapeno, & maui onion sesame vinaigrette).  I also added edamame and ginger for good measure!  The mini container itself is pretty small but they packed on all of the ingredient for a voluminous volcano of toppings!  The fresh and light ingredients truly hit the spot on a steamy Chicago afternoon.  We were able to get seats at this small location during the lunch rush, ordering and getting our food very quickly.  My friend (new to Chicago) and I really enjoyed the chance to try a new cuisine in the Lakeview.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family and hope to frequent it in the months to come!

Aloha poke is a tiny restaurant but is very good. It's basically the chipotle burrito bowl of sushi. You start with your base, then select you fish, then your toppings and sauce. They have every thing form pineapple to sesame seeds. You can order a creations off the menu or make up your own many people say get the marinated fish but if you really love sushi get it plain. I got middle size and it was more than enough. My only issue is that they put so much stuff in the bowl you can't really mix it up to eat it(1st world problems) but regardless I will be back!
So good!!!! The poke bowls were just the right size and the variety of ingredients you can add are awesome. I ate here back to back the next day! Can't wait to come back.

This is the first poke I've had and as I eat this, I get sadder and sadder with every forkful knowing that I'm getting closer to its end. This stuff is delicious. Friendly staff and quick service. I will be back for sure...most likely tomorrow.

Awesome! Soooo thrilled this has made its way to lakeview. Our poke bowls were fantastic. Ordered the volcano with sauce on side. A plus lunch. Short line, fast service. Pretty sure this will be my new " go to" lunch place!!!
Food is so amazing! And affordable. You won't be disappointed. Place could be tidier though.
I can't say enough good things about poke. This is a must try for a casual lunch. My favorite is the crunch with half ice, half greens and added pineapple. Enjoy!

Today was my second time stopping in, the first was yesterday. I work off the redline so the location is very convenient. Staff is super friendly, patient and knowledgable. The food itself is awesome. Flavors go well together, portions are huge, everything taste fresh, and I always leave feeling super satisfied. You can add extras wo an extra cost which I appreciate. Definitely recommend 100%

If you like Sushi, you'll LOVE this place.  My photos wouldnt do this place justice.  Def a must go to.  It might seem like the line is long, its really not.  There just isnt a ton of space to stand before the register.  Cant wait to go back.  We got tuna and another bowl of salmon, salmon was better (and get it crunch style!) and the mid sized dish is the perfect amount.  Bravo to this concept!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Amazing! So happy this location opened up. The fish and ingredients are so fresh and they absolutely give you your money's worth. The staff is very friendly and the place is always packed. I also wouldn't mind to poke the tatted guy behind the counter.
Great to have a healthy take out option with so much flavor in the neighborhood. They told me they aren't taking phone orders yet, but in doesn't take long when you order there.

The crunch bowl with marinated ahi tuna is my everything. Deeeeelicious. On the pricey side, but worth it for the amount and quality of ingredients. Side note: the "big" size looks like it's on the small side, but will definitely fill you up.

I have gone about 5 times since they opened and it has gotten better each time. The first time I went they forgot some ingredients but it was still delicious. I only wished they delivered! It is so fresh and taste amazing! Definitely recommend!
Had my first poke bowl today - absolutely delicious. Obviously great you don't have the lines that you do in French market, but I hope they do enough business to stick around!

Aloha poke is mouthwater healthy food and unreal sushi sashimi grade fish and fresh vegetables in delectable sauce, what's not to like!  I love how Poke is popping up across Chicago. Have been replacing unhealthy eating options with Poke.   The lines kept me away from their French Market location (well mostly ha i've been a bunch) but now you get pick up, delivery, or just eat there.  Aloha Poke FTW!
Fresh & Delicous! A refreshing addition to Lakeview. The service is amazing and the food speaks for itself
I've been looking for poké for the longest time since I gotten back from California. So happy to have found this spot. Delicious hands down everything is so fresh. Will be coming back for more.

I'm pretty sure this is my new chipotle but 100x better. I've been dying to go to Aloha Poke Co but the Fulton market location wasn't exactly convenient and the hours weren't great. I was counting down the days until they opened in Lakeview by my apartment and just had the chance to go today! It was as awesome as I expected. The best part is, they don't charge for toppings so you can get whatever you want! I went for a big bowl with marinated ahi, brown rice, avocado, edamame, scallions, jalapeño and tobiko with both volcano sauce, crunch, and spicy aoli. I went all out!! The big size was really filling! I definitely wouldn't have been able to go for kahuna but the small would've probably been enough for a light lunch. I loved the combo, it tasted amazing, even better than sushi. In the future, I'd probably ask them to go light on the jalapeños and maybe would've tried a different sauce because the aoli was rich. But the combo made for a perfect "treat yoself" meal while still staying relatively healthy
Food is absolutely incredible. Everything is light, fresh, healthy -- favorite spot for lunch hands down. Also staff are super cool!! Have a feeling we'll see many more Aloha Poke's in our future!

Omg, I am in love!  I have already eaten here twice this week.  Fish is sooo fresh and they have so many options to add to the poke bowl.  Absolutely delicious and healthy!  I wish they had parking but it's Chicago so you have to try your luck with street parking.
SO GOOD. Food is vibrant, filling, and flavorful. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable.

Good spot for a brand new trend. The fish is fresh which you can tell upon consumption. My only real complaint is when they put the sauce on themselves they put a little too much on. I solved that problem by asking for sauce on the side, pretty well executed in my opinion.

Simply amazing!! I've been determined to try a poke bowl since the poke craze started and I'm glad I finally caved! One of the employees suggested the crunch bowl which I ordered with brown rice and ahi tuna. That with the jalapeño and fresh ginger was heaven! They just made a new fan!

Amazing!!!!! They ran out of mixed greens and gave me seaweed. I will now pay extra for this option. The marinated tuna was perfect and the portions generous.  Added crunch, avocado, ginger, onions and tobiko. Didn't need sauce.

The food is REALLY good!!  HOWEVER, all 4 times I've gone there, they got my order wrong. The last time I went I told them it was incorrect and the guy was not happy to have to remake my dish. I likely won't be back because of the service.
Delicious , fair priced and fast ! Very fresh ingredients and a great option for lunch.
Friendly service and great food at a reasonable price.
Decent for mainland standards. If you've ever had authentic Hawaiian poke, though, you'll know better. Haoles will enjoy it. And if you don't know what a Haole is, you've proved my point ;)
Soooo delicious!! Awesome staff too. Perfect for grabbing lunch on the way to the beach.

When you want to step back into time,... go to Tortoise Supper Club.Upon arrival, I was greeted right away.  Since my dinner date hadn't arrived yet, I had opted to have a drink in the bar area, which has several tables along with a piano in the corner for entertainment on the weekends.  The attendants were friendly and attentive.Once my friend had arrived, we were seated right away in the dining room.  The room has several sizes,  The server, Philia Y, had greeted us right away.  Since I had glass of wine, my companion decided to order a Whiskey Sour and the Relish Tray for an appetizer.  Both were delivered shortly.  You never can go wrong with their relish tray.For main entree, we decided to have the Salmon Cedar and the BBQ Ribs. Within 12 minutes. great timing, our meals were brought to us.  Along with couple more glasses of wine.    Philia would check in with us periodically.    Both meals were excellent.For dessert, we had opted to try slices of the Key Lime Pie and Peanut Butter Pie.  I have had the slice of Cherry Pie before and it very delicious.Overall, we truly enjoy the food and service.  I would recommend this great supper club.

SERVICE: Very prompt and attentive service. He started suggestions as soon as I walked in. And asked about a refill within 2 minutes. I think the bartender was training, and he was doing a great job, even as things sped up with more people coming in.They are very particular here about their drinks and the flavors going into them. I heard some of the notes given by a senior bartender to the trainee and got PTSD of when I worked at a very similar bar.OYSTERS AND SHRIMP: Delaware Bay. Plump and fairly firm meat. Some sources describe DB's as "nutty" in flavor and I can see that. Definitely earthy oysters. This places served them with a mignonette sauce and a ta sauce. The hot sauce was amazing. If I were the kind of person to take sauces in my bag, I would totally do it now.The shrimp were juicy, a little smaller than expected, but a dollar is a dollar I guess. The hot sauce made them awesome. I've already added cocktail shrimp and Tabasco sauce to my shopping list.ATMOSPHERE: After work crowd, because I came at 5pm. Light conversation, dim lighting, and soft music playing in the background. The music almost sounded  like 70's disco or soul. The place starting filling out more as time went on and conversation drifted from a soft din to a more robust situationDRINKS: Guava Margarita was very flavorful with a strong guava taste. Basically what you would expect from the ingredients. The chili lime rim made this drink. I love chili lime rims.Southside was very boozy, though it didn't taste it, about .5-1 ounce more of alcohol. Very minty and very refreshing.Overall, the Wednesday drink specials make this place doubly worth the happy hour. When you can get a well crafted drink for $6 in the heart of chicago, that catches my attention. The price might make my review a bit biased.

A new favorite in Chicago, which says a lot with all of the fantastic restaurant options.  Great drinks, even better food, AND live jazz!  Great atmosphere and a beautiful wooden interior.What more do you want?

Great place for a fun, lively, and friendly dinner with live music!  It can definitely get noisy so it maybe isn't the best place for a romantic date. But $1 happy hour for $1 shrimp and oysters is definitely worth checking out after work!Other dinner highlights: the lobster bisque, salmon poke, braised short ribs, and chilean sea bass.And for dessert: get the peanut butter pie!

Great atmosphere and wonderful drink options to choose from. Best place to go for happy hour, 4:30-6 for $1 shrimp and oysters. Also love the grilled shrimp and guac. (I live shrimp, can you tell)?The service is always excellent, from everyone in the bar or dining area, to the hostess. I will be back often and would like to sit outside sometime. Its hard to top this wonderful experience!

Since Benny's didn't have its $0.25 oyster special on Wednesdays anymore, my friend and I had to find a new oyster bar special nearby. The happy hour at Tortoise is not bad! I had 1 dozen of Delaware Bay oysters for $12, half dozen of jumbo shrimps for $6, and a $12 mint chocolate shake (overpriced because I asked them to make it a virgin non-alcoholic version). The oysters were very fresh, but lacked the oyster liquid. Jumbo shrimps were very plump and fresh as well. The adult milk shake is also very tasty... too bad I can't drink. I appreciate that the happy hour special is an every day offer from 4:30pm to 6:30pm. ^__^V  Will be back!

Stopped by with co-workers for the restaurant week lunch special. The lunch special consists of 3 courses - appetizer, entree, and dessert. The choice of appetizer was soup of the day (mushroom/asparagus), tomato soup, or house salad. Choice of entree included kale and quinoa salad, bacon cheeseburger, fish and chips, and meatloaf. Dessert was limited to tortoise pie - chocolate custard, candied walnuts, bourbon-caramel sauce, and whipped cream.I started with the house salad - green leaf lettuce, julienned granny smith apples, candied walnuts, goat cheese, cranberries, and vanilla vinaigrette. The salad was great and I especially enjoyed the light vinaigrette, although I didn't really taste any vanilla. I was conflicted between the meatloaf and fish/chips. I ordered the fish and chips based on our servers recommendation. The fish and chips is not a great value - one piece of fish comes with the order. While I enjoyed the flaky fish, tempura batter and tartar sauce, I couldn't get past the portion size. The fries were decent as well. The dessert was outstanding and reminded me of a walnut brownie. The dessert is extremely rich if you're wondering.My co-workers enjoyed their bacon cheeseburgers and meatloaf. I had a taste of the meatloaf and it was definitely the highlight of the lunch. I would return to order the meatloaf.**I revised my rating because the restaurant week lunch special, specifically the fish and chips is not a great deal. With tax and tip I paid $30 for my meal.

I have always tried to avoid Tortoise Club. And I really shouldn't have. We came in for a birthday dinner - a group of 8 on a Sat. night which isn't always easy to find in the River North area. We had incredible service, I had the best char, and we were very well taken care of.Our waiter was great. He was over friendly and I felt like he wasn't use to getting a larger group so he was doing his best to make sure we were liking everything. It is an older crowd, but the live insturmental music is great, and the environment is fun and chatty.

I went for happy hour to get the $1 shrimp and oysters which were tasty. Service was okay, the waiter never came back until we stared at her to get her attention. I will only go back as a last resort if I'm craving oysters and shrimp until I find another spot.

Dear 1$ oysters, how can you exist? Ohhhh and the hand made drinks are on point. Thx you Lisa for your expert service and knowledge and supreme confidence in what you're establishment puts out. Excellent all around.

Great spot for dinner AND casual happy hour, not many places in that neighborhood that can do both! Service and hospitality are above and beyond and the owner presence is a welcome surprise compared to most more corporate spots around town!
Just hosted a luncheon for 25 people in their beautiful private dinning room. Jenn and our server George with a pleasure to work with. Will be back soon.

This may look like any of the hundred other steakhouses in River North, but the food here is a but above (no pun intended) and it's not all about steak.The bar can be pretty loud after work, and the patio gets crowded on nice summer days, but even when full the dining room has some reasonably un-boistrous corners.We stared with the excellent smoked salmon, a generous serving with bagels and condiments, and the hamachi crude, which was topped with peppers with just the right amount of spice.For entrees we also enjoyed the rich and tasty Oak Aged Bourbon Barrel Meatloaf, which came with some very creamy seller root mashed potatoes. The Lake Superior Whitefish had a really nice crust and a pleasantly citrus tinged beurre blanc.The Not Your Father's Root Beer float was the perfect dessert.Wine markup seems a bit steep, although there was a nicely priced Scotch flight the week we visited.

I visited this restaurant for a friend's birthday dinner.  It had a nice ambiance. They had a live jazz bland playing music in the back of a dimly candle lit restaurant. I felt "fancy" lol. I had a mix review on the food. The tomato soup I had was delicious! It was roasted tomatos (not cream based) topped with fresh goat cheese and croutons. Yummy! But the salad I ordered? Ehhh I had the house salad and added chicken. The chicken was dry with little to no flavor and the salad didn't have enough toppings for taste. The service was great. So I had enjoyable experience.

-3.5 stars-Tortoise Club is quite the random restaurant on State that's easily glossed over by the thousands of folks passing by on foot each day. I was one of them too, always wondering just what exactly was inside this 'Tortoise Club' place until I decided to stop by for lunch.We started off with the complimentary cheesy and sesame chips which was super unique and tasty albeit some parts of the chip were incredibly salty. For our mains, we got the French dip and the Tortoise club sandwich. The French dip was alright, the prime rib had no flavor by itself so you must dip the sandwich into the light rosemary au jus for a much tastier bite. The Tortoise club sandwich was like your typical club sandwich with bacon, lettuce, chicken, egg, and avocado. The sea salt vinegar chips on the side were very good. You can tell it's made in-house; definitely nothing like the ones you get from a bag of chips at convenience stores.Dessert was the real shining moment for me. We got the white peach and champagne sorbet which was DELICIOUS!! It was probably my favorite part of the meal. The taste of champagne really sticks out and then you get a hint of the white peach in the background as well. We also got the bourbon pecan ice cream which although also very tasty, after having the champagne sorbet, the bourbon did not stand out as much until you eat more of it.Tortoise Club is a quaint little spot from the outside, much bigger once you walk in. It's fairly dim inside but the little lamps at each table work to brighten things up a bit. They have private dinner rooms capable of seating 10+. Service was great but the food came somewhat slowly especially if you have limited time for lunch.

Because we live very close to TC, we tend to overlook it and we shouldn't. It has a nice, old world feel and the food is really good. We went last night for dinner and enjoyed ourselves.We had the chef special of leg of lamb & the steak frites with a side of root vegetables. Everything was excellent.During the week they have $1 shrimp & $1 oysters for happy hour. Also $5 drinks on Wednesdays.TC also has live music on the weekends in the bar area. This area is very lively & festive, yet mature & civilized.

The Tortoise Club is a great spot in the thick of it all.  It has an old style charm about it - with modern, delicious American food and cocktails.  I'd say that it's fit for foodies, friend gatherings, special occasions and dates.  I wouldn't bring a family with small kids here.I was recently here with a large group celebrating a birthday - and the service and food were fantastic.  The cocktails were even better!A great spot worth a visit!

I came here with a small group, and was able to secure the private room that was beautiful, and warm on a cold snowy night!!They have a great wine selection and we ordered the Fleur De Campo Pinot, which was complimentary with everyone's orders.I loved the menu immediately because they have gluten free items very clearly marked.  It made it very easy for me to order.Favorite appetizers were the oysters and the relish tray.  We also ordered the calamari, but I would say that it was not as special as the mix of East Coast and West Coast oysters and relish options.The favorite plate of our group was the whitefish, lamb rack, and the filet steak.  All were delicious and cooked perfectly.Our server was excellent.Great steakhouse atmosphere!!

While I was staying downtown at the Wyndham which is amazing the front desk told me to eat at the tortoise club which was 2 blocks away from the hotel. When we got there it had a very old but romantic setting. Dimmed lights, thick table cloths, and more silverware then I am use to. When me and my gf got there we were instantly greeted by 2 associates. We sat in a very nice booth with candle light. I had the New York steak crusted with blue cheese with grilled asparagus. For the price of almost $50 a steak it was okay, I had it done medium but it seemed rougher than normal and the blue cheese was overwhelming the taste of the meat. If you are downtown and really want to go "fancy" and treat your lady go here, the food is just okay but the location is perfect and the ambiance is amazing along with exceptional service.

I came here with a couple friends this weekend.  While the atmosphere was great, the food and drink did not meet up to its standards. I realize it's downtown, and drinks are pricey everywhere, however I want to taste the alcohol in my $12 drink.  These drinks were good, but tasted like high quality sugary juice. The worst part of the evening is that both of my friends ordered oysters (not happy hour oysters, regular priced oysters) and a few of them were so small we didn't even know if an actual oyster was present.  On top of that, they both said the oysters tasted off.  They sent them back, and they were taken off the bill, but no one really seemed too concerned. Such a bummer.

Started with a friendly greeting as we came in, a warm and welcoming atmosphere occurred.  Chimmee (rhymes with Jimmy) did a great job being attentive and giving us recommendations on wines and entrees.  Since this was pre theatre! We told him about our 7:30 curtain time and he made sure to get us through all courses with plenty of time to spare from our 5:30 reservation. (No service delays at dessert time which is so common in many places) The wine selections were great.  Bottles run from $50 on so and make sure you have plenty of credit on your card available.We started with the lobster bisque, which had a few strips of zucchini added for enhanced flavor.  Wonderful!For the entrees, my partner had the filet.. They have 2 sizes and choices.. one was stuffed with blue cheese and one without but had asparagus and worchester sauce.   The small size was perfect.So i had the market fish special, which was a grouper with some kind of crab topping. Missed the whole explanation but ... I will say this, it was among the best fish dishes i ever had anywhere.  (And given the number of places and excellent fish offerings I've tried, this really says a lot).Dessert was a peanut butter pie.. Again it was the recommendation of Chimmee and what a great one it was.I can't say enough great things about this place.  One of my new favorite downtown places.  Pricey but worth every penny!

My sister and I celebrated our respective birthdays at the Tortoise Club last night and couldn't have had a better time.  The food was amazing, starting with the baked crab dip for our appetizer and a cocktail called 10 Cent Pistola (which was very similar to the Raise Your Glass cocktail I had there earlier this year.  Bourbon, citrus, coffee.  I asked our server to request that the bartender stop by my house every evening to mix up a batch, but I was told that there's a waiting list for that, so I'm out of luck for now.)We followed that up with salmon for my sis and the petite filet for me.  Both perfectly cooked and seasoned.  There is an option to have a sauce of your choice on your steak, but I prefer my meat naked, so to speak.  I want to taste the meat!  The filet was so tender and tasty I wish I had ordered a larger one.We ended the meal with cherry pie and a "Hummer" adult cocktail.All in all, a spectacular meal and our server couldn't have been friendlier, more professional, or more helpful.  She gave us the space we wanted to have a leisurely meal and even told us the story of the caricature hanging behind our table.Thank you, Tortoise Club, for another wonderful evening.

Conveniently located traditional upscale restaurant. Clientele tends to be on the older side, which I take as a good sign (I think older people tend to know the good places, and they have more $$ to actually go haha).Great ambience with live music, dimmed lights, and table cloths. I'm a sucker for table cloths. Service was great and the waiter gave very good recommendations.Highly recommend their cocktails, especially the sazerac.

Can't believe we arrived in Chicago during "Chefs Week!" The food here is amazing! We had the salad, sea bass and the filet. Delicious!  He had the tortoise pie for dessert; I had the ice cream/espresso dessert (it's actually a drink). Both were fantastic!  The service was excellent. Loved the clubby atmosphere.

Visited twice and unfortunately this place was just alright at best. If anything, I'll say the appetizers taste better than the main courses. Personally I'm not a fan of the new menu. For the price, I was disappointed in the food. The crusted whitefish was delightful, but unfortunately is no longer on the menu. I wouldn't visit a third time.

Of the little bit I know of Chicago, I would say this is one of the best happy hours there.  1 dollar shrimp an oysters?  Great deal!  The fresh horseradish cleared out my sinuses!The bartender was very knowledgeable of his craft and a cool dude.  The waitress was great and nice too.When I go back to Chicago, I am going back to the Tortoise Club.
Excellent food, service, atmosphere, and live jazz. Hard to beat this restaurant for a delicious and pleasantly traditional night out.

My friends and I came here to celebrate my husband's birthday at Tortoise Club. We walked by here few times and finally decided to give it a try. Our server (forgot her name) but she's a cute petite young girl was helpful and friendly...accommodating to us since we took awhile to order since the 5 of us wanted to chat. Total time we spent at Tortoise Club was probably around 3 hours. We love the atmosphere - it has a very Chicago feeling, playing jazz music in the background, dimly lit room with artwork around. A nice place to have dinner and catch  up with friends.Our table started with the shrimp and guacamole, crab cake, and each one of us ordered a soup. I had the tomato soup which was decent. My husband had their special cream of corn chowder with crawfish which he thought was ok...didn't taste much of the crawfish, mainly corn. The shrimp and guacamole was decent. Crab cake was a disappointment, 2 small pieces for $17 and it was heavily breaded. It did not taste as good either.I had the roasted amish chicken. It was decent - I like the sauce on the chicken. It came with potato salad and corn on a cob. I didnt eat much of the corn, but potato salad was decent. My husband had their steak..which he thought was good along with the asparagus. Two friends ordered their white fish..one didn't really like it, the other liked it. I forgot what my other friend ordered. Shortly later one of my friends threw up in the bathroom - not sure if it was from the food she just ate or from breakfast..We ordered the strawberry shortcake to share with the table as dessert. It was a belated birthday celebration for my husband. The presentation of the shortcake is nice, but the biscuits on the short cake or the actual cake itself was dry. Didn't really enjoy that, but it came with lots of fruits so we all took bites of the fruits.Overall it was a decent time, and food is just average for our liking. We did enjoy the atmosphere and the music.

Good steak and very nice ambiance, but service could have been SO much better, so we will go with 2 stars on this one.We had a reservation for 7, and we were sat by 7:05.We were sat in a cozy corner half booth, half table, and our server came over shortly after.I could already tell from the initial contact I wasn't going to like this guy, and every small interaction thereafter proved me correct.I was doing my thang trying to be fun and engaging, and the whole time he was as stale as three month old bread. I asked him how their Moscow Mule is ("since I'm very picky about my Moscy's") and he was like, "yea, it's fine". K well I guess I'll have one. Thanks for making that sound so enticing sir.Anyway, onto the food....We had an amazing Crab Cake for the appetizer, which had a sriracha aioli, pickled cucumber, and crispy jalapenos on top. YUM. So so good. I'd come back just for the crab cake.My boyfriend and I both went with the Chicago 250 Filet, medium rare, and the twice baked blue cheese and bacon baked potato on the side. I also got a blue cheese crust on mine.So anyway, this is where it got really weird....My steak was fine, my boyfriend's was definitely overcooked, there was no pink or red in there...He was just going to eat it, and I told him he was nuts if he did that, and we'd just get a new one, it would only take 5-10 minutes...I called our overly friendly waiter over, and told him that the steak was overcooked and his response... "I don't know what you want me to do about that." oh and then asked him to cut through the steak to show him his steak to prove it wasn't cooked correctly. WHAT?! What does that even mean. I was so turned off at that point I literally had to look away because it was so unbelievably uncomfortable. We both sat there in disbelief, steak still in front of my him for the next 5 minutes, not really knowing what to do. Anyway the manager finally came over and was like "I heard you may have had an overcooked steak." To which I replied, "Actually, we could really care less about the steak being overcooked, I just didn't appreciate the way the server handled it and how rude he was." Anyway, he comped the steak, and we didn't get a new one.Long story short, there are many other steak houses in Chicago...

Tortoise Club is a great spot for a nice dinner out with friends or a fancy date. This upscale restaurant has a warm, welcoming feel. I enjoyed the live music playing in the background while we spent time in conversation, good food, and drinks.We tried a few items on the menu and I personally felt the Oak Aged Bourbon Barreled Meatloaf, Steak burger, and calamari were the top dishes!The meatloaf was rich in flavor and not dry whatsoever. The meatloaf came with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprout sprinkled with bacon bits. Portions were rather small in my opinion, definitely not enough to share, but if you don't like sharing then it's perfect.The steak burger was perfectly tender and juicy the way a good burger should be. The burger came with a side of fries.If you're party is generally hungry then you'll want to order at least 1 hors d'oeuvres for every 2-3 people for your entree to be filling.

Awesome service and good food with and delicious drinks! Came for a friend's birthday party on a Saturday night, and the service was very accommodating for everyone coming in separately over the course of the evening. Definitely recommend this place for a group event! (Our reservation was for 15, I think we ended up with 17? For an 8pm, with stragglers coming in through 9:30/10pm) wonderful! Live music an awesome bonus

My two employees and I had an epic lunch at Tortoise Club and it was phenomenal. While they also can do a quick lunch meal, the vibe is certainly going back to the era when face-to-face business mattered for a two-martini lunch. They even say "founded in 2012, inspired by 1959." In such a flashy area of the city, Tortoise Club is not doing a fly-by-night business. They show that a good, classic meal with genuine hospitality and a homey interior is to be coveted, especially in the year 2016.My ahi tuna steak was massive. I tasted the filet mignon - it was perfectly salted. The fries had that magical texture of super crisp on the outside and soft inside (double fried maybe?). For dessert we split the decadent tortoise pie, fudgy inside and oozing in caramel. Service was professional, straight-forward, friendly and efficient.I work with groups with my tour company, Chicago Detours, and hope to bring clients here. They have a room for up to 60 that is outfitted with a/v equipment, and the design is warm, simple and elegant - a big step up from more generic steakhouses in the area. And the restaurant has some great ties to Chicago history, with paintings of characters from history and wood from the Pump Room.Oh, and check out the jazz on weekends and the happy hour looks great, too!Highly recommended!
My meal was a little underwhelming.   I had pan seared Tuna with asparagus.   The food was on the bland side and lacked any flavor.On the positive side, they make a really great old fashion!

The atmosphere and dinner at the Tortoise Club is really some thing special. I brought my wife here for her birthday and the service from the staff was exceptional. We started our evening at the bar to take advantage of their Happy Hour indulging in fresh shrimp and oysters. Presented on a bed of crushed ice both were incredibly fresh with a wide selection of wines to suit anyone's taste. We moved to their romantically lighted dining room well appointed with dark wood and contrasting painted walls. We both chose entrees following the shrimp and oysters. She had the baked grouper which was remarkably fresh and I had the pork chop on a bed of smoked grits which was absolutely delightful. The waitstaff, in particular our waiter Philipe, was very attentive and answered all of our questions regarding the entrees. We closed the dinner with a desert of peanut butter pie and a glass of twenty year port. Both were delectable. I will come here again to enjoy the live Jazz that they have on some evenings. The Tortoise Club is an amazing experience for those that want an adult dining experience. Cheers
Nice place with live music, but crowed was so so. I guess midwest , I shouldn't expect more ;-)We stopped by for oysters and champagne, but next time would like to try full dinner.

Came here this past Monday after work. I never talk about servers but our server seemed like he hated his life. Monotone and no personality. I enjoyed watching other servers talk to their tables and saw how enthusiastic they were  and then I looked at my  server. That can really alter my experience at  a restaurant like this.The fact that he knew it was $1 oysters and shrimps for happy hour and didn't mention it and charged us full price for it at the end. And then tried to make it seem like it was our fault for not mentioning it though it was clearly advertised when you walk in. Was it not your job to tell your table what the specials were when greeting the table? And you failed to do so. Come on now, I've been a part time server for 10 plus years, don't try to rack up your bill like that.

Had been pushing off going here but I'm glad that my fam was finally able to go.Service was great. Food was greater. Decor was the greatest. Looks like Ralph Lauren designed the place and I just want to live there.The Food...Oysters: 2 east, 2 west. Wasn't presented which ones were which (really?) but I could figure it out. Very small. Pretty fresh- east tasted a little off but it's probably a seasonal issue not the restaurant. No shell and separated. Not enough cocktail sauce bc served with other raw items.Tuna tartar: best ever. This was smokey and fresh... Indescribable. Wish the crackers weren't so flimsy. They couldn't hold the tuna. You should stop with that rice cracker stuff. So many places do it and it doesn't work. Use an actual cracker.Caesar: Perfect. I eat a lot of caesar salads and this was one of the best. Dressing tasted a little bit tangy which I really liked.Steak: perfect again. I loved the potato it came with. Perfect.Desert: cherry pie- why not served warm? Good but not mind blowing. Ice cream was fantasticNot Good Stuff...Do you not offer bread? My table didn't get any but I thought I saw bread at other tables.No drink menu at the table. WTF. Do I look like I don't drink bc that's just crazy. Always drink menu. Always.(Star taken away bc oysters not presented, not enough cocktail sauce, rice cracker issues, no drink menu, and mediocre pie)

Tortoise Club strikes me as some old school throw-back where ad execs take their lady friends for lunch. Located in the basement of a nearly inaccessible building (fire hazard??), my friend and I were greeted by two blonde short skirts asking if we had reservations. We were sort of anxious that we didn't but the ladies let us in passed a couple of tables of 'ladies who lunch' into a dining area that was dark but upscale into one of their many open tables (it was about 30% full at noon).Long story short, the service was 'meh', the french dips were fine and it was a perfectly reasonable place to have lunch. I could definitely do without the snooty ladies at the door who hoovered over the table next to us not so quietly gossiping about a TV host that was there and scheming to walk by him. It's a $12 sandwich in a quiet place but don't take your laptop or hope that the upscale name gives you anything worth paying extra for.

I went to Tortoise Club this past weekend for my birthday and had a wonderful experience.  Upon arrival, there was a sign on the table wishing me a happy birthday and the server came around with complementary champagne for us to start our meal with a toast.The ambiance is lovely and it was quiet, even when packed. The service was wonderful.  Our server was just the right balance of attentive and not in our faces.  The food was delicious.After dinner, our server brought me a piece of cake with a candle, which was also delicious and very thoughtful.Our whole party walked away feeling like we had a very special dining experience.  It is fancy and fun enough for a celebratory dinner but not so expensive that you couldn't go there on a normal night.I will definitely be back!

Was there for a concierge event.Chris was our host. He was awesome! Friendly, knowledgeable, professional and hospitable.This was for 2, we started with a crab cake which was nothing short of excellent. Small side of slaw, and it's only one crab cake but it's HUGE and shareable. We wanted more!Ordered a chilled, bottle of Ken Wright Pinot(approx. $70)2nd course was braised beef short ribs and the lady had chef's halibut special.The best braised short rib I've had. Fall off the bone, tender, and juicy. It was served with first layer of mashed potatoes, then braised beef, carrots and daikon around the dish. Can't remember the name of the rendered sauce but it was SOO GOODThe Chef's special Halibut was buttery and flaky. Served with roasted corn on the cob and pineapple salsa. The best part of the Halibut dish was the Lime crema. Splash the lime crema on everything, we asked for more.For dessert we had the cherry apple pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was good, but we both thought it could have been sweeter.The restaurant itself is pricey, but you can taste the quality of food and experience the excellence in service.Come here! Will not be disappointed!

I really enjoyed my experience at the Tortoise club. While this restaurant was recently established, it possessed an old world feel. The decor included dark oak finishings and tables, and nice red and green hues on the walls and furniture.Beyond the comforting decor that harkened back to another era, the food was fantastic. I was pleased with my choice of the tomato soup and ahi tuna tartare. Both dishes were well presented and flavorful. Lumps of goat cheese in the soup and a pairing with a moist and fluffy biscuit really made it a wonderful option.  The ahi tuna tartare was also a perfect, with its fishy and avocado flavor pairing.It was a perfect end to a trip to the Windy city.
We were sitting in a bar area for couple of drinks. I saw they have oysters for happy hour. Good and very friendly service. I'll be back for a dinner.

Great atmosphere and service! Their food is delicious- good for meat eaters and vegetarians. I work at a hotel in Lincoln Park and I always recommend Tortoise Club to guests when they're looking for a nice meal. Their apple pie is to die for!

Late dinner review.I keep missing their $1 oyster happy hour special but I finally made dinner and it was OK.To fully appreciate this review, THINK  how many drinks and $1 oysters you and a partner could have in two hours 4:30-6:30 for $150?We received very helpful attentive service from Sasha who we would have loved to have taken home but we are sure now that we couldn't have afforded her, see below. Our steak tartare was very good, a little small but spicier in a good way than usual. The Berkshire pork chop was excellent but we would not order the white fish again, either improperly frozen or just too thin to really prepare well, overcooked or mushy- pick one. Small salad was small.It could be quiet and intimate there after 8pm but somebody decided to seat us next to the only other four people, LOUD from the South, we could see outside the bar.The star was the cherry pie with the smallest scoop of really good ice cream we've ever seen. We had four glasses of wine and a $25 coupon, and left minus $147 so think before you just wander in here instead of catching the happy hour oyster special.Thanks Sasha, you rock.

Came here on a Saturday night for dinner with friends.  It's got a "classic steakhouse" vibe, with wood paneling and old school classy dining  set up, seems like a great place for a business meeting.We started with drinks, which were all fabulous.  We tried the Manhattan, Old Fashioned, Whiskey Sour, Aviation and Jack & Rose and all were fantastic! (the Jack & Rose is a little sweet for my taste - apple brandy - but still well crafted).  My friend also tried the rose sparkler and it was nice and crisp.The food was excellent too.  We took a pretty comprehensive tour of the menu, here it is, by course, in order of yumminess:Apps-Ahi Tuna Tartare - we almost didn't order this, but I'm so glad we did!  It was fresh and delicious and oh so refreshing!-Smoked trout spread - I actually wasn't expecting to like this, but it was delicious!  Smokey and creamy, it was very tasty-Baked Crab Dip - good but not as good as the smoked trout spread, aboveMains-Pheasant Pie - this is one of their signature dishes for a reason.  It was delicious!!!  Perfect pastry, very meaty and sinfully rich (thanks, foie gras!)  One of the best pot pies I've ever had!-Bourbon Barrel Meatloaf - I usually expect meatloaf to be overcooked, but this was great, it's a generous portion and full of flavor.  The brussel sprouts were great too!-Grilled Tuna- I didn't get to try this, but my friend really liked it-House Ground Steakburger - in a restaurant that serves several cuts of steak, you would expect the burger to be outstanding.  It looked dry and was pretty underwhelming.  The fries were good, but not enough to save a disappointing burgerDessert-Tortoise Pie - It took me an embarrassingly long time to realize this was their play on Turtle (duh), and IT WAS AMAZING!   We wished we had gotten two!-Cherry Pie - Very tasty to those who like tart pie, the tortoise one was more of a crowd pleaser-House made ice creams - we were pretty underwhelmed by these, but they weren't greatOverall, delicious cocktails, great food, good service.  I would come back!

I came heat for restaurant week with friends on Saturday and really enjoyed my meal. We started with steak tartare and wild mushroom soup. The tartare was delicious but the soup was alright. My entrée was a birkshire pork chop. Now that made the meal worth eating! Cooked to perfection! For dessert I had the tortoise pie. Not really my thing, it was too sweet for my taste. The waiter was great and suggested a great Cabernet that went well with my chop. I would definitely return but maybe some new menu items.
One of my favorite venues in Chicago. Great appetizer, great drinks! Salmon Poke is amongst the favorites.Happy hour and dollar shrimp / oyster on Wednesdays makes it even better.

We had a nice pre-theater dinner here.  This is a cozy clubby place - dim, leather, banquettes.  Nice.  You feel like you're a big shot eating here.  There's a nice cocktails and wine list.  My wife was in the mood for a pinot noir and they had three different selections and she was given tastes of all three - one from Burgundy, one from Santa Barbara and one from Oregon.  She picked the one from Burgundy, a Marsannay from Louis Latour.  Yum.  I had a cocktail - their house Sazerac is made with mezcal - nice.Service is friendly.  Food was in general, good.  We had the Spanish baked clam appetizer - clams with chorizo and crunchy breadcrumbs.  Clams were very small - difficult to eat - I would not recommend these.  Our salads were good - a first rate Caesar salad marred only by croutons that tasted unfresh, not yet stale, like they've been in an unsealed bag for a couple of days.  We shared the pheasant pie - this is something they're known for - this was delicious.  Rich, roasted pheasant meat with vegetables in a savory pie crust garnished with cracklings and a foie gras sauce.  For dessert, we stuck with the pie theme and tried the cherry pie - also very good.Overall, I enjoyed this meal quite a bit.  You can valet here for dinner and leave your car here for a show which is a great deal!

Probably the best dining experience I have had since my March birthday dinner at STK Chicago. I booked a table for three for their Mother's Day brunch. When I arrived (was late but the beautiful hostess was understanding and accommodated) I was greeted by my server by LAST NAME. Never has this gesture been offered to me an immediately set TC a cut above the rest. Service was prompt, personable, an my mother enjoyed him thoroughly. The spread had variety, it was buffet style. The plates were warmed and everything was delicious looking an tasting. If it was more appropriate I would have taken pictures but I didn't want to be in anyone's way.  The owner Kean an his wife made sure they were front and center for a this event which really made a difference.  I felt comfortable and catered to. Since this was a special event I won't go into describing the food since none of the items served I believe are on the regular menu. HOWEVER the raw bar was super fresh an I do plan on attending their happy hour which offers $1 dollar oysters an shrimp. Great place Kean, thanks to you an the Mrs.Franklin DeLeon Wooten
Amazing AGAIN!!  By far the best happy hour in Chicago!  Where else can you get $1.00 jumbo Shrimp and Oysters !!  Owner is ALWAYS there that's why it's run so well!!

I really enjoyed this place.The Tortoise Club is right in River North. It's in a spot that does not really stand out. You walk down a couple of steps from the sidewalk to get into Tortoise Club.The day was beautiful and we sat outside. The menu does not have an enormous selection, but it was adequate. They are one of the places in Chicago that offers $1 Oysters - but only until 6:30, and we arrived at 7 so we missed the cutoff. We did order shrimp and two types of oysters to try. All were outstanding - very fresh.For dinner, I had a petit filet with pomme fritte (french fries). The meat was excellent - perfectly aged, perfectly rare. The reduction was outstanding and made the meat taste even better. Others with me all got different things off the menu and each shared the same compliments.We skipped dessert in favor of going out elsewhere afterwards. I would definitely recommend the Tortoise Club to anyone looking for a great meal.

Had a work lunch here (on my birthday!) and the food was out of sight. French Dip sandwich that was just everything I could have wanted as a birthday gift to my tastebuds. Loved the decor and vibe of the place, too. Very Hitchcock/Mad Men feel to it.
Perfect place to sneak away if you don't want to be found. It is dignified, yet not uptight. We only ordered an appetizer - steak tartare - and it was pretty mediocre.

I was invite to this wonderful restaurant for lunch by a man named Ed. From the very moment I walked in, I was greeted by Mrs. Addington (the owner). I felt like I was family coming to thanksgiving dinner by the welcoming I got. My friend and I were sat to eat outside where the ambience was impeccable. The light sound of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin played in the background and our waitress Sasha was great.  She recommended everything from the appetizers to the cocktails. I had a wonderful experience here and will be recommending this place to everyone I know! So if you're a Chicagoan looking for a classy causal night out or a tourist looking to grab some lunch, you won't be disappointed by tortoise club. Thank you for your hospitality! I'll be back soon!

We eat Gluten free because of Celiac disease. They offered a nice selection. I had the evening special of pan seared scallops. My husband asked them to blacken salmon. Everything was great!  Live piano player. Amazing music. Good evening!!

This place was literally the only near by place that had $1 oysters and $1 cocktail shrimp. I'm from Florida and we have great deals like this and while on vacation I found this gem. We wish they had this on weekends too. Fresh oysters and large shrimp. The bartender was very nice also.

I really wanted to love Tortoise Club. It was my choice for a special occasion dinner with a group of close friends. But I didn't love the TC. I didn't really even like it. The ambiance is exactly what I had been looking for, very traditional, clubby and mature. My first impression of the look was positive but immediately I sensed an off-putting smell, like all of the wood (lots of wood) had been recently varnished. It was not pleasant, especially for a restaurant. Next, we had requested an area for our group and we were seated in a little alcove which would have worked well if it hadn't been about 80 degrees with no air movement. It was uncomfortable all evening. We made mention and our waiter ( more on him later) did relate our complaint to the manager. I guess the heat was turned off and to be fair, it was an unusually warm day and the room was packed. But still eating when you are warm- not good. But what of the food you say?Meh. The food was spotty. I, myself had a dreadful meal. My companions seemed to enjoy their meals more but no one raved.Let's begin with the rolls. Many restaurants give you bread with your meals, free, gratis. But not TC. You can order their special Parker house rolls. What I found special was that they cost 4.95, had weird pepper on the top and were served with an unpleasant-tasting dill butter which sounded better then it tasted. Oh, and you get four per order. I have had much better bread and rolls for free (Wildfire corn bread or onion loaf- unlimited).Next was an uninspired Cesare salad, nothing special for 7.95. So I was super looking forward to my entree, steak frites. But what I got was far from steak frite. It was supposed to be Waygu beef and maybe it was but it was tough and tasteless. I couldn't cut the steak. And then there were the frites. I have never seen a more sad pile of soggy French fries   . They weren't frites- I have had delicious steak frites at Mon Ami Gabi and DJ bistro in Lake Zurich among other places. To compound the pain, the waiter wanted to argue with me saying they had never had a complaint on this dish. I asked him to try the frites and even he had to admit they were soggy and cold. So I got the skirt steak which tasted better but was still tough and the celery root mash which was too salty. So basically my meal sucked. As I said, my companions seemed to like their meals. Two had the skirt steak, one had chicken, one had the Cornish hen, one had salmon and one had white fish. Dessert was okay. Folks liked the cherry pie and the peanut butter pie which I felt was too rich but strangely tasteless. We did get free champagne to toast our special occasion and my meal was comped which I would expect. Would I go back. No. Plenty of other great Chicago restaurants to try. I would have given only one star based on my experience but gave two because my companions seemed to like it more than I.

Stopped in with friends for Nye reservation at 1030, we were a four top seated by the fire place.  First of so the restaurant is beautiful.  Cute 'cigarette' girls.I ordered the lobster it was phenomenal.Really buttery. Delicious.Service was awesome.Really phenomenal.Wasn't really fond of the dessert.But had a GREAT nye!

This is my first review and it's for a reason. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. It seems old school but their menu says they've only been open since 2012.Do not consider this a stand alone steakhouse. This is a restaurant that happens to serve a limited selection of high quality beef. The first time I went, I skipped the steak as I had just had it the night before. I am glad I did and have had the same thing each time I go (switching up the appetizers). Friends I have gone with did enjoy the steak and loved the blue cheese stuff twice baked potatoes.All of the appetizers I have tried have been delicious. I'd highly recommend the Chicken Liver Pate (if that's your thing...). It's some of the best I've had and I've ordered it each time. The steak tar tar is great too. My friend ordered the calamari the last time, and it was interesting. It was breaded calamari but is not served with marinara--instead it sits in some kind of sauce I can't even describe--somewhat spicy, but lemony and light. Definitely unexpected and unique.As far as entree's go, I have had their meatloaf each time. I went out on a limb the first time I ordered it since I'm not a huge meatloaf fan. This is not your mama's meatloaf. It is flavorful and moist, but with a crispy, flavorful and savory crust. It comes with whipped potatoes and the best brussel sprouts cooked with bacon. And this coming from someone who doesn't like brussel sprouts either.However, the dessert is one of the biggest draws here. Get the tortoise pie or you're doing yourself a disservice. It is a chocolaty pie, firm like a brownie, but gooey in the middle, with walnuts. No ice cream needed. The last time I went my friend had the champagne ice cream which she raved about.They've got live music on Saturdays in the bar too--but it's not overpowering. Although I think the drummer was about 70 years old but it was cute.Anyway--I highly recommend it if you're looking for classic Americana with a twist.
Beautiful, rich interior. Drinks are on point as well. This is a place you'd smoke a cigar in if you already had terminal cancer and if you could smoke inside.

Not great. Food was delicious but for me it's about people and kindness. I Expected a lot more from location and decor. Staff were not friendly and rushing Xmas party setup. This would not delight me on a date. Easy for them to improve. Smile more. Eh?

I love this place. The ambiance, the food, the service - it's all fantastic. It reminds me of a throw-back supper club when dining out was an experience, not just a meal. It's great for large groups or an intimate dinner withe an array of entrees to please everyone.

Outstanding! We wandered in unaware of the classic tones that characterize this dining establishment. Arriving in shorts and t-shirts, while everyone else (obviously returning patrons, a testament to their love of this restaurant) was dressed more appropriately, nevertheless we were warmly and graciously welcomed and seated. Our server Chris R., a Massachusetts native who keenly picked up on and welcomed the echoes of home our accents offered, proved a pleasure and expert representative of the Club. Two of us enjoyed pasta and sauce, judged as excellent, while the third had the evening's Market Catch Greek Sea Bass, a delicious version of this grilled fish and tabouli salad dish. All-in-all, definitely a "do-again" on our list!

What a wonderful experience!  Walkining through the door you feel transported to a different era.  Such a beautiful place, I was a little worried about how much we'd be spending there, but prices are actually very reasonable.After being shown to our table, we were promplty greeted by our lovely server Sasha, who really made the evening perfect.  She was just so warm and geniune, we couldn't help but be charmed.  During the peak of the evening the place was hopping, but Sasha always was there right when we needed her, and more than happy to answer all our questions (about the menu, the restaurant and her home in Russia).  She is quite talented to be so attentive while also juggling her numerous other tables.   She made us feel very special that night.The food was delicious of course.  Tuna Tartare was divine, with the perfect balance between the creamy avacado and the spicy togarashi.  Entrees were the Chilean Seabass and the meatloaf.  The meatloaf was very moist and flavorful, and the Chilean Seabass was to die for (ginger sauce and coconut rice, yum!)  Those dishes were tricky to pair wine with, but Sasha expertly picked a lovely Pinot which nailed it for both of us.  We were told we simply must have the cherry pie a la mode to finish, and even though we were nearly full we obliged (twist our arms, lol), and boy were we glad we did!  It was magnificent!We could have sat for another hour after we left and chatted with Sasha, but unfortunately we had to call it a night.  The place is full of fun facts and tidbits (Wood from the old Pump Room, history for each Chicago rogue charictature, etc), and Sasha seemed to know about all of it.  Clearly a well trained staff.All in all, a truly fabulous evening, thank you Tortoise club and especially Sasha!

The ambiance was good but the lighting was dim. We were here for a birthday party dinner and were disappointed with the food. I ordered the $15 bacon cheeseburger that I asked to be well done. Not only well done outside, the inside tasted burned. My girlfriend had the Amish chicken and it was so tasty to her that she bagged it to feed the alley cats at home. The $12 shrimp and guacamole appetizer was OK. But the $6 Stella Artois and a $12 glass of wine were expensive. After all was said and done our bill was $94 and we wound up going to Chili's afterwards to eat some good stuff. The waiter was very attentive but he wasn't cooking the food or creating/pricing the menu. And the topper was the Marina City parking fee of $32 for a 3 hr after 7pm night out. I probably won't return here if it's my decision.

Get the burger. It was recommended by the bartender and it did not disappoint. (It's also the cheapest thing on the menu )  Almost want to head back here again before I head back home just to get it again.

Brunch was excellent and so was the service. Highlight was the excellent cold seafood bar included oysters, shrimp and smoked salmon was exceptional. Roast beef and ham carving stations, arugula salad with apples was tasty; fried chicken, biscuits/gravy, variety of desserts.  go to early reservation slots if available.

I live in Streeterville and but my heart is in the Gold Coast. Gibsons, Hugo's, Tavern, Carmine's, etc. I stumbled upon Tortoise Club with my partner and we loved it. The service is great but the specials are unbelievable. But even more important than that is the professional yet still relaxed attitude of the bartenders and bar patrons. It has become our new favorite spot to add to our list. The atmosphere is beyond perfect as is the staff. Special shout out to Cal, our bartender this evening for taking extra special care of us and making us want to stay around for dinner. This is a must try for any local or visitor.

I dined at the Tortoise Club this past Saturday evening with a group of 8 friends and colleagues following a professional event.The food was excellent! We enjoyed the Steak Tartare and Ahi Tuna Tartare appetizers - wonderful! The seasonal soup was also lovely - a very straightforward butternut squash soup. For mains, the Meatloaf and Whitefish entrees were favorites among the group. The cherry pie for dessert was aces!Our waiter and supporting service staff were helpful, friendly, and professional. They offered truly good service. All the while, live jazz added to the traditional and somewhat formal atmosphere.The only drawbacks here are a slightly raucous level of ambient noise - and - if you are looking for culinary creativity, this is not the place you're looking for. I would recommend The Tortoise Club for formal occasions with your older family members!

Solid spot for drinks after work.  I always a appreciate a classic cocktail bar with some swank and an old school feel.  They have a piano in the bar area but on the night I was here no one was playing.  Sad face.Looking forward to coming back for dinner!

A few friends and I came here for happy hour one Friday. It was a nice atmosphere, with plenty of seating in the bar area. The oysters were okay. Nothing too spectacular. The Chicagoan was a good drink, but a bit strong for me. If you don't like a strong-tasting drink, be sure to ask them to dilute it a bit. Easy to rack up a tab at happy hour because there aren't any drink specials.

Wow! Really enjoyed this place. Food was fantastic. We got the salmon and filet mignonette. Delicious. Service was excellent: we got seated but wanted closer to the music and they found us a new table quickly with no fuss. Waitress was experienced and very helpful. The live music and overall atmosphere is what has us coming back again.

29 September 201416 of us had a board of directors dinner here. Upon arrival, out table was ready for the group.This place is cool. You enter off of the street by going down a few steps and this makes for a very elegant entrance. Low lighting, dark wood, very comfortable toned down seat fabric but very comfortable chair made our 3-1/2 hour dinner very, very comfortable.I was surprised that they put one server on our group but she did an absolutely terrific job. Cocktails got ordered and the bar was out of Red Bull but they sent a bussboy across the street to pick up a few cans. This did not hold us up at all.Dinner selections ranged from Hanger Steak to the Pheasant Pot Pie. Desserts ranged from the real vanilla-y ice-cream to cherry pie.The wine was served at the proper temperature! This is huge!Going back....

This place is what you call a hidden gem.  There's so many other swanky steak houses in the area, Tortoise Club can fall off the radar a lil bit...And I WILL admit, it wasn't our 1st choice, simply because we were looking to go somewhere kinda swanky, but we're so happy to have ended up at Tortoise Club.  We were able to get 8:30 dinner reservations on a Saturday night.  Showed up right at 8:30 and the hostess said they were running a little behind..She suggested drinks at the bar and to give her about 10 minutes...So we settled in at the bar which was overly crowded and hot!  To say it was bustling would be an under statement!  It was almost to capacity!  It was awesome though and we were lucky to have found 2 bar seats open together.  They had live jazz going.  the poor musicians were damn near being stepped on bc of so many people standing around them, but hey!  It's Saturday night in the Chi, what do you expect.  We ordered wine and 15 minutes later we went to check on our table...Still no go, so we just enjoyed the people watching...We were seated around 9pm in the main dining hall.  Our waitress was nice and answered all our questions.  She did a good job at keeping our wine glasses filled too, always asking if we wanted another round when we got low.  I ordered the meatloaf and mashed potatoes.  The Husband ordered the filet Medium-well and asparagus.  The waitress asked if it was ok to butterfly the filet and he agreed.  When the food came out everything looked excellent, although they overcooked his filet a tad bit.  It looked more well done than anything, but at least it wasn't completely dried out.  He said it tasted good, but just wished he would have said medium...I thoroughly enjoyed my meatloaf and mashed potatoes.During the meal, I excused myself to the restroom, but really I went to find our waitress to tell her it was my Husband's birthday week...I asked if she could bring out a slice of cake with a candle in it and she was more than happy to.  I picked the german chocolate cake and at the end of the meal she brought it out and my Hubby was so surprised!  He had no idea and it was so cute :)  The cake ended up being on the house which was also a nice surprise and a nice touch.It was the perfect amount of food, they don't overstuff you here.  We were able to go on with the rest of our night out on the town, feeling good and not bogged down from a heavy dinner.  I truly appreciated the quality in this place!  Everything was great from start to finish.

Slow and steady wins the race! When you enter you are greeted by Teddy the Tortoise! (He has his own twitter!)Owned by the former owners of the Flat Top Grill franchise this place has been open since 2012. However it captures a feel of a private club of a different era.The owner even came to say hi!Wood, leather, and a very preppy atmosphere. Food was amazing! Rich and excellent portions!The service was excellent. Three different types of bread, and different plates for each course.The lobster roll was highly recommended. I had the whitefish with pine nuts and it was buttery and just the right amount of flavor.Dessert is all made in their restaurant, including the ice cream!I went with a group of lawyers in training ;) and the verdict was a unanimous guilty! Of being delicious! HeheheWill be back!

I was really disappointed in the Tortoise Club. We went here for a work dinner and the service was terrible. They were slow to take our orders, and when dinner came out our appetizers were still on the table. The person bringing out our dinners just stood there. It was a little awkward. When they were serving water they also spilled it on some of our plates since they were really rushed. After we got dessert and were done, it took at least 20 minutes to get the check. I had to ask for it since one of our clients was falling asleep and I felt really bad for her. Then our waiter told us he comped our dessert, but he really should have comped a bottle of wine or more since it was so bad. The food was good, and the whisky sour was one of the best I've tasted, so they have some things right. If the service were better I would come back.

Tortoise Club has a wonderfully clubby vibe and excellent atmosphere.  The cocktails are great and the food generally matches, but it can be sketchy at times and you'll need to be careful in your choices.During the week, from 4:30-6:30, oysters are $1 each, as are shrimp.  This is reason enough to stop by.  The oysters are huge and very meaty; on a recent visit I ordered one dozen at the bar before dinner and it took me 45 minutes to eat them, because they were all massive in size - the Barry Bonds of oysters.  The shrimp are similarly large and meaty, and are dusted with fresh shaved horseradish, which adds just a hint of kick without being overpowering at all.The cocktails here are superb - the house Manhattan, made with Templeton Rye and Carpano Antica, is flawless.  Currently, all cocktails are half price on Wednesdays.  I don't know how long that will last, so enjoy it while you can.  Pro-tip: if you order a martini and they don't discount it, complain - a martini is a cocktail, after all, and the offer as advertised does not limit the selection to a subset of cocktails.Atmospherically, dinner is quite enjoyable.  The banquette is upholstered in rich leather, the tables have ample space between them, and there is a generous walkway between the banquette and other tables.  The feeling is elegant but relaxed, and service is friendly and attentive.You must be inquisitive when ordering, however.While the menu has a steak selection, these are not Chicago steakhouse steaks.  The ribeye is about 8 or 10 ounces, the filet 6 or 8.  It is rare that I would say this, but the filet is much more flavorful than the ribeye - it is thicker and has a much richer, meatier flavor.  The ribeye is barely half an inch thick and quite dry - and how often would you ever say dry in the same sentence as ribeye?  Not that often, I wager.  If you are in the mood for steak, definitely opt for the filet.But overall our dinner was quite good.  I started with tomato soup, which, while delicious, was spiked with paprika and much spicier than I anticipated.For wine, I ordered what was advertised on the wine list as a Gaja from Piedmont - Ca' Marcanda  Promis.  The price was comparably reasonable so I ordered it.  Indeed, when I asked the waiter if this was nebbiolo, he said it was.  In fact, this was not correct.While this wine was excellent, and I was fine with the price, I discovered through online research that Marcanda Promis, while made by Gaja, is actually a Super Tuscan, and so has no nebbiolo.  For those who know Piedmont wines, this is a significant problem.  While I don't think I overpaid for the wine, which was earthy, sumptuous, and delicious with our steaks, I am disappointed in the inaccuracy.Despite this, the wine and the food were still good.  We would visit again, because the bar specials and the service make the evening worthwhile.

Easter brunch was as expected. Mediocre. Cold raw seafood bar, tuna tartar was almost tasteless, and who doesn't put out tobasco sauce  with fresh oysters? Overall the food was decent, however it was the service that only gets 3 stars. No one offered us drinks (of course we want mimosas! It's Easter!) and who haves a brunch without coffee cups on the table? Not one offer for coffee. Brunch without mimosas and coffee? Not a brunch I want to go to.

Good drinks. Great starters. Fair-to-middling entrees.Went here for a joint birthday dinner. While we weren't disappointed, we weren't gushing either.I did really like the decor, which reminded me of RL. The large dining room has lots of dark wood and tartan plaid, and the servers are all dressed in preppy clothes. The female staff wear their hair in ponytails tied with grosgrain ribbons.We started with a round of drinks. I had the Southside, which is the perfect summer cocktail. No complaints there.We then ordered four east coast oysters. We were brought six, and decided not to say anything about receiving two extra. I forgot to look to see how many we were charged for. Oysters were fresh and pleasantly briny. The tuna tartare was excellent, and had some diced cucumber and avocado, which added a nice contrast.Get the pretzel bread with a 312 beer cheese dip. So snackable and delicious!The tomato soup had a very pronounced, deep tomato flavor and was served with a goat cheese crostini. Excellent.We were quite full after the appetizers so we opted to share a ribeye and a side of creamed spinach instead of each of us ordering full entrees. After waiting almost 40 minutes for our entree (this is when they really lived up to the "Tortoise" part of their name), our steak was served, and they split it in the kitchen, which was nice. Now granted, we were sharing this, so we weren't expecting huge slabs of meat, but we got only about two bites each, so I guess it's good we weren't that hungry.The steak was not that good. It was thin, had no discernible "char," and very little flavor. I expect a filet to be bland, but not a ribeye. Truthfully, I've had better steaks from Jewel.The creamed spinach was downright awful. I'm not sure how they can legitimately call this "creamed" spinach because it was just leaf spinach sitting in a coagulated pool of gloopy white stuff. The spinach wasn't incorporated into the sauce at all. Pretty disappointing.I wasn't all that keen on ordering dessert, but they offered to buy it since we waited so long for our entree, so that was appreciated. We ended up with the Michigan cherry pie a la mode. Again, decent. Not fantastic.Tortoise Club is okay. I would definitely go back for a drink or an appetizer, but for dinner, there's a ton of other places in the area that do it better.

The tomato soup was devine! My filet was over cooked but my friend's wasn't so I'm not going to judge them too harshly on it. Definitely try a Chicagoan (signature cocktail), it's DELISH! Really great ambiance and vibe as well. And our server was incredibly attentive (and British ). I'd definitely go again - especially before HOB shows!

Overall, great food, friendly & knowledgeable servers, and fun atmosphere.  However, if you order oysters, beware that they are small.  Reeeally small.  We asked for larger ones and got some that looked about the same - the size of a quarter.  It would have been nice to know they were Kumamoto oysters, which are characteristically small.  I took photos, so you can decide for yourself.  Would you pay $3.50 each for these?  I have to admit, though, they were tasty.  Everything else was fantastic.

This review is for the whiskey week flights that we had here last Friday. Someone said whiskey, so I came runnin'! LOL. Can't say no to drinks.Anyway. The Macallan flight was totally worth it: for only $35 we got the 10 year, 15 year, 12 year and the 18 year (in that order). Of course, the 18 year was my fav. :PNext we tried the Manhattan flight, which was interesting. I wish we started out with this flight and "moved up" to the Macallan flight, but oh well.
