Felt kinda guilty for having a workday lunch that was TOO delicious!Plus if you eat in, you get free pickles (including yummy green tomato pickles)Will be back soon!

Solid five-star experience today; the corned beef in that Reuben was out of this world tender.  The service is fast (at least, once you work through the long lines that are typical with Revival's opening few weeks) and the prices are fair for the amount of food you get.The biggest win today?  Those $3 cookies that are staring back at you from the register.  Trust me--get one.  Just be sure to come with someone else, because it's almost too much cookie for one sensible adult.I'll be back to try the shakes the next time!(Yes, these guys operate a couple of food trucks, but this review is tagged solely to the brick-and-mortar location.  There's a great deal on Gilt City right now for the trucks, but not the physical location.)

Today I walked down Wacker toward Adams, knowing food trucks were around but not knowing what I wanted. Grilled cheese, however, always speaks to my heart. It's probably my favorite food. So when I saw The Fat Shallot had it on their menu, I made my decision and it's probably the best life decision I've made in a while.For $7, I got my grilled cheese, with munster cheese (my favorite cheese actually, and yet somehow I never considered putting it in a grilled cheese), spinach, and caramelized onions. I added on a side of fries for $3, because next to anything cheese-based, my next frequented food group is anything potato-based. I waited about 5 minutes before my epic meal was presented to me.I took it back to my office and dove in. Now, if I had eaten lunch at my regular time, I probably would have only had half and saved the rest for later, because it was a lot of food. But I was getting hangry, so I scarfed that sucker down and enjoyed every bit of the gooey cheese and buttery toasted bread. I'm not always a fan of spinach, but it was welcome between the heaping globs of cheese. The fries were some of the best I've ever had. They were thick and somehow, crispy, which I feel you don't always get with thick fries. They were salted perfectly.It's going to be hard to resist coming here all the time. By the time I was done, I felt like a fat shallot.But a happy, satisfied shallot.

Yummy! All I had were the truffle fries from the food truck, but I'm a fan. The Truffle is actually drizzled over the fries. ($5) Next time I'll have to try the buffalo chicken sandwich. Everyone and there mother seemed to be ordering that. Oh and the grilled cheese too!

We used Fat Shallot for our wedding and we're nothing but impressed! Guests raved about the sandwiches and they were very quick to get food out in a timely manner and not have a long line. The commutation throughout was always easy and painless. They came a lot earlier then expected, which I can't complain about, but guest were confused if they were open or not. It didn't help that the second food truck was LATE so it made it a little extra confusing. The guys running the truck were completely understanding of me wanting to wait to open them together and were beyond nice about the situation. HIGHLY recommended for your next event!!!

Their sandwiches may be classic, but they indulge no less. I certainly got my protein fill for the day with all that turkey!Pretzel bun, turkey, avocado, cuke, arugula, & basil aioli make for a scrumptious and filling green sandwich!

I need to check myself before I wreck myself.Fat Shallot is a warning. A warning as to what kind of shape your body will resemble if you hit this truck every week, since they are on Clark on either Tuesdays or Wednesdays (check their schedule) and Wacker & Adams most Thursdays.They are a treat, for sure. While it will be a slightly spendy lunch option, the food is freshly made, with quality ingredients, and generous portions. My modus operandi is the grilled cheese and the spicy sesame fries. First, I will try to pawn off, I mean, share some of the fries with my co-workers because the portion is huge and realistically should be split between 3-4 people, but I have no shame and have polished off an order by myself before, because these are some damn good fries.Next, I will happily dig into the beautifully messy, gooey composition of grilled sourdough, caramelized onions, sauteed spinach, and muenster cheese.  I am a fan of using muenster cheese in my grilled cheese sandwiches and was happy to discover these guys are too.  Usually, with the fries involved, I only manage to finish half of the sandwich.  When that happens, I save the other half for breakfast the next day (it re-heats well in the oven or toaster oven; do not microwave, DUH) and I add a fried egg. Heaven!Note, the usual preparation involved regarding popular food trucks like the Fat Shallot: get out there early or be prepared to wait. They do move pretty efficiently, though you can place your order online via their website and it should be ready for pick up, if you fear the wait.  Also, check in on Yelp and get a free beverage with your order.

I went to the food truck and got the truffle BLT and truffle aioli fries. It was too much truffle and grease. I felt super sick as the day went on. If the sauce was on the side for the fries, I think it would have been good. The bacon in the BLT wasn't bad. I just wish I didn't get as much truffle.

The Fat Shallot is Amazing!Always great food and consistent product.My go to sandwiches are the Truffle BLT and the Buffalo Chicken - both big and filling.The spicy sesame fries are a great side too.Don't miss this truck when it's on the road. (I follow them on Facebook and they post their locations in the loop-)

Been meaning to write a review for far too long! Discovered this food truck last summer and have regularly hit them up ever since when they come around Wacker & Adams.Pretty sure I've tried everything on their menu, including some of their specials and I've never not liked anything. My favorites are the buffalo sandwich and truffle BLT (it's a toss-up between the 2), and their spicy sesame fries. (I can smell the spicy sesame sauce while waiting in line and it seriously makes my mouth water.) Word of the wise: portions are large! I have easily ate a sandwich and fries for lunch by myself, but if you aren't 100% starving, convince a co-worker to go with and each get a sandwich but share an order of fries. :)

Amazing. I will follow them around the whole city wherever they are to get one of their sandwiches.Tried them for the first time a month ago when all the food trucks rolled into Daley Plaza for their food truck Fridays. My coworker and I immediately headed for their truck, as I had been stalking them on twitter for some time and viewing their foodporn.It was lent so I ordered the caramelized onion, spinach and Gruyere grilled cheese. Coworker ordered the croque  monsieur. Both sandwiches came out in about five minutes, despite there being a line. The guy in the truck taking our order was super nice and struck up a conversation with us while we waited.We took our sandwiches back to the office, and eating them made us strike up a conversation of the best meals we've had around the city. They were that good. My grilled cheese was garlicky, gooey, smokey, and the bread was oily and crispy. My coworkers looked and smelled amazing, and he said it was the best croque monsieur he's ever had. For 7-9$ a sandwich, you're looking at the price of a subway meal, but instead you're getting a huge handcrafted gourmet sandwich.Try them today if you haven't and follow them on twitter @thefatshallot to see where they are headed for the day! They also tweet new menu options and daily specials.

This is my favorite food truck in the city, hands down! Anytime it's anywhere relatively close to work I have to get it. Everything is so delicious and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I've tried their truffle BLT, turkey sandwich and their fries but the best menu item has to be their Buffalo Chicken sandwich! Oh. My. Yum!!! They ran out of egg buns so mine was on a pretzel bun. I typically don't like pretzel buns because they're too salty but this one was made perfectly! I also am not a fan of blue cheese so I got it with truffle sauce which they cleverly name the truffalo... DELICIOUS. Well done, you have my vote for the best truck :)

Stopped by for lunch and ordered the Truffle BLT. Huge sandwich with bacon, avocado, argula, tomato, truffle aioli on texas toast. Also ordered a side of spicy sesame fries. The sandwich is loaded with bacon and quite tasty. It's a little difficult to cut in half. The spicy dipping sauce was fantastic! I'm not a fan of spicy food and this sauce is not spicy at all.When I got in line there were about 15 people ahead of me but the line moves fairly quickly. Extremely friendly and they accept debit/credit cards. They were also serving grilled cheese, buffalo chicken and turkey sandwiches which all sounded great. I'll definitely be back! Plus, if you check in you can get a free drink.*8/5/16Ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and regular fries. The sandwich consists of about 3 or 4 crispy chicken tenders doused in their truckmade buffalo sauce, topped with a crunchy celery slaw, and blue cheese. The sauce has a good buffalo wing sauce taste and is a little spicy. The crunchy celery slaw provides the perfect crunch and blue cheese sauce always complements anything doused in buffalo sauce. The fries were fine, as they were a tad undercooked and soggy.

I've honestly never been to a food truck before, there are some downtown and of course numerous videos/tv shows showcasing the trend out west, but this was picture perfect experience. Fat shallot was one of several food trucks parked at goose island's battle of the breweries dodgeball tournament. After sampling several varieties of fantastic beers I fond myself working up quite an appetite. The menu is of course limited by the capacity of the food truck, but quality is absolutely on point. We ordered a few grilled cheese sandwiches, a turkey and truffle fries. All of which were generous portions delivered in a timely manner. The gentlemen working are very friendly and engaging they seem passionate about their business. All of the food was delicious and complimented the afternoon quite well. This truck is going places.

There is a Reason I go back to the Fat Shallot week after week.Not only is the food great tasting, it's also extremely consistent quality.At this point I've tried almost every sandwich on the menu, and nothing falls short of impressive.Really a top notch establishment, try their food, you won't be disappointed.

I kept seeing this Chicago based food truck during its NOLA carnival residency and either there was a line or I was scurrying somewhere. But Wednesday, I got to sample their wares.They only had one veggie selection on Ash Wednesday, so I had their grilled cheese with grilled onions and spinach with added avocado. It was tasty but a bit odd since the bread was a bun. My guess is this truck is more meat focused.My sandwich came up quick and the guys were loving the NOLA weather (even though it was cold for us). I think they're heading back up north soon. So catch them while you can.

The BLT was really good, tons of crisp, quality bacon.  The sesame fries were also very tasty with a little spice and the fries were crisp.  Guys in the truck were friendly and engaging as well, I'll be back for that BLT & fries again.

I have been wanting to try this for as long as I have known about it. Their truck is on Adams & Wacker on Thursdays usually but it just never worked.Went today with a coworker and was pleasantly surprised by how fast the line went and the quick service. A++ there.I ordered the BLT and the spicy fries. Fries were great, there was a lot of flavor and you couldn't really stop eating them. I am disappointed by saying I didn't like the BLT. The texas toast was a dud (had too much flavor of whatever was on it), maybe there was too much aoli or seasoning. And, the avocado was non existent.Will come back to try another sandwich, however I won't be coming back for the BLT.

I love their food truck and now that they have a brick and mortar location close to my work at Revival food hall, my life is goooooooood!  I usually get the BLT and sesamie fries from the truck, but the revival food hall location doesnt allow fryers so can get the blt only with chips.  Try the chai ginger milkshake it is seriously amazing, as is the espresso chocolate!

Fat Shallot is one of those guilty pleasures. After finishing your sandwich at the Fat Shallot you will feel satisfied and full, and a lil greasy. Not that grease is bad by any means. #teamcheese.The grilled cheese: My favorite thing on this menu. Although doesn't have any meat in it, the flavors are astounding and is probably one of the best grilled cheese's I've had. Of course, expect a greasy mess as you eat it, but oh so satisfying.The BLT: Truffle mayo is amazing, but it's a huge sandwich and a little difficult to eat. It's served with bacon, tomato, avocado, and arugula, which I can always get behind.The FRIES are also important. Big fan of the spicy sesame fries.

People always use "like crack" to say things are really tasty and addictive, but I ask you: would crack really be that pleasant to munch on?  Nay I think not... it's time for a new drug-food metaphor.Rambling setup aside, I'm pretty sure they mix molly into the sauce on their spicy sesame fries.  That shit is off-the-chain delicious, like a yummy rave in my mouth.  And since molly is a powder it's not as nasty as crumbled up crack.Sandwiches are all massive and indulgent as well.  There's so much chicken on the buffalo chicken sandwich that you can take some off and have a side of buffalo chicken with your buffalo chicken sandwich.A little on the pricey side, but you're paying for a gourmet product.  Anytime I see this truck parked in a herd with other trucks, I make a bee-line for it.

I love food trucks. We don't have a lot of them on Chicago's North Shore due to various licensing laws and zoning permits, so I'm thrilled that I got to meet these guys at Highwood's Gourmet Evening Market.So, I don't eat garlic, really. In fact my stomach can't usually handle digesting it very well at all. But there was something so powerful about seeing The Fat Shallot truck at the market! I don't know what came over me, but I headed right over there and ordered up what I thought would be the easiest thing to digest. I ordered a Jumbo Sausage with sauerkraut on a pretzel bun with yummy mustard (ha!). There was no skimping here on the beef. It was a lot more mild in flavor than I expected, which was a perfect complement to the piled high kraut and brown spicy mustard. I really loved the pretzel bun thrown in to the mix, but it didn't hold everything together very well. Needless to say, I went through a lot of napkins - but it was sooo worth it!There's more! I was enticed to try their spicy sesame fries. Oooh wee were they a bit spicy for me, but I was amazed at how crispy the fries stayed under the spicy aioli topped with black sesame seeds. Talk about a real kick to the palate! I had to surrender them to my picky eater husband, who surprisingly gobbled them up before my eyes! I was honestly shocked. When he eats anything and likes it, you know you've made a super tasty side of fries.The owners are really sweet and seem to take pride in what they serve. I'm looking forward to these guys again real soon. Hope you bring the pulled pork with you!

I work in an area I like to call food truck Hades: a street full of restaurants (oh yeah yeah, pity me) but no good spots to park a food truck. And sometimes one just needs something different for lunch.  When I read on Twitter that one is within decent walking distance and I have time for lunch  to make said walk, I'm on it. Helloooo The Fat Shallot.I first tried them at a mini-food truck rally event thing-y at Daley Plaza. I was intrigued by the truffle fries with aioli sauce and knew that's what I needed. Ok, maybe not, but I was starving. It was quite a big order than I expected. Hot and messy - just the kind of fries I like. Thank goodness I wasn't going anywhere fancy after. I caught the truck again over by City Front Plaza (NBC Tower/Pioneer Court-ish area). That time I ordered the BLT. Again, I was surprised by this order: tons of bacon for such a big sandwich order was at $10. Hot damn. I thought the Texas toast style bread was just ok, but I still ate every last bit and totally not ashamed.

Really liked the grilled cheese sandwich.  The sautéd spinach and caramelized onions are deliciously perfect with the muenster.  Nice people, quick service.  Looking forward to trying the meatball soon.  Fennel and spicy breadcrumbs - yum!

We had The Fat Shallot for our wedding late night snack and it was fabulous!  We had so many compliments on the food and the service, the guy working the truck was the nicest man!  Sarah was great to work with as we set up the arrangement, she will work with you to get exactly what you want.  I had the grilled cheese and it was the best grilled cheese I have ever had!

Absolutely love this food truck! I've eaten here twice, and can't seem to stray away from the amazing buffalo chicken sandwich to try something else:). I have had the spicy sesame fries, and the regular rosemary fries- both delicious. Would recommend to anyone passing by!

If you see this red truck and they are open, drop everything and get in line. After reading about the Fat Shallot I saw that they were a block away. walked over and got myself a Grilled Cheese, they use Sourdough which I love, and spinach inside! what!? their fries were nice thick cut with an audible crunch when you bite into them, whats more is the spicy sesame aioli made it that much better. I dont have a twitter but you can follow the truck and pray that they are in your neck of the woods. Believe me.. one lunch is all it takes. you will thank me later.. Oh.. and i will put the Fat Shallot on my Vegetarian Friendly list.

Gave this food truck a try and it was delish.  HUGE portions!  Buffalo Chicken sandwich was gigantic, could have shared.  Truffle fries were good, I would get sauce on the side next time, too much on top for my taste.  Def not your place to go if dieting.  Great flavors, check them out.

My new favorite food truck!The food is terrific, all top-notch, well-prepared, and made fresh to order. The staff (a husband and wife team) couldn't be any nicer.I've tried the Fat Shallot (love the name!) twice in as many weeks. On Wednesdays, they're located a stone's throw from my office, so when it's cold out or I'm pressed for time, it's ideal.So far I've tried the grilled cheese (muenster, carmelized onions, sautéed spinach), turkey sandwich on a pretzel croissant with avocado, arugula, and herb aioli, as well as their truffle fries and rosemary and sea salt fries. Everything is so delicious. I love that I can get gourmet fries and they're still piping hot by the time I get back to my office.You can order online or via their app, saving you even more time (and no standing outside in the cold!). Today I took advantage of that and it couldn't be easier; place your order, and they'll text or email you when your food's ready (usually in about 15 minutes). I arrived at the truck, and they were just pulling my fries out of the fryer. Talk about impeccable timing! Bonus--first-time users can save $2 on their online order.From this day hence, Hump Day will be known as Fat Shallot Day.

Lives up to their reputation... LITERALLY the best sandwich I've ever had!!  The women that manages the truck is so engaging... Was just at a wedding that they catered and people couldn't stop talking about how good the food was, and how fun it was to have a their truck at the event.  I have been working with them to cater my sons bar mitzvah, and they have been so great to work with.  HIGHLY recommended!

Visited this truck for the first time yesterday at Daley Plaza and had the most amazing BLT I've ever had.  I also tried a bite of my friends turkey sandwich and loved the basil aioli and pretzel bun combination. We split an order of the truffle and spicy sesame fries and I still can't decide which I liked better.  Can't wait to go back and try the grilled cheese!
My chicken sandwich was undercooked, in fact it was raw. It's still making me feel sick. Sorry Shallot. Be more careful with your quality control in your food truck. Posted photo.

All I can say is wow, wow, wow. In a vegetarian's perspective some might not think there are very many options but that's ok because the grilled cheese is on point. Toasted to perfection with ooey gooey cheese melted in the middle this one may be the best I've ever had.Today there was a special roasted veggie sandwich that was to die for. The portions are huge and the fries have a fabulous unique flavor. Asian flavor is nothing I've ever experienced. This truck is a must try.

I'm long overdue for a review update on the Fat Shallot, and I'm happy to report that they've stayed consistently good since I first visited them a year and a half ago (wow, that seems like a long time).A lot of the reviews will mention the BLT (heck, even I did on my first review). I admit, it's a crowd pleaser, but how could it not be, stacked high with bacon and truffle aioli, atop buttery Texas toast? Here's the secret: the BLT, while delicious, is actually not the best thing on the menu. The real star of the menu, in my opinion, is the turkey.Their regular sandwich rotation is the BLT, the grilled cheese, the buffalo chicken, and the turkey. I've tried all but the buffalo chicken (I don't like buffalo sauce, ever, no matter what restaurant/establishment makes it). While all of them have been tasty, the turkey sandwich is the standout for me because it has the best flavor combination and tastes exceptionally fresh, and it's also one of the lighter options on the menu - the others are a bit too rich/fatty for me. The grilled cheese and BLT are on the obvious side - duh, buttery bread, cheese, and bacon taste good, and they'll taste good pretty much in any combination with any other toppings. The turkey, on the other hand, combines basil aioli (officially one of my favorite ingredients now), arugula, avocado, cucumber slices, and turkey breast, all served atop a pretzel bun. The pretzel bun is actually worth singling out - I've never given much thought to bread before, especially not sandwich bread, but their pretzel bun is amazing. I'd probably eat it by itself even without the sandwich filling. I don't know what they put in the bun to give it so much flavor, but it adds a lot to the sandwich and is worth the price of admission in and of itself. The veggies are always crisp and fresh-tasting, and are the perfect complement to the richer aioli and avocado. And finally, the turkey itself is thinly-sliced and packed with flavor.Oh, and the fries are great as well (the house fries are great, truffle fries are great, but I'm not as big a fan of the sesame), but I'd have to be rolled out of there if I ate the entire sandwich with a side of fries. For those with small to medium appetites, it's probably too much food to get both (it's certainly too much food for me).The owners are super nice and I'm very appreciative of the fact that they seem to always run on schedule and update their Twitter feed accordingly - something I cannot say for all food trucks.As you can see, I'm obsessed with the Fat Shallot.

This truck parks near my office during lunch once a week.  It's the highlight of my week.My favorite is the BLT, with almost too much bacon, tomato, avocado, and arugula, with a truffle mayo that puts it over the top. It's well worth the wait, even if you don't skip the line. A close second, and my favorite on some days is the Turkey, a refreshing and savory sandwich that is great in the warm weather. The grilled cheese is also delicious and easily customized. I have tried some other options here and there, the meatball sandwich-- OMG-- But generally just stick with the two. I have gotten truffle fries once, but I have to draw the line somewhere.

Let's face it: a lot, and I mean a LOT of these food trucks are overrated. You stand out there on Clark Street in some ridiculous line only to finally get some food that is "meh" at the very best.Not so, Fat Shallot. This is gourmet comfort food at its finest. The grilled cheese sammies are totally delicious and the ingredients are high quality -- I don't tolerate dairy well, but their sandwiches don't give me the bubble guts.And then there's the piece de resistance: Can you say "truffle fries"? I knew that you could.When you see the little red truck coming, queue up. It's worth your while!

I have been slacking on my yelping lately...so time to get caught up.I can't say enough wonderful things about this truck.  They are the cat's pajamas.  I have never been disappointment by any of my delicious fat shallot lunches.The new buffalo chicken sandwich was amazing.  Just saucy enough for the right kick without the bread disintegrating into a soggy mess.The grilled cheese was like WHOA!!!  I know I know, it's grilled cheese...how can it be that special?  Answer: WHO CARES IT JUST IS!!!Now, the spicy sesame fries...let me just say I dream about these.  The french fries are perfectly crispy and served piping hot.  The spicy sesame sauce is just perfection.  Last time I got them, everyone from my office came poking their head into the lunch room to figure out what that heavenly smell wafting through the hallways was.Only thing better than the food is the service.  The owners of the truck are so friendly and welcoming...how can you not want to just order one of everything!!!!!

I love this food truck!  I think the truffle fries are my favorite but you can't go wrong with the sesame fries.  I've become a bit obsessed with The Fat Shallot. I follow them on Instagram so that I can keep up with their whereabouts in the city!  By far the best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had!

This is probably my favorite food truck. However, in full disclosure, I've only ordered one thing (over and over and over and over).  They usually park outside my office on Thursdays and when I see them I always order the grilled cheese, with house fries. This grilled cheese is simply amazing. The fries have been less consistent, but when they are "on" they are really great.
Been back twice since my review last month.  Happy to say back to fabulous food and service.  You must try the grilled cheese w avocado

Well, now that I'm trying to eat more healthfully to make up for decades of bodily abuse, I try to avoid menus like this, but I had to try it once since my foodie buddy at work wanted to try it.  I'd probably give 3.5 stars if I could, but I can't, so they get 3, mostly because it's expensive.  Admittedly, that's the trend with food trucks, since they've got the additional expense of the truck, etc., so not unexpected, but still....The Buffalo Chicken sandwich was very, very good and substantial.  The seasoned fries with spicy aoli, not quite for me.  It felt like I was eating a pile of fat and salt.  The aoli was tasty, but I think I've decided I just need to stay away from fries.  It seems that 90 percent of the time they're disappointing, and they're not the healthiest of options as it is.Now I've talked myself into giving them 4 stars, because for this type of food, they did do an excellent job.  I may not hit The Fat Shallot again, or maybe once or twice a year to go along with the food crowd at work, but I am glad I tried it..

I don't understand why every food truck in Chicago seems to feel the need to make a buffalo chicken sandwich, nor do I understand why I feel compelled to order it at every food truck in Chicago, but the Fat Shallot does it far better than most.  There's too much chicken and not enough chopped celery, but the whole thing holds together reasonably well and the sauce is great.These folks are pros.
Amazing BLT and fries. Great lunch spot and very friendly ppl greeting and taking orders.

Today was one of those days where I just needed a grilled cheese. I can see the food truck line-up on Clark/Monroe from my office building, I spotted the Cheesies truck & decided that today was my lucky day! I got to the Cheesies truck only to learn that they had to move because they were illegally parked. But, lucky for me, The Fat Shallot was parked right next door!I ordered the grilled cheese, it comes with spinach, muenster & onions (sorry shallot, no onions for me) & I added avocado. Holy. Ish. This was an amazing grilled cheese. Some of the cheese was slightly burnt & crispy on the edges, just the way I like it. Great stuff. I've had the truffle fries before, and they were delicious as well. Super fast, friendly service.I am glad fate intervened & I finally got to try their sandwich.

The Turkey sandwich I ordered was extremely well flavored. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the sandwich is super messy. It definitely didn't stay together. I took one bite and half the sandwich fell out the bottom. I'm not sure if its because the turkey was shaved or just poor construction. Other than that, the food they serve is excellent.

The word authentic is thrown around so much in the restaurant business, I think it's a good word to use, it cuts to the point of what someone is really looking for.  Authentic mexican or Authentic Thai means just that, "the real deal".  However when it comes to food trucks how do you define "an authentic food truck".  I mean for so long food trucks were just dingy taco trucks that sat on the side of the road cooking up mediocre food in a mediocre kitchen by mediocre chefs.  However about 10 years ago there was a food truck renaissances.  Food trucks started making high quality food, by high quality chefs, and with that renaissance came the averages foodies desire to find the authentic food truck renaissance.Well if you find yourself in Chicago please do yourself a favor and visit the Fat Shallot.  It should be your first and last stop when it comes to telling people you had "a real authentic food truck experience".I was visiting from Baltimore last weekend and had a friend bring me here.  I love food, however I have not been able to get that food truck experience yet.  So we went and visited The Fat Shallot.  The three of us ordered it all!  And I will just start out with the two stars of the show (everything is divine, but these things really made my jaw drop).  The Truffle oil BLT is the most amazing combination of flavors that you could ever want in a sandwich.  The bacon is cooked perfectly, and the avocado adds such a level of creaminess and flavor, I could have had 3 of them, I mean come on Bacon and truffles!  I also fell in love with the Spicy sesame fries.  When I first saw them on the menu I had my reservations. I immediately thought I should order the Truffle fries (I mean rosemary salt and truffle oil on fries! how could you go wrong)?  But my friend assured me to try the spicy sesame fries, I am not ashamed to admit it that I went back and ordered a second helping!  They are that good.I also tasted the buffalo chicken sandwich and the grilled cheese.  They are classics done right.  They deliver the flavors you want and are cooked to perfection.Please I insist of you, if you go visit Chicago find out where this food truck is parked and make a pilgrimage.  Just be prepared to wait a little in line, because this place is not a secret anymore, and Chi-town is eating it up. I found the authentic food truck experience at the Fat Shallot, you should too
Food is always good from here and worth the wait.  I usually get the grilled cheese and truffle fries.

I was so incredibly frustrated after ordering from here and I will NEVER GO BACK. I ordered the Avocado BLT, probably my favorite combination of sandwich incredients.  The bacon was crispy, the avocado was fresh, the tomatoes were red and not smooshy.  But I requested the order with very light mayonnaise.  And it's not like they mis-heard me thinking I asked for extra mayonnaise because the gentleman who took my order repeated it back to me and I saw him write it down.  There was no line, they were not in a hurry.  When he handed me my sandwich he said again, BLT light mayo.The purpose of a food truck, is to take your food somewhere else to eat it (likely your office as in my case) because there is no where to eat unless you're sitting on the side of the road.  I should have checked it before walking away, but when I got back to my office let me just tell you this sandwhich was D-R-E-N-C-H-E-D in mayonnaise.  It was beyond being able to wipe it off, oozing out of every tomatoe and every piece of arugula, all over the bacon and soaked into the bread.  I tried to wipe it off but it was for lack of a better word, disgusting.Pay attention to your customers.  Especially if you go through the trouble of repeating your oders back to your customers and there is no line.I will never go back.

In an attempt not to spend the rest of my Friday afternoon at work in a total coma, I executed some self control and was able to save half of my buffalo chicken sandwich and fries for dinner the next night and I didn't have high hopes for how it would reheat but honestly was very impressed. Everything tastes fresh and was like it had just come off the food truck, and now I know I can order a sandwich or two for later if I want. Love this place, try it immediately if you come across this glorious food truck anywhere.

Picked up a buffalo chicken and their signature sesame fries today after a blisteringly cold 10 minute wait in line for their food truck (which is only around campus on Tuesdays I am told). The fluffiness of the challah bun was to die for, as was the four chunks of chicken inside of it that were fried and buffaloed to perfection.Treat yourself here once in a while. Be careful to not turn into a fat shallot.
I believe this food truck had the longest line at the taste. It's so worth it. I had the grill cheese with spinach so good.
I ordered BLT and truffle fries. Like them both. But without any great impression.

We took an hour train ride from the suburbs to downtown Chicago and walked to the location posted on their website.-Found it fairly easily.The main reason we went out of our way was because we watched the episode of Food Court Wars (which aired a while ago), including The Fat Shallot and Taco in a Bag. Taco in a Bag won the episode and now had a location inside Spring Hill Mall. We live fairly close to the mall, so we visit them now and then. I love their food at Taco in a Bag, so I have been curious to see what they were up against.The Fat Shallot had a very different style of food. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich. It was spot on with the Buffalo flavor. Not too spicy, had the nice balance of celery/coleslaw (I'm not sure what it was but it doesn't matter because I liked it). It was a huge sandwich. I tried to finish it, but only got about 3/4ths of the way there. Also ordered the truffle fries. They were presented nicely with a huge amount of sauce. Which was pretty, but then all the fries on the top had an overbearing amount of sauce and the ones on bottom none at all. The flavor was pretty good though, a little tangy (but in a good way). My boyfriend ordered the grilled cheese and added bacon to it. He said it was one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches he ever had. Along with the spicy sesame fries -- I tried these and liked them better than my fries.It was about $30 for the two of us (with a drink each).The drink selection was pretty limited, but I did appreciate the selection they had.The location we were at was in the west loop off of Monroe and Sangamon. It was my first time visiting the truck, but I really locked this location. It was right by a children's park and dog park. And there is conveniently a nice little area to sit, fairly close to their parking spot. It was a great place to sit and enjoy my food.Overall, it was a good experience. There was a lot of delicious food truck food in a nice Chicago location. It was definitely worth the train ride.The only complaints I have aren't really complaints:-Too big portion--- but leads to leftovers-Pricey-- but has big portions-Didn't get to try the Polish sausage, but they said there was a limited availability on the website anywayOh and Taco in a Bag, definitely did have competition. Both restaurants present a fresh take on old classics. But Taco in a Bag is definitely the new fad.

HOLY FRIES.Confession: I have a self-diagnosed, probably fatal attraction to fries. I can't help it - no matter where I go, I have to get 'em. Sometimes, I'll pick a lunch/dinner spot simply based on its reputation for good fries; other times, I'll be hit with a sudden craving, and the next thing you know, I'm happily/guiltily munching away. I've eaten fries at Pommes Frites in New York, practically everywhere in Chicago (you name it, I bet I've had it), and even (of course) in Belgium, and France, and England, and Spa- ... okay, now this is just embarrassing.As something of a fries connoisseur, then, I can with 100% authority tell you that the fries from this food truck are AMAZING. They have the perfect crunchiness & consistency (not soggy, not charred or burned, not rock-solid, etc.).But the absolute BEST thing about the The Fat Shallot's fries is that they come with amazing flavors! Not only do they have truffle fries, but they also have this awesome, fusion-esque, spicy sesame fries. I've tried both (I'm coming for you next, Rosemary!) - and each comes with very, very generous portions of both fries & sauce.As for the "real" food - I got the pulled pork sandwich, which I appreciated, but didn't like as much as some other BBQ places in the city (Q, namely). One coworker got the buffalo chicken sandwich, and similarly said it was decent, but not the best he's ever had (and he's from down south, so I believe him). However, one co-worker got the grilled cheese sandwich and said that it was out of this world. (Grilled cheese, I'm coming for you too!)Based on the strength of the food explained above, I'd normally give only 4 stars, but the fifth is for:a) the incredibly friendly and efficient staff,b) the enormous portions (you will feel totally self-conscious if anyone catches you hauling an entree + fries back to your desk - sometimes the lid on the takeaway box won't close!),c) how ridiculously excited my team gets when they know the truck is coming near our building,d) and the fries, of course! :)----Bottom Line: catch the Fat Shallot if you're super hungry & looking for a filling meal - they have good comfort food, and the kind of fries that people dream about!(... or is that just me?)

Damn this place is good!Food trucks way back in the day used to be kind of disgusting, but Fat Shallot has convinced me otherwise.I tried the turkey sandwich with garlic aioli on a pretzel bun...sooo yummy. Also, delicious truffle fries, topped with a thick truffle aioli! (Seriously even the hornet on the prowl outside wanted a piece and I had to make a break for it).If this is what food truck lunches are all about, sign me up!

I have an office downtown and I've tried and been disappointed by a lot of food trucks but these guys really truly deliver. More than just a single flavor, the ingredients they've picked for their sandwiches coalesce into a beautiful experience.That said, I was a little skeptical about the grilled cheese having greens in it (spinach I think?) and based on my wife's opinion of it I think I was right. However, the sausage sandwich was EPIC. My friend who got the fried salami sandwich, their signature, said maybe it had too many flavors on it.

My favorite food truck! I used to be a Truffle BLT junkie, but the the grilled cheese is also amazing! The spicy fries are great, too. They aren't too spicy but have a great kick to them. Given the long lines, they do a great job of tracking orders and working as fast as possible. Definitely my favorite truck in Chicago!

My husband and I were going to go to the Taste of Chicago, but instead decided to head to Arlington Park for the races and Food Truck Festival. From The Fat Shallot, we shared the Grilled Cheese - which was muenster cheese melted between slices of sourdough with sautéed spinach and caramelized onions. This sandwich was delicious. Grilled cheese with shallots cannot be beat.We als shared an order of the Truffle fries, which were topped with truffle aioli. They were so good. When I turned focus to the rest of my grilled cheese, my husband ate the rest of the truffle fries without even offering me a few more before he licked the plate clean!!The staff here was very friendly. I hope to see this truck around again, because the food was amazing. It was priced well too. Our meal was around $12.

Very good, and pretty quick.  We ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, which was huge and the chicken was cooked very well, only disappointing thing was not enough blue cheese sauce on this one.  It's not super-spicy.  Could have been spicier, but was also good as served. The tuna nicoise sandwich was quite good with green beans, tomatoes and hard-boiled eggs.  We also ordered 2 fries, one spicy sesame and one truffle.  The spicy ones could have been spicier, but they were good and the truffle fries had a creamier sauce and were quite delicious.Overall this was a fabulous experience.  The line when we went around 12:30 was quite respectable, but they served up their food in a timely manner and I will say it again, everything was quite large.  Pricers were fair, service was friendly.

Holy Salami sandwich!!!!!!!!!!!!!! One of the best I've had in my life!! Served w/ a poached egg, bbq sauce red onion on a pretzel bun. WOW!The truffle fries were EVEN BETTER though!!! OMG like better than DMK, no joke.I am following this truck around whenever possible!! LOVED IT!!

I had to do the truffle blt, that everyone talks about. Its a really solid sandchich, the aioli and bread were top notch. There was a TON of bacon, but it was too cooked, crumbling all over the place. I also don't think it was super highly quality, reminded me of super crispy cafeteria bacon.  Having said that, it was tastey and filling and I'd have again. However, its way too expensive. The sandwich was $10, fries another $3-$5. That's too much for a food truck lunch. With a drink you could be $18, come on now.

All of their sandwiches are great and from what I can tell are made to order.  The fries are great also, if you like truffles, get the aioli version.  The reason I'm giving them a 5 stars instead of 4 is people are super friendly and will gladly make changes where they can like say dropping the onions from the grill cheese.  And their brownie...the best brownie that I've ever had.  I'm hoping that they make that a regular item on their menu because it's perfect and totally worth the 3 bucks.  Big enough to share with someone else or freeze it and have it later on.

With more and more food truck competition out there, this is certainly one to be on the look out for, and try!  The grilled cheese with sauteed spinach was absolutely fabulous!  The fries were amazing!   The food was prepared right on a grill in the truck, and served HOT! I will be back for certain!

I'm a big food truck fan.  Well, let's face it - I'm a big food fan.  I'm pretty sure serving quality food on a truck isn't easy but The Fat Shallot proves differently.  If you want great food made with high quality ingredients then find your way to TFS.  Their truffle BLT is a site to behold with a taste to match.  Who thought you could get amazing fries from a truck - well you can and TFS has the most fabulous sauces to top them.  Sarah and Sam couldn't be any nicer so whenever possible I find the truck and have a great meal.  See you at The Fat Shallot!!!.

Ah grilled cheese. My ultimate comfort food. At first $9 seemed a bit pricey for a grilled cheese sandwich...then I ate it.I usually consider myself a grilled cheese purist.  That is a grilled cheese is cheese + bread and that's it. Once you start adding other ingredients you've moved into pannini territory. The Fat Shallot had me reconsidering my position because this was hands down the best grilled cheese I've ever eaten. The sandwich had Muenster, caramelized onions and sautéed spinach. I added bacon and avocado for an additional $2 (which is what made it a $9 grilled cheese.)The sandwich is loaded with tastiness and perfectly prepared. Usually when you add bacon to a sandwich, places give you two, maybe 3, slices of sad, limp looking bacon. This sandwich read chock full of delicious, crispy bacon - enough for every bite. The onions were perfectly caramelized and practically falling out of the sandwich. The cheese was gloriously gooey. The bread was perfectly toasted.The employees were friendly and the food came up quick and hot!I didn't try the fries, but after reading other people's reviews, I think I'm going to have to next time The Fat Shallot is on my area.

We've eaten there twice and in two different locales. The grilled cheese is good, but they need to add a tangy or sharper cheese to the muenster. I wonder how mushrooms spinach and onions might taste? The bacon sandwich is decent, but what gives with the Texas toast? Why not challah or brioche or something much more specific tasting than thick white bread?  Pretzel bread, even? The fries are frozen...boo! Or, at least that's what they taste like or like they've been fried twice.  They should be fresh cut. Why in the world would you serve quality ingredients then serve frozen fries? The truffle sauce is decent but it should be a dip. I know I've been critical but it could be so much better. Finally, they have been out of things and don't vary the menu very much. They are only open three to four hours on most days. I'd love to get a chance to taste some of their other fair.Very nice folks, though. Pleasant and focused, but they need a little work on the menu to really bring in more patrons. Also, the app is cray. It needs work, like to reflect the actual hours of operations.

I think that I died the day I ate from the Fat Shallot.But like, the good kind of died. The kind of died where I couldn't move for hours and I couldn't eat until the next day.A BLT with 2 pounds of bacon? And arugula? OMG yes.French fries LOADED with truffle aioli (sounds so much nicer than saying mayo)? Ahhhh droooooool.Death was worth it.If you haven't tried the Fat Shallot, you kind of need to. This is everything a food truck should be and more.They're really social too, so if you engage with them on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook, they write back. It's fun. Try it.

better notifications directly to my email when you arrive to locations please!!!  i need to know when you are at 600w. everytime!!!!! i have you on my twitter, but when i miss the opportunity there is a chair that is kicked.  keep up the good work!!!!!!!!!  love the food!!  #helpdefenslesschairs

I tried the BLT, it was pretty darn good. Not the best ever, but the sandwich is huge. I am not a big fan of the bread but the bacon was delicious! I think if I buy from there again I would try the grilled cheese because that looked delicious too!

If Yelp allowed six stars, I would definitely give them to The Fat Shallot! This is best food truck, hands down! The sandwiches are made to perfection (and let me not even start on the TRUFFLE FRIES). Thank you Sarah and Sam for making the University of Chicago a happier (and more delicious place)!

I had the grilled cheese, add bacon.  It was a very filling sandwich and it was absolutely delicious!  I find that many places skimp on ingredients and there was no skimping here!  They were super friendly, quick and overall it was a really great sandwich and I'll be back to try other things!

The food was great, but it was a bit pricey.  If it were slightly cheaper, I would give it 5/5 stars.I got the grilled cheese and rosemary fries.  Everything tasted great, and the food wasn't as greasy as I expected it to be.The service was pretty fast, and the people who worked there were very friendly and upbeat.Nonetheless, I wouldn't eat here frequently, because I cannot justify spending ~$10 on a grilled cheese and fries.  I will eat here every once-in-a-while as a treat.

Terrific food!! I got the grilled cheese sandwich, which comes with  muenster cheese, sautéed spinach and caramelized onions all on sourdough bread (for an extra buck you can add bacon) plus the house fries loaded w/ truffle aioli.Great gourmet meal all for under $15. Definitely will be back!

Visiting Chicago and passed through U of C's campus to take a look at where we used to work so long ago and it's time for lunch and there is a row of food trucks! all we got was the Fat Shallot fries with homemade cheese sauce and giardiniera and grilled... shallots. We shared that and then we were full! Did not eat the entree we got from another truck until a couple of hours later! They were really hopping but I appreciated that they did an order of plain fries for our girl, even though it is more convenient to do all the fries with the herb salt. That was really cool.

If you haven't yet come across the ridiculously awesome food truck that is The Fat Shallot, well you need to check out their schedule and hunt them down to find out what you've been missing! I stumbled across them this past weekend at a food truck fest in my friend's neighborhood and everything I tried was delicious! The BLT, grilled cheese, AMAZING truffle fries, and the seriously perfect brownie...I will hunt them down just for another one of those brownies! Love, love, love The Fat Shallot!

This was my first truck food experience and it was not disappointing was so ever. It had taken me a while to figure out where they were in the loop, but thanks to Twitter andfoodtruckfinder.comI'm now set. I had the pulled pork here and it was terrific. A bit pricey but tasted gourmet for a food truck. Sounds like next time I need to try the fries though. Really friendly service too.
best grilled cheese in the city, hands down. Don't miss out on truffle fries either! These guys got a real sandwich Master on board.

I'd give it 4.5 if I could.  Ate here while at the Lagunitas Beer Circus.  At first glance, I had some sticker shock- they're not cheap.  I saw truffle fries & BLT on the menu though, and that was a lock.  Worth the money, seriously.  The fries were crisp on the outside, soft on the inside...smothered in awesome sauce.  The BLT was totally legit, my only kinda of sort of complaint not really a complaint was MAYBE there was a tad but too much bread (and I'm a bread girl).  I will just have to track down this truck to solidify my judgement, which I look forward to.

I've never written a review of a food truck, but the food they turnout is amazing.I've also never had grilled salami before, but now I'm wondering where its been. Add some homemade BBQ sauce and a fried egg with a pretzel bun and you're eating a masterpiece. The Shallot fries with homemade cheese sauce are a wonderful compliment too.Hands down best food truck. The prices are a little high, but they earn it with the portions and taste.

I really, really don't have the words to say how awesome this food truck is, and those who know me know that I talk a lot...I'll do my best, though...After hearing about this truck for quite some time, I tracked it down to Clark and Monroe (it's there on Wednesdays). I had the grilled cheese - which was made from munster, onions and spinach - which was just incredible. Bread was perfect, not soggy, and perfect amount of cheese.Then I had the fries...and wow. I had the Spicy Sesame Fries which are topped with spicy sesame aioli and black sesame seeds. I really have never had anything like this! Perfect amount of spice, great flavor and the fries are of course perfectly done.And then the brownie. Ok, so I am not a sweets person and would rather eat fries all day long. However - this is easily (!!!!) the best brownie I have ever had. I came back to my desk and made a coworker try a bit, and he said it tasted like fudge in the middle because it is so gooey and perfect.Essentially, my entire office now wants to hunt down the Fat Shallot each week. I hesitated to write this review in case more people now find this truck and they run out of food before I can get there!

I have seen The Fat Shallot parked outside 600 W Chicago, and made a mental note to drop by and try it out.  There's moments in life when you make a decision made purely on a visceral reaction felt deep inside your self.  Sometimes it pays off, and you reap the rewards.  Sometimes it doesn't, and you're left questioning whether you can ever trust yourself again.The Fat Shallot was the right choice.  Sarah and Sam are lovely, and welcome you with a smile.  The food was a delight.  I got the meatball sub, and every single bite was better than the last.  The bread was baked perfectly, with the perfect mixture of crunch and moistness, and a hint of onion.  The meatballs were juicy, fresh and flavorful.  I also got an order of the spicy sesame fries, which were delicious as well.Definitely one of the top food trucks I've ever had.  Can't wait to try it again.
Their sour dough grilled cheese and truffle fries were on point! Also their staff are super sweet!

After having their food for the first time outside of the Merchandise Mart when in town I scheduled a return trip from East Lansing, MI. This time I sampled three of their sandwiches (finishing them with some help): the blt, the grilled cheese, and the grilled veggie sandwich. Nothing came close to disappointing. The BLT was great, crispy bacon, the peppery arugala,  fresh tomato, and perfect bread. The grilled cheese was just wonderful. The greens cheese and bread all blend into that perfect cheesy, satisfying bite. The grilled veggie sandwich just highlights the summer bounty. Delicious.I also tried their signature fries. How has no one commented on this? The giardenera is a nice salty, spicy accompaniment to the great potatoes and sweet carmalized shallots. Oh, and then there is the cheddar cheese sauce, not too much but the right amount to bring it all together. Get them.

Today was the first time i ever had food from a food truck and all i have to say is the fat shallot has the best fries ever! The spicy sesame fries were so delicious i couldnt stop eating them! I wished i would of tried more food! Highly recommend!

Just had the Reuben for the first time, and it is clearly the best one I've ever had.I'll express it again, the chef simply has a great grasp of building flavors without overdoing it.I hope the duo behind the truck opens a traditional restaurant soon!

Went to The Fat Shallot over the weekend at the Chicago Food Social. I had the grilled cheese with  sautéed onions and spinach. I love grilled cheese but, truthfully (and sadly), this was just mediocre to me. Munster cheese is my fav but I'd never use it for grilled cheese.. It's just too mild for that. For grilled cheese, nothing has beat my old Grahamwich experience. R.i.p. :( But I would give the Fat Shallot another try if I see them again. Unless Chicago Lunchbox or Husky Hog is also nearby!

I had truffle fries from here today and they were ta-die for!! so fresh and perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of truffle aioli. also got fresh watermelon juice and it was the perfect compliment to a heavy meal of french fries. it basically tasted like biting into the juiciest piece of watermelon. the woman working the truck was super friendly and accommodating and i hope she's back in my hood soon so i can go back!

If you haven't tried the Fat Shallot, you don't know what you're missing.  Every time they come to the U of C, I'm there!  Not only is the food phenomenal (and portions are huge, you WILL have leftovers for dinner, I promise you), but the owners are the sweetest people.  Sara always greets me with a huge smile and it really makes my day.  My favorite - the BLT with the Fat Shallot fries.  I'm guaranteed two awesome meals.  These guys are the best!

I ate at the Fat Shallot this weekend at Riot Fest, and I had the best french fries I've ever had. I had the truffle fries with the aioli and oh my, they were perfect. I've looked at their menu online and everything seems really tasty! Would love to catch this truck again on my next adventure to Chicago.

We had the jumbo sausage, the salami and the truffle fries.  The truffle fries are just as good as everyone says and totally worth seeking out this food truck.  The two sandwiches were very tasty, but not street fest food.  I think the sausage needs to be skinless because after a few bites, the whole sandwich totally fell apart.  The salami was too big for my husband's large mouth.  So there we were, at a food fest, with remoulade all over our hands.  Maybe if the sandwiches were cut differently?  I don't know but it was just kind of awkward.  Very good flavors.
The crispiest and most generous serving of bacon in town. I really hate the trend of thick cut, flabby bacon. The Fat Shallot does bacon right--CRUNCHY. Pretzel croissant was pretty good too.

I love these guys. They are always very nice and accommodating. I am addicted to their buffalo chicken sandwich. The chicken is tender and not greasy. All their portions are huge, their French fries are awesome and keep me coming back!

Wow!  Food trucks don't get better than The Fat Shallot.  It starts w/ their customer service, which is top notch and goes to their food ... which I swear eating the BLT I died and went to heaven.  Wait, I returned to relish in their truffle fries!  We are hooked.   Can't wait to order again next week!

I have to say, I'm not usually one to write Yelp reviews, but I felt genuinely compelled to write on behalf of this duo.They were recommended to me by a friend of a friend, and I hired them to cater my friend's bridal shower. They were a dream in every possible way. Easy to work with, and, without question, THE best catering food I'd EVER tasted. Good catering food? AT A SHOWER? Honestly, I didn't know such a thing existed. But these guys are operating on a different level.I feel confident in saying no one else could do a better job for you, whatever the event. Hire them! They'll be the dream experience you're always, well, dreaming about.

Had the BLT off their truck today, my initial reaction was to balk at the $10 cost but once I received the sandwich it was well worth it. The have a simple process and stick to it.  I admit it's hard to screw of a BLT and even more difficult to make it extraordinary, but the aioli spread and arugula make the difference.... Definitely a thumbs up!!!

Looking for an affordable guilty pleasure place to order delivery from? Then this is the joint! I have ordered delivery twice from here over the last 6 months and both times did not disappoint! The rigatoni in bolognese sauce was deliciously meaty. The second time, I added meatballs and that was definitely not a regret. My husband ordered the farfalle pollo. They were not kidding when they said their signature dish. The cream sauce was on point! The fried ravioli dish was also good. They did a great job frying the ravioli without drying it out. Oh and do NOT skip dessert. The chocolate butterscotch melt away bar is this heavenly blend of sweet and salty. It takes great restraint not to polish the whole thing off.Great place for lunch or dinner in a pinch!

I enjoyed it. Yes I did.I came here the night before the Chicago marathon to load up on them carbs. They had a sign out from inviting runners in too. It was a party of 4 and we waited maybe 10 minutes on a Saturday night. The décor is nice and the place was clean. Two things I like.Our party of 4 ordered some appetizers which were all nice and I ordered I think the capellini pomodoro. and it hit the spot. Not really heavy. Saucy but not watery. It sure helped me the following day while running that's for sure. The rest of the group seemed to enjoy their food but I can't remember what they got unfortunately.Our server was really nice. I wish I could remember her name.Overall, a solid place.

So I come in with my kids and everyone just ignores us (they were not that busy).  One was at the cash register, another behind the bar, and the others were walking around.  So I interrupted the girl at the cash register who was on the phone and asked her if someone is gonna seat us and she said to just sit anywhere.  My other family members were parking the car.  So we went to the booth and sat down.  The guy from behind the bar told us that the booths are generally reserved for larger groups at which I told him that the girl told us to sit anywhere and that I had 7 people.  I only gave an extra star because the food is decent.Update:Ok so the waiter was being nicer and got our orders right and comped one appetizer.   I still think it's crappy to be ignored, and don't tell us to sit anywhere only to be confronted by someone else not to sit at my choosing!

Awesome authentic and delicious ! Very fresh I am very satisfied ! Smells like heaven when u walk in, the kitchen is open which I love so u can kinda see what's being cooked its really an awesome place that I would like to come back too

Almost like Noodles & Company's more mature, seemingly more authentic, and just overall exponentially better older brother. This restaurant features a cozy and casual space with a menu that consists primarily of pasta. However, there are also salads, appetizers,  sandwiches, and sides. I came here on the verge of starvation, and left very satisfied. The portions are not small by any means.Here's what we ordered:Caprese Salad: Hard to mess up. This one was particularly good though.Calamari Fritti: I love calamari in general. This was pretty standard.Tortellini Crema: I loved this. I was a little apprehensive since the dish is simply cheese and pasta, but it was so good. Worth the calories. The bread on the side was not, however.My friends had the daily special and the Farfalle Pollo. Everyone was equally pleased. I absolutely could not believe the prices. The lobster ravioli is $14! For lobster??? And like I said, large portions. Very impressive.

I was in the mood for pasta from Chicago and this place didnt disappoint. I loved the vibe of the place and the service was fantastic. We ordered the garlic cheese bread which was real yummy!Also ordered the fortello pollo and it was great. However, I preferred putting the marina sauce over it, really changed it up. For dessert we ordered the oreo bar which was a good soze for 2 people and it was super delicious.The area is also nice, so great to walk and drink and such.

Came in here to pick up take out and my initial thought was that the interior was much nicer than the first Lincoln Park location. They had big red tufted leather couches, and playful decor up on the walls. They also had a long bar that was directly up against the kitchen so you could watch the cooks make your meal. Overall the interior looked really nice!Our food unfortunately fell a little flat. We tried both the clams capellini and the gnocchi aurora. Both were just okay. The clams dish was wayyy too oily, and lacked the spice the menu claimed it had. The gnocchi was better, but just okay. It wasn't a terrible experience by any means, I just wasn't thrilled with either of our choices. I'd be open to come back and try something new.
Our waiter was so fly and so funny and hes got jokes. Awesome customer service from that guy dont know his name. Oh and the lobster ravioloi and caprese salad were the bomb.

The food is decent so I'm sad to write this, but the service is awful: specifically, when it comes to delivery (I have not been in the restaurant).The first time I ordered delivery via grub hub and it took almost 2 hours for it to reach me - that's after I called to remind them.  When I called, they told me that this was a grub hub issue.  So, I chose to believe them and ordered a second time, but directly from their website (a different delivery engine).  This time, when my promised delivery time came and the food didn't, I called again. I was told the food was still at the restaurant and there was nothing they could do to get it to me quickly.  The woman I spoke to completely shirked all responsibility and once again attempted to blame the online service (a second one and one that is on their own website!).  I asked to speak to a manager and another person came on and said that they were unable to put a manager on.  I have not often dealt with a business that didn't attempt to resolve an error with some consideration for the wronged party.  It's unfortunate - I will never order from here again... if you want pasta delivery, I would suggest that you go to another place too :(

When you're here, you're family for real. I was immediately greeted by a young gentleman who told me he runs things at the restaurant during the day. Impressed by his energy and enthusiasm, all I had to do was listen as he showed me the lunch specials and the regular menu.Although everything looked good on the specials, I went with my usual tri-colored tortellini with shrimp. You really can't go wrong with a little comfort food on a cold autumn day. It was perfect. The shrimp was nicely portioned with the pasta. The pasta was just the right kind of chewy, but I wouldn't call it al dente. A nice mass of parmesan cheese was piled in the center of my to-go dish. Complete with slice of bread on the side.While I waited, I took a moment to scan the space. Local art covered the walls, and it looked like it was all for sale. The seating is either found around the perimeter as large booths, or there is ample bar seating. Everything is decorated in dark brown and merlot. Perfect for the low-lit atmosphere and a couple of drinks.To people who pick up their food. Be careful how you carry it out. Most of the cheese sauce had spilled inside of my bag by the time I got back to work. I didn't notice the plate had managed to turn on its side as I carried it. If I had known that, I would have held the dish through the plastic instead of the handles on the plastic bag. The portions aren't too big so you don't feel too pasta bloated after your meal. Very tasty, and the next time I crave Italian, I'm coming here.

The food was pretty good, and I like that there's a little pasta/Italian restaurant in the heart of Wicker Park. The portions were a great size! I did have to wait to be seated for a little bit but that was fine. The ambiance was nice. It was very welcoming. At times the noise level would get really low, I personally found that annoying but that could happen anywhere.

I wasn't impressed by the food here. They offered a check-in deal, which consisted of a free cheesy bread. Free food is always good. I noticed that the cheesy bread is normally $5, which I definitely would not pay for. The bread was lightly toasted with melted cheese on top and served with generic marinara sauce.I ordered the portobello sandwich because I was sad that the portobello mushrooms in my fridge went moldy earlier that day. The bread was over toasted for my taste. The cheese was good though. I had originally ordered white beans as my side but instead I got pasta salad. I don't remember whether that was good or not.The servers were super nice and attentive, which is always a plus!

WHOOOHOOOOOO!!!!  Finally!!!  A big bowl of good pasta for an affordable price.  Always loved the pasta bowl but since I love my neighborhood didn't frequent it too much in the park.  Now since it's down the street - we'll be coming here A LOT.The caprese salad for $6 is unbeatable.  Rigatoni bologanese was so good.  And gorgonzola shells - Oh my.  And not one pasta dish is over $13 except...the lobster ravioli which is $15.  Oh the shame!!!  It's so nice to get good pasta outside of my house and not pay $28.The only problem I have with this place? Once I start eating the bowl of pasta I don't stop and usually leave there with noodle and sauce belly.I always leave there feeling more than satisfied with my meal and the cost.We love you pasta bowl!!!

Great great service. The atmosphere is very chilled. I've tried around 5 different pastas and they've all been delicious. The lemonade is also perfect made. I feel like this place doesn't get enough credit for how great it is.

I have only ordered take out from here. It every time I have it has been delicious. Normally when you order takeout it seems to have been kept under a warmer for much too long and does not taste very good, but the pasta bowl takeout is delicious! If you want delicious comfort food at a good price than this is your place.

Having birthday dinner with my lady. Our waitress Natatlie was really nice and helped us choose a the right choice on the menu. We had the fried ravioli for the appetizer. She had the shrimp pasta and I had the signature chicken pasta. Both were excellent choices. There are a few items that they offer but not this location which is a bummer but it was still a great experience. I loved how quiet and personal our date was.

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile. Last night I ordered the linguine with clams for the delivery. The food came quickly - way before estimated. But I was so underwhelmed. My best guess is that the clams were canned (not fresh) which just ruined the entire meal. I'm not sure I'll give this place another shot. Very disappointing.

Since the Pasta Bowl was my go-to Italian restaurant in Lincoln Park, I figured I had to try this location and I'm glad I did!The restaurant itself seems more open and spacious than the other location, and I loved the atmosphere and all the art around the dining room. The menu itself seems to be the same, and the pasta is just as delicious! The portions are large and the pasta comes with a dinner roll, so don't worry about leaving hungry. I'll definitely be back next time I have a spaghetti craving!
reasonable price and portion, food is always tasty and fresh.A staple for casual dinner for many years.

Seriously some of the best pasta I've ever had.Neither my boyfriend or I could finish our bowls of cheesy, saucy, carb goodness. Although we were close....a pasta induced food coma quickly followed. No regrets!The polenta appetizer we had was great too. I don't even like polenta but I still enjoyed it. The marinara served with it was warm and full of flavor!
Great service, good wine, decent food. The pasta was definitely good but nothing special; the service, wine, and location made up for any deficits.
Great array of dishes. Able to accommodate veg options.  The best part is the sauce though...simply amazing

$6.99 LUNCH SPECIALS (entree PLUS drink!) are the bomb! And the food is actually good too! Pretty big portions and the food comes out pretty fast. They only had 1 waiter when I came on a Tuesday for lunch but maybe they'll get more staff once it gets busier. Had to wait to get seated and order. He was nice though. Came with my brother - he got the bolognese and really liked it except it was a bit too salty. I had the pesto which had great flavor.The restaurant is a lot nicer inside then I imagined. Nice comfy booths and a bar area with a TV. It's in a great area, 3 min walk from six point in wicker park.Overall: great experience, perfect for lunch, definitely worth a try if you're ever close by!

I've never been in the restaurant itself, we always order delivery and I'm surprised how good it is!!! The food always fresh!!The spaghetti and meatballs are delicious!!!! is very good and also the tiramisu is very moist and good!!

Lunch Specials are great! Healthy portion of awesome pasta. I've been going to The Pasta Bowl on Clark for years and now I can finally enjoy it in Wicker Park! I have never been disappointed with the quality of service or food at any of the The Pasta Bowl locations.

My partner and I were craving some late night pasta. I was skeptical of finding anything that was good and able to deliver at 9pm. We saw The Pasta Bowl open and decided to peer at their menu. The menu showed a plethora of appealing pasta options when compared to other restaurants. We decided to give them a chance, and ordered delivery. The food was delivered about 20 minutes earlier than the expected time, which was a pleasant surprise. The delivery person was nice, and the food was still piping hot.When we opened the containers up, my partner and I were shocked to see exactly how much food we got for the price we paid. The tin containers were packed with ooey gooey, cheesy pasta. It looked very tantalizing.I had ordered the Capellini Pomodoro. When the menu says that it contains mozzarella, it really means it. There were big chunks of it along with chunks of tomato. The taste was delicious for a relatively cheap delivery pasta. The basil was pronounced giving it a great fresh taste. The noodles were cooked well, and the cheese...well, let's just say I enjoyed how much there was.My partner had the Macaroni al Formaggio. This dish was almost as good, but the trouble it ran into was that it was a tad dry. That might have been from them baking it in order to toast the bread crumbs on top. The flavor was good, however. It was very rich and creamy. I doubt I would have been able to eat the whole portion of that by myself because of just how rich it was.I will definitely be ordering from here again the next time I get a hankering for some pasta.

Came in with arestaurant.comgift card with my pregnant wife (due this week) to try it out. Had a $15 balance that clearly says "Certificate never expires". Only term is that you must spend $22.50, which we did. Upon receiving our check, we informed waitress that we had the certificate, and she came back and said "the owner says we don't honor these anymore". I ask to speak to the owner. Taylor comes out and awkwardly tells us that "we haven't accepted these in 5 years (date the certificate was issued was not 5 years old so this was a lie). Then he proceeds to tell us that there are predator sites and he can't honor.  I told him that I have used these in the past at Lux Bar, Hugo's, Boundary, Division Ale house, and he wouldn't budge.  I asked him "how are we supposed to know you don't take these anymore, when the certificate says it never expires and we met all the conditions on the certificate"? He couldn't provide a good answer.So to prove his wrong, I called the 800 # and typed in the certificate number on the phone to redeem, and sure enough, it says "Your certificate has been successfully redeemed". So I call over Taylor again, and told him that the certificate does in fact work and is valid, and he says "What did you pay for it, like $5?. I told him, I have no idea, and he offers me $5 off my tab. So for $10, he now has a negative review (i never write reviews). And of course, I got a survey fromRestaurant.comasking how my experience was, too.  At the end of the day, his short-sightedness over $15 in value (cost of a pasta dish that probably costs him $3 to make) really is perplexing to us.  Didn't want to penalize the waitress who was very pleasant (although gave us the wrong dish - we ordered gnocchi and not the special) so they had to re-make our order. We didn't make a big deal about that, but certainly a big "customer service miss" on this one.

Attempted to try something new tonight with the bf. We were greeted pleasantly by the server who commended us on our courage and helped with any questions we had about the menu. Very friendly servers and staff. I got the pesto pasta and it was okay but I tried my partner's dish and it was so much better! We can't remember what it was called but it was just an angle hair with red sauce. Very large servings of pasta but only came with a small amount of bread. A little expensive for pasta ranging from 10-13 per dish. Fine enough for the night.

Pretty nice place.Had my boyfriend over the other night and decided we wanted pasta.  The name immediately drew us in, and so did the prices.  They are very cheap, and they give you a BUTTLOAD of food.  It was awesome!  However, my tip: get some for everyone and split it, because it can be hard to eat THAT much food just by yourself.  It isn't the best place on earth, but for the price and amount of good tasting food, it's so worth it!

Well.. I have tried to order from this place several times via their website. Each and every time the restaurant is "not accepting orders." What?[update -1] Going to change my review due to the owners fast and quick response. Will update accordingly pending my ability to actually try the place.[update -2] Issues have been corrected, order was placed, and was delivered fast. What can I say... it was delicious, as everyone else has stated. Delivered very quickly... will definitely be ordering again. Star value updated to reflect.

amazingly good food, nice portions, great music and a wonderful waiter. Their Linguine Pesto is perfectly cooked with the perfect amount of sauce. the food is not too expensive so it's great for a cheap date.

So I said I would go back and try the pasta here. I had the same nice server.  Tonight I tried the chicken caesar with garlic croutons. The best dish was the lobster stuffed ravioli with garlic sauce. Our calamari was nicely seasoned and perfectly cooked as well. We were naughty and had the tiramisu for dessert. Prices were affordable and it's a causal place. It's right around the corner for me so I'll be back again for the pasta

Took a drive out here yesterday to go shopping on north ave, stopped here to grab a bite and we love it!!Salad was big enough to split as well as the pasta. We had the fried ravioli 's as a starter- yum. Everything was delicious.And it's $5 for a glass of wine monday- Wednesday :-)Go!

I've never been to the actual restaurant but have eaten out of their food truck outside of northwestern university for years! The Conchiglie Gorgonzola and Farfalle Pollo are my favorites. They never disappoint.

It's a four star because it was affordable and delicious! I made a reservation for six people, when we arrived they didn't have our table ready. we were seated near the window with chilly draft!  We asked to switch tables and the server was very nice and seated us somewhere else with no problem.  Our appetizer calamari was delicious.  All the main dish came out great with large portion size.  The decor was nice and the atmosphere was very relaxing.   All the pasta dishes we had were very tasty from chicken to seafood pasta. I would definitely come back.
The food was ok but the place had a weird smell that was also on their silverware. I was just too hungry to go somewhere else so I ate.

If you're looking for deliciously unhealthy, rich, cheesy pasta, this is the place for you. I came here with a few friends for dinner and ordered the tortellini with grilled chicken, which was yummy and very filling. The restaurant has a warm, classy ambience; the artwork on the wall is actually for sale, which is pretty cool.However, one of my friends ordered the potato gnocchi with rosemary, and the sauce was salty to the point that it was basically inedible. She finished half her plate (and about two glasses of water) before giving up. Also, while the service is friendly, I felt that it was a little slow considering that we were the only people in the restaurant.Overall, the food is good, but not consistent. Next time I'll probably try another pasta place or the Lincoln Park location instead.
