I'm such a sucker for the Capellini Pomodoro. So simple yet so freaking amazing.Additionally, I found out this location delivers to me. This is very dangerous.

Is it me or is the Lincoln Park location better? I wanted to give it 2 stars but I'm feeling maybe that's too harsh. 3 it is. I ordered the Farfelle Pollo to go. It wasn't as good as I remembered. I used to eat it when I was hung over at work. Maybe it's not as good sober. The restaurant was empty. I mean 5:15 on a Tuesday explains that, I suppose. I asked to add pea's. I know , gross. But it makes it yummy. They don't have them anyway. I also ordered the cheesy bread. It was not good. I'll try it again, maybe I'll BYOB. It may bring back memories of how amazing this place was. I guess try it. But with a hundred other choices in any direction I will probably go someplace else next time.

Wonderful place! Food is just amazing, juicy rich flavored pasta, affordable prices. Sad moment - no bar inside, but server told us he wouldn't mind us carrying in some drinks from liquor store. Service is pretty nice as well.Will definitely come back again on our next visit in Chicago.

Been going to the Lincoln Park location since moving to the city. Super happy for the new location because I can get there a lot easier from where I live. Went with my girls one night and were treated like rockstars and fed like queens. We got a round of apps: salad, polenta, and calamari. All yummy and served with perfection. I ordered my all time favorite, the Conchiglie Gorgonzola, while my friends tried the special (some shrimp pasta in a tomato cream sauce) and Rigatoni Bolognese. We shared our tasty bowls of hearty heaven with each other and pretty much said "I'm totally ordering that when I come back!"I can't wait to go back and fill my belly up with the comforting warmth of well made pasta. One of these days I'll live close enough for delivery, but so far I'm more than happy to go out of my way to this super cute location. BYOB while you can and mangia, mangia!

Just left from there! Amazing food and staff was great! Definitely going back. We got the spaghetti and meatballs and the gnocchi. Very fresh and tasty... Got desserts to go because we could even finish our food. Soooo looking forward to my dessert!

LOVE that they deliver! Very fast for the quality of food they make. Also, they just got alcohol in the Wicker Park location which is nice for a date night. Seafood pasta or gnocchi leave you scrapping your plate clean!

We love the pasta bowl! Big thumbs up on the generous portions and prices.. The staff are always so friendly. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because there is no "regular" soup schedule!! For a while you had our favorites on the usual week day and now it has stopped. Please get that going again.. if you haven't tired their cream of mushroom you are missing out big time!

We walked in for the $6.99 lunch special. Honestly, the guy who worked there on Wednesday was the nicest guy ever in the food industry. You can tell not only did he love his job, but believed in the product.   Oddly enough, we did not get pasta but a chicken caesar salad , which was insanely large, to some type of sub. Which was OK but could have used a little more meat and a PICKLE.   But, because the guy was so cool, I am giving it 5 stars and will try the pasta next time.

TL;DR great place for Italian "comfort" food. Though there can be a bit of a wait. The staff's hospitality ties this place together handsomely.I was visiting the area, craving pasta. I was on a time crunch so I didn't have time to sit down for a fancy gourmet place. I walked by the Pasta Bowl and it looked small, causal and the food smelled delicious.I sat down, and just behind me there was a party of maybe 20+ people. Whoops- like I said I was on a time crunch. I was committed. I placed my order quickly and the staff brought me my drink.Because of the big party, I did have a bit of a wait. The staff was very apologetic and tended to me as much as they could. No big deal. With friendly staff like that, the hunger didn't bother me much. Food finally came out (gnocchi) and it was well worth the wait. Cheesy, but not overpowering, with sweet Mariana sauce hit the spot.On my way out, the owner offered again an apology and asked if I wanted a dessert on the house. Very gracious. He even gave me a free meal next time on him.   I graciously refused as I was stuffed from the meal.Pasta Bowl, you're doing it right. Thanks for making a potentially bad experience, a very good one.

This has become one of our go to places to come with our two year old. The food is good (for adults and kids) and comes quickly--key for young kids--and the servers are always super friendly even if he makes a mess. And we've never encountered a wait, even on a Fri or Sat night. Our son also likes the crayons, and sometimes there's a kid's show on one of the TVs, which helps us get some grown up conversation in. Also the portions are very generous, so we always have leftovers.

Lovely, friendly and warm environment. Always excited to dine at this location. The staff is so welcoming and extremely attentive, all your needs are met. I appreciate recommendations from the servers, the menu is full of delicious items, it's hard to choose. The servers are well informed on their pasta and their recommendations were delightful. I love that this place was BYOB, I was able to make my dining experience even better with my favorite wine.I am vegetarian and absolutely loved that you can create your own dish, substituting pasta sauces for whatever you want.Did I mention the prices are great too?One of my favorite dining places. Will def come back to dine here

At first I thought, "How hard is it to make great pasta?" I am Italian after all, so I'm fairly discerning. I've only gotten the lunch specials until last night and ordered a favorite of mine, the cappellini pomodoro. It reminds me of the cappellini I used to get as a kid at this place called Pasta Fair which was located in Orange, CT. I haven't tasted any pasta remotely like that since I lived on the east coast so it definitely lives up to the "Italian comfort food" claim.My boyfriend had the conchiglie special and that was quite tasty too. The zucchini in the grilled vegetables side was the best.Wait staff is always super friendly -- especially the guy I used to see around lunch time. Maybe I always came in way too early, but I've been concerned about the seeming lack of customers in there almost every time I've been there.I want this place to stay!

Sooooooo good and excellent staff. Omg they're so nice. The farfalle pollo is amazing and you can taste the freshness in the food. Lunch special is a good size portion got just $6.99 with a free drink. Clean place. Clean restrooms nice atmosphere. Wish I lived closer!

Totally F'd up our delivery! I called after 1.5 hours of waiting and all they said was that they just missed the online order and didn't even care. Un-F'N'-believable! We told them that we have kids who have a bedtime and they didn't care. They casually asked if we still wanted the order. They said it would take an hour to get us the new order ergo 2.5 hours of total waiting! Wow Wow Wow! NEVER AGAIN!

We used the Pasta Bowl to cater our wedding on 3/19/16. Jay, the catering manager, was extremely helpful and patient with our many requests and needs. We had vegans, vegetarians, and gluten free folks who were all happily catered to. The price was also unbeatable!! Food was delicious, piping hot, and our guests LOVED it. I think this could easily be a place that people would overlook for wedding catering, but I'm telling you, our guests didn't have a clue they weren't eating food from a high-end caterer. We're both so pleased with their service!
Awesome !!!! The customer service was everything also the food meets my expectations, will be back soon of course.

Delicious food here. Lobster ravioli is a personal favorite. And the tiramisu is amazing! Service was great, prices were fair, and quality was high. Check out the daily specials on the chalkboard too.
Great food. Great service. Great relaxed feel. Great prices. What more can you ask for?
Super yummy! I had the tortellini in cream and bruschetta for an appetizer, all delicious. AJ was awesome!

My boyfriend must ask me at least twice a week about going to pasta bowl. Its one of our regulars. My favorite is the farfalle pollo, it's always served fresh and creamy.  If your in the mood for a drink there is a connected bar next door. Love how fast and relaxing this place is. I also love that I don't have to pay an arm and a leg for top notch pasta. I love pasta bowl and will continue going there.

I ordered the Faralle Pollo WITHOUT mushrooms and of course it came with mushrooms. I was sitting at the bar and It took my waiter at least 15 mins to realize that I stopped my plate was barely untouched and it was only about 5 people dining in. I decided not to get the same dish again and sub out to Tiramisu (still slightly frozen) and coffee... Service was very slow and water was not replenished during my visit. Nothing impressive for my first visit.
Very good place!!They have lunch menu that is $6.99 include drink.Pretty good portion and very delicious.

We were really excited to try this place and it was ok. Not great. We had a great waiter, who was very attentive, but it was almost too much. We would barely set our forks down, only to be asked "are you finished?" We like to linger and eat slowly so that was kind of annoying.The food was ok. Being Italian, I admit that I can be very picky about it. I'm always on the lookout for good Italian food. The pasta was cooked perfectly. The amount of options was awesome - really, everyone can find something. But the garlic! Why do people insist on adding so much garlic that it overpowers the beauty of a sauce? In all my life, growing up with an Italian grandmother and mother, I never saw them use garlic. So back off the garlic and I think the food would be ok.I didn't mind the BYOB but excited to hear that they might get their license to serve. Would be nice to have a glass of wine with dinner w/o forethought.Overall, would I go back? Probably not, which is a bummer since it's so close to our house. But I've had better pasta in our area so tough choice for us.

Horrible service. Recently went here for Mother's Day with my family and we did not have a pleasant experience. We chose here because the first time my boyfriend and I came here, it was amazing with excellent service. This time? Not at all. When I called in, I was already answered by a person with a rude attitude (already should have been a red flag to not go) but I risked it anyways. So we show up and a lady comes up to us and seats us down at a tiny table where my mom was literally sitting on the edge of the table. Then a girl named Angela who was so rude and dull attitude asks us what'd we like to drink, to which my boyfriend asked if it was free refills and she then said uh yeah in such a rude tone. She didn't give us the lunch special card although it was only 3:30pm and when I asked her for it, she was SO hesitant in giving us it (probably to charge us full price) and said she needs to check what time it is and then went to grab the lunch special card in which she seemed so annoyed doing. She then hands out our plates for the appetizers to which had crumbs on it. You would've expect that with no business, they could have at least spent some time washing the dishes. Lol, nope. We then placed an order of 2 dishes of calamari, 4 farfelle pollo and 1 capellini pomodoro. We get the 2 orders of calamari (of which Angela couldn't balance so she dropped a piece to which she proceeded to laugh about...?) and we're all appalled on how LITTLE calamari there was on the plate. The two sauces took up half the plate. We then ask for more tissues and she again has a rude attitude and when we said thanks (even when we were served our sodas and food) she never not once said you're welcome and just walked away. The first time my boyfriend and I came here, we got a FULL plate of calamari and now we barely got 10 pieces on the damn plate!!!!! Probably saw because we placed 2 orders so they decided to split one order between 2 plates lol. We then get our food after a while of waiting and the farfelle was under seasoned... Lol... Food was 3/10 and the service is definitely 0/10. I'm guessing they changed the chefs and the servers because the first time was definitely 10/10. Maybe they need to change their server once again because Angela gave the worst service ever. You don't give your customers a rude attitude based on whatever's going on in your life. In that case, stay home. Never coming back to this location again.

I've continued to visit this location, both for sit in and for take out. My experience with sitting in has always been great. The waiters are friendly and knowledgeable about the food. I'm re-thinking going back mainly because of my experience with the take out service. They always seem to forget something important with the entree. The first time I didn't get marinara sauce with the garlic cheese bread. I figured it was an honest mistake and went back a few weeks later. I ordered a chicken & pasta entree... only to come home and find out that the chicken was missing. So I paid about $20 for cheesy carbs? Not a happy customer.
Great service. A very nice pasta place to sit down and grab a quick lunch. Lots of options and great prices. Would definitely recommend!
I had the toasted ravioli as an appetizer and the Farfalle pollo pasta as my dinner. Both were great & would recommend! The fact that it was BYOB made it even better.
Quick and easy. Lunch special very affordable, portions are still large.

Our party of four was quickly greeted and seated. After ordering appetizers - which were delicious - our waiter took our dinner order, but he forgot to write down the fourth dinner. He didn't realize his mistake until all dinners arrived. Although he was extremely polite and apologetic it took 30 minutes to deliver the fourth dinner. Because we were right by the kitchen we could see several of the same dish being taken to other tables.  We eventually called for manager who came and apologized. but we couldn't help think our waiter wasn't assertive enough to get the NEXT order, not wait until all previous orders had been taken care of.  They did comp the dinner and a second glass of wine. Although we were guests of regulars, they said they wouldn't be back. BTW, the food was really good!

The gnocchi aurora is to die for. I recently moved to the neighborhood and chose to try out as many restaurants as a I can to enjoy my new town. The pasta bowl is a top notch place was never a huge fan of pastas. But, like my opening sentence says...the gnocchi aurora is phenomenal!  10/10
Quick. Easy. Delicious. Cheap. Awesome waiter. Perfect. Fast. Amazing. What more do you need?!!!!
Great gem of an Italian restaurant. Cute atmosphere, great service and and the best pasta I've ever had.  Generous portions served piping hot and reasonable prices, what more could you want!
On this part of the street there are far better options for a quick and easy dinner.

I love Pasta Bowl. The gnocchi is delicious and their fettuccini alfredo is the best I've had in a long time. The service is super friendly, and we got free bruschetta the first time we visited. I live nearby and it's great that I can order takeout and it's ready in 10-15 mins. I definitely recommend this to anyone looking for some really great pasta at the most reasonable prices in the neighborhood.

First time here, it was great!  I got the lunch special which is a great deal. Food was delicious and came out fast. The best was the host/ manager, AJ!  He is very nice and seems to be on top of it, making sure everything is running smoothly. It's a great place and I will be sure to come again!

The food was great! Excellent prices! Portions were more than enough! Katlynn was so nice and super efficient! Will definitely be back! Also, because it was our first time here they offered up a free dessert of our choice!

I love going here for the lunch special. Every time I come in, I order a different kind of pasta, and they've all been amazing. The service is also friendly and quick. It's reasonably priced, the portions are excellent, the appetizers and desserts are great, the art on display is good, and I've always had a really nice experience here.

Came in by myself on a Thursday night and was immediately greeted by the cute host who offered me either the bar or a booth. I chose the bar and was then brought water by my attentive and friendly waitress who I did not get a name for, though she was stellar. I ordered the garlic cheesy bread and a spaghetii with meatballs.The flashy cooks make the food right in front of you, with large spurts of fire occasionally spurting up for a cool scene. The food was fantastic for about 17 bucks. Props to the excellent cooks, and thanks to the sweet waitress I had.

This place is the best; especially when you work in the area eat lunch in the hood four times a week. First things first, AJ is a dope server. He will guide you through your order with the precision of a senior surgeon. He will also recommend you get a carafe of root beer. It will be the best decision you didn't realize you needed to make. The carafe of carbonated beverage will make you feel like a kid again. Also, the pasta is great and the lunch special is incredible.

I'd really like to write a good review here, but 2 for 2 with the cleanliness factor here.  I have gone into this place twice and both times I have really enjoyed the food!  The bruschetta and the pasta were very tasty.  However the people behind the counter or the management are not doing their jobs.  Each time I came in I happened to sit in the booth, facing the kitchen, since I happen to like sitting in booths.  You can see everything the staff and cooks are doing throughout your meal...maybe next time I should face away as to not see what is going on.My first visit the hostess was eating bread at the front host stand and handing out menus as people were walking in.  She then went to the back of the kitchen to cut herself some more bread and continued to eat in front of customers.  I spoke with the manager Taylor about this and was assured this would no longer happen.Well my second visit was today and it was actually must worse!!!  The servers were eating a plate of pasta in the back of the kitchen and the cooks were picking up pieces of shrimp with their bare hands and eating it, and then going back to cook, without even washing their hands!  I know for a fact the girl serving us did not wash her hands, I watched her my entire meal!!!  Another chef had gloves on....this is a good thing right?!....wrong...he kept the gloves on while texting on his personal cell phone in front of a customer at the bar.  Believe me, he was watching this guy the entire time, and so was I!  I could not believe this was actually happening.Look guys, there are tables for a reason, eat your food away from where people can see you eating.  It is really gross and please please please wash your hands!  I am not a germ a phobe, I promise, but I do not want to get sick!!!!  I spoke with a different manager this evening, and he assured me this will never happen again....I am not so sure....I will be watching every time I am in there!!!

I had the clams capellini delivered over a year ago and it was fine.  Today after watching the Cub's game in the neighborhood, went in to get the same and take it home.Sure, I prefer any clam in white sauce in Europe or anywhere in N.Y., and this was fine before.  I was so disappointed.  I couldn't eat even 1/4 of it.  The salt was overwhelming.  It was bland...just no taste at all.  As last time, I asked for garlic, but not a hint today.  I do know how to prepare this, and just plain pasta and olive oil and a couple of broken basil leaves would have been better, and call it a day!Do you think they could afford a little more than one small end piece of crusty bread?

This place is a hidden gem. I can't believe how amazing it was. My co worker and I were drivin around trying to find somewhere new to eat, when she looked on Yelp and this place came up! It had 4 1/2 stars so we figured why not? The inside is a very relaxed vibe, not your typical Italian restaurant. Our waiter was AMAZING! I wish I could remember his name. He was super helpful and funny and pleasant to talk to. The food was AMAZING. I got the tortellini with creamy sauce....oh my GOD! Heaven in my mouth. We ended up ordering it to be delivered to our work today. It was super fast delivery and still hot and fresh. So easy to order online too! Will be coming back over and over again. Have nothing but good things to say about this place.

I went there for lunch during the week and was blown away --the lunch special was fabulous and very reasonably priced and the service was excellent.  Went back for dinner today and a totally different experience. I don't know if it was because they were understaffed but our waiter barely was around except to take our order and give us the check.  The food was unfortunately sub-par. My daughter order the gnocchi and the rosemary was overwhelming, drowning out any other flavor of the pasta. It was like instead of a sprinkling they drowned the dish in rosemary. I would have mentioned it if we even had a chance to talk to our waiter or anyone else. Ditto for the capers in the penne dish but that wasn't as bad. I had the lobster pasta dish which was just okay.  Really disappointed because my lunch experience was so good.

I'd like to rate this restaurant, but when I called to make a reservation I was told that they only took reservations for parties of 8 or more.  And it was because they were planning on being too busy the night I requested.  I suppose that means that this place is doing so well that they don't need my business, so take from that what you will.

I have been a fan of the original location for some years and was happy to hear they have expanded in a new neighborhood. Parking is a little tough at both locations, but once you are in you get to see the kitchen in action and sit in comfy booths and enjoy the people walking by or ACTUALLY TALK to your guests. The manager greeted us immediately and even brought water and made small talk. I love this place for the food, but it definitely can't hurt that you feel like you are at home.  We always get the chicken and bow tie pasta and the other usually varies on the specials.. this day I had pesto chicken with roasted veggies.. delish.

Food was super yummy! Atmosphere was perfect for a chill dinner out after a long week. Katlynn was awesome and went above and beyond to make sure everything was just right.  We will most definitely be back.

Went last night for the first time since it opened in the neighborhood. I enjoyed the farfalle pollo pasta dish - great flavor, will definitely order again. Great sized portions, enough for dinner and a take home box for lunch as well. Service was polite, good and attentive. I definitely see this as a great spot for a yummy, quality dinner when you're just not in the mood to cook. I also plan to use their take out option when winter comes back around.

The Pasta Bowl is my second home away from home. It's great to have a restaurant where I can escape to and always be greeted with a smile and warm welcome. All the dishes are always fresh and are a delight to the palate. My son wanted me to add "It's the best place ever!!"

Welcome to the hood!  You can't beat the price and quality.  We've had dinner there twice in a week.  Portions are great for sharing and they have daily specials.  The waiters and manager were all super friendly.  It's byob for now which will save you $ but it seems they will have an alcohol list very soon.  Perfect for small or large parties.
Really happy with how delicious this pasta is. Friendly staff and the pasta is great!!

Delicious pasta and good prices. I think I am addicted to their Fettuccini Alfredo.  Plus they were instantly generous and helpful  when I accidentally ordered to the wrong location online. They whipped up my dish for me, called the other location to let them know, and no extra charge. I am sure I am not the first person to do that and appreciate them being so helpful and nice about it.

Went on a whim after a haircut. It was after lunch too early for dinner but hadn't eaten yet and Italian comfort food sounded yummy. Really cozy and nice inside. Only had one server but service was friendly and quick. Ordered a spinach salad, dressing was tangy and perfect. I also had the Gnocchi w/ rosemary and goat cheese. I've never ordered gnocchi before but I love rosemary and goat cheese combined it was delicious. Really incredible sauce and definitely hit the spot. I'd love to come back for dinner with friends.

Best neighbors ever!Amazing food and even more amazing management and staff!  This location is new to our neighborhood and graciously donated lots of great food and an entire keg of beer for our block party.  Everyone on the block was impressed with their generosity and how great the food was.HIGHLY recommend!!

Food was tasty and abundant. We had plenty for a second meal. The Bona Vita was delicious with ample meat and veggies. Enjoyed the bruschetta. Great service, too. We had a great meal. Definitely be back when we are in the area.

Excellent location, great staff and delicious food. Our server, AJ, was more than friendly and accommodating. The food was well priced and BYOB always helps. I would recommend the fried calamari and Italian meatball sandwich.  We will be back shortly.

My wife and I just went there tonight for the first time. I was a bit reluctant because I assumed that with prices  so reasonable, the food could not  be very good. My assumption could not have been more off the mark. We were both very pleasantly surprised.My wife had the spinach cranberry gorgonzola salad with a side of meatballs and I had the caprese salad and spaghetti with meatballs. We brought our own bottle of wine.Every item was terrific and the service could not have been better. The check was $30.00. Unbelievable!

This place is fast becoming a favorite for us all over again. We used to go to the original Pasta Bowl on Clark Street and we're thrilled when opened another location in Bucktown. Food is as good as always. Large portions of delicious al dente pasta and the sandwiches are amazing as well. Their lunch specials are a complete bargain and cover most of their most popular dishes. We eat here at least once a week and the service is always wonderful. Would be great if they start serving the pizza they have at the other location as well because I think it will definitely give some pizza places in Bucktown a run for their money.

Just ordered from there -- the food was good, but not as much as you would get altho the original location. Taylor, the owner is HORRIBLE! Met the owner when he was remodeling the place and bought a bunch of bar stuff. He was nice at first and we told him that we commuted from the West Loop to this location at least 3 times a week. This and the other side bar. Their delivery zone stops as far south as Chicago Ave. I live by Grand/Halsted/Milwaukee. Literally 3 blocks from Chicago. He did my roommate and I a favor and "approved" delivery to our home as we were such loyal customers. So we started to order and everything was GREAT!!! Anyhow, we get a call after the 3rd delivery from the owner himself stating that he cannot deliver to our location anymore -- its too time consuming. We argued back and he accommodated us with 2 $25 gift cards to the Pasta Bowl. We haven't been back since. He wrote us over email stating that he was in the process of opening a new location in Wicker Park that would be closer and we received the email yesterday the Wicker park location was open! So we placed an order and everything was fine. We called back to inform them that we would be using the gift card and the same owner answered and said that he would accommodate us this one time, however, we were not able to get delivery (despite being only 2.5 miles out)...fine, we'll take our business elsewhere Taylor. The new location skimped on the food -- maybe because he knew it was us....I'll never know. Do yourself a favor Taylor -- be a man of your word!

mmm found my favorite burger in Chicago!Came on a Sunday afternoon around 1PM and the line was about 15 people out the door.  The line moves kind of slow since there is only one cashier but there was plenty of seating indoors and outdoors.  The burger and fries were ready fairly quickly and it was delicious, great patties and love their pickles.  The burgers come with 2 patties, I would have been pretty happy to have only 1 patty as the burger was pretty big with 2.  Only thing I didn't care for was the ginger soft drink, it tasted very artificial and left a bad after taste, forgot the brand but it was not Seagrams or Canada Dry.Definitely will come back again.

Small Cheval isn't quite as great as the big brother Au but still does a fine job. I like the more casual/laid back concept Small Cheval offers. The burger was really good and had the same type of flavor. I think the bun was a little more crisp but it wasn't a bad thing. I didn't get the bacon but I hear it's not the same as Au Cheval's. My burger fix was more than satisfied so I would recommend coming here when you have an Au Cheval craving as it will hold you down. Service was fast and friendly.#RefereEats"I call it like I eat it."

Great burger, beat in Chicago. Ha a nice afternoon lunch. Lots of good drinking options if you are up for a session. Definitely a cool layout- similar to a  classic Chicago dog/ burger joint.Also enjoyed the outdoor seating.

Ok, so Burgers are my thing. If I am trying a burger for the first time, I get it just the way they make it. I don't enjoy slathering a burger in so much ketchup or sauce, that you can't taste the beef.This burger needs nothing on it. It has a luscious flavor. The meat is so flavorful. Their menu is simple, burgers, two kinds. Hamburger and cheeseburger and fries. They have achieved perfection. I think the bun is potato bread, with a golden crust. Dijonaise, pickles, and onions come standard on the burger. The cheese was melted perfect, and the fries were crisp yet soft enough.The atmosphere of the place is awesome. One large room, with the kitchen open to the dining area. Tin ceiling, and liquor around the wall. They have outside seating, which is cute and allows you to watch the world go by.They have a limited drink menu, with some liquor options. With the burger as perfect as it was, I regret not buying a cocktail here.Try this place. If you love burgers, this is where you go.

For a restaurant that's supposed to be the little sibling of the best burger in the city/state/world, I was underwhelmed. I haven't tried au cheval yet but hope it's infinitely better than this "fast food" version of itself. The only redeeming factor is the garlic aioli which helped add some flavor/juice to an otherwise plain and dry burger. I ordered the hamburger house style ($8.95), which doesn't include lettuce or tomatoes fyi. The fries ($2.95) are decent and serve their duty as an appropriate vessel to carry obscene amounts of garlic aioli into my mouth.I do really like their outdoor patio though which has strings of lights draped across. Order and pay at the counter. The line moves relatively fast.

In every way this burger was *exactly* what I thought it would be and at minimum met my sky high expectations, would even say it exceeded them.Came here for take out around 7ish on a Monday. Place was 1/3 full dine in with maybe five or so ppl waiting to get their food to go.Step up to the register and order Cheeseburger w Fries w all toppings offered. Also grabbed a Half Acre Beer//not.daisycutter, was given the buzzer and sat down at the larger communal table in the middle.  In about 7 minutes buzzer goes off, grab and go. Burger, Fries and Beer - $21 and change.15 minutes later at home, open up and happy to see that this burger traveled quite well and it probably even set up better wrapped in its foil packaging giving it time to rest and allow all the toppings to sort of get happy together. Fries were also still hot and crispy.You know the rest, two seared patties cooked to a perfect medium in true diner style fashion.  The bun is perfect in size, taste, and look for all that is going on with this masterpiece.  They strike the perfect balance with all the ingredients - cheese, dijonnaise, pickle and onion (no bacon necessary imo) - still allowing the excellent beef flavor to shine through.[X] Will be back -
This is my go to burger spot.  Whether you want to sit down or take out, the food is always great.  Simple menu, liquor, shakes...  The patio area is huge now, and there is plenty of parking.

I loved everything about Small Cheval!It's such a quaint and small burger joint. You order at the counter and there's several beers on draft ($6 - $8 for craft) There's seating indoors and in the back patio area. Burgers are a little pricy ($8.95 for a hamburger and $9.95 for a cheeseburger) but the taste and portion doesn't disappoint!My friend and I split a cheeseburger and fries and sat outside to enjoy the gorgeous afternoon. The cheeseburger was superb, with oozing cheese and pickles between two juicy patties. The. Fries. Were. So. Good. They came out fresh and had the perfect amount of crispiness to them! Delicious plain, dipped in ketchup, and oh dipped in the garlic aioli... phenom. Which can also be found at the condiment station so you can enjoy yourself garlic aioli for days.I thoroughly enjoyed the cheeseburger and fries. Would highly recommend Small Cheval for a great burger in Chicago!

Having a mini-me is awesome, right?  (Or it would be at least).  Yes, well we know it'd be cool and so does Au Cheval which is why they are "boss" enough to have a legitimate mini-me...and let me introduce Small Cheval.  Small as in the menu, but definitely not in the flavor...in fact, with the exception of the menu there is nothing small about Small Cheval - not the food, not the space itself, and not the personality of the restaurant.  Oh - you know what, I already lied to you.  Small Cheval also has small lines...and that's one small thing that I am completely okay with.  Unlike the mothership you can come to Small Cheval and expect get that juicy burger in your hands within a matter of minutes...instead of a matter of hours.  Hmm...to wait a couple minutes or a couple hours for my food???I'm definitely not telling you to skip Au Cheval altogether, and in fact I would recommend you going there first, but my gosh - coming to Small Cheval is a better gig if you're looking for something to satisfy that craving but don't have the time and energy to wait at the mac daddy, aka Au Cheval.  The quality of the burgers here at Small Cheval are definitely on par with those that they are making at Au Cheval, but they differ just a little in that when requesting bacon here at Small Cheval you won't be getting thick-cut bacon and all that fancy schmancy stuff.  The toppings here reflect more of a sedated, typical "fast-food" burger but this is NOT a fast food burger.  You must not be so easily deceived.  It sort of has the fast food-feel, but with a funky, fresh twist.  Small Cheval is a great place to come and hang out with friends or family as they have a plethora of seating outside in addition to that inside.Getting back to the food - the good stuff, the juicy stuff - well, it's just as savory and it hits the spot so perfectly.  As I had mentioned already - the burger is divine, but then again I fully expected that having already eaten at Au Cheval a couple weeks prior.  The burger definitely wasn't as decadent and yet the price for the burger was pretty much the same price - it's my opinion that the burger should have been a little cheaper seeing as how it was more of a "common" burger, if you will.  Your meal simply is not complete without those golden fries though - yes, it's regular fries, but they're fresh and good.  Who doesn't love fries, right?  What truly made my day, though, was the fact that they had a big honkin' dispenser of the garlic aioli which I gladly loaded up on for the purpose of smothering my fries in that yumy goodness.  And now, your meal still is not complete...not without a shake - a boozy shake.  You can get a chocolate or vanilla shake and for about $5 extra you can have them add Bailey's.  Believe me, you want to fork out that extra $5 - it will be the best damn milkshake of your life.  They are generous with the Bailey's in there too - depending on how much of a lightweight you are - you may very well feel it.If you want alcohol, but not in your shake (but let's be honest - you want alcohol in your milkshake) there are a couple beers on tap and they have a row of shot glasses lined up on the counter so that you can order a quick shot while ordering your food.  Small Cheval knows how to get the party started.  Overall, its quite an enjoyable experience, especially while the weather is pleasant and you have the option of sititng outside.Let's give a BIG shout-out for Small Cheval!

On a recent visit to Chicago, I was excited when I passed Small Cheval.  I've always wanted to try Au Cheval, but could never stomach the wait time.Overall, decent experience.  The inside of the restaurant is designed to look like a shack...and it feels like a shack.  The outdoor patio is gorgeous, so I would opt for that.Burger: I went with no cheese and added BACON.  I also asked to add lettuce and tomato (available by request).  Overall, burger was pretty good but nothing to write home about.  I prefer burgers with lots of toppings, so it might be better for the "purists."Fries: Great and a huge portion!  The condiments on the side (aioli and two types of ketchup) were great as well.Chocolate Shake: Classic and delicious.  'Nuff said.
Best fresh, quick order double burger, Chocolate shake, and fries in a long time; a can't-miss lunch!

Epic. Best. No comparison. This is the definition of a quintessential burger and a blueprint burger shop experience.Patio. Small dining room. Menu with just one focus. That is your experience. This unassuming little dive will have a line but you'll move through quickly because the menu, well, is the way I like menus. What do you want? Burger, cheeseburger, fries. Add bacon.Yep. That is it. But oh that is where it begins.The burgers are juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The bun is deliciously soft but holds up under the two patties and cheese that is oozing over the edges. The bacon is a perfect addition! However, skip the house mayo.Fries are perfectly crisp and fresh with each having slightly different textures. The flavoring is not pronounced so don't expect a heavy salt or upscale flavoring. Just good ol fashion, perfectly done fries.Drinks are out of can (grab from cooler), from the tap, or from the milk shake shaker. Seating inside or outside.The price is heavy but I'll pay for it with these burgers! They are a five star place if the cost was a bit lower. 4 because of cost.Tips1. Garlic aioli is wonderful on fries2. It is two patties3. Save the dessert and head around the corner to Margie's Candies4. Cheese is great - do it!5. Bacon is wonderful!6. Fries are a tweener in terms of size for one or two people. Go with one and get a second order if needed.

How can you not like a cheaper and faster version of "Chicago's best burger" at Au Cheval!? It's not really quite as good as the burger at Au Cheval, or so I've heard, but it's one of the better burgers in the city of Chicago! And, this place has something that it's big brother restaurant doesn't.... simplicity and speed. If you want a trendy, fast, YUM-tastic burger... Come here now.There's a short menu of a Hamburger or Cheeseburger (you can add bacon for $2) and delicious house made fries. No frills delicious greasiness! Done deal!PS- Don't forget that they have around nine different kinds of beer, Negronis, Margaritas, Peach gimlets, 3 different kinds shots (at least) and vanilla and chocolate shakes!PPS - You can also order whole pitchers of beer! Yay! =) The more, the merrier!

Went at 2:30 on a Tuesday with our 16 month old - they have highchairs, yea!  Small inside, bigger outside.  The cheeseburger was great, the fries were amazing as was the garlic aioli.$42 for 2 cheeseburgers (1 w/bacon), 1 order of fries and 2 beers.

The burgers are almost as good at Au Cheval, but still sooooo gooood.This is counter service, so the wait is not crazy, only a few things on the menu, quick order and then get to choose where to sit. The outdoor patio is huge, its an amazing atmosphere especially for a weekend lunch.The wait for food was not too long, which is a great plus.A must try.
Burgers are good. Just not $12 good. Over priced for burger king sized burgers. Fries are good.

Alright everyone, listen up: everyone in the general vicinity should stop going to Shake Shack, Five Guys, or any larger / lesser franchises right now and go get your burger fix at Small Cheval.This is no In-N-Out $3 (or so) double-double, so there should not be any comparison to begin with. This is a completely different price point at about $10 for a burger. The buns are perfectly bouncy with some give, meat patty is juicy and perfect (a single order is two patties), and all the fix-ins just work. Should you want to splurge, go get a bacon add-on. A cheeseburger is just enough for me (and my gf!) Definitely go for some Sir Kensington ketchup / mustard and garlic aioli! Fries give off just the right amount of texture of crunchy exterior and bouncy starchy goodness.Yes it's different than the Au Cheval burger, but this place was designed as a local, casual hamburger bar rather than a full blown restaurant. Wait times are very short if any and are pretty consistent here and they make one of the best burgers (if only under their parent restaurant) in Chicago. This is definitely my stop to go for burgers and I highly recommend this place above all!
Walked in, walked right out. Horrible service from the start. Came in and signed in, the hostess was incredibly rude, very obnoxious, steer clear, try small cheval in bucktown instead.

The location is awesome.If you keep in mind what you going in for, you won't be disappointed!The burger is great, it has double patties so whoever is trying to not eat that much meat should keep that in mind.The price is good for this kinda burger, we got 2 cheeseburgers- 1 fries and 2 canned sofas and it set us back about $30Nice play to just hang out and talk too

That Chocolate Shake: 5! Never fails!!!Cheeseburgers are always a hit! Hamburgers are always filling!The condiments... get them all!!! I wish I could buy their Aioli and Ketchup by the gallon!Fries: 4Nice, large outdoor patio for those hot summer days!

COST:$9.95 (Cheeseburger)$2.95 (Golden Fries)$4 (Draft Beer)Let's cut to the chase, this is the BEST DAMN BURGER I'VE HAD IN CHICAGO. It's so good and you get so much food for the price. It's quite literally Au Cheval without the bells and whistles (and WITHOUT 1+ hour waits).It's probably good that Wicker Park is comparatively inaccessible via the Red Line because I'd be here every single meal time.The patties are thick and juicy and beats In-N-Out any day. It's kinda like Five Guys taste wise but much better and fresher tasting. The fries are to die for. They gave you a heaping of these crispy on the outside, soft on the inside french fry gift-from-the-gods.I believe they do $3 shots of various amounts of hard liquor like whiskey or vodka. Also $4-6 pints of beer. Really respectable prices!But the dealmaker so to speak? Serve your own condiments! Yes I know aioli is just a fancy term for mayonnaise, but Small Cheval's garlic aioli is so good you'll wanna take their dispenser home (not really, that's called stealing!).I've been three times already, and I suspect - nay - I'll be back for more!
For 10 bucks, you absolutely won't find a better burger. So simple, so good. Fries are legit. 4 dollar beers. Fast service; beats waiting at Au Cheval to get your fix.

Knowing I was going to pay $10 for a burger AND being spoiled with In-N-Out, I was expecting a lot. The location is awesome. They have a really nice outdoor seating area with 10+ large tables, an indoor area with a ton of seating (and obnoxiously loud music)plenty of shade, and you get to see the train pass by every 10 minutes.The food was alright, but nothing special. One of the parties on a burger was undercooked, and there was way too much sauce. The pickles and bun were really good, but the burger was just ok - nothing special. Stop by here for a quick bite, it's a cool spot.The service left something to be desired. The guy taking orders wasn't very personable or welcoming.

Not the same... definitely not the same burger as Au Cheval.I was excited to hear that Au Cheval opened another restaurant that just focused on their signature cheeseburger called Small Cheval. The idea was great since it would have a much shorter wait time and the option of adding lettuce and tomato. Sounds great in theory but after the first bite, I realized that the burger at Small Cheval didn't have the pure awesomeness and enchantment from David Blaine's demon magic at Au Cheval. The fries (cooked in animal lard) were still amazing but the burger wasn't quite at the same level.Overall, it's still a great burger for $10. It's just a bit disappointing because I was hoping for the epic signature burger from Au Cheval without the wait. For the location and convenience of being a burger joint, it's definitely a smaller version of the superior and nationally ranked Au Cheval burger.

Best burger I've ever had! Small Cheval, u just might the ugly, red-headed stepchild..but i luv ya! Service is very efficient & no 3hr wait times like the original(Au Cheval). Pricey but worth it. Make sure to add BLT. Got cheeseburger $10 with bacon +$2, fries $3 & shake $4= $21 after tax. Choco shake tastes like Wendys Frosty-but better!! Gotta get it with Bailey's next time (+$4). Will def be back!

These burgers are life changing. The garlic aioli? The fries? The milkshakes? God, just writing this review is making my mouth water.Their outdoor seating area is gorgeous if you get the chance. If this place were more affordable on my tight college budget, I'd be here more often but I've eaten here 4 times this past year and each time was phenomenal. A must try! Maybe bike there off the 606 to relieve any food guilt or coma this place will inflict upon you.

From a business standpoint, this place is genius.  $15 bucks for a tiny cheeseburger and some fries?  They must be sleeping on beds made of $100 billls with gold dubloons over their eyes and a headboard made of diamonds.I've been to the actual Au Cheval and the burger there is good.  This is not the same burger.  I find it fascinating that they are marketing it as such.  Have you been to 5 Guys?  Shake Shack?  Epic Burger?  Any sort-of-upscale fast casual burger spot?  If so, you've had this burger.  Better quality meat than McDonald's but not as good as Portillo's... and not nearly as good as a real restaurant quality burger.  Here, a sort-of-fast-food-burger will just cost you more.I do like the options to add booze to my shake, drink a shot with my beer, and sit at a giant picnic table with the sexy-dirty foodie hipsters of the city.  The atmosphere is good, but the food isn't anything special and anyone who is saying it is doesn't know their way around a pile of ground beef.  But if you meet the owner(s) you should probably try to marry them because they must be rich as fuck.

I haven't been to Au cheval so I won't make any comparisons but the burgers and fries here are really good.Super juicy and flavorful cheeseburger and awesome crispy fries...can't go wrong. Menu is super simple, which is great. Good local beers on tap.I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the mood for a solid burger.

Finally got to this place last night, and I'm so glad I did. Service was great and fast, and the food was delicious -- everything I was hoping for. I ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and a chocolate shake with Bailey's, and it was American food perfection. The double patty burger was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of cheese, the fries were a great blend of crispy outside and mushy inside, and the shake tied it all together with its boozy, chocolatey creaminess on a hot night.Yeah, it's pretty expensive. My husband paid the bill, so I'm not sure, but I think it was in the neighborhood of $65 for my meal, plus his hamburger with bacon, shot of Fernet, and chocolate shake, but I think it was worth every penny.

The little sister restaurant to Au Cheval got some game.  Sometimes you have to just take a step back and realize when a great burger is a great burger.Small Cheval.  *Steps back*. Great burger.  See?But really, every nook and cranny of this burger has been detailed to the last grain.  The beef is succulent.  The bun has that firm yet inviting softness.  The cheese has a nice meltiness, but not too runny.  The onion and pickle give off that clean crisp flavor that you know there was care into selection.  The sauces... don't get me started...**Sauce Side Note**Sauce on a burger is such an underrated aspect.  A well-made sauce can bring a burger to a new echelon.  It often goes unaddressed with just ketchup, mustard, mayo, or barbeque.  But if you want an amazing burger elevate the sauce and you will get there faster than a frat boy jumping off a roof.**End note.**...So Small Cheval's assortment of Homemade sauces are delectable.  From that garlic aioli to the homemade ketchup to the handcrafted mustard to the delectable dijonnaise.  All available at a friendly pump station next to the pickup counter?  Wow.Saucin', Saucin', I'm Saucin' on you...

All time favorite burger place !With only three things on the menu, it makes ordering food easy (:I like my burgers cooked medium rare, but with thin patties it makes it a little harder to do that.They could step up their fries game though. Nothing special, but is good with the burger.Overall, amazing burger and decent fries

Honestly, I don't understand why people wait in 4 hour lines for Au Cheval (I'm guilty of it myself), when they can just come to Small Cheval for an infinitely better burger and little to no wait. I've now been to Au Cheval 4 times and Small twice and really don't understand what the Au Cheval fuss is about. Now that I've had both burgers within a week of each other, I can confidently say the Small burger is superior to the Au burger. Something about the patties, the flavor, and the buns. Both times I've been to Small Cheval I've been in burger heaven, and all times I've been to Au Cheval, I've left pretty underwhelmed. Maybe it's just me, but next time you consider waiting in a four hour line, consider Small Cheval as a worthy alternative.

Be warned.  This is a good burger, but this is NOT the AU Cheval burger.  They share a name only.  Whatever they do on Randolph to make their magical burgers has not transferred here.  Something is missing.Again, it's a good, tasty burger, but it isn't one of the best burgers you have ever had.
Expensive for a quick burger joint and not as good as the original. Cool setup though. Burger and fries are still delicious and they have the garlic aioli sauce!

I'm straight.Not to say the burger wasn't good or anything but there's JUST a burger. Now obviously I came here already knowing the extent or lack thereof of options but I think I had this exclusive location and their ten dollar burger on a pedestal before ever having it. Maybe I daydreamed that it would have 24k gold flakes or at the least have more fresh onion on it than the little handful of chops. I really feel it missed the crunch and texture of raw onion rings. I also just don't have mad love for burgers that don't come standard with lettuce, tomato, and onions. It seems like people sweat the aioli but the gourmet ketchup was better. I had a chocolate shake and it was on point.Two burgers, one order of fries, one shake... thirty dollars. I've had single burgers that tasted like they should be thirty dollars but Cheval didn't add up for me. Don't get me wrong, it was an alright burger. I just don't think an alright burger deserves to be the only thing a dedicated location sells.

Wait, what?  I haven't reviewed this yet after many trips?I admit, I've been to Au Cheval once and i didn't have the burger, so I can't compare the Small Cheval burger to it, but this burger is darn good!I love the atmosphere and the really friendly staff.  Everyone is so nice and friendly that when you are smooched in seats (if busy), you still don't feel too terrible about it.The burgers are delicious.  I hear they are slightly smaller than Au Cheval, and I don't know if I'd need any burger.  The cheeseburger is amazing - juicy, flavorful, perfectly covered in cheese.  Yum.  I occasionally dip in a nice helping of ketchup.  Yum.  The fries are also quite delicious.  I haven't gone for bacon, but maybe on one of the next trips.Good selection of beers and there's also a giant cooler for water if you're thirsty.I highly recommend the outdoor patio, but inside is just as cozy if the weather isn't nice.

Cheaper version of Au Cheval. There's pretty much only 1 food item on the menu: BURGER. And you can add fries or a milkshake if you want. Prices are basically $1 or so less than that of Au Cheval. But there's not much of a wait because it's a order at the counter and find a seat yourself type of place. Seating is quite interesting... there are seats around the edges of the small restaurant, and then a huge table in the middle. It can get busy, but I came with 2 friends on a Friday night and only had to wait 10 min for seats.The burgers of course taste great! I mean, if that's the only thing they make, it better taste amazing. The meat was juicy and chewy. The fries were real potatoes but way too salty. And the smoothie was pretty good - I got the vanilla one. It's pretty smooth and creamy. My friend did mention that the chocolate one doesn't really taste too strongly of chocolate though. I got a burger with fries and a milkshake, which came out to $18.There's usually street parking available on Milwaukee.

I choose this place every time over au cheval. The burger that most people wait three hours for is available here with little to no wait. There's shakes are wonderful and the employees are so nice. Every time I order a burger here I am able to have my meal within a few short minutes. This helps because the wait is absolutely unbearable since it is so amazing! Do yourself a favor and order it the way it comes because you will not be disappointed. I recommend this place to anyone visiting Wicker Park. The alcoholic milkshakes are just a plus. You may want to Uber because the milkshakes are a must try, but parking is available for others. Enjoy!

I was referred here by a local. I got a cheeseburger, golden fries, and a can of coke. Plus tip, this cost me about $20. That seems very high, even for a high-quality burger joint.The burger was good. I did not like the fries, but they did have a unique flavor that probably appeals to some people. I probably won't go here again, but only because of the price.

Casual quint space, positive/welcoming vibes, small menu (not a bad thing!), $10 per person average but good quality items. No need to travel across town but if walking by in the neighborhood give them a try.

Now you can get Au Cheval's famous -- justly famous -- burgers in Wicker Park, and without having to wait in line for two hours to fight for a table. Almost.It seems to me that the burger here is in the *spirit* of Au Cheval's, but isn't quite the same. The whole thing is a little more orderly, a little more assembly-lined, and has just a hint of fast-food about it.  It's still an extremely good burger, the pickles and sauce and bun are still very nicely done, but you are a little more likely to think about it competing with Shake Shack.One other difference from Au Cheval is that you can't get an egg on your burger here.  I'm not sure they should keep "Cheval" in the name if they're not going to go around sticking eggs on things, but I guess frying eggs to order would destroy their ability to turn these things out at high speed.Bottom line: It's not going to replace Au Cheval in my life -- but I'm still glad it exists.

As a burger expert around the country I was really excited to come here. It's very basic I understand, but there are better places that you don't have to wait so long for or spend so much money that are better. I wouldn't come back and would say if you didn't make it you didn't miss anything. It's average at best, but pricey. Overrated. Now I can't say that worse than places like Five guys, they all kinda aren't great, but it's way more than Five guysI'd check our Redhot Ranch which isn't far from here if you want a no frills burger, no lines and better. It's like the In n Out of the midwest.And NO I don't have any affiliation, just helping folk out.

Best "fast food style" burger I've ever had in my entire life, hands down. There is definitely a difference between burgers like this (with small, thin patties) and big burger patties like Kuma's Corner. In terms of thin burger patties, this burger was amazing. It's the perfect blend of salt and seasonings. Five stars for the burger.The fries were OK - could be better. Nice to have fries with the burger, but not necessary and I would pass on the fries if you were on a budget. The shake was good too - but not any better than say Portillo's or any other fast food shake.Atmosphere was cool. Small little one room restaurant with a big table with open seating and then seats lining the walls. Didn't have trouble finding seating at 8 PM on a Friday night (though it was raining). There is a nice outdoor patio too. Parking in the area was fine (given the rain though).Price overall is expensive - $50 for two burgers, one fry, one shake, two cans of pop, and a beer. To be fair, the burgers are AMAZING. I ate mine in 1 minute or less and wanted another one immediately after I realized what I had done! I'm actually craving a burger now that I'm writing this review...

Shockingly, we did not order any food here because we were full from Big Star.  So we opted for one of their cocktails.  It was super sour and I didn't really enjoy it.  I would, however, come back here to try their burger and see how it compares to Au Cheval.  This place has a really cool outdoor area though!

It was just another day at work, and I needed adventure. Time for a lunch break. It was cold and windy, almost too cold for the walk I made to Small Cheval, but nothing prepared me for the shift between atmospheres once I walked in the door. Holiday season was full throttle, drinks were being had, and connections were being made. It was the older clientele that threw me off. No one in here seemed unattractive to me, but then again, Parallel Lines by Junior Boys was pumping through their sound system. A song I hadn't heard since my apartment was robbed, and all my music was taken away. Even the staff seemed sexual.As the track switched to Feel it All Around, by Washed Out, I knew I was right. This place not only cranks out excellent cheeseburgers, they are sexual cheeseburgers. I'm not gonna lie, I was a little intimidated about not knowing what I was getting myself into. I stepped up to the counter and the man at the register already had that look on his face that said, "We only like customers who know what they want." I didn't know what I wanted. I had never been here before, and I tried to put on my best face that said, "Be patient with me. It's my first time." It felt like they were about to rob me of the last piece of innocence I had. Once I had that burger in my mouth, I enjoyed every minute of it.They made me wait. While I waited, I felt my anticipation grow. Or was it my anxiety picking up being surrounded in such a small space by sexual holiday foodies? I couldn't tell. My emotions were all over the place. I finally found my second wind of confidence and began to look around the restaurant. Along with the Richard Geres (circa early '90s) in puffy Columbia Jackets (ribbed for your pleasure), I began to relax as I noticed maybe 2 other normal people, being painfully normal. A young couple, oblivious to their surroundings, trapped in their bubble of heteronormative lifestyle. They stood out like a sore thumb. I began to wonder if this entire experience was all in my head like a David Lynch film.There was a host, more like a Maitre d, who managed to make eye contact with me. I had forgotten about the vibrator in my had, which would signal that my order was up. He assured me everything would be fine. The wait would not be much longer, and my food would be everything I needed it to be. I'm glad I ordered my food to go. As soon as i got my burger, I ran. More like a brisk walk. I knew that burger needed a minute to cool down to a temperature that would allow me to swallow without burning my throat. I was breathing heavy, and for the first time, I exhaled as I charged through the doors of my work and into the break room. For a moment, I was alone, and I undressed, I mean unwrapped, that burger slowly.Then I showed that burger who's boss, sinking my teeth in like Lorena Bobbitt. Alas, I was in love, and she was beautiful. Pink on the inside. Moist. Medium, just like the man at the register told me it would be. My entire daydream faded as quickly as the onset. "WHERE DID YOU GET THAT?" It felt so confrontational. I was guilty. I stumbled over my words. It didn't take long to pull my coworker into my world. She didn't need to touch or taste in order to tell I was having a love affair with a burger. She only needed her sense of smell and the visual of the melting cheese and immediately knew what was going on. Finally, she left me alone so I could finish.

Lovely, subdued décor, both inside and out; the perfect place to sit out on the patio in the narrow window between summer and fall and enjoy a delicious cheeseburger, some super tasty crispy fries, and a reeeeaaaally delectable chocolate shake. Also, there's garlic aioli by the pump. Amazing! This is a classy joint. Highly recommended.

I haven't been to Au Cheval yet. It's on my list but that wait time is cray. Anyways, stopped here after 606 trail walk and the ambiance is great for the summer. The patio is pretty awesome. The burger is simple and smaller than what you usually find at bar/grills in terms of patty size which is PERFECT for me. I hate fat patties. Why even have a burger. Just eat the slab of meat since you can't taste anything else anyways. I digress.These are basic ingredient burgers but everything tastes very good together. The cheese is gooey, the pickle is refreshing, the dijonaisse is unique. I really enjoyed their fries and the ketchup and garlic aioli they have. I don't give it 5 stars because I personally love creative burgers with different combinations of ingredients but overall I did really enjoy the meal and the service.

the menu is basic... burger, cheeseburger, add bacon? that's all you need because it was yum. of course i had the works with cheese and bacon. why not? i knew it wasn't going to be like au cheval but i was still sad that i couldn't add an egg on top. all good though... it was delicious! i was slightly, maybe a tad "under the weather" when i dined here so i couldn't partake in the libations.... beer, cocktails, SHOTS! next time, next time. they also have milkshakes that i'd like to try.the star knock off was because of the fries. It was just too much to handle... I got tired of wiping down each one before taking a bite. they were waaaaay over seasoned and salty.

Outdoor seating. Burger looked delicious. Fries were great. Open late. Couple of things dropped ratings..1) Rats. We definitely saw at least one rat. It was running around behind the potted plants within the patio area. It destroyed any appetite we previously had. This brings my review to 3.5-stars.2) Attitude. When I got up to the counter to order a drink, I ordered a straight vodka, which they don't carry (?). So I asked how big the house drinks were. The guy explained it was "a 5 oz pour." Cool man.. I don't really know how much that is (I don't think the average person has a really good sense of how much that is..). So I ask how much that fills in the cup - he got flustered and shrugged - which did not help me answer the question. To be fair, he didn't raise his voice or anything, but I was out with a friend and it was embarrassing for me to ask to begin with. So it only drops the review by half-star. This brings my review to 3-stars.So bottom-line, last night I had a 3-star experience. Would've probably been 5-stars on a different night. I'll probably try it again - and when I do I'll certainly update my review.
mmmm nothing like 11am burgers and beer after a long weekend of pizza and beer visiting chicago :)

Ok so they are different from the OG on Randolph, but different good.Simple menu. Happy service.Get the burger with everything.Get the fries to share with yourself.Stock up on waters and condiments at the self service station.Joy buzzer pocket toys to remind you to come to the counter for your noms.Shots.Beers.More ShotsMore Beers.Go uber home.You've been here for HOURS!

It was really good burger and we will come back but it wasn't the best burger. Me and my date git the cheeseburger and his was without onions but in the end both of ours came out without onions. The place was back for Saturday lunch, but it's a quick meal so people come and go pretty quick. There are outdoor seating too and the seating inside gave a friendly/family style vibe with a a big table in the middle. Don't get me wrong it's a good burger but it was a little too salty for both of us. I haven't been to au cheval but this was a good start. It was about 10 dollars per person with a small menu, don't let the small menu fool you, the bacon is thick, the buns a buttery and toasted and the garlic Aoli was amazing. So I would recommend it.

This is my most favourite burger.Here's why:- it's perfectly cooked, with the teensiest of pink remaining- the buns are not an afterthought: they complement the burger and toppings, and don't collapse. Also: are they glazed with butter? I don't know if I want to know the answer to this question, but also: YUM- get it 'house style' with pickles et al. Trust. Just do it.There are three options: hamburger, cheeseburger, bacon cheeseburger. Not to get all Goldilocks-y but I think the hamburger benefits from the cheese, the bacon is gilding the lily too much and so: the cheeseburger reigns supreme here.The fries are an afterthought in this review (DEM BURGS THO) but really aren't second fiddle at Small Cheval: they are deliciously crisp, perfectly seasoned, skin-on taters. You should go for 'em.Bonus points: unlimited access to garlic aioli. This ain't no ketchup-mustard-mayo only joint.Watch-out: no options beyond fries for vegetarians.Yelp note: COCKTAILS ON TAP, whatddup old fashioneds (and other delicious concoctions!).

Yasssss! Why had I not come here sooner. Burger meat is just like Au Cheval's. Comes with Dijonnaise, pickles, and onions. You have to pay extra for bacon. Lettuce and tomato are complimentary if you choose to add it on. Very simple menu. Fries are ON POINT. Perfection. Thick, but not too thick. Every surface area of each fry was crispy. Love that they let you get condiments, including garlic aioli, yourself. It's an order, get a buzzer, and pick up your order kinda place. It is a little pricier than other "casual" burger joints, but you do get an amazing burger. There is a little bar with beer options. Friendly staff. One point off for no egg as an add-on option.Btw, their bathroom soap smells really good. LOL

Small Cheval is a pretty darn good burger joint. This younger sister restaurant to Au Cheval is a no-frills, pared-down sibling to its more elaborate predecessor. Only serving burgers, fries, shakes, and boozy adult beverages at a marginally smaller size, but doing it oh-so-well.Went here around noon on Sunday for brunch. And just a word of advice: please if you wake up early enough, get there before 12:30 pm, because this small place fills up pretty rapidly. We had new patrons hovering and hawking our corner spot like a predatory bird waiting for mice, prior to leaving. Yikes!I got the cheeseburger, and my S.O. got the cheeseburger + bacon, tomato, and lettuce for $2 extra. We shared an order of Golden Fries and had two hair o' the dog as well. The cheeseburger at its base had two perfectly griddled beef patties cooked to Medium (my favorite cook for burgers/arguably the best! Thanks, Small Cheval!), a quick smear of dijoinaise, a smattering of minced red onions, a handful of tangy pickles, and melty, gooey American cheese. As for the double-fried Golden Fries, they were so mouth-shattering good. Like as soon as you bite into it, a nice crispy crunch would yield. A pitch-perfect amount of salt on it, too. Reminded me so much of Hot Doug's duck fat fries. R.I.P. Hot Doug's  :-(My only -- and I mean only complaint -- is that their use of the all-natural Sir Kensington's ketchup for their fries was just a touch too grainy and reminded me of flavored tomato paste. Sorry, y'all !!! But I am firmly a Heinz ketchup type of gal.Revision: There was a Heinz ketchup dispenser! It was just less vivid and appealing than the bright red Sir Kensingon's ketchup dispenser. Ooops! My bad! :/

If I'm comparing Small Cheval with all the similar burger options out there, I'd have to say that it's okay. Don't get me wrong, a solid burger option for sure, but nothing out of the ordinary.What I like:- If you just want a less sophisticated version of the Au Cheval special, you can get that burger with a lot less fuss! (Maybe minus some of the fancier ingredients like the egg, but I can't remember)- I also like the casual, communal vibe of Small Cheval- It's in Wicker Park, so duh, I like thatOn the other hand:- If you want anything other than beer, burger and fries, you're pretty much out of luckOverall, I think Au Cheval is okay and likewise, Small Cheval is too. If you're in the area and looking for a good, classic burger in a laid back atmosphere, this is your place!

Dear Small Cheval,Thank you for being you. Don't ever change.Love Always,LauraI LOVE small cheval, would it be fair to say one of the highlights of moving to Bucktown was this fine establishment. I've never had Au Cheval, but those who have, have said they're almost the same (about 90%) there, I like those odds. The burger is juicy and delicious, and the French fries!? I also love the selection of dipping sauces, because what would a great burger place be without a million and 1 dipping sauces.Warning: it's small and has communal seating, so it's best to go during "off times." Also typically tough for a big group, but nevertheless worth your while.

I wouldn't go as far as to say that these guys make a bad cheeseburger, it's not like they're serving rancid meat, but the quality of this burger is definitely not on par with the price tag and the wait.The bun is fresh, the beef patties have a good melt-in-your-mouth texture, but the flavor profile is that of a typical fast-food burger.  All I could taste when I took a bite was salt, salt, salt and Dijon mustard.  There is zero beef or cheese flavor at all.   The cheese they use is cheap; it's got a great gooey melted texture, but it brings absolutely no flavor to the table.  I give them credit for blending their own homemade sauces and condiments but that's about where the compliments stop.The bottom line is that if I'm going to pay $10 for a burger I expect much more in the flavor department.  I think this burger is overrated and overpriced and I'd take a Shake Shack or 5Guys burger any day over this place.

This joint has a very simple food menu (and a rather extensive drink menu).   They make a mean burger and you can definitely tell the difference between a fresh cut potato fry vs. packaged fry (full transparency:  I am not a huge fan of the fry category so I am probably not the best judge of quality).   Chocolate shake was an excellent pairing to the burger.   They have a nice tap list of all of Chicago / regional greatest craft beer hits.  Atmosphere is clean and simple.   Staff is professional.Couple drawbacks to the place:1) A little bit pricey for what you get.2) Music is playing quite loud.Overall, definitely worth checking this place out if you are in the mood for a good burger.

Yummy.  If you don't know already, they have a very short menu: burger or cheeseburger (with an option to add bacon) and fries.  They have a few drinks, including beers (and a cider), a few cocktails and milkshakes.The burger is darn tasty.  It has two beef patties, delicious cheese, the dijonnaise, pickles and some onions. The burger is so juicy and the bun can stand up to it. The bacon is thinner than the original and provides more of a crunch and texture to the burger. The fries are also good and easily shareable. They were crispy but yet soft inside and you got to taste the potato. Of course, they have the famous garli aioli for dipping. If you want to experiment, there are also other sauces available too.Small Cheval is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat without the notorious 2 hour waits Au Cheval is now has.  So far, the most I've had to wait is about 10 minutes and got a seat by the time food was ready.  It is also a completely different experience with communal tables and has more of an "in and out" than "stay and hang out" vibe.  I definitely can't wait until it is nice enough to check out the patio. The staff are helpful and friendly.Make no mistake: this is not the original Au Cheval burger and if you are looking for that, you might be disappointed.  However, there are similarities and overall, it is still a very, very good burger.  In fact, my husband prefers the small cheval burger. While the original still reigns #1 in my book, small cheval is at the top of a short list. Plus, I can get small cheval without the wait and hassle which is very good considering now I really want another.

If you come here expecting an exact replica of an Au Cheval burger, you might leave disappointed. But if you can appreciate a solid burger and fries with a shot of whiskey on the side, then come on down. After reading about Small Cheval taking over Roxie's old spot, I definitely wanted to see how it stacked up with the real deal. It seemed like a good enough idea, giving burger lovers a chance to get a piece of the Au Cheval menu without having to endure that absurd wait.We got there around 7 on a Friday night and there was a line out the door. It looked intimidating at first, but the wait wasn't actually too terrible. We were inside within 10 minutes, then another 10 minutes in the line inside before we ordered. We probably waited a half hour between when we got there and when our food was ready.Ambiance:The inside is pretty much identical to Roxie's. It was small and had a real casual atmosphere. It's the same drill too: order at the counter and just wait for your order to be called. There were a couple tables inside and a pretty large patio outside with plenty of seating, which is a huge plus over the cramped inside of Au Cheval. You could actually come with a group larger than 4 for once.Food:The menu is pretty simple. Hamburger or cheeseburger with the option to add bacon, then the only side is fries. Like Au Cheval the burgers automatically come with two patties. It's impossible to not compare the burger to Au Cheval's, so I'd have to describe Small's burger as a slightly toned down, faster food version of Au Cheval's. I thought the actual burger patties were pretty much the same. Just as juicy, and just as delicious. The bun was also really similar, with a really nice toasted outer layer but still a soft pillowy center.The major differences come with the add-ons. The most obvious is the bacon. The bacon on Small Cheval's burger is definitely thinner and just slightly better than what you would find on any other fast food burger. It was still tasty and flavorful (I mean how could bacon NOT taste great??) but it was just missing that awesome sweet and peppery glaze on the outside and that thickness that made it a major component of the burger rather than just a topping. The second major difference is there's no option to add an egg. I'd throw eggs on everything if I could, so this was kind of disappointing. I wanted that golden stream of egg yolk running down the sides to make every bite that much heartier.The fries that came with the burger were great. They were definitely thinner, but they were super crispy and salted well. I'd say the biggest upgrade at Small Cheval over Au Cheval is the self-serve sauce station. Giving me the freedom to take as much garlic ailoi I want is a very dangerous thing. I ate disgusting amounts of aioli that night. The garlic flavor was very potent and overall it was just amazingly rich and creamy. I slathered it all over the buns, I dumped some between the meat patties, and of course every bite of a fry was naked without a trip to the aioli cup.Overall, I enjoyed the burger at Small Cheval. It doesn't match the greatness of the almighty Au Cheval burger, but it's pretty tasty in its own right. A cheeseburger with bacon and fries would run you about $15, which is a little on the steep end, but still only a little more than something like Five Guys, and it tastes much better. It's not a bad option to get a quick bite. Now if they only added the bologna sandwich to the menu, then I'd be here everyday.

If you like grilled meat with toppings and bread on either side, you will like this.Double-decker hamburgers and cheeseburgers built with thin patties that remain juicy but not dripping. First bite was an absolute rush of flavor that overwhelmed the senses.Fresh cut golden fries are pretty good and serve as a nice delivery vehicle for garlic aioli, mayo and gourmet or regular ketchup.Austere decor is a bit divey but cozy. Their website shows several sit down tables but when we went there was one community table in the middle of the room with bar style seating around the perimeter.

Excellent burgers and fries - the best I've had in Chicago. The drinks were canned, which doesn't make sense to me - I prefer fountain sodas.If you're in the mood for a good simple burger and perfectly cooked fries, you should definitely stop by.Not a fan of the name though - Not sure why anyone would name a burger restaurant "Small Horse" makes me think of horse burgers...
everything has already been said. it's awesome. it's expensive - but awesome.fries all day, garlic aioli, and cheeseburger with bacon.

Nice outdoor pub garden. Due to its close proximity to the "Blue Line" hopefully the music is at least as loud outside as it is inside.The vanilla shake was good.  I'll try the cheeseburger again when I'm in the area and I'm craving a burger but, this is not a destination site. The flavor and size of the cheeseburger with bacon don't live up to its price. At twelve dollars, I shouldn't have to open my cheeseburger to make sure they didn't forget the bacon.
