No lettuce and tomato in this cheeseburger. Not an option on the menu either. Maybe it was on a secret menu. Anyway, a nice juicy slice of tomato would have improved this cheeseburger as it was a bit dry and tolerably salty. Next time I'll add some of that garlic aioli and see if it tastes better. Hopefully it won't make it saltier. That would suck.The music inside was good. Maybe if I ate inside instead of having it to go I would feel better about the value. Nah, I'm there for the food.  If the burger sucks who cares if the music is any good. A good example of this is Burger Belly (previously Lead Belly).For those of you that rated this burger five stars and said it was the best burger you've ever had, please get out and try more burger places. I'm not cutting you guys down but, if you love these, there are burgers out there that blow these away. Burger Belly is not one of them. Now get out there and continue your quest for the end all be all of burgers, I did.Finally, if your wondering why I keep picking on Burger Belly.  It's because they recently burned me for the second time. I don't believe in third chances. Unless it's my wife. She can have all the chances she needs. Unless she cheats on me. In that case, all bets are off and I'll eat her liver with some fava beans and a nice Chianti. :)

Smallllll cheval. When I first hear about this I was so excited I put it down in my calendar. I wanted to go opening day. I'm glad I didn't. I heard they ran out of burgers by 4 PM. Not surprising. I was able to go the following day. I kept wondering how the line would be. It ended up taking 30 minutes to get to the cashier on a Sunday afternoon. It was lolla weekend so perhaps there were less people there than usually. I thought, 30 minutes is nothing compared to going to Au Cheval, where the wears vary between 2 to 6 hours. It's absurd. Chicagoans should have an express like for Au Cheval. I mean, WE LIVE HERE.  I just assume plenty of tourist go there because they have heard all the amazing things about it.Anyway, this location only has burgers and cheese burgers (and fries+beverages). I like that. It keeps it quick and to the point. BUT NO FRIED EGG??? So sad when I saw that. I adoreeeeeee the fried Egg on my burger. It really takes it to the next level. Also not that I order four patties on a burger but I don't think you can do this here. But then again I don't know, it's no on the menu.I do like this location because it is a quick fix for a delicious burger. I mean one of the best in the city  my only issue is that the menu is so limited which has its ups and downs.  I love Au Cheval becAuse of everything else there. Not just the burger. The bone marrow is amazing at Au Cheval and I've heard good things about their matzo ball soup. So is this place awesome? Yes. But you're getting the burger. And youre still waiting. Haha.

I've heard good things about small cheval!  If my sister, who is not a big burger person, said their burgers are good then you know they're good!!Even though its so simple, the ingredients are so fresh and everything just works so well together! The burger patties are thin so there are two patties and the cheese is delicious and if you get bacon, its a THICK, perfect slice of bacon.I can't wait to bring my boyfriend here and go HAM! I'm also pretty pumped for their outdoor patio!

Au Cheval's younger hipster sibling has opened appropriately in Bucktown/Wicker Park. We came a little before 6pm on Friday and there were a handful of people ahead of us in line. The layout and ordering is the same as Roxie's - order at the counter and wait for your number to be called. Took about 10 minutes for us to get our order, total we were in and out in a little over 30 minutes - beats waiting two hours at Au Cheval.The cheeseburger is mostly the same here (and a dollar cheaper?!) -- similar if not same bun, similar if not same Sysco patties (a "double" is still 3 patties), same Kraft cheese, same pickles, same aioli, and same chopped onions. The bigger differences are in the additions: 1) you can order tomato and lettuce 2) no fried eggs here and 3) probably the most glaring difference is that the bacon is different. I know those who swear it's the bacon that makes the burger at Au Cheval. That peppery, maple glazed thick piece of pork belly. The bacon at Small Cheval is smaller, thinner, less maple-y, and not peppery at all. It's pretty much thicker cut bacon that you'd get on a typical burger with bacon. Sadsies.The fries are supposed to be the same as well, but they were kind sogsville when I got them. They still tasted great, just not as crispy as I remember. Hopefully it's just those first-day jitters and it'll get better.Another difference is they have milkshakes - chocolate and vanilla. I ordered chocolate but they gave me vanilla and I was too lazy to get back into the ever-growing line. The vanilla shake is made with real vanilla beans as shown by the black flecks swimming through my shake. While great in flavor, the shake itself turned soupy really quickly -- not the texture I'm looking for in a shake. Shakes need to be in that limbo between frozen popsicle and melted ice cream. Again, hoping this will get better. Milkshakes are new-ish territory for Sodikoff around here, no?The bonus on Fridays and Saturdays is that the Doughnut Vault truck parks itself outside. As if you haven't consumed enough calories, the truck tempts you with the thought of doughnuts on your way out.Also, outdoor patio has lots of seating. The Adirondack chairs are not ideal for consuming burgers, but rather for the after-effects of needing to lay back and enjoying your beer, or undoing that top button of your pants.All-in-all, I'm still ecstatic that I can walk down the street and get some version of the Au Cheval burger. I heard this might just be a temporary summer thing and Roxie's is supposed to be back in the winter. Sorry Roxie's, I think I'd prefer Small Cheval to stay forever. EDIT: Small Cheval is here to stay, yay!

Great concept!I went the other day, no line, fast service and great food. They had drinks on tap, great milk shakes and great beers too.Yes, it's not quite the same as it's brother store (Au Cheval) but it's still an amazing burger. I think, if I can guess, the buns and meat seasonings are different. Either way, can't wait to come back!!

Last time I went, Au Cheval was an hour wait so being able to walk in Small Cheval and get my food within 10 minutes was awesome!  My cheeseburger and fries came to just under $15, which isn't much cheaper, but the speed and convenience is great.  Although not quite the same, the burger is very juicy and tasty.I had every intention of sharing my fries, but that didn't happen.  Initially, I wasn't sure if I liked them as they were very well done, but they have a great crunch and that definitely grew on me.  I'm convinced it's the chunks of sea salt that makes them super addicting.  My only warning is to watch how many times you come back!

There is nothing to dislike except all of the people who will crowd this place and create long lines for me.Came here on Friday the day before their official opening in an effort to beat the crowds. Thank God because when I walked by on Saturday at about 1pm there was a line, out the door, down the block. When I was walking my dog on Sunday, there were even more people waiting in line.The burgers are almost as good as the ones at Au Cheval and that is good enough for me. They are the perfect greasiness, flavor, and patty to topping ratio. The fries are good too and the pump-it-yourself garlic aioli is worth it. I had the peach gimlet (which isn't really a gimlet since it's made with vodka, but I digress) and it was good as well. All of the alcohols come out of a tap (efficient!). I loved the outdoor seating (which I never got to enjoy while it was Roxie's) and it is dog friendly. No waiter service. Just order, grab a seat, and wait for them to call your number.Can't wait to come back, but not too often because I don't want to die of a heart attack.Bonus: the Doughnut Vault van showed up on Friday night so we were able to add 4000 more calories to our day by purchasing their always incredible donuts.

We all want it to be as good as Au Cheval, and the burger doesn't quite reach that epic dream of ours, but it comes PRETTY DAMN CLOSE. And with some pretty sweet benefits: shorter wait time, ALL THE GARLIC AIOLI YOU WANT, no tipping counter service = cheaper burger, and getting a bomb ass burger away from the west loop. The fries are every bit as delicious as the ones at Au Cheval and the burger comes pretty close.The space could use a little sprucing - it literally looks like they just stockpiled all of their condiments throughout the restaurant on random shelves, put up a menu sign, painted a mural on the outside wall, put a table in the center and called it a day as far as the redecorating of the space goes. I think they knew the masses would come no matter what the space looked like, but hey, the space needs a little more love. Give it a little more love!

Just went to Small Cheval for lunch an hour ago. It was our second time here, and I just had to put in a five star review for this place! I am not a huge burger person, but after we came here two weeks ago, I really craved their cheeseburger this afternoon! I'm officially hooked on the Small Cheval burgers!Food:Their menu is super simple, which I love!- Hamburger- Cheeseburger- add bacon- Fries- Milkshakes- A limited barCheeseburger:I haven't had their hamburger but their cheeseburger is the way to go. It's double patties, and they melt the cheese all over the patty, and the buns are toasted on the grill. Their "house style" includes this dijyonnaise sauce with some red onions - I love it that way, I recommend it. I also dunk my burger in the special ketchup and it's amazing!Sauces:They also have two kinds of ketchup, garlic aioli, and mustard. I recommend the garlic aioli and the ketchup thats not the Heinz kind - taste more salty and less sweet compared to the heinz.French fries:They make the french fries out of fresh california potatoes. They are thicker cut and cooked just the right amount, not greasy, just crispy on the outside and moist in the inside. The Garlic Aioli tastes amazing with the french fries.Shakes:Recommend the vanilla - they use good quality ice cream, you can see the vanilla bean dots in the shake - super yummy! Comes piled with whipped cream. They also have chocolate for the chocolate lovers - but I haven't tried that myself.Atmosphere:Inside the restaurant is extremely small. The real deal is sitting outside in their patio. It's much bigger than it seems from across the street, lots of big wooden bench chairs to be used community/family style. It's a great atmosphere, with nice lights and lots of people hanging out. It's very child friendly too - see a lot of people with baby carts as they can just put it next to the table.

So I have to preface that my updated 1 star addition is not based on me eating here. Part of the downfall with my visit were the cold fries. The manager here on Yelp was very attentive and responded that the issue will be fixed as they were getting a new fryer. I have yet to try the  promised hot fries, but I figure since it's been months, I have to at least reflect the attempt of rectification/manager's awesome customer care.

3.5 stars based on food alone but bumping up to 4 stars because I like the simplistic concept of the restaurant itself.The burger was definitely solid but I wish there was a little something extra in terms of flavor, either directly in the meat patties or with some sort of sauce. I say this only as someone from LA who holds In N Out burgers in the highest regard. Cheese was delicious and the bun was good too, although I would have preferred a little extra crispness on the inside of the bun.The fries here are spectacular. I just wish the kitchen had made them ready at the same time as the burger because I had to wait like ten minutes after my burger was ready to actually get my fries. Considering they only make two things here, burgers and fries, the timing on this really should not have been an issue. The place was not super crowded at the time, but I'll give them a pass on this, maybe they were down a fryer or something, who knows.The vanilla shake was tasty and I was delighted by the option to add baileys to it to make it an adult shake. Every place should do this.All in all, this is a good choice when you just want to sit down and enjoy the basics of a good burger, fries and drink without any fuss.

#300, and for a very particular reason.the experience here is vastly different from au cheval, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. it truly feels like you're hanging with the hip, younger sibling (and i love being that sibling myself). i appreciate the minimal, down-to-the-point menu, and the food is excellent.but the *real* reason why i decided this deserved the big three-zero-zero?because. if you only get ONE thing here, it *~has~* to be a chocolate fernet milkshake. TRUST ME.i'll be waiting for those words of affirmation.

After having one of the best burgers ever at Au Cheval last summer, I have been waiting to go again. Problem is Au Cheval is downtown, parking sucks, theres long lines, and its just not convenient. Then I heard theres another option right here in wicker park, done. The place is a little red hut, hard to miss. The inside is just as small. The menu is clear and simple. They have liq and beer in there. The burger is not as good as AU, but with all things considered, its a pretty damn good burger.

You get the quality and taste of the famed Au Cheval burger without a 2 hour wait.Line moves quickly and food is served even quicker because there's only a couple items on the menu. When there's no outside seating (closed during Winter), the interior seating can be a bit odd: bar seating along 2 walls and a huge center table that occupies 75% of the floor space, but wastes about 25% of it. But, you can overlook that for a Top 3 burger in Chicago.

First time eating here read so much good reviews about small cheval.Well after finally trying the cheeseburger here I was very disappointed.It's an ok burger average at best.Price wise no surprise  a decent cheeseburger with fries and drink will cost you $20 at any high end burger restaurant.The chocolate shake was good though.

"Mmmmm, this is a tasty burger!" Jules Winnfield, Pulp Fiction.I can leave my review at just that.  Because really, if the burger can't stand alone, it's not worth a visit.  But I can talk a lot if you give me the space, so here I am, taking up the space.The Cheeseburger cooked to medium (you all should know by now that the regular cheeseburger is really two patties) is super flavorful, with just enough grease to make it indulgent. That's why I ask for lettuce and tomato so at least I get some veggies in.You can ask for a single patty cheeseburger too, but why do that, unless you're ordering for your kid...and take it from my 4 year old, he loves their cheeseburgers too.Their golden french fries are perfectly crispy and are a great vehicle for the garlic aioli...which is self-serve pump by the way, get some for the burger or your fries or both.  Trust.My husband likes the house grainy mustard (also self-serve pump), it can add a vinegary element to your burger/fries and quite good too.What else can round out a burger and fries but a milk shake, or better yet a boozy milk shake.   I have yet to try a boozy shake, but tried the regular chocolate shake and that was good.  I do also love the craft cocktails here too.The patio is one of my favorites for lunch in the summer.  The planted greenery make nice walls to block out Milwaukee Ave's traffic noise. And there's plenty of seating.Service is nice.  Super casual spot with elevated diner style burgers.  I've not been to Au Cheval yet.  When I vist I guess I can compare the burgers.  But really it doesn't matter, let's give a shout out to the little sibling. Small Cheval, you done good.

This place is ooey-gooey cheesy goodness! I love their burgers here, almost as much as the original!I came in with my boyfriend on a Friday evening at about 6PM, and the line was surprisingly short. We only waited about 10 minutes, and they've got it down pretty efficiently there with one person working the cash register while the other covers the drinks. I ordered an old fashioned (obviously) and this is by far the largest old fashioned I've been served in Chicago. They put it in a large plastic cup and fill that puppy all the way up. My boyfriend opted for a beer on tap, and we chose two cheeseburgers served with the standard toppings (lettuce, tomato, dijonaise, and pickles) along with an order of the golden fries.The food came out extremely fast, and we posted up at one of their bar seats with some of Sodikoff's amazing garlic aioli and Sir Kensington's Ketchup. The burgers were piping hot and have that traditional old-school burger taste. The pickles and the dijonaise were amazing, and even without the bacon, I couldn't ask for anymore from a burger. Fries are crispy and fresh and I'd definitely recommend only one order if you want anything else.Can't wait to come back, and next time, a milkshake will be in order!

All I can say after eating here is, wow! The burgers were cooked to perfection and the fries were fresh and crispy (not overdone).The wait however is another beast. Prepare to spend about 30 minutes or so in line and waiting for a seat. The seating arrangements are along the outside of the building and a community table plopped in the middle. When arriving, I didn't expect for that long of a wait, but I'm glad I waited!The service was good, even though you're waiting in almost a painfully long line, servers approach to take your drink order while you wait (huge plus). You just make sure to add it onto your bill at the counter.You MUST get the garlic aioli dipping sauce. I dipped my fries and burger in it. I honestly wanted to take some home with me. Absolutely delicious!!!!

Just like its big brother, Small Cheval has some of the best burgers I've ever had. When you walk in you are greeted with a rustic, bare-bones decor. And I love it-I would rather a restaurant focus on their food than their atmosphere. My opinion.The fries are the perfect amount of crispy and salty, and they are just as great dipped into the milkshakes (which are thick and rich) or their garlic aoli (a must try!).The burgers are worth the wait on the weekends when it gets busy. While you can only choose your standard hamburger/cheeseburger and there's not much to add besides bacon, they are juicy, flavorful, and incredible. They're usually medium rare and I usually prefer medium, but I can compromise for these babies.If you're in the area, swing by and get a burger and go have a picnic on the 606. These burgers are worth every penny.

Great place to grab a quick bite and eat on the go - that was our original intent; however, since the place was so open and not crowded (during the time we went at least) we ended up eating our meal there.Food:They have a short list of items on their menu. I had the cheeseburger and the golden fries - pretty good! They have a decent amount of sauces in a help-yourself type availability which was nice when deciding how we wanted our burger or fries to be enhanced. But let's be real now, their garlic aioli is the real deal - add some to your burger and have a dipping cup for your fries - boom!Seating:There is one large communal table in the middle of the room, and seats across the walls of the room. For some reason, it reminded me of those outdoor communal tables they have at those original hot dog joints, in a good way.Parking:There's meter parking around the restaurant. Tight streets.

My boyfriend and I were en route for empanadas, but we couldn't wait....so we stopped here. Patience is not a virtue when one is hangry.Anyway, it was just what we needed. I had a mouth full of protein earlier, but I needed more.I should have gotten lettuce and tomato on my burger, but there are lots of things I "should have" done in life.Overall, pretty good. I was happy.

Great burgers! The burgers here are mouth watering, melt in your mouth good. There's also a pretty decent group of beers on tap.It can be a bit hard to find a seat when it gets crowded and hard for larger group to sit together but the burgers are worth it.

We were 7 hungry and finicky ladies trying to find a place to have dinner that would make all of us happy.  The requests ranged from, "it must be affordable"  "it has to be quick", "It must be walkable", and "I'm tired of Mexican food!".  Ugh.  How was this Yelp Elite going to please everyone?  And just like that!  It was as if the stars aligned and the Yelp gods shone their light of grace on me and directed me to Small Cheval!  There was some hesitation about the menu, the heat and the distance from our airbnb.  But as soon as we walked up all the chatter stopped and Oohs and Ahhs began.  I heard praises like "Yay, a patio!"  "Pretty string lights" "SHOTS!!!"  One by one, each member of the gaggle ordered as they wished, they paid for it, collected their light up buzzer and made their way to the lively patio out back.Mere minutes later our table lit up with good news bearing buzzers and we loaded up on water, napkins and garlic aioli when inside.  We all DEVOURED our burgers and I personally snarfed the crispiest fries I've ever had  -- all of them btw.  Then washed it all down with Cheval punch that we were handed before we made it to the counter to order to sip and make the wait feel shorter - nice touch!The feel is super casual and fun, the service is happy and prices are affordable.  Most importantly, the food and drink was phenomenal!If you're in Wicker Park, this place is a MUST!

The highlights are pretty much the patio and the bun, as the burger was just average for me. The location is pretty cool - situated on a corner, with a simple & open interior and a secluded garden-style patio that is actually larger than the interior. But, this is a burger joint - so the food is what counts. While the burger was well cooked, especially for thin patties - it was entirely, entirely over seasoned. The overwhelming strong presence of salt was the primary flavor, which unfortunately didn't let the beef shine. I'm sad to say what I ate was essentially a nice & juicy cheesy salt-patty. The bun was by far my favorite part, and the savior of the experience. It would be a good sandwich to have for a late afternoon snack when you're having a late dinner - but double up on the water cups!The place was quick - both in paying and in preparing the food, and they had some good tunes playing while I waited. But, since the food was mediocre and, per other reviews here on Yelp, there is supposedly a better version of their food elsewhere, I would just recommend checking the original Au Cheval. Given the high praise for this concept, I'll have to reserve judgment until I conclude Chicagoans just don't know a good burger - but this was mostly a let-down, unless salty Shake Shack was the goal.

The next time that I have a craving for a great burger and shakes this is where I will be. This place is a bit different than your regular burger joint, when you first walk in their menu is all the way to the front by the register and there are only two food items (which of course narrows it down and makes it easy to pick). Right above it is their drink menu and if you happen to want an iced soda they will be sitting in a cooler(once again very different than any place I have visited). Food, food was great! The only cheese available for your burger will be sharp cheddar and if you do not like cheddar then I suggest you go elsewhere because what good is a burger with no cheese? They also have no alternative choice for the dijonnaise sauce they add to the burger but they do have garlic aioli which I added to my burger. The content of the burger was delicious. The burger was cooked to perfection and the ingredients are fresh and rich in flavor. They have an outside patio, where you can enjoy great food on a sunny day(inside seating is also available). Next time I am in a mood for a burger this is where I will come!

My favorite place when I just want a burger. This cheeseburger is my favorite. The flavors are perfect and the way it all just melts together is out of this world.This place gets tough criticism because of its older brother. I will agree with everyone else that it's just not the same as Au Cheval. However, to me this fixes the craving without the crazy wait...and it's designed as a quick order and eat place so they are just on totally different levels.When you arrive here you will just jump right in line to the counter where you'll place your order and be given a buzzer. The buzzer goes off when your food is ready :) It should be noted that they only offer hamburgers and cheeseburgers here, but I did hear the person in front of me ordering a "kids burger" so it sounds like they have a smaller portion for the little ones.This last Saturday when I visited, it was a little busy, so a server was walking through the line serving drinks if you wanted to order. This was awesome. What a nice touch. I ordered the Seattle Cider on draft and it was crisp and refreshing.Let's talk food. The cheeseburger. So good. This is definitely an eat it right then and there kind of burger. I can't imagine it would be as good as take out if you're going very far. The first time I visited here my cousin and I split a burger. This only lead to me wishing I had my own burger. You probably need your own burger at this place :) IMO it's dressed perfectly house style, but here you have more flexibility with toppings contrary to its big brother Au Cheval. The fries are also crispy, delicious and well priced. Only 2.95 for a side of fries and my fiancé and I always just split one order. I also love that the condiments are self serve here, hello garlic aioli!In my book Small Cheval is exactly what I've been looking for. Nothing complicated, just an amazing burger and fries.

Overrated and over-priced.Do not come here expecting a burger that will blow you away (which is what I expected given the name and price). Burger had no real flavor to it. Tasted like a fast food burger on a fancier bun. Also does not come included with lettuce or tomato.... for a burger joint that sells $10 cheeseburgers that seems pretty crazy. Paid $2 extra for bacon but could barely taste the flavor.The golden fries came in a generous portion, but they were hard as rocks. Garlic aioli sauce and house ketchup were the best food items.I will say that the large outdoor patio space with string lights and vibey music deserves 5 stars. Still, not worth it to come back and waste any more of my money.

If you come here expecting Au Cheval's quality, you will be disappointed. Prices are on par, but the bacon is not the same thick cut... Also, the fries were hard as a rock. Burger was delicious though.

Loved it.  Good beer selection too.  Simple menu; like "in and out."  Ive eaten at Au Cheval as well; best burger in Chicago.  Small Cheval is a great way to get that experience w/o the crazy wait.  Great sister company; great idea.

After debating for hours about whether to go to Au Cheval or Small Cheval (here after referred to as Regular and Small, respectively, as per our nickname for the places), my friend and I took the plunge and decided to try Small this past Friday. She was insistent on walking and avoiding public transportation (an abnormal New Yorker) and Small was only a 20 minute walk, whereas Regular was an hour and 20. Small won by a landslide (considering the 35 degree weather).The menu was horribly extensive (just kidding) - a whole 3 items to choose from. But really, those three (or for my needs, two) items on the menu are all you need - fill your stomach with an out of this world cheeseburger and an order of their delicious golden fries and you'll be thinking about this meal for days, as I've been doing. Another one of the best parts is the 5-part condiment line, including 2 different kind of ketchups, mustard, mayonnaise, and garlic aioli. Yes, that's right folks, UNLIMITED GARLIC AIOLI.My friend and I rated the cheeseburger an 8 - it was double-pattied juiciness, with a great dijonaise, pickles, and lettuce. It was probably the best burger I've had in a longggg time and definitely more than I expected from Regular's smaller sibling. To be honest, I would say that in some instances, this burger may actually be better than Regular's. Yup, that's right, I said it. Avoid the long lines and wait times at Regular and go to Small for a hella good burger.And even though we were so full and ate so much we felt like vomming, we took the plunge and got a milkshake as well. Chocolate? Vanilla? Hm, vanilla. No, chocolate. Most people have chocolate. But I usually like vanilla. The debates continued so my friend went ahead and asked someone who worked there what he would do, and he recommended chocolate, so we went for it. When it came out, he also brought us a complimentary vanilla milkshake, which was so nice of him. That milkshake was so good. Chocolate won. Small wins.

This is a Public Service AnnouncementWe all know the burgers are great and the fries are impeccable.But I want to point something out...I don't like their bacon.It's kinda chewy and tastes more like pepper than bacon.Next time I get the cheeseburger I'm gonna save my money and opt for no bacon.As you were

Best fried seafood in the City!  The jumbo shrimp are colossal.  Everything is fried perfectly so it is not greasy.  Super inexpensive.  The oysters are huge and delicious!Tonight it was meaty frog legs, huge scallops - amazing and, of course, clams!  This place is so inexpensive & fresh.  I have been eating here for 30 years & it's consistently EXCELLENT!!!

It pays to know the dope hood spot.A little off the beat and path in the heart of the greens (or what's left of it) is goose island. Some of the best fried seafood in the city. I tend to go with the jumbo shrimp. But I would stand by anything on this menu. Sometimes the best food comes out of a hole in the damn wall and that's essentially what's going down here. There is no where to sit. It's all to go. Just so you know.Goose island is the one.

The shrimp here was not up to my expectations as much as people inflate their food,The guy behind the counter was crass and rude the place is dingy and not the cleanliest would not suggest it to anyone, Frank's shrimp is far better.And is cash only which is another strike.

Cash only. carry out only (no dine in). All fried seafood.Their breading has a nice cornmeal crunch to it and it isn't too thick of a batter. Their jumbo shrimp is pretty jumbo. I think we got about 9 shrimp in the 1 pound jumbo bag. we also tried a half pound of fried oysters but this was passable as some bites were better than others. I'll probably return to try other items.

Hands down best shrimp and scallops in the city!!!! I've been going here for over 10 years. Memories having a bag of shrimp when I worked at the Mercantile stock exchange and late nights after clubbing at zentra and crowbar.  Talk about taking it back old school.
This is my favorite spot for fresh fried seafood. The Shrimp are my favorite, but the catfish and frog legs are good also. It's cash only & a good idea to call your order in.

I had been wanting to try this place for awhile and I finally did today. And I am so glad! I got the jumbo fried shrimp and it was so delicious. The breading was excellent! And the guys that work there were so friendly. I will definitely be back!
Best Fried Shrimp in Chicago!!! no sit down and no eat in and cash only!!

Today I decided to stop here as I haven't been in over a year or so. I was excited to get some jumbo shrimp. The place is as remembered and could stand for some remodeling. There business is still doing well as I could see ....so it wouldn't hurt to put some money back into the place. The gentlemen behind the counter was not rude but it appeared he rather be somewhere else. I ordered a pound of jumbo shrimp and 2 packs of the peanut butter cookies ( they stated they were the original lunch room cookies). I rushed back to my car and started to devour my purchase. The excited ending quickly. The shrimp were awful. I'm not sure if it was the lack of seasoning, dirty grease, or the fact they were over fried. Thinking about it, it may be a combination of all of the above. Either way this place has been aborted from my places to eat. Do yourself a favor and just go to Lawrence Fish and Shrimp.
The best shrimp I tasted in the Chicago area! I'm never disappointed when I come to Goose Island.

Stopped in here yesterday and got two 1/2  pound jumbo shrimp orders and fries. The guys were nice and even joked when I sat my bag on the counter saying 'nice! Is that a gift for me?' I told him if he could fit it he could have it we all laughed when he looked in the bag he made a concerned look. It Def couldn't fit him, lol. Anyway when I got home to eat, the food was a absolutely tasty. My mom used to bring us these shrimp home when I was a kid. Now that I'm older and have been on my own for quite some time I decided to make a visit to this place myself. Still delicious shrimp as they were when I were a child. I got my boyfriend who has been a die hard Lawrences customer to try them and his response was... "I won't be going to Lawrences anymore." This place is a winnnnnnnnnnnng!!!

Best shrimp in the city, hands down. Only real complaint is that the establishment is very small and accepts cash only! Other than that, it's better than all the other shrimp houses that I've eaten at.Also, open late!

Another old friend from Chicago that I drive in to visit, Goose Island has had several names and locations. But this place no matter what they call it or where it is is the real deal. Best fried shrimp, available in regular or jumbo, fried oysters, smelt, fish.  The place is a carry out only little dump. But don't let looks fool you. Every order is cooked to order. Served in a paper bag. Sauce , crackers pop are available. To there at the wrong time and you may have to wait 30 minutes for your order. But this place is worth the wait. Been eating here since I was a teen. So I'm a 50 year customer at this place. You won't go wrong here because everything is FRESH!
Wow this place is amazing all around my first time here an ill definitely be back shrimp are huge the only thing that i did not like is that they leave the tail on other then that really good
Better than the rest. Best shrimp in the world. Hands down. They only take cash. Hot sauce is fye. Call and order ahead. No sit down area.

My dad has been coming here since 1975 and they still taste like they used to after a long day of working in the factory. Huge shrimp in delicious hot sauce! If you're mad about the jk credit card thing, go to an atm!

Honestly, the best fried seafood in town! Regular or jumbo shrimp, scallops, & clam strips are all favorites. Fries for 70 cents? Count me in. The food's always hot, fresh, & CONSISTENT. Sadly they don't deliver & they're closed on Monday, but with everything they do right? I can't complain. They're worth the trip!
Smoke a dube and call for some shrimp.  Show up, eat the shrimp in your car, and be happy!  Cash only and its a shit hole.  The fried shrimp is bomb OTOH.
Been here once, the food compares to Captain B's in Cicero very much(possibly same owners)only exception is this place is a shit hole!
Been coming here for years. Place is a hole in the wall but the shrimp is amazing. Don't forget to grab the goose island sauce

Haven't been in a while, but it should be on your late night list. It's a hole in the wall, so have an open mind. If you don't appreciate such places, then don't go. If you do, don't have a dang attitude. Focus on the food, not the décor.

I mean it's kickass fried shrimp. Like really Fred. And the hot sauce isn't hot but more like a southwestern tangy deliciousness.It's in the middle of nowhere and there's no seating so take that for what it is. The wait is around 15 minutes but there's arcade games.I want to go back and eat the fish chips because everybody's doing it.

This place might not look like much but in this case looks are definitely deceiving. All in all everything I've ever ordered is always fresh and delicious. As a matter of fact they have the best damn frog legs this side of the Mississippi. I didmt like their hot sauce but other than that this place rocks. Guys behind the counter are good with the customers, get the order right, and get you out as quick as they can. I also have to say the quality of food for the price is amazing. There's no skimping here. Don't really care if its a cash only place. Maybe if you have to use your credit card you really can't afford it anyways. Bon Appetit

I heard a lot about this goose island, even seen it on TV as having some of the best shrimp in Chicago. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing (half pound of regular shrimp) because I wasn't impressed. The man that took my order wasn't friendly or pleasant at all. Pretty much had the "gimme your money take the food and get outta here" attitude. To be perfectly honest Bob's Shrimp in Hammond Indiana is better than this place hands down. Don't get me wrong the food wasn't bad and I'd go back for the prices but at days end the food is mediocre and the service is poor. Disappointing....

Literally the best seafood in Chicago. Way better than Lawrence's!I always get half pound of regular shrimp and two orders of clam strips with the hot sauce. Tastes super fresh. I've had a half order of jumbo shrimp and those things are huge. Some may say too big but I didn't mind it. You just need to be ready for how big these shrimps are or else you will be caught off guard lol.Cash only. No seating. Strictly coming for the food. And that's 100% fine with me.

Goose Island is going to that spot either you mess with it or you don't.  Its really no grey area.If you are a late night, food junkie that doesn't want to pay alot of money, Welcome to Goose Island.  Because their shrimp is great and they give you a lot for your money.  Its cash only but for 5-10 bucks (depending on the size of your order), you'll tons of great tasting shrimp in a paper bag and can be on your way.If you are the type who doesnt like hole in the wall spots and wants breadsticks with your shrimp, pass on Goose Island.  As I said before the shrimp is great but place is a true hole in the wall.Its Cash Only and no where to sit.   And its not an ATM near so keep that in mind when you stumble in there off a Friday night bender.  But if you just want good food, hit an ATM in route and go.
Come here late at night and get some cheap fried food.People seem to love or hate the breading.  I for one like it, but it's THICK!Do yourself a favor and try the frog legs.  Delicious.
Not a fan, the shrimp are fried to hard & it scratches the inside of my mouth. I am a shrimp lover.
I love Goose Island but I don't understand why is closed it's supposed to be open till 4 a.m.

Stick to the basics--fried shrimp, fries, soda.  All were great and all were cheap.  The catfish was cheap too, but it was so laden with chunky bone pieces (like, the size of a quarter or larger in some cases) that I would skip the catfish next time.  Called ahead and all was ready in 20 minutes...and, you can't beat the prices:  a pound of shrimp, a pound of catfish, two orders of fries and a soda was done for less than $20.  Very plain interior so no place to dine in.  Solid!

The best and biggest fried shrimp ever. I have gone here every Friday for lunch during Lent, and the shrimp are fresh and amazing. This is a carry out joint and it does not have an ambiance, just a counter where you order. I always order the jumbo shrimp with cocktail sauce. AMAZING.

The food here is good. The service staff is rude and the wait time is high. Especially if you go at night when most people crave seafood anyway. If its late forget about it, just go to white castle. There will be long lines. There have been times I wanted it so bad that I waited and there have been times the wait wasn't worth it and I just drove away. I tried to call in my order to avoid the line and they refused the call in. So I will rate this ok because I love the food but I am not a fan of the service.

This place has been around forever!I remember my aunt and uncles would always talk about coming here after being out partying on weekends. I remember being a teenager eating the leftover shrimp they could not eat and I enjoyed the hell out of it.I decided to stop by recently for nostalgia sake. I ordered 1/2lbs of jumbo shrimp. I always enjoy checking out old establishments that have signed pics of local and world celebrities. Shaq, Lisa Raye, local news reporters and countless others have donated their John Hancocks to the wall of fame here. My food didn't take very long to come out and I hopped in my car and drove home. I was excited to try the shrimp I hadn't eaten in almost 20 years. Once home I ripped the damn bag open and saw my big ass shrimp which caused the hunger to rise. There was too much breading on the shrimp which made it difficult to eat and it definitely affected the taste in a major way. Not as good as I remember it. The hot sauce definitely added flavor to the overly breaded shrimp and would probably be good on anything fried.People behind the counter are really cool. Parking here should be easy as there is street parking in front. The place is virtually in the middle of nowhere with nothing else to eat until you drive about a mile west on Division. I would definitely try the place again, but I prefer Lawrence Fisheries shrimp.
Love love their fries shrimp and fish chips.   Their seasonings are on point and the sauces to dip the seafood is super tasty

Goose Island Shrimp House Chicago, has been in the same location for well over two decades.  They have celebrity pictures on the wall.I've eaten at this restaurant for many, many years.  I usually buy the jumbo shrimp.  They are HUGE, and not over seasoned with salt, or breading.  The shrimp are de-vained and clean.  Prices are reasonable.  This is NOT a sit down fancy restaurant.  This restaurant is well worth the drive if you're craving big fresh jumbo shrimp.  The customer service is not so great, but the food is delicious!!!

Exactly what you think it is: a hole in the wall, cash only, and deep friend goodness. Pretty simple menu, pretty simple food. Staff is nice, food comes out pretty quick - the call in business seemed to be booming, and there were a lot of regulars in there as well.Breading seems to be cornmeal and is laid on nice and thick. Everything is breaded (tails included), and everything goes well with the sauces they hand out. It isn't your normal Chicago fast food place - definitely worth a trip.

Probably worth it for the experience alone. Come here after a long night, park outside, get your shrimp in a bag, then sit in your car and eat it while watching all sorts of characters do the exact same thing you just did.The shrimp is interesting. No one is lying here when they say they're huge! And the tails are still on, but breaded so easy to accidentally ingest. The breading is really thick but not particularly flavorful. Clam strips are the same thing... but clam strips. Fries were good in the way that only fries stuffed in paper bag can be, but they really need salt. It seems like a lot of people like the hot sauce, but I just thought it was ok.
If you haven't had it, your missing out the best fried shrimp. So good the line speak for it's self

All you need to know is after partying in the Clubs or a Bar, Goose Island is the Spot to Hit on the way Home. Never in my life have I tasted better Shrimp and yes that includes Lawrence's! The Clam strips are off the Hook as well and don't be shy to try their Frog Legs!! Seafood is more expensive regardless where you go so the prices shouldn't be a concern. You'll get Quality and Quantity! The Goose gets nothing less than 5 Stars!!

This place has...character and the very very very best jumbo fried shrimp on the planet.  They sell their own cocktail sauce,..,don't complain about the $1 charge just buy some as your taste buds will be happy.  The guy behind the counter is nice.  The crowd is diverse.  You can play classic Ms PacMan or pinball while you wait for your order so bring quarters.  Note that there are no tables.  This is a take out place.  If you are super hungry when you get your order you can stand and eat by a small ledge counter by the window.  Wish they were open 7 days a week yet happy they take time off for rest.  Yay!  A big time favorite.

So, the long and short of it is: I guess I don't like fried oysters. I mean, I used to. I lived in New Orleans and would eat them all of the time. Thing is, when I ate them, I don't recall space alien-green sh!t (literally) oozing out of them all the time. It's repulsive. Of all the things to willingly put into one's mouth, this has to go near the bottom.Yes, I'm a Protestant.But, seriously, my meal here might have been one of the most singularly unhealthy things I have ever eaten. I ordered a 1/2 scallop, 1/2 oyster and 1/2 shrimp meal with fries. The shrimp were very large, expertly breaded and incredibly satisfying. And, after observation, they were de-veined, which is points for me. The rating has much to do with the shrimp and I would probably come back here to eat them (or, eat someone else's). The sauce was a slight upgrade from the usual cocktail sauce and provided just the right coating for the sea roaches. The scallops, too, were quite large, nicely breaded and tasted great. If I had never seen what these ugly f*ckers look like in the wild, I would eat them again. But, I can't. They're disgusting. They have all these beady, googly eyes all over their shells... ugh, I am getting grossed out by even writing it. Tasted good -- but no more for me.The oysters were... hot. I took a bite a did the "Haa-haaa-haa" thing and waved at my mouth. Spitting the bivalve onto a piece of paper so as to stop the scalding, I looked into the abyss and came back a changed man. The oyster was full of green ick and it was nauseating. I put that one aside and cut into another. More ooze. I tried to pawn one off on my friend as an experiment. He cussed me out. I just couldn't do it. No amount of sauce, breading or hype could get me to eat those things. I tried to salvage the meal with the fries. They were eh. The heat from the sea food made 'em soggy (the order came in the same brown bag). The lack of over salting/seasoning kept them bland. I threw most away. But, in GISH's defense, I was sober throughout the experience.There's a reason this is drunk-food.

Ordered a pound of scallops and a half pound of friend oysters, both were warm fresh and delicious, couldn't eat there but yowza amazing flavor. I am in love with the fried scallops, melt in your mouth goodness and they're open till 5!? Winning!!

Was walking home on Division from Ashland and the only enticing eaterie that popped up on Yelp was this place. The only storefront as far as the eye could see, 9pm, in the middle of a dark street.. probably not a great place for a girl to go alone... but everyone (staff & patrons) was so nice!Got the catfish and fries.. excuse me it was only $4? I only got the 1/2 lb catfish but it was like 5 huge pieces. Catfish itself tasted pretty fresh and was yummy enough, but the breading was kinda flavorless and a bit too thick, and there were a couple pieces with lots of bones. I got the hot sauce which helped but wasn't a huge fan of that either. Fries could use seasoning.It was certainly not the greatest food but for the price and the hours it's open, can't be beat.
The most phenomenal shrimp of all time! I've been going since I was a kid and wont stop now.

I feel like I am the only one that thinks it is just "ok". I was so excited because it is a staple in Chicago. The shrimp have a lot of breading on them. My partner liked the fish chips. I honestly think Shrimp Express in Cal City is so much more fresh and does not have all the batter.

I wish it wasn't such pain in the a$$ to get to this place.  This small restaurant is located on division between 2 bridges and the traffic is almost unbearable.  Nevertheless, this is probably one of the best shrimp places I've ever had a pleasure to devour (trust me, I've been all over the world)I usually call ahead and order 1/2 to 3/4 lbs jumbo shrimp and 1/2 of catfish.  What makes it so good is the breading.  I don't know that the mixture is, but it's cripsy on the outside, and soft/moist/juicy on the inside.  I've never had a bad meal from this place, but only thing I've ordered are the shrimps and catfish.  I might order some fried oysters but after reading JT's review, it might not be a good idea.Hot damn man, their hot sauce is pretty good too!  I was pretty skeptical about hot sauce at a seafood joint since every hot sauce I've tried around chicago has been..... straight up garbage.In the end, this is probably my favorite place to get fried shrimp and catfish so far, I know few other places (lawrence fish market) I need to try but so far, this is it for me!  And parking ain't a problem either, it's in middle of industrial area so there are tons of free street parking.  But call ahead so you don't have to wait in line for too long.Peave out homie.Oh yeah.  CASH ONLY!  1 pinball machine and 1 arcade with pac-man and galaga installed.  You can play while you wait if you want to.
I have been coming here since I was a child and it had always tasted the same and been fresh and delicious! The shrimp and scallops are my fav's! Oh and it's cash only!

I got a pound of skrimps and clam strips. The shrimps tasted good, the breading was ok. I came here during lunch. The service was fast and they hooked it up with shrimp. I couldn't come close to finishing it. The hot sauce is on point, probably my favorite part.

Either you get it or you dontThis is a cash only hole in the wall, evidenced by signs that say 'cash only' and have pictures of credit cards with a red X through them.This place defines hole in the wall and defines the neighborhood before it was gentrified.Dont pass on the fish chips.  They are the best thing there.  Although a lot of my friends like the shrimp. I order a pound bag for $5 and that is a LOT of food.

Delish.  Love the Smelts with a little hot sauce mixed with the Cocktail sauce.If your looking for fine dining or a healthy salad, this is not the place.If your looking for a whole in the wall to pick up delicious fried Jumbo Shrimp or Smelts, this is the place.As others described, it's best to call the friendly staff to place your order ahead of time..
Love their scallops and their hot sauce. You can't beat them for what you get. Their freshness is the best on all they offer

So I had heard that this is the place to go for shrimp.  I was so excited to finally get the shrimp and catfish.  The shrimp were huge and it smelled great.  However, after the first bite I was very disappointed.  Everything tasted like it was fried in old grease.  It was a total waste of $25 for a pound and a half of Jumbo Shrimp and half pound of cat fish.  The cat fish had a lot of bones.  The breading was extra thick. I won't be going there again.  Lawrence's is much better.

Staff rude, loud music and loud talking coming from the kitchen. Ghetto joint!!!!No class whatsoever. I stopped by hear because of the rumor of their shrimp. These shrimp has to be on Steroids. I ordered a 1/2 pound and paid 6.00 bucks for 5 pawns!!
The best fry shrimp in Chicago,and at $9.00 a pound.I havebeen going to GOOSE for 40 years and Tony and the guys are the best.
I went here today i must say the jumbo shrimps are good but the have to much breading.also i tried the froglegs,in fish chips it all taste the same.

I heard great things about GISH and that the jumbo shrimp were delicious and the best in Chicago. So, I drove all the way from the Southside of Chicago and paid $69.72 for 3 lbs of shrimp, 1lb of catfish, 3 orders of lunchroom cookies, and 6 pops. Oh and 3 extra sauces!  If you enjoy jumbo heavy, heavy, cornmeal breading on your shrimp then you will love this place. I myself found the shrimp to be the nastiest shrimp I've ever eaten. The hot sauce is some kind of weird color that was unrecognizable, didn't even touch that. The only good thing I can report is the Sprite was delish.

Shrimp house is right down the road and from all the reviews we decided to give it a try for lunch. About 5 of us order about 5# shrimp, 1/2#oysters, clams, fries, almost everything. I think most of these 4-5 stars are just having a nostalgia moment. The food was OK at best, oysters were downright scary.Breading was thick but shrimp size was good, just not much flavor. Goose Island sauce is just cocktail sauce (over priced).Won't be back except maybe for the clam strips. They seemed to be breaded differently which makes me think right from the freezer into the fryer from Gordon's fisherman.

Fried shrimp. regular shrimp is perfect, they have jumbo too if you like it big. they have a bunch of other fried seafood but I have only gotten the shrimp (its their name after all...)i got 3 pounds and took it to a party and was mister popular. the sauces are all good, they have bottles of hot sauce for sale too, the guy at the counter suggested an awesome one.cash only. hole in the wall. take out only. call ahead. if you dont understand these things stay away and leave it for us who appreciate it.

The shrimp is the  star of this place  HUGE  tasty and filling .I love the ocean scallops personally which also are huge and wonderful and full of flavor .While i am not a fan of their sauce everything else I have ever purchased from this establishment seems to please my palate and doesn't kil my wallet and that important in my book .There is one problem parking and  navigating  the area but is definitely worth it once you get there .
Expensive and not very high quality. The counter people were very friendly, but way too much breading for my taste.

I pass the shrimp house 5 days a week and today was my first visit. I of course yelped ahead and read some reviews. Here's the nitty gritty:- CASH ONLY- take out only- call ahead (it gets busy in there)- decent prices- huge jumpo shrimp and great oysters!I called ahead to pick up my order in time for my boyfriends lunch break. The man who answered was very polite and friendly, which is unusual for phone orders, so I had a good vibe already! Everything was ready when I got there and I paid $23 for a pound of huge, delicious fried shrimp, a half pound of oysters, fries, 2 cans of pop, lemon juice, hot sauce, and their signature sauce. I have always gone to Lawrences on Lawrence, but now I think I found a more convenient, affordable and tasty new shrimp house!

Two words: JUMBO SHRIMP!  I absolutely love this place.  Just grab your food and go.  Call ahead though because most of the time, they take forever.  It's not really a place you want to hang out at and wait for your food.The Jumbo Shrimp is so good though.  i also tried the frog legs but they were nothing to write home about.  The canned pops are always ice cold too.  All you need is a half pound (or pound) of jumbo shrimp and a can of Root Beer.  :)

Some of the best fried shrimp I've ever had.  The Goose Island Sauce is a MUST. The hot sauce is also fantabulous.  You can call ahead, but if its late enough it only takes them about 10 minutes to throw your order together.  And don't worry, you won't get shot.  Well, most likely won't get shot.  Park right out in front, run inside, order your shrimp and enjoy.  I like the jumbo. The "pros" seem to order the regular.  I have yet to order the regular size. Jumbo are $12 a pound, regular are $8.50 a pound.  All I know is, when shrimp are so good that you are happy to eat the tail, then these are some damn good shrimp.  You will enjoy!
DELICIOUS, cheap seafood. I'd recommend to anyone. Call ahead, because it will take forever for your food.I love the clam strips.

((((day dreaming of Goose Island shrimp))))This is one of those Chicago staples.. nothing fancy abt this spot, it's somewhat in the hood, and you'lll prob run into some sketchy characters... keep your doors locked and windows rolled up when you go in.  I say this only b/c my dumb arse left my windows down one visit, and had anything in plain sight stolen out my car. it is what it is, and that is the price of amazing shrimp. Their sauce is what marries it all together- a bit tart and spicey.. mm, delicious. Crunchy and well seasoned..  you just have to order a lb of jumbo shrimp!!!

Want GOOD fried shrimp that is fresh, never frozen, cheap, and from a place that has been around for a few decades?!  Well I'm glad to let you know that Goose Island Shrimp House is THE destination for yourself.Don't be discouraged by the appearance of the outside or inside. Just a bare-bones white counter, non-flashy sign, easy to miss on Division Ave... but they will cook up the best tasty little shrimps your lil heart can handle. I recommend the super-spicy hot-sauce (it isn't that spicy, don't be a baby).Cheap, delicious, and I hope they will be around for another few decades!
Great Shrimp... Love it.Cheap...but good and fresh!

OK.. this will be quick.  The line was long  OK.  The shrimp were TERRIBLE!!  Shrimp are to be golden with a slight crunch, this was beyond crunchy to say the least, it was just plain HARD!  The crust or should I say batter was not up to my standards at all.  In fact anyone who thinks that these are good shrimp, well they have not gotten out much to eat.I expected more, from the reviews, but sometimes you cannot believe the hype!!

If you're not from the city manage your expectations here.  This is an inner city experience.  The cast of characters you'll encounter here will certainly be interesting and may be frightening.Cash only my friends.  Take out only.  Don't even think about eating in here.  No delivery.  Everything is fried and the breading is extra thick.  Some people think it's too thick.  The place is a dump but clean.  Its located in a scary lonely street at night but there are probably a couple of police officers inside getting a pound of jumbo to go.  A real bare bones place but the food is great.  If I'm not that hungry I get a order of fried clams, a bag of chips and a pop.  Otherwise I'm a pound of jumbo with two bags of chips and two pops.  Occasionally the frog legs.Here is how it goes at Goose.  Don't mess with the staff.  While you're still in your car get the money you expect to spend out and put it separately in your pocket.  When you pay you won't have to pull out your entire wallet or a wad of cash. Walk in.  Look at large menu above counter.  Smile for the ten security cameras. They've been robbed a couple of times.  When the guy looks at you tell him the main thing you want. e.g. Pound of jumbo.  Half pound of regular.  Two order of clams.  That's it.  Get it.  Small talk is unnecessary and unwanted.  Stand to the side and enjoy the show.  Usually a great people watching experience.  Now when they tell you your order is ready tell them what kind of pop you want and what kind of chips.  Tell them whether you want the hot or mild sauce.  It's included in the price but extra sauce costs extra.  Don't take too much time.  You should have decided what you wanted while you were waiting for your order.   The hot sauce is hot and the mild sauce is mild.  Don't ask about it.  I always get the Goose Island sauce.  Yeah it's extra but I like it.  Now reach into your pocket and only grab the money you put aside earlier.  Just pull out what you need.  Pay and get out.

Love the shrimp here and its a good price. There are a few other similar shrimp places that have the same taste but are a little higher. I can say I am not a fan of the sauce that comes with it and the Goose Island sauce is better but its a dollar for a small cup. You need at least 2 for a pound.Didnt like the fries either

I stoppped by here on my way to Fed Ex.  I must say it's a hole in the wall, but hey I got my food to go (and there's no seating so you can't eat there anyway).  The shrimp were fresh and hot, and I really savored the hot sauce.. The breading was bit thick, however, but I guess that's just their style.  I still liked it and am definitely coming back to try the fried scallops.  Oh and they have frog legs for you meat lovers.

Pardon my French, but what the f@ck???  And I say that in a good way.The other night after a lot of drinking, a few friends and I made a stop at the Goose Island Shrimp House.  We all waited in the car while one person ran in and 5 minutes later was back in the car with a bag full of deep fried goodies.The deep fried shrimp was as big as my head!  Ok, it really wasn't, but it was HUUUUGE!!  The deep fried oyster was even bigger!  This is drunk food on steroids!  Deep fried, artery clogging goodness.  At least the seafood part of it is healthy, right?

The best things on the menu are the regular shrimp and the scallops, make sure to ask for the scallops to be cooked dry so they aren't soggy.  And you've got to go for the hot sauce...it's the perfect marriage.  Always call ahead, waiting there can take forever when it's busy.

So, my husband got lucky..... I like good fried food over a fancy white table cloth place any day.SCALLOPS - don't need anything thing else.  YUM-O!  Honestly I was a lil upset the other stuff wasn't as great as I had pictured it be in my mind.BRING CASH - no credit.I also read other's complain about the staff - I thought they were really friendly and talkative, so 2 thumps up for service.A great Dive Place!
Flame biz, real Chicagoans know whats up, negative reviews on here are from lames that just moved here. Goose Island & Hagens is the best fried shrimp & scallops in town.

AMAZING.Wonderfully deep fried seafood in a questionably ghetto sketch area with friendly service.They're open till 5 am, and you can call ahead to order and pickup if you don't want to wait around inside.Jumbo Shrimp was humongous, albeit really really thick breading. The shrimp was still huge, but the breading makes me sated really quickly.My favorite is the fried scallops and clams. Nom nom. delish.The sauce is great, but I can't see how its amazing as people mention here. I've tasted sauce from a bottle just as tasty.Anyway, i almost don't want to write a review about it because I want it to be a secret. Haha.
Good and cheap ... take out only ... free street parking.
4* Jumbo Fried Shrimp2.5* Fried Mushrooms

My step-dad used to bring me here all the time and NEVER let me wait in the car alone lol he used to hide all his belongings in the car too, had me all sorts of paranoid, but who cares! For shrimp this crunchy, this fresh, and perfectly hot bright orange hot sauce in a brown paper bag I'll give my keys to the homeless valet guy...I dragged my health freak muscle headed boyfriend there yesterday and even the man who won't touch anything deep fried, let alone breaded couldn't resist eating a pound of the jumbo shrimp followed by the 3 regular shrimp I couldn't stuff in my face.The menu is in your face with huge letters so tell the man what you want, give him your cash (which you should already have ready), stick your hand in your pocket and grab your keys and get the hell out of there (after you grab your food of course)They have other delicious things like crab salad, macaroni salad, which are good, then they have frog legs and other misc foods, which I'm not brave enough to try...one day I'll grow a pair and go for it!!!! Buen provecho!!!

OVERRATED!I just returned from Chicago from being in SC for a week where I literally ate good seafood every day.   After checking out YELP for suggestions on good fried seafood,  I read the reviews about this place, realized that it was close and decided to take my chances.  *sigh*Must say, I was not impressed - not at all.   As a matter of fact, I was deeply disappointed.   I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp, Scallops, and Catfish.   Shrimp were large but the breading was toooooo thick and the shrimp were fried too hard. The scallops were ...BLAH... and so was the catfish.   I'm good with a whole in the wall every now and then, but Needless to say, I won't be returning.

Wonderfully ghetto. Friendly service. No frills.Awesome jumbo shrimp - very jumbo!The goose island sauce is delicious, though an extra $1 is sketchy.As an aside, the crazy upscale Calumet photo shop is just aronud the corner from there. Pick up your high end camera gear and stop by for a snack to take home.

I order the jumbo shrimp, they are nice sized but i wish there was just a little less breading on them. i like their shrimp better than lawrences the scallops are the bomb! perfect size taste and breading love love love them. i only really like tater sauce didnt use the sauce they gave me

G.I.S.H. is a unique Chicago experience, though not for the faint of heart. You gan get the regular shrimp or the JUMBO 6 count to the pound shrimp here. I know of no where  else that serves these jumbo monsters in the Chicago area. This is walk in; carry out only. No place to sit and eat. Parking on the street only. The place looks "grungy" but I have never heard anything about health problems with the food. The shrimp do tend to be "over breaded", and over cooked, for the most part, but the trick here is to ask for everything "LIGHTLY BREADED", and "LIGHTLY FRIED". You may have to wait a little longer, but it's worth it. I suggest bringing your own bottle of hot sauce or the like, and a salt shaker. I used to be able to take my bag of shrimp and walk up to "LIFE'S TOO SHORT" and eat them with a beer, but that place doesn't exist anymore. Another tragedy. So there it is. Follow my suggestions and you will have a great experience.
Food was ok. Nothing so good I'd go out if my way for and not so bad that I'd never go back again.
Love the Shrimp. Best afterhours meal hands down

These have to be the biggest Jumbo Shrimp I have ever seen or  ate! OMG! it is like eating a steak. I can only eat 2 of them. I have been stopping in at this place over the years when I am in Chicago and nothing has changed which is good but for newbies the experience could be good or bad. The atmosphere is get in and get out so call ahead. The place is not fancy but the Shrimp is good!. Now I am not a fan of their shrimp sauce because it is too tangy for me so I carry my own sauce with me if I want to tear right into the bag and start eating once I get in the car.

I was concerned coming upon the GISH when we saw a paramedic ambulance parked outside the front door. Maybe someone had keeled over due to the food. But no, inside the paramedic was just picking up lunch, whew.This is the kind of joint you walk into where you feel the atmosphere and decor must be inversely proportional to how great the food is going to be.You walk into a little room, and a bunch of people are standing around like it's the post office. Then the guy at the counter says 'NEXT'. You humbly walk up to the counter and order a mess of fried by the half pound, 3/4 lb, or pound. This may consist of shrimp, jumbo shrimp, frog legs, fish chips, oysters, etc. Anything you can fry basically.I wasn't really that hungry so I just got a half lb of reg shrimp. It was really good stuff, so much so that I can't wait to go back and try some more.I was expecting it to be a little cheaper than it was given the area and the fact that not much money is going towards interior design. Though they do have an old Centipede arcade game and a rather new looking Batman pinball machine.$4.25 for the half pound of reg shrimp, not bad but not great. Next time I will pony up for the jumbo shrimp and maybe some frog legs.Also, this place is apparently open till 5am which seems crazy to me.

Goose Island Shrimp is affordable, fast, and arrives in brown paper bags with their very own recipe called Goose Sauce, which is your cocktail sauce. It has a bit more horseradish which I liked a lot.The actual shrimp are larger than described, and in a half inch thick cracker breaded crust. Very crunchy, and very unique. \I just, like mine from Michigan with beer batter. I really enjoyed the spicy horseradish sauce though, it seemed like fresh radishes were used.Carryout only.

The Jumbo Shrimp is the bizness!!! I loved the food. Where else in Chicago can you still get a can of pop for 65 cents? At least around the Northside? They were friendly and the food was hot and delish! Definitely will be going back! I have read some reviews on here about the place being "ghetto" All in all it is a shrimp and fish shack!!! This is not some 5 star restaurant, it is the same type of shrimp and fish shack you would encounter in the deep south like in New Orleans or Houston (I know because I have been). So relax, get your food and STFU!!!!

I think I've tried every fried seafood joint in Chicago, and Goose Island takes first place. Don't bring a date here or anything, but if you want to grub it out in the car or at home, this place will hit the spot. Ironically, while the seafood is insanely fresh, my favorite thing is the hot sauce. After years of trying to decipher the ingredients, I found its a mixture of hot sauce and mustard. ANYWAY. Shrimp and catfish are the way to go. Jumbo shrimp are HUGE and taste really fresh. Had fried oysters and to this day I can't figure out why it looked and tasted the way it did. It wasn't bad, just wasn't good. Similar to how you feel after eating a piece of celery.Go at off peak times, or you'll probably wait a bit. Pacman and pinball games await though.

Completely ghetto joint across the river from what was once the Cabrini Green housing projects on Division St.. You can't eat there...it's dirty...it's very unappealing...BUT, don't be intimidated!  Park on the dark street, head inside, order a pound of jumbo shrimp, a pound of fish nuggets, 4 hot sauces and 2 x 7UP's and you'll be glad you did.  If you go on a Friday or Saturday night you'll be waiting awhile (standing), but it's worth it.  They even have a big picture window so you can keep an eye on your car!  Don't be a wuss...visit this charcoal-covered gem and keep it in your back pocket.

EPIC WINI've been going here for years. This is a Chicago classic. Every time it's exactly the same delicious taste. Awesome fried fish. The fried oysters are my favorite.It's not super cheep or expensive, and it's to go only, so you stand around waiting for them to call out your order.. There is plenty of street parking right in front.This place just does it right. PeriodI'll be coming back for years to come. Thanks guys!

OMG! I've ben coming here for years and I an't get enough of it! I always order a pound of regular shrimp and a pound of oysters. I haven't been able to find fried oysters anywhere else that tastes this good! The food tastes even better after a night out clubbin! I don't know if it's the grease mixed with the alcohol that makes everything so delicious but whatever it is, I'll take it! I've been daring before and tried the frog legs and smelts, but it's just not as good as the shrimps and oysters.

I've been goin to this place with mydad since i was about 5 years old.You wanna try a scary neighborhood?Try goin to goose island about 20 years ago!then you guys can whine.Nowadays the nieghborhood haschanged alot, but the place is stillthe same and as delicious as i remember.healthy, maybe not?But tasty?? hells yes!

The shrimp in this place is quite good, though not the best in my book - breading is a bit heavy, and the hot sauce is actually a bit medium and milky.  Never had their catfish, cod, and frog legs.  They are open late hours.  Staff could use some shake up; there's one guy who's good in getting your orders and seems like a decent chap, but there's another one who's downright rude and will almost yell at you - so in general, don't take them to heart, get your food, pay for it and just leave.Parking is limited in front of the place, though there's other places to park nearby, but just watch out for the towing areas.
